title: Junior Digital Marketing Assistant
description:
Junior Digital Marketing Assistant

Are you looking for an opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of digital marketing? IMP is seeking a creative, energetic and detail-oriented Junior Digital Marketing Assistant to join our team. In this role, you will work with our team to develop and create creative designs for pay-per-click advertising, social media, email marketing and more using your graphic design and web development skills. There is also the opportunity to learn about campaign development and execution for these areas.

Come join a fun and knowledgeable team of digital marketing professionals in a flexible growth-driven work environment. Our existing team of 19 passionate experts loves working with our clients to help grow their business. Work with some of the most well-known hot tub and spa brands. Enjoy the benefits of a 6-hour workday, 12 days paid vacation right from the start, an extra paid day off for your birthday, a flexible remote work environment and a robust library of tools to define our team as the leading agency for the pool and hot tub industry. Read what our clients say about us and view our work.

Duties

  • Provide stellar support to Account Managers on projects and client retainer work
  • Creation and design of industry-leading emails
  • Dive into all digital assets for quality control and review
  • Assist with daily community management of client social media channels
  • Collaborate with team members to create remarkable graphic design pieces
  • Design unforgettable PPC ads for social media, google, display and connected TV campaigns
  • Become an officer of the brand to ensure all client and brand guidelines are followed
  • Participation in regular team meetings and collaboration sessions

Skills

  • Graphic design skills using Adobe Suite, Canva, Creatopy
  • 1+ years of experience working in B2C digital marketing
  • Functional knowledge of social media platforms
  • Email marketing design and deployment
  • Base knowledge/experience of Adobe Suite
  • Ability to stay organized and meet project deadlines
  • WordPress/Shopify dev experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Previous experience with SalesForce, SharpSpring or Accelo is an asset

Why Work Here?

An amazing culture with flexible hours and work from home. Enhance your skills by learning from your team and work on exciting client projects.

Please include graphic design work samples or portfolio with your application.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $40,000.00-$45,000.00 per year

title: Marketing Administrative Assistant
description:
You will be working in a team environment within our Marketing department. As a Marketing Administrative Assistant, you will be responsible for assisting with daily marketing activities and trade show preparation. Your functions will include but are not limited to:

  • Coordinating all tasks related to the execution of trade shows. This includes: arranging trade show space, confirming lighting, logistics, booking hotels and flights for all show attendees, and other related responsibilities.
  • Assisting the marketing team in preparing, setting up, and product planning for trade shows.
  • Working directly with management and members of the team to organize trade show product selection, showcases, planning, and logistics.
  • Ensuring all necessary product is collected and labelled for each trade show, which may include collecting items from our warehouse from time to time.
  • Attending trade shows to support the marketing and sales team when necessary.
  • Maintaining, organizing and updating all files related to trade shows.
  • Supporting the marketing team on project-based work in the development of marketing strategies.
  • Providing input, support and ideas to marketing initiatives and subsequently promoting those initiatives while monitoring results. This includes: promotions, email marketing campaigns, advertising, and trade shows.
  • Supporting the marketing team in conceptualizing and creating marketing materials for customer direct marketing, trade show promotional use or social media content.
  • Assisting with creating marketing materials. This includes: product descriptions, creative blurbs, email marketing and other marketing related materials.
  • Updating email lists on a weekly basis, sending email campaigns when needed, and managing any unsubscribes.
  • Maintaining and updating all marketing folders, spreadsheets, and copy for all packaging and ad material in the master spreadsheet.
  • Working on creative methods to promote the sale, and use, of our company products.
  • Supporting all social media accounts. This includes: collaborating with management to develop content and strategy, maintaining and updating all online platforms, updating spreadsheets, and monitoring results.
  • Creating high visual impact at trade shows, and in our in-house showroom.
  • Supporting our graphics and sales teams when samples, mock-ups or artwork proofing is required.
  • Supporting our sourcing department to test and use products from a quality control perspective to ensure products meet our high standards.

For the effective performance of your duties, you will be expected to possess the following qualities:

  • Quick learner with solid business instincts.
  • Ability to work well with others and be an effective communicator.
  • Exceptional computer skills in MS Office and Outlook.
  • Ability to problem solve and think critically.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize work accordingly.
  • Ability to begin, manage and finish multiple projects simultaneously and be extremely organized in order to meet tight deadlines.
  • Solid understanding of and ability to effectively utilize social media platforms such as Instagram and Facebook.
  • Proven ability to manage and organize a heavy flow of information.
  • Ability to work under pressure while maintaining a high level of attention to detail.
  • Ability to be self-motivated and work independently when required.

Prerequisites:

  • Post-Secondary education in an associated field.
  • 1+ years’ experience in a similar role.
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite would be an asset.

Additional information and benefits:

  • Travel may occasionally be required, to attend trade shows within North America.
  • May be required to lift boxes up to 20lbs.
  • 8 hour working days, Monday through Friday.
  • Working on site with our fun and diverse team.
  • Health and Dental benefits offered after 3 months.
  • Ten (10) paid personal days per year in addition to paid vacation days.
  • Salary increase and bonus in December 2022.
  • Company pension plan offered.
  • Salary: $48,000 to $52,000 annually.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $48,000.00-$52,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: newMarketing Assistant
description:
The Marketing Assistant will assist in the strategic creation and implementation of content to expand the digital reach, promote research and program outcomes, and create awareness about increasing men's mental health and well-being of men in communities.

The responsibilities of the position include: social media and analytics, content creation, and graphic design. The individual will require a high level of creativity, attention to detail, and time management skills. Duties include:

- Assist in the creation and execution of timely messaging and communications for social media channels, including Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn and Youtube

- Assist in developing and implementing marketing and promotional strategies, grounded in current industry trends and best practices, to grow our digital following

- Assist in the creation of digital content that is engaging and relevant

- Assist in gathering analytical data to drive decision making in the development of a content strategy

-Assist in the development of written material such as articles, blog posts, program guides and website updates

-Assist with event photography

-Other duties as needed

This is a temporary contract for for 8 weeks (35 hours per week) with the possibility of extension.

Qualifications:

Excellent written English

Content creation skills (Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, Hootsuite, Wordpress)

Experience with social media content marketing and strategy

Ability to meet deadlines and communicate well

Ability to work independently

Photography, video creation and editing an asset

To meet the criteria of our Canada Summer Job grant funding: Applicants must be 18-30 years old and be Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of the employment. Applicants must also have a valid Social Insurance Number at the start of employment and be legally entitled to work in Canada.

Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 8 weeks

Salary: $20.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Hybrid position. Work from home 3 days per week, report in person 2 days per week.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Vancouver, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-13
Expected start date: 2022-05-30

title: newMarketing Assistant (Remote)
description:
Scribendi is a market leader in the online editing and proofreading services industry. Scribendi provides e-commerce solutions to clients globally and is a fast-growing organization with a network of more than 600 professional freelancers.

In this position, you will work with our Head of Growth to execute the marketing strategy. From planning and implementation to data analysis and following-up with stakeholders, you’ll be the person getting things done.

Who You Are
Required

  • Minimum 2 year degree in an analytical discipline such as Business or STEM
  • 1–2 years of experience in an analytical role within Business or STEM
  • Comfortable manipulating data through spreadsheets and different tools
  • Ability to identify areas of improvement and support recommendations with data
  • Strong organizational, structural, and analytical capabilities

What You Will Do

  • Work closely with the Head of Growth to execute the company’s marketing strategy
  • Collaborate with various internal & external stakeholders to support marketing initiatives
  • Manage the project board and follow-up on critical items to ensure deadlines are met
  • Support marketing projects by compiling and analyzing data through spreadsheets and other tools
  • Spearhead marketing projects through platforms such as HubSpot, Google Optimize, WordPress, etc.

Compensation & Benefits

  • Base Compensation of $45,000–50,000 as well as a quarterly bonus
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a wellness benefit
  • A dynamic corporate culture founded on flexibility and continuous learning
  • Career development opportunities
  • An opportunity to use the latest tools and technologies

How to Apply

  • Send a resume to scribendi (dot) hr (at) scribendi (dot) com with a brief description detailing your experience in relation to the job requirements

Scribendi is committed to equal opportunity employment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application deadline: 2022-05-08

title: newMarketing and Communications Assistant - Top Compensation
description:
Marketing & Communications Assistant

Are you looking for a challenging position in a growing Marketing & Communications department? Is “Organization” your middle name? Do you attack every job with creativity and enthusiasm?

Our company is looking for a Marketing & Communications Assistant to join our team. This is primarily a support role, but it is critical in the life of our Marketing & Communications Department. The right candidate will continuously strengthen external and internal communications and contribute to operational excellence through their strong gifts of organization, customer service orientation, creativity, and adaptability to the changing needs of the department.

A background in hospitality is a plus as you will be responsible for coordinating events and promotions, communicating our expectations with outside vendors. Other responsibilities may grow out of the chosen candidate’s skills and interest. There is potential for this to grow into a hybrid position with part-time work from home.

General Responsibilities:

- Help in the planning and execution of corporate and customer events
- Collaborate with merchandise suppliers and marketing team to design and order promo merchandise
- Provide support to Marketing & Communications team with general administration, budget reconciliation, etc.
- Prepare, edit, and proofread announcements, presentations, reports, forms, and other related marketing and communications material
- Provide support for the development, maintenance, and organization of various digital tools
- Assist in creating and/or re-purposing content for websites and social media networks
- Participate on committees and in meetings as needed to provide support on communications planning or implementation
- Perform other related duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Education & Experience:

- Post-secondary education in a related field such as marketing, communications, or event planning, and one to three years experience in a related environment or an equivalent combination of education and experience

Competencies:

- Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and Power Point
- Fluent spoken and written English communication skills
- Strong writing and editing or graphic design skills an asset
- Familiarity with Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, an asset
- Familiarity with Google Analytics and SEO tools is considered an asset

Skills:

- Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills, including the ability to prioritize multiple projects and work well under pressure to meet tight deadlines
- Impeccable written and spoken communication skills in English
- Ability to work effectively independently, with individuals, and teams in a wide variety of settings, applying interpersonal skills and taking a problem-solving approach
- Curiosity and commitment to continuous learning and developing skills and knowledge in the marketing and communications profession
- Knowledge of written and spoken French would be a strong asset

Rob Requirements

- Occasional domestic and international travel may be required to support customer/company events
- Valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle preferred
- Unassisted lifting required. Maximum 20 lbs.

The Offer

Competitive salary - we take great pride in offering our workforce the best benefits and compensation packages in our industry, and we think you will too.

Healthcare and Dental for single, couple or family coverage

Insurance benefits and employee assistance program

Group RRSP – save for retirement – you are eligible after 1 year of continuous employment and matches your contribution based on years of service

Time Off – Everyone needs time away from work to recharge and be with family and friends - receive a generous amount of paid holidays

Employee Referral Bonus Program

Paid training/tuition reimbursement – Ready to further your education?

Open door policy in a supportive and encouraging work environment

Overtime available in peak periods

Internal Promotions

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $45,000.00 per hour

title: Marketing and Communications Assistant
company: Norwood Child and Family Resource Centre
description:
Full Time (35 hours per week)

Job ID: 22-00NCFRC

Are you looking to make a difference in your community?
Join the Norwood team and start making a difference today!

Norwood Child and Family Resource Centre is an Edmonton based non-profit organization that has been supporting children and families since 1963, with a vision of Healthy Children, Healthy Families, Healthy Communities. Our programs and services are designed to strengthen and enrich families with children birth – 6 years old. Early childhood experiences are aimed at fostering optimal child development and healthy parent-child attachment. Parent education opportunities are created to support building the capacity of families. Family support services are provided to support families as the child’s first and most important teacher. Information and referral are a key practice in supporting families to grow and learn within their own communities. Programs are delivered using a holistic approach to support the social, emotional, intellectual, language, physical and creative needs of children and families in the community. For more information, visit https://www.norwoodcentre.com.

Norwood provides the following:

  • Great benefits plan
  • 5 weeks of paid time off per year (1 week at Spring Break, 2 weeks at Christmas and 2 weeks’ vacation)
  • 12 sick/personal leave days per year
  • Service recognition and employee awards
  • 2 staff fun/appreciation days per year
  • Strong focus on employee wellness and work-life balance
  • Supportive of ongoing professional development
  • A compassionate team environment

The Marketing and Communications Assistant supports communications for the agency through the creation of content that reflects the work of the agency. This position works with the Marketing and Communications Manager to ensure that Norwood is promoted effectively to other agencies and the community at large. This position has a wide variety of responsibilities within the scope of marketing and communications to ensure that the objectives are achieved.

Norwood staff are guided by the following Team Charter: (SPIRIT)

  • Support – We utilize one another’s strengths to take on challenges and opportunities using positive communication, collaboration, and compassion.
  • Passion – We have the energy, attitude, and enthusiasm to be fully committed and engaged in our work with each other.
  • Integrity – We are honest, trustworthy, transparent, and accountable with each other.
  • Respect – We accept others without judgment and recognize that every individual is a person of value.
  • Inclusivity – We celebrate diversity and welcome people of all abilities, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives.
  • Team – We are all one group working towards improved outcomes for children and families.

If you share our values and support our mission and vision, please consider joining our team.

Reporting to the Marketing and Communications Manager, the Marketing and Communications Assistant is responsible for the following:

  • Supporting the development and implementation of the agency’s communication strategy.
  • Updating the agency

title: Social Media Assistant for @six.surgery @realdrsix
description:
Do you scroll, tweet, share, and post in your sleep? Do you know what it takes to grow an online community? We're looking for a Creative Director interested in brand building and content creating -Everything from vlogging to collaborating with influencers. This also includes managing our social media accounts by implementing strategies and tactics that grow our followers, engage and retain them while running campaigns to track your success. You should have command of best practices and trends in social media marketing, enjoy being creative, and understand how to both build and convert a digital audience.

The creatives. The determined. The daring. The free thinkers. The wild ones. We want you.

* We're Looking For *

  • Charisma & witt. Not shy on camera (or around surgery)
  • Tons of experience with TikTok, Reels, Snapchat, & Video Content
  • Knows how to use Social Media tools: Light video editing, image editing (Apps + Canva acceptable), Hootsuite, Schedulers, Social Tracking
  • An aesthetic UX/UI design eye with video production and editing experience
  • Hands-on experience executing marketing strategies in areas such as lead generation, digital marketing, and communications
  • Self-starter. With a proven track record of execution (you know how to leverage resources and get stuff done)
  • Storyteller. Knows how to cater a message to an audience
  • Understanding of the vlog/influencer world
  • Plus: Knowledge and experience with Adobe Creative Cloud apps

* More Things You Might Do *

  • Act as the gatekeeper of brand perception and manager of channels (website, social etc.)
  • Research audience preferences and discover current trends
  • Generate entertaining, educational and captivating content for social media campaigns including Youtube videos, infographics, graphics and copy
  • Help ensure video and social media content meets quality and brand standards and is compelling to our audiences.
  • Be results-driven and proactive in the application of innovative and creative approaches to drive engagement and conversions.
  • Growth hack with other types of digital media such as PR, Influencer, blogging, seo, etc.

* Other Details *

  • Working alongside renowned Plastic Surgeon influencer Dr. Six @six.surgery @realdrsix
  • Lots of creative freedom
  • You'll have a desk at a beautiful heart of downtown office
  • Full time but highly variable hours. Some days 7am to 10pm, some days you have off.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$26.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Social Media Marketing: 1 year (preferred)

title: newMarketing and Sales Assistant
description:
Canadiana Flowers is a full-service floral and gift provider in Scarborough, servicing the GTA and surrounding areas. Family owned and operated for 49 years, we are committed to providing the highest level of customer service and the best in floral design and quality.

We are currently looking for an energetic, creative & imaginative individual to join our team 2-4 full day shifts/ week (including some Saturdays & Sundays) our location at 3087 Kingston Road This is an exciting opportunity to work in an extremely diversified, and fast-paced environment.

We are in the process of deploying our long awaited custom website that has been customized for our business and require someone to assist us with uploading the catalogue of images and descriptions to keep us up to date. We also have 2 separate websites for our events rental and wedding sites (wordpress and Wix) that require some upgrading looking for a creative individual to help us develop these sites to portray the image and professionalism that Canadiana Flowers has to offer to our clients.

We are looking for an individual that can adapt to a changing and exciting environment and assist the owners & team with administrative, marketing and day to day operations.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Assist with uploading and maintaining website
  • Assist with the development of internal marketing material on a day to day basis
  • Assist with the development & upgrade of our events website on Wix platform and Wordpress Platform
  • Assist with our social media posts and daily/ weekly specials
  • Assist walk-in customers with point-of-sale interactions
  • Answer store phone: take orders, messages, etc as applicable
  • Enter telephone orders into computer system
  • Flower care: cut flower maintenance, plant maintenance, etc.
  • Merchandise incoming stock
  • Prepare and wrap customer orders for delivery
  • Maintenance of general e-mail account, social media, website
  • Process orders from online business
  • Act as the first point of contact in direct customer related interactions
  • Provide every Canadiana customer with the highest level of customer service, both in person and over the telephone
  • Maintain a clean and safe working space
  • Other administrative tasks as assigned

Job Requirements:

  • Excellent computer skills in: Microsoft Word, Excel, & Outlook, and quick learner of new computer programs and systems
  • Great working knowledge of Wordpress and Wix
  • Willing to work weekends and stay later than scheduled time depending on volume of business, holidays, special events, etc.
  • Must be able to lift and carry up to 35 lbs for short distances
  • Must be fluent in English, both written and verbal
  • Dedicated to customer service and providing a positive customer experience
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
  • Team-player with a positive and friendly demeanor
  • Detail oriented, focused, and committed to long-term employment
  • Excellent communication skills, both over the phone and in person

Canadiana Flowers is open seven days a week. Availability on some Saturdays & Sundays is required.

We thank all applicants, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted

title: newAdmin & Marketing Assistant - Halifax
description:
Please apply on Isarta.com
https://isarta.com/jobs/?utm_source=IND&job=79653

Posted

29-Apr-2022

Service line

Advisory Segment

Role type

Full-time

Areas of Interest

Administrative, Marketing

Location(s)

Halifax - Nova Scotia - Canada

About CBRE

Would you like to work at the world's largest commercial real estate brokerage and a Fortune 500 company? Do you want to expand your knowledge while working on a high-performing team alongside the industry's best talent? If so, we want to hear from you!

Few companies are as dynamic as CBRE. Few industries are more exciting than commercial real estate. If you are looking to make an impact, have fun and build your career, this is the opportunity for you!

CBRE's single unifying message is creating the real estate solutions of tomorrow, so businesses and people thrive.

Be a part of the industry that shapes our cities and our lives.

About You

You thrive on detailed-oriented work and have stellar time management skills.

You are a self-motivated individual who can collaborate effectively in team settings.

You are proactive and able to be flexible as work priorities change.

You integrate feedback well and always search for ways to grow in your professional career.

You are creative and eager to deliver high-quality solutions.

The Opportunity

CBRE is seeking a resourceful, proactive, and dynamic person to provide administrative and marketing support in an upbeat team environment.

This role is the backbone of the sales team and is highly valued.

Responsibilities include :

Prepare high-quality proposals, presentations, and marketing materials as well as tour books, maps, and floor plans.

Perform real estate administrative tasks such as coordinating client correspondence, updating databases, files, and documents related to transactions.

Coordinate sales professionals' schedules and record action items during meetings.

Produce eye-catching social media posts and other communication materials while maintaining the CBRE brand.

Handle confidential information with discretion and demonstrate the highest level of customer service.

Coordinate sales events such as open houses and other industry events.

Carry-out special projects as requested.

What We Require

A Bachelor's degree or equivalent combined experience and education (We do not require a background in Real Estate).

Experience providing administrative support to a team of professionals, sales or marketing environment preferred.

Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite applications.

Experience using Adobe Creative Cloud, particularly InDesign, would be considered an asset.

What's in it for you?

At CBRE, you are empowered to take your career path into your own hands.

Work in a high-energy, collaborative environment with supportive teammates while reaching your highest potential.

Enjoy workplace flexibility in a global organization with our modern, Well-Certified offices proven to maximize employee wellness. We believe our working spaces should allow everyone to feel comfortable, productive, and inspired. Because when people feel inspired, great work is accomplished.

Come experience the employee advantage at CBRE.

We look forward to hearing from you!

CBRE is committed to being an organization that celebrates diversity as a strength, where people have access to equitable opportunities and management fosters inclusion. Employees have the freedom to be authentic and are empowered at work.

NOTE: An additional requirement for this role is the ability to comply with COVID-19 health and safety protocols, including COVID-19 vaccination proof and/or rigorous testing.

title: Marketing Assistant/Coordinator
description:
Title

Marketing Assistant/Coordinator

Salary

$45K-$55K (salary to be determined by qualifications, skill level, and experience)

Job Type

Full-time, Permanent

Location

Currently working remotely from home. Will be working a hybrid work week in our office in downtown Toronto (University/Dundas) as things start to return to normal.

Summary of the Position

We’re looking for a full-time Marketing Assistant/Coordinator—and an extremely creative, kickass storyteller!

You will report directly to the president of 42 North. For that reason, the ideal candidate must have a well-rounded marketing perspective. You are the ideal candidate if you’re a leader who is confident working in a fast-paced environment with various brands on multiple projects.

Our partners trust us to grow their brand by identifying marketing opportunities so we can develop and execute their marketing strategies. You will support these efforts by planning, managing, and monitoring these campaigns. In doing so, you will also be required to get your hands dirty by working alongside the rest of our content creation team to help write any and all copy required.

We treat our partners as part of our team. We have total confidence to stand by the quality of work we do, and you must be willing to do the same. We have a saying around the office—if it’s not amazing, then what’s the point?

The 42 North Difference

Mindfulness is a key part of our day-to-day operations. We know it’s important to have a healthy work-life balance which is why we set intentions, celebrate wins, reflect on where we can improve, and genuinely care about our team and partners’ well-being. We strive to create an environment that brings out the best in each team member so we can show the world why we kick ass! When you work with 42 North, you’re part of a team striving toward the common goal of greatness.

42 North is a relationship-centric, full-service marketing agency providing digital strategy and industry-leading multimedia for the best brands around the world. We create purposeful, highly creative content for our partners in a variety of B2C and B2B industries. We take a holistic, integrated approach to working with our partners by not only providing marketing services, but by supplementing their everyday operations as an extension of their own team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Bring our brand partners’ visions to life while keeping the 42 North’s core values top of mind
  • Conducting primary research and presenting it to anchor the efforts of our campaigns
  • Collaborate with the 42 North creative team to push the envelope in our innovative marketing strategies for all partners
  • Optimize current strategies within our partners’ marketing budgets, timelines, and measurables
  • Write and edit key creative copy for various marketing campaigns with a distinct voice: including ad copy, press releases, video content, email newsletters, web copy, and social media posts—anything and everything with words
  • Improve KPIs and metrics, while providing insight, according to our partners’ individual targets
  • Identify trends, insights, and other opportunities to source, develop, and deliver content that tells a compelling, cohesive story across all channels
  • Plan and execute email, social media, and other campaigns based on targeting information specific to each partner
  • On-call duties for issues that arise on social media after regular business hours as required

Requirements

  • A degree in Marketing and Communications
  • Proven professional writing experience and editing skills
  • Proven experience with sales operations, reporting, marketing & campaign dashboards, and KPIs
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office products and/or Google equivalents (Excel/Sheets, Word/Docs, etc.)
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud Applications (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, etc.)

Key Behaviors

  • Outstanding communication and writing abilities
  • Impeccable attention to detail
  • Ability to ask the right questions to collect data, create survey questions that are empathetic, and encourages detailed responses that reflect the overall goal of the campaign
  • Strong problem solving and decision-making skills
  • Comprehensive knowledge of marketing and brand strategies/channels
  • Self-motivated, fast learner, and able to work independently
  • Organized and capable of multitasking
  • Ability to work under pressure to meet hard deadlines
  • Up-to-date on latest marketing trends
  • Effective interpersonal skills and able to work within a team
  • Mindful, empathetic, and self-aware

Preference will be given to those with

  • 1+ years working experience in a marketing role
  • 1+ years of creative agency experience
  • Working knowledge of French is desirable
  • Willingness to lead

Bonus/Perks

  • Awesome team energy/culture
  • Paid leave for team building events
  • Opportunity for further specialized education
  • Employee extended health benefits package
  • Access to company tech & equipment
  • Access to company studio
  • Looking for immediate hire.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $45,000.00-$55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Currently working remotely with plans of implementing a hybrid office/remote work week.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

  • What’s the best KPI for measuring success for a relationship marketing agency?
  • Please provide a link to your portfolio.

Application deadline: 2022-05-07
Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: Sales and Marketing Assistant
description:
Toronto, ON

The Exterminators Inc. are looking for a sales and marketing assistant to join our growing team. As a full-time marketing assistant, you would be working closely with our sales and advertising teams to support ongoing marketing projects and assist in the implementation of new marketing plans.

Role Overview:
Engage customers over the phone and online – answer written and oral inquiries
Create, curate and post content on web and social media channels
Organize information and input data, documenting sales and marketing initiatives
Responsibilities
Interact with customers to schedule appointments and measure customer satisfaction
Write and submit quotations
Create compelling copy for website and various social media mediums
Curate, edit and publish content – WordPress and social media channels
Help manage editorial calendar
Edit, organize and optimize photos
Handle general administrative functions as needed
Basic data entry
Some graphic design

Video editing skills a plus Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Business and/or marketing
1 year – 3 years’ experience in sales
1 year – 3 years’ experience in digital marketing
1 year – 3 years’ content marketing
Strong oral and written communication skills including proofreading
Proficiency in Excel, Word, Google Docs, Google Sheets and Google Drive
Proficiency in WordPress
Experience working with image editors
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Flexible hours with some evening and weekend availability Salary and Benefits
Full time salary
Health and Dental Benefits
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $36,000.00 to $45,000.00 /year – based on experience
Why Work With Us?

We are an established but growing pest control and wildlife removal company servicing the Greater Toronto Area. We take pride in our work, enjoy helping customers and solving problems. We are ambitious but above all we are a team.

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Please apply with resume.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $36,000.00 to $45,000.00 /year

Why Work With Us?

The Exterminators Inc. is an established but growing pest control and wildlife removal company servicing the Greater Toronto Area. We take pride in our work, enjoy helping customers and solving problems. We are ambitious but above all we are a team.

Please apply with resume. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: newMarketing Assistant
description:
Status: Open
Department: Communications
Type: Full-Time
Work Site: Kensington Village


Marketing Assistant

The 8-week position described in this posting is funded by Canada Summer Job Grant, please ensure you that you are eligible for the program prior to applying: https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/services/funding/canada-summer-jobs.html

Being part of Shepherd’s Care Foundation means having an opportunity to belong, grow, and succeed. Our employees work in engaged teams, which are present in the lives of our residents where our employees make a difference.

The Opportunity

38.75 hours weekly

Eight weeks of employment funded by Canada Summer Job Grant

Hourly Rate of Pay: $18.00

The Marketing Assistant provides support to the Executive Director, Communications in the development of Shepherd’s Care Foundations (SCF)’ communications, marketing, and outreach related tasks.

You have demonstrated skills and experience in marketing, communications, website and social media management, as well as the ability to provide outstanding customer service. You are currently enrolled in or have graduated from a Marketing and/or Communications program. A valid driver’s license, strong graphic design and computer skills are preferred.

This position is a hybrid of remote work and in-person. We are open to flexible working hours.

How to Apply

Click the button below or apply directly to HR@shepherdscare.org. We thank all applicants; only those under consideration will be contacted.

Who We Are

Shepherd’s Care Foundation is a mission driven, faith-based, not-for-profit organization providing quality care and accommodations to more than 900 seniors throughout Edmonton and in Barrhead. Our seven campuses provide living options for residents with a full spectrum of care needs, including independent living, supportive living, supportive living with dementia, long-term care, and complex care.

What We Offer

Shepherd’s Care Foundation offers competitive total rewards, a strong focus on employee safety and wellness, and a commitment to progressive work teams, personal development, and collaboration. We also offer respectful and culturally inclusive workplaces that align with our employee-developed Behaviour Standards, and pride ourselves on open and connected work environments.

Canada Summer Job Grant Youth Requirements

  • Be between 15 and 30 years of age at the start of the employment;
  • Be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of the employment; and;
  • Have a valid Social Insurance Number at the start of employment and be legally entitled to work in Canada in accordance with relevant provincial or territorial legislation and regulations

title: newMarketing Assistant (part-time, remote work)
description:
Marketing Assistant (part-time, remote work)

Knighthunter.com offers a suite of locally focused, web-based recruiting solutions. From simple-to-add job postings that reach thousands of local candidates to a robust Applicant Tracking System that integrates with local corporate websites.

Services to candidates include the ability to search and apply to hundreds of local job postings and create a free resume and job alert profile. Locally owned, and based in London, Ontario we have been a leading local careers website since 2000.

Our Marketing Assistant position is aimed at supporting promotional efforts of Knighthunter.com. This is an excellent opportunity for a student or recent graduate of a digital marketing, or graphic design program.

The role:
  • Provide insight and feedback on digital marketing best practices, and target markets
  • Advise on the creation of appealing targeted ads and content aimed at growing Knighthunter's employer and candidate user base
  • Assess, measure and report on results of digital marketing campaign effectiveness including Google Ads
  • Advise on social media strategy, and other online content
  • Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
  • Strong computer skills including but not limited to MS Office, Google Suite, Adobe Creative Suite and other marketing tools/systems

Qualifications:
Minimum of 1 year of digital marketing experience is required
Degree or diploma in a business or marketing related program (or in progress)

This is a part-time position and approximately 15-20 hours per week are required
In order to maintain a safe work environment all work will be performed remotely
Remuneration: $16.00 per hour

Other requirements:

This position is partially funded by the Canada Summer Jobs 2021 program, and as such there are several eligibility requirements. The successful candidate:
  • is between 15 and 30 years of age (inclusive) at the start of the employment;
  • is a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of the employment*; and,
  • is legally entitled to work in Canada in accordance with relevant provincial / territorial legislation and regulations.

* Per program rules, International students are not eligible. Recent immigrants are eligible if they are Canadian Citizens or permanent residents.

How to apply:
Please email your resume by May 26, 2022 to:
Mike Sherlock, Knighthunter.com
support@knighthunter.com



See more great local summer & student job opportunities here: www.knighthunter.com/student

description:
Home Suite Hope (HSH) is a non-profit agency located in Oakville that provides wraparound services to assist single-parent families to break the cycle of poverty in the Halton Region.

HSH is looking to fill an 8-week position as a Marketing Assistant. This position is being funded by the Canada Summer Jobs program, and as per the requirements, the candidate must:

1. Be between 15 – 30 years of age at the start of employment

2. Be a Canadian Citizen, permanent resident, or be under refugee protection

3. Have a valid Social Insurance Number

4. Must be available to work the full work term from May 16, 2022 – July 8, 2022

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in developing Corporate, Foundation, and Stewardship templates for community outreach and solicitations.
  • Collaborate with Director of Development to create innovative ways to gain exposure and increase digital profile for fundraising campaigns.
  • Assist in the development and distribution of monthly newsletter marketing on MailChimp and promotional material.
  • Support Administrative Assistant in designing digital marketing materials through Canva to be posted on social media platforms.
  • Other tasks as assigned

Qualifications:

Due to COVID-19, the job position will include work from home and work in the office. The candidate must have access to an internet connection to fulfill this job position. Home Suite Hope will provide a company laptop and cellphone.

The ideal candidate:

  • Experience with Microsoft Office, specifically with Excel
  • Type speed: 50 WPM
  • Experience with Marketing is an asset
  • A marketing diploma or equivalent education/experience is an asset
  • Experience with Marketing and Design is an asset

Teamwork: Refers to the skills needed to interact with other people. At work, people work with others in pairs and in small and large groups to coordinate tasks, share resources, plan, make decisions, negotiate, solve conflicts, and complete other activities that involve teamwork.

Communication: Refers to the skills needed to exchange thoughts and information with other people. This exchange can happen orally by speaking, listening, and using non-verbal cues, such as body language or in writing. At work, people use communication skills to talk to customers, discuss products with suppliers, explain work procedures to co-workers, participate in virtual sales meetings with clients, and other activities that involve verbal or written exchanges.

Digital skills: Digital technology refers to the skills needed to understand and use digital systems, tools, and applications, and to process digital information. At work, people use digital technology skills to input, access, analyze, organize, create and communicate information and ideas using computers, software, point-of-sale equipment, email, podcasts, web applications, smartphones, and other digital devices.

Contract length: 8 weeks
Part-time hours: 30 per week

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
About us

Fort Erie is filled with racing traditions. Great Canadian champions have raced at the "Fort", providing race enthusiasts with thrills and life long memories. From its beginnings in 1897, Fort Erie Race Track has always been a special place. Its beauty has been well documented with aesthetics second to none

Responsibilities:

Under the guidance and direction of the Manager, Marketing & Corporate Communications, the Marketing Assistant will be able to gain valuable experience in the following areas:

1.Creating and posting content on social media platforms to promote racing and engage with fans. ·

2. Assist with internal and external communications for the Fort Erie Race Track, including writing internal communications, press releases, creating newsletter content, writing web stories, etc. ·

3. Assist with marketing campaigns, including creating artwork for advertisements to promote race days and special events. ·

4.Assist with the planning and execution of all special events, including Fort Erie’s signature event, the Prince of Wales Stakes. ·

5. Create and update website content using a content management system. · 6.Provide communications support to all departments at Fort Erie Race Track. ·

7. Assist with editing and proofreading content created by other individuals. ·

8. Assisting with program printing for busy events ·

Other duties as assigned to support racing and special events at Fort Erie Race Track.

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal
Contract length: 5 months

Salary: $18.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Application deadline: 2022-05-05
Expected start date: 2022-05-23

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
The Workforce Development Board (WDB) is a not-for-profit organization funded by the Ministry of Labour, Training and Skills Development. Under the Canada Summer Jobs Program, we are seeking a motivated and dynamic individual with some marketing experience to work for us for 8 weeks this summer. The work week will be 35 hours, five days a week, at $16/hour with a start date of May 16, 2022, if possible. The Marketing Assistant will work remotely.

The Marketing Assistant will work closely with the Community Development and Communications Coordinator to assist in a wide range of activities covering all areas of marketing including (but not limited to):

· Producing and proofreading marketing and communications materials such as writing social posts, creating content for WDB’s monthly newsletter and Eventbrite events;

· Providing coordination and support to the Community Development and Communications Coordinator on marketing or communications-related projects;

· Assisting with analyses, development and implementation of communication and promotion strategies and information programs;

· Assisting with market research to determine awareness / advertising needs and developing appropriate marketing plans for related activities, initiatives and virtual events;

· Monitoring WDB’s social media / internet presence;

· Following direction to complete other tasks and projects as required.

This is an ideal role for a college or university student in business administration or communications to gain on-the-job experience and mentorship opportunities with an interest in working in a virtual team environment with a variety of stakeholders in the communities of Peterborough, City of Kawartha Lakes, Northumberland and Haliburton.

What You Will Bring:

· Experience with social media and related software such as Canva, Adobe Creative Suite and WordPress is considered an asset.

· Post-secondary focus on marketing, business administration, communications, or journalism considered an asset.

· High proficiency in all Microsoft Office programs, including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

· Strong verbal and written communication skills.

· Ability to work independently to achieve day-to-day results.

· Evidence of exceptional interpersonal and stakeholder engagement skills.

· Demonstrated time management and organizational skills.

Qualified applicants are invited to send a cover letter and resume by May 9, 2022 at 4:00 p.m. indicating the position name in the Subject Line. As this position is funded under Canada Summer Jobs, please refer to the youth participant eligibility requirements https://www.canada.ca/en/employment-social-development/services/funding/canada-summer-jobs/screening-eligibility.html.

All Applications treated confidentially. While we appreciate all applications, we can only contact those individuals selected for interview.

We are committed to providing accommodation for persons with disabilities. Accommodation will be provided as part of our hiring process (if accommodation is required, Applicants are requested to make their needs known in advance).

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 8 weeks

Salary: $16.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-05-09
Expected start date: 2022-05-16

title: newCanada Summer Jobs Marketing Assistant
description:
Job Posting: Canada Summer Jobs Marketing Assistant
Posting Date: April 29, 2022

SPECTRUM is a volunteer-based 2SLGBTQ+ charity that is sustainable, supportive, positive and a safe space for people of all ages in the Waterloo Region. By providing resources, information, rainbow-related events, and programming, SPECTRUM works together with partners and allies to ensure a strong and inclusive community.

SPECTRUM aims to provide a diversity-friendly work environment and particularly encourages people of all ethnicities, genders, sexual/gender identities, cultural backgrounds, abilities and beliefs to apply.

Position Description:
Thanks to a Canada Summer Jobs grant, SPECTRUM is recruiting a part-time Marketing Assistant. The Marketing Assistant will work 30 hours per week for 12 weeks and will be paid $30 per hour.

Reporting to the Executive Director, the Marketing Assistant will work on a variety of projects with a focus on:

1. Our first annual fundraising gala event and Pride month events
The Assistant will help with developing social media content (writing and graphics) to advertise events, assist with social media scheduling, checking people in at events, setting up and tearing down events, managing a silent auction at the gala, and managing our table at the local tri-
Pride festival.

2. Our Rainbow Pages directory/magazine
The Assistant will work with the Executive Director to solicit advertising for our Rainbow Pages directory. They will help to conduct interviews with local organizations and individuals and to write articles for inclusion in the directory. They will assist with layout and design in Canva.

3. Our Annual Report
The Assistant will help to plan and layout our 2021-2022 annual report.

4. Our Pride month fundraising campaign
The Assistant may help with our fundraising campaign by helping to process donations, write thank you cards, and sell Pride-related merchandise (processing online orders or assisting with sales in our office).

Qualifications:

  • be between 18 and 30 years of age at the beginning of the employment period
  • be a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or person to whom refugee protection has been conferred under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act for the duration of the employment
  • have a valid Social Insurance Number at the start of employment and be legally entitled to work in Canada in accordance with relevant provincial or territorial legislation and regulations.
  • Preference will be given to candidates who are 2SLGBTQ+-identified
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with social media scheduling and posting
  • Experience with graphic design and layout in Canva
  • Strategic thinking
  • Post secondary education in marketing and/or communications is beneficial

Application:
Please apply with a cover letter and resume by May 13, 2022.
Subject line: APPLICATION: MARKETING ASSISTANT

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 30 per week

Salary: $30.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Flexible schedule
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Visitors to our space are required to wear masks. If more than one employee or volunteer is in the space they will also wear masks.

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-05-13
Expected start date: 2022-05-30

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
Celebright is looking for an experienced Marketing Assistant to help grow our footprint across North America. Based in Kanata, Celebright designs, manufactures and installs permanent holiday lighting systems. The Marketing Assistant will help facilitate marketing initiatives to grow the Celebright brand, both locally and internationally.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Help Create marketing strategies and test campaigns for use in both Ottawa and throughout our North American dealer network
  • Manage social media platforms and leverage them to grow our brand
  • Gather, analyze and report analytics and marketing data
  • Perform market research and apply findings to future marketing campaigns.
  • Assist sales staff in dealer acquisition and support.
  • Work with both new and existing dealers to create and implement marketing strategies and offer support.
  • Collaborate closely with other departments such as sales, dealer network, and production.

Skills and Qualifications:

  • Direct marketing
  • Market research & segmentation
  • Project planning & coordination
  • Reporting research results
  • Strong computer skills
  • Basic graphic design skills an asset
  • Excellent proofing and editing abilities
  • Ability to multi-task and be highly organized at the same time
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Courteous and just generally nice to be around

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or a related field
  • Proven working experience in digital marketing
  • Demonstrable experience leading and managing SEO/SEM, marketing database, email, social media and advertising campaigns
  • Highly creative with experience in identifying target audiences and devising digital campaigns that engage, inform, and motivate
  • Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
  • Solid knowledge of website and marketing analytics tools
  • Working knowledge of ad serving tools
  • Strong social media knowledge using social media platforms, posting and engaging with customers

Compensation:

  • Salary to be negotiated based on successful applicant's skill set and experience
  • Bonus: annual bonus for company profit sharing
  • Benefits: Health, Dental, Vision + Life Insurance

Location:

  • Hybrid position with part time in office and part work from home.
  • Office is located in Kanata

About Celebright:
Celebright is a Fast Growing, Ottawa based company. We design permanent holiday lighting systems, which combine custom lighting controller hardware with industry leading cloud based control. We’re a tight knit group of nice people, with a focus on creating quality products and delivering an excellent customer experience.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Marketing Assistant
description:
Company: Céla

Location: Bayview Village

Position: Marketing / Communications Assistant

Type of Employment: Full Time

Compensation: $19-$22 per hour – min. 35 hours per week.

About Cela:

Céla was founded in 2018 by Celine Tadrissi, having owned and operated Hammam Spa in Toronto since 2006. The business has grown into the largest independently run spa in Canada and has expanded to a second location. Hammam Spa welcomes over 1,000 guests a week which requires a substantial number of products used for treatments and services. Céla was created when Celine searched for high-quality, clean products to use at the spa and was frustrated by the lack of thoughtful, Canadian-made options that were up to Hammam Spa's professional standards. A decision was made to explore ingredients available here at home within Canada. For over 8 years Celine sourced Canadian ingredients and made bases were tested and adapted to develop a selection of key formulas. Recognizing that the home was also an important place to build ritual and supplement wellness in-between treatments. In 2018 Celine sought out a proper manufacturer to start working on making the line into a scalable Canadian brand.

Position Overview:

As part of the Marketing and Communications team, the Marketing Assistant will report to the Operations Manager. This role will not have a “typical day” the successful candidate will work collaboratively on a wide variety of duties and to deliver digital marketing content, communications, and other special projects.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who has strong communication, organizational and project management skills. Open to learning in other aspects of the organization and enjoys working in a fast-paced environment where no two days are the same. The successful candidate will deliver value to everything they touch by collaborating, providing unique insights and getting the job done. Knowledge in D2C and B2B marketing practices would be an asset. They will be comfortable in maintaining various marketing campaigns and have a creative skillset which enables them to brainstorm new initiatives. We are currently expanding our business internationally and are looking for a collaborative and driven marketing coordinator to join the team during this exciting time.

Duties & Responsibilities including but not limited to:

· Deliver digital content innovations

· integrate digital marketing strategies and provide recommendations into other active marketing channels such as email marketing and social media

· Assist on a variety of content projects, such as blog posts, landing pages, and campaigns

· Plan and collaborate on new marketing content

· Participate in editorial meetings, brainstorming sessions, and quarterly planning to help us execute on top-level strategy that supports our brand and products

· Fulfill supply chain responsibilities such as, pick and pack orders and logistics

· Administrative tasks such as data entry, research projects and basic bookkeeping

Qualifications

· Working towards marketing diploma or related field of study

· Knowledge of Mailchimp and / or Klaviyo would be an asset

· Strengths in managing workflow and prioritizing multiple projects

· Experience in Canva, Adobe InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop, would be an asset

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Experience in Digital and Social Media applications such as Google Ads, Instagram, TikTok

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $19.00-$21.00 per year

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Hope you are doing well!!!

Iris's Fortune 500 direct client is looking for UX/UI Designer. Please find below Job description and share me your updated resume at Jatin.gupta@irissoftware.com

 Position: UX/UI Designer

Location: Mississauga, ON

Duration: long Term Contract

Skillset

  • Degree in Design, Fine Arts or related field.
  • Prior experience as a UI Designer as well as a strong portfolio of related projects.
  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (specifically Illustrator, InDesign and Photoshop) as well as Sketch, Abstract and Invision
  • Strong attention to detail and have a keen eye for esthetics.
  • Excellent communication skills and can clearly articulate ideas, designs, and suggestions. 

Responsibilities

  • Take design briefs to understand requirements.
  • Translating requirements into style guides, design systems, design patterns and attractive user interfaces.
  • Creating a visualization of screens within a prototype framework.
  • Identifying design problems and devising elegant solutions.
  • Presenting ideas, concepts and design solutions to various stakeholders incorporating feedback into your designs.
  • Developing and maintaining documentation regarding style guidelines.

title: UX Researcher
description:
UX Researcher

 

Contract Terms: 1 Year

Client Industry: Gaming

 

UX Researcher

As a UX Researcher, you will report to the Senior Manager of Research for IT, where you and the rest of your team will envision digital and live experiences for players and employees.

 

Responsibilities

  • Connect user research with products related to players, recruiting, employee, and game creation related products being an amplifier for relevant insights by working across the company.
  • Be an expert at matching research insights and its delivery mechanisms with the priorities and strategic goals product pillars.
  • Work with designers, creating user scenarios, concept sketches, experience storyboards, high fidelity designs, and rapid prototypes.
  • Work with product managers, designers, engineers, researchers, marketers, and external partners to establish cohesive language and a unified voice across products and platforms.

 

Requirements

  • Provide research that directly supports consumer marketing, social marketing and strategy, and audience illumination.
  • Skill at framing problems and scoping research approaches.
  • Questionnaire designer, survey programmer, data analyzer.
  • Translate complex questions into efficient and focused inquiries.
  • Analyze end-to-end product development from initial product strategy to post-launch iteration.
  • Familiarity with Agile Scrum, a variety of product design software, spreadsheets (can maintain complex spreadsheets) and customer research tools.
  • Diverse B2B/B2C portfolio (2+ years), spanning both web and mobile, that reflect design excellence

 

Constraints / Special Conditions

  • Note that this is not a game studio design role 

  • Only applications with a portfolio submission will be considered 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

EEO Employer

Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at

mailTo:employeeservices@apexsystemsinc.com

or 844-463-6178.

title: Business Development Executive
description:
Johnson Service Group (JSG) is recruiting for an experienced, Business Development Executive (BDE). JSG is a premier provider of IT & Technical staffing solutions with 30 years of experience and 32 offices across North America. We have been named by Staffing Industry Analysts (SIA) to three of its prominent 2021 lists: Largest U.S. Staffing Firms, Fastest-Growing U.S. Staffing Firms, and Largest U.S. Engineering Staffing Firms. We are experiencing tremendous growth across North America and now seeking to expand our Canadian Operations dedicated to Staffing Services and Solutions in the Canadian market.

As a Business Development Executive, you will be responsible for attracting and developing new clients across Canada. You will manage the growth and productivity of your clients by presenting contract, contract-to-hire, and permanent staffing solutions, as well as Solutions and formulating service level agreements. Our successful BDE's enjoy a base salary plus an extremely highly rewarding, uncapped compensation structure. We also provide ongoing professional development to enable top-performing team members career advancement opportunities into potential leadership roles.

 

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Attract new and maintain existing client relationships via phone, social media, face-to-face meetings, and email
  • Collaborate with current and potential clients to determine staffing needs and offer solutions
  • Negotiate contracts and pricing with clients
  • Schedule interviews between job candidates and hiring managers
  • Provide consistent follow up to both clients and recruiters in order to obtain feedback and move along the sales process
  • Work closely with our internal recruiters to fulfill client's staffing needs
  • Follow up on sales leads from internal recruiters, candidates, and contractors

 

Required Experience:

  • Outgoing personality with the ability to instantly connect with people
  • 2+ years of technical staffing or permanent placement experience preferred
  • Proven success in account development, establishing and maintaining customer relationships, and moving accounts through a sales funnel
  • Experience with Fortune 500 companies preferred
  • Self-discipline, confidence, and commitment toward following a business plan in a CRM tool
  • Previous experience with giving presentations and with the RFP process
  • Commitment to providing clear communication within the office and to clients
  • Computer literate with a high level of proficiency in all Microsoft Applications

 

All applications will be treated with the strictest of confidence.

Only those selected for interviews with experience in the industry will be contacted.


Job Type: Full-time Salary plus lucrative commissions

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Duration: 6-12 Months to start, renewals probable.

Must Have:

  • You take a user-centric design approach and apply design thinking and ideations across your work.
  • You have a portfolio demonstrating your experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments,
  • Building out user stories, journey maps, mockups, and prototypes.
  • Conducting user workshops and A/B testing.
  • Addressing heuristic analysis, usability, and accessibility concerns.
  • You have expertise in design software such as Sketch and Abstract, Adobe Creative Suite, Figma and Marvel.
  • You may have exposure to Balsamiq, Axure, InVision, and UXPin
  • The practical knowledge. You have experience in using UX best practices to design solutions, applying a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. You can rapidly iterate designs and solutions intelligently and clearly communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to internal and external teams.
The Role:

You will utilize quantitative and qualitative research to generate meaningful insights that will drive creative concepts. You will translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups, and rapid prototypes - optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces, leading to intuitive user experiences. You will apply your findings to create detailed UI designs for the product and development team.

Be a thought-leader. You will identify design problems and devise elegant solutions drawing on best practices and past experience to make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.

Collaborate and iterate. You will collaborate with Product and Development, working with internal and external clients to answer critical business questions. You will elicit needs and draw on user research and insights to create user journeys and user stories. You will workshop and test ideas with customers, iterating designs based on findings and feedback; relaying your commitment to a positive, engaging user experience.

title: Business Development Specialist
description:
DRS Technologies Canada Ltd. (DRS Canada), a subsidiary of Leonardo DRS, is a leading mid-tier Canadian defence electronics company specializing in military voice and data communications systems; electro‑optics (EO) and infrared search and tracking systems (IRST); command, control, communications, computers and intelligence (C4I) systems integration; deployable flight data recorders; and defence/space electronics manufacturing. 

What it is like working at DRS!

  • A motivating team-based environment where your achievements matter
  • A chance to work on industry leading edge technology with exceptional mentors
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Every second Friday off. We care about your work life balance!
  • Flexible hours. Work your hours around your schedule
  • Recipient of Carleton University’s Co-op Employer of the Year in 2018
  • Seasonal company-wide events: free BBQs, Christmas party, Dragon Boat team, Shinny hockey tournament, golf tournament, the Army Run, and more!

To learn more about Leonardo DRS, please visit our website at www.leonardodrs.com.

Purpose:

Working closely with the Business Development Team this position will perform a variety of key functions in support of business development initiatives and activities.

Major Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Participate in the development, implementation and tracking of strategic business development plans to ensure sustainable revenue growth;
  • Develop five (5) year bookings forecasts as part of the Company’s financial operating plan;
  • Assist in the forecasting of monthly, quarterly and yearly sales inventory and manage the Scorecard;
  • Research new business opportunities and prepare for evaluation at bid/no bid reviews;
  • Assist in the coordination of capture activities while monitoring the Bid & Proposal funding;
  • Promote communications and marketing material on both internal and external platforms;
  • Coordinate the participation of DRS TCL in both domestic and international tradeshows from planning through to onsite support at the event;
  • Develop positive working relationships with other functional areas within DRS TCL as well as with external customers serving as the key interface for business development activities; and
  • Support the VP, Business Development and Strategy with special projects and ad hoc assignments.

Core Competencies:

  • Possession of a Degree or Diploma in Business Administration or technical field combined with a minimum of five (5) years relevant experience ideally within the defence industry or equivalent years of experience;
  • Comfortable working with various social media platforms including presentation of materials in a manner that would be appealing to a wide audience;
  • Understanding of financial principals including compiling, reviewing and analyzing data;
  • Previous experience utilizing project management and planning skills in a business development environment;
  • Proficiency with computer software specifically with MS Office Suite;
  • Ability to pay attention to detail, manage own time effectively, produce work of the highest quality and meet deadlines consistently; and
  • Demonstrate strong communication, interpersonal, problem solving, and presentation skills.

All applicants must be eligible to meet requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Program and to obtain a Secret level security clearance.

Applicants requiring a disability related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process are to advise Human Resources. DRS Technologies Canada Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer.

Applicants may apply to this position online at www.leonardodrs.com careers.

title: Communications Specialist
description:
Reference Code: IT044594

Details and Requirements:



Looking for Services of a Communications Specialist with the following (or similar) to assist in the delivery of professional communication services including the following:


• Create content (presentations, videos, articles, success stories, etc.) that develops awareness, knowledge, and understanding across the enterprise of high-level Digital initiatives.
• Develops and promotes communication channels to connect all Manitoba Hydro employees to Digital leaders to enable feedback, sharing, ideas, and dialogue.
• Consistently integrate Digital and Technology initiatives into channels and content.
• Collaborate with Corporate Communications for internal communications to ensure alignment with enterprise messaging, tone, and narrative.
• Arrange and coordinate key events (Brown Bag presentations, etc.).
• Collaborate/coordinate with Business Transformation Office communications and change activities,
• Lead the development of compelling messaging and execution of communication activities across all Digital transformation efforts.

• Provide expertise and support in writing, editing, and producing consistent and quality communications content.



Requirements:
A four-year degree in Communications, Public Relations, or Journalism from an institute of recognized standing and a minimum of five years of directly related experience in Communications, Public Relations and/or Creative Communications
OR
A two-year diploma in Creative Communications from an institute of recognized standing and a minimum of seven years of directly related experience in Communications, Public Relations and/or Creative Communications.
Excellent analytical, decision making, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information clearly and concisely both oral and written.
• Must demonstrate ability to work independently
• Are subject to a PRA (Personnel Risk Assessment)

title: Marketing Research Analyst -Qualtrics / Survey Monkey
description:
LOOKing for a Marketing Research Analyst with quantitative and qualitative skills to support the organization’s research and customer experience programs.  The service provider will support deliverables with the goal of further understanding our target market, audiences, customers, customer satisfaction and brand perception. 
Duration: 12 months
Security Clearance: Reliability
Location: Ottawa (not be expected to work in office locations at this time)
Required Skills:
  • Market research skills, including experience in analyzing quantitative data by coding open ends into themes, conducting frequencies and crosstabs.
  • Online survey programming skills using a research platform like Qualtrics or Survey Monkey
  • Ability to prepare & review insights summaries, reports or presentations
  • Experience using software such as Microsoft office, Excel, and SPSS, research platforms (like Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, etc.)
  • Possess a minimum of 2 years of experience in marketing research.
  • Demonstrated experience in statistical methodologies and proven knowledge of the tools and techniques to capture, analyze, and disseminate actionable customer insights.
  • Experience programming online surveys and manipulating data in a research platform
  • Experience conducting quantitative and qualitative data analysis including; coding open ends into themes, conducting frequencies and crosstabs
  • Good communication skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to collaborate with other researchers and marketing members
  • Familiarity with customer research platform such Qualtrics Experience Measurement Platform (Asset)
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Asset)
 
Tasks/ Responsibilities:
  • Review and perform quality assurance on research instruments (surveys & interview guides)
  • Prepare sample lists and upload them into customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Create and test survey distributions in customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Program surveys in customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Test programmed surveys in customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Code Open end responses: hundreds of verbatim, open-ended comments (non-structured data) from survey responses, code them into themes using Qualtrics and help generate insights
  • Load customer survey results manually into CRM
  • Create dashboards in customer experience and research platform (Qualtrics).
  • Conduct some analysis in SPSS
  • Put together small reports from SPSS analysis into PowerPoint
  • Review and perform quality assurance on reports
  • Participate in meetings
