title: UX/UI Designer, Remote Ontario
description:
We currently have exciting new opportunities for a UI/UX Designers to join our digital design team here at Our client Canada. You will be designing digital products that help our customers build financial resilience. Working with a diverse team of designers and developers with a wide range of experience.

This position reports to the UI/UX Manager.

If you feel this is a good fit for you please email me your word resume to aaron.lail@randstad.ca

Advantages
As a UI/UX designer you should have an eye for clean pixel perfect web experiences, be able to create sitemaps and process flows and interactions, and transform your wireframes into beautiful, intuitive and functional web applications. You will work closely with product owners, delivery managers, QA testers, business analysts and developers to help craft the look, feel and interaction of the web applications.

Responsibilities
Excellent knowledge working with Figma
• Ability to review, understand and make recommendations based on analytics.
• Worked at a digital organization (client or agency) designing web and app experiences
• Have a varied and exciting Digital Portfolio
• Experience of working on responsive web design across a range of devices
• Eye for typography, colour, layout, brand systems, and a pixel perfect attention to detail.
• Worked collaboratively with developers to make your design a reality in code
• Working knowledge of current user experience design principles, standards and trends.
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate your designs and ideas confidently and engagingly and the ability to present work and interface with all levels of management
• Strong experience working with interactive content and efficient at creating Pixel perfect production-ready artwork and assets
• Excellent knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, in particular Photoshop and Illustrator
• Working knowledge of current accessibility design standards.
• Experience designing single page applications
• Understanding of accessibility laws in Canada

Qualifications
Extensive experience in digital visual design (in-house or client-side) designing products and features for mobile or desktop, native or web.
• Have a portfolio that exhibits solid architectural and detailed design thinking, a solid grasp of information architecture, web or mobile technologies, and expert and inspiring visual design.
• Basic CSS and HTML skills

Summary
We are ideally looking for a UX/UI designer who is very strong with Figma and has a responsive portfolio to share.

title: Senior Product Analyst REMOTE
description:
Are you a talented Product Analyst, keen to deliver solutions designed to improve customer value? Our Regina Saskatchewan client is seeking to hire a Product Analyst to join their team on a long-term contract with high potential for extension. Apply to this amazing Product Analyst opportunity today!

What’s in it for you!
As a Product Analyst with our Regina client, you’ll receive:
• Competitive market hourly rates.
• A 12-month contract with high potential for extension.
• Remote interview process.
• Opportunity to work from home during Covid-19.

What will you do?
As a Product Analyst with our Regina client, you will:
• Analyze business and data requirements, analyze and test large volumes of data, help build data models and data mapping, write complex SQL queries, and collaborate with development teams to facilitate application development and design
• Accountable for delivering solutions that enable organizational changes necessary to deliver value to employees and customers.
• Collaborates with the development team, product stakeholders, and end-users to understand, manage and document business requirements.
• Facilitates teamwork and seeks feedback from end-users and stakeholders.
• Involved in complex business and technical domains.
• Documents and executes user story acceptance tests.

How do you qualify?
To qualify for the Product Analyst role with our Regina client, you must have:
• 5+ years’ experience as a Senior Product Analyst/ Quality Analyst
• Experience with a variety of software solutions and technical applications.
• Strong technical quality assurance skills and experience
• General knowledge of systems analysis and design concepts.
• Experience working with data and data models
• Writing complex SQL

If the prospect of building a career in the technical and business domains by providing support while honing your product analysis skills intrigues you, then the Product Analyst role with our Regina Saskatchewan client could be the perfect opportunity for you!

title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer
description:
** If this posting is still published, it means we are still reading through every resume **

Location: USA and Canada. 100% remote.
Job type: Both full-time and contract - multiple roles open
Start date: Immediate


About the job:
Our client is hiring for a full-time Salesforce Marketing Cloud developer.

Responsibilities:

  • Architect the structure and setup new instances of the Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • Maintain and support exist instances of the Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • Work with a RESTful APIs to move data between custom databases, CRM platforms and the Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • Read and understand business requirement documents to facilitate the creation of an appropriate functionality requirements document
  • Ensure that solutions meet both business requirements and technical requirements, including performance, maintainability and stability
  • Design and build digital marketing Journeys
  • Use your SQL experience to build automations and manipulate data
  • Use SSJS to create Cloud Pages within the Salesforce Marketing Cloud that update the Salesforce Sales Cloud
  • Use AMPScript to create highly dynamic emails

Experience:

  • 2+ years of hands-on experience working with the Salesforce Marketing Cloud: Email studio, Content Builder, Contact Builder, Cloud Pages, Automation Studio, and Journey Builder
  • Experience with SSJS (Server-Side JavaScript), AMPScript, SQL, Journey Builder, Automation Studio, and Cloud Page
  • Experience with the design and development of relational databases
  • Experience working with web services and RESTful APIs

Nice to have:

  • Excellent understanding of the full software development life-cycle
  • Excellent communication and documentation skills
  • Self-motivated, good initiative and able to work independently to deliver a quality product while meeting tight deadlines
  • Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud Mobile Studio is considered an asset
  • Experience with Evergage (Interaction Studio) or Datorama is considered an asset
  • Certifications

title: Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications
description:
Client ID: 5486

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications

On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications.

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications – Job Description

  • UX designer (Interaction Designer) will work within an agile and cross-functional squad to work closely with Content Designers, Visual Designers, product and technology teams to produce flows from discovery to delivery phase
  • Looking for more of a “progressive” interaction designer in the sense that they exhibit more of a Product Designer mindset with regards to being comfortable with multiple skillsets (i.e., Interaction, Visual, Design Thinking)
  • Product Design focused (interaction, visual design, service design principles)
  • Highly skilled interaction designer with strong experience and understanding of component design
  • The ability to communicate rationale for design decisions as well as exhibit the flexibility to understand business and development constraints and how might that affect the design

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications – Mandatory Skills

  • BA/BS degree in Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science (CS), or a related field or equivalent practical experience
  • 2-3 years of experience in designing usable interfaces across multiple channels and platforms
  • Product Design focused (Interaction and Visual Design skillset)
  • Must have experience working on projects focused on Banking Product application
  • Strong understanding and experience with component design (Figma a requirement)
  • Has mobile-first design experience
  • Has worked in an Agile setting and a proven track record of working closely with product owners and developers
  • Has experience working with a Design System

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications – Nice to Have Skills

  • MA/MS degree or certification in Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Computer Science (CS), or a related field
  • Strong understanding of strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during each product phase
  • Appreciation for the potential of 'design thinking'
  • Experience working within a large organization and within an agile environment

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications - Assignment Start Date

ASAP – 12 months to start

Digital UX Interaction Product Designer, Banking Applications - Assignment Location

Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

title: Market Risk Analyst
description:
Client ID: 3825

Market Risk Analyst

On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Market Risk Analyst.

Market Risk Analyst – Job Description

  • The Model Control & Governance team within Market Risk & Model Development services the analytic and quantitative modeling needs of valuation and risk models for various stakeholders
  • Strong candidate to join the group to support model implementation testing for Murex system upgrade project
  • Work primarily with the team to perform model implementation review and testing, version control, as well as providing the analytic and quantitative modeling expertise to various internal partners
  • Perform model implementation testing and version control process for Foreign Exchange, Base Metal, and Precious Metal derivative models across PnL, Risk, VaR and CCR from bank's global trading businesses.
  • Design testing scenarios and conduct quantitative verification on model review and analysis as requested to ensure the timely delivery.
  • Review and provide effective challenge to model developer or model validation.
  • Create detailed model implementation testing documentation report.
  • Ensure to acquire an understanding of processes and methodologies followed by the business requirement.
  • Work on a project within securities
  • Communicating with different departments (deal with different people in different teams, some will not have a financial background so they will need to be able to take financial and/or technical terms and put it in layman’s terms)

Market Risk Analyst – Mandatory Skills

  • Solid quantitative finance knowledge associated with excellent understanding of derivative products, as well as the valuation and risk management methodologies
  • Solid understanding of pricing theory, stochastic calculus and numerical techniques used in derivative pricing (PDE/trees, Monte Carlo simulation, optimization)
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to translate complex technical issues for the benefit of others
  • Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematical/Computational Finance, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering

Market Risk Analyst – Nice to Have Skills

  • Previous working experience with Murex system on Foreign Exchange, Base Metal, and Precious Metal derivative models
  • Computational and programming knowledge (Python or VBA)
  • Experience in Model Development, Model Validation or related quantitative role – 3-5 years

Market Risk Analyst - Assignment Start Date

ASAP – 12 months to start

Market Risk Analyst - Assignment Location

Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

title: Content Marketing Assistant
description:
General Description

DMA Global is looking for a Content Marketing Assistant for our client.The company is growing fast, and we need someone who is self motivated and can handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.  We are looking for someone with 1-3 years of experience who has a degree or equivalent in marketing, communications, or a related field.

Your role will be to handle content marketing, social media platforms, digital branding, SEO, and website design.  The selected candidate must work well in teams, and be able to communicate effectively with the team to ensure the best results are achieved.  

You will have excellent communication skills, you are a problem-solver and outcome seeker, you have excellent presentation skills, and you are extremely organized.  

As this is a new role, in a quickly growing company you will have to wear many hats!

Marketing Support:

  • Digital Marketing 2+ years
  • Content Creation 2+ years
  • Photo and Video Editing 1+ years
  • Website design (Wordpress or similar) 1+ years
  • Understanding of the marketing funnel

Technical Support: 

  • SEO maintenance 1+ years
  • SEM management 1+ years
  • Google Analytics or similar

Other: 

  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Must be able to work in a team environment under minimal supervision

Degree (or equivalent) in marketing, communications, or information design is preferred. 

Responsibilities include:

  • Planning, development and execution of digital programs and campaigns, including online advertising/marketing to specific target audiences.
  • Leading ongoing management of digital touch points, including social networking landing pages and marketing funnels.
  • Owning and maintaining site analytics, metrics, and campaign reporting.
  • In depth knowledge of SEO and Ad words programs.
  • Social media data analysis and reporting.
  • Content creation experience with platforms like InDesign, Photoshop, and/or Canva.
  • Video recording and editing with Movavi or similar programs.
  • Website design and maintenance for programs like Wordpress or similar. 

We would like to thank all applicants, but only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Marketing Assistant - TPT - OHVA / Business Development
description:
Posting #: 2021-886602

Non Union

Position:Marketing Assistant

Department: Oakville Hospital Volunteer Association / Business Development

Status: Temporary Part-timeuntil approx. February 28, 2022 (Must provide availability up to a 0.6 FTE)

Hours:Monday to Friday - Days

Site:Oakville

Halton Healthcare takes great pride in providing quality, compassionate healthcare services to our rapidly growing communities. As a progressive and vibrant healthcare organization, we take healthcare to a new level to meet the urgent needs of ourcommunity's growing and aging population. We are adistinctive centre of healthcare excellence that offers first-rate care in an innovative environment that supports the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual needs of the community.

Halton Healthcare’s vision of Exemplary patient experiences, always , goes beyond just the patient experience; it has shaped our entire culture and remains at the core of every interaction in our organization, from our patients & families to our staff, physicians and volunteers. We believe in exemplary PEOPLE experiences always!

This is what you'll be doing:

Social Media

  • Assist in marketing and advertising promotional activities on diverse media platforms
    • Facebook
    • Websites
    • Youtube
    • Internal Intranet
    • Constant Contact – Email Campaign Blast

Campaigns
  • Support the Marketing Department in daily administrative tasks and odd jobs
  • Tracking sales data
  • Dispersing Marketing Material
  • Maintaining Promotional Material Inventory
  • Maintaining a database
  • Sending out e-mail campaigns

Project Search:

Business development Social Media & Marketing Student Volunteer Position:

  • Uploading to Facebook pages –4 Business Development Facebook pages
  • Upload communication to daily dose for our retailers, as well as BD hospital events for OTMH, Milton and Georgetown.
  • Using an e-marketing program called Constant Contact to reach clients that follow our events.
  • Execute all communication plans – which could consist of walking around the hospital and placing marketing pieces in pre-approved areas
  • Preparation of logistics for all events at the hospital and externally. May be asked to attend events if it falls during their placement time.
  • Printing to the Colour printer
  • Cutting and lamination
  • Computer knowledge a must. – Excel and Word
  • Some telephone work

This is what you’ll need to do it:
  • Strong knowledge of social media
  • Goal oriented ability to stay focused on creating winning results
  • Excellent time management
  • Some marketing experience would be an asset
  • Excellent communications both verbal and written, interpersonal and organizational skills and ability to manage and engage in a volunteer based working environment
  • Hours/days of work may vary due to the demands of the business must be available during hours of operations.

Date Posted: October 21, 2021

Internal Applications due by: October 28, 2021

Please apply if you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

W e thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.

In accordance with Directive #6, Halton Healthcare has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination and Management Policy. All new hires must be fully compliant with our Policy as a condition of employment with Halton Healthcare. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of vaccination or proof of a documented medical exemption as part of the hiring process.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation. All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products. We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: Part-Time International Marketing Assistant
description:
Department: International Education and Development
Campus: Barrie
Classification: Support Staff
Posting Date: February 3, 2022
Salary Range: $18.95 - $24.58
Hours per week: Up to 24 hours per week - Current hours anticipated to be 24 hours per week
Status: Part-time (Regular)

Reporting to the Director, Global Engagement, International Education and Development, the incumbent assists with departmental marketing media, including print, digital copy, website and social media. Specific duties include, but are not limited to:

Media Design:
• Assisting with concept development, design and production of multi-language communications and marketing documents ensuring material conforms to cultural norms and that translation services are coordinated. Documents / materials may include case studies, photography, digital communications, program guides, paid and unpaid media, brochures, videography, and reports to raise awareness of the programs and services.
• Creating graphic design images for various digital media.
• Producing and maintaining international student information graphic video series
• Assisting with Marketing and Communications with student recruitment efforts by producing high-quality communications (multi-language formats as needed) such as alumni testimonials, blogs, webinars, etc. in accessible formats for a wide range of audiences
• Assisting in the daily updates of departmental social media in various applications globally by answering inquiries and posting information on social media platforms.
• Assisting with the development of an annual internationalization marketing plan which may include assisting with the development of graphics or content for the plan.
• Ensuring all website designs are AODA Compliant and accessible in other countries across all browsers and all devices
• Generating media usage reports using web analytics (user engagement, user feedback, etc.), summarizing information if applicable, and providing the appropriate international manager with the material which is used for decision making (i.e. negative comments received on a specific topic may warrant the manager to decide to remove the content or re-word the content)

Events:
• Assisting with photography collection at various on and off-campus events
• Participating in international department and college-side events on behalf of the international department such as Open Houses, Come Together Week, college events and community events.
• Assisting with communication efforts to promote events to international students

Projects:
• Assisting with organizing and coordinating marketing project activities which includes requesting assistance, and communicating the task requirements, to student and staff international team members
• Assisting with marketing efforts on various departmental projects
• Aid in the coordination and collection, analysis, distribution and response with stakeholder communications in relation to project scopes, creative development and feedback, and facilitates the flow of information with clear establishment of milestones and/or deadlines

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Successfully completed a two-year postsecondary diploma in web design, graphic design, marketing, or a related field.
• A minimum of two years experience working in web design, graphic design and/or marketing.
• Experience working in a post-secondary environment would be an asset
• Demonstrates sensitivity to different cultures and able to working in challenging environments
• Excellent communications skills, both written and oral
• Strong computer skills and experience using the MS Office Suite (i.e. Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access), Adobe Suite (i.e. InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator), and Social Media
• Organization and time management skills
• Strong knowledge of campus and community services and Georgian College programs
• Experience gathering, analyzing data and preparing reports, including website data analytics
• Ability to work independently as well as part of a team

Georgian College supports diversity, equity and a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. Georgian College is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process and workplace. If you are contacted to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please advise the interview coordinator of any accommodations needed with respect to any materials or processes used to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process.

Alternate formats will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process.

Georgian College has a COVID-19 vaccination procedure in place. As a condition of employment, employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 to work on any campus, or a facility owned, operated or controlled by Georgian College unless they have a valid medical or religious belief/creed reason for not getting vaccinated, which reason will be considered on a case by case basis and which will be subject to the College's accommodation processes.

Applications for this position must be received by 11:59 p.m. on February 9, 2022. While we thank all applicants, only those contacted for an interview will be acknowledged.

title: Acquisitions and Marketing Assistant - Summer Student
description:
ECO Canada is the steward for the Canadian environmental workforce across all industries. From job creation and wage funding, to training and labour market research - we champion the end-to-end career of an environmental professional. We work with the federal, provincial, and municipal governments in all Canadian regions to support economic growth and environmental stewardship as best practice.

When you work at ECO Canada, you are supporting the growth of an abundant environmental workforce. Along with competitive benefits and compensation, we provide the opportunity to work alongside a dynamic team that values collaboration, high performance and, of course, celebrating our successes! We believe that rewarding, meaningful work should be part of every step of the career journey.

Job Description

The Acquisition and Marketing Teams at ECO Canada oversee the brand, customer engagement, client relationships, growth, and reputation of the organization. We support the five streams within ECO Canada and their programs, as well as the overarching strategy of the organization. We need to understand the industry, the story behind the numbers, our personas and how these are tied together to ensure we meet the yearly targets. As a key member of the team, the Acquisitions and Marketing Assistant - Summer Student will support in communication duties involved in both sales and marketing, and help with research and analytics which will determine strategies, campaigns and tactics.

While each member of ECO Canada has individual responsibilities, ECO takes a team-based approach. Everyone is encouraged to take ownership of his/her ideas and to see them through to completion, collaborating with key influencers as required. 

Responsibilities

The Acquisitions and Marketing Assistant - Summer Student will assist both Acquisitions and Marking with the accomplishment of a variety of tasks and initiatives, including but not limited to:

  • Communication - Review content and include feedback, and when the opportunity is available develop scripts and content for smaller tactics e.g. social media, call scripts, email marketing content. Sitting in on team meetings and brain storming session to provide ideas on how to best communicate to certain audience segments/personas, as well as how to market programs.
  • Research - When launching a new campaign, developing a strategy for a new program or product, or when trying to increase market strength, conducting research on the competitive landscape, opportunities of success and recommended next steps are vital. This role will support the team members who are overseeing the research portion.
  • Analytics - To continue the growth of ECO Canada and ensuring we are providing the best recommendations we need to analyze past tactics to track performance. Data analysis allows to tailor our approach and identify areas for improvement. This role will be responsible for the analysis and the story behind the numbers for smaller programs and campaigns - with support for team members. In addition, there may be opportunities to assist with digital marketing campaigns: planning, tracking, and reporting.
  • Administration - To assist team members by organizing files and folders, to input data and to update project dashboards across a range of platforms.

 Qualifications and Education

  • Working towards a bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, communications, or a related discipline
  • Excellent command of the English language, with strong emphasis on written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience using MS Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) as well as general computer skills including file management and data entry
  • Strong interpersonal skills and desire to connect with people in working in all areas of the environmental sector
  • Great attitude and ability to maintain control while coordinating activities and balancing multiple priorities
  • Exceptional time-management, organizational skills and high attention to detail
  • Well-developed, independent work ethic along with ability to communicate with the team and external parties
  • Self-motivated and able to work with minimal oversight
  • Fluency in French will be considered an asset
  • Experience with email marketing programs an asset (Act-On, Mailchimp etc.)
  • Experience using social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn) and knowledge of content tools an asset (Hootsuite/Buffer)
  • Experience with website content management systems as asset (WordPress, Elementor, etc.)
  • Experience with CRMs (Pipedrive, Hubspot, etc.) considered an asset
  • Experience with sales processes considered an asset
  • Desire to grow personal skills is essential

This is a temporary 8-week contract position, funded by Canada Summer Jobs 2022.  If you feel you are the perfect fit for this position and are looking to join a company culture that is fun, flexible and defined by our collective drive for success, please apply now through our website. Please upload your resume and cover letter as one PDF file. 

Applicants who do not include a cover letter will not be considered.

We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
Overview:

TYLin is a full-service, professional engineering firm focused on the planning, design, and construction of infrastructure solutions for public and private clients worldwide. The firm is an internationally recognized pioneer in solving the most difficult engineering challenges.

 

Headquartered in San Francisco, California for over 65 years, TYLin has more than 3,200 professionals throughout the Americas, Asia, and Europe. TYLin is a member of Dar Group, a global, privately-owned professional services group, and its industry-leading family of Global Infrastructure companies.  

 

We are currently seeking a Marketing Specialist to provide support for marketing activities in Canada. The Marketing Specialist exercises independent judgment and performs most assignments based on specification of desired results.

 

In this role, you may supervise administrative, and marketing-related support staff, such as Marketing Coordinator or Marketing Assistants. You may also coordinate/direct the efforts of specialized consultants, such as photographers and other marketing related vendors and you may assume temporary supervisory responsibility for technical staff assigned to marketing projects.

Responsibilities:
  • Serves as project manager for the coordination, writing, editing and production of statements of qualifications, proposals, presentations, and other marketing materials, or assist with such efforts.
  • Works with sector managers to implementation marketing plan.
  • Implements communication strategy including project and personnel internal and external public relations efforts in coordination with the Corporate Communications Team.
  • In partnership with appropriate thought leaders, develops a strategy for storytelling in written and visual forms.
  • Composes narrative for marketing materials such as proposals and collateral using creative and persuasive writing skills.
  • Creates concepts for and coordinates production of collateral materials.
  • Develops strategy on project- and marketing sector-specific marketing activities, which may include content marketing plans.
  • Assists in research of target markets and clients as directed.
  • Gathers, formats and maintains accurate, up-to-date firm marketing information including staff bios, project descriptions and statistics, and other information for marketing purposes.
  • Supports the implementation of corporate identity initiatives, and social media.
  • Updates firmwide database with project and proposal information on an ongoing basis.
  • Develops award submittals and coordinates public relations initiatives as needed, including social media participation with Corporate Communications Team.
  • Produces high quality work products in terms of messaging, accuracy, content and compliance with customer requirements
  • Conduct and coordinate a range of marketing support activities as directed.
Qualifications:
  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in marketing, communications, or technical field; or 2 to 4 years of experience, preferably with 1 year in marketing assistant/jr. marketing coordinator or related position; or associate degree and 3 to 5 years of experience;
  • Experience in the AEC industry highly desirable.
  • Demonstrable experience of the development of technical proposals, is highly desirable.
  • Must be proficient using MS Office (including Word, PowerPoint, and Excel) and Adobe (including InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop and Acrobat). Knowledge of Deltek Vision CRM databases a plus.
  • Client focused, always striving to give clients the best solutions.
  • Strong commitment to innovation by creating new and better ways to solve clientsâ€™ toughest challenges.
  • High levels of integrity, always doing the right thing in an ethical, fair, and sustainable way.
  • Demonstrated experience of collaboration in a diverse and inclusive team, working together toward technical excellence.
  • Has proven capabilities to write messaging for various content channels (news releases, website, email, social media, etc.).
  • Has an interest in and ability to learn about industry-related concepts and apply that understanding to written marketing materials.
  • Can solve problems and work independently, and as a team player.
  • Shares knowledge with others and seeks out knowledge that can be gained from others.
  • Is actively involved in professional and community organizations.
  • Is proactive, resourceful, a self-starter and can easily multi-task against deadlines.
  • Thrives in a collaborative, engaging and fast-paced environment.
  • Has strong organizational, problem-solving and attention to details skills.
  • Is able to think creatively and strategically.
  • Should be able to develop marketing program through both original contributions and refinement of existing activities.

 

TYLin is an equal opportunity employer and we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type as protected by federal, state, or local laws. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The Company requires that all employees be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or submit to weekly COVID-19 testing prior to attending any Company or client locations or events.

title: Marketing & Promotions Assistant
description:
We are the leader in marketing and promotional consulting services. Our expert team of Marketing and Promotions Assistants are helping transform our clientsâ€™ business into leaders of their market. We are seeking an entrepreneurial mindset with strong relationship-building and customer-facing skills to join our team as a Marketing and Promotions Assistant. 

 

Marketing and Promotions Assistant Responsibilities:

This role is critical to the Marketing and Promotions team and serves as a key point of communication between their respective working marketing teams. They are involved in each project from start to finish, helping wherever possible to meet the needs of the team and the clients. It will be your responsibility to communicate our proven track record, leadership and innovation through a clear marketing and promotions strategy in this extraordinarily fast-growing, exciting industry segment. You will report directly to the CEO, as a key contributor to our continued success in our marketing and promotions consulting services. 

 

The daily responsibilities of our Marketing and Promotions Assistant include: 

  • Determine appropriate marketing and promotions strategies for local territory
  • Build and monitor promotions in various territories using marketing systems and tools that are taught by top marketing and promotions team members
  • Be data-driven. Monitor marketing and consumer metrics; make recommendations for enhancing effectiveness, and report on all activity and results
  • Must have strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize in a changing environment 
  • Assist in relationship development with the consumers by thoroughly running through each marketing promotion our clients are offering and helping them select a package that suits their needs

 

Marketing and Promotions Assistant Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree and/or experience in marketing, communications, or business development
  • Passion for analyzing products, customers and market dynamics; interest in industry trends and latest marketing techniques 
  • Understanding of marketing perspectives and strategies
  • The ability to think creatively and â€œoutside of the boxâ€ as it pertains to developing marketing ideas and campaigns for our business partners 
  • Must be timely and have a flexible work schedule in order to deal effectively with responsibilities throughout the year: weekends, nights and holidays as dictated by clients and their needs

title: Content Marketing Specialist (Remote Friendly)
description:
*This position is open for consideration of candidates in both Saskatoon, SK as well as remotely across Canada (dependent on experience).


At Vendasta, we believe in helping great local businesses survive and thrive in a world that’s more competitive than ever—and we’re growing our team! This is an opportunity to join one of the fastest growing tech companies in Canada and make a direct impact on local economies worldwide. In a world where local businesses all over the globe have had their livelihoods turned upside down, Vendasta continues to help them embrace digital solutions and flourish. 


Vendasta is a certified Great Place to Work and Best Workplace™ for Today’s Youth and Women. Keep reading if you’d like to join us on our mission to support small businesses all over the world.


About the Job

We are looking for an eager wordsmith and storyteller to join our content team. The ideal candidate is an outstanding writer, who is a quick learner with a deep interest in digital marketing, a keen eye for detail, and an ability to keep up with the changing landscape in content marketing. 


This is a great opportunity to join a dynamic marketing team, get involved behind-the-scenes in the tech and marketing industry, and explore and improve your creative abilities. There’s plenty of room for growth, and self-starters are sure to thrive.


The impact you’ll have

  • Write high-quality content for the website, blogs, long-form, social, email, and other collateral as required
  • Develop pieces as determined by the Director of Content Marketing, as well as contribute new ideas
  • Create long-form content like reports, case studies, and white papers
  • Read and absorb industry-leading content outside of Vendasta’s production
  • Produce lead-generation content that reflects Vendasta’s goals and helps our partners and prospects solve their business challenges
  • Construct email campaigns based on specific objectives and audiences
  • Create and publish paid and organic social media content on a range of topics
  • Keep a consistent social media posting calendar to engage audience on social platforms
  • Depending on skills & interests, help out with podcast production, video and audio production, ad campaign creation, web design, and other marketing projects


The value you’ll bring 

  • 2+ years of relevant experience
  • Strong writing and communication skills are essential
  • Experience in information technology and software-as-a-services is preferred
  • Exceptional organizational skills and keen attention to detail
  • Interest in digital marketing, content marketing, blogging and other content creation
  • Proficient knowledge of social media and best practices
  • Ability to work independently as well as collaborate within a team
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SEO best practices
  • The following are a strong plus: experience with graphic design software (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign or others), video and/or audio production and editing software (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, After Effects, Audition or other), and Wordpress knowledge.


About Vendasta

So what do we actually do? We create an entire platform full of digital products & solutions that help small to medium sized businesses (SMBs) have a stronger presence online through digital advertising, online listings, reputation management, website creation, social media marketing … and much more! Our platform is used exclusively by channel partners, who sell products and services to SMBs, allowing them to leverage us to scale and grow their business. We’re trusted by 60,000+ channel partners, serving over 5.5 million small to medium businesses worldwide! 


Perks

  • Benefits  - health, dental, life, and disability insurance, an employee assistance program (EAP)*, and $500 annual Health Spending Account. Premiums for health & dental insurance will be covered by Vendasta!
  • Vacation - Minimum 3 weeks paid vacation per year; uncapped sick time policy.
  • Employee Options Program  - get in on Vendasta’s growth and success!
  • Sweet Eats - On site cafeteria with beverages & snacks all day and free catered lunch every Friday
  • Training & Career Development - Education reimbursement program, professional development plans, leadership workshops, mentorship program, and so much more! 
  • Culture - comprised of our core values: Drive, Innovation, Respect, and Agility
  • Social Events -  Ideas on Tap, ski trips, virtual talent shows, yoga classes, and more!
  • Giving Back -  endless opportunities to take part in programs and initiatives that give back to the community we work in, including paid volunteer time.
Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

title: Sr Pricing Analyst
location: Area F (Mcconnell Creek/Hatzic Prairie), British Columbia
description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Affirm, Inc. proudly includes Affirm, PayBright, and Returnly. 

We are looking for intelligent, driven professionals to join the fast growing Merchant Pricing team! Merchant Pricing is responsible for enabling efficient value exchange between merchants and consumers through innovative and strategic pricing solutions.

In this role, you will help Affirm drive revenue growth and portfolio optimization and apply strategic pricing solutions to deepen merchant relationships. You will collaborate with Commercial, Marketing, Credit, Finance, Capital Markets, Product, Engineering, and Data Science teams. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem solving skills with solid knowledge of analytical tools, as well as interpersonal skills to work cross-functionally and drive forward recommendations.

What you'll do

  • Use data insights and work with various cross-functional teams to implement innovative pricing strategies for our top strategic partners and scaled programs
  • Structure new pricing strategies and solutions to go-to-market in a digestible and scalable framework to strengthen our positioning, deepen merchant relationships, and increase our competitive advantage
  • Develop analytical capabilities to enable pricing optimization at various levels of aggregation addressing needs for Affirm, our merchants, and strategic partners
  • Conduct analyses on sophisticated and open-ended questions at the intersection of profitability and risk; present findings in a clear and concise manner to influence partners across Commercial, Credit, Finance, Capital Markets, Product, etc.
  • Own end-to-end analytics workflow, including defining success, implementing data requirements, conducting analysis, generating insights and hypotheses, monitoring performance metrics, socializing them across the organization

What we look for

  • 3+ years of experience in an analytics role (consulting, finance, analytics, pricing, etc.). Experience in Financial Services and pricing analytics / deal desk is a plus
  • Masters Degree in Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Computer Science, or Financial Engineering is a plus
  • Strong working knowledge of analytical tools, such as SQL and Python
  • Eager to seek out new opportunities, navigate ambiguity and develop creative solutions using data
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to develop strong relationships and work with cross-functional partners
  • Strong work ethic - able to take ownership beyond own responsibility and manage timelines/outputs effectively

Location - Remote Canada

#LI-Remote

Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles are remote and can be located anywhere in the U.S. and Canada (with the exception of the U.S. Territories, Quebec, Yukon, Nunavut, and the Northwest Territories) unless the job indicates a different global location. We are currently building operations in Spain, Poland, and Australia.  Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely or from an Affirm office in their country of hire, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our offices in Chicago, New York, Pittsburgh, Salt Lake City, San Francisco and Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.

All full-time jobs at Affirm (excluding interns and apprentices) are tied to a transparent grade-based pay range taking location into account. 

[Colorado Candidates] In accordance with Colorados Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the grade for this position in Colorado is listed above. You can find the Colorado base pay range and benefits here.

If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people who believe in Affirm's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of waysnot just candidates who check all the boxes.
 
Inclusivity:

At Affirm, People Come First is one of our core values, and thats why diversity and inclusion are vital to our priorities as an equal opportunity employer. You can read about our D&I program here and our progress thus far in our 2021 DEI Report.

We also believe Its On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.

By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy, or the Affirm Employment Privacy Notice (EU) for applicants applying from the European Union, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
Company:

Finning International Inc.

Number of Openings:

1

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

Pricing data, strategy and revenue analytics are increasingly impacting traditional businesses, and the heavy equipment business is no exception. Through system and quoting controls, improved administration, revenue analytics and strategic optimization, Finning is working to identify market willingness to pay and dynamic optimization opportunities.

This position is responsible for conducting pricing analytics, developing and implementing pricing strategies, and administering pricing changes based on analysis that will profitably grow the Finning business while enhancing customer loyalty.

Job Description:

Large opportunity and RFP support (30%)

  • Be agile in providing pricing scenarios for large opportunities or RFPs (requests for pricing) that come from our large mining customers.
  • Provide detailed analysis on impacts for various scenarios.

Provide fixed pricing scenarios to our large mining customers (40%)

  • Understand the scope of each pricing agreement as specified by the customers contract.
  • Calculate the pricing appropriate to each customer to be loaded into Finning's and the customer's ERP systems.
  • Own the pricing process for each customer end-to-end when working with other business units.

Give Sales Managers and Product Managers visibility to detailed revenue and pricing information via consistent reporting (30%)

Qualifications:

  • Bachelors’ degree in Business, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics.
  • Masters level (MBA) considered an asset.
  • 5 +years of experience in an analytical role with progressing levels of responsibility, with 2+ years in a Pricing, Economics, or Marketing analyst role
  • Completion of pricing specific training / professional development
  • Well versed in SQL and data analysis tools and techniques.
  • Proficient with MS Office applications and internal systems.

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

title: Marketer (Door to Door)
description:
SWP Burnaby is hiring door-to-door marketers for the Summer season (May to August) to work in the Burnaby area.

Ideal candidates are outgoing, positive, and independent. On the job training and marketing materials are provided and no experience is necessary. In this position, you will learn valuable customer service and marketing skills.

Position:

  • Marketing door-to-door independently or with a friend in the Burnaby area
  • Perfect for those who want to earn money with flexible part-time hours. Recommended that applicants apply with friends as it will create a more fun work environment!

Wage:

  • $19/hour

Hours:

  • Weekdays: 4:30pm-8pm
  • Weekends: 11am-6pm (Minimum 4 hours per week, not required to work all of the weekday and weekend hours)

Requirements to apply:

  • Strong conversation skills
  • Great attitude
  • Willing to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest

 

SWP West is a local painting company that has been operating in the lower mainland for the past 30 years. We offer Interior and Exterior, Residential, and Commercial painting services.

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Marketing & Promotions Associate
description:
We are the leader in marketing and promotional consulting services. Our expert team of Marketing and Promotions Associates are helping transform our clientsâ€™ business into leaders of their market. We are seeking an entrepreneurial mindset with strong relationship-building and customer-facing skills to join our team as a Marketing and Promotions Associate. 

 

Marketing and Promotions Associate Responsibilities:

This role is critical to the Marketing and Promotions team and serves as a key point of communication between their respective working marketing teams. They are involved in each project from start to finish, helping wherever possible to meet the needs of the team and the clients. It will be your responsibility to communicate our proven track record, leadership and innovation through a clear marketing and promotions strategy in this extraordinarily fast-growing, exciting industry segment. You will report directly to the CEO, as a key contributor to our continued success in our marketing and promotions consulting services. 

 

The daily responsibilities of our Marketing and Promotions Associates include: 

  • Determine appropriate marketing and promotions strategies for local territory
  • Build and monitor promotions in various territories using marketing systems and tools that are taught by top marketing and promotions team members
  • Be data-driven. Monitor marketing and consumer metrics; make recommendations for enhancing effectiveness, and report on all activity and results
  • Must have strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize in a changing environment 
  • Assist in relationship development with the consumers by thoroughly running through each marketing promotion our clients are offering and helping them select a package that suits their needs

 

Marketing and Promotions Associate Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree and/or experience in marketing, communications, or business development
  • Passion for analyzing products, customers and market dynamics; interest in industry trends and latest marketing techniques 
  • Understanding of marketing perspectives and strategies
  • The ability to think creatively and â€œoutside of the boxâ€ as it pertains to developing marketing ideas and campaigns for our business partners 
  • Must be timely and have a flexible work schedule in order to deal effectively with responsibilities throughout the year: weekends, nights and holidays as dictated by clients and their needs

title: Senior Marketing Automation Specialist (Marketo) - Remote
description:
Please note: We are open to hiring anywhere in Canada, as long as you can work in EST.


It's our time to scale. It's your time to be part of something big.


Tulip's mission is bold. We're a team of experts who have worked with and for retailers over the past 20 years. We are driven to disrupt an entire industry and enable one of the world's largest job markets.


Tulip has built a retail mobile software platform that empowers leading retailers such as Mulberry, Chanel, Saks Fifth Avenue, Kate Spade, Coach, and Michael Kors to give mobile devices to their store associates so they can elevate service, sell more and provide a personalized experience.


Tulip is a place you come to make an impact, working with like-minded people to build something meaningful using the best technology. We are growing, and while lean is great, we need more people, energy, innovation and talent.


Right now, we are adding a Marketing Automation Specialist to the team. As part of the Marketing team, you will help Tulip execute and optimize its marketing automations and operations programs. The Specialist will perform day-to-day system maintenance and configuration of Marketo aiming to drive improvements and employ best practices across the department. Working very closely with both the Sales and Marketing teams, they will contribute to process improvement projects to help drive team efficiencies.


What you will do:

  • Oversee and execute Marketo campaigns, nurture programs and emails
  • Implement and optimize nurture and drip campaigns 
  • Collaborate with Sales and Marketing team members to optimize lead scoring and ensure accuracy across all channels, programs, and initiatives
  • Ensure leads are properly tracked and attributed across complex sales cycles 
  • Create and manage forms and form architecture 
  • Use templates to create and update landing pages and thank you pages in WordPress (Marketo form embeds)
  • Support and enable multi-channel campaigns and conversions 
  • Manage dashboards and provide weekly metrics updates on full funnel lead progression 
  • Automate and improve data integrity and data management initiatives
  • Manage contact database, including segmentation and list management
  • Work closely with Revenue Operations to ensure Salesforce and Marketo work smoothly together 
  • Ability to set up, analyze and adjust email plans using A/B testing
  • Continually learn, research, recommend, and implement email and marketing automation best practices


What you bring:

  • University degree, preferably in marketing, business, or economics, or equivalent working experience
  • 2-3 years of experience with marketing automation systems
  • Solid understanding of the Marketo platform
  • Comfortable with Salesforce and Google Ads 
  • Experience with advanced automation and segmentation logic  
  • Experience with dashboarding and reporting 
  • Strong understanding of email nurture tactics and strategies 
  • Strong executor who likes to be hands on 
  • Ability to prioritize own workload and meet deadlines


Tech Stack: Marketo, Salesforce, WordPress, Google: Analytics, Optimize, Tag Manager, Clearbit, Unbounce, Zoom


Tulip has perks, career progress, and an intimate culture. We have:

  • Embraced remote culture! Work remotely, permanently, and full-time.
  • Ability for employees in many roles to choose to work a 4½ or 4-day week.
  • A “workcation” benefit that’ll let you work reduced hours in order to extend your vacations
  • An excellent healthcare plan with no wait time, paid parental leave, and corporate gym rates.
  • A culture of openness and idea generation. We have weekly all-hands and quarterly town halls. We pride ourselves on our transparency and keeping it real. From the most senior to the newest team member, we give you access to decision makers and career building work. 
  • The opportunity to grow and apply new skills be it hands-on or leadership. We prioritize diversity, inclusion, and building a community. We're a little weird but in a good way. 


Why we are awesome.

Tulip is hungry and humble. When you join Tulip, you'll be part of a strong, thriving, diverse group of people who come from different disciplines, countries, and experiences. We do what we love and it shows in our unrelenting pursuit of affecting real change. We believe in investing in our people, building positive relationships with our customers, and treating our work like our craft. 


Tulip is at the cutting edge of technology. We work with big-name retailers. It's a chance to step up to solving complex technical problems and develop a deeper understanding of the retail world while being part of a niche startup style company. We don't fear failure; we embrace challenges. We're excited about taking the lesser known paths, using the open source tools and keeping up with the pace of evolving tech solutions. It's fun, it's fast, and it's future-focused.


Tulip gives back. Inspired, passionate, and committed people helped make us the successful company we are today. We challenge norms and put people before profits. Our CEO, Ali Asaria, created The Tulip Foundation, a charity controlled by all of us, the employees. We believe we can build a great company that changes the technical space while simultaneously giving back to society and the community.


Join us.


Feel like you can't tick all the boxes? If you have some of the skills and experience that we're looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply.


Tulip Retail is strongly committed to equal opportunities in employment. We welcome applications from all minority group members, women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, members of sexual minority groups, and others who may contribute to the further diversification of Tulip Retail.


Tulip Retail welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Brand Retail Production Specialist
description:
Your Opportunity at ARC’TERYX:

As the Brand Retail Production Specialist, you are responsible for bringing brand experiences to life in a growing fleet of Arc’teryx brand stores. You will work closely with your team and partners in Brand and Retail on everything from global campaign production to new store openings. You are as comfortable taking initiative and working autonomously as you are asking for guidance. You manage multiple vendor relationships, projects, and budgets comfortably and have a strong understanding of production needs, timelines, and impacts. You are a valued contributor to a cross-functional team focused on creating elevated and innovative retail experiences. 

Meet Your Future Team:

You will work as part of the Brand Operations team – a collaborative group of Project Managers, Producers and Operators responsible for defining and evolving process and leading creative teams to the successful delivery of campaigns and projects.

Is this job open to relocation? No
Will there be Visa support? No
Can this job be hired remote? Yes

If you were the Brand Retail Production Specialist, now, here are some of the core activities you would be doing:

  • Working with external partners to coordinate and deliver printed and fabricated materials to stores
  • Supporting Brand and Retail partners to plan timing, installation and removal of campaign, experience, and construction deliverables
  • Processing and tracking invoices for Brand related production projects
  • Maintaining and updating the Production Coordination dashboard to keep stakeholders informed of project status
  • Working with the Visual Merchandising and Retail Communications partners to provide consistent and current information and direction to stores
  • Supporting Stores with Branded material requests as needed
  • Working with Retail partners to ensure seasonal and campaign creative or templates and assets are available for in-market production when relevant 

Here are some of the things you could be working on in the future:

  • Partnering with your Retail Excellence and Store Design partners on new store opening (NSO) production needs for both exterior and interior  
  • Working with your Brand Creative partners on creative file development and delivery for NSOs and campaign creative
  • Building and managing vendor relationships in Canada and US primarily
  • Supporting our EMEA partners with European store openings and campaign roll-outs  
  • You will help to evolve our processes and build strong communication between teams

Are you our next Brand Retail Production Specialist?

  • You have 3+ years’ experience with a retail organization
  • You have 2+ years’ experience working with production and fabrication vendors, from print to large-scale 
  • You are a strong communicator, both verbally and in writing 
  • You are comfortable managing multiple projects at one time. 
  • You have experience working with web-based project management tools (e.g. Monday.com, Smartsheet)
  • You have demonstrated success in a fast-paced, matrixed work environment
  • You are able to thrive in a dynamic, constantly evolving, and highly competitive industry 
  • You are a performance focused individual with experience working from concept to completion, dealing with ambiguity and working toward clarity, while maintaining high quality in outcomes and a strong sense of accountability 
  • You have strong Project Management expertise; strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to plan and prioritize 
  • You are able to create strong relationships, collaborate, and influence across all levels, functions, geographies - internal and external 
  • You have experience driving timelines and managing budgets 
  • You have a strong understanding of a multi-brand, cross-functional, vertically integrated organization 
  • You are a results driven, proactive self-starter, and are organized and focused 
  • You are able to travel 20% of the time 
  • You remain highly flexible and adaptable when faced with ambiguity 
  • You are proactive in identifying the root cause of issues and developing solutions 
  • You seek to execute the best (but sometimes not the easiest) solutions, with an unwavering commitment to do what is right 
  • You drive breakthrough thinking and continuous improvement 
  • Your passion for your work is paralleled by your passion for getting outside and living it 
Equal Opportunity

Arc’teryx is committed to actively creating and fostering a culture of inclusivity where voices are heard, people are seen, and values are respected. We care about the uniqueness of our applicants, employees, and guests, and we do so in a safe space fueled by curiosity and acceptance. 

Creating an inclusive workplace is connected to our core value Do Right while also having the added benefit of helping make our business better. We believe inclusion helps us to create a healthier, happier workplace, drive creativity and innovation, and reflect the communities where we operate.  

All applicants, employees, and guests can expect equality of opportunity and fair treatment in alignment with our values.

Design your Purpose. Live our Values. 
DISRUPTIVE EVOLUTION. Design your future through challenge, experimentation, and inspiration.
COMMIT. Set and deliver on bold objectives as we collectively raise the bar.
LIVE IT. Deepen your connection to nature and live your most purposeful life. 
LEAVE IT BETTER. Create a better world, together.

title: Marketing Specialist, Senior Associate (Remote)
description:
Line of Service

Internal Firm Services

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

IFS - Brand & Communications

Management Level

Senior Associate

Job Description & Summary

A career in Sales and Marketing, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to focus on positioning a distinctive PwC brand in the marketplace and driving long term revenue growth. Our Sales and Marketing Generalist - Practice Support team focuses on designing, developing, and implementing communication programmes and media events to promote and sell PwC’s brand and services as well as contribute to and evaluate our pricing strategies in the marketplace.

Important point to consider

  • Please note this is 15 month contract

  • COVID-19 Vaccination Policy: Putting the safety of our people and clients first as we look to a hybrid future: The health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, clients, and communities is our number one priority. Vaccinations have proven to reduce the risk of COVID-19. Effective Friday, October 1, 2021, PwC Canada requires all partners, staff, contractors and visitors to be fully-vaccinated when entering a PwC location, subject to applicable legal exemptions. At PwC, the future ways of work will be a hybrid of in-person and virtual, allowing choice and flexibility to explore new ways of working and collaborating. Read this press release for further details.

What you'll create and do

As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:

  • Key player in the execution of employer brand marketing plans

  • Understands and participates in project planning, administration and budgeting

  • Understands and supports the connection of marketing efforts (advertising, events, sponsorship, digital/content etc.) and the tracking of ROI across media

  • Reviews and edits marketing materials to ensure content produced is of high quality, with consistent use of PwC guidelines

  • Writes content for a variety of external communications: email, blogs, digital advertising including full ownership of the development of event invitations and select internal communications

  • Collaborates with the Design team to develop marketing collateral such as thought leadership, event invitations and promotional materials

  • Collaborates with the Digital marketing team to maintain and update the PwC Canada website

  • Manages the risk, independence and branding guidelines processes for various marketing initiatives

  • Process and track the payment of invoices to ensure vendor payments meet all deadlines

  • Contributes to the development and execution of social media campaigns using resources such as LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram etc. Provides recommendations as needed

  • Collects all metrics and reports on the performance of marketing campaigns and external events to the necessary stakeholders

  • Ability to conduct ongoing competitive intelligence and external market research

  • Responsible for the deployment of demand generation campaigns using the Firm’s campaign management tool

  • Collaborates with the campus talent acquisition stakeholders on business priorities and challenges and adjusts upcoming campaigns to address and meet those needs.

What you’ll bring to this role

  • An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work

  • A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives

  • Familiar with Google Suite, Salesforce and data analysis software like Power BI and Tableau

  • Progressive marketing experience in campaign planning and execution, client-facing events (in-person and virtual), internal and external communications, digital marketing and content development

  • Solid understanding of managing a budget in support of marketing and event plans

  • Experienced in the procurement and management of external suppliers of support services

  • Proven ability to manage multiple priorities to deadline

  • Self-starter who is detail-oriented and can work well within a local and national team

  • Demonstrated ability to excel in a fast-paced, corporate environment

Why you’ll love working for PwC 

At PwC, we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits. Discover a life that works for you with our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture. To learn how you can grow and shine in your career at PwC, please visit: https://www.pwc.com/ca/whypwc

See how you can create your future at PwC

www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/create-your-future.html

Get to know us

Check out our careers blog to hear what our people have to say and discover a place where you can bring your passions and whole self to work. https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/blog.html 

Applying at PwC

At PwC, we embrace new technology where you will learn to innovate and deliver differently. For Administrative, Specialist, Associate, Senior Associate, and Manager roles you may have the opportunity to participate in an on-demand video interview. To learn more about our innovative cloud-based online application interview process click here:  https://www.pwc.com/ca/applytopwc

We take your privacy seriously. To protect your personal information, please submit your application directly through PwC Canada Careers: https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers.html

Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)

Degrees/Field of Study required:

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

Required Skills

Optional Skills

Travel Requirements

Not Specified

Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?

No

Government Clearance Required?

No

Job Posting End Date

PwC is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.

Every day we see how people make businesses great. But it's not only about skills. If your experience is close to what we're looking for, please consider applying. We recognize that experience comes in many forms, and passionate teams reimagine the possible. Create your future at PwC.

PwC s’engage à bâtir une équipe diversifiée et représentative des collectivités qu’il sert. Nous invitons toutes les personnes qualifiées, sans égard à leur appartenance ethnique, leur race, leur religion, leur sexe, leur orientation sexuelle, leur identité sexuelle, leur statut d’autochtone, leur âge, leur handicap ou leurs besoins en matière d’adaptation du milieu de travail, à présenter leur candidature, qu’il nous fera plaisir d’examiner.

Chaque jour, nous voyons des personnes participer à l'essor des entreprises. Ce n'est pas seulement une question de compétences. Si votre expérience se rapproche de ce que nous recherchons, n'hésitez pas à postuler. Nous sommes conscients que l'expérience peut prendre diverses formes et que des équipes de passionnés peuvent réinventer le possible. Créez votre avenir chez PwC.
