title: Market Research / Insights Analyst
description:
Market Research / Insights Analyst - Work from home position - location open

If you prefer an office-based role, you could work in our HQ in Michigan when our office re-opens.

We are continually considering candidates for our Insights roles across our industry-based teams (like Auto, Financial Services and Health).  These are roles where you could design and deliver research for well-known brands you would recognize. This is not an entry-level position. You should have at least 1 - 3 years of work experience to qualify.

Our industry groups have a diverse set of clients offering you the chance to work on projects ranging from large quant studies that are fielded internationally, or smaller highly custom studies that may include a mix of qualitative and quantitative methodologies to manage.  Across our teams, we have great people, great work, and clients that treat us like an extension of their team.  In addition, we have internal experts to help you learn and grow analytically, plus navigate the nuances of our clients' business or industry. 

People who excel in this career path are:

  • Inherently curious
  • Enjoy the challenge of a puzzle
  • Enjoy the art and science of research
  • Work with precision / have high standards for their work
  • Make good decisions – how to spend time, how to interact with clients, which tools in the analytical and resources toolboxes to use
  • Collaborators
  • Able to communicate in writing, verbally and visually
  • User of analogies / Able to convey complex concepts in ways to which the audience can relate
  • Enjoy the variety and pace of work offered on the vendor side

You will learn:

  • How to synthesize data and knowledge from a variety of sources
  • How to present our work and ideas to clients
  • How to use data to help clients with the problems they face
  • The nuances of the client, industry, and solutions
  • Variety of analytical approaches & tools used
  • How to Communicate, Collaborate & Influence others internally & externally

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in study design meetings with project team and/or clients.
  • Execute research projects using a variety of research methodologies
  • Demonstrate understanding of survey sampling concepts, their impact, and use.
  • Draft questionnaires using our preferred questionnaire writing processes.
  • Format surveys and prepare for programming.
  • Monitor the quality of the data and discard non-qualified respondents (set and apply strike criteria).
  • Execute phases of the analysis plan with guidance from experienced team members.
  • Analyze research results and create graphical displays to convey the implications of the data.
  • Create reports that include effective graphs, tables, summaries, and narratives.

Qualifications:

  • Must have a Bachelor degree in a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
  • Minimum 1 year of prior Market Research experience (as Intern or entry-level market research role).
  • Prefer 2 – 3 years prior work experience in market research supplier role.
  • Must demonstrate knowledge of basic statistics, research procedures, and survey methodology.
  • Proficiency in SPSS required.
  • Experience with data mapping, troubleshooting data that doesn’t make sense, weighting data, etc.
  • Must have effective communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Must show strong organizational skills, time management and attention to detail abilities.
  • Works well on multiple projects simultaneously and under pressure.
  • Must be proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).

Our environment offers you:

  • Access to experts for maximum learning.
  • Exposure to a rich variety of research techniques.
  • Insight into the needs and challenges of your clients—to learn how the world’s leading brands use research.
  • Peace of mind working for a company with a commitment to conducting research ethically.
  • Fun colleagues and a familial culture that values each person.

Equal Opportunity Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status.

#LI-Remote

title: Senior Product Analyst
description:
Were the technology leader building the modern home management platform. Today, millions of people use Thumbtack to effortlessly manage their homes. We help them confidently know what to do, when to do it and who to hire. 

Our goal is simple: to be the only platform homeowners need to fix, maintain and improve their homes. As a long-term partner for homeowners, our promise is to turn what was once confusing and intimidating into something straightforward and a lot less stressful.

At Thumbtack, we're not just creating a new era of homeownership. Were supporting local economies and building stronger communities. Each day, we connect local professionals across America with busy homeowners so they can grow their businesses. 

Thumbtack is for everyone. Our customers and pros come from all walks of life and every county in the country. We want our team to reflect that. If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply. 

Our North Star is bright and our ambitions are big. Weve been at this for over a decade, but the way we see it: were just getting started.

Thumbtack by the Numbers

  • Available in all 3,143 U.S. counties.
  • Nearly 4.5 million customers in the last 12 months
  • Hundreds of thousands of local professionals on our platform
  • 65 million projects started on Thumbtack
  • Over 7.5 million 5-star reviews left for stellar pros

About the Analytics Team

The Analytics team empowers Thumbtack to use data to guide business decisions. We collaborate with partners across the company to solve the most analytically challenging problems -- everything from how we set prices across hundreds of local services categories, to evaluating the impact of a new business model on company performance, to identifying early predictors of high-quality customers. We are a tight-knit, intellectually curious team that is committed to improving Thumbtack and improving each other.

Team members personal and professional development is a priority for us. We have a solid track record of growing team members into more senior responsibilities in analytics, as well as preparing them for diverse roles across product, data science, and marketing.

About the Role

As a Senior Product Analyst at Thumbtack, youll be expected to leverage your analytical expertise, product sense, and interpersonal skills to drive a variety of high-impact projects. You will embed directly with a product team to help launch features and transform our marketplace. Outside product work, youll contribute to our broader analytics team and company data culture by sharing your learnings, partnering with others, and building new capabilities for how we can use data to guide decisions.
Team members personal and professional development is a priority for us. We have a solid track record of preparing team members not only for more senior responsibilities in analytics, but also for diverse roles across product, data science, and marketing.

Responsibilities

  • Drive product strategy by proposing and conducting quantitative research into key user behaviors and business trends, in partnership with product managers, engineers, designers, and other team members
  • Design and analyze A/B tests, market-based tests, etc. and conduct other forms of causal inference, to help us rigorously learn about our millions of users
  • Design new features and inform the product roadmap through analysis, e.g., help define matching mechanics and ranking behavior for new Thumbtack product lines
  • Define and analyze key metrics to inform decision-making and measure success
  • Apply advanced statistical/econometric modeling tools to develop robust models to support business initiatives
  • Provide complete solutions to business problems using data science techniques, statistics and data analysis
  • Contribute to our team and company data culture through accessible data table design and maintenance
  • Collaborate with, mentor, and help recruit team members

Must-Have Qualifications

If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.

  • 2+ years of analytics/data science experience
  • Passion for problem-solving, critical thinking, and data
  • Sharp business judgement and the ability to see past the noise
  • Strong communicator, attentive listener, and compelling explainer
  • Proficient in one of Python or R
  • Expert in SQL
  • Familiarity with basic statistical, machine learning, and econometric concepts, e.g., power analysis, linear regression, etc.

Nice-to-Have Qualifications

  • Experience in relevant tech companies, e.g., consumer-facing or marketplace
  • Experience in an analytical environment outside of analytics, e.g., management consulting
  • Bachelors or advanced degree (preferred) in statistics, math, data science, computer science, or economics
  • Familiarity with advanced statistical, machine learning, and econometric concepts, e.g., fixed effects models, decision trees, SVMs, etc.
  • Expertise with applying predictive modeling techniques (model training, logistic regression etc), statistics and information retrieval methods to real-world data

Thumbtack is a virtual-first company, meaning you can live and work from any one of our approved locations across the United States, Ontario or the Philippines. When it is safe to gather, we will begin to host in-person events on a regular basis. Remote employees will be expected to travel occasionally for these events to a Thumbtack library or offsite team-building location. In cities with 5+ employees, we are establishing local communities, where employees can gather for local events. Additionally, employees in the San Francisco, Salt Lake City, Toronto and Manila areas will have opt-in access to communal workspace at one of our Thumbtack libraries. We always prioritize the health and safety of our employees. Currently, participation in these events and Thumbtack library use are optional. Both require employees to be fully vaccinated.

#LI-Remote

More About Us

Thumbtack is a technology leader building the modern home management platform. Through the Thumbtack app, homeowners can effortlessly manage their homes confidently knowing what to do, when to do it, and who to hire. Bringing the $500 billion home services industry online, Thumbtack empowers millions of homeowners to fix, maintain, and improve their most valuable asset. 

Founded in 2008, Thumbtack is backed by over $500 million in funding from folks that include Sequoia Capital, CapitalG, Tiger Global Management, Javelin Investment Partners, Baillie Gifford. 

  • See what its like to work here  
  • Meet the pros who inspire us
  • Follow us on LinkedIn  
  • Discover our virtual first plan

Thumbtack embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you are a California resident, please review information regarding your rights under California privacy laws contained in Thumbtacks Privacy policy available at https://www.thumbtack.com/privacy/.

*Currently, Thumbtackers can live anywhere in Ontario, Canada or the Philippines or in any of the following US states: AZ, CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, HI, IL, IN, KY, MD, MA, MI, MN, MO, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NY, NC, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI. Our long term vision is to hire across all of the United States and Canada, but this expansion will take a few years.

title: Consultant, Professional Services (Mid-Market)
description:
We’re Ada, a brand interaction platform that empowers brands to live up to their promises and have more—and more valuable—interactions with the people who love them. Our AI-powered platform has automated over 3.5 billion brand interactions for the world’s fastest growing enterprises, including Zoom, Facebook, and Shopify. In May 2021, we raised Series C funding of $130M by Spark Capital (early investors of Twitter, Slack, Snapchat), and officially became a global unicorn with a $1.2B valuation! 

The passion of our people and dedication to their craft continues to drive our dramatic global growth. 

Our work is rooted in authenticity, courage, empathy, and simplicity. We use these values to create a culture that encourages groundbreaking results, career progression, and community investment. You can learn more about the founding of our company here.  

We are inspired every day by the opportunity to pioneer a new industry, and welcome those who want to join us.

We’re looking for a Consultant to join our brand new Mid-Market Professional Services team. You will be the quarterback on each implementation, responsible for the successful delivery of your mid-market accounts, as well as the expansions of existing accounts.

You will partner with Mid-Market Account Executives and Solutions Consultants to support services activities with technical and consultative expertise during the final stages of the sales cycles. After a seamless handoff, you will support your Delivery Manager by leading the implementation - executing on the agreed upon deliverables, in the agreed upon timeframe. Additionally, you have a mindset of ongoing process improvement. You constantly ask, “How could we do this better?” in order to develop new solutions for individual client challenges.

You describe yourself as a deep thinker with a knack for problem solving. What motivates you is an opportunity to play an integral role in shaping the future of customer experience through automation. As an innovator and trailblazer in the space, you will not just be implementing a conversational AI solution - you will be changing the way businesses communicate.

About You

  • 2-3 years of professional services or technology consulting experience, with a passion for the customer implementation journey.
  • Excellent communicator with a proven track record of helping customers meet their business objectives.
  • Working knowledge of APIs and a common understanding of SaaS platforms (e.g. Shopify, Salesforce, Zendesk, Adobe, etc.).
  • Experience working and collaborating with Engineering and Product teams to provide ongoing feedback on how our product is being used and how it can be improved.
  • Reliable and resilient team player who can adjust to new challenges to deliver on your commitments in a fast-paced environment.

Outcomes

  • Own the successful training and enablement of new mid-market clients, to develop strong alignment and trust, and ensure their overall success with Ada. 
  • Engage with the pre-sales team to review and confirm scope of implementation prior to the sales-to-implementation handoff process. 
  • Ensure that each client engagement remains in-scope and on-time. 
  • Work closely with the clients to develop unique solutions to new challenges. 
  • Collaborate with your team to formulate strategies and best practices for implementation and consultations by developing the Mid-Market Professional Services playbook. 
  • Provide industry and product expertise, including ability to demonstrate, configure, test, train and deploy Ada solutions.
#LI-remote
#LI-RD2

Benefits
• Competitive salary and generous stock option plan
• Unlimited vacation
• Wellness account
• Extended health coverage
• Dental/optical/travel insurance
• Life insurance
• Employee and family assistance plan

Perks
• Flexible work schedule
• Digital first, fully remote with WFH budget
• In-house social worker
• Paid parental leave for Canadian and U.S. residents
• Development opportunities

About Us
Ada is a rapidly growing digital first company in a thriving AI ecosystem. We optimize our communication, collaboration, and work ethic for the digital world instead of in-person. We are building the workplace of the future to build the customer experience of the future. With flexible working hours, together we'll determine a schedule that fits your style and the requirements of your role. 

We are backed by world-class investors, including Spark, Accel, FirstMark, Bessemer Venture Partners, and Version One. We provide our employees with competitive compensation, great health benefits, and ownership in our company.  

Ada is an equal opportunity employer. In fact, diversity is what drives our success—it’s at the core of how we hire, communicate, and work. Like our platform, we are inclusive to all, and combine our diverse backgrounds, skill sets and thinking to build the best experiences for our clients and their customers.

Ada Privacy Policy

title: Growth Marketer (Remote)
description:
About Bird&Be

The current fertility experience is broken, and we want your help fixing it. We offer personalized fertility kits, designed to help our customers optimize their outcomes, no matter the stage of their journey. With rising infertility rates, our kits will help educate our customers on their fertility health early, and help them take action with personalized supplements and prescription medication that is scientifically proven to impact outcomes. All delivered together in a beautiful box right to their doorstep.

All of this will be done under a brand umbrella that resonates with our customer base. We see a future that is different from the current "family planning" aisle filled with blue and pink boxes, plastered with photos of white babies. Our brand will reflect the modern millennial. Less First Response, more Knix. 

We are a very early stage startup, and are building a brilliant team that is excited to help solve this complex problem. 

About you

You want to be part of a small, very early stage startup that is having a massive impact on people’s lives. You are self motivated, love to collaborate, and are resourceful. You’ll need to be as passionate about our vision and as ambitious for growth as the founding team.

We are dealing with very emotional (and sometimes traumatic) subject matter for our customers, so your empathy must run high. You will need high level knowledge of digital strategies and a digital-first approach to communications and community development. You are an expert in multi-platform formats and strategies - Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest, Tiktok, Twitter, blog, etc. You are highly experienced in directing paid/organic search strategy, display advertising, content and retention marketing and emerging marketing channels. You understand and utilize analytics to find ways to improve performance across all channels. 

The work

This role is focused on digital marketing and community development, reporting directly to the CEO. Your role is to lead and drive communications in the US and Canada, build and expand our online audience, community and user base.  You’ll be working closely with our designer and developer to execute creative and effective marketing campaigns, turning small budgets into highly successful outcomes.  You will need to be nimble and resourceful and be able to recommend changes as we test different customer acquisition strategies.

Your responsibilities:

  • Work with the CEO/COO on development and execution of highly creative communications strategies for Bird&Be in Canada/US

  • Lead digital marketing strategy to amplify the impact, influence and visibility of brand and product launches

  • Focus on building brand awareness and authority, driving traffic and growing the business

  • Align digital marketing support to amplify PR strategy

  • Analyze metrics to understand where we need to improve performance, make changes, or double down on a highly functioning strategy

Role requirements:

  • Experienced (3+ years experience) in launching small to large-scale digital (earned and paid) campaigns with an understanding of ROI and measuring customer insights

  • You are passionate about driving stories across different social channels 

  • Excellent knowledge of media, cultural landscape and societal dynamics in Canada and the US

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills and full proficiency in English

  • Strong problem solving skills with a creative approach

  • Thrives in a scrappy, fast-paced environment

  • Generous and passionate team leader with strong organizational skills




By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Research Associate II
description:
Job Description:

Position:   Research Associate II

File #:  2022-26789

Compensation Grid Range: $32.52/hour - $40.65/hour

Dept/Program:   Research Operations, Institute for Better Health

Job Type:  Temporary (Approximately 12 months), Part time (3 days/week)

Site:   Mississauga Hospital

Posted: May 04, 2022

Internal DeadlIne: May 11, 2022

Trillium Health Partners - Institute for Better Health  

Trillium Health Partners' (THP) Strategic Plan has identified research as a key priority for achieving its vision of delivering a new kind of health care for a healthier community and the Institute for Better Health (IBH) was created to support this vision. The IBH creates diverse and meaningful partnerships within and beyond Trillium Health Partners with the aim of improving the health of our community. Through this, IBH supports a diverse spectrum of research across THP, including biomedical, clinical, population health, health services and educational research, as well as leads research focused on population health and improving health services.   THPs mission of creating a new kind of health care for a healthier community is enabled by strategic research partnerships and collaboration of health researchers. That is why we are seeking a talented Research Associate to join our Better Together team.

 

The Role  

The Research Associate role within the IBH supports research studies and initiatives across the organization and within the community.   Through this role the successful candidate will support the Family and Child Health Initiative (FCHI) (https://familyandchildhealth.ca) to lead the first phase of first phase of a Canadian Institutes of Health (CIHR) â€“ funded data innovation project entitled, â€œBuilding CAPACIty for pediatric diabetes research and quality improvement across Canada.â€

 

Project Description

Diabetes in one of the most common lifelong childhood disorders that affects ~40,000 children and youth in Canada. Research shows that even with new technology and drugs, children and youth living with diabetes are still not meeting recommended treatment targets. For example, their blood sugar control is poor, and they are more likely to have lower quality of life and develop other health problems such as heart or kidney disease. This is in part due to poor access to diabetes healthcare, which is worse in disadvantaged populations across Canada. We will develop strategies to address these gaps: The CAnadian PediAtric diabetes ConstortIum (CAPACIty) is a network of 10 childhood diabetes centres from across Canada, and their doctors and researchers who specialize in childhood diabetes. We will partner with patients/families and healthcare professionals to jointly design a Canada-wide childhood diabetes registry that will support improvements in clinical care, advance research, and inspire action by policymakers like improving coverage of diabetes technology and expanding support for diabetes in school. We will: (1) create an Advisory Board that will guide all aspects of the project and will include people living with/caring for a child with diabetes, health care professionals, researchers, and policymakers; (2) design and implement, in partnership with the Advisory Board, a childhood diabetes registry and quality improvement initiative called â€˜audit & feedbackâ€™ where key clinical measures, that matter most to patients and families, are compared between Canadian diabetes centres; and (3) evaluate how this registry and audit & feedback initiative inform action across all parts of the system including healthcare, research, policy and education. We are unique because we will focus on measuring indicators of inequality so that our strategies will positively impact the most disadvantaged children and youth living with diabetes, and their families.

 

Role Requirements

The successful candidate must meet the following qualification and skill requirements, demonstrate the ability to take on the following responsibilities, and demonstrate the following competencies:

 

Qualifications and Skills

 

·                     Successful completion of either a university degree or college diploma in health or social sciences with a minimum of 4 yearsâ€™ experience in research; or Masterâ€™s degree in an appropriate specialization (health or social science related field)

·                     Minimum of two yearsâ€™ of related professional experience in a healthcare settings that included familiarity with mixed-methods research

·                     Experience supervising data collection tasks with diverse individuals, groups and communities and facilitating participatory, group-based research and knowledge exchange activities

·                     A background in organizing, coordinating, and managing research projects and/or grant-based programs

·                     Certification in research ethics core principles and guidelines (e.g. TCPS-2)

·                     Training and experience using an Equity, Diversity and Inclusion framework in research projects and familiarity with sex and gender-based analysis

·                     Proficient academic writing skills is an asset (protocol development, grant writing, manuscript development, poster and abstract development)

 

Responsibilities

·                 Supports and helps coordinate the implementation and evaluation of research studies and projects

·                 Assists with the development of data collection tools (e.g. interview and focus group guides, participant feedback surveys), study protocols and ethics applications and submissions as well as maintaining ethics approvals and liaises with Research Ethics Boards as needed.

·                 Participant recruitment, managing informed consent processes, conducting mixed-methods data collection and analyses.

·                 Provides Principal Investigators and research team members with day-to-day administrative support tasks such as coordinating and scheduling research and community meetings, creating and communicating detailed meeting notes, facilitating and documenting participant stipend payments, maintaining project folders and documentation.

·                 Supports the onboarding, training and supervision of community-based and peer research assistants.

·                 Maintains research and project management databases, carries out data entry responsibilities such as reviewing and coding transcripts using a qualitative software management program and conducting data entry and data cleaning using quantitative statistical software programs.

·                 Contributes to the development and evaluation of engagement strategies that encourage community participation in research and research-related activities.

·                 Liaises with community stakeholders to facilitate knowledge translation activities with a wide range of organization activities and groups.

·                 Contributes to grant preparation, literature reviews, proposal development, conference presentations and manuscript production activities.

·                 Other responsibilities as may be assigned

 

Competencies:

 

·                 Takes ownership, accountability, and responsibility for his/her actions and own performance

·                 Demonstrates an ability to accept change and manage change effectively

·                 Demonstrates integrity, humility, maturity, empathy, and a positive attitude

·                 Works collaboratively with others to meet goals

·                 Speaks and writes clearly, concisely, and with impact

·                 Takes pride in their work, balancing quality, capacity and risk

·                 Seeks out, considers, and integrates the appropriate data, ideas, and experiences to make decisions and solve problems

·                 Translates ideas and concepts into practical solutions

·                 Strong understanding of qualitative research methods, and experience working in a mixed methods research environment

·                 Comfortable working in community-based, interdisciplinary environments

·                 An understanding of and sensitivity to equity, diversity and inclusion issues

·                 Demonstrated commitment to critical analysis of disability, gender, social class, sexuality, aging, race/ethnicity, Indigeneity, and body size

·                 Strong knowledge of social determinants of health, intersectionality (i.e., the intersections of gender inequality, racialization, and socio-economic marginalization); an understanding of structural and institutional influences that shape the health of marginalized populations

·                 Demonstrated ability to organize and prioritize project workload, handle multiple assignments effectively and meet deadlines

·                 Track record of excellence in preparing project documents, reports, and communication materials

·                 Outstanding and timely communication, engagement, collaboration and networking skills

·                 Excellent research skills, with an ability to conduct basic analysis of written and visual qualitative data

·                 Demonstrated computer literacy with Microsoft Office suite and database management skills

·                 Demonstrated skill and experience in event planning and grant application preparation

·                 Strong analytical and planning skills

 

 

Equity and antiracism are essential to academic excellence, and fosters the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applicants from members of groups that have been marginalized on any grounds enumerated under the Ontario Human Rights Code based on race, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nations, MÃ©tis or Inuk/Inuit person.

title: Pricing Analyst (Remote)
description:
Our Mission is Simple: Be the easiest place to buy and sell your car in Canada.


What does that mean? We look at every single aspect of a vehicle purchase and remove all of the friction points.


Here's a few examples:
You can buy a car entirely online, without any salespeople involved
You can have your new car delivered to your driveway, usually the same day
You can spend a week with your vehicle to decide if you love it, and if you don't we'll pick it up


Job Description

  • Source and appraise new inventory through multiple different channels
  • Set bid limits for auctions and private buys
  • Price recently purchased vehicles that are ready to go online
  • Provide prompt appraisals for buying and reconditioning teams when required
  • Be up to date on market trends affecting vehicle values
  • Other duties as assigned


Skills and Qualifications:

  • Excellent Analytical skills
  • High attention to detail
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent multitasking and time management skills
  • Working knowledge of excel and google sheets
  • General knowledge of vehicles is an asset, but not required


This is a truly exciting time to join Canada Drives and we are looking forward to doing great things together! In addition to a competitive salary, we provide
    Extended dental and medical benefits
    Opportunities for advancement
    Excellent on the job training
    Inclusive, fun, and vibrant work environment 


Please apply with a resume and cover letter. In your cover letter, please include a short paragraph describing why you want to work at Canada Drives and what would make you a great addition to our team.



NOTE: This position is only available to candidates living in Canada.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Demand Generation Specialist
description:
Uberflip is a marketing technology company founded in 2012 with 170+ employees and headquarters in Toronto. Customer-facing teams use the Uberflip platform to package marketing collateral into mini, personalized websites that educate buyers on their product or service. Uberflip's core product features enable marketers to centralize and organize all their content, drive consumption with an AI-powered recommendation engine, and get data and analytics to measure and optimize the performance of content and campaigns. Our Uberflip Analytics & Enrichment give marketers the ability to integrate their favourite tech with our platform. 

We’re on the search for a Demand Generation Specialist to join the Uberflip team in Toronto!

Working with our Growth Marketing team, you will own the execution behind innovative marketing programs and campaigns designed to generate awareness and demand for Uberflip. Through a combination of inbound, outbound, and ABM strategies, you will be responsible for driving both pipeline and revenue across Manufacturing, Financial Services, and Healthcare verticals. You will continuously look for effective ways to drive growth and convert customers and be a key part of a team that encourages experimentation, focuses on impact, and keeps the customer at the centre of everything we do. 

Never alone, you will be supported by and work closely with the Growth, Content Experience, Marketing Operations, Product Marketing, and Sales teams. You will have access to best-in-class marketing technology and large budgets.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Understand the role of campaigns and programs through all stages of the marketing funnel, monitor performance, and identify opportunities to drive impact where it’s needed most.
  • Work with Uberflip’s marketing team, vendors, and internal and external stakeholders to define, build, and optimize multi-channel, multi-touch, personalized programs, campaigns, and events that drive brand awareness, generate pipeline and revenue, and accelerate sales cycles.
  • Forecast, measure, analyze, and report on the impact of growth marketing activities against core marketing metrics. 
  • Partner closely with the sales team to ensure awareness of upcoming and in-market activities, alignment, gather feedback, and achieve results, adjusting programs as needed to meet goals.
  • Evolve Uberflip’s vertical growth strategy by identifying and experimenting with new marketing opportunities. 
  • Manage the vertical marketing budget to ensure that expenses are forecasted and tracked correctly, and that projects are completed on-budget.
  • Be accountable for business impact measured by pipeline and revenue.

We want to talk to you if:

  • You have 2+ years of demand generation / growth marketing experience in B2B tech.
  • You have a clear understanding of the relationship between sales and marketing during the buyer’s journey, the marketing funnel and associated metrics.
  • You know your way around leading marketing technology platforms like Salesforce, Marketo, Drift, 6sense, etc.
  • You’re collaborative, solution-oriented, and have a bias for action.
  • You have strong analytical skills and can synthesize data to make strategic decisions.
  • You’re eager to experiment and optimize, and you understand the basic principles of A/B testing.
  • You have the writing skills needed to draft a marketing email or write compelling landing page copy.
  • You’re a skilled project manager with demonstrated experience successfully managing projects involving tight deadlines, multiple stakeholders, and many moving parts.
  • You can roll up your sleeves and immerse yourself in the details.
  • You are excited by a high-growth, fast-paced environment.

Bonus points if:

  • You have experience with Google Ads or paid social.
  • You have experience within the healthcare, financial services, or manufacturing industry. 
  • You’ve used Uberflip in the past. 
  • You are content experience certified!

What you’ll love about us:

  • Great Company Culture 
  • Inclusive and Collaborative work environment
  • Competitive Health Benefits for you and your family starting day one
  • Wellness Programs including company paid counselling
  • Flexible Working Hours and Remote work flexibility
  • Employee Stock Option Program
  • Unlimited Vacation Days 
  • Additional Paid Health Days
  • Parental Leave Top Up Program 
  • Learning Credits to put towards your professional development
  • (Virtual) Regular Standups, Demos, and Socials to keep us aligned and connected 
  • And so much more!
Uberflip is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe that the more inclusive and diverse we are, the better our work will be. If you're smart and great at what you do, come as you are.

title: Sales Analyst
description:
EQ3 was born in opposition to trends, vowing instead to focus on timeless designs. We make furniture not fast, but to last. Born in opposition to the growing trend of disposable design, our greatest hope is to have our pieces passed down like heirlooms. We pride ourselves on being innovators in our industry, and we believe that the more voices and choices we incorporate into our perspective, the better we’re able to find creative solutions for modern life.

Everything we do is made in consideration of people, of the planet and of our space.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, collaborative individual to join our Merchandising Team as a Sales Analyst to share in our mission of bringing quality design to all.

THE DETAILS:

You’ll be joining our EQ3 Head Office team at 70 Lexington Park, Winnipeg, MB, in a full-time capacity

  • You’ll optimize sales across all business channels, product categories and marketing initiatives by collecting, reporting, and analyzing sales related data
  • You’ll generate and analyze daily, weekly, monthly reports such as sales by business unit, product & category, returns, sales per square foot and linear reporting, retail store traffic, etc.
  • You’ll generate ad-hoc reports for Sales, Marketing, Operations and Product teams
  • You’ll contribute to creative planning and ideation meetings with relevant research, timely ideas, and a collaborative attitude
  • You’ll partner with sales and marketing to create product lists to execute category or product specific promotions
  • You’ll report on and analyze promotions results
  • You’ll analyze outcomes of ongoing marketing initiatives

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:

  • Bachelor’s degree or diploma mathematics, statistics, commerce, or business admin preferred
  • Minimum one (1) year of relevant experience analyzing complex data
  • A combination of education and relative work experience will be considered
  • Advanced understanding of Microsoft Excel
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Good logic and problem-solving skills, priority setting, and time management
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work well as part of a team and maintain effective working relationships with a range of people

PERKS OF LIFE AT EQ3:

  • A fun, collaborative environment that enjoys coffee (a little too much!), values collaboration, and supports work-life balance
  • A company culture wherein you are celebrated for your work and compensated accordingly, with an extensive benefits package to boot
  • Employee discount program that lets you bring home our designs for less, wellness plans, group banking, and more
  • EQ3 Spirit Committee that promotes community engagement, rewards, and recognition for all our employees
  • A company that supports professional growth and promotes from within wherever possible

CLOSING DATE: May 13, 2022.

WE’D LOVE FOR YOU TO APPLY: Submit your complete application by clicking on “Apply to Position” now!

We thank all interested individuals; however, we’ll only be reaching out to those selected for an interview.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
We are an experienced and award-winning home builder, community developer, and construction manager focused on bringing modern lifestyles together with high design, expert craftsmanship, and proven strategy. We are proud of the products that we deliver; quality and integrity are key drivers behind our success created by hiring valuable talent who uphold these values.

We are looking for an enthusiastic Marketing Coordinator to join our growing team and take ownership of the coordination of marketing materials for our projects, and corporate priorities. The Coordinator is also responsible for creative development of required materials and communications and providing administrative support on marketing initiatives and project planning.

Personality: At JD we strive to hire staff that fit our business culture. When you think of your work personality the following springs to mind:

  • I do tasks once, and do it right the first time
  • I see a problem, I find the solution
  • I do it today, not tomorrow
  • I see opportunity in challenges, not obstacles
  • I am a great problem solver and never give up
  • I donâ€™t let my job description constrain me
  • I am committed to a lifetime of learning

Responsibilities:

  • Assist with the development and review of all corporate and site marketing materials to ensure they are error-free, on-brand and strategy.
  • Assist with social media content planning, creation, execution, and reporting.
  • Write and develop project & purchaser communication and e-blasts/e-newsletters.
  • Write and create monthly corporate newsletter.
  • Sales and marketing research and data management/analytics, where necessary.
  • Coordination of sales-related marketing items, including brochure and associated collateral, marketing floorplans, signage, merchandising, and additional Presentation Centre needs.
  • Maintain corporate website and project microsites, ensuring they are always up to date.
  • Coordinate marketing materials with external suppliers, including sales teams, marketing agencies, PR agencies, signage suppliers, interior designers, and architects, when necessary.
  • Track and report on media spends against budgets.
  • Attend marketing meetings and prepare agendas and meeting minutes, when required.
  • Additional administrative functions, as required.
  • Sales-related support, as required.

Qualifications:

  • A post-secondary degree in marketing, communications or related field.
  • 0-2 yearsâ€™ experience in marketing or communications role, preferably with experience or interest in new home or condo development and/or interior design/architecture.
  • Acute attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication.
  • Excellent customer relations skills.
  • Working knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite (specifically Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign).
  • Experience with or knowledge or email marketing CRMs (e.g. Mailchimp, Sharpspring, Campaign Monitor) considered an asset.
  • A deep understanding of social media & networking platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tiktok, Pinterest, and LinkedIn.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt easily to changing business priorities.
  • Flexible work hours, as required. Extra time may be required on evenings and weekends as dictated by sales events.

Working Conditions:

  • Typical office environment; located in Markham, Ontario
  • Periodic driving may be required
  • Periodic visits to active construction sites

title: Marketing Campaign Coordinator
description:
SPUD.cais looking for a Marketing Campaign Coordinatorto join our growing team!


SPUD.ca is an online grocery delivery business in Western Canada. We are a passionate team who believe that food touches every aspect of our lives, so we are advocates forsustainable farming practices, sourcing locally, treating animals humanely, and reducing food waste. As a Certified B Corporation since 2013, we are committed to socially responsible business practices.

SPUD.ca is a subsidiary of Freshlocal Solutions (TSX: LOCL); a Vancouver-based leader in end-to-end grocery e-commerce solutions. Our mission is to leverage innovation and technology to create a sustainable and profitable food system for all.


Responsibilities:


  • Planning, scheduling and execution of recurring campaigns and promotions
  • Analyze, document and report on campaign performances
  • Researching and evaluating potential new promotions to increase revenue and traffic to SPUD and/or Blush Lane
  • Setting up tracking systems for online marketing activities
  • Collaborate with the design department to produce promotional materials
  • Define and execute the marketing campaign calendar
  • Build promotional campaigns from brief to execution, working with the various teams to bring the campaign to life
  • Work closely with Marketing Campaign Manager to support and execute overall marketing strategies/campaigns
  • Communicate and coordinate with store managers regarding upcoming promotional activities and signage
  • Design and write engaging copy for all channels and assets, including but not limited to website, email, blog, and store signage
  • Additional duties as assigned

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or Communications
  • Minimum two years of experience working in a marketing related role
  • A creative thinker who can put themselves in the mindset of the customer
  • Proven project management and administration experience with the ability to work on multiple concurrent tasks
  • Very organized and detail oriented
  • Strong grammar and editing skills and are comfortable proofing your own work
  • Self-starter and ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally to accomplish goals
  • Understanding of the business objectives related to marketing/brand management
  • Knowledge of traditional, digital and content marketing
  • Proficiency in full Microsoft Office suite, especially with Word and Excel as well as experience with Eventbrite, WordPress and online marketing tools
  • Passionate about food and sustainability
  • Understanding of the food industry, with a particular focus on the natural and organic segments of the industry


What's in it for you?

  • Join now and receive an initial $250.00 of SPUD credit, and another $250.00 of SPUD credit after six months of employment ($500.00 total)
  • 20% discount on SPUD.CA purchases
  • Flexible health spending plan options and benefits available for all team members working more than 14 hours per week


SPUD's approach to inclusivehiring

Our team is committed to building relationships rooted in trust, integrity and respect. We believe in a growth mindset and support our team members' personal and professionalgrowthin a safe work environment. We know from experience that great talent comes in many forms and we want to meet you at your best. Please let us know if we can provide unique accommodations that will enable your equal participation!


Our Values

Our values are more than just words to us. Our values drive our success and guide our growth:

  • Create amazing customer experiences. We are passionate in our commitment to deliver for our customers.
  • Lead with sustainability and consider our impact.
  • Learn, grow and make time to celebrate wins together
  • We welcome different perspectives. Diversity makes us stronger.
  • Prioritize, work smart and deliver results for our stakeholders and each other.
  • We are committed to our mission and that requires resilience, persistence and grit to persevere and succeed.

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
Melia est à la recherche d’un Analyste tarification pour combler un poste permanent pour son client, une belle entreprise en forte expansion dans le domaine des assurances collectives située à St-Hubert

* Salaire concurrentiel

* Programme de bonifications

* Horaire été vendredi 12h

 

 

Your responsibilities will be as follows:

L’Analyste tarification aura comme fonctions : 

  • Traiter les demandes de tarification des soumissions et établir les taux suite à l’analyse des différents paramètres et des facteurs de risques;
  • Travailler étroitement avec les assureurs collectifs;
  • Analyser les tarifications et les traitées;
  • Produire des dossiers pour transmettre au département des ventes;
  • Donner un suivi de dossier impeccable aux clients;

In order to join the team, you must have:

Les exigences du poste de l’Analyste tarification sont les suivantes:

  • Formation universitaire en administration en comptabilité ou finance ou assurance ou une certification en assurance collective (un atout) ;
  • 1 à 3 années d’expérience en tarification secteur assurances;
  • Bonne connaissance de la Suite Office;
  • Axé sur la résolution de problèmes;
  • Fortes compétences organisationnelle et esprit d’analyse;
  • Capacité d’adaptation et bonne gestion du stress;
  • Bonne capacité de communication écrit et oral en français, anglais un atout

Les avantages de l’Analyste tarification;• Salaire concurrentiel• Programme de bonifications• Belle stabilité de carrière • Assurances complètes• Vacances annuelles • Régime de retraite • Congés mobiles• Télémédecine • Programme d'aide aux employés• Entreprise ayant de belles valeurs à proximité de ses employés• Travail hybride L'opportunité de l’Analyste tarification vous intéresse? Nous attendons votre candidature !Faites-nous parvenir votre CV ou communiquez avec Marie-Claude 450-494-0172La diversité est une pratique fondamentale dans notre processus de recrutement. Ainsi, nous souscrivons au principe d'équité en emploi et offrons des chances d'emploi égales à tous.* Le genre masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte.

Schedules

Day

Experience

1-2 years

Diversity is a fundamental practice in our recruitment process. Therefore, we are committed to the principle of employment equity and equal employment opportunities for all.

title: Marketer (Door to Door)
description:
SWP Burnaby is hiring door-to-door marketers for the Summer season (May to August) to work in the Burnaby area.

Ideal candidates are outgoing, positive, and independent. On the job training and marketing materials are provided and no experience is necessary. In this position, you will learn valuable customer service and marketing skills.

Position:

  • Marketing door-to-door independently or with a friend in the Burnaby area
  • Perfect for those who want to earn money with flexible part-time hours. Recommended that applicants apply with friends as it will create a more fun work environment!

Wage:

  • $19/hour

Hours:

  • Weekdays: 4:30pm-8pm
  • Weekends: 11am-6pm (Minimum 4 hours per week, not required to work all of the weekday and weekend hours)

Requirements to apply:

  • Strong conversation skills
  • Great attitude
  • Willing to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest

 

SWP West is a local painting company that has been operating in the lower mainland for the past 30 years. We offer Interior and Exterior, Residential, and Commercial painting services.

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Communications Specialist
company: Home and Community Care Support Services
description:
Job Description:

At Home and Community Care Support Services Toronto Central by providing an accessible workplace, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. That is why we are intentionally committed to diversity and inclusion by providing an accessible and inclusive work place for all persons. We are strongly committed to include Black, Indigenous, visible minorities, Francophone, 2SLGBTQ+ persons, neurodiversity, women, national origin, ancestry, disability status, age, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, all faiths, or any other aspect, which makes them unique, through recognizing each applicant through anti-racism and anti-oppressive practices to ensure equitable opportunity.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Communications Specialist is responsible for supporting the development and implementation of internal and external communications plans, organizational initiatives and other confidential matters, locally and provincially. Reporting to the Manager, Communications, the Communications Specialist develops key communications products, engages internal leaders and teams to provide communications support and advice, and establishes relationships with key stakeholders to educate, inform and advance Home and Community Care Support Servicesâ€™ strategic priorities. A valued member of the Toronto Central team, this position also supports the provincial Communications team and provides services across geographies, as assigned.

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Support initiatives in Toronto Central and as part of the provincial Communications team â€“ operating as one team to support HCCSS-wide priorities and objectives â€“ including materials for the CEO and Board, as well as projects that impact staff and stakeholders across the province
  • Engage and collaborate with Communications teams across the province to streamline efforts and maximize resources
  • Support the development of Communications & Engagement strategies aligned with the organizationâ€™s strategic priorities including public relations, stakeholder engagement, marketing, brand management, social media and issues management
  • Develop and implement communications plans and tactics to support corporate projects and initiatives, which at times may include confidential matters about the organization or operations
  • Provide Communications support/advice, including on confidential matters, to the Communications Manager and/or Director, provincial Communications team and other leaders
  • Advise and work collaboratively with human resources, including on confidential matters which may include information about employees or positions, to effectively engage and communicate with staff to raise awareness of HR initiatives, programs and policies
  • Create written and designed content (in collaboration with graphic designer) for newsletters, brochures, posters, videos, web, intranet, speeches, presentations and other communication materials aimed at diverse audiences
  • Oversee the production of patient-facing pamphlets, brochures and newsletters and coordinate the distribution of print/branded materials to staff, patients, caregivers, etc.
  • Oversee the translation of materials, including use of internal French translators and external translators for additional languages
  • Leverage digital technology solutions and incorporate digital, social and web strategies to support strategic communications plans, while taking a lead role with social media activities
  • Provide media relations support including creation of news releases, organization of media events, development of speaking points, triaging of media requests, development of media responses and building and maintaining strong media relationships
  • Provide support for internal and external stakeholder engagement activities, including community engagement and education opportunities, in-person and virtually
  • Provide issues management and risk management support
  • Provide support for Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act requirements (FIPPA), keeping confidentiality top of mind
  • Support crisis communications at the local level, and at the provincial level as assigned
  • Monitor, analyze and report communication metrics and results to determine effectiveness of communications initiatives
  • Uphold the organizationâ€™s reputation through relationship-building with stakeholders, public awareness activities and marketing in alignment with visual identity, brand guidelines, AODA compliance and French language requirements

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:

Education

  • Post-secondary degree/diploma in communications, journalism, marketing or a related academic field  

Experience

  • Minimum of 3 yearsâ€™ experience in strategic communications, public affairs, marketing and health care communications
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative software and website content management systems; proficiency with graphic design software an asset
  • Communications experience in a multi-stakeholder environment. This includes knowledge and experience with best practices and planning methods
  • Strong organization skills
  • Ability to work independently and possess a strong sense of responsibility
  • Detail-orientated, able to multi-task effectively, take initiative and function well in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
  • Ability to analyze, digest and understand complex information
  • Understanding of the Ontario health care system, its stakeholders, programs and issues
  • Business professionalism
  • Strong relationship management and facilitation skills, including the ability to work collaboratively with all levels of staff, members of the public, health system partners, government and other diverse stakeholders
  • Developed negotiation and conflict resolution skills with the ability to provide advice on best practice guidelines
  • Strong leadership skills to participate on/or lead internal committees, councils, etc.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality, exercise good judgement and discretion when dealing with confidential information

JOB-SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES:

  • Business Acumen: Ability to apply business principles, including systems thinking, to the healthcare environment; basic business principles include financial management, human resource management, organizational dynamics and governance, strategic planning, risk management and quality improvement.
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Develops networks and builds alliances. Engages in cross-functional activities; collaborates across boundaries, and finds common ground with a widening range of stakeholders.
  • Relationship Management: Builds multiple external collaborative relationships to support department performance. Identifies the key issues and accommodates the key players when dealing with external parties/units on joint projects.
  • Strategic Planning: Communicates corporate goals and objectives within the department. Aligns department tasks and objectives with corporate goals and objectives. Establishes clear targets and measures to track progress toward department objectives. Shares organizational performance measurement information and encourages dialogue and analysis.
  • Change Management: Actively embraces change efforts and initiatives to improve department performance. Develops and uses different methods to help employees to positively react to change.
  • Community Engagement: Mobilize connections, facilitate collaboration and cooperation to create trust with the community.
  • Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Makes clear and convincing oral and written presentations to individuals or groups; listens effectively and encourages open communication; facilitates an open exchange of ideas and fosters an atmosphere of open communication; considers and responds appropriately to the needs, feelings, and capabilities of others in different situations; is tactful, compassionate and sensitive, and treats others with respect.
  • Crisis Management: Deals effectively with pressure; maintains focus and intensity and remains optimistic and persistent, even under adversity. Recovers quickly from setbacks.

 

 

Home and Community Care Support Services Toronto Central is committed to accommodating people with disabilities as part of our hiring process. If you have special requirements, please advise Human Resources during the recruitment process

title: Programmatic Coordinator
description:
ABOUT GROUPM:

GroupM is the world’s leading media investment company responsible for more than $63B in annual media investment through agencies Mindshare, MediaCom, Wavemaker, Essence, NEO and m/SIX, as well as the outcomes-driven programmatic audience company, Xaxis. GroupM’s portfolio includes Data & Technology, Investment and Services, all united in vision to shape the next era of media where advertising works better for people. By leveraging all the benefits of scale, the company innovates, differentiates and generates sustained value for our clients wherever they do business.

JOB TITLE: Programmatic Coordinator

The Programmatic Coordinator will be responsible in supporting the day-to-day campaign activity for all clients within their assigned agency teams. You are a strong team player where you will support both the trading strategy and service teams on campaigns. You are a curious and active learner with a strong sense of ownership and accountability for the work that you produce for the team

 Key Accountabilities: 

·Supports the Programmatic Specialists and Director on all tasks related to the management of programmatic campaigns

·Proactive internal communication between different business units

·Accurately inputs and maintains campaign data in internal platforms

·Communicates to ad ops and analytics thoroughly

·Supports the service and trading strategy teams with timely campaign launches

·Input and setup approved campaigns into the internal platform and sync to internal campaign management platforms

· Liaise with vendors and agencies in preparation for campaign launches

·Auditing and reviewing digital creative tags, ensuring they are accurate for the launch of the campaign

·Checks and ensures that live campaigns are delivering after launch

·Ensuring monthly campaign actualizations are completed at the expected date

·On co-owned accounts, updates pacing and performance in campaign tracker for internal team.

 Knowledge and Skills: 

·Familiarity with digital advertising industry terms and concepts is a plus

·Well-organized and strong attention to detail

·Proficient user of Microsoft tools such as PowerPoint, Excel, Word

·Strong analytical and critical thinking skills - ability to problem solve

·High energy and teamwork mentality is a must

·Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

 Education Requirements:

·Post-secondary education (preferably in a Media, Marketing or Advertising related program) 

GroupM is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know. While we appreciate all applications received, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

You are a strong team player where you will support both the trading strategy and service teams on campaigns. You are a curious and active learner with a strong sense of ownership and accountability for the work that you produce for the team', '·Strong analytical and critical thinking skills - ability to problem solve', '· Liaise with vendors and agencies in preparation for campaign launches', '·Supports the Programmatic Specialists and Director on all tasks related to the management of programmatic campaigns', '·Post-secondary education (preferably in a Media, Marketing or Advertising related program)', '·Proficient user of Microsoft tools such as PowerPoint, Excel, Word', '·Ensuring monthly campaign actualizations are completed at the expected date']

title: Spécialiste Gestion de projet – Ventes, Marketing et Service à la clientèle
description:
Au CN, nous travaillons ensemble pour faire avancer notre entreprise et l’Amérique du Nord. Intégrez notre équipe Services informatiques et de la technologie (I et T), un élément essentiel du moteur qui nous maintient en mouvement. De l’architecture d’entreprise aux technologies opérationnelles, nos équipes font appel à la méthodologie Agile pour automatiser et numériser notre chemin de fer pour assurer l’optimisation et la sécurité de nos activités et permettre à notre personnel de se consacrer à des tâches à valeur ajoutée. Vous pourrez approfondir vos compétences et bâtir votre carrière dans notre culture tissée serrée et axée sur la sécurité, où nous travaillons ensemble comme UNE ÉQUIPE. Nous offrons des carrières valorisantes car notre travail fait une différence. Embarquez avec nous!

 

Résumé des fonctions

Le ou la spécialiste Gestion de projet – Ventes, Marketing et Service à la clientèle gère de bout en bout la planification et la livraison d’un ou de plusieurs projets pour répondre aux attentes des clients tout en s’assurant du respect de la portée, de l’échéancier et du budget approuvés et en veillant à la livraison de produits de qualité. La personne titulaire du poste participe activement à la mise en œuvre de la gouvernance et des normes des projets. Cette personne supervise les membres de l’équipe. (Gestion matricielle)

Sa principale fonction sera d’abord axée sur le secteur des Ventes, du Marketing et du Service à la clientèle du CN, en collaboration avec les partenaires de l’I et T, du secteur et d’affaires.

 

Principales responsabilités

Gestion de projets – 70 %

• Élaborer l’approche de livraison, soit l’échéancier, le budget et les ressources afin de répondre aux besoins d’affaires et de suivre les conseils en matière d’architecture

• Cerner et évaluer les risques et les dépendances en créant des plans d’atténuation pour les éliminer

• Collaborer avec des sources internes et externes pour obtenir les ressources nécessaires au plan de livraison

• Travailler avec les partenaires d’intégration sur des projets majeurs pour s’assurer que les livraisons attendues par les partenaires d’affaires du CN répondent aux valeurs requises pour l’entreprise et correspondent à la portée convenue

• Exécuter le plan de projet, comparer les progrès réalisés par rapport au plan de projet et s’assurer du respect de la portée, de l’échéancier et du budget tout en veillant à l’exhaustivité et à la qualité de tous les livrables du projet

• Assurer la réussite de la transition des livrables du projet à l’équipe du soutien de base

 

Gestion de la portée – 30 %

• Collaborer avec la Gestion des produits et les partenaires d’affaires pour convenir de la portée à respecter et pour veiller à ce que les équipes de livraison s’y conforment

• Réviser les livrables fournis par les partenaires d’intégration pour s’assurer qu’ils respectent la portée et l’échéance convenues

• Collaborer avec les partenaires d’intégration et d’affaires pour régler tout problème qui pourrait survenir

 

Incidence sur l’organisation

Prise de décisions et incidence des décisions

• Prendre en charge les livrables assignés, dont les recommandations sur la portée, le budget et l’échéance formulées aux comités directeurs

• Prendre des décisions relativement au budget, aux ressources et au risque suivant la portée des livrables assignés

 

Exigences

Formation, certification et désignation

• Baccalauréat ou expérience similaire dans un domaine afférent

 

Compétences et connaissances

• Expérience en gestion de programme, de projet ou de livraison

• Expérience en planification, prévisions et rapports budgétaires

• Compétences et mentalité axées sur la gestion des risques

• Expérience en gestion, en planification et en évaluation des ressources

• Grandes aptitudes en collaboration, dont la capacité à influencer les autres et à comprendre leur point de vue

• Expérience en analyse commerciale, en optimisation des processus et en gestion de la portée

• Expérience en supervision des équipes de livraison internes et externes

• Capacité à créer des demandes de renseignements, des demandes de propositions et l’énoncé des travaux pour les partenaires d’intégration

• Capacité de trouver un équilibre entre les exigences et les préoccupations des divers intervenants (affaires, finances, TI, etc.) et de prendre des décisions efficaces en usant de logique

• Capacité d’influencer et de guider des personnes ayant des connaissances commerciales et techniques vers des approches et des objectifs communs

• Capacité de naviguer au sein d’une organisation complexe comme le CN et d’établir des relations de collaboration interfonctionnelles

• Capacité de communiquer efficacement avec des intervenants de divers horizons et degrés d’ancienneté

• Capacité de collaborer avec des partenaires externes aux fins de conception et de configuration, et de leur fournir des conseils

• Autonomie, capacité de déterminer quand il est nécessaire de demander de l’aide et d’offrir la visibilité adéquate

• Capacité de participer à plusieurs projets parallèles de manière efficace

• Curiosité et intérêt à acquérir des connaissances dans de multiples nouveaux domaines d’activité et domaines techniques

 

Expérience

• De 3 à 5 ans d’expérience en gestion de projets, ou expérience similaire

Atouts (s’il y a lieu)

• Expérience dans le domaine des ventes et du marketing ou dans des domaines connexes

• Expérience dans le domaine du service à la clientèle ou dans des domaines connexes

• Expérience des solutions d’analyse et d’information stratégique

• Bilinguisme (oral et écrit), excellente maîtrise de l’anglais et connaissance pratique du français

 

À propos du CN
Le CN est un chef de file mondial du transport et un partenaire commercial majeur. Essentiel pour l'économie, les clients et les communautés dans lesquelles il exerce ses activités, le CN transporte annuellement de façon sécuritaire plus de 300 millions de tonnes de ressources naturelles, de produits manufacturés et de produits finis partout en Amérique du Nord. Seul chemin de fer reliant les côtes est et ouest du Canada à la pointe sud des États-Unis avec un réseau ferroviaire de 19 500 milles, le CN et ses filiales contribuent à la prospérité des collectivités et au commerce durable depuis 1919. Le CN demeure engagé à soutenir des programmes supportant la responsabilité sociale et les initiatives de protection de l’environnement. Au CN, nous travaillons comme UNE ÉQUIPE axée sur la sécurité et nos clients, offrant l’excellence sur le plan de l’exploitation et de la chaîne d’approvisionnement pour produire des résultats.

Le CN exige que tous les membres de son personnel au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 et qu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat de vaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales en propriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents et fournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN au Canada.

 

Candidats internes: notez que le niveau du poste dépendra de l'expérience de l'employé

 

 

Le CN exige que tous lesmembres de son personnel soient entièrement vaccinés contre le COVID-19 etqu'ils en fournissent la preuve comme condition d'emploi. Le mandat devaccination de la Compagnie s'étend aux membres du personnel de ses filiales enpropriété exclusive ainsi qu'aux entrepreneurs, consultants, agents etfournisseurs du CN et à toute personne ayant accès aux propriétés du CN auCanada.

La forme grammaticale utilisée dans ce document vaut tant pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Le CN souscrit au principe de l’équité en emploi et invite toutes les personnes qualifiées à présenter leur candidature. Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt; cependant, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes dont la candidature sera retenue. Veuillez consulter régulièrement vos courriels, car les communications sont surtout envoyées par courrier électronique.
