title: Coordonnateur(trice) Marketing / Marketing Coordinator
description:
Our Story

Notre Histoire

Notre petite entreprise née au Canada a été fondée en 1978. Elle est depuis devenue une firme d'envergure mondiale qui compte maintenant 120 bureaux dans 20 pays. Certes, notre croissance a été rapide, mais ce qui compte le plus, c’est la conviction commune qui pousse nos 5 000 employés à faire de notre firme une société immobilière différente. Nous sommes d'avis que les lieux de vie, de travail et de loisir ont le pouvoir de nous rendre plus heureux et en meilleure santé, et nous sommes unis par un but commun : avoir un impact positif sur la vie des gens. Bref, nous sommes une société immobilière commerciale mondiale avec un objectif simple: que l’immobilier joue un rôle de premier plan dans la création d'espaces, de villes et de lieux dynamiques offrant une valeur sociale et un impact économique durables.

Pourquoi travailler ici?

Notre industrie est en changement constant et nous voulons que notre entreprise soit un lieu où se rencontrent des esprits curieux, des cœurs passionnés et des idées stratégiques. Chez Avison Young, nous nous engageons à embaucher des personnes de tous les horizons axés sur la collaboration et l'innovation. Nous croyons qu'une main-d'œuvre diversifiée et généreuse crée une entreprise plus forte, plus compétente et plus compétitive. Nous vous offrons un endroit où vous pourrez vous améliorer et changer les choses. La collaboration est ancrée dans notre façon de travailler: nos employés ont l’autonomie nécessaire pour collaborer aux relations avec les clients, engager des équipes dans l’ensemble de l’entreprise, diriger les opérations, travailler collectivement à des projets, participer à la stratégie de l'entreprise et ultimement, être à la barre de notre croissance. Notre modèle de gestion distinctif, selon lequel nos associés dirigent notre firme, nous place dans la position enviable de pouvoir offrir à chaque employé la possibilité de détenir une part de notre entreprise. Ce modèle inspire et permet à quiconque de devenir un Associé d'Avison Young. Ce rôle confère aux employés le droit de vote afin qu'ils aient vraiment leur mot à dire sur l’orientation future et le fonctionnement de notre entreprise. Cela signifie que nous sommes en mesure d'attirer, d'engager et de fidéliser les meilleurs talents.

______________

Our small Canadian-born business was founded in 1978 and has become a global organisation that now spans 120 locations across 20 countries. Our expansion has been rapid, but what matters most is the common belief that drives all 5,000 of our people to be a different type of real estate organisation. We believe that the places in which we live, work and play have the power to make us happier and healthier, and we are united by a shared sense of purpose, to have a positive impact on people’s lives. In short, we are a global commercial real estate advisory firm with a simple aim: for real estate to play a leading role in creating vibrant buildings, cities and places that deliver long-lasting social value and economic impact.

Why Work for Us:

We believe that our industry is changing, and we want our business to be a melting pot of curious minds, passionate hearts and strategic intelligence. Your gender, religion and race are all highly respected, but are less important to us than your ability to step up and change the game. We provide you with a place where you can do just that, with like-minded people. Collaboration is embedded in the way we work – our people have the autonomy to collaborate on client relationships, engage teams across the business, lead operations, work collectively on projects, participate in strategy and are ultimately responsible for our growth. Our distinctive Principal-led, privately-owned model puts us in the enviable position of being able to offer every employee the opportunity to own a share of our business, and inspires and allows anyone to become a Principal. This role carries voting rights so our people have a very real say in the future direction and operation of our business. This means that we are able to attract, engage and retain the best talent from the industry.

Overview

Résumé du poste

Nous cherchons un expert ou une experte en marketing, une personne talentueuse, créative et passionnée pour travailler dans un environnement en ébullition. Un individu qui s’accomplit en étant responsable de mener des projets de marketing à leur achèvement en portant une attention particulière à la conception visuelle de chaque affectation, travaillant de concert avec de multiples divisions et lignes services.

We are seeking a talented, creative and driven marketer to work within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. An individual who thrives on maintaining responsibility for carrying out marketing projects from start to finish with a specific attention to the design and visual aspects of each assignment, working closely across a variety of divisions and service lines.

Responsibilities

Responsabilités

Relevant du Directeur principal du marketing, le coordonnateur ou la coordonnatrice du marketing devra effectuer une variété de tâches, incluant, sans s’y limiter:

  • Gérer le design et l’aspect visuel de divers outils de marketing (dépliants, brochures, publicités de vente, propositions, invitations, présentations PowerPoint et autres documents d’accompagnement marketing);
  • Gérer le processus créatif pour les propositions, présentations et outils de marketing y compris les campagnes d’envois par courriel, les dépliants, plans d’étage, cartes, cartes postales, invitations, tableaux et affichages;
  • Préparer les budgets de marketing et faire le suivi de dépenses reliées pour les présentations et projets;
  • Design de sites web et autres mises en marché web de propriétés. Une familiarité avec Wordpress, Wix, Foleon et autres services de design web sont un atout majeur;
  • Fournir des approches créatives et innovantes pour les programmes de marketing des diverses équipes et lignes de service;
  • Créer et modifier des documents hautement formatés avec un grand souci du détail;
  • Gérer et maintenir les lignes directrices établies sur tous les documents d’accompagnement marketing;
  • Aider au maintien et à l’uniformité de la marque Avison Young dans tous les documents d’accompagnement marketing, en assurant la stricte conformité au lignes directrices de la marque et agir en tant que gardien de la marque;
  • Gérer et préparer des campagnes de marketing par courriel en utilisant les plateformes automatisées à cet effet;
  • Gérer et prioriser une variété de demandes/tâches dans un environnement hautement dynamique;
  • Faire preuve de jugement et prendre des décisions pour que la charge de travail s’effectue rondement. S’assurer que les demandes sont comblées;
  • Aider au maintien et à la mise à jour des listes de contacts/base de données, entrée de données avec un haut niveau de précision (expérience avec Salesforce et/ou Hubspot CRM un atout);
  • Élaborer des campagnes sur les médias sociaux avec le graphisme des médias sociaux;
  • Fonctionner dans un environnement immobilier rapide et évolutif;
  • Être axé(e) sur les solutions et apte à fournir des résultats créatifs à des défis uniques;
  • Autres projets spéciaux tels que requis ou attribués.

Reporting to the Senior Marketing Manager, the Marketing Coordinator is required to perform a range of duties including, but not limited to:

  • Manage the design and layout of various marketing materials (flyers, brochures, sales advertisements, proposals, invitations, Power Point presentations, and other various marketing collateral)
  • Own and manage the creative process for proposals, presentations, and marketing materials, including email campaigns, flyers, floor plans, maps, postcards, invitations, boards, and signage
  • Preparing marketing budgets and tracking related expenses for pitches and projects
  • Website design and other web-based property marketing, familiarity with Wordpress, Wix, Foleon and other web design services considered a major asset
  • Provide creative and innovative approaches to marketing programs for various teams and service lines
  • Develop and edit highly formatted documents with strict attention to detail
  • Manage and maintain established brand guidelines on all marketing collaterals
  • Assist in the maintenance and consistency of Avison Young’s branding on all marketing collateral, ensuring strict adherence to brand guidelines and act as a brand steward
  • Manage and prepare email marketing campaigns using marketing automation platforms
  • Manage and prioritize a variety of requests/tasks in a fast-paced atmosphere
  • Exercise judgment and make decisions to promote smooth workflow to ensure demands are met
  • Assist in maintaining and updating contact lists/database,data entry ensuring a high level of accuracy (experience with Salesforce and/or Hubspot CRM an asset)
  • Developing social media campaigns along with social media graphics
  • Thrive in a fast paced, dynamic and ever evolving commercial real estate environment
  • Be solution focused and able to provide creative results to unique challenges
  • Other special projects as required or assigned

Qualifications

Baccalauréat en marketing, graphisme, administration des affaires, communications OU autre diplôme en graphisme est requis. Une expérience de travail significative avec des études postsecondaires en graphisme ou en marketing sera considérée.

Maîtrise des programmes informatiques suivants:

  • Bonne connaissance de la suite Adobe Creative, connaissance avancée de InDesign, Photoshop et Illustrator;
  • Bonne connaissance de la suite Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, Excel et PowerPoint);
  • Une expérience avec les plateformes automatisées de marketing est souhaitable;
  • Une expérience avec Salesforce ou Hubspot CRM est souhaitable;
  • Une expérience avec l’industrie du design, de l’imprimerie et la l’édition est un atout;
  • La capacité de communiquer en anglais avec fluidité (à l’oral et à l’écrit);
  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication efficace à l’oral et à l’écrit;
  • Aptitude éprouvée de soutenir une personne ou une équipe;
  • Avoir le sens de l’organisation, le souci du détail et la capacité de prioriser les tâches et les échéanciers;
  • Aptitude à travailler sous pression, gérer de multiples demandes et travailler efficacement pour respecter des échéanciers serrés;
  • Avoir démontré une aptitude à résoudre des problèmes, faire preuve de discrétion dans le respect de la confidentialité;
  • La capacité de travailler avec une grande équipe est un atout;
  • Fortes aptitudes de gestion de projet: responsable de voir au déroulement de la charge de travail, s’assurer que les mandats soient complétés dans les échéanciers selon les spécifications du client, faire le suivi des diverses tâches de graphisme et de leur progression.

Bachelor Degree in Marketing, Graphic Design, Business Management, Communications OR Diploma in Graphic Design is required. Significant work experience along with post-secondary education in Graphic Design or Marketing also considered.

Proficiency in the use of specific computer programs:

  • Strong working knowledge in Adobe Creative Suite: advanced knowledge of InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Outlook, Excel & PowerPoint)
  • Experience using marketing automation platforms is preferred
  • Experience with Salesforce or Hubspot CRM’s is preferred
  • Experience in the design/printing/publishing industry is an asset
  • The ability to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written)
  • Excellent and effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Recognized ability to support an individual or team
  • Strong organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks and deadlines
  • Ability to work well under pressure, handle multiple assignments and work efficiently to meet tight deadlines
  • Demonstrated problem solving and ability to use discretion and adhere to confidentiality
  • Ability to work with a large team an asset
  • Strong project management skills: responsible for tracking workflow, ensuring that jobs are completed in required time frames to client specifications - track various graphic design jobs and their progress

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Notre Engagement

Avison Young respecte les règlements relatifs à l'équité salariale dans tous ses bureaux autour du monde. Nous nous engageons à rassembler et à maintenir une main-d'oeuvre diversifiée en matière d'expérience, de compétences et de connaissances, avec comme but commun l'excellence du service, l'engagement et l'intégrité.

Avison Young applique une politique stricte visant à garantir l'équité salariale, et à ne faire aucune discrimination, qu'elle soit fondée sur l'origine ethnique, la couleur, la religion, les croyances, l'âge, le sexe, l'identité ou l'expression de genre, l'orientation sexuelle, l'origine nationale, la citoyenneté, le handicap, les relations matrimoniales et civiles, le statut de partenariat/d’union, le statut de vétéran ou de service militaire protégé, ou tout autre élément protégé par la loi.

Pour les candidats nécessitant une assistance pour personnes à mobilité réduite, les informations relatives au besoin d'adaptation et aux mesures d'adaptation seront traitées de manière confidentielle.

Avison Young s'engage à employer les meilleurs talents, en ayant recours aux pratiques de recrutement les plus justes et équitables.

Postulez dès aujourd'hui!

______________

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.

The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.

For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

title: Analyste en Marketing et Commerce Électronique | Marketing & E-Commerce Analyst
description:
[English description to follow]

Sonder révolutionne l'hospitalité grâce à un service innovant alimenté par la technologie et à des hébergements inspirants et conçus de manière réfléchie, combinés en une seule expérience gérée de manière transparente. Lancé officiellement en 2014 et basé à San Francisco, Sonder rend un monde de meilleurs séjours ouvert à tous avec une variété d'options d'hébergement - des chambres aux suites et appartements - que l'on trouve dans plus de 30 villes réparties dans huit pays et sur trois continents. L'application innovante de Sonder permet aux clients d'accéder à des fonctions en libre-service et à une assistance sur le terrain 24 heures sur 24 et 7 jours sur 7. Qu'il s'agisse d'un simple enregistrement en libre-service ou d'articles de toilette haut de gamme, nous offrons le meilleur d'un hôtel sans aucune formalité.
 
Sonder est à la recherche d'un analyste en marketing et commerce électronique pour rejoindre son équipe. Cet analyste fera partie de l'organisation Data and Analytics et sera en contact direct avec les parties prenantes des produits et du marketing.  Il s'agit d'un rôle à fort impact où vous serez responsable de la mesure et de l'analyse des canaux d'acquisition du marketing de croissance et de l'entonnoir de réservation du site Web afin d'aider Sonder à accroître sa clientèle de manière plus efficace et rentable. Vous soutiendrez l'équipe marketing en analysant l'incrémentalité et le ROAS de notre canal publicitaire, en identifiant et en testant de nouvelles opportunités d'optimisation, en créant des tableaux de bord de performance et en fournissant des recommandations pour améliorer la stratégie de croissance de Sonder. 
 
En tant qu'analyste, vous travaillerez de manière transversale pour définir les principaux indicateurs et les mesures du succès, vous travaillerez avec les équipes d'ingénierie pour construire et assurer un suivi de qualité, vous utiliserez une variété de sources de données pour construire des outils et découvrir des informations qui permettent de prendre des décisions commerciales clés et d'accélérer les performances du canal. Si vous êtes passionné par l'élaboration d'informations commerciales tangibles et utilisables à partir de données, si vous travaillez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif et interfonctionnel, et si vous relevez des défis analytiques complexes, nous voulons vous connaître ! 
 
CHEZ SONDER, VOUS DEVREZ:
  • Formuler des mesures de succès pour suivre et améliorer l'efficacité et l'efficience des efforts de marketing et des fonctionnalités du site.
  • Vous établissez des relations solides avec les parties prenantes de l'organisation - Sonder.com, Channel and Product Marketing, Paid and Social Marketing, Email Marketing, et SEO entre autres.
  • Concevoir et lancer des expériences de marketing, déterminer les stratégies de ciblage des campagnes et développer des indicateurs clés de performance, des prévisions et des objectifs spécifiques à chaque catégorie.
  • Analyser de nouveaux canaux de marketing numérique à mettre à l'échelle tout en exécutant de nouvelles stratégies de ciblage pour débloquer de nouveaux segments de clientèle.
  • Créer des tableaux de bord et des rapports pour surveiller les campagnes et les efforts de marketing en partenariat avec les ingénieurs BI.
  • Collaborer avec l'équipe pour optimiser les campagnes d'acquisition de clients, définir et s'approprier les métriques qui capturent les performances des canaux, et identifier des tendances significatives.
  • Utiliser une approche statistique fondée sur des hypothèses pour les tests et l'optimisation, et communiquer les résultats de manière claire et concise aux partenaires commerciaux.
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l'analyste de l'application mobile pour assurer la cohérence de la stratégie de contenu dans les notifications par e-mail et par push mobile.
  • Diriger la gestion des données marketing, le marquage et le suivi des canaux, les règles d'attribution et la qualité des données en collaboration avec les ingénieurs BI et d'autres propriétaires de données fonctionnelles afin de garantir l'intégrité des données sur les canaux marketing.
  • Créer des tableaux de bord pour analyser l'entonnoir de réservation en ligne et surveiller les indicateurs clés de performance. Identifier les tendances et travailler avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre les causes profondes et les traduire en enseignements.
  • Contribuer au lancement de nouvelles fonctionnalités du site web en analysant les résultats des tests A/B et aider à formuler des recommandations pour le lancement de nouvelles fonctionnalités. Mesurer l'engagement envers les fonctionnalités afin de produire des informations et d'orienter les décisions relatives aux futurs produits.
  • Participer à des analyses ad hoc du site Web afin d'obtenir des informations qui orientent les décisions et les priorités en matière de produits.
 
CE QUE NOUS RECHERCHONS :
  • Une personne orientée vers les résultats, capable d'identifier les dépendances et de tirer parti de plusieurs sources d'information à la fois.
  • Minimum 2 ans d'expérience dans un rôle d'analyste dans une entreprise publique ou une start-up à forte croissance.
  • Compétences avancées en SQL avec la capacité d'écrire des requêtes complexes et optimisées.
  • Maîtrise de Tableau ou d'autres outils de visualisation de données.
  • Expérience dans la conception d'expériences et l'analyse de tests
  • Une expérience en Python et/ou R est un atout majeur.
  • Une expérience préalable dans le domaine du marketing numérique/du commerce électronique est préférable mais pas obligatoire.
  • Capacité à établir des priorités et à répondre à des demandes d'analyse dans un environnement où le rythme est soutenu.
  • Curiosité intellectuelle et envie d'apprendre

Nous offrons également d'excellents avantages sociaux pour vous faciliter la vie et vous permettre de vous concentrer sur ce que vous savez faire le mieux :

  • Une rémunération compétitive
  • Plan d'options sur actions généreux
  • Assurance médicale, dentaire et visuelle
  • Les membres de l'équipe exonérés bénéficient de congés payés. Les membres de l'équipe non exemptés accumulent des congés payés.
  • Crédits annuels gratuits et remises pour rester à Sonders
  • Une entreprise avec une grande vision, un environnement de travail dynamique et une équipe de collègues intelligents, ambitieux et avec lesquels il est agréable de travailler !

Nous sommes un employeur qui respecte l'égalité des chances et nous valorisons la diversité au sein de notre entreprise. Nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination fondée sur la race, la religion, la couleur, l'origine nationale, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'âge, l'état civil, le statut de vétéran ou le statut de handicapé ou d'autres classes protégées.

Sonder is revolutionizing hospitality through innovative, tech-powered service and inspiring, thoughtfully designed accommodations combined into one seamlessly managed experience. Officially launched in 2014 and headquartered in San Francisco, Sonder is making a world of better stays open to all with a variety of accommodation options — from rooms to suites and apartments — found in more than 30 cities spanning eight countries and three continents. Sonder's innovative app empowers guests by making self-service features and 24/7 on-the-ground support just a tap away. From simple self check-in to boutique bathroom amenities, we bring the best of a hotel without any of the formality.

Sonder is looking for a Marketing & eCommerce Analyst to join the team. This Analyst will sit within the Data and Analytics org and will have dotted line to Product and Marketing stakeholders.  This is a high-impact role where you will own measurement and analysis for growth marketing acquisition channels and the website booking funnel to help Sonder grow our customer base more efficiently and profitably. You will support the marketing team by analyzing incrementality and ROAS of our ad channel, identifying and testing new opportunities for optimization, building performance dashboards, and providing recommendations to improve Sonder's growth strategy. 

As an Analyst, you will work cross-functionally to define key metrics and measures of success, work with the engineering teams to build and ensure quality tracking, use a variety of data sources to build tools and uncover insights that drive key business decisions and accelerate channel performance. If you are passionate about crafting tangible, usable business insights from data, working in a highly collaborative and cross-functional environment, and tackling complex analytics challenges, we want to hear from you! 

AT SONDER YOU WILL:

  • Formulate success metrics to track and improve the effectiveness and efficiency of Marketing efforts and site features
  • Build strong relationships with stakeholders across the organization – Sonder.com, Channel and Product Marketing, Paid and Social Marketing, Email Marketing, and SEO amongst others
  • Design and launch marketing experiments, determine campaign targeting strategies and develop category-specific KPIs, forecasts, and goals
  • Analyze new digital marketing channels to scale while executing new targeting strategies to unlock new customer segments.
  • Build dashboards and reports to monitor marketing campaigns and efforts in partnership with BI Engineers
  • Collaborate with the team to optimize customer acquisition campaigns, define and own metrics that capture channel performance, and identify insightful trends
  • Use a statistical hypothesis-driven approach to testing and optimization, and communicate results in a clear, concise manner to business partners
  • Work closely with the Mobile App analyst for consistency in content strategy across Email and Mobile push notifications
  • Drive Marketing data management, channel tagging and tracking, attribution rules, and data quality in collaboration with BI Engineers and other functional data owners to ensure data integrity across marketing channels
  • Build dashboards to analyze the web booking funnel and monitor KPIs. Identify trends and work with stakeholders to understand root causes and translate these into learnings
  • Assist with the launch of new website features by analyzing the results of A/B tests and help drive recommendations to launch new features. Measure engagement with features in order to produce insights and drive future product decisions
  • Assist with ad-hoc website analyses in order to drive insights that guide product decisions and prioritization

WHAT WE LOOK FOR:

  • Results-oriented individual with ability to identify dependencies, and leverage multiple sources of information at once
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in an analytics role at a public or high-growth start-up
  • Advanced skills in SQL with the ability to write complex and optimized queries
  • Proficiency in Tableau or other data visualization tools.
  • Experience with Experiment design and Test analysis
  • Experience in Python and/or R is a big plus
  • Previous experience in digital marketing/ecommerce is preferred but not required
  • Ability to prioritize and respond to analytics requests in a fast-paced environment
  • Intellectually curious and excited to learn

We also have great benefits to make your life easier so you can focus on what you're best at:

  • Competitive compensation

  • Generous stock option plan

  • Medical, dental and vision insurance (where applicable)

  • Flexible vacation

  • Annual free credits and discounts to stay in Sonders

  • A company with a huge vision, a dynamic work environment, and a team of smart, ambitious and fun to work-with colleagues!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status or other protected classes.

title: Product Data Analyst
description:
Numerator is a data and tech company bringing speed and scale to market research. Headquartered in Chicago, IL, Numerator has more than 2,000 employees worldwide. The company blends proprietary data with advanced technology to create unique insights for the market research industry that has been slow to change. The majority of Fortune 100 companies are Numerator clients.

Here at Numerator, we've made all corporate roles have maximum flexibility between office and remote work, except for rare situations when the role requires coming into an office regularly. In those situations, the recruiter of that role will clarify at the beginning of the process if that is the case. In fully remote situations, the company will provide technical equipment necessary to be successful in the role. In addition to maximum flexibility of return-to-office, the company also provides generous PTO, Internally Quiet Focus Time, and other recharge efforts to give time back to employees.

Job Description
Numerator is looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our Data as a Service (DaaS) team. As part of our DaaS team, you will be a vital member ensuring on-going excellence in delivery of our data feed solutions. You will be responsible for the technical delivery of our data feeds product to a myriad of clients and strategic partnerships, as well as work on on-going improvements and extensions to this capability. This is an opportunity to collaborate with a cross-functional team in one of our fastest growing business areas.

Responsibilities

  • Develop expertise in Numerator datasets with deep understanding of data schema and storage systems
  • Define queries for data feed deliveries via interpretation of data requirements and scoping documents
  • Maintenance of technical documentation as it relates to DaaS delivery processes
  • Assist in development and maintenance of Airflow dependent processes
  • First level support for operational triage and bug fixes in code
  • Implement extensions of pre-defined code and architecture
  • Regularly communicate progress and timing implications for directed tasks

What you bring:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or related fields
  • Intermediate to advanced experience with SQL
  • Experience with ETL tooling (particularly Airflow)
  • Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and comfort with shifting environments
  • Strong database skills
  • Experience with version control systems (Git, etc.)
  • An eagerness to learn new things, and improve upon existing skills, abilities, and practices.

Nice to have's:

  • Prior experience with Snowflake Data Warehouse
  • Knowledge of engineering best practices and coding standards
  • Airflow -- Experience building and monitoring DAGs, developing custom operators and using script templating solutions
  • Scripting experience with Python
  • CPG and/or retail industry knowledge

What we offer:

  • An inclusive and collaborative company culture
  • An opportunity to have an impact on our growing teams and organization
  • Ownership of platforms and environments with industry leading product
  • Market competitive total compensation package
  • Volunteer time off and charitable donation matching
  • Strong support for career growth, including mentorship programs, leadership training, access to conferences and employee resources groups
  • Great benefits package including health/vision/dental, unlimited PTO, 401k plus matching, and more!

If this sounds like something you would like to be part of, we'd love for you to apply! Don't worry if you think that you don't meet all the qualifications here. The tools, technology and methodologies we use are constantly changing and we value talent and interest over specific experience.

While this position can be remote, Numerator is only able to hire in many, but not all, states and provinces. In certain cases, if you are not located in a specific area where Numerator is able to hire, you may not be eligible for employment.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law

title: Marketing Automation Technical Consultant
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The MA Technical Consultant will contribute in the Services Teams' effort to fulfill client mandates. As an MA Technical Consultant, you will participate in all phases of deployment from initial project briefing, requirements gathering, solution design, configuration and development, testing, validation, and go live activities during the deployment. You will develop, configure, implement MA and CRM solutions, along with leveraging key functionalities to deliver a valuable and outstanding client experience. You will also be responsible for the mentorship and guidance of Associate Technical Consultants. 

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Assist with technical discovery discussions to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and present solutions with supportive documentation
  • Design technical solutions to client challenges in collaboration with Lead Management Consultant
  • Implement technical solutions to business problems utilizing MA and CRM
  • Responsible for writing technical portion of Business Requirements Document and all technical documentation (technical solution specification, testing requirements and validation, user and maintenance documentation, client training, etc.)
  • Build positive client and peer relationships by developing an understanding of customers' business and project objectives
  • Integrate MA and CRM platforms to deliver Lead Management solutions
  • Technical development and configuration will include, but may not be limited to:
    • Implement and enhance new or existing Marketing Automation and/or Sales Automation implementations (e.g. configuration and rollout of Marketo, Pardot, Eloqua, Salesforce.com)
    • Familiarity with direct outbound Marketing channels best practices (Email, Direct Mail, SMS, etc.) and current privacy regulations such as CAN-SPAM, GDPR, CCPA, etc.
    • Set up automated targeted marketing journeys and nurturing stages; including the development of segmentation, campaign flows, emails, landing pages, forms, data processors, etc. utilizing MA platforms, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS, etc.
    • Campaign and Lead Management reporting, tracking, and analytics utilizing Excel, Business Intelligence (BI) platforms, SQL, scripting (JavaScript, Python) for technical and non-technical audiences
    • Implement and enhance lead scoring and lead routing rules
    • Define and implement data management (cleansing, de-duplication, standardization, augmentation, enrichment) to enhance targeting, segmentation, and personalization
    • Implement and enhance funnel progression tracking for prospects and leads; establish the ability to track conversion ratios, lead volume and velocity through each funnel stage
    • Implement and enhance automation and workflow rules enabling Service Level Agreement (SLA) definition, tracking, and enforcement for lead progression through the funnel
  • Mentor Associate Technical Consultants with an intent to facilitate the development of their MA and CRM skillset
  • Maintain awareness of new Marketing Automation and Sales Automation technologies and apps
  • Guide and educate clients on MA and CRM systems and capabilities
  • Work in a collaborative team (Project Management, Business Consulting, Technical Consulting) to analyze client objectives, assess potential options, provide recommendations, and develop solutions
  • Other projects, assignments and tasks as may be assigned 

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE 

  • Minimum 2-4 years of experience as a technologist in marketing automation and/or sales automation or equivalent experience in a related field
  • 1-2 years relevant experience implementing and delivering MA and CRM across the full lifecycle
  • Working technical knowledge of at least one CRM (Customer Relationship Management) platform stack. Experience with Salesforce.com is a definite asset
  • Experience and ability to communicate effectively with clients (face to face, over the phone, by email), and managing multiple projects
  • Experience with the development lifecycle (Business Process design, documentation, QA, testing strategy and execution, troubleshooting analysis)
  • Experience in a B2B environment (an asset)
  • Experience building lead scoring and lead management processes that align marketing and sales;
  • Web page and HTML design experience
  • Experience with coding and development languages like C, C++, Java, C# (an asset)

EDUCATION

  • Minimum Bachelor's Degree is required in either: Business Administration, Marketing, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or equivalent training/experience
  • MA and/or CRM certification (considered an asset)

SKILLS, COMPETENCIES & BEHAVIOURS

  • Solid understanding of direct marketing concepts, email marketing, marketing and sales funnels
  • Strong technical expertise and the proven ability to remain current with respect to industry trends, provincial and federal privacy legislative policies and changes
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate and present effectively to others
  • Organization skills and the ability to effectively deliver on multiple projects and services
  • Capable of multitasking within a fast-paced demanding environment
  • Strong commitment to professional client service excellence
  • Very good interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams
  • Ability to demonstrate confidence and establish trust with our customers
  • Ability to transfer knowledge and mentor others
  • Detail and results-oriented; able to balance multiple priorities and work under tight deadlines
  • Positive attitude combined with the desire to contribute to the success of MASS Engines
  • Alignment and commitment to demonstrating MASS' core values of Ownership, Quality, Integrity, Teamwork and Hard Work

WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Professional services office environment
  • Using a computer keyboard, monitor and mouse for extended periods of time
  • Travel within Canada and USA may be required for client-facing meetings: 20%

title: Marketing Operations Analyst
description:
WHO WE ARE 

At Personify, we build strong connections with our clients so they can build strong connections with their communities. One of the most diversified and fastest-growing technology providers of integrated software solutions, we are innovative leaders in the industry and respond to the needs of our clients through products that include: 

  • A2Z Events, a multi-event platform that enables clients to manage their events from start to finish, including floor plans, financials, managing contracts and sponsorships, and increasing engagement through mobile applications and a networking suite. 
  • CommUnity, an online community platform for those with common interests to connect, learn and collaborate.  
  • Wild Apricot, an all-in-one solution that automates and simplifies workflows enabling nonprofits and associations to manage their membership, streamline their processes, and make room for human connections. 
  • MemberClicks, an easy-to-use member management cloud solution aimed at small to medium-sized nonprofit organizations and associations. 
  • ThreeSixty, an enterprise management solution for associations, nonprofits, YMCAs and JCCs to engage, manage and grow their membership. 
  • And more. 

At Personify, we're in the relationship building business, powering conversations, donations, events, and foundations through analytics, tools, and robust backend management systems. With 300+ employees in our offices in Austin, Atlanta, and Toronto, and as part of remote teams across Canada and the US, we're the people designing the technology that reaches 30,000+ clients resulting in 3B+ interactions a year with our products. Joining us is a chance to take your skills and expertise and build solutions for the real world that strengthen the connection between clients, their mission, and their communities. 

WHO WE NEED 

We're looking for a Marketing Operations Coordinator to join our team. This is an amazing opportunity for someone early in their career with responsibility for all things data, reporting, analytics, and use of sales and marketing technology to support revenue growth. This is a critical role for the company as we lay the foundation for a growing operations team and leverage data-driven insights from our core technologies more than ever. Despite being early in your career, you'll have an enormous opportunity to influence key marketing and sales decisions and strategy. It's fast-paced, fun, challenging, and rewarding.   

WHO YOU ARE 

You are a data and technology junkie who also enjoys:    

  • Seeing the results of your collaboration with Marketing and Sales impact growth    
  • Being relied upon for your analytics, insights and expertise to drive decisions 
  • Enhancing the marketing and sales database to improve marketing and sales effectiveness 
  • Being viewed as a marketing and sales technology expert using the latest tools 

    

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU 

This is an opportunity for someone who wants to be a part of something bigger by helping small organizations and non-profits succeed. Our environment is vibrant and collaborative where we foster the personal and professional growth of all our team members.  

You will be working with an amazing team that is invested in your success. We work and play hard, celebrate results, learn from our mistakes, and work to continually improve our performance so that everyone succeeds. 

HOW YOU WILL MAKE AN IMPACT 

  • Serve as key source for marketing data reporting and analytics leveraging Salesforce.com, Marketo, Drift, SalesLoft, and a growing list of other technologies  
  • Manage analysis of individual campaign performance toward business goals.  
  • Responsible for database enhancement and hygiene.  
  • Identify opportunities to leverage data from other technologies in core database.  
  • Assist with the development, execution and tracking of testing strategies to optimize marketing tactics and campaigns.  
  • Work with Business Operations to enhance database with additional data for segmentation and to develop more targeted audiences for marketing campaigns.  
  • Support the Marketing team's efforts to build and deploy campaigns through Marketo and other marketing tools.  
  • Assist with integration efforts of new acquisitions on marketing channels and platforms.  

WHAT YOU BRING 

  • Bachelor's degree in business, computer or data science, or related field required.  
  • 2+ years of B2B marketing operations experience, SaaS experience preferred.  
  • Aptitude to grow into a marketing, marketing operations, or business intelligence role with even more responsibility and influence within two years  
  • Experience analyzing data, identifying trends and patterns, reaching fact-based conclusions, and making compelling recommendations  
  • Highly analytical and metrics driven with a high degree of intellectual curiosity  
  • Marketing automation (Marketo preferred) and Salesforce experience; certification in either or both of these would be a huge plus!  
  • A solid understanding of how integrated marketing efforts drive demand for individual product lines.  
  • Experience working on lead generation programs and campaigns.  
  • Outstanding project management and communication skills with a great track record of working across sales, marketing and product teams.  
  • Self-driven with a desire to experiment, fail, learn and grow.  
  • Passion for data-driven decision making and using marketing efforts to meet buyers where they are.  

WHY JOIN US? 

We are committed to creating a balanced, inclusive, and equitable workplace.  

  • We recognize and appreciate the varied experiences, backgrounds, and knowledge our team can bring to our culture, operations, products, and relationships internally and externally. 
  • We have an impactful recruitment diversity strategy to increase representation across the company at every level. And, we're working with our teams to create employee resource groups that further support our people in the safe spaces and ways they need to feel heard. 

We're proud of our evolution. We promote – and live – a culture of not just listening but acting, making ourselves available and accessible. 

We're a great place to work. 

Guided by our values, inspired by our clients, and forging ahead with optimism and the commitment to service of a new President and CEO, Scott Collison, at the helm, Personify is driven by our purpose. We empower our clients, from small nonprofits to large enterprise organizations, to build strong connections with their communities, ultimately enabling them to achieve their missions. And, our leadership team brings profound expertise and a deep commitment to taking Personify to the next level. 

With generous paid-time-off, flexibility, and the option to be fully remote, we prioritize the well being of our teams. Choosing where to power up their laptops empowers our employees to connect with each other and our clients from anywhere while meeting their life demands and without sacrificing their performance. In fact, we know it makes them do better, feel better, and enjoy being part of our company.  

Recognized by Built In Austin in its Best Places to Work Awards for three years in a row in 2019, 2020, and 2021, we spend our days creating a virtual place and physical space where people are comfortable being themselves, feel supported and heard, enjoy each other's company, and have an opportunity to shine.  

Apply now. 

Personify is a company made up of people who like to work with brilliant teams passionate about delivering exceptional solutions to our clients. We're a place to make an impact, see the difference, and accelerate your career doing something you love. 

We know not everyone gains their education and skills the traditional way, so if you feel you have 70% of the qualifications you are looking for and you are ready to make a difference, submit your application. Of course, we can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider the full scope of who you are and what you bring. 

Personify is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran or disability status, or other protected characteristics.  

Employment offers are contingent on the candidate successfully completing a background investigation in compliance with federal, state, and local laws.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Are you hungry to innovate? To do things differently? To work with a company that's real, thoughtful and very forward-thinking?

Meet Riverside. We are an organic, “better for you” snack company, manufacturing award-winning, nutritious, allergen-free snacks. Your kids know us as MadeGood, tasty school-safe snacks. Your workout buddies grab GoodToGo Keto certified bars. And your pup begs for a Cookie Pal treat, our human-grade, vegan dog treats.

At Riverside, we make delicious snacks that are good in every way. From our ingredients to our manufacturing practices, we've raised every bar on every aspect. We're friendly and focused on creating foods that are good for you and good to the planet as well. Riverside Natural Foods is B-Corp certified, Triple-Bottom Line, Zero Waste, and Canadian owned and operated.

Come work with a new Canadian leader! We value teamwork, humility, respect, ownership, adaptability, passion and fun

You can learn more about us at www.riversidenaturalfoods.com

We continue to grow and today are looking for a committed, talented, star to join our team as our Marketing Coordinator.

Position Summary/Objectives

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for supporting activities related to all new product launches and day to day management of the Riverside product portfolio, which include but are not limited to; managing sample shipments, GSI product specs data entry, product catalogue management, master data product specs and internal codes management and liaising with internal functions to ensure an open flow of communication regarding project status and updates. In addition, the Marketing Coordinator is responsible for day-to-day administrative requirements to support the marketing department.

Primary Responsibilities

Marketing

  • Collecting all relevant product details including codes, dimensions, product description with support copy, images, and inputting into the GSI tool
  • Collaborating with internal stakeholders to source and maintain all product content for all SKUs on the Product Information Management System: including images, product names, product descriptions, hierarchy, and attributes.
  • Communicating with cross functional teams (Ecom, Commercial, Innovation, Brand) to effectively support product content requirements and priorities and ensure consistent execution and optimizations.
  • Executing the product information syndication process to retailers in North America
  • Work with Innovation and Commercialization team to collect master data details from internal teams to input into the SAP system.
  • Reviewing and updating the master product catalogue with any missing or new information. Leveraging this information to provide updates to the team when information has changed and where needed pulling the information to provide to team members. Where required create documents with all relevant information to provide to the team as a one pager.
  • Process reconciliation of credit card charges bi-weekly.
  • Responsible for Marketing samples and promotional items including purchasing, inventory management and fulfilling requests.
  • Prepare sales material mailings, demo kits and other special mailing requests for Marketing/Sales.
  • Support in the development of sales materials as part of the launch deck development

Administrative

  • Provide administrative support to sales and marketing team including taking detailed notes of key meetings and circulating to all participants within 24 hours
  • Maintain order and cleanliness of Marketing Room
  • Monitor D2000 SPA inventories for Sales Samples
  • Keeps the work atmosphere FUN by keeping it light and welcoming
  • Special projects and other duties as assigned

Reporting Relationships

The Marketing Coordinator reports directly to the Innovation and Commercialization Manager

No positions report to the Marketing Intern

Education & Qualifications

  • A bachelor's degree in project management, marketing, or another relevant field.
  • Talent for finding creative solutions to complex problems.
  • Highly organized, with the ability to work within a team and effectively plan and prioritize tasks (with guidance).
  • Understanding of project management techniques and methods.
  • Ability to perform to deadline in a changing environment.
  • Written and spoken communication skills, along with a talent for integrating and processing information.
  • Fluency in written and spoken English.

Skills and Abilities

  • Self starter with a high level of initiative and flexibility
  • Excellent planning, organizing, multitasking and time management skills
  • Excellent English communication skills, both oral and written
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple cross-discipline projects concurrently
  • Strong TEAM player, demonstrated ability to take OWNERSHIP
  • PASSIONATE with a positive attitude with a desire to learn and collaborate
  • Exceptional time management and organizational skills, self-starter with a high level of initiative and ADAPTABILITY
  • Demonstrates HUMILITY throughout the company on a daily basis
  • Aptitude to exhibit, RESPECT and protect Riverside's Core Values in a changing environment
  • Good computer skills, Intermediate level Microsoft Office 2007 Word & Excel

How to Apply:

If you have the commitment to excellence, the energy, the attitude and experience we need, then please submit your resume to careers(AT)riversidenaturals.com with the subject line Marketing Coordinator or click the apply button!

Riverside Natural Foods is committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you have a disability and require accommodation in the interview process, please let us know when you apply.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, due to volume, please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Depending on the nature of the role, you may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by your hire date to be eligible to start the role. In this case, proof of vaccination will be required by your start date. Riverside will consider and review accommodation requests based on protected human rights grounds for qualified candidates.

title: Business Development and Proposal Advisor - Permanent Full-time
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Canadian Base Operators' team is growing! If you are a committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you.

The Business Development and Proposal Advisor's head office is located in Collingwood, Ontario however, the successful candidate will work remotely and typically reports directly to the Business Development Manager. Their primary focus is to provide support to all aspects of the Business Development team under the direction of the Business Development Manager. Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Assist with planning, organizing and execution of proposal submission and presentation.
  • Write, research, design, and develop content answering request for proposals.
  • Conduct quality assurance before delivering proposals.
  • Proposal writing and coordination.
  • Represent CBO as required at client pre-bid and bid clarification meetings.
  • Review client request for proposal/quotation packages, including terms & conditions and scope of work documents, for completeness and consistency, highlight areas of concern and resolve or follow up with others to resolve.
  • Ensure conformance to client forms of proposal or bid submission.
  • Assist in the development of strategies for profitable penetration into new or existing market segments in a geographic area.
  • Assist in the development of bid templates, pricing list, catalogues and literature; prepare quotations and reports.
  • Support all aspects relating to proposal and presentation development and special client deliverables. As assigned, handles proposal, presentation, and client deliverable development from end-to-end.
  • Works closely with division manager, project managers and estimators to compile, develop, assess and maintain appropriate proposal exhibits, appendices, project profiles and illustrative documents, keeping them current and ensuring materials are well organized and easily accessible.
  • Works closely with business subject matter experts to collect and/or develop appropriate proposal intelligence on our business strategy aligned with customer benefits.
  • As needed, handles formatting and electronic and print production for client deliverables related to proposal generation.
  • Maintains and updates project profiles and key company information that may be required to be included in proposals / pursuits.
  • Administrative support in the processing of tenders, purchase orders, contracts and job numbers.

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS  

  • Teamwork and collaboration
  • Maximizes business performance and team effectiveness
  • Strategic perspective
  • Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
  • Commitment to integrity, confidentiality, and accountability.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships.
  • Proven ability to work with a diverse team
  • Able to make decisions in complex situations

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

Degree or Diploma in:

  • Business Administration or a related field

The following certifications/designations are considered an asset:

  • Advanced Word, Excel and PowerPoint

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 3-5 years' experience in a similar role

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Intermediate knowledge and understanding of:

  • Intermediate to advanced computer skills
  • A valid driver's license
  • Extensive travel required at times

Due to many mandatory vaccination requirements at client projects / facilities, in order to provide substantial employment by ensuring compliance with our clients' mandates, the successful candidate may be required to validate full vaccination prior to hire.

Please forward your application prior to close of business May 10, 2022

Canadian Base Operators welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Marketing Technology Consultant
description:
William Thomas Digital is one of Canada's fastest growing companies. We are building North America's leading personalization, Digital Messaging and CRM agency. We help organizations of all sizes communicate relevant and personalized messaging to their customers through Email, Mobile Push, SMS, Social, Web, Marketing Automation and Chat.  Some of Canada's most successful brands in the Loyalty, Retail, CPG, B2B, and financial services sectors work with William Thomas Digital's CRM subject matter experts to create lasting relationships, increase lifetime value, capture wallet share, build loyalty and elevate their brand above competitors. 

We are seeking a Marketing Technology Consultant to lead enterprise marketing technology implementation and transformation projects. You will serve as a thought leader in using technology and content to connect with consumers in meaningful ways, and in aligning digital strategy with clients' business goals and objectives.

Key responsibilities for the role include:

  • Maintain a solid grasp of digital trends, emerging technologies and how consumers use them, marketing trends, and industry dynamics. As a marketing technology expert, you'll be a resource for Account, Strategy and Creative teams for perspective on digital trends, activation, and implementation.
  • Deep understanding of the marketing technology space and industry platforms and purposes (Customer Data Platforms, Marketing Automation tools, Content Management Systems, Mobile Applications and frameworks)
  • Ability to conceptualize marketing technology solution architecture that maps back to the organization's needs, breaking down large-scale projects to manageable tasks, and evaluating which Marketing Cloud components and other technology products and frameworks to use to bring personalized experiences to life. 
  • Work closely with account leadership and provide technical leadership internally and externally and help to define strategic opportunity for digital in the overall context of a clients' marketing communications plan.
  • Ability to map out best-practice architecture and implementation plans of marketing automation/digital marketing platforms
  • Ability to develop technical documentation for Marketing Technology  implementation projects 
  • Ability to create and deliver presentations to C-suite level audiences and cross functional teams including marketing and IT leadership
  • Ability to perform rapid analysis and decomposition of complex business information into technical process components, including in-depth technical architecture diagrams.
  • Ability to lead discovery and elaboration workshops, which includes the facilitation of large audiences, solution presentations, and prototype demonstrations
  • Certified and Expert level hands on knowledge in Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • Strong knowledge of APIs, integrations, and database architecture
  • Ability to lead, motivate and train a team of implementation engineers and consultants

You're a good fit for the job if you have:

  • Endless curiosity and expert knowledge around how marketing technology delivers on personalized customer experiences.
  • 6+ years of experience including Agency or Consulting experience
  • Deep knowledge of Salesforce Marketing Cloud including multiple certifications
  • Experience leading enterprise scale digital transformation projects 
  • Can roll up your sleeves and build, solution, troubleshoot and execute in the platform when necessary

title: Marketing Content Specialist
description:
Marketing Content Specialist

About the company

CamDo Solutions, Inc. is a leading provider of affordable, high-quality time lapse cameras and remote monitoring equipment based in Vancourver, Canada serving customers worldwide. For years, we have been providing the best value time lapse cameras for construction professionals and bringing easy-to-use solutions to the masses. With a focus on creating a simple workflow that allows anyone to start capturing content in minutes, CamDo is bringing viewers closer to the source.

As a small start-up, we are a resourceful team of self-starters that roll up our sleeves to get the job done. We speak to each other respectfully yet candidly and informally. We challenge each other, and joke often. We're a tight-knit team working towards a common goal.

About the position

The Marketing Content Specialist is a new role on the CamDo Sales and Marketing team with the critical aim of developing interesting, high-quality, valuable content that is relevant to our target audience and in support of company objectives. The Content Specialist will be responsible for content planning, development, deployment, monitoring, and moderation of the CamDo blog, social media presence (Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn), email and various internal resources (white papers, guides, case studies, etc.). We are looking for someone that wants to be a part of a growing team, long-term and we are prepared to assist in your growth both within the position and within the company. Support for appropriate training and development initiatives will be provided. There are opportunities for promotion and internal career advancement in this role. Your success is our success.

Experience/Skills/Education

● Post-secondary diploma/degree in Marketing, Journalism, Communications, Public Relations, or a related discipline

● 2-3 years of related experience

● Your understanding of technology and startups would be useful

● Knowledge of the B2B space is preferred

● Experience and proficiency with social media management, blog writing, basic knowledge of SEO, graphic design, video recording, editing, and

publishing

● Advanced knowledge of social channels relevant to the company's success

● Ability to write and edit a wide variety of audience-targeted materials

● Ability to take direction and work independently while being part of a team

● Strong and critical attention to detail

● Ability to meet deadlines while working autonomously

● Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Adobe Creative Suite, HTML, and video editing software

● Excellent writing and editing skills in English


Responsibilities/Accountabilities

This role is responsible for the following:

● Research industry-related topics (combining online sources, interviews, and studies)

● Write clear marketing copy (blog, email, and social posts) to promote our products/services

● Prepare well-structured drafts

● Write, proofread, and edit email, video scripts, blog, and social posts

● Meet with the internal team to review project and departmental objectives

● Monitor graphic identity and consistency of messaging across all public-facing materials

● Promote and monitor content on social media

● Conduct simple keyword research and use SEO guidelines to develop content that will increase web traffic

● Ensure all-around consistency (style, fonts, images, and tone)

● Create, edit, and publish YouTube videos

● Create graphics using Adobe Creative Suite for marketing materials including videos

● Other duties as required to meet the needs of the role in relation to the company's goals

About You

You can juggle a number of projects and responsibilities while maintaining a “can-do” attitude, a commitment to customer service, and collaboration across teams and departments. You relish putting campaign plans in place and excel in getting them implemented. You are energetic, communicative, a team player, and have proven success in writing compelling, well-written content. You are well-planned, motivated, and tenacious in achieving your goals. We're a match if you're hungry, humble, and smart. We've always operated as a remote team, so you will need to demonstrate the ability to work autonomously. The position requires the use of your computer, internet connection, and phone. We would provide the software, documents, and onboarding to allow you to be effective in the position.

Your location in Vancouver, Canada is preferable; however, anywhere in North America will be considered.

How to Apply
If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. Please include your cover letter, resume, and 1-2 writing samples in a single word or PDF le.

title: Associate Live Content Marketing Specialist
description:
A little About Us:

Making fans - That's what we're all about! Since our humble beginnings in 2011, these two words have driven Big Viking Games to become the successful company it is today. We are focused on making our mark as a live operations games company.

We believe that each Viking is unique and brings exponential value to the company. In return, we provide Vikings with the opportunity to solve problems through continuous learning and fostering feedback, ultimately mastering their craft. By investing in our Vikings, we can continue our success for years to come.

The Nitty-Gritty:

Big Viking Games is on the hunt for someone to join our team as our new Associate Live Content Marketing Specialist. This person will be primarily responsible for managing digital content in our online games, including asset configuration and management as well as in-game marketing and promotion. Our ideal candidate is a fast learner with an excellent pace of productivity, has an eye for details, and is great with people.


What You Will Do:

Be Creative

  • Create engaging in-game promotional advertisements
  • Ideate detailed, engaging content releases for our players
  • Work in a fast-paced environment, with a mastery in juggling multiple priorities

Be Analytical

  • Maintain and update our inventory management system to a high degree of accuracy
  • Assess content desirability to appropriately align with pricing guidelines
  • Use our proprietary tools to transform art team's work into functional in-game assets
  • Work alongside the Product Management, Data, and Content Design teams to drive sales and player experience
  • Participate in marketing retrospectives to analyze past releases in order to repeat successes and learn from misses

Be Empathetic

  • Work closely with Player Support Specialists and Community Managers to ensure that Making Fans is at the heart of all of our efforts
  • Working alongside the QA team to help squash bugs

Job Requirements:

Must Haves

  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal, along with the ability to deliver information in an empathetic manner (Strong Documentation Skills required)
  • Demonstrable skills in accurate data input or inventory management
  • Fast learner who can adapt quickly to changing expectations and processes

Nice to Haves

  • Experience in LiveOps, marketing/advertising, SaaS, or related fields
  • Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Animate, Illustrator, Photoshop)
  • 2+ years experience in gaming and/or LiveOps environments
  • Experience in online gaming environment preferred
  • Experience with Confluence and Jira preferred


The Loot:

  • Health, Dental, Vision Benefits
  • A generous amount of Paid Time Off (Vacation, Personal Days, Sick Days, Family Leave)
  • Competitive Salaries
  • Professional Growth
  • Health & Wellness Benefits (Employee Assistance Program, Monthly Spending Account, Wellness Initiatives, Perkopolis)
  • Vikoins (Peer Recognition Program & Rewards)
  • Stock Options
  • Group RRSP
  • 100% remote work environment


Becoming a Viking:

Are you cut from our cloth? Does the idea of working for a gaming company and doing what you love every day get you so excited that you kind of want to scream? Great! Send us your resume!

Big Viking Games is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Accommodation may be provided in all parts of the hiring process.

We are focused on making our mark as a live operations games company.", 'We believe that each Viking is unique and brings exponential value to the company. In return, we provide Vikings with the opportunity to solve problems through continuous learning and fostering feedback, ultimately mastering their craft. By investing in our Vikings, we can continue our success for years to come.', 'Nice to Haves', 'Create engaging in-game promotional advertisements', 'Becoming a Viking:']

title: Campaign Marketing Specialist
description:
Stradigi AI, a leading artificial intelligence solutions provider, is looking for a Marketing Campaign Specialist. The Marketing team is responsible for all go to market efforts for the company, to build and scale meaningful pipeline for product, partner and enterprise sales teams. Marketing is also responsible to craft and uphold the brand vision and identity, for a dynamic and engaging internal and external presence.  The Marketing Campaign Specialist will be responsible to define and execute multi-channel campaigns to generate awareness and leads for our company.

Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Senior Director, Marketing, the Marketing Campaign Specialist will be responsible to organize and manage all aspects of campaign execution including:

  • Produce a campaign brief summarizing the audience, message, and tactics
  • Lead a team of internal and external contributors to execute and deliver on the campaign including Product marketing, strategy, content, digital marketing, creative, and web team
  • Oversee the project delivery in Asana, ensuring smooth flow of information and optimal team collaboration
  • Set up marketing automation in Salesforce / Pardot including email nurtures, campaign tracking, and campaign reporting
  • Prepare SDR cadences in MixMax
  • Report on campaign performance across all channels and make optimization recommendations on a bi-weekly basis
  • Lead the optimization efforts with internal and external team members

Required Qualifications

  • Degree in marketing or equivalent experience;
  • 3-5 years working in a similar role at a B2B SaaS company, ideally promoting products to a senior technical role (IT or Data team);
  • Strong storytelling skills;
  • Exceptional writing skills, in both French & English;
  • Solid project management skills;
  • Exceptional attention to detail;
  • Experience with Salesforce, Pardot, and WordPress;
  • Experience managing and monitoring marketing campaigns;
  • Collaborative work ethic.

Nice to haves

  • Experience with ZoomInfo, Oktopost or other social media platform, LinkedIn paid advertising SEMRush, LinkedIn Navigator, MIxMax or other sales engagement software;
  • A huge asset if you have experience in AI, SaaS, machine learning, data science, big data, and/or analytics;
  • Skills: SEM, ABM, SDR collaboration with agencies and outside consultants.

Why considerStradigi AI? 

  • We offer very attractive salaries.
  • The opportunity to own shares in our company through our ESOP program
  • RRSP matching up to 3%
  • A generous vacation program & additional paid time off during the holidays
  • Health, Dental and many additional wellness benefits
  • Flexible work arrangements, allowing you to work from home or the office.

Become part of a forward-thinking, innovative AI business that truly values what you do, what you think, and how you feel.

title: Marketing Specialist, Wholesale, Levi's and Signature
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

You’re an original. So are we. 

We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we’ve used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi’s®, Dockers®, Denizen® and Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™

In this role as the Wholesale Marketing Specialist supporting Levi's and Signature brands, you willdevelop and execute integrated wholesale marketing strategies that build brand equity and elevate the consumer experience while driving traffic, sales and conversion.  This role reports to the Marketing Director in Toronto.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead Canadian wholesale marketing plans that promote equity and drive traffic and conversion, for both the Levi’s® and Signature Brands

  • Partner with sales and merchandising teams to understand seasonal business objectives and develop programs to support these priorities

  • Work with the marketing teams at key accounts to develop integrated campaigns leveraging available tactics; including online/digital, email, events, PR, media, demand generation, social, and engagement programs

  • Partner with brand environment teams to ensure cohesive presentation of keyproduct and brand stories

  • Lead wholesale.com marketing. Work with creative agency to develop digital marketing elements for customer’s e-commerce sites. Manage collection and distribution of marketing copy and image assets

  • Recap, review, analyze and share insights and KPIs on all marketing programs

  • Act as the primary contact for wholesale accounts and assist in buildingvarious sell-in and report-out presentations

  • Manage wholesale portion of A&P Marketing budget including annual financial plans, accurate monthly forecasts, monthly and year-end accruals and quarterly reporting.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3 years of marketing experience, including both digital and event management

  • Strategic thinker with extensive experience managing integrated marketing programs

  • Experience working with agency partners, developing briefs and managing project timelines and budgets

  • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy with exceptional planning and organizational skills and ability to multi-task, manage priorities and deadlines with superior follow-through

Levi Strauss & Co. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. We are committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category. Minorities, females, people with disabilities and veterans are highly encouraged to apply.

LOCATION

Richmond Hill, ON, CAN

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.
