title: Product Marketing Specialist
description:
About ZE

ZE PowerGroup Inc. (ZE) is a global leader in the development of enterprise data management and analysis software. We design and develop ZEMA, a sophisticated suite of products that provides clients with powerful capabilities for data collection, process automation, and business intelligence through web-based analytical tools, services, and dashboards. We work with world-class companies in energy, commodities, and finance to serve users in trade, risk management, and IT. Our head office is located in Richmond, BC, Canada, and we have operations Brighton, UK, and sales offices in Houston, TX, USA, and Singapore.

COVID-19 considerations:

To keep our employees as safe as possible, we've transitioned to remote work temporarily where possible.

Vaccination Status:

ZE PowerGroup Inc. is committed to protecting the health and safety of all our team members, customer and our communities from COVID-19.  Accordingly, following provincial and federal vaccination's approach, we require that all of our employees be fully vaccinated and provide proof of immunization or substantiated grounds for exemption.

Responsibilities

The Product Marketing Specialist must be an orchestrator, ensuring all relevant groups collaborate on and execute a shared go-to-market strategy for solutions that combine multiple products and services.

Working with the Product Management team, the role will have primary or shared responsibilities for:

  • Collaborating with executives, product management, marketing, business solutions, market data services team, and research & development to define new ways to position and Market the ZEMA suite
  • Performing market research (primary and secondary) to segment the market and establish buyer insight, identifying what opportunities, challenges and dynamics exist for the organization and its portfolio of solutions.
  • Developing and collaborating on go-to-market strategies to bring best-in-class solutions to market through effective, well managed launch campaigns
  • Validating the alignment between the solution offering and the identified target segments and ideal customer profiles
  • Outlining strengths and weaknesses of the current offer and ZEMA solution
  • Working with several departments to define the messaging, content, tools and programs that will be required to bring a solution to market or increase traction for existing offers

Create Positioning, Messaging, Storylines and Content

A Product Marketing Specialist must ensure that compelling and impactful communications are created and delivered by:

  • Developing clear and crisp solution positioning for a set of products and services that will guide messaging and other go-to-market strategies
    • Ensuring that solution positioning is comprehensive and explains the additive value of multiple products or services
  • Working with marketing to explore and define the core questions and FAQ's buyers need to have addressed throughout their buying and owning life cycles
  • Crafting storylines to communicate value, and that can be applied and contextualized for different buying scenarios
  • Articulating solution stories within the context of the larger brand storyline
  • Helping to create and execute a content strategy that supports all stages of the buying journey through the channels and formats most valued by buyers
  • Inspiring and contributing to thought leadership development and delivery

Skills

To support the wide range of responsibilities encompassed within a product marketing specialist role, the candidates must possess an equally broad set of skills:

Excellent communication skills:

  • Must be able to command and sustain attention, and be a natural, authentic storyteller
  • Must be able to determine when to probe for additional lessons and when to push forward
  • Must be able to deliver clear, compelling and articulate written and verbal communications

Creative skills:

  • Has a good eye for evaluating creative design options that will resonate with target buyers
  • Open to experimenting with new approaches and establishing KPIs that can help determine effectiveness
  • Ability to balance innovation against known and effective approaches

Analytical skills:

  • Ability to analyze and understand the underlying business problem(s) for buyer organizations
  • Ability to identify signals and measures that can be incorporated into KPIs
  • Ability to analyze and interpret disparate datasets to derive insights
  • Willingness to change direction based on results illustrated through analytics and feedback
  • Fortitude to acknowledge mistakes unearthed through measures, and ability to pivot rapidly to adjust

Managerial skills:

  • Build relationships and collaboration with functions outside of product marketing, including corporate communications, demand generation, marketing, channel& partner marketing, product management, software engineering, sales, customer success, business solutions, and IT
  • Experience in selecting and managing external resources
  • Ability to manage upward in the organization to influence executives, as well as down

Requirements

  • 5+ years experience of B2B marketing and business strategy, with 3+ years in a product marketing role defining and executing the go-to-market strategy. Formal education in product management or product marketing is a plus
  • Strong quantitative analytical ability and excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to craft compelling and succinct positioning, messaging, and differentiation in enterprise software space
  • Think strategically and analytically, then follow through to execution with unyielding attention to details
  • Experience with deriving market insights primarily through quantitative methods
  • Results-oriented with a positive "can-do" attitude to get things done
  • Experience developing strategic direction and executing go-to-market plans
  • Marketing experience in the Energy and Commodity industries is a bonus

Benefits

  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience & qualifications.
  • A generous benefits package
  • Highly autonomous environment
  • Excellent work-life balance
  • Work remotely anywhere in Canada or in our office location in Richmond BC, just outside of Vancouver

title: DNA PRODUCT LINE ANALYST
description:
Janssen Commercial Pharmaceutical business. This position’s primary location will be in Toronto Canada. At times, this position will require up to 10% travel in US.



At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to build a world without disease. Redefining lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease encourages us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen! We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Pharmaceuticals Inc. is a company of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.



The DNA Product Line is uniquely positioned to power world-class data and analytics technologies that enable end-to-end data management, operational/sophisticated analytics and data science capabilities. By turning our J&J commercial and corporate functions into insight driven organizations that are true analytics competitors, we are redefining how we serve our consumers, patients, healthcare professionals, customers and employees around the world. In close partnership with full JJT organization and our business, we will develop, demonstrate and scale smarter, faster and more efficient future-ready enterprise platforms and capabilities that will help to unlock new and differentiated insights needed to drive innovation, commercial growth, operational efficiencies and improved health outcomes.



This position will have specific responsibilities as an IT lead with in-depth technical skills, delivering high impact analytic products and solutions that address the evolving needs of the Business. The IT lead will be directly responsible for supervising the design, execution, delivery, and support of analytics products and solutions across the Janssen Canadian portfolio. The IT Lead will partner closely with Business Technology Leads (BTLs), External Vendors, other Product Lines, Business Product Owners, Technology Services, Finance, and Portfolio teams to apply Enterprise technology and development capabilities and deliver analytics solutions that rapidly meet business needs, optimize flow, and enhance our ability to deliver quality products and solutions with greater speed, increased agility, and measurable business impact. Key skills are needed to build Reporting & Analytics capabilities in the realm of Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing and Analytics, Self Service, and Metadata Management.

Specific responsibilities include:



+ Partner with Business Technology Leads (BTL) and Business Product Owners (BPO) to understand business drivers and to deliver analytics products that address business needs



+ Utilize Agile methodology to work with business partners to define and translate business needs into user stories, prioritize product backlog, and define sprint plans.



+ Work with the product development and platform teams to communicate product vision and functional requirements and ensure implementation of configuration needs for the products



+ Ensure all stakeholders are clear on the roadmap activities, interdependencies & deadlines



+ Actively participate in the development and evolution of product strategy and roadmap by staying current in technology advancements and working closely with architecture teams and IT management



+ Develop and manage Project Plans and areas related to project management



+ Partner across IT teams (BTLs, PLs, EA, SA, TS, and Data Science) as One IT to deliver high quality analytics solutions which are aligned to business and IT strategies



+ Lead, monitor, and measure product health, technical quality, development and support services, adoption and usage through consistent metrics reporting



+ Implement solutions using Enterprise Analytics Platforms (Dataiku, Qlik and/or Tableau and AWS cloud stack components (S3, RDS, Redshift)



+ Ensure Compliance to J&J Standards for all Product Development and Product Ownership (Privacy, Health Care Compliance, Data Governance, Software Development Lifecycle Management)



+ Provide technology leadership and Commercial data domain expertise to drive business adoption of analytics products and solutions.



+ Apply process improvement methods to optimize business processes by continuously searching for ways to eliminate redundancies and inefficiencies



+ Cultivate collaborative, healthy, inclusive, and credo-based culture of highly engaged, robust teams by modelling credo values, valuing diverse perspectives, with high touch approach to employee talent and development





Qualifications


Requirements:





+ A minimum of 3 years of experience within a large, global and matrixed organization is required



+ A minimum of 4 years of technology development (platforms or products) is required



+ A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree is required, preferably in technology or engineering discipline



+ Demonstrated track record of delivering successful analytics products and solutions is required



+ Experience leading project teams is required



+ Data analysis skills with hands-on expertise to work with heterogeneous data sources is required



+ Experience developing in BI visualization technologies and/or developing in other programming languages is required



+ Experience with databases modelling and database queries is required



+ Experience working directly with business partners and capturing business requirements is required



+ Experience working with IT support teams



+ Experience collaborating cross-functionally within a matrixed IT organization



+ Practical experience using Agile development methodology



+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with exceptional interpersonal skills is required



+ The ability to work with minimal direction and achieve results in a fast-paced environment is required



Preferences:



+ Qlik Sense Certification



+ Hands on experience working with S3, Redshift, RDS, Dataiku, and QlikSense



+ Experience in the Commercial Pharmaceutical industry



+ Knowledge of commercial pharma business processes such as sales and marketing, field alignment, medical affairs, and government access.



+ Experience with CRM environment and the Calls Data from Veeva/Salesforce



+ Experience with wide array of pharmaceutical data including but not limited to Patient Access Services, sales and marketing syndicated data, CRM, digital.



+ Knowledge of Data science concepts and Artificial Intelligence



+ Master’s degree in technology or engineering field





At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of full COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.



For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.



Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing, and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is essential to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive, and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.



Primary Location

Canada-Ontario-Toronto-19 Green Belt Drive

Organization

Janssen Inc. (7710)

Job Function

Info Technology

Requisition ID

2206036219W

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Seaspan has an opening for a Marketing Coordinator who has experience working with Indigenous communities or political level ideally with BC First Nations. This newly crafted position will plan and implement strategies for events related to BC First Nation communities. The successful candidate will be able to analyze qualitative data, trends, strategies, and competition sought at growing Seaspan's competitiveness.

What you’ll do

  • Conducts studies of market conditions to assess the potential sales of products and services.
  • Analyzes qualitative data, trends, strategies, and competition to increase competitiveness.
  • Provides communications, collaboration and planning support for events related to BC First Nations communities.
  • Performs market research SWOT analysis.
  • Uses online market research and catalogue findings to databases.
  • Develops methods for collecting data (Surveys, Questionnaires, Opinion Polls).
  • Interprets data, builds reports, and provides recommendations.
  • Captures and analyzes statistical data using modern and traditional methods of data sourcing.
  • Remains informed on market trends and implementation of standard methodologies.
  • Performs additional duties as assigned.

What you’ll bring

  • Bachelor's degree or similar training in Marketing or related field.
  • 3 - 5 years of recent experience in the development and execution of activities with Indigenous communities.
  • Experience working with Indigenous communities and/or political level.
  • Experience with community engagement and community/organizational development.
  • Experience supporting traditional ceremonies and cultural practices.
  • Knowledge of the BC First Nation political and governance landscape and the current community, in both nation and regional contexts.
  • Analytical and numerical skills.
  • Creative personality with problem-solving skills.
  • Passion for service excellence and business enablement, with the ability to deliver on work products that provide measurable business benefit.
  • Effective and self-motivated collaborator, with communication and presentation skills, able to build consensus across and influencing a variety of internal business units and levels of leadership.
  • Strategic problem solver, who can work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Project management and organizational skills to meet multiple initiatives on time and on budget.

Why you’ll love working here

  • This is a full-time permanent position because we have long term projects that need long term strategic thinking support.
  • Located at the waters’ edge in the heart of our operations in North Vancouver.
  • This position is eligible for a hybrid work arrangement, providing the opportunity to work remotely 50% of the time. 
  • In addition to an annual bonus and pension plan matching, this role provides you a very competitive salary in line with your strong proven years of experience. 
  • We also provide a best-in-class health and wellness benefits package for this position that includes such things as full health care (including unlimited physiotherapy), dental, vision, life insurance, medical leave coverage, maternity and parental leave coverage, wellness/fitness reimbursement for memberships or registration fees, free on-site gym and a free Employee Family Assistance Program (EFAP) through Homewood Health.

 

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

title: Sr Pricing Project Specialist
description:
Job Description :


Are you looking to play a pivotal role in attracting the next generation of best-in-class talent for one of the worlds most respected fast moving CPG’s?


Diageo is a global leader in beverage alcohol with an outstanding collection of brands including Johnnie Walker, Crown Royal, Bulleit and Buchanan's whiskies, Smirnoff, Cîroc and Ketel One vodkas, Captain Morgan, Baileys, Don Julio, Tanqueray and Guinness.


Our performance ambition is to be one of the best performing, most trusted and respected consumer products companies in the world. We are proud of the brands we make and the enjoyment they give to millions. We are passionate about alcohol playing a positive role in society as part of a balanced lifestyle. It is central to our purpose to celebrate life, every day, everywhere.


We are a global leader in beverage alcohol with an outstanding collection of brands across spirits and beer! We produce an assortment of over 200 amazing brands – old and new, large, and small, global and local – that are enjoyed in more than 180 countries around the world!


Diageo is listed on both the New York Stock Exchange (DEO) and the London Stock Exchange (DGE). For more information about Diageo, our people, our brands, and performance, visit us at www.diageo.com . Visit Diageo's global responsible drinking resource, www.DRINKiQ.com , for information, initiatives, and ways to share standard methodology.


Context & Purpose


+ The RGM Contract role will be of crucial support in facilitating and delivering the DIAGEO CANADA Revenue Growth Management and Price/Mix Agenda.

+ The RGM Contract role will help us implement key results within our AOP agenda.


+ This role will work closely with Sales to implement the plan: Drives internal and external organizational capabilities, processes, and tools in the RGM space in order to accelerate data insights into commercial action


Management Responsibility


+ Reports into the RGM Director


+ Will be responsible for regional pricing execution: will take the strategy and bring it to life at a local level.

+ This person should be able to work cross functionally and collaboratively


Complexity of Role


+ Work across multiple teams / collaborators to drive pricing delivery

+ Influences to make better decisions to improve NSV and GP.

+ Work with DBS on development of next generation pricing analytics, tools, data, automation.

+ Understanding of Marco economic factors impacting the industry

+ Has executive presence and can share findings, insights and actions to senior level management


Key Outputs/Results:


+ Deliver RGM value through price and mix that is ahead of the industry

+ Acts as a revenue growth partner to Commercial functions

+ Periodically supports RGM Director on key strategic results such as AOP and Sprints

+ Embodies Diageo’s core values, as well as a positive demeanor with an eagerness to coach, guide and encourage the team


Systems


+ Outstanding Excel Skills

+ Solid understanding of Power BI

+ Solid understanding of Anaplan

+ Outstanding at optimizing processes and driving efficiency

+ Strong presentation skills, executive presence and can distill sophisticated ideas into digestible insights


Experience


+ Undergraduate degree (BA/BS) required

+ MBA/post graduate education a plus but not required

+ Diageo experience or Alcohol industry experience preferred

+ Strong background in analytic or commercial sales/finance roles, commercial savvy is key

+ Demonstrated ability to perform analytics and use results to drive outcomes

+ Able to build strong relationships; excellent influencing skills

+ Expertise in one or more of: pricing / promo analytics, tool development, syndicated data, trade terms optimization, promotional effectiveness, finance

+ Familiarity with multiple data sources e.g. syndicated sales data, financial data, and consumer data


Worker Type :


Fixed Term Contract (Fixed Term)


Primary Location:


Downtown Toronto


Additional Locations :


Job Posting Start Date :


2022-05-05-07:00

As a global leader in beverage alcohol, our 200+ brands are part of everyday celebrations in over 180 countries. Our ambition is to create the best performing, most trusted and respected Consumer Products Company in the world.


Ever since Arthur Guinness took out a 9,000 year lease on a Dublin brewery, some 250 years ago, we became a business that is defined by the character of the people who work here. It took immense character from Alexander Walker to convince the captains of every ship in the port of Glasgow to take crates of Johnnie Walker to the four corners of the world. Today, nothing’s changed.


We’re proud to be more than 27,775 talented people . While they make our iconic brands ever stronger around the world, we help them go further than they thought possible. Diageo is where you’ll find a wide variety of personalities, experiences and perspectives , wherever you’re based in the world. It makes for a stimulating and rewarding working environment, where everyone can flourish.


DRINKiQ


What's your DRINKiQ? Take our quiz to understand how alcohol is made and explore the effects of drinking. You can discover everything you need to know on DRINKiQ website (https://www.diageo.com/en/in-society/drinkiq/alcohol-facts/) .

title: Category Advisor – IT
description:
Description:

Agilus is recruiting for a Category Advisor – IT in the IT Hardware and Telecommunications. in Calgary, Alberta.

A typical day:
  • Lead commercial negotiations with vendors ensuring goods and services are contracted in an efficient, efficient manner bringing maximum value to the organization.
  • Review, interpret, and analyze legal and commercial contract terms and conditions in legal documents including master agreements, schedules, statements of work, pricing, confidentiality agreements or other documentation as required. These agreements will include but not be limited to software, hardware, services, hosted/cloud solutions, subscriptions and professional services.
  • Interface with IT leadership team, subject matter experts and external vendors on contract management related tasks.
  • Responsible for end-to-end Category Management of the IT Hardware and Telecommunications portfolios.
  • Execute on annual and long-term strategic planning and budgeting to secure supply of goods and services and manage the associated price and supply risks.
  • Lead strategic sourcing initiatives including RFx activities, development of negotiation strategies and recommendations to award

Successful candidates will have:
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
  • Post-secondary Business, Supply Chain or related degree
  • 5-7 years’ experience, ideally in an IT portfolio
  • Experience leading and managing RFx activities
  • Strong negotiation skills required
  • Oil & Gas experience will be considered an asset
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail required
  • Must be proficient in Microsoft Office application suite

Total rewards:
  • Competitive Compensation

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email sthirupathi@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Marketing Co-ordinator
description:
About Deliverr

Founded in 2016, Deliverr is dedicated to growing local economies and empowering new ways of working, earning, and living. Deliverr has become the fastest-growing on-demand liquor delivery in Saskatchewan, growing 170% year-over-year. Deliverr has distinguished itself by offering liquor and grocery on-demand delivery. Deliverr’s technology-led approach to solving for hyperlocal, offers a hassle-free fast and reliable delivery experience for our consumers.

With COVID pandemic and recently grown demand for on-demand deliveries and market expansion, Deliverr is proud of providing contactless safe delivery options to Saskatchewan communities and business partners. Be a part of an awesome growing team whose mission is to provide a responsible, convenient, and enjoyable delivery experience.

About the Role

Deliverr is looking for an effective Marketing Coordinator in Regina, SK. who will analyse, develop and implement digital, traditional communication, and promotion strategies. Assist in information programs, analyse advertising needs, and developing appropriate advertising and marketing plans for various Deliverr stakeholders all across Saskatchewan.


Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the preparation of partner brochures, reports, weekly emails and monthly newsletters

  • Create strategies and execute online paid media campaigns using Facebook Ads Manager and Google Ads

  • Advise Deliverr business partners on advertising or sales promotion strategies

  • Create, edit, and publish social media content

  • Conduct customer surveys to identify the interests and concerns of key Deliverr customer groups 

  • Manage reporting and analytics for a variety of social channels and ad campaigns

  • Gather, research and prepare communications material for internal and external stakeholders

  • Develop and organize workshops, meetings and other events for internal and external Deliverr stakeholders

  • Act as spokesperson for an organization and answer written and oral inquiries

  • Conduct market research for organizations to help understand customer needs

  • Learn consistently and create amazing customer ads with your unreal marketing skills and knowledge of digital tools to grow Deliverr products

  • Prepare and deliver educational and training programs along with informational materials to increase product knowledge to all stakeholders and help build amazing Deliverr partner / customer experience

title: Lifecycle Marketing Specialist
description:
PressReader is a rapidly growing technology company that partners with the world’s leading publishers to deliver content to millions of users in over 160 countries. Our progressive approach to digital distribution has allowed publishers such as The Washington Post, The Guardian, Newsweek, Rolling Stone, The Globe and Mail, and Vogue to find new audiences through business partnerships, including airlines, hotels, cruise ships, libraries, and thousands of other companies worldwide.

Our technology also powers Branded Editions (BE) - a white-label solution that enables publishers to deliver their digital content in interactive ways. BE allows them to build a customizable platform that supports a wide range of revenue opportunities.

We have an opportunity for a Lifecycle Marketing Specialist role to join our Marketing Team.

As a Lifecycle Marketing Specialist, you will be key in creating the bridge across the organization to streamline processes, automate manual workflows and set up measurement tools that generate actionable insights. Thanks to your strong collaborative and problem-solving skills, you will focus on better productivity for our employees and optimize our Time-to-Value towards our customers’ needs. You will also help improve the collaboration with CRM in order to create better reporting to understand the impact of marketing automation on our organization.

In this role, you will:

  • Translate project requirements and build solutions in marketing automation platforms
  • Create campaigns to support nurture, scoring, event promotion, and data management
  • Proactively improve nurture strategy and tactics for operations excellence and ROI
  • Be responsible for daily hands-on work including email builds/sends, landing pages, dynamic content, list imports, database management, and multi-tool orchestration
  • Setup cross-channel campaigns (such as email, push notifications, app & web messages, social media and more)
  • Plan and perform A/B testing within marketing automation platforms to improve productivity, conversion rates, program/campaign ROI, and sales growth
  • Understand the framework of campaigns, lead routing, and data management between sales and marketing systems
  • Maintain and monitor internal system integrations for the digital marketing technology stack to ensure full usage of these tools
  • Collaborate with Marketing Leads, Sales and CRM teams with the planning and execution of strategic marketing automation projects like segmentation, deliverability, dashboard reporting, software integrations, and database maintenance
  • Enable cross-functional relationships amongst teams to deliver operational needs within the defined verticals
  • Track automated program performance, get insights and recommend data-driven optimization avenues to improve demand-gen, engagement and retention

You are a great fit if you have:

  • 4+ years of experience in marketing automation or marketing operations both inbound/outbound best practices
  • Strong knowledge of best practices for email deployment, data, analytics, segmentation, list management, dynamic content, testing methodologies, and deliverability
  • Solid experience with HubSpot, Braze, Microsoft Dynamics, and related platform integrations such as Drift, 6Sense, Splash, Zoom Webinar, Folloze, and Outreach
  • A high level of technical aptitude dealing with complex processes and how to leverage them to achieve desired results
  • A data-driven mindset with a passion for continuous learning to seek new strategies and techniques to regularly upgrade the programs
  • Intermediate HTML knowledge
  • A deep understanding of authentication protocols (DKIM, SPF, DMARC, IP) and bounce categories
  • A broad knowledge of global privacy and anti-SPAM legislation (GDPR, CASL, CAN-SPAM, etc.)
  • A creative and analytical outlook with a focus on continuous improvement
  • Strong collaborative skills and you seek out cross-functional feedback and input to build comprehensive strategies

Bonus points if you:

  • Have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science
  • Have certification in HubSpot or Salesforce
  • Have a great sense of humor and like working with diverse and passionate colleagues
  • Have a strong interest in the technology sector

This role is a full-time position based in our Richmond, BC office. Working from home is available during the Covid pandemic and we are actively considering and trialing hybrid solutions post-pandemic.

We understand everyone has different circumstances; however, we will only consider applicants who are legally eligible to work in Canada.

If you don’t see yourself fullyreflected in every job requirement listed for this job, we still encourage you to apply. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive and diverse company and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, sexual identification, and life experiences.

Sometimes emergencies happen and you may need to reschedule an interview. We understand. Please let us know without worrying about losing the opportunity or your credibility.

PressReader offers a compensation package which includes extended health care, dental, vision and accidental death insurance paid by the company; 15 paid vacation days to start, sick and bereavement days; reimbursements for professional training and membership in professional associations; fitness subsidy and more, along with a chance to be working with amazing people.

To apply, please submit your resume, and a cover letter explaining why you are the right person for this role.

This is a great opportunity for the right candidate.

We can’t wait to meet you!

title: Community Marketing Specialist
description:
tentree is a lifestyle apparel company based out of Vancouver, Canada that plants ten trees for every item purchased. By combining social and environmental consciousness with apparel, we empower our customers to have a direct impact on saving the planet through intentional purchasing.

We are looking for a Community Marketing Specialist to join our Marketing team and help grow our digital community. In this role, you will be responsible for developing, executing and monitoring strategies and campaigns all across organic social media and ambassador channels. Reporting to the Manager of Brand Strategy, the Community Marketing Specialist will ensure our social media marketing efforts are executed on time, on-brand and contribute to the goals of the company. Our ideal candidate will be passionate about making this conversation more accessible to a diverse audience and is inspired and excited by discussions around sustainability and environmentalism.

What will you be doing?

  • You will drive, evolve and execute tentree’s organic social media strategy across Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, LinkedIn and more
  • You will integrate tentree’s ambassador platform into the holistic community marketing strategy and oversee ambassador execution alongside Marketing Specialist
  • You will manage a social media content calendar that aligns with our key brand goals, campaigns and initiatives
  • You will lead the sourcing and scheduling of content that reflects our brand calendar and values, and assist in driving traffic, conversations and engagement - with the assistance of the Marketing Coordinator
  • You will track, measure and report on all social channels and brand ambassador analytics on a weekly basis including engagement, follower growth, web traffic, conversions etc.
  • You will manage organic social and ambassador budgets in order to meet key tentree KPIs every quarter
  • You will liaise with cross-functional team members in creative, content, partnerships, merchandising and more to coordinate all community logistics and ensure creative execution is on time and within budget
  • You will work closely with Influencer Marketing Specialist to ensure UGC is strategically integrated across all organic channels
  • You will remain up to date on relevant social, influencer and ambassador content, changes, trends and strategies among both competitors and innovators outside of our industry

Professional Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications or equivalent experience
  • 5+ years of organic social media experience
  • 2+ years of experience of marketing at a brand
  • Strong experience working with content scheduling and influencer platforms such as Curalate and Grin
  • Strong knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, YouTube, LinkedIn and other social platforms
  • Experience with driving results and managing overlapping social media campaigns on a variety of platforms
  • Proficiency in Google Analytics and other digital measurement tools
  • Working knowledge of performance marketing is considered an asset

Personal Strengths:

  • Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to multi-task and shift between projects
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize activities, develop plans and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and proven interpersonal skills, including internal communication, coordination, and facilitation skills
  • Strong writing, copy editing and proofreading skills
  • Curious mindset and desire to always be learning, innovating, and optimizing
  • Extended healthcare plan
  • Generous paid days off
  • Ability to work from home occasionally
  • Opportunities for training and development
  • Employee discounts
  • Discretionary bonus


tentree is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business needs.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Company Description

Be part of a community of authentic, proud and trusted people.

Our Heavy Vehicle Parts Division is the country’s largest network. This division’s banners include Traction, TW and Cadel. Servicing the transport, construction and farming sectors, we keep them moving forward. This makes for a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.

Job Description

We are looking for a marketing coordinator to join our dynamic and talented team who is passionate about challenges and teamwork.  We work within a large company that supports us in our projects, but with the collaborative and energetic spirit of a small business: the best of both worlds!  Projects are numerous, ideas are welcome and teamwork is our greatest value.

The Marketing Coordinator will report to the Marketing Director and will have as collaborators two graphic designers, a marketing coordinator, a web team and an electronic catalog team.
The incumbent will participate in the development of the marketing strategy and the execution of national initiatives for the entire Heavy Duty Parts division (115 Traction stores, 125 TruckPro repair shops, 4 TW warehouses and 3 Cadel warehouses).  

  • Coordinate the production, printing, distribution and communication of promotional material (flyers, brochures, posters, point of sale material...)
  • Coordinate various promotions, contests, draws, loyalty programs and other promotional initiatives
  • Manage communications to the network and customers through various channels (newsletters, internal emails, web banners...)
  • Organize national and regional special events
  • Support the product management team during product launches
  • Write national content for in-store messages
  • Manage digital signage in our store network
  • Handle media placement in trade magazines
  • Ensure compliance with the graphic standards of our brands throughout the network
  • Participate in the marketing strategy on our social networks and websites
  • Produce reports, analyze promotional results and suggest ways to improve
Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, administration or other;
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar position in a marketing department
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office environment;
  • Bilingualism in oral and written communication;
  • Strong writing skills ;
  • Experience in the distribution or retail environment is an asset.


Additional Information

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Product Marketing Specialist
description:
Norwood Sawmills is looking for an experienced Product Marketing Specialist to join our growing Marketing team. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a diverse team, growing an established, international global lifestyle brand. As the connector between marketing, sales, and product, our ideal candidate will have a wealth of experience developing go-to-market plans for launching new products, as well as a toolkit of best practices for elevating the sales and marketing of our current product portfolio.

The Product Marketing Specialist will be responsible for the pricing, promotion, and positioning of all Norwood products, ensuring accuracy, and maximizing opportunities to connect product solutions to customers. A creative strategist, the PM Specialist will create and work with vendors to develop high-quality and appealing product photography and video, catalogs, and all product-related content for Norwood’s numerous Global website properties.

If you have a proven track record of successful product launch execution and are a pro at driving sales through persuasive copy and strategic marketing, we want to meet you.

About Norwood

Norwood is an outdoor equipment lifestyle brand company and leading designer and manufacturer of portable sawmills sold throughout North America and in over 100 countries worldwide. Our mission is to empower resourceful people everywhere to build their best futures through wood and their natural environment. For more information visit www.NorwoodSawmills.com and
www.FrontierSawmills.com

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute marketing plans to support the successful launch of new products, including positioning, technical data gathering, asset development, and sales enablement
  • Develop feature and benefit copy, aligned to Norwood’s customer personas and buying journey
  • Collaborate with Product Development, providing marketing insights to support the product roadmap including market pricing, competitor data, consumer trends, etc.
  • Source video production vendors and work with them to storyboard and produce promotional and how-to/assembly videos
  • Source professional photographers and coordinate product photography shoots
  • Collaborate with website and eCommerce team to ensure products appear accurately and are optimized for online purchase
  • Develop seasonal promotional campaigns to drive sales, coordinating across the marketing team to execute across website, email, paid ads, and/or direct mail
  • Own and maintain the product catalog in print and digital formats, adding new products and updating existing content to engage, inform, and sell

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or College diploma in Marketing or related field
  • 5+ years of product marketing experience with working knowledge of product lifecycle management, specifically the new product launch process
  • Extensive experience developing marketing plans, project plans, and promotional plans
  • Ability to perform market research and distill findings into insights for use by stakeholders across the business
  • Experience working with photographers and videographers, creating briefs, coordinating shoots, and giving feedback and direction
  • Experience developing marketing collateral, including catalogs, brochures, direct mail, etc.
  • Experience developing product content for eCommerce platforms
  • B2C experience within the outdoor equipment or tools industry would be an asset
  • Technical aptitude for working with business systems and tools such as Asana, MS Excel, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment with exceptional time-management and project-management skills to meet deadlines
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task
  • Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work collaboratively in a rapidly growing global business

We thank you for your interest in our position! Only those applicants who are selected for interviews will be contacted. We are committed to providing equal opportunities for persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process, at the 'candidate's request.

title: Étudiant- Marketing (Croissance et stratégie)
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Nous pourrions vous dire que nous sommes une entreprise de télécommunication et de divertissement à la fine pointe de la technologie.  Que nous sommes constamment en évolution pour non seulement offrir ce qu’il y a de mieux à nos clients, mais aussi à nos employés; après tout ce sont eux notre plus grande force.

Description du poste

Relevant de la Directrice Forfaitisation et Stratégie de prix, tu réaliseras différents mandats d’analyse et de vigie pour la Vice-présidence marketing. Tu auras la chance de travailler en étroite collaboration avec divers intervenants internes et externes.

Voici comment tu pourras mettre à profit ce que tu as appris sur les bancs d'école:

  • Assurer une vigie concurrentielle quotidienne et la communiquer aux équipes concernées ;
  • Participer à l’analyse des stratégies de prix et recommander les changements appropriés au besoin ;
  • Analyser diverses données (résultats de différentes activités, comportement du client, résultats de ventes, etc.) ;
  • Analyser et communiquer les indicateurs clés de performance : revenus et marge par client, taux de débranchement, escomptes et rentabilité ;
  • Coordonner et aider à la réalisation de projets (lancement de nouveaux forfaits, présentations ppt, …) 
  • Participer à gérer le budget d’escomptes (promotionnel et permanent) et assurer la rentabilité des actions de commercialisation;
  • Travailler en collaboration avec plusieurs équipes multidisciplinaires.
Qualifications

Si ton profil correspond à ceci:

  • Disponible entre 15 et 37.5 heures/semaine;
  • Baccalauréat en marketing ou finance en cours d’obtention;
  • Expérience pertinente en marketing ou en analyse;
  • Démontrer des habiletés en analyse et synthèse de l’information;
  • Habileté avancée : suite Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint);
  • Esprit analytique;
  • Intérêt pour les télécommunications;
  • Posséder un bon sens de l'organisation;
  • Être très confortable avec la gestion parallèle de nombreux projets;
  • Bonne capacité à travailler sous pression;
  • Faire preuve de curiosité, de rigueur, de minutie et d’autonomie dans son travail;
  • Communication verbale/écrite efficace, grande facilité pour les relations interpersonnelles;
  • Capacité à collaborer étroitement avec les membres de l’équipe.

N'attend plus et joins toi à notre équipe!
skills: ['Travailler en collaboration avec plusieurs équipes multidisciplinaires.', 'Disponible entre 15 et 37.5 heures/semaine;', 'Nous pourrions vous dire que nous sommes une entreprise de télécommunication et de divertissement à la fine pointe de la technologie.\xa0 Que nous sommes constamment en évolution pour non seulement offrir ce qu’il y a de mieux à nos clients, mais aussi à nos employés; après tout ce sont eux notre plus grande force.']

title: Product Marketing Content Specialist - Toronto
description:
Optimy is a world-class digital solution that helps around 350 clients in over 30 countries optimize their CSR, Grants and Sponsoring activities.

With a scale-up mindset and a drive for results, we all work towards one common objective: Making an impact on the world of philanthropy through Tech!

Our client portfolio includes Capital Power, New Gold, Akebia Therapeutics, Ford Motor Company, Epcor Utilities, Fortis Alberta and many others.

Our dynamic and international team is the keystone of our success. Optimy headcount has been growing by 33% in 2021, and despite the context we all know, revenue has grown by 25%!

You’re looking to be part of a team where your ideas are valued and you see the direct impact of your work?

You want to be part of one of the fastest growing SaaS companies that helps corporations to have a positive impact on society?

Passionate about translating customers’ needs and pains narratives into simple and effective product stories, material? This is a unique opportunity to craft copy that educates and inspires existing and potential customers.

Your Mission

Working together with a global team you will hone the skills to amplify the Optimy platform positioning and communicate the benefits and functionality of our solutions and features in a practical and meaningful way.

You will be joining the team in the Toronto office, working directly with the sales and customer success team, and remotely with our marketing and product teams internationally. Prior B2B / Saas content marketing and editorial experience is essential for this role.

Key responsibilities:

  • Work with the Product team to extract informative data from market research and distill complex product value propositions into simple, easy to understand, compelling messages for potential customers
  • Develop content for products across our portfolio that includes, but not limited to, product web pages, customer success stories, infographics and solution narratives
  • Assist the Product team to develop positioning and messaging documents for each new feature
  • Act as a key internal resource and product expert capable of offering knowledge that helps lead both customers and prospects to understand the platform offerings that suit them best
  • Conceptualize and write technical and product related content for web pages, knowledge-based articles, landing pages, emails campaigns, blogs, sales decks, collateral and more
  • Proofread and edit content created by the other teams
  • Bring customer data into life through the marketing materials to inspire, engage and retain potential customers
  • Organize internal workshops to train sales on the value proposition and USPs at product level and educate on the usage of different content assets (blogs, email copies, user cases pricing and cost related content, email content, infographics, RFPs/RFIs/RFQs content, cross selling and upselling content, sales pitches)

Daily and monthly tasks:

  • Create monthly product focused blog articles to be used in nurturing and sales enablement campaigns
  • Support the sales and customer success team with email content to support prospect and customer sequences
  • Support the Digital Marketing Specialist with product focused email content to help convert cold leads
  • Conduct customer interviews and write data focused user cases
  • Create product focused comparison content around features and cost
  • Support the sales team with content to overcome sales objections
  • Support the sales team with product focused content for RFPs, RFIs and RFQs
  • Craft product focused messaging for Social Ads
  • Deliver on a timely manner on all customer success and sales product-focused requests
  • Keep an up-to-date product focused content library to be used in a multi-touch approach
  • Create different content assets to support upselling and cross-selling
  • Create data focused infographics based on customer outcomes
  • Support with relevant content product focused review sites and new features announcements
  • Collaborate with the Multimedia specialist on visual content (icons, gifs, screen recording, etc.)

Your Profile

  • You are a native English speaker
  • You have +2 years of marketing product copywriting experience in B2B Saas
  • You can write clearly and you are able to translate complex information into user-friendly content
  • You are tech savvy, flexible and are able to work on multiple, challenging projects at the same time
  • You enjoy working with stakeholders to deliver quality content
  • You work well individually while being a team player
  • Ability to work under pressure and to meet tight deadlines

The Offer :

  • A permanent contract with an evolutive fix wage
  • Health insurance
  • Working materials such as a computer
  • Even after COVID will maintain a Hybrid working policy!
  • 16 volunteering hours per year to focus on your social goals and values
  • A flexible and international work environment spreads throughout our three offices based in Brussels, Toronto and Manila (cumulatively, we speak 17 languages !)
  • A friendly atmosphere where transparency and inclusiveness is valued
  • Friday Demos - once per month we all meet in an open space Google Meet environment to connect with our peers from both offices: Canada and Belgium. We get to know our newcomers, present our achievements, share updates and challenges, and get to know each other while having some fun
  • Team-building events - twice per year we have our Team-Building events: one in summer (July) and one in winter (Christmas). It’s always a surprise and it’s always lots of fun and adventure!
  • We organize regular meet-ups to share information amongst the team members (ie. demonstration of a new feature, presentation of a customer story, etc.)

#LI-Hybrid

title: Product Analyst / Analyste de produits (Réf : 5-24E)
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Par où commencer ? Cette compagnie est tout simplement incroyable! Leurs produits, leurs équipes, leur localisation, l’ambiance de travail, les avantages, etc. tout est « numéro 1 »!

Il s’agit d’une PME a forte croissance qui est déjà en affaire aux 4 coins du monde auprès de clients prestigieux.

Ils ne recrutent pas une liste de compétences mais des personnes avant tout. Bien sûr il vaut mieux avoir le savoir faire, mais ce qui compte c’est surtout qui vous êtes.

Fondée en 2003, l’entreprise est située à Montréal, avec des bureaux localisés à Chicago, Chennai, Melbourne, Amman et Londres. Ils collaborent avec 35 % du Fortune 100 et 25 % des meilleurs établissements de l’enseignement supérieur, ce qui inclut 8 des 10 meilleures écoles de commerce au monde. L’entreprise compte des clients dans plus de 40 pays. Depuis 2014, notre client fait continuellement partie des Meilleurs lieux de travail de l’institut Great Place to Work® et s’est classée au premier rang des « Meilleurs lieux de travail au Canada » en 2021.

Description du poste

  • Concevoir des conditions/spécifications détaillées pour l’équipe de développement.
  • Créer des documents reliés aux sorties des produits.
  • Participer aux activités reliées aux conditions, en s’assurant de mettre à jour régulièrement la documentation.
  • Garder une communication rapide et claire avec les membres de l’équipe.
Qualifications

Une expérience :

  • D’au moins 3 ans en analyse de produits.
  • En rédaction de documents techniques et non-techniques (ex. conditions, matériel de formation, etc.)

D’excellentes compétences verbales et écrites afin de bien collaborer avec les parties prenantes

Une capacité :

 

  • À bien présenter l’élément à l’équipe.
  • À bien comprendre les concepts techniques.
  • À compatir avec le client et à vouloir offrir une expérience agréable pour l’utilisateur.

Une passion pour nos produits.

Une bonne connaissance de : Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Confluence, JIRA.

De bonnes compétences d’organisation : le sens des priorités, de l’organisation des documents, de la gestion du temps, du multitâche et de l’autonomie.

Un souci du détail et un bon œil pour trouver les défauts d’une solution.

 

Atouts :

  • Une expérience avec la méthodologie Agile.
  • Une capacité à apprendre rapidement.
  • Une connaissance du français et d’une autre langue.

 



Informations complémentaires

Avantages :

  • Des congés/vacances illimités.
  • Un environnement de travail flexible et hybride.
  • Une assurance maladie, dentaire et médicale.
  • Un régime d’assurance collective.
  • Une subvention pour les transports en commun (Montréal).
  • Des abonnements de gym entièrement subventionnés.
  • Un programme d’aide aux employés.
  • Un programme de dons des employés.
  • Un salon Blue une salle de jeu.

Bien sûr il vaut mieux avoir le savoir faire, mais ce qui compte c’est surtout qui vous êtes.', 'Atouts\xa0:']

title: Communication Specialist
description:
Axya is an innovative technology company with ambitious growth goals. To help us achieving our goals, we’re searching for a qualified and highly passionate Communication Specialist to work closely with the marketing communication team. From day one, this individual will contribute to the development of new communication initiatives aligned with company and client goals. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in communications, digital marketing and public relations. The Communication Specialist must be data driven, think outside the box and challenge the status quo.


At Axya, the Communication Specialist will:

  • Assist the Head of Marketing in the development and execution of short and long-term communication plans, strategies and campaigns.
  • Work with key internal role-players to brainstorm content ideas, in line with the company’s strategy and in support of various brand initiatives.
  • Prepare, in collaboration with freelancers, marketing and communications collaterals to ensure that it is consistent with the organization's brand, including website copy, one pagers, email templates, blog articles, podcasts, videos and more
  • Plan, coordinate and execute our newsletters and e-mail campaigns.
  • Reach out to influencers, media and beyond in order to arrange story placement on a national and global level as well as managing media relations and building strong relationships with journalists.
  • Participate to the elaboration, optimization and edition of the website.
  • Plan and manage events, webinars, podcasts, conferences, by identifying, assembling, and coordinating all requirements.
  • Define metrics and create reports for measuring communication initiatives success.
  • Bachelor’s degree in communications, public relations, marketing or a related field
  • Minimum of 3 years experience in a SaaS company or digital marketing agency
  • Knowledge of digital marketing, content marketing and public relations
  • Excellent writing skills with an emphasis on writing for the web and social media (SEO knowledge)
  • Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) is an asset
  • Must have strong organizational and project management skills, as well as attention to detail
  • Must be a self-starter and able to independently move projects forward, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines
  • Love to experiment and think outside of the box in a fast moving environment

Why be part of our team?

  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Group employee insurance program
  • Work at any time you want from wherever you want
  • Join a dynamic and highly collaborative team
  • Continuous training and professional development


About Axya

Axya is an innovative technology company that standardizes, automates, and centralizes the subcontracting process for buyers and suppliers in the manufacturing industry. It has developed the best technological solution for all companies that have manufacturing needs or capabilities in CNC machining, sheet metal, and welded assembly. All this to make the process easier, faster, and less expensive than the traditional method.

**Axya is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Reporting to the Director, Corporate Services, the Marketing Coordinator will help with all marketing related activities that will help build, grow, and market our company’s internal and external brand. This newly created role will build and maintain sustainable processes and systems that will position us for continued growth and innovation. This position will be based out of the Corporate Head Office in Edmonton, Alberta, with some travel to other offices and field sites as needed.

About You:

As a brand ambassador, you are passionate about business and marketing; you are creative and enjoy building things. In your role, you are extremely organized and do well with having multiple balls in the air. Details matter to you, you strive for brand consistency and content quality. You consider yourself a SEO seasoned expert and what you do not know, you will learn very quickly because you are driven to succeed. You bring fun to the workplace, you enjoy people, you communicate well, and you get others excited about projects you are working on. You are ready to grow with us and move at a pace that makes your head spin. All while having fun and trying things we have yet to even think of.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute on strategic marketing initiatives and activities that will strengthen the company’s brand.
  • Implement marketing plans that include print, media, and online content.
  • Plan, coordinate, and maintain a consistent schedule of activities and campaigns across all social media accounts in order to help support Morgan’s targeted recruitment and business development efforts.
  • Support the rebuild of the company’s website, including but not limited to technical content compilation, design, rebuild, and strategic use of SEO techniques, and analysis to bolster traffic to the site and create positive conversions.
  • Create a brand book which includes the company’s various brand stories, history, pillars, vision, purpose, logo(s), color schemes, fonts, styles, images, etc.
  • Develop internal templates, designs, and presentations for internal and external use.
  • Assist with selection and design of company swag.
  • Support the creation and editing of video and photo content.
  • Provide market research, forecasts, competitive analyses, campaign results, and trends.
  • Understand and keep abreast of industry best practices as it relates to digital marketing and advertising.
  • Maintain and build upon your knowledge of marketing, including user research, data analytics, and marketing trends.
  • Other administrative duties as assigned, including event planning and internal communications.
  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or relevant field.
  • 5 years relatable experience in marketing.
  • Familiarity with analytical tools such as Google Analytics and Google Search Console.
  • Documented success in creating targeted SEO-friendly online content.
  • Strong working knowledge of scheduling tools for social media such as Hootsuite.
  • Possesses strong communication, research, presentation, and creativity.
  • Thrives on delivering exciting campaigns and content.
  • Adapts to a changing workload and requirements.
  • Highly organized and able to work on multiple, competing priorities at any one time.
  • Impeccable written and verbal communication skills with a high attention to detail.
  • Comfortable and competent communicating with all levels within the organization.

Our Values:

  • We are safe.
  • We operate with integrity.
  • We work hard.
  • We always find a better way.
  • We never give up.

We are Morgan.

Our Purpose:

We build trust.

Benefits commence immediately upon starting which include:

  • Extended Health Care
  • Dental Care
  • Life Insurance
  • Accident and Serious Injury
  • Long Term Disability
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Telehealth Services
  • Health Spending Account

title: Partnership Marketing Specialist, Destinations
description:
Company Description

Navigatr Group is a privately held company that invests in travel companies that elevate the customer experience and drive innovation. Our expansive and growing group of brands empowers seamless access to a comprehensive range of luxury travel options and services globally with over $1 billion transactions annually. Navigatr Group’s goal is to create a more purposeful travel industry through its strategic investment, best-in-class services and philanthropy.

Job Description

Reporting to the Director, Partnership Marketing, the Partnership Marketing Specialist, Destinations will be responsible for designing, proposing, and implementing coop & partnership marketing strategies that promote revenue growth generated through our network of companies. 

This is a hybrid role with 70% of your time dedicated to strategically planning, negotiating, securing and nurturing coop partnerships and 30% of your time you will be focused on implementing and executing the coop plans with the support of the marketing team. 

This will include but not be limited to:

  • Develop coop programs for the Navigatr network of companies
  • Negotiating and securing coop contracts, working in close partnership with the Procurement team, Supplier Relations team.
  • Drive new opportunities through brand partnerships
  • Working towards revenue targets, develop, support on the execution of, and maintain marketing plans and campaigns
  • Financial and invoice management
  • Report KPIs to vendors and to our network of partners

This requires an extremely talented and flexible individual who has a roll up their sleeves attitude and is comfortable with a hands-on position. They have the ability to relate and build successful relationships with a wide range of stakeholders, use creative marketing and analytics to influence, is a champion of the customer experience and of successfully driving and positioning brands.  

Key Accountabilities:

  • Assist in the development of a coop strategic marketing plan using market research, competitive analysis, pricing, customer behavioural data and engagement, current marketing conditions, sales activities and business planning
  • Develop a thorough understanding of the opportunities with our group of brands in order to drive revenue and audience engagement, identify and define the most efficient ways to attain coop revenue
  • Cross functional partnering with Procurement, Product, L&D, Advisor Relations and Sales to curate the coop experience and implement and optimize the right mix of touch points, including pre sales ‘dreaming’, initial sales process, mid-trip communications and post trip follow-ups.
  • Drive new business opportunities by sourcing, pitching brand partnerships, FAMs and marketing alliances
  • Develop, manage and support on the execution of the coop marketing advertising and promotional activities within the agreed marketing budget, including product presentations and educational webinars
  • Liaise and continually develop relationships with relevant national tourism board partners and other key players in travel industry
  • Collaborate with both inside and outside sales representatives to identify and market opportunities and trends, and to develop promotional programs to improve coop campaigns and increase sales at key times
  • Monitor, review and report on all coop marketing activity, ROI and against KPI’s. Develop recommendations and /or additional coop marketing initiatives that drive improvement
  • Attend relevant and industry events and trade shows
Qualifications

  • 5 years’ experience as Partnership or Account Manager or equivalent industry experience
  • Requires experience designing and executing marketing strategies, communications campaigns and programs delivering highly customized, targeted consumer offers
  • Travel industry experience
  • Proven experience identifying opportunities and driving strategic partnerships and affiliations
  • Experience with web analytics, online insights, segmentation and behavioral trends
  • Intimate understanding of traditional, digital and emerging marketing channels
  • Experience developing business plans for new initiatives including business case / rationale development and launch marketing plans
  • Strong analytical and project management skills to forecast and identify trends and challenges
  • Ability to collaborate and connect effectively with multiple departments, partners and customers
  • Superior communication, writing and editing skills and ability to demonstrate versatility in writing formats, including online
  • An experienced communicator to senior level execs; you can confidently and eloquently instill the business value of your marketing strategies
  • Budget-management skills and proficiency
  • Ability to think both strategically and tactically
  • Ability to work autonomously in an agile, fast paced, entrepreneurial environment with a track record of taking ownership and driving results
  • Must be highly organized and able to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to set priorities based on alignment with business goals and strategic direction, define timelines and deliver to commitments
  • Some travel may be required


Additional Information

We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please advise us when completing your application.

title: Paid Marketing Specialist (Pay Per Click Advertising)
description:
Paid Marketing Specialist (SEM)

This is a dream role designed specifically for a proven manager of pay per click platforms such as Google Adwords who is looking to take his/her career to the next level of performance and pay. If you have worked with Google PPC, Bing PPC, Youtube Ads, Taboola or other paid marketing platforms, that is a bonus but you must “crush it” on Google.

If you have what it takes, you'll join a team of passionate, work-hard-play-hard professionals in the leading company in natural osteoporosis treatments. Our products are backed by clinical studies - so they dramatically and measurably improve human health.

You'll also work alongside, and learn from, top marketing professionals that have helped grow our company from 25 people to over 100 people in three short years while tripling revenue.



This job might be for you if you’ve got….

  • 3 to 5+ years experience in PPC marketing.
  • An intimate knowledge of managing and optimizing paid search campaigns for Google Ads and Microsoft Ads.
  • Good knowledge of programmatic display platforms such as Google Display, Microsoft Audience, AdRoll and Taboola.
  • A good knowledge of managing Youtube Ad campaigns from inception to completion is highly beneficial.
  • A proven track record of overseeing profitable SEM campaigns.
  • Experience building timely reports and overseeing the delivery of such reports while ensuring tracking, tagging, attribution is demonstrated and accurate.
  • Experience performing thorough Keyword research and planning and implementing suitable bid and budget suggestions.
  • Ability to Identify general opportunities in an account to help to optimize and scale all SEM campaigns.
  • A resume that demonstrates your mastery of SEM campaign creation and optimization, market research and data analysis and reporting.
  • An ability to recommend actionable insights based on campaign insights.
  • A friendly way of collaborating cross functionally with various stakeholders .

This job will give you ALL the feels….

At AlgaeCal, we’re driven by a single idea. To end the fear of bone loss. In the United States, an estimated 54 million people have crumbling bones. And they’re scared. Scared of fractures. Scared of breaks. And, most of all, scared of losing their independence.

The good news? AlgaeCal has the world’s only clinically-backed natural solution to this problem. We give hope to thousands of frightened people. If that excites you, you’ll find no better place to continue your career than at AlgaeCal.



How to apply

So, do you have what it takes to become the next member of team AlgaeCal?

Job opportunities like this don’t come along often, and we’ve got a lot to offer our successful applicants. So, to make sure our future Paid Marketing Specialist is the real-deal, will be a great fit, and will thrive at AlgaeCal, we ask a little more than your run-of-the-mill job application:

If this sounds like a position for you, please respond to this advertisement with your resume and cover letter. Please, read carefully:

1. Write a cover letter addressing:

  1. Why you're the best Paid Marketing Specialist for this role. Give quantifiable examples of related achievements.
  2. Describe why you fit perfectly with our values. Read them: here
  3. What's the toughest challenge you’ve ever overcome in your life? How did you overcome it?
  4. What are the last three books you’ve read?
  5. What do you do for fun?

2. Explain what you’re doing now for a job:

  1. If you don’t have one, explain why.
  2. If you have one, explain why you’re looking elsewhere.

3. Upload your cover letter and resume:

  1. Ensure that your cover letter and resume are saved and sent as one file.

Yes, our hiring process is challenging, but it’s our way of selecting the best--and your way of ensuring your AlgaeCal teammates are tops.

Click the “Apply Now” button on this page and upload your cover letter and resume.

***Note: Please include your cover letter WITH your resume in one document.

Applications without a cover letter will not be read!

We are looking to hire as soon as we find the right person, so act quickly and you can also expect a prompt response.

title: Technical Sales/Business Development Associate (FT)
description:
Job description

Mafna Air Technologies Inc. is one of the leaders in providing custom Air Handling Solutions and HVAC Equipment to it's vast client base across the US, Canada and overseas. Over the past 20 years, Mafna has provided solutions to a number of industries and Government Agencies including Fortune 500 Companies.

Join the dynamic team of one of the leading Custom Built Central Air Conditioning and Refrigeration Equipment Manufacturers.

As part of our growing team, we are seeking full time permanent Technical Sales Associates.

Job Details: 
  • The successful candidates will be the ones who have skills and desire to develop business through Sales & Marketing in US /Canada and Overseas. 
  • You should have knowledge of the construction industry, aptitude for learning engineering features of equipment and be able to read drawings and blue prints, have attention to detail and be able to work well with people.
  • You should be comfortable in interacting with Company agents, Consulting engineers, contractors, facility owners and Architects.
  • You should also be able to travel to US, have valid passport and Ontario driving license and car, be willing to relocate to closer to the work place and be able to start within a short time.
  • You should be well versed in effective written and oral communication along with skills in email / social media marketing and be able to research and gather leads, prospects, opportunities, industry trend using various online tools and methods.

Required Education: Diploma/Certificate.

Salary: Based on Experience and job related skills.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent.
