title: Data Analyst, Marketing Acquisition (Remote)
description:
Data Analyst, Marketing Acquisition (Remote - Canada) 

 

It turns out… unicorns are real! In fact, FreshBooks just became one after raising our valuation to more than $1 billion. And ever since launching in 2003, we’ve been on a steady incline towards one goal: Building easy-to-use accounting software for small business owners. It’s the goal that’s driven us to expand into five offices, serving customers in over 160 countries. And it’s the goal we’d love for you to be a part of as a member of our global team as we continue our journey.

Known for extraordinary product and customer service experiences and based in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries, with offices in the U.S., Netherlands and Croatia.

The Opportunity – Data Analyst, Marketing Acquisition

Location:Canada, Remote

Department:Data & Analytics

The Data Analyst will enable FreshBooks reporting and help to derive insights from website, event, campaign and customer web and product interaction data to improve the volume and quality of acquired trailers, determine growth opportunities, understand the customer journey and major drop-offs.

The right person for the job will love to solve a problem and have a knack for translating data into insight and presenting that information to stakeholders. You will be collaborating with managers and a team that includes other analysts, data scientists, marketers, financial analysts, and developers all working together to drive growth at FreshBooks.

Specifically in this position you will:
  • Complete ad-hoc / deep-dive analyses by translating raw data into useable information 
  • Build dashboards for core performance metrics/monitor KPI’s
  • Channel level reporting on trends in acquisition performance
  • Support with A/B testing for campaign treatments
  • Content / Webpage reviews and analyses
  • Work independently & with engineering to ensure the integrity of data flows / transfers
  • Monitor changes in usage behaviours (organically and due to marketing)
  • Performance evaluations of various customer segments
  • Consult with internal clients to gather requirements, scope & execute
  • Complex, long-term analyses on visitor trends and performance impacts
  • Communicate results and recommended analyses/approaches to stakeholders
We thinkyou'llbe an amazing fit for this position if your application can demonstrate:
  • Minimum 2-3 years in data analytics/business intelligence
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL is required
  • Google Tag Manager experience is an asset
  • Knowledge of Google Analytics data, and/or similar web analytics tools
  • Strong knowledge of one or more visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau etc.
  • Quantitative background with strong analytical skills
  • Experience working with relational databases
  • Familiarity with the marketing campaign and/or web data is preferred 
  • Python knowledge is an asset
 

Why Join Us

We're a motivated bunch, with our eyes laser-focused on shipping extraordinary experiences to businesses. You will be surrounded by hardworking team members who share a common vision for what an amazing software company could be, and have the opportunity to help build an elite one, right here in downtown Toronto.

Apply Now

Have we got your attention? Submit your application today and a member of our recruitment team will be in touch with you shortly!

FreshBooks is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, religion, race, mental disability, sexual orientation, age, or any other status. All applicants are considered based on their qualifications and merits. At FreshBooks, we inspire an environment of mutual respect and we believe diversity and inclusion are crucial to our success.

FreshBooks provides employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us at phone 416-780-2700 and/or accessibility@freshbooks.com.

title: Product Marketing Specialist – Agricultural Products
description:
We are growing our Product Marketing team to align with the expansion of our product portfolio, market segments, and growth of our business. We are seeking a Product Marketing Specialist to lead our Agricultural Equipment portfolio as a subject matter expert and owner of the value proposition.

Brandt manufactures and distributes a variety of grain handling and tillage products that support farm operations. As part of the Product Strategy team, this role will lead our go-to-market efforts for product lines including:

  • Grain Augers and Conveyors
  • Grain Carts
  • Land Rollers, Heavy Harrows, and High-Speed Discs

The Brandt Product Marketing team is responsible for being the voice of the customer internally enabling us to bring new products to market through differentiated messaging, collateral, sales enablement, customer engagement, and cross-functional marketing activation. You are a compelling storyteller and creative thinker, able to transform complex needs and solutions into unique messaging, while also having a passion for collaboration and go-to-market initiatives.

You will work closely with our Product Planning and Engineering teams to build a differentiated and compelling product offering that solves critical pain points for our customers. You will ensure that the technical message is clear for new Agricultural Equipment products and work with the Sales team and Marketing team to present the value and benefits to potential customers.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Develop product messaging and positioning documents that serve as the foundation for internal and external sales assets, marketing campaigns, web copy, creative briefs, and presentations.
  • Serve as the product advocate and thought partner to the account management, creative services, digital, and multimedia teams in the development and execution of marketing materials that align with overall business strategies.
  • Collaborate closely with the Advertising Account team to guide and develop the ideal content and positioning for campaigns. Ensure product narratives resonate with our target customer and speak to their challenges and pain points.
  • Enable our Sales team to position products in the market through training materials that solidify our value proposition.
  • Report to senior leadership, business unit leaders, sales and other stakeholders on marketing opportunities and performance.
  • Conduct quantitative and qualitative research to better understand customer behaviors, market insights, and competitive intelligence to unlock insights and translating customer needs into opportunities for product strategy.
  • Identify market opportunities and act as the primary thought-leader for the products you support, including presenting to internal stakeholders and external audiences.
  • Demonstrated experience in industry-relevant marketing that includes messaging and positioning, competitive analysis, product launch management, GTM strategy and sales tool development, leveraging customer and market insights to inform product roadmap, and more.
  • The ability to collaborate in the development of creative brand and marketing strategies.
  • Ability to influence and work cross-functionally to drive major initiatives and decisions.
  • Bias for action, ability to adapt, and enthusiasm for a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong project management skills and attention to detail.
  • Passion for understanding and solving customer problems.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant discipline.
  • 2 years in a Marketing, product development, or account management role.
  • Industry knowledge is an asset.

Position to be based in either our Regina (Head Office), Saskatoon, Edmonton (Nisku), or Calgary office location.

title: Analyst Market Parameters
description:
Analyst Market Parameters 
Primary Location: CA-QC-Montreal Island-Montreal  
 
Employee Status: Regular  
 
Schedule: Full-time  
  
 

A career on the Market Parameters team of the Operations, Financial Markets and Payments sector at National Bank is an opportunity to use your expertise to advance and execute the business lines’ strategy. The Analyst position will let you live your ambitions in an environment that values partnership and empowerment. You will play a role in the Bank's transformation by being involved in various processes related to market data and benchmarking. 

 

Your duties: 

  • Configure, manage, analyze and maintain various types of market data
  • Ensure data quality in transaction systems and databases on a daily basis
  • Be actively involved in different initiatives and projects of varied scope
  • Interact with numerous Bank sectors
  • Acquire extensive expertise in financial instruments and internal systems
  • Actively participate in improving our processes and our transformation

 

You have the flexibility of working remotely. The position reports to the Manager, Operations Financial Markets. You will work daily with a team of experts.
Your onboarding includes on-the-job training to help you master your role and become familiar with our products and technologies. You'll also have access to colleagues with a wide range of expertise, experience and backgrounds to enrich all aspects of your development. 
 

 

Required skills: 

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field OR university certificate and relevant experience OR any other relevant combination 
  • Excellent knowledge of financial instruments (equities, options, obligations, etc.) and derivatives
  • Diligence, autonomy and advanced analytical skills
  • Bilingualism, both spoken and written (English and French), essential

 

Preferred skills: 

  • Knowledge of Excel and Bloomberg programming, an asset
  • Experience in data management software (e.g., SmartCo), an asset

 

Your benefits

Upon hiring, you’ll be eligible for a wide range of benefits.  In addition to competitive compensation, we offer a flexible benefits program for you and your family:

  • Health and wellness program, including many benefits
  • Flexible group insurance
  • Defined benefit pension plan
  • Employee Share Ownership Plan
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Preferential banking services
  • Community involvement program
  • Telemedicine
  • Virtual sleep clinic

 

These are just some of the many benefits we offer.  We’ve introduced a number of additional measures to ensure your health, safety, and wellbeing during the pandemic. 

 

People first

We’re a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people.   Our mission is to have a positive impact on people’s lives.

Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us,  and inclusivity is central to our commitments.  We offer a barrier-free workplace that’s accessible to all employees. 

We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible.  If you require accommodation, feel free to let us know during our initial conversations.

We welcome all candidates! What can you bring to our team?

Are you ready to live your ambitions?

 
Job field: Operations
Job Posting: May 4, 2022
Unposting Date: May 19, 2022
Work Postal Code: H3B5G2 
Job Number: OPE00311

title: Marketing Operations Specialist
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Varicent is the industry leader in developing Sales Performance Management (SPM) software, enabling businesses worldwide to Plan, Operate and Pay effectively to drive sales performance and growth.

A named Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Sales Performance Management seven times in a row, Varicent was founded in 2005 when we pioneered sales performance management software. Evolving quickly to become the fastest growing software company in North America according to Deloitte’s Fast 50™ in 2010, Varicent was acquired by IBM in 2012 and has since been re-founded as an independent global business serving mid-size and enterprise clients with our full suite of solutions to assist in smarter territory and quota planning, efficient lead to revenue operations, and the fastest and most flexible way to pay sellers accurately and on-time. We are looking for talented, driven people that can make an impact across our organization.

The Marketing Operations Specialist will work closely with our Marketing team members, BDR and the RevOps team to assist in driving marketing impact while increasing operational efficiencies. You will support the management of our MarTech stack by leveraging best practices and developing end to end processes to supporting demand generation programs, web, and social initiatives.

Varicent is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process please email accomodations@varicent.com

Varicent is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. By applying for a position at Varicent and/or by using this portal, you declare and confirm that you have read and agree to our Job Applicant Privacy Notice and that the information provided by you as part of your application is true and complete and includes no misrepresentation or material omission of fact</section>

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Overview:

Tree of Life Canada ULC is an Employer who strives to provide an inclusive work environment that involves everyone and embraces the diverse talent of its people. We are committed to meeting the needs of persons with disabilities. If selected for an interview, we will be happy to work with you to ensure your interview is accessible and accommodation is provided. When your interview is being scheduled, please advise the Recruiter of how we might be able to support your participation.

Primary Responsibilities:

The overall focus is to support the marketing department in analytical and administrative areas. Main areas of focus are data retrieval and tracking of sales, margin and inventory for management and product maintenance. This position also interacts directly with Tree of Life Sales, Supply Chain, Operations, IT and Finance teams. As with all positions at Tree of Life Canada we expect that all actions will be consistent with Tree of Life Canadaâ€™s Mission, Vision and Values.

Essential Functions:

â€¢ Support the Team Lead and Brand Development managers with administrative functions required for the brands they manage, including participating in brand reviews and other client meetings
â€¢ Liaison with sales & supply chain teams to monitor fill rate reports, out of stocks, compliance charges, reduction reports and fines.
â€¢ Provide strategic forecasts, monitor stock levels, distribution points and sell through rates pre, post and during promotions. Recommend required corrections.
â€¢ Work with brand managers & supply chain to ensure product availability and on time delivery.
â€¢ Prepare and distribute all reports weekly and monthly for management assessment.
â€¢ Enter and track client specific monthly MCBs.
â€¢ Work with brand manager to prepare and complete retail trade promotions, launch presentations, sell sheets and sample distribution in a timely fashion.
â€¢ Maintain current Marketing information on Intranet.
â€¢ Assist in the preparation, and publication of price increase with proper supportive documentation.
â€¢ Maintain Product data information on the AS400 as it relates to new item setup, pricing, marketing and nutritional information, stewardship, attributes, allergens, ecology, trade deals, vendor deals and high-resolution photos.
â€¢ Provide administrative support to the Marketing Director.
â€¢ Approach all internal and external tasks, communication and transactions according to our Purpose and Core Values.
â€¢ Maintain good attendance, safe work practices and maintain safeguards of confidential company information.
â€¢ Other duties and special projects as requested.

Minimum Requirements, Qualifications, Additional Skills, Aptitude:

â€¢ University or College degree in business/marketing preferred.
â€¢ Minimum of three (3) years in an administration role preferably with experience in data analysis.
â€¢ You are PROFICIENT in MS Office with high-level proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint. Knowledge of AS400 and COGNOS also preferred.
â€¢ You have superior analytical skills and project management skills.
â€¢ You love to COMMUNICATE! and your skills are epic in both oral and written, fluent in English.
â€¢ Must be results-driven, resourceful and well ORGANIZED with an ability to work on multiple projects and strict deadlines with minimal supervision.
â€¢ You are incredibly PROACTIVE, service oriented with a sense of urgency.
â€¢ Ability to work well under pressure.
â€¢ Your INTERPERSONAL ABILITIES are excellent; you have a natural ability to get along with diverse personalities and develop strong business relationships; you of course are tactful, mature, and flexible. And most definitely you must have good reasoning abilities and sound judgment.
â€¢ Your ENERGY level is through the roof, very comfortable performing multifaceted projects in conjunction with day-to-day activities.
â€¢ Must keep all personnel and department matters confidential.

title: Marketing Specialist / Spécialiste du marketing
description:
At Brother, we live and breathe the spirit of “at your side” by offering our people careers where they can learn, grow and thrive. And with over 100 years of experience making high-quality printers, labellers, scanners, sewing, embroidery, and quilting machines, we’re a rock-solid company with a reputation for being great people delivering a superior customer experience.

Are you passionate about designing and implementing impactful marketing campaigns to support the company’s business goals? Do you excel in handling and leading different projects simultaneously, being able to delegate tasks and making sure that everything is on track? Are you a go-getter, initiative taker on projects and not afraid to ask questions? If yes, the Marketing Specialist opportunity at Brother could be for you!

What you'd be doing: 
Reporting to the Manager, Omni-channel Marketing, the Marketing Specialist will possess extensive knowledge of marketing strategies and tactics in both traditional and digital channels and should be able to deliver customer-focused, timely, insight driven by performance-based strategies, communications, and solutions, in support of key strategic initiatives and sales objectives. 

Some key responsibilities:
•    Proactively, autonomously support Manager Omni-channel, Marketing in all major marketing projects, by:
o    Collaborating in the development of product positioning and support in translating features into benefits
o    Leading content creation and ensuring messages are supportive of and consistent with marketing strategies
o    Establishing and maintaining timelines, gathering pertinent information, getting stakeholder feedback, ensuring project execution, follow-ups and on-time delivery
•    Inquire and understand the overall corporate strategies, have the ability to connect them to marketing initiatives and ensure that deliverables are aligned with the strategic vision
•    Lead and own specific marketing initiatives by leveraging analytic data (GA) and research to make strategic recommendations and coordinating the development and deployment of the initiative
•    Ability to understand key campaign metrics/KPIs and analyzing marketing tactics/activities against goals to improve future campaigns (A/B test and learn strategies)
•    Projects vary from digital marketing campaigns (organic and paid), emails campaigns, SEO/SEM optimization, digital content development to print collaterals, cartons, brochures, spec sheets, etc. and events coordination.

What we look for:
•    5+ years’ experience in similar position 
•    Marketing qualification: certification or bachelor
•    Extremely flexible in a fast-paced and driven environment with multiple aggressive deadlines
•    Accountable professional with a strong aptitude in teamwork 
•    Effective, experienced communicator, bilingual in French and English

What you need to know about Brother:
•    Our shared values are Inclusion, Collaboration, Customer Centricity and Social Responsibility
•    We’re an open and honest group of people that foster a challenging spirit in all that we do
•    "At your side" is more than a slogan; it’s our purpose and we do our best to fulfill it every day
•    We’re great people who work hard, play hard and look out for each other because we’re a team – it’s that simple!

What Brother has to offer:
•    We're committed to achieving shared success and we provide opportunities for you to develop through experience, training and learning via Brother University
•    RRSP program – we match up to 4% base salary per year after your first year of enrollment
•    Insurance package that cares for you as much as we do
•    Wellness subsidy to support your wellness goals
•    Recognition Awards Program: we give and receive kudos through our social recognition program, where you accumulate points towards your preferred reward
•    Friends and Family discount on Brother products saves you, your friends and family money on the things you need
•    Hybrid work model (at home/in the office) provides greater balance in supporting our Brother Community and team spirit

Bring your positive attitude and great personality and apply today to become our next Marketing Specialist! #joinbrothercanada #LI-Hybrid

At Brother Canada, we strive to provide an environment where everyone feels valued by respecting individual differences and welcoming diverse life and work styles. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate or make employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Chez Brother, nous incarnons et respirons l'esprit « At your side » en offrant à nos employés des carrières où ils peuvent apprendre, grandir et s'épanouir. Et avec plus de 100 ans d'expérience dans la fabrication d’imprimantes, d’étiqueteuses, de scanners et de machines à coudre, à broder et de courtepointe de qualité supérieure, nous sommes une entreprise solide comme le roc et nous avons la réputation d'être des gens formidables qui offrent une expérience client supérieure.

Vous êtes passionné par la conception et la mise en œuvre de campagnes de marketing percutantes pour soutenir les objectifs commerciaux de l'entreprise? Vous excellez dans la gestion et la direction de différents projets simultanément, vous êtes capable de déléguer des tâches et vous vous assurez que tout est sur la bonne voie? Vous êtes un fonceur, vous prenez des initiatives sur les projets et vous n'avez pas peur de poser des questions? Si oui, l'opportunité de spécialiste du marketing chez Brother pourrait être pour vous!

Voici ce que vous ferez: 
Sous la responsabilité du gestionnaire du marketing omnicanal, le spécialiste du marketing possède une connaissance approfondie des stratégies et tactiques de marketing sur les canaux traditionnels et numériques. Il doit être en mesure de fournir des stratégies, des communications et des solutions axées sur le client, opportunes et fondées sur la performance, en soutien aux initiatives stratégiques clés et aux objectifs de vente. 

Principales responsabilités:
•    Soutenir de manière proactive et autonome le gestionnaire du marketing omnicanal dans tous les grands projets de marketing, comme suit :
o    Collaborer au développement du positionnement des produits et aider à traduire les caractéristiques en avantages
o    Diriger la création de contenu et s'assurer que les messages supportent et sont conformes aux stratégies de marketing
o    Définir et respecter les échéanciers, recueillir les informations pertinentes, obtenir les commentaires des parties prenantes, assurer l’exécution des projets, le suivi et la livraison à temps.
•    S'informer et comprendre les stratégies globales de l'entreprise, avoir la capacité de les relier aux initiatives de marketing et veiller à ce que les produits livrables soient alignés sur la vision stratégique
•    Diriger et prendre en charge des initiatives de marketing spécifiques en s'appuyant sur des données analytiques et des recherches pour formuler des recommandations stratégiques et coordonner le développement et le déploiement de l'initiative
•    Capacité à comprendre les paramètres et les indicateurs de performance clés des campagnes et à analyser les tactiques/activités de marketing par rapport aux objectifs afin d'améliorer les futures campagnes (stratégies de test A/B et d'apprentissage)
•    Les projets varient des campagnes de marketing numérique (organique et payant) aux campagnes par courriel, en passant par l'optimisation SEO/SEM, le développement de contenu numérique, la production de documents imprimés (boîtes, brochures, fiches techniques, etc.) et la coordination d'événements.

Qualifications requises pour le poste:
•    5 ans et + d'expérience dans un poste similaire 
•    Qualification en marketing : certification ou baccalauréat
•    Extrêmement flexible dans un environnement dynamique et au rythme rapide avec plusieurs échéanciers agressifs
•    Professionnel responsable ayant une forte aptitude au travail en équipe 
•    Communicateur efficace et expérimenté, bilingue en français et en anglais

Ce que vous devez savoir au sujet de Brother:
•    Nos valeurs communes sont l'inclusion, la collaboration, l'orientation client et la responsabilité sociale.
•    Nous sommes un groupe de personnes ouvertes et honnêtes qui cultivent le goût du défi dans tout ce que nous faisons.
•    « At your side » est plus qu'un slogan; c'est notre objectif et nous faisons de notre mieux pour l'atteindre chaque jour.
•    Nous sommes des gens formidables qui travaillent fort, associent sérieux et plaisir et s’entraident parce que nous sommes une équipe– c’est aussi simple que cela!

Ce que Brother a à offrir:
•    Nous nous engageons à parvenir au succès commun et nous vous offrons des opportunités de vous développer par l'expérience la formation et l’apprentissage avec l'Université Brother
•    Programme REER – nous versons une contribution de contrepartie allant jusqu'à 4 % du salaire de base par an après votre première année d’emploi
•    Un ensemble d’assurance qui se soucie de vous autant que nous
•    Subvention de bien-être pour soutenir vos objectifs de bien-être
•    Programme de reconnaissance : nous donnons et recevons des félicitations par le biais de notre programme de reconnaissance sociale, dans le cadre duquel vous accumulez des points pour le récompense de votre choix
•    Des rabais accordés aux amis et à la famille sur les produits Brother vous permettent, à vous ainsi qu'à vos amis et à votre famille d'économiser de l'argent sur les articles dont vous avez besoin
•    Le modèle de travail hybride (à domicile/au bureau) offre un meilleur équilibre pour soutenir notre communauté Brother et l'esprit d'équipe

Apportez votre attitude positive et votre belle personnalité et appliquez aujourd’hui pour devenir notre prochain spécialiste du marketing! #Brothercanadarecrute #LI-Hybrid

Chez Brother Canada, nous nous efforçons d'offrir un environnement où chacun se sent valorisé en respectant les différences individuelles et en accueillant des styles de vie et de travail différents. Nous sommes un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l'égalité des chances et nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination et ne prenons aucune décision d'embauche sur la base de la race, de la couleur, de la religion, du sexe, du handicap ou de toute autre caractéristique protégée.

title: Senior Associate, Product Marketing
description:
Job Description:

IGM Financial Inc. is one of Canada's leading diversified wealth and asset management companies with approximately $271 billion in total assets under managements. The company provides a broad range of financial planning and investment management services to help more than two million Canadians meet their financial goals. Its activities are carried out principally through IG Wealth Management, Mackenzie Investments and Investment Planning Counsel.

 

Under IGM Financialâ€™s unique business model based on leading brands and multi-channel distribution strategy is Mackenzie Investments, founded in 1967.   Mackenzie Investments is a holistic asset-management partner for thousands of Canadian financial advisors and the investors they support.  

 

At Mackenzie Investments You Can Build Your Career with Confidence.

 

We have a vision and a strategy that will challenge the way business in this industry is done and help Canadians be successful in the ways that mean the most to them. As part of our team, you will do some of your best work, develop some of your most valuable skills and give back in ways that make a difference in the lives of Canadians.   We are proud to be recognized as one of Greater Torontoâ€™s Top Employers (2022) by Mediacorp Canada Inc. for empowering our employees with the tools to thrive while working remotely, while also providing resources to ensure physical and mental wellness were put front and centre.

 

Join an unstoppable team that is embedded in continuous learning, understanding, and knowledge sharing. You will thrive in our supportive environment where you can indulge your curiosity to learn, while receiving the feedback you need to refine your skills and abilities. We are dedicated to offering a hybrid work environment when applicable.

 

Mackenzie Investments is a diverse workplace committed to doing business inclusively - this starts with having a representative workforce! We encourage applications from all qualified candidates that represent the diversity present across Canada â€“ including racialized persons, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, 2SLGBTQIA+ community, gender diverse and neurodiverse individuals, as well as all who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.

 

Creativity.   Strategy.   Nimbleness. Team.   Itâ€™s what powers us and sets us apart. With transformational leadership and the development of a truly innovative and integrated Marketing organization, itâ€™s an exciting time to be in Marketing at Mackenzie!  Weâ€™re building deeper client relationships, leveraging client insights, innovative media and engaging content via digital and social growth channels to build a fresh marketing approach that differentiates us from traditional investment marketing.   This role is an incredible opportunity to have significant, transformational impact on the organization and business.

 

The Role

The Product Marketing Team plays a pivotal role at Mackenzie by leading the development of effective Marketing plans and strategies that are aligned with its corporate goals, objectives, and strategies.

 

This role will require an organized, proactive individual who is able to multi-task. The following are select key responsibilities:

  • Support the execution of the strategic marketing plans for multi-channel and multi-segment initiatives
  • Provide ongoing management of integrated marketing initiatives
  • Oversee and manage relevant webpages
  • Coordinate the production of product and event support materials
  • Coordinate approvals and feedback from cross-functional stakeholders
  • Build and manage close relationships with key business partners, both inside and outside of marketing, to understand their strategies and priorities
  • Support efforts to better understand and improve the experience and resources for advisors and investors
  • Other duties as they pertain to  marketing and brand initiatives

 

Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of Marketing and/or Communications experience
  • Undergraduate degree with an emphasis in marketing, business or communications preferred
  • Asset Management industry experience with ETF and Mutual fund knowledge preferred
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Highly organized with keen attention to detail
  • Strong multi-tasking and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Collaborative work ethic
  • Highly motivated individual with willingness to take initiative
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Advanced PC skills, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Successful completion of Canadian Securities Course is an asset
  • Knowledge of Mackenzie's products, policies and procedures including familiarity with marketing practices

 

Please visit our career page by clicking on the following link: https://www.mackenzieinvestments.com/en/careers

 

Apply by April 18th,2022

 

We thank all applicants for their interest in Mackenzie Investments; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Mackenzie Investments is an accessible employer committed to providing a barrier free recruitment experience. If you require an accommodation or this information in an alternate format at any stage of the recruitment process, please reach out to the Talent Acquisition team who will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Sales Analyst
description:
Company Description

WE ARE SGS – THE WORLD’S LEADING TESTING, INSPECTION AND CERTIFICATION COMPANY. WE ARE RECOGNIZED AS THE GLOBAL BENCHMARK FOR QUALITY AND INTEGRITY. OUR 89,000 EMPLOYEES OPERATE A NETWORK OF 2,600 OFFICES AND LABORATORIES, WORKING TOGETHER TO ENABLE A BETTER, SAFER AND MORE INTERCONNECTED WORLD. 

Job Description

  • The primary role of this position is to provide analytical support for the management of the sales pipeline and business development team.
  • Sales Analyst is responsible for arranging detailed and industry specific sales reporting, data analysis, CRM reporting, training and setup and other sales-oriented projects as required. The sales analyst creates sales reports for management staff and can use the data from reports to create sales forecasts and strategies.
  • The sales analyst analyzes sales performance in light of sales goals and identifies areas of weakness the organization can address to improve sales.
  • Create, update and distribute Sales Reports and Dashboards
  • Regularly provide sales analytics to Sales Team and Management
  • Improve efficiencies in CRM systems and processes with IT
  • Manage the sales management process, lead sales review/performance meetings, and workshops
  • Measure and communicate Sales KPI’s  individuals and teams accountable for commitments and goals
  •  Support Business Development Leadership, submit updates, and report shortfalls/growth
  • Assist Marketing initiatives including Campaigns, Tradeshows, advertising, and merchandising

 

Qualifications

  • Degree in Business or related field
  • 2 years of experience with CRM systems
  • A solid knowledge base of the sales process and marketing needs in the testing industry
  • Organized professional with strong communications skills, written and verbal
  • Bachelor's degree in Business or related field preferred


Additional Information

SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process.  Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings should be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Analyst, Ad Monetization
description:
About Scopely:

Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Scrabble® GO, MARVEL Strike Force, Star Trek™ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes™ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival™, YAHTZEE® With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune®: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company’s ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’ and #2 on Deloitte’s ‘Technology Fast 500’ as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people’s lives. Scopely has global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona, Boulder, Dublin (DIGIT game studio), London and Tokyo, with additional studios in seven countries across four continents. For more information, visit scopely.com.


Do you get excited by finding ways to increase revenue? Do you love playing games and finding ways to creatively improve how games make money through advertising? Combine your creative chops, with playing games, and data optimization, and become an industry leader by putting your stamp on the future of social and mobile gaming!


What you will do:

We are looking for a mobile ads operations and revenue analyst to help us set up advertising campaigns and report/analyze revenue trends. Day-to-day functions include:


  1. Building and trafficking mobile ad network demand and troubleshooting issues/challenges as they surface
  2. Summarize revenue reporting daily for the business and key members of management including performing revenue analytics and metrics to understand key drivers
  3. Analyze daily traffic data within our system and report discrepancies or opportunities
  4. Support the revenue optimization team in documenting, tracking and reviewing monetization and promotional campaigns for our games
  5. Research the latest trends in mobile gaming, advertising, identify opportunities and improvements on existing products and communicate best practices to product teams.


If you're great with people, insanely detail-oriented, a creative problem solver, and eager to learn more about mobile advertising, we want to hear from you.


What you need

  • 2 + work and/or internship experience in advertising, digital marketing, or business-related fields
  • Advanced Excel skills (i.e. lookup, pivot table, etc.) is a must
  • Understanding of SQL and data extraction is a plus, willingness to learn is a must
  • Passion for advertising, mobile gaming, and making money!
  • Ability to think and react quickly and to multi-task
  • Self-motivated, with an exceptional work ethic
  • Web/tech-savvy a must (ability to quickly learn and master new programs/interfaces)
  • Very strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strategic and Analytic mindset


Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status.


Candidate information will be treated in accordance with our candidate privacy notice which can be found here: https://scopely.com/scopely-candidate-privacy-notice/

title: Database Marketing & CRM Coordinator
description:
The Opportunity:

1-800-GOT-JUNK? is looking for a Database Marketing & CRM Coordinator to join our growing team! As part of the Marketing department, you will help to maintain brand integrity & compliance as well as the general administration. The focus of the Coordinator will be to help execute operational and programs to propel our overarching goals of journey and process integration to increase efficiency, reduce costs and improve the customer experience.

 

When we say Itâ€™s All About People we mean it. We have created a hybrid work model that helps us get together to Collaborate, Celebrate and Connect while enjoying the flexibility of working where it makes sense for you. For this roleâ€™s duty and responsibility we anticipate that you will be in the office 25% of time.

 

O2E Brands is committed to creating a safe and healthy environment for our team members, customers and community. As part of this commitment, we require all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for an exemption under provincial health guidelines as of January 7th, 2022.

 

A Day in the Life:
  • Coordinate and support asset development with our creative & content teams
  • Assist the team in building, QAâ€™ing and deploying email campaigns / journeys
  • Monitor database journey, campaigns and 3rd party programsâ€™ performance
  • Prepare marketing activity reports and metrics for measuring program success
  • Assist in program audits, weekly, quarterly and annual department performance reviews
  • Work with vendors to ensure brand quality and messaging
  • Coordinate and ensure opt-ins / opts are transferred between internal systems and vendors. Overall Compliance protocols are adhered to
  • Create & maintain process documentation for the DBM & CRM Team
  • Support the Database Marketing & CRM Team with their administrative and day to day functions
  • Be awesome and have fun!
What You Bring to the Table:
  • Understanding of marketing principles and database marketing
  • Experience working with marketing automation software is considered an asset
  • Respect for, and a basic understanding of compliance with CASL, CAN SPAM and other anti spam regulations and guidelines
  • Aptitude for content design and asset creation, exceptional communication skills, and a flair for the creative
  • Familiarity with template design - HTML and CSS experience would be a great addition but not necessary!
  • Comfort working within existing brand standards and design systems
  • Ability to work with multiple stakeholders
About Us:

Did you know O2E Brands has been voted one of the Best Workplaces in Canada 12 times!?Take a sneak peek into why that is, here: (https://youtu.be/DJA02gMNU-0)

 

 

 

 

Check us out on social!

 

 

At O2E Brands we know that great talent comes in many forms and we want to meet you at your best. We will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities at any time throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please reach out to our Talent Acquisition Team at talentacquisition@o2ebrands.com or notify the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with if unique arrangements will enable your equal participation.

title: Marketing Analyst II
description:
Requisition Title: Marketing Analyst II | CAN

Description: The Canada Global Commercial Services (GCS) team offers a fast-paced environment with great opportunities for career growth and development. The team is responsible for developing and implementing innovative strategies across all Card and Non-Card Lending products to successfully target, acquire and nurture high-value customers.

We are seeking a Contractor to support Prospect Marketing Offer Strategy and Business Loans. The Contractor will be responsible for performing data analysis of past acquisition offers to help inform our go-forward strategy. They will also help lead the launch of our Business Loans product in the Outbound Telemarketing channel.

Primary responsibilities of this position include:

" Gather and maintain data analysis of Acquisition offers; provide insights into optimal offer constructs and opportunities to do further testing
" Co-ordinate across the broader acquisition team and other business units to ensure a cohesive product offer strategy and to gain alignment Manage the day-to-day relationship with the Outbound Telemarketing partner to drive acquisition performance, deliver reporting, and ensure operational excellence
" Enable Sales onboarding, training, call listening and best practice sharing to effectively manage performance with the vendor
" Gather Business Loan data insights, prepare reporting on Key Performance Indicators including conversion rates, average loan size, and risk profile of the acquired portfolio
" Develop and execute industry focused campaigns acquiring prospects
" Manage measurement, reporting, and analytics for the channel and continuously monitor performance against channel targets, analyze what is working / not working, identify areas for improvement and provide actionable recommendations
" Conduct regular performance review sessions with each vendor
" Execute performance based vendor compensation program

Qualifications

" Minimum 3 years experience in B2B marketing primarily in credit/lending would be preferred
" Personable, forward customer-first thinker that challenges the status quo with proven ability to drive results in a dynamic, collaborative and fast-paced environment
" Strong analytical and reporting skills with proficiency with MS Office (Excel and PowerPoint), Salesforce.com experience preferred
" Strong ability to learn quickly and adapt effectively with new dynamic plans, platforms and technologies
" A highly motivated self-starter with high energy and a very positive attitude
" Ability to work independently to manage multiple project priorities and details with multiple cross-functional teams
" A bachelor degree in business or marketing or related experience

title: Category & Sales Analyst LCL & A/O - FC
description:
Category & Sales Analyst LCL & A/O - FC

Job Description

Category & Sales Analyst LCL & A/O FC (This role can be based anywhere in Canada.)

The Category & Sales Analyst LCL & A/O - FC is responsible for providing in-depth analysis of category opportunities across Family Care categories for LCL and assigned regional customers and making recommendations to the National Account Manager/Key Account Manager that support the achievement of budgeted sales and share volumes and the establishment of category growth for the customer and K-C.

KEY CUSTOMERS AND CUSTOMER EXPECTATIONS:

Key customers for this position are Customer Development, Category Development, Customer Development Leadership, and Retail Customers. These customers expect clear, succinct, compelling and timely communication of Category Development principles and consumer needs to support customer and Kimberly-Clark objectives.
 

ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS/SCOPE:

This position reports to the Director of Category & Shopper Insights and interacts internally with their assigned customer team, the business units, Category Management team, Customer Teams and other Customer Development staff.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provide category management expertise (including Planograms) to assigned head office customer in the areas of product mix, shelf merchandising, promotion, pricing, and profitability to enable Kimberly-Clark to become the supplier of choice and to assist retailers in the management of KCI’s product categories.  (Assist) Initiate projects as part of the Category Development team. Develop category overviews and action plans, as directed by sales managers and the team leader, utilizing category management software that will deliver customer category objectives and improve sales results for K-C. Assist in developing category knowledge and expertise in the Sales team to enable Kimberly-Clark to take full advantage of all sales opportunities. Participate in customer presentations, and interface with category decision-makers within assigned customer organizations on category developments and opportunities. Communicate with Marketing brand management personnel on key category initiatives and developments to ensure category management principles are included when developing products, marketing plans, and programs. Monitor developing category management trends and techniques by the Trade, other manufacturers, and vendors of software.  Provide recommendations on the use of new software and techniques to the team leader. May maintain product master file of both competitive and K-C products, taking accurate measurements of products and electronic photo images to be used in conjunction with space management software. May provide technical support with POS data processing and Nielsen Quad (weekly) data reports, and translating purchased data into K-C meaningful data to support analysis. Contribute, when required, in situations, projects, and activities not included in other principal accountabilities to assist in the accomplishment of business objectives and personnel development. Contribute to the achievement of business and personal objectives by seeking and responding to performance and development feedback, and by initiating personal development activities to enhance functional effectiveness. Contribute to an environment in which all team members are respected regardless of their individual differences, and are motivated to improve both their individual and team contributions to achieve desired business results.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Education required/ preferred:

A recognized Bachelor’s Degree and equivalent work experience.

Experience:

1 – 2+ years previous experience in account management / category management, preferably with a Consumer Packaged Goods company.

Skills/Competencies:

Microsoft Office Suite

Space Management Planogram (Modular) Software

Nielsen MarketTrack

Broad knowledge of Kimberly-Clark organizational structure; products and categories; and Customer Development policies and procedures is required. 

Ability to develop and interpret market, business and financial analysis supporting the execution of national / regional business.

Effective command of the six Leadership Qualities and ability to apply those qualities toward effective interaction with team members and internal customers.

The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills required for this position.

Kimberly-Clark and its well-known global brands are an indispensable part of life for people in more than 175 countries. Every day, 1.3 billion people - nearly a quarter of the world's population - trust K-C brands and the solutions they provide to enhance their health, hygiene, and well-being. With brands such as Kleenex, Scott, Huggies, Pull-Ups, Kotex, and Depend, Kimberly-Clark holds No.1 or No. 2 share positions in more than 80 countries. With more than 150 years of history of innovation, we believe in recruiting the best people and empowering them do their best work.  If fresh thinking and a passion to win inspire you, come Unleash Your Power at Kimberly-Clark. 

For Kimberly-Clark to grow and prosper, we must be an inclusive organization that applies the diverse experiences and passions of its team members to brands that make life better for people all around the world.  We actively seek to build a workforce that reflects the experiences of our consumers.  When you bring your original thinking to Kimberly-Clark, you fuel the continued success of our enterprise. We are a committed equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

This position may require a post-offer/pre-hire Physical Abilities Test (PAT) to confirm that individuals are able to perform the essential functions of the job.

K-C requires that an employee have authorization to work in the country in which the role is based.  In the event an applicant does not have current work authorization, K-C will determine, in its sole discretion, whether to sponsor an individual for work authorization.  However, based on immigration requirements, not all roles are suitable for sponsorship.

#Remote-LI

Global VISA and Relocation Specifications:

K-C will support in-country relocation for the chosen candidate for the role, including assistance to obtain proper work authorization. The benefits provided will be per the terms of K-C’s applicable mobility policies. The benefits/policy provided will decided in K-C’s sole discretion.

Primary Location

Canada-Ontario-Mississauga

Additional Locations

Canada-Alberta-Calgary, Canada-British Columbia-Vancouver-Flexible Location

Worker Type

Employee

Worker Sub-Type

Regular

Time Type

Full time

These customers expect clear, succinct, compelling and timely communication of Category Development principles and consumer needs to support customer and Kimberly-Clark objectives.']

title: Product Information Analyst
description:
Who are we?

Teknion creates furniture that connects people, technology and spaces. We hold to a simple yet powerful principle: design does matter. We are a different kind of company–one with an entrepreneurial spirit defined by passion, curiosity and bold, creative thinking. A privately held company with a youthful entrepreneurial spirit, we recognize the vast skills, knowledge, perspectives and cultural contributions that diversity brings to Teknion. Because different perspectives and experiences trigger creativity and innovation, diversity is integral to our success. Our employees are the heart and soul of our business. To support their development is to enhance our biggest asset.

What will you be doing?

The Product Information Analyst, will be responsible for development and implementation of a product information strategy to support Teknion’s architectural product lines He/she will work very closely with program management, design and engineering to develop and implement methods to ensure products are brought to market in an effective and timely manner in line with the Teknion New Product Development Process. He/she will be accountable to ensure the effective management and support of the product information requirements for Architectural Interiors Products.

Specific Accountabilities 

  • Validate and learn from broad inputs (customers, analysts, competition, partners, suppliers, employees, sales channels, etc.)
  • Create implementation plans based on understanding of business strategy and business needs of various stakeholders.
  • Understand and execute on various product information requirements included in the company’s New Product Implementation process.
  • Identify and evaluate opportunities for continuous improvement of product information quality, process and standard.
  • Create product structure logic to enable effective specification, ordering and manufacturing. This includes the creation of product codes and necessary supporting information to define and communicate the product structure to other groups.
  • Ensure all required product information, including pricing, is prepared in an effective manner in the Corporate product database.
  • Ensure the accuracy of price and product information across various information tools made available to dealers, customers and Teknion sellers.
  • Act as a primary linkage to Corporate Marketing implementation groups.
    • Develop methods, processes and solution providers (internal or external) to ensure timely and effective access to the following essential elements of product information
    • Product Database
    • Application Guides
    • Price and Product Guide (PPG)
    • Technical Specifications Documents to communicate product features and attributes o Installation Guides
    • Architectural CAD details
    • Storyboard and Revit product symbols
    • Product Memos
  • Review and participate in Current Product Engineering Changes to determine impact and changes on all sources of product information.
  • Review engineering drawings and architectural details to determine impact and changes on all sources of product information.
  • Develop product pricing in conjunction with finance group and business unit colleagues
  • Work with other departments as required ensuring that the development, implementation and launch initiatives are executed as per established project schedules and in line with processes employed for Teknion product lines.
  • Work with internal specifiers, design and finance to develop applications and typicals to develop analysis of pricing and margins to guide product decisions.

What skills, experience and education are we looking for?

  • Post Secondary diploma or degree in Architectural Technology is an asset
  • Experience in organizations with design driven products, and a technology/engineering orientation.
  • Excellent computer skills:
    • Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, Power Point
    • Microsoft Visio Flow Chart, Lucidchart
    • Adobe: Acrobat, Photoshop, Illustrator
    • Advanced knowledge of database / electronic catalogs managements 20-20 Project Matrix, CET
    • Exposure to engineering modeling software: AutoCAD, Draftsight
  • Must add value to the company by focusing on delivering superior client-service.
  • Demonstrates a high energy level and sense of urgency in getting things done.
  • Excellent organizational and prioritization skills.
  • Creative and Innovative thinker who possesses a passion to learn.
  • Proven ability to understand and articulate how a product information strategy leads to improved business results.
  • Excellent communication skills (listening, verbal and written).
  • Team player, flexible, committed and reliable.

Why should you grow with us?

  • Competitive Salary
  • Company Paid benefits
  • Group RRSP plan
  • Pension Plan
  • Excellent work environment and culture
  • Corporate perks and discounts year round
  • Our People

Teknion is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization, starting with the hiring process.  It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment.

Teknion welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

By applying for a position with Teknion, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Teknion's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, credit check and criminal check. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

See job description

title: FIG Product Specialist
description:
S&P Global Market Intelligence

TheRole: FIG Product Specialist

Grade (relevant for internal applicants only): 9A

The Location: Toronto, ON; Charlottesville, VA; NYC, NY; Los Angeles, CA; Buenos Aires, AR

The Team: Within the S&P Global Market Intelligence Commercial organization, Product Specialists are expected to identify, analyze, and propose solutions relating to specific products and services. Within Risk Services, Quantamental Solutions, Desktop, MMD, LCD, Industry Solutions, Product Specialists become domain and knowledge experts


The Impact: These roles drive revenue growth and client retention by working with Sales, Relationship Management, Product Management, and Client Operations to promote Market Intelligence’s products, data content and delivery business, and other services across all client segments. You will have a ‘seat at the table’ while leading or participating in these external and internal conversations and negotiations. Your input will help clients identify needs, construct solutions that utilize our products, and ultimately position Sales teams for success in their contracting discussions and support successful ongoing outcomes for Relationship Managers.

Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):

S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $46.6 - $95.9k. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for a commercial incentive plan.

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires.

Responsibilities:

  • Possess a firm understanding of the diagnostic sales process and employ its principles and techniques when engaging with a prospect or client.
  • Support existing platform and/or content and feed clients with a strong focus on renewal rate. Respond attentively to client questions, help clients get the most out of our solutions, and work with Sales and Relationship Management to drive usage and adoption of products across the client organization.
  • Assist the trial process with a thorough understanding of the client’s workflow, and how Market Intelligence’s solutions may enhance that workflow.
  • Conduct product demos as needed and help to design the best solution to fit a prospect’s or client’s needs.
  • Master the specific technical knowledge of each Product Specialist domain in order to advise clients and prospects on Market Intelligence solutions. Some roles require significant hands-on application of technical knowledge of systems and feeds.
  • Act as a product specialist for a given product segment business by understanding the application of Market Intelligence products and content for complex workflows, conduct training, troubleshoot problems, answer product questions, and work on proof-of-concept projects to ensure that the client has the tools that will make their experience a success.
  • Act as a regional market feedback consolidation source for regional product, content and delivery enhancements. Partner closely with Product Management, legal and client support teams to provide feedback and rank feed enhancement requests, assist with contract issues or coordinate client support requests as needed. Collaborate across borders with other Product Specialists serving in similar capacities.
  • Learn and understand new product enhancements and relevant datasets as they are deployed through our platforms, and communicate the advantages of these products and datasets effectively to clients and prospects.
  • Develop a complete understanding of competitors’ products and be able to articulate Market Intelligence’s relative capabilities.

What We’re Looking For:

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Strong understanding of at least one of the segments we serve and the FIG specialized solutions
  • Firm understanding of workflow solutions within Market Intelligence Desktop platform.
  • A mixture of Finance, business, commercial and technical skills are necessary.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Independent, self-starter capable of working without close supervision or daily guidance
  • An understanding of the value of careful attention to documenting activities
  • Team player with an ability to collaborate across functional and geographic boundaries
  • Some experience and ability to apply the core concepts of our diagnostic sales methodology
  • Demonstrates drive, initiative, energy and sense of urgency
  • Passion for data driven analytic solutions
  • A high level of client service and communication skills
  • Thorough understanding of the equity, fixed income/credit or industry specific investment process (with a focus on either quantitative or qualitative security analysis). Prior experience in selling to or interacting with the types of firms and individual personas we target is highly desirable.
  • Prior experience in selling to or interacting with the types of firms and individual personas we target is highly desirable
  • Degree in business, corporate finance, commerce or a numerate discipline such as Finance, Accounting, Economics, or equivalent experience is required depending on the role. A strong understanding of fundamental data is necessary
  • Strong level of computer skills including MS Office proficiency; programming, databases, computer science and other specific skills are highly desirable for some roles
  • Constructive team player, capable of balancing and prioritizing multiple projects across different teams or business segments

S&P Global Market Intelligence

At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand competitive and industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction.

S&P Global Market Intelligence is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence.

S&P Global has a Securities Disclosure and Trading Policy (“the Policy”) that seeks to mitigate conflicts of interest by monitoring and placing restrictions on personal securities holding and trading. The Policy is designed to promote compliance with global regulations. In some Divisions, pursuant to the Policy’s requirements, candidates at S&P Global may be asked to disclose securities holdings. Some roles may include a trading prohibition and remediation of positions when there is an effective or potential conflict of interest. Employment at S&P Global is contingent upon compliance with the Policy.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to:

EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com

and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

US Candidates Only:

The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdfdescribes discrimination protections under federal law.

Please note that S&P Global is a federal contractor, and in keeping with the US Government’s federal contractor vaccine mandate, the company plans to require all employees in the US to be fully vaccinated if and when such requirements becomes enforceable. S&P Global will also follow other state and local vaccine requirements which may apply.

20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), PDMGDV202.1 - Middle Professional Tier I (EEO Job Group), SWP Priority – Ratings - (Strategic Workforce Planning)

title: Analyst, Marketing Science
description:
Analyst, Marketing Science

What we are looking for:

Valtech is seeking a data-minded Marketing Analyst with experience in measurement, data, analytics, dashboards, optimization & SEO. We are looking for individuals with a passion for helping solve clients’ challenges through data and attain an ROI from their digital investments & data sets.

This is an exciting opportunity to grow your skills and work with a fantastic roster of clients within an expanding Marketing Science practice at Valtech. We place a strong emphasis on KPIs, measurement, and tagging across the customer journey, with an experiment-driven approach. You’ll be hands-on with a variety of platforms including Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Episerver, Sitecore, Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Optimizely, and others (feel free to bring your favorite tools into the mix). 

Your day will have immense variety; you’ll be running client workshops, designing tagging strategies, mining data for opportunities, and reporting on campaign performance. There will be plenty of opportunities to apply your strategic and analytical skills to link tactics and experiments to revenue and conversion lift, in a variety of client and vertical contexts. 

If you’re interested in data science or machine learning, we’re working on applying those techniques to marketing data as well! Most importantly, you love to tell data-driven stories of measurable improvements to digital performance.

Before we continue to dive into the requirements for the role let’s talk about Why you should join Valtech?

Flexibility: We trust in the expertise, skills, and actions of our colleagues. That’s why we provide a flexible work schedule that supports work/life balance.

Career Advancement: We offer a career, not just a job. We invest in the personal and professional growth of every employee because we believe growth leads to both business impact and personal fulfillment.

Learning and Development:  We foster a culture that encourages and promotes professional growth and development, with continuous learning through our in house LMS (Ask us about the Academy)

Toronto Benefits:  

  • We offer competitive compensation, Group Benefit Plan, and a Health & Wellness program  ($1000 toward mental health!) 
  • Monthly events with an active culture club
  • We close over the winter holidays and keep summer hours to help you make the most of those sunny Friday afternoons

Want to learn more about our unique culture and awesome people click here

What you will do:

  • You will be working closely with colleagues across North America and the role breaks down into two large buckets:
  • 1) Billable client work including but not limited to:
  • a. Delivery of workshops to define KPIs, digital objectives, project requirements, education on digital best
  • practices
  • b. Delivery and implementation of optimization roadmaps and experiments
  • c. Delivery and implementation of data strategy, data layer design, and tagging plan
  • d. Delivery and implementation of dashboards & ongoing reports
  • e. Delivery and implementation of marketing automation plan
  • f. Delivery and implementation of SEO recommendations & enhancements
  • g. Research into the latest practices, tools, and approaches to make informed recommendations
  • h. Providing general guidance and expertise to our clients as a trusted advisor
  • 2) Non-billable work to produce thought leadership and provide sales support defining early opportunities
  • Travel within Canada and US is expected to deliver client workshops (pre-COVID 19).

What you should have:

  • Experience presenting to stakeholders and delivering workshops and training engagements
  • • Understanding of the digital marketing space, including popular tools and common channel strategies spanning
  • web, email, social and mobile
  • • Experience in configuring and using Google Tag Manager & Google Analytics to understand visitor behavior and
  • identify opportunities for optimization
  • • Understanding of audience segmentation and content targeting to segments
  • • Experience developing and prioritizing KPIs to measure a program, initiative or project
  • • Understanding of marketing strategy and optimization tactics including personalization, SEO, A|B testing,
  • automation
  • • Experience embedding analytics and optimization within larger digital delivery projects
  • • Experience with DXPs such as Sitecore, Episerver, Salesforce Commerce Cloud
  • • Experience with analytics tools such as Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Adwords,
  • • Familiarity with SEO / optimization tools such as Semrush, CrazyEgg, HotJar

Nice to have:

  •  Experience in a consulting or client services environment (>2 years)
  •  Experience with dashboard tools such as Google Data Studio, PowerBI, Tableau
  • Marketing Automation experience (Marketo, Pardot, Episerver, etc.)

Here’s a little about us:

Valtech is a global digital agency that focuses on business transformation for our clients. Founded in 1993, Valtech has established itself as one of the largest independent global agency groups with more than 3.000 exceptional individuals operating out of 40+ offices in 15 countries. We work with some of the world’s best-known brands from travel to retail, connected experiences to automotive and we’re now ready to bring on even more talented colleagues to join us.

We believe diversity is essential to creating the best digital products & experiences. Valtech is committed to providing and maintaining a work environment where all employees and candidates are treated with dignity and respect and that is free of bias, prejudice, and harassment. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, citizenship, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status. 

So, if you are looking for your next challenge?  Then this is your chance to join our team of exceptionally talented, creative and innovative professionals working with composable Best-of-Breed technology platforms within the large-scale digital experience and e-commerce business area.

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
Company Description

Who we are:

At Reitmans (Canada) Limited (RCL), every moment of every day revolves around our customers and our love of fashion. We believe fashion empowers our customers to put their best foot forward when it matters the most. From the design table to the stores and our digital channels, we are always finding new ways to create memorable customer experiences, backed by a strong brand portfolio and powered by the most passionate people in the industry.

Job Description

Position overview

The Marketing Automation Specialist is a technical expert responsible for the implementation and evolution of marketing automation initiatives for the RCL divisions. He or She plays a key role in supporting the divisions’ omnichannel needs and ensures that strategies are constantly optimized based on provided insights.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with RCL divisions to deploy and optimize personalized e-mail triggers and journeys across various Salesforce Marketing Cloud products ;
  • Operates the Automation Builder and creates complex data workflows to support marketing automation use cases ;
  • Builds targeted segments based on e-mail behavioral data and CRM attributes using Data Extensions and AMPScript ;
  • Works closely with internal partners to implement proposed solutions based on functional specifications provided, and maintains documentation related to SMFC projects completed ;
  • Reports on campaign performance using SFMC report builder and web analytics tools. Optimizes strategies based on provided insights.

Qualifications

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in IT, Marketing, E-Commerce or in a related field ;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with Salesforces Marketing Cloud products, more specifically Email Studio, Advertising Audiences, Automation Builder, Journey Builder and Personalization Builder ;
  • Hands-on experience creating and maintaining data extensions, automation workflows, data transfer processes and triggers in SFMC ;
  • Must have solid understanding of relational databases, with expertise in writing SQL queries for data extraction ;
  • Must have good reporting and analytical skills with SFMC report builder and Google Analytics ;
  • Must be bilingual, spoken and written.

Additional Information

What we offer (Why work with us):

  • A competitive benefits package (Full Time Employees Only);
  • Paid Time Off ( Sick Time, Flex Days & Vacation (Full Time Employees Only);
  • Additional benefits include monthly bonus potential, opportunities for advancement and tuition reimbursement;
  • 50% discount at all Reitmans (Canada) Limited brands (Penningtons, Reitmans & RW&CO.);
  • Generous Employee Referral Policy.

If this inspires you…let’s talk. Send us your resume today! 

By the way, did you know that Reitmans (Canada) Limited has several hundreds of stores all across Canada and three fashion apparel banners? Get ready to join the Canadian fashion retail icon, with a great success story where you can have a voice and make a real difference. 

There are many ways to wear a career at RCL! #ReadytoRCL 

Reitmans (Canada) Limited is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for providing an accessible candidate experience. 

We thank all applicants. Only selected candidates will be contacted.
