title: Mobile App Marketing Specialist
description:
Company Description

Position:                   Mobile App Marketing Specialist

Term:                        1 year contract

Location:                  Toronto/Remote

Industry:                   eCommerce

 

We are seeking for an experienced Mobil App Marketing Specialist for our client, a leading global eCommerce platform.  This is a 1-year contract role.

 

The company offers a casual working start-up environment and a group of friendly and talented individuals. Our employees rank us highly in terms of commitment to work/life balance. We realize that for our people to be innovative, creative and passionate they need to feel valued and supported. We believe in rewarding all our employees with competitive salaries, performance based annual bonuses, stock options and training opportunities.

 

    Job Description

    The Role:

     

    Looking for a highly creative and performance-oriented Mobile App Marketing Specialist [1-Year Contract] to join our Digital Marketing Team. Growth marketing efforts advance at an incredible pace and we pride ourselves on using the latest digital strategies to deliver ongoing value for the organization. Our team’s core objectives are to drive customer acquisition and sales through the website and apps.

     

    Reporting to the Director, Digital Marketing, the Mobile App Marketing Specialist plays a vital role in driving growth by managing paid digital marketing programs for a rapidly.

     

    The successful candidate in this role must have mobile app marketing experience along with B2C paid advertising knowledge. A strong background in working with an MMP and Google Analytics is key. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to create and execute effective acquisition strategies, launch new marketing campaigns, build relationships with networks and publishers, and optimize activities for return on investment and cost efficiency.

    They will be responsible for launching, optimizing, and expanding mobile ad campaigns, reporting on performance and communicating results to internal/external partners, assisting in developing an ASO roadmap, working alongside the Digital Marketing team to invest budget efficiently across all channels, and leading testing strategies to constantly move the needle across targets.

    Qualifications

    The Person:

     

    You’re the first to know what’s going on in the worlds of digital and mobile app marketing. You speak a language of acronyms, like CPA, CPI, ASO, ROAS, DSP and SDK. You have broad skills and experience across PPC digital marketing channels, especially for eComm and Apps. You’re motivated to take ownership and grow by expanding new and existing strategies. You’re a true team player with a positive, collaborative attitude. You’re known for your ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies, and clearly explain them to others. You’re an entrepreneurial spirit who knows how to get things done in a fast-paced environment. You love a challenge and being challenged. You excel having your hands in many things at once.

     

    You will be responsible for:

    ·       Establishing, executing, and measuring our mobile app paid advertising initiatives to drive conversion and sales across products and services.

    ·       Demonstrating your ability to work at the planning level by generating bold and innovative ideas for growth and at the tactical level by managing advertising campaign execution, creating and optimizing campaigns, analyzing traffic data and solving problems.

    ·       Overseeing and consistently improving tracking, attribution, and analysis of key metrics including CPA, CPS, CPI, CVR, CPC, quality of the traffic by source, and return on investment.

    ·       Building, developing, and managing relationships with top mobile ad networks and publishers.

    ·       Providing complete performance reporting and analysis on all mobile app marketing campaigns and taking relevant actions on insights gained.

    ·       Working with our in-house Product team to collaborate on ASO by assisting, developing, and supporting on the execution of a dedicated roadmap.

    ·       Collaborating closely with technical, business, and support teams to manage timely projects.

    ·       Managing global budgets across multiple countries, campaigns and targets to accurately invest in KPI growth.

    ·       Proactively sourcing new opportunities for expansions across digital media channels to drive customer acquisition.

    ·       Working with our in-house creative team to write insight-driven creative briefs and develop all marketing campaigns and materials.

     

    The Skillset:

     

    Required:

    ·       2 years in digital marketing with a focus on paid mobile app marketing tied to growth success, specifically using metrics such as CPI, CPA, CPC, CR (preferably eCommerce).

    ·       Deep understanding of digital marketing strategy across PPC channels (including DSP, SSP, DMP and the programmatic ecosystem); with proven track record of optimizing campaigns to improve performance and CPA results along with audience segmentation, targeting, APIs, custom audiences.

    ·       Proficiency in working with mobile app marketing strategies, attribution and MMPs, such as Tune, Branch, Appfigures, AppAnnie & Google Analytics.

    ·       Proven track record of delivering customer acquisition growth, sales, and optimization across key metrics.

    ·       Strong time management skills: ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously.

    ·       Strong analytical and decision-making skills based on data; the ability to leverage data sources for reporting to provide meaningful insights back to business stakeholders.

    ·       A good understanding of ASO tactics with proof points and apps.

    ·       Intermediate or higher Excel proficiency.

    Nice to Haves:

    ·       Experience working with creative teams to guide and create visual and copy assets.

    ·       Familiarity with SQL, HTML, XML, and general office software. Adobe Creative Suite is desired but not essential.

    ·       Comfortable working with Javascript tags, APIs and mobile SDKs.

    ·       Knowledge of app store optimization (ASO).

    ·       Foreign language skills (French, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, etc.) or localization experience an asset.

    ·       International marketing efforts are an asset.

title: Product Development Specialist
description:
Company Description

Founded in 2006, Kensington Tours is a $170 million privately-held company that has been rapidly growing for the past few years.  We are a multi-award-winning luxury tour operator offering tailor-made, private-guided experiences to the world’s most extraordinary destinations. Anchored by an industry-leading team of 150 destination specialists, we deliver curated travel experiences for the most discerning clients.  The success of Kensington Tours has been its ability to provide customized tours for each and every client in a market with increasingly sophisticated consumer knowledge and a heightened search for “authenticity of experience.”  We do this with our pioneering technology platform that allows the company to connect tour experts all over the world into a single, streamlined database and booking engine.  Kensington strives to surprise and delight at every turn with authentic, extraordinary and unexpected experiences.  Our brand promise - to create the experience that changes the life.

Job Description

Reporting to the Product Director of Kensington Tours, the Product Development Specialist plays a key role in the management and delivery of the Kensington product portfolio.

With a requirement for advanced writing skills, a creative flair, an analytical mind and the ability to project manage, the Product Development Specialist is responsible for bringing a competitive portfolio of services and itineraries to market in a timely manner, in addition to maintaining the existing portfolio within an assigned geographic region. Supporting the Product Director and cooperating with the Procurement, Marketing and IT Teams, as well as our local vendors and the Sales Floor, this role is essential in owning the product as it lives in TMT and driving consistency across the portfolio. The Product Development Specialist is accountable for ensuring accuracy of both the client-facing content and technical components of every service.

Responsibilities

  • Create itineraries and content with a consistent Kensington “voice” that spans across region
  • Oversee the service building and itinerary creation process while using both Excel and TMT and communicating closely with our local vendors and Procurement Team
  • Support the maintenance of existing product by addressing sales product tickets, reviewing weekly NPS results, consolidating DE feedback from Teams and pulse surveys, as well as analyzing vendor feedback and annual tariffs descriptions based on annual rate adjustment process, FAM feedback, etc.
  • Work in collaboration with the Product Director on itinerary flow, content and pricing
  • Support the Product Director in the preparation and compilation of product data for product development meetings and reporting purposes:
    - Competitive Analysis
    - Strength/weakness of existing programs
    - Sale to date
    - Service Briefs
    - Various BI reporting including Sales figures, COGS numbers and itinerary demand
  • Ongoing management of “File Finishing”; updating imagery, modifying or re-writing text as it appears on the website and client-facing quotes, monitoring and updating service alerts, implementing changes in service flow, routing, inclusions and exclusions.
  • Assist the Product Director in communicating product updates and itinerary sales status effectively with the sales floor and marketing teams via monthly updates, internal newsletters and Product Development meetings
  • Communicate product updates to the sales team
  • Other duties as assigned including rate entry and dynamic hotel mapping
  • Identify missing or unclear information in annual tariffs and address directly with vendors to ensure accuracy and high level-of-detail
  • Compile, maintain and complete project build grids, cross-referencing with both itinerary templates/concepts and vendor tariffs
  • Oversee project handover to TripArc (Procurement Operations) for rate entry using shared formatting standards
  • Support the Product Director in estimating project scope and timelines
  • Identify and flag potential delays and barriers to project delivery
  • Determine when to make use of license free imagery vs. paid credits (I.e., Getty Images) and flag any resource concerns

 

Qualifications

  • Advanced communication skills – ability to write with a clear sense of style and consistency across regions
  • Superior attention to detail
  • Highly effective project management, prioritization, multi-tasking, and time management skills to meet deadlines and manage a large volume of work in a fast-paced environment
  • Demonstrated ability to gather, analyze and organize information
  • Understanding of the Tours Market/Specialist Travel/Luxury Travel/Cultural Travel space an asset
  • Proven ability to demonstrate creative and innovative thinking
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate across cross-functional teams
  • Able to work in a fast paced, changing, entrepreneurial environment and meet time sensitive deadlines
  • Upbeat personality with a comfort being both a team player and a self-starter - must be able to work in a lean environment with autonomy
  • Intermediate knowledge of Excel and strong aptitude to learn to use new software
  • Experience with selecting and managing digital images and file management


Additional Information

We thank all candidates for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Successful candidates will receive communications from the Navigatr Talent Acquisition team, our exclusive recruitment partner.

We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please advise us when completing your application.

title: Marketing Coordinator - Budweiser Gardens
description:
Overview:

MARKETING COORDINATOR

 

REPORTS TO:                   Director of Marketing

 

ENTITY:                                       Spectra

 

SUPERVISION

EXERCISED:                       Marketing Interns

 

 

GENERAL STATEMENT OF DUTIES:

This position with the assistance of the Director of Marketing and Marketing & Digital Interactive Manager is responsible for creating comprehensive marketing, advertising, and promotional plans for upcoming events; preparation of marketing settlements for concerts and shows; BudInsider email blasts; coordination of special events and promotions for upcoming events; maintaining the Budweiser Gardens social media pages and website, placing media buys for upcoming events; and is responsible for the Budweiser Gardens Centre Tour program.

Responsibilities:

AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:

  • Creation of marketing, advertising, and promotional plans for upcoming events at Budweiser Gardens
  • Prepare marketing settlements for events taking place at Budweiser Gardens.
  • Utilize all opportunities presented through the Eloqua platform in collaboration with Paciolan to create BudInsider email blasts to our database.
  • Assist the Marketing & Digital Interactive Manager in creating, maintaining, and updating content on the venueâ€™s social media accounts (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, and Twitter).
  • Responsible for the content of the website and a liaison with our web provider, Carbonhouse, to make necessary additions, corrections, or revisions.
  • Creation of Third-Party Partnerships, arranging meetings with potential partners, and working with existing third parties to promote upcoming events.
  • Assist the Director of Marketing and Marketing & Digital Interactive Manager with the coordination and execution of special events and promotions associated with upcoming events at Budweiser Gardens.
  • Assist the Director of Marketing and Marketing & Digital Interactive Manager with the coordination and execution of self-created events at the venue.
  • With assistance from the Director of Marketing and Marketing & Digital Interactive Manager shall also be responsible for the creation and implementation of grassroots marketing plans to promote upcoming events.
  • Responsible for maintaining in-venue signage and assets with assistance from the Marketing & Digital Interactive Manager.
  • Assist the Marketing & Digital Interactive Manager, utilizing the Adobe Creative Cloud, for graphic design projects such as our Annual Report, resizing images, logo creation, etc.
  • Write press releases, copy for self-created events, social media content, blogs, etc.
  • Responsible for the daily activities of interns within the Department
  • Responsible for the Budweiser Gardens Tour Program which consists of creating the program, scheduling, and providing guided tours of the facility
  • Other duties as required.

 

Qualifications:

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree, diploma, or equivalent experience required.
  • Intermediate to strong knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, and Premiere Pro is required.
  • Basic knowledge & interest in marketing and advertising functions
  • Understand the concept of branding.
  • Intermediate knowledge of social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc.).
  • Working knowledge of Outlook, Word, Excel, Teams, and PowerPoint.
  • Previous event or entertainment marketing experience is a plus.
  • Excellent writing and verbal communication skills in the English language.
  • Well organized with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple assignments.
  • Flexible - must be available to work evenings, weekends, and all event days as assigned.
  • Team player who is creative and a proactive problem solver.
  • Applicants must be fully vaccinated.

ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • Oversee Marketing Departmentâ€™s Interns. Performs the departmental administrative duties and assists the Director of Marketing in ensuring a high standard of excellence regarding the marketing department objectives                          

 

Those interested are asked to submit a cover letter and resume to Danielle Phillips at

danielle.phillips@spectraxp.com

by 4:00 pm on Friday, March 18, 2022.

 

Spectra, an industry leader in sports, entertainment, and venue management, is dedicated to recruiting and developing individuals with the skills, experience, desire, and values to contribute to the continued growth and success of our organization.   Together, with our 250+ sports  

Vaccination Statement:

We are committed to ensuring all our buildings and office locations are the safest in the world for artists, teams, employees, and fans. Based on recent encouraging trends in the U.S. and Canada. We highly encourage our employees to continue to get vaccinated and boosted against COVID-19.    Should circumstances change, we may need to reinstate vaccination requirements, in whole or in part, to safeguard the health of our employees, guests, performers, athletes, and partners.

EEO:

Oak View Group is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally recognized basis (â€œprotected classâ€) including, but not limited to veteran status, uniform service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class under federal, state, or local law.

Performs the departmental administrative duties and assists the Director of Marketing in ensuring a high standard of excellence regarding the marketing department objectives', 'Assist the Marketing & Digital Interactive Manager, utilizing the Adobe Creative Cloud, for graphic design projects such as our Annual Report, resizing images, logo creation, etc.']

title: Senior Analyst, Market Growth
description:
Job Description:

We are Canada Life

 

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place whereyour unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

 

You can be your best here. Youâ€™re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

 

Together, as part of a great team, youâ€™ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. Itâ€™s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company thatâ€™s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.  

â€¯  

Be your best at Canada Life.

 

We are looking for a   Senior Analyst, Market Growth.  

 

Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Montreal, Toronto, London, Winnipeg.  

 

As a Sr. Analyst for Market Growth, you will at epicenter of the ongoing development of Canada Lifeâ€™s distribution strategy, impacting over 30,000 advisors.

The scope of work includes exploring opportunities across Mergers & Acquisitions, Innovation and Technology, partnering with start-ups and solution vendors, and much more across both wealth and insurance. You will aid in enabling advisor engagement, scaling new growth ventures, and identifying future market opportunities within the Advisory Network.

 

What you will do

  • Provide analytical support for a range of strategic initiatives and projects related to distribution and growth strategy, including the following:
    • Developing financial models for M&A or partnership opportunities
    • Conducting market scans and competitor insights from industry associations, publications, and research reports
    • Interview internal stakeholders to collect information on different lines of business, competitive threats, market trends, and internal operations
    • Analyze customer and advisor level data to understand market size, trends and segmentation
    • Independently drive/lead workstreams within a project
  • Support and work closely with Advisory Network leadership in the development, management and implementation of medium and long-term strategic initiatives.
    • Provide presentation, meeting, and strategy implementation support, including PowerPoint materials
    • Participate in a broad range of strategy team and business team meetings to gather information, share insights and present findings
    • Ensure strategy translate to clear business plans, with measurable outcomes, and communicate those with the involved departments
  • Perform other related duties as assigned e.g., represent distribution on cross-functional projects as required from time-to-time.

 

What you will bring

  • An undergraduate degree (preferably in economics, business, finance, actuarial science, or related)
  • 4+ years experience in relevant roles (experience / accreditation in insurance / investment / consulting industry is an asset).
  • Direct working knowledge of financial advisory business, particularly Lifeco distribution networks is beneficial.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with particular emphasis on financial and strategic analysis, demonstrated through high impact professional experience
  • Highly proficient in financial modeling and presentation development
  • Strong leadership and influencing ability â€“ willing to professionally ask tough questions that elevate the teams thinking
  • Ability to work well in an open, collaborative environment without rigidly defined boundaries of â€œwho does whatâ€
  • Proficient across Microsoft Office set of tools (including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Teams, and SharePoint); Working capabilities in research and analysis tools such as Bloomberg and Tableau are an asset

 

 

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today  

 

We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!

 

Canada Life servesâ€¯the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, weâ€™re one of Canadaâ€™s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.â€¯  

â€¯â€¯  

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employeeâ€¯has the opportunity toâ€¯reach their potential.â€¯  

â€¯â€¯  

â€¯â€¯  

Canada Lifeâ€¯would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contactedâ€¯  

#LI-DT1

#LI-Remote

#IND

title: CRM Specialist
description:
The Montreal office of a leading Law Firm in Canada, with an innovative client-centric approach, is looking for a CRM specialist. This position is for a period of one year.

The CRM Specialist is an thought leader in CRM and works collaboratively with Business development and Marketing and Communications to define and enrich their business initiatives. The CRM specialist is expected to be aware of the latest and emerging best practices in the industry and to develop strategic CRM programs that can support the company in its thought leadership and customer development efforts.


The CRM specialist:

1. works with the various functional areas to understand business processes and help users become more efficient when using CRM and related Business Development and Marketing systems;


2. acts as a specialist for his office of the firm's database and responds to all requests for information that concern the CRM database, direct mail, contact management and local resources for the firm's CRM system.


The main responsibilities associated with this position are as follows:

• Designs, documents and updates system design processes, testing procedures and quality standards.

• Develops technical solutions (programs) to create data files for importing data from or uploading data to external systems.

• Participates in the resolution of technical issues related to CRM and other related systems.

• Acts as a contact person in the office for all matters related to data quality standards.

• Leads the office's legal assistants in the development and maintenance of a national CRM database to ensure the accuracy, completeness and integrity of the information.

• Handles data change requests, including the review of all data requests and the research required to approve or reject changes that users propose to make to the data stored in the system.

• Manages and refines the distribution of publications (printed and electronic) and information materials; handles returns to the sender.

• Takes care of projects related to list preparation and advertising campaigns.

• Continuously monitors the database to proactively create new searches and maintain existing searches.

• Analyzes various numerical parameters and offers clients summary reports in the context of campaigns or quarterly reports.

• Trains legal assistants in conjunction with the firm's trainers and develops training programs and reference materials to increase the firm's ability to maintain contacts and ensure the integrity of the database.

• Provides regular status reports and updates on all CRM system programs and makes recommendations to continuously improve the system.

• Integrates programs into the overall customer contact strategy and participates in the day-to-day management of this strategy.


Main requirements:

• Bachelor's degree in marketing, information technology or a related field

• Bilingualism (French and English) (compulsory) and strong oral and written communication skills

• Between 3 and 5 years of CRM system experience as a CRM integrator/ adapter or related experience in database management and direct business-to-business mailing for a professional services organization or in the marketing sector

• Knowledge of customer relationship management systems or relational databases and experience with Microsoft CRM and CRM4Legal desirable

• Data management; desire to master and apply database technology and its concepts in the legal sector

• Ability to handle many projects simultaneously; proactive attitude focused on achieving desired outcomes

• Ability to multi-task, prioritize and find solutions to problems; ability to assess the overall situation and follow up with minimal supervision

• Attention to detail and deep respect for privacy issues

• Strong work ethic and strong sense of initiative; team spirit within a national structure

• Ability to lead data quality projects in conjunction with legal assistants, a key element

• Advanced computer skills and proven proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite

• Experience in a law firm, desirable


Do you have a good ability to work under pressure in a rapidly changing environment while paying great attention to detail and meeting deadlines? You are the person we are looking for!

As an equal opportunity employer, Personnel Alter Ego values diversity in its workforce and seeks to ensure all groups remain fairly represented. Candidates must have the legal right to work in Canada.

title: Product Information Specialist / Spécialiste technique
description:
Overview: Our Customer Product Information Representative team represents the Benjamin Moore brands for all Customers by providing excellent customer service and answering technical product questions while developing relationships with our customers. You will know all of our brands inside and out and make sure that the voice of the customer is heard throughout the company. The ideal candidate will be a true "people person." If you're the type of person who enjoys finding creative ways to resolve problems and wants to grow with a company, then this is where you belong.
RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Provides accurate, timely responses for a broad range of technical product inquiries from retailers, end users, architects, designers, field personnel
* Educates callers to properties and advantages of our product offerings, both in general and within a given end use
* Works in conjunction with the chemists regarding advanced technical inquiries
* Knowledge of competitor products and converting to our brands
* Assists in converting competitive specifications into Benjamin Moore & Co. products, both architectural and industrial maintenance
* Refers calls to appropriate personnel regarding sales opportunities, retailer prospects, product complaints and environmental/regulatory inquiries etc.
* Enters complaint data for our Product Portfolio (CRM) for analysis by Product Complaint Resolution Team
* Conducts research analysis and reports to share with Market Development, Brand and Product groups
* Shares new learnings with Customer Experience team to ensure consistent information
* Coordinates with others in the Customer Experience team to ensure proper service coverage
* Excellent Knowledge of marketing programs and related information
* Other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS:

* Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience.
* 3-5 years of Benjamin Moore & Co/competitive product knowledge.
* Superior knowledge with company systems including, Microsoft Office and SAP.
* Effective interpersonal and relationship building skills.
* Effective verbal, written and telephone communication skills
* Ability to analyze situations and identify opportunities for success.
* Effective decision making and problem solving skills.
* Must be self-motivated and driven.
* Effective organizational and time management skills.
* Flexibility in adapting to changing situations, how to best prioritize and multi-task.
* Ability to work in a team environment.
* Specific markets require fluency in both English and French.
Flexible schedule availability to meet business needs


Représentant du service à la clientèle -- Niveau un

* Fournit systématiquement, au téléphone comme à l'écrit, un service exceptionnel au client, en utilisant les systèmes, les procédures et les autres ressources disponibles pour répondre rapidement et précisément aux demandes et aux problèmes des clients.
* Traite tous les types de commandes des clients avec précision et efficacité par le biais de différents canaux.
* Fournit de l'information aux clients concernant les commandes régulières et ponctuelles (promotions), incluant la livraison, la disponibilité des produits et les prix.
* Communique avec le personnel de la logistique pour coordonner les livraisons spéciales et pour résoudre les problèmes liés à la disponibilité des produits.
* Connaît les politiques de l'entreprise, les programmes de marketing, les offres spéciales, la politique en matière de transport de marchandises, les produits et les attentes des clients en matière de service à la clientèle.
* Achemine les problèmes aux membres de la direction, communique les demandes et les plaintes, et fournit un service qui dépasse les attentes des clients et les satisfait entièrement.
* Partage les procédures, utilise les systèmes et les autres ressources pour fournir une réponse rapide et précise aux demandes des clients.
* Offre une assistance en matière de formation et de soutien interfonctionnel pour atteindre et dépasser les objectifs liés au rendement, à la satisfaction des clients et au service.
* Assure le suivi nécessaire en fonction des demandes des clients afin de vérifier que la solution apportée satisfait le client et répond aux attentes à l'interne.
* Accomplit toute autre tâche qui lui est assignée.

Company Profile
Click to see how you can paint your future!
The color of pride: Benjamin Moore is proud to be a part of Berkshire Hathaway, which was recognized by Fortune magazine as the world's fourth most admired company. And for more than 130 years we've been a respected leader in the architectural coatings and home décor landscape; creating the products and tools that enrich and beautify thousands of communities each day. We recognize that our associates are the driving force behind our success and we strive to provide a work environment where hard work, creativity and purposeful collaboration are fostered and encouraged.
Join a company where innovation is constantly recognized as we look for individuals who produce world-class products, best-in-class services and customer experiences, design pioneering paints using the latest technologies and deliver unparalleled value and brand experiences for our customers and retail network.
Safety
At Benjamin Moore, our people are the heart of the company and our number one asset. We are committed to providing safe working conditions at all of our locations and have invested heavily in measures aimed at keeping employees healthy during the COVID-19 pandemic. With safety as one of our core company values, we've modified facilities and work schedules to support social distancing, established enhanced cleaning and sanitization protocols, and regularly provide personal protective equipment to all employees--including masks, gloves and hand sanitizer. Ensuring the well-being of our team members is a top priority.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Market Research Project Support Clerk
description:
About Ipsos

Ipsos is the world’s third largest market research company, present in 90 markets and employing more than 18,000 people. Our passionately curious research professionals, analysts and scientists have built unique multi-specialist capabilities that provide true understanding and powerful insights into the actions, opinions and motivations of citizens, consumers, patients, customers or employees. We serve more than 5000 clients across the world with 75 business solutions.

Founded in France in 1975, Ipsos is listed on the Euronext Paris since July 1st, 1999. The company is part of the SBF 120 and the Mid-60 index and is eligible for the Deferred Settlement Service (SRD). ISIN code FR0000073298, Reuters ISOS.PA, Bloomberg IPS:FP www.ipsos.com

We are currently recruiting for Research Project Support Clerks. This is a Work from Home position located in the Winnipeg and surrounding area.

The At-Home Market Research Project Support acts as a support role to the Project Manager to assist in the field execution of online research projects. This role will work with project suppliers to provide status updates and make minor adjustments as needed in field to ensure the project stays on track and meets the expected timelines. This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to starttheir career in market research and build their experience in online sample for research studies.

 

We are hiring for this position at an hourly rate of $14.00 for fluent English-speakers. Hours are flexible with up 40 hours per week; this position requires that applicants to work both Saturday and Sunday as part of their weekly shifts.
 

 This position may be right for you if….

  • You are fluent in using a Windows based PC
  • You are comfortable speaking & writing in English
  • You have strong time management skills
  • You reside in Winnipeg and the surrounding area and are looking to work from home
  • You are available to work weekends

Responsibilities:

  • Have a courteous, customer service approach to the people you communicate with
  • Provide written updates to suppliers and internal teams
  • Check all communication for accuracy, proper spelling and grammar

  Required Skills:

  • Self-motivated, positive attitude
  • Excellent reading and listening skills
  • Fully fluent in English with excellent written communication
  • Professional customer service attitude
  • Commitment to working as a team

 Home Office Requirements:

  • Broadband or high-speed DSL, cable or satellite internet connection
  • Quiet location to focus on work related activities

Interested in this opportunity? Please submit a detailed resume that demonstrates you have the skills and experience we are seeking by submitting an application with your resume online (button provided below). We thank all applicants; however, due to the volume of applications, only those short-listed for an interview will be contacted.

Ipsos is committed to equity in employment and in providing a workplace environment that treats all employees with respect and dignity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity to all staff and applicants.

#remote

title: Marketing Coordinator, Harlequin Brand Group
description:
Overview:

Company: Harlequin Enterprises ULC
Department: Harlequin Brand Group
Reporting To: Senior Marketing Manager, Series & Digital Publishing
Status: Regular Full Time
Location: 22 Adelaide Street West, Toronto (currently working remotely but will be returning to the office May 2nd, in a hybrid model)

 

We celebrate and support the differences that make each of us unique, striving to create a welcoming workplace that ensures everyone has a voice and are able to do their best work. We welcome all applicants, including those who identify with groups that are traditionally underrepresented in the publishing industry including, but not limited to, Black, Indigenous, and people of colour, and members of the LGBTQIA2S+ community, and persons with disabilities. Join us, and share your story.

 

Job Summary:
We are looking for a highly organized book lover to join our Harlequin Brand Marketing team. Reporting to the Sr. Marketing Manager, the Marketing Coordinator will work closely with in-house teams to coordinate, develop and implement plans and activities that will optimize and enhance Harlequinâ€™s catalogue of titles.

 

The ideal candidate will be a creative, highly detail-oriented, proactive, and self-directed professional who can multi-task, set priorities, and manage a number of projects at once.

Responsibilities:

Product Execution â€“ 50%
â€¢ Assists in the workflow process with all key stakeholders to ensure production deadlines are met.
â€¢ Supports with the cover design process for front list products and new product development, ensuring production deadlines are met.
â€¢ Assists with market analysis of romance subgenres and reports insights to help inform front list product strategy.
â€¢ Participates as the marketing representative with select product publishing teams to ensure strong competitive packaging and sales.

 

Promotion â€“ 30%
â€¢ Supports Assistant Product Managers with execution of promotional opportunities for titles/authors/themes.
â€¢ Provides executional assistance to the Brand and Promotions team.
â€¢ Supports brand publicity team with Net Galley platform.
â€¢ Creates, executes, and maintains in-book advertising for front list products.

 

Communication â€“ 10%
â€¢ Tracks reviews, promotions, and product priorities for effective communication with all key stakeholders.
â€¢ Supports Assistant Product Managers and Sr. Marketing Manager in presentation materials of program results.

 

Analysis and Reporting â€“ 10%
â€¢ Provides publishing teams with the analysis and reporting of monthly sales results and identified trends. Participates in the presentation of recommendations to enhance performance.

Qualifications:

Specific training or job experience required includes:
â€¢ University graduate
â€¢ Publishing certificate would be an asset
â€¢ Project management experience
â€¢ Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), with the ability to build presentation decks, schedule meetings, and create and utilize pivot tables and vlookups
â€¢ Exceptional written and oral communication skills
â€¢ Proven ability to flawlessly manage execution, display organizational savvy and show high attention to detail

 

Competencies/Skills:
Competencies and skills required to perform this job include:
â€¢ Results-oriented and highly detail-oriented
â€¢ Highly collaborative team player
â€¢ Calm under pressure, with the ability to take initiative, and prioritize multiple projects under tight timelines
â€¢ Excellent project management, communication, organizational, and prioritization skills a must
â€¢ Ability to influence at the individual contributor level
â€¢ A drive for results and ownership of product

 

What's in It For You?
â€¢ The opportunity to be part of a company on the leading edge of publishing, working with a very talented team and exceptional books
â€¢ Remote work, flexible start/stop times
â€¢ Paid time off days and vacation allotment, starting at three weeks (prorated based on start date)
â€¢ Flexible benefit plans to fit your needs and pension matching
â€¢ Various virtual social activities to keep you connected â€“ we love trivia!
â€¢ Virtual author events and access to discounted books
â€¢ Working with passionate people!

 

About HarperCollins Canada and Harlequin
Harlequin is a leading publisher of commercial fiction and narrative nonfiction. We publish more than 100 titles a month that reach audiences globally. Encompassing highly recognizable imprints that span a broad number of genres, we are home to many award-winning New York Times and USA TODAY bestselling authors. Harlequin is a division of HarperCollins Publishers, the second-largest consumer book publisher in the world. Through HarperCollinsâ€™s global publishing program, Harlequin titles are published in 17 countries and 16 languages.

 

Known worldwide for the quality of its list, HarperCollins Canada is the proud home of many bestselling and award-winning authors, including Esi Edugyan, Heather Oâ€™Neill, and Lawrence Hill. It is our vision to publish the best books of our generation and to work with authors over the length and breadth of their careers. Our authors are at the centre of everything we do. In addition to the Canadian publishing program, HarperCollins Canada is responsible for the sales, marketing, and publicity of HarperCollins titles from around the globe.

 

HarperCollins Canada and Harlequin are Equal Opportunity Employers committed to equal employment opportunities. Employment decisions are based on job requirements and the skills, knowledge, and experience of the candidate, regardless of any other factors unrelated to job performance. We are also committed to ensuring that the accessibility needs of candidates and employees are considered and accommodated during the recruitment process. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Spécialiste marketing 360
description:
L’équipe d’Humanify est fière de contribuer au succès de son client, acteur majeur du secteur du commerce de détail, en l’accompagnant dans ses recherches d’un nouveau :

 

 

Spécialiste, Marketing 360

 

 

Description

 

Chez nous, plus de 26 000 employé(e)s cultivent leur passion chaque jour. Nos équipes sont animées par la volonté d’aider nos clients à faire de leurs projets une réalité, et engagées à faire une différence dans les communautés où nous sommes établis.

Nous exploitons ou desservons quelque 470 magasins corporatifs et marchands affiliés indépendants. Grâce à une offre de produits et services unique et à des formats complémentaires allant des quincailleries de quartier aux magasins de grande surface, nos enseignes sont outillées pour répondre à tous les besoins des rénovateurs amateurs et des professionnels de la construction.

Chez nous, votre travail et vos idées contribuent à bâtir une organisation florissante. Votre voix sera toujours entendue et valorisée. Vous trouverez des possibilités de carrière à la mesure de vos ambitions et pourrez développer encore davantage l’ensemble de compétences qui vous rend unique.

Si vous cherchez à faire ce que vous aimez, à grandir au sein d’une grande famille accueillante et à vous perfectionner chez l’un des meilleurs employeurs au Canada, selon un récent sondage mené par Forbes, nous pourrions être parfaits l’un pour l’autre.

 

 

Nos attentes

 

Sous la responsabilité du (de la) ‘Chef, Marketing – Initiatives corporatives et marchands affiliés’, le ou la ‘Spécialiste, Marketing’ participe activement à l’élaboration et à la mise en œuvre de plans 360 pour faire rayonner la marque, les produits et les services, tant à l’externe qu’à l’interne. La personne choisie travaillera en étroite collaboration avec les autres services de l’équipe Marketing (marketing de marque et commandites, marketing intégré, recherche, médias payants et médias sociaux), ainsi qu’avec les agences externes.

 

 

Le rôle

 

•                    Gérer des projets multidisciplinaires d’envergure (campagnes 360, du brief à la livraison) et des projets variés en ayant le client et son parcours au cœur de l’exécution;

•                    Gérer les actions de communications internes et externes dans le but de promouvoir les produits, les services et valoriser limage de lentreprise;

•                    Accompagner les clients internes dans l’élaboration de leurs orientations stratégiques en marketing/communication;

•                    Participer à la production de contenu en lien avec les besoins de l’organisation et les plans médias;

•                    Établir une relation de confiance avec les clients internes (communications internes et externes, développement durable, ressources humaines, opérations et marchands affiliés).



Profil

Les compétences que nous recherchons

 

•                    Diplôme universitaire (en marketing, un atout);

•                    De 3 à 5 années d’expérience dans un poste similaire en marketing/communication;

•                    Expérience en gestion de projets multidisciplinaires et en production vidéo, radio, imprimée et digitale;

•                    Capacité de travailler sous pression et de respecter des délais serrés;

•                    Créativité, innovation et autonomie;

•                    Excellentes aptitudes relationnelles;

•                    Expérience dans le commerce de détail (un atout);

•                    Maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office.



Informations contractuelles

Les avantages que nous offrons

 

•                    Un centre de conditionnement physique, des activités sportives et des douches;

•                    Un centre de la petite enfance pouvant accueillir 78 enfants;

•                    Une cafétéria avec un menu de qualité cuisiné par un chef dédié, des options santé et des stations de café Starbucks et Tim Hortons;

•                    Des rabais exclusifs aux employé(e)s, en plus d’un rabais de 10 % en magasin (dans toutes les enseignes de l’entreprise);

•                    Des avantages sociaux : régime de retraite, primes annuelles, régime d’achat d’actions, programme d’encouragement aux études, etc.;

•                    Des horaires flexibles et du télétravail;

•                    Des bornes de recharge pour voitures électriques;

•                    La possibilité d’évoluer au sein de l’organisation;

•                    Un environnement de travail inclusif et sécuritaire;

•                    Une sensibilité à l’équilibre travail-vie personnelle;

•                    Un employeur engagé dans sa communauté;

•                    Et plus encore!

 

 

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d’alléger le texte. Nous sommes déterminés à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.

 

 




Les compétences que nous recherchons • Diplôme universitaire (en marketing, un atout); • De 3 à 5 années d’expérience dans un poste similaire en marketing/communication; • Expérience en gestion de projets multidisciplinaires et en production vidéo, radio, imprimée et digitale; • Capacité de travailler sous pression et de respecter des délais serrés; • Créativité, innovation et autonomie; • Excellentes aptitudes relationnelles; • Expérience dans le commerce de détail (un atout); • Maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office.

title: Alliance Marketing Coordinator
description:
Join SADA as an Alliance Marketing Coordinator! 

Your Mission 

SADA's SaaS Alliance Program and partner team have experienced tremendous demand and growth. We are seeking an Alliance Marketing Coordinator to help drive SADA's business with our strategic alliance partners. On this highly visible, fast paced team, you'll play a crucial role in implementing joint go-to-market strategies with members of our SaaS Alliance Program. You will have strong partnerships with our internal partner account team, customer success, field sales and corporate marketing teams to execute multi-channel programs that expand SADA's brand awareness, program benefits, and co-marketing and co-selling initiatives with our partner accounts, as well as drive demand through joint marketing and sales initiatives.

This is an exciting opportunity for a tech marketing specialist to help drive the key initiatives of multi-million-dollar ISVs that are growing rapidly. We're looking for someone who is organized,  resourceful, quick on their feet, self-motivated, creative, analytical, and collaborative. 

Responsibilities: 

  • In support of the Alliance Marketing Manager and under direction of the Sr. Director of Strategic Alliance, help develop our joint go-to-market strategies with our alliance partners 
  • Execute plans to achieve brand awareness, drive pipeline and partnership goals with strategic alliance partners and dedicated alliance account managers
  • Collaborate with internal and external cross-functional teams to execute partner marketing programs, including campaigns, conferences and events, product marketing collateral, and sales enablement for field sales teams
  • Build strong relationships with field sales and inside sales teams, and customer success teams to promote SADA's alliance partners' solutions and products, create joint messaging and value propositions, and create partner marketing collateral and programs
  • Create programs to educate and engage sales development representatives, field sales and account management teams to drive new leads and opportunities
  • Effectively communicate with technology and channel partners, and be a resource for both internal and external teams
  • Help the team track and optimize toward objectives and key results

Pathway to Success 

#MakeThemRave: We go all in, all the time – for our customers, our partners and each other. No matter if it's a major project or a small step along the way, we aim high and deliver an exceptional experience. 

Your success starts by positively impacting the direction of a fast-growing practice with vision and passion. You will be measured quarterly by the breadth, magnitude, and quality of your contributions, your ability to estimate accurately, how well you collaborate with your peers, and the consultative polish you bring to customer interactions.  

Expectations

Customer Facing - You will interact with partners (who are also customers) on a regular basis. You can expect to interact with a range of stakeholders, including Alliance Account Managers, Sales Reps, Engineers, Technical Project Managers, Marketing and Executive Team Members.

Onboarding/Training - The first several weeks of onboarding are dedicated to learning and will encompass learning materials/assignments and compliance training, as well as meetings with relevant individuals. Details of the timeline are shared closer to the start date. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, all onboarding will be temporarily conducted remotely.

Job Requirements

  • Bachelor's Degree or higher education qualification 
  • 1-2 years of experience in alliance, channel partner marketing role, ideally within enterprise software, Cloud and SaaS solutions
  • Familiar with Google Cloud and other cloud service providers a plus
  • Experience working with alliances partners on joint marketing plans 
  • Demonstrated ability to build highly effective working relationships with partner sales and marketing teams, supporting the delivery of go-to-market and alliance strategies
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to create content and collateral including presentations, flyers, battlecards, etc and manage creative, social and logistic execution to roll out campaigns to target audiences
  • Results-oriented with a solid understanding of how to prioritize and execute against a strategy 
  • Ability to accommodate cross-time zones, fast-paced environments
  • Experience with Google Workspace a plus
  • Knowledge of how to navigate social media / project management platforms is a plus! (I.e. Hootsuite, HubSpot, Monday.com, and more)

About SADA

Values:  We built our core values on themes that internally compel us to deliver our best to our partners, our customers and to each other. Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to SADA's values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer.

  1. Make them rave
  2. Be data-driven
  3. Think one step ahead
  4. Drive purposeful impact
  5. Do the right thing

Work with the best: SADA has been the largest partner in North America for Google Cloud portfolio of products since 2016 and has been named the 2020, 2019, and 2018 Google Cloud Global Reseller Partner of the Year. SADA has also been awarded Best Place to Work year after year by the Business Intelligence Group, Inc. Magazine, as well as LA Business Journal!

Benefits:Unlimited PTO, Paid Parental Leave, competitive and attractive compensation,  performance-based bonuses, paid holidays, rich medical, dental, vision plans, life, short and long-term disability insurance, 401K/RRSP with match,professional development reimbursement program as well as Google Certified training programs.

Business Performance: SADA has been named to the INC 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Companies list for 15 years in a row garnering Honoree status. CRN has also named SADA on the Top 500 Global Solutions Providers for the past 5 years. The overall culture continues to evolve with engineering at its core:3200+ projects completed, 4000+ customers served, 10K+ workloads and 30M+ users migrated to the cloud.

SADA is committed to the safety of its employees and recommends that new hires receive a COVID vaccination before beginning work.

title: Marketing Generalist
description:
About Energi

Energi (NRG) is a next-generation Proof of Stake (PoS) cryptocurrency, combining Ethereum-compatible smart contracts with on-chain governance, a self-funding treasury, and a layer 2 masternode network, enabling powerful DeFi applications.

We are a fully remote company with no fixed headquarters. The team is spread throughout the Americas, Europe, Africa, Asia, and Oceania. With more than 90 contributors, the team forms a well-linked network across a variety of locations, lifestyles, and backgrounds.

Energi's culture is driven by integrity, strategic thinking, leadership, and the shared desire to perform at our peak. While our differences make us adaptable and versatile, it's our shared values that give us the strength and drive to become the cryptocurrency for world consciousness.

What's in It for You?

  • Work flexible hours from anywhere and be part of a team that is driven by strong values and a clear shared vision.
  • Directly shape the future of a completely new model for cryptocurrency and blockchain applications.
  • Challenge your skills and push your creative limits working with the latest blockchain technologies & systems.
  • Play an active role in one of the most significant technological innovations in human history. 
  • Receive a competitive salary paid in a combination of BTC and NRG.

What we're looking for:

We are looking for a data-driven Marketing Generalist to assist our marketing team with content marketing, social media, strategy development, and other marketing operations. Working closely with all members of the marketing team, the marketing generalist will ensure that all efforts are aligned with long-term marketing goals and strategy. 

To be an ideal candidate, you should have a strong background in marketing with in-depth knowledge of the crypto space and current marketing trends in crypto. You should also thrive in a fast-paced remote environment and be able to switch quickly from one side of marketing operations to the other.  

What You Will Do

  • Work collaboratively across the organization with other departments to coordinate delivery of marketing tasks and projects
  • Assist in the planning and implementation of marketing strategy
  • Research current trends and gather data to inform long-term strategy
  • Conduct regular reviews of Energi's online presence
  • Manage inbound marketing collaboration queries
  • Conduct competitor research and analysis 

Essential Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience in marketing in an agency or in-house team
  • 1+ years of experience in crypto marketing 
  • Self-driven with the ability to deliver results with minimal supervision
  • Experience managing projects and tasks using an established PM platform
  • Fluent English communicator
  • Well-versed in using analytic tools to uncover insights and trends
  • Values aligned with the Energi culture and values

Nice to Have

  • Experience working in a fully remote environment
  • Degree in marketing or another relevant field

This role is not open to 3rd party organizations or agencies. Any candidates sent will be considered free of any charges

Energi is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.

title: Product Analyst (Remote)
description:
Avesdo is a real estate services company powered by technology. Designed to enable success in selling and managing new home transactions across Canada, Avesdo provides a portfolio of services and the â€‹most trusted transaction management software (TMS) platform. To learn more about Avesdo, visit avesdo.com

Our product team is small but mighty! We collaborate with our engineering, sales, and customer service teams to help deliver a platform that enables the sale of thousands of new construction homes each year. We listen to feedback from industry, end-users of all types, and our own internal experts, and translate that into a leading experience. 

Our Product Analyst is someone with critical thinking skills, great attention to detail, excellent writing abilities, and interpersonal skills to work collaboratively with various stakeholders. This position is a pathway to the Product Manager role and a great opportunity for someone who wants to learn and grow as a Product Management professional.

Job Status:  Full-Time

Location: 100% Remote Work (Remote applicants must reside in Canada and have valid Canadian work authorization).

What you'll be doing:

  • Work closely with the Product Manageron key product roadmap items.
  • Collaborate with Software Developers and User Experience Designers to develop and iterate on solutions from initial concept through execution and delivery.
  • Assist in QA test activities including creating test cases to validate that solution releases deliver the expected value, as well as user acceptance and the management of test results.
  • Support the product teams with the development and go-to-market launch of new products and capabilities.
  • Document functional specifications and business process changes related to business requirements
  • Compile industry research and analysis to validate assumptions and uncover new market opportunities.
  • Support product team in user and market research by taking notes, transcribing interviews and recordings, and asking follow-up questions.
  • Maintain all project documentation, database, logs, and records.
  • Research and analyze industry trends and benchmarking information as they apply to Avesdo's business models and domain needs.
  • Draft release notes and content to support future product releases.

Who weâ€™re looking for:

  • 1-2 years of prior experience in Product analysis, Quality Assurance testing, or Business Analysis.
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree preferably in a discipline such as Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or equivalent.
  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to learn new concepts, and technologies.
  • Strong project management, organization, and prioritization abilities.
  • Meticulous attention to detail.
  • Excellent documentation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Deep interest in data, metrics, analysis, and trends and to turn data into stories that key stakeholders can understand.
  • Proven proficiency with Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, Word & PowerPoint.
  • Be able to work in an agile project environment.

Why Avesdo?

  • It's official, we are Great Place To Work-Certified.See what makes us a great place to work.
  • Personal Growth: Mentorship will be available to you and you will learn new things in a rapidly evolving company, grow professionally and have a chance to make your mark on a trillion-dollar real estate industry.
  • Hyper-Growth: Avesdo is growing exponentially; you'll be joining at an exciting time where your contributions matter every day!
  • Great Culture: We foster a culture of well-being and connectedness! To keep things fun and stress-free we have a number of team bonding activities including weekly game sessions we like to call B4, Virtual Wellness Sessions (midday stretches, spring step contest), and more.
  • Enjoy a flexible 100% remote work environment, competitive Base Salary Benefits package, unlimited vacation, home office improvement stipend, and more.

title: Tradeshow marketing coordinator
description:
Are you passionate about retail and exhibition logistics?
You want to work in action or you can split your time between the office with colleagues in an open space and concentrate at home 3 days a week
Do you want to join a national company in Quebec in the hardware industry?
You like to build relationships, negotiate, and you stand out with your skills in planning and managing marketing projects?

You are the person we want to meet!



Advantages
- Salary between $60k and $65k
- WFH 3 days a week and 2 days face to face
- Work schedule: 37.5h Mon to Fri 8:30 am to 5pm
- Group insurance + RRSP (employer contribution) after 3 months
- 2 weeks of vacation + 1 discernable
- Share purchases: 10% of salary and 2% from the employer
- 6 sick days;

Responsibilities
Assistance in the design of displays
o Contacts with suppliers
o Price negotiation
o Approval of demos
o Production and delivery follow-up

Procedure management and site evaluation
o Image management in showrooms
o Uniformity of the facilities
o Implementation of the master plan
o Contact with managers on a weekly basis

Assist in the development of booths for the various exhibits:
- Assist in the development of the layout and displays
- Manage the logistics for the exhibitions

Assist in concept development and supervision of marketing projects
- Brochures, advertisements, sales materials, roadshows, etc.



Qualifications
- BAA business administration, marketing specialization or other related field;
- 3+ years of experience in marketing and events
- Interest in the retail and trade show industry
- Excellent bilingual communication skills (oral and written)
- Knowledge of MS Office suite

Summary
You recognize yourself in this role, so contact me quickly at:

Annick.brouillard@randstad.ca
514.214.8222

Annick

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Sales / Business Development - B2B Consulting Services
description:
About VIRTIRA

VIRTIRA is always looking for bright, naturally organized, on-the-go professionals who crave balance and opportunity. Everyone at VIRTIRA works remotely - we've been working this way for years, so no more worrying about traffic, long commutes, or missing time with family. We embrace work-life balance like no other employer with flexible work schedules, a great culture and plenty of autonomy in return for delivering excellent results.

We believe that work is what you do, not where you are.

VIRTIRA has been producing extraordinary results for the world's most successful sales organizations for over a decade. Our remote-based teams harness the power of innovative project management methods combined with flexible execution strategies to optimize complex sales team activities. We drive internal collaboration and reduce administrative burden to clear the path for sales leaders to focus their team on maximizing revenue.

At VIRTIRA you will learn world-class remote work practices, the latest collaboration tools and software along with proprietary methods for keeping project teams and yourself on track, accountable and winning every day. We work without boundaries and produce results without boundaries for our clients.

We are a diverse employer with customer-focused spirit, heart and hustle.  There truly is no end to the opportunities to learn and grow in our â€œgo for itâ€, entrepreneurial environment!

Live in a rural community? No problem! Reliable, high-speed internet is what matters most. 

Job Summary:

We are looking for an experienced and savvy B2B Business Development Consultant to deliver on our business growth and diversification strategy.  If you are comfortable with a relatively long sales cycle and have the skills for consultative relationship selling, then we want to talk to you!

Responsibilities:

  • Identify, prospect, qualify and select sales opportunities aligned with our business strategy.
  • Develop market coverage strategies in partnership with other business development stakeholders and engage appropriately to accomplish objectives.
  • Identify and continuously monitor changing customer and market trends to identify areas of business growth.
  • Negotiate new contracts and close new business by preparing collateral and presenting our services to prospective clients.
  • Contribute to the alignment of sales and marketing efforts.  
  • Provide timely and accurate sales funnel and forecasting through VIRTIRAâ€™s Hubspot CRM.
  • Leverage attendance at trade shows/conferences and through trade organisations to generate new leads in addition to other traditional lead generation tactics.
  • Nurture strong client relationships to maximize organic growth opportunities.
  • Partner with Marketing to capture and leverage market and customer insights.
  • Contribute to sales department best practices and processes.

Qualifications and skills:

  • 3-5 years experience in direct sales, business development or account management. B2B services or consulting sales experience preferred.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business or Marketing, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Efficient working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
  • Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
  • Confidently able to establish and maintain excellent working relationships with all levels of internal and external colleagues and stakeholders.
  • Impeccable written, verbal communication and influencing skills.
  • Willingness and ability to commit to overnight travel to conferences and to meet prospects.
  • Able to work flexible hours outside of 9 to 5 Monday to Friday to meet the needs of the role.
  • Prior experience prospecting/selling for a service-based company is an asset.
  • Prior experience prospecting/selling in a complex sales environment is an asset.

If you see yourself in this exciting role, we highly encourage you to submit an application!

Thank you for considering VIRTIRA as a potential employer!
We look forward to connecting personally with candidates whose qualifications meet our future needs.

Work Without Boundaries

As a fully remote company, VIRTIRA is proud to have an extremely small environmental footprint â€“ our team produces next to zero carbon emissions, uses hardly any paper and from a community standpoint, we encourage volunteerism through company initiatives.  

 (*It is advised that you monitor your junk mail for any communications regarding your application)

title: Content Marketing Specialist
description:
Cincopa is a complete Digital Asset Management Platform (SaaS) providing an all-in-one hosting solution for videos, audio, images, and podcasts. The Cincopa SaaS solution provides our clients a platform to manage, enhance, embed, and publish content while they monitor and analyze in real-time the engagements with their clients and viewers. 

 

The role

Cincopa is seeking a driven, detail-oriented Content Marketing Specialist to join our growing team. Reporting to the CMO and playing a key role in our marketing strategy, this role will be responsible for leading and executing our content, email, social, and sales material support initiatives. 

If you are a content marketer with a conversion-driven mindset and youâ€™re looking to be a part of a company that truly wants to make a difference, this role is for you.

Daily responsibilities

  • Write and edit high-quality content (blogs, social media posts, case studies, landing pages, emails, sales materials, etc). 
  • Monitoring site metrics and identifying content optimization opportunities.
  • Manage Cincopaâ€™s blog and resources, building a strategic content calendar that prioritizes topics that support lead generation objectives.
  • Understand new features and solutions, create content marketing, and adjust per channel. 
  • Manage the creative review process touchpoints, external and internal.
  • Blog on an ongoing basis to support and promote your offers and to attract site visitors through search, social media, and email subscribers.
  • Growing our subscriber base by providing them with regular, helpful content. 
  • Gathering customer feedback on documentation to improve usability.
  • Generating innovative ideas for content and workflow solutions.
  • Researching and editing existing documents and resources.
  • Collaborate with design, sales, and customer success to create collateral that supports company objectives. 
  • Conduct ongoing keyword and competitor research in order to create content for the site, landing page, on platform pages. 
  • Support the marketing team in any other duties as assigned.
  • Collaborating with product marketers, sales, external influencers, and industry experts to produce relevant content that meets the needs of both key stakeholders and our audience.
  • Creating high-quality, value-driven GRC resources that drive leads, subscribers, and awareness (user guides, technical overviews, ebooks, whitepapers, infographics, templates, etc.)


Requirements

  • Fluent English.
  • BA/BS in business preferred or equivalent experience.
  • Strong writing, analytical, and presentation skillsâ€”so much so that you can take even the most complex processes and technologies and translate them into simple and digestible content (written, graphica, and verbal).
  • Comfortable with technology and can pick up new platforms, tools, and features quickly.
  •  You think marketing software is anything but boring.
  • 3 years experience in SaaS B2B content marketing with improving organic performance and SEO. 
  • Experience on the latest tactics and algorithm changes to drive qualified organic traffic.
  • A portfolio of B2B marketing writing samples is required.
  • A self-starter with excellent project management skills and the ability to lead and manage time-sensitive, cross-functional initiatives in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial environment with little supervision.
  • Experience executing a variety of marketing initiatives as part of managing an integrated content marketing program â€“ e.g., developing, writing, and editing a variety of marketing assets and other content, including white papers, case studies, e-books, guides, web copy, and digital ads.
  • Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop)
  • Expert knowledge of Google Search Console, Google Analytics, and SEMrush.  
  • Experience using marketing automation tools like Pardot, Marketo, or HubSpot

 

Compensation Package

 

Base Salary | Monthly Commission | Team Goals (Q/Y) Bonuses | Extended Health Care Benefits | Home Office Allowance

 

Learning & Developing | Career Growth

Cincopa is dedicated to supporting new members by building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and growth. Successful candidates will get the opportunity to work with colleagues with a broad mix of experience levels and tenures. The Content Marketing Specialist will be on a career growth path where assigned projects will be based on developing into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

title: Product Advisor - Calgary Market Mall
description:
A LITTLE BIT ABOUT US...

At Rocky Mountain Soap, we are PASSIONATE about everything NATURAL! For over 20 years, we have been crafting natural recipes right in the Rocky mountains with one goal in mind..to remove toxins from the world.  Itâ€™s our way of feeling great about the products we put out there, supporting our community with career opportunities, sustainable initiatives, and creating natural enthusiasts across Canada! The Rocky team is at the HEART of what we do, and our team is growing.  Not only do we make products that are good for you, we want people that want to make a difference too.  If you love a healthy planet, care about natural ingredients, and want to work in a fun, inclusive, retail environment, then the Rocky family might be the right fit for you!

DOES THIS SOUND LIKE YOU?

  • You have proven success in offering extreme customer service in a retail setting
  • You have amazing operational and detail orientated administrative skills
  • You have a love for natural products and their benefits
  • You can demonstrate how our products are used to customers
  • You are goal-oriented and organized and looking to develop your business skills
  • You want to have fun at work, laugh and make our customers and co-workers happy
  • You are willing to commit to open and flexible availability. Thursday - Sunday availability for 15-20 hours a week.

BENEFITS & PERKS

  • bonuses based on performance additional to your base wage.
  • Product discounts
  • A happy, flexible and healthy work environment
