title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Passionate about creating engaging customer experiences? Love challenges and are recognized for making things happen? Join the Browns’ Marketing team and be a part of the digital transformation of one of Canada’s largest footwear retailers.


Browns is looking for a highly motivated Marketing Coordinator who is not afraid of challenges and who is ready to invest him/herself in the success of the company. Reporting to the Creative Production Manager, you will assist in the planning and execution of high-performance marketing activities. The ideal candidate is organized, detail-oriented, dependable and eager to learn. Must love marketing, fashion, and shoes!


Responsibilities for Creative Marketing Coordinator


  • Support the creative marketing department's initiatives with the planning, executing, and tracking tasks such as emails, social media, or content marketing.
  • Collaborate with strategic partners to ensure that output is aligned with overall business objectives
  • Manage Creative team work flow to ensure deadlines are respected.
  • Coordinate content for email marketing campaigns, including artwork, copy, scheduling, testing.
  • Proofread copy for various marketing channels, ensuring consistent voice.
  • Assist with developing and managing content and social media marketing programs.
  • Create weekly status report of ongoing projects
  • Conduct market research and identify trends


Qualifications for Marketing Coordinator


  • Experience in coordinating or project management a must.
  • Strong organizational and project management skills, as well as attention to detail
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Good understanding of various marketing platforms, channels, and best practices, including social, digital, and email marketing
  • Must be a self-starter and able to independently move projects forward, priotitize tasks, and meet deadlines
  • Must have a high level of creativity
  • Works collaboratively
  • Able to effectively receive and communicate feedback
  • Must be positive, agile, and be a solutions thinker
  • Eager to learn


While we appreciate your interest in this role, please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.


Thank you for your interest in Browns


Vous êtes passionné par la création d'expériences client attrayantes ? Vous aimez les défis et êtes reconnu pour faire bouger les choses ? Rejoignez l'équipe Marketing de Browns et participez à la transformation numérique de l'un des plus grands détaillants de chaussures au Canada.


Browns est à la recherche d'un coordinateur ou une coordinatrice marketing très motivé(e), qui n'a pas peur des défis et qui est prêt(e) à s'investir dans le succès de l'entreprise. Relevant du gestionnaire de la production créative, vous participerez à la planification et à l'exécution d'activités de marketing performantes. Le/la candidat(e) idéal(e) est organisé(e), soucieux(se) des détails, fiable et désireux(se) d'apprendre. Il/elle doit aimer le marketing, la mode et les chaussures !


Responsabilités du coordinateur ou de la coordinatrice du marketing créatif


  • Soutenir les initiatives du département de marketing créatif par la planification, l'exécution et le suivi de tâches telles que les courriels, les médias sociaux ou le marketing de contenu.
  • Collaborer avec les partenaires stratégiques pour s'assurer que les résultats sont conformes aux objectifs commerciaux globaux.
  • Gérer le flux de travail de l'équipe créative afin de garantir le respect des délais.
  • Coordonner le contenu des campagnes de marketing par courriel, y compris les illustrations, le texte, la programmation et les tests.
  • Corriger le texte pour les différents canaux de marketing, en veillant à la cohérence de la voix.
  • Aider à développer et à gérer le contenu et les programmes de marketing des médias sociaux.
  • Créer un rapport hebdomadaire sur l'état d'avancement des projets en cours
  • Réaliser des études de marché et identifier les tendances


Qualifications pour le/la coordinateur/trice marketing


  • Expérience de la coordination ou de la gestion de projets indispensable.
  • Solides compétences en matière d'organisation et de gestion de projet, ainsi que le souci du détail.
  • Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale.
  • Bonne compréhension des diverses plateformes, canaux et meilleures pratiques de marketing, y compris le marketing social, numérique et par courriel.
  • Doit être autonome et capable de faire avancer les projets de manière indépendante, de prioriser les tâches et de respecter les délais.
  • Doit faire preuve d'un haut niveau de créativité
  • Travailler en collaboration
  • Être capable de recevoir et de communiquer efficacement des commentaires
  • Doit être positif, agile et avoir le sens des solutions.
  • être avide d'apprendre.


Bien que nous apprécions votre intérêt pour ce poste, veuillez noter que seuls les candidats sélectionnés seront contactés.


Merci de l'intérêt que vous portez à Browns

title: Marketing Co-ordinator
description:
This a fast-paced role that involves working closely with their Head of Marketing and Senior Leadership Team to facilitate our marketing activities across the United States, and Canada. This plays an important role in the growth of their rapidly expanding global business.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage all aspects of HubSpot, sending newsletters and email communications, running campaigns and tracking results
  • Help maintain the company website, making updates, publishing new content, building landing pages
  • Develop and execute promotion plans for their content and news announcements
  • Running their LinkedIn paid ads, and social media accounts and developing strategies to help grow their following
  • Update and maintain a variety of marketing collateral which consists of presentations, fact sheets, adhering to brand guidelines
  • Track, analyze and reporting on key metrics
  • Managing a variety of ad hoc marketing requests including, but not limited to, running surveys and webinars, overseeing events, and managing special projects

Requirements:

  • 2+ years experience in a similar marketing role
  • Demonstrated HubSpot experience
  • Strong written and oral communication
  • Planning, organization, and time management skills
  • Comfortable using Google Slides and Adobe InDesign if needed (or willing to learn)
  • Excellent close attention to detail
  • Passionate about consistently meeting or exceeding performance objectives
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines, both under supervision
  • Strives in a fast-paced environment
  • Prior experience in technology, professional services or financial services sectors preferred but not required
  • Bachelor’s degree
    Marketing Co-ordinator
This is a full-time position located in Downtown Toronto on a hybrid work from home model due to Covid-19. It will require to be onsite 5 days a week post pandemic.

title: Marketing Specialist, Contractor Services
description:
Job Description:
Do you want to work in the heart of retail at one of the fastest growing and most successful retailers in the World?
Right now is an exceptionally dynamic time for retail and The Home Depot Canada is committed to being a leader in that transformation. We know that to do this, we need to invest in our retail experience, our technology but most importantly, our people. Our Associates’ talent is what has made us the #1 Home Improvement Retailer and what will keep us leading in retail. At The Home Depot, product innovation, customer service and exceptional value is why our customers keep coming back – our competitive advantage.
As part of the greater Pro, Loyalty Marketing team, the Marketing Specialist helps to plan and implement all marketing activities for the Contractor Services team, supporting our Pro, Home Services and Rental businesses, which includes all three of our growing base of customers – our Pro, DIFM (Do It For Me) and DIY (Do It Yourself) customers. In this role, the Marketing Specialist will lead and support campaigns ranging from brand building, product excitement and know-how focused, to CRM-based opportunities as we look to attract, retain and grow our customer base. Finally, the Marketing Specialist is empowered to lead their campaigns and partner with cross-functional teams to deliver on marketing objectives, as well as optimize current campaigns to improve performance.
This candidate will report directly into the Marketing Manager, Contractor Services.


What you will do:

The Marketing Specialist is a champion for our customers. In this position, the Marketing Specialist will develop their marketing skills by:

  • Leading marketing execution across cross-functional teams in display, social, digital flyer, email, online, TV, magazine, radio, other digital marketing channels Acting as the main point of contact for their cross-functional partners in order to help support the planning, production and launch of their marketing campaigns
  • Delivering campaign analysis, reporting and insights to influence and improve future campaigns
  • Developing test plans to continuously optimize and maximize campaign results
  • Building and maintaining an annual marketing and customer calendar, and competitive tracker
  • Communicating with internal partners to drive awareness and excitement for the marketing campaign
  • Executing against new and exciting marketing campaigns that will help differentiate and lead the market for the Contractor Services portfolio
  • Collaborating with key cross-functional partners such as the Pro, Home Services and Rental Operations team, Advertising, Production & Media partners, as well as merchants and other peer marketing teams to gain feedback and alignment in delivering against marketing campaigns goals
  • Influencing segmentation and targeting strategies to tailor the right message to the right audience



Who you are:
We are looking for people who are passionate about the customer and retail and:

  • Are a self-starter, driven by results and continuous improvement
  • Have strong project management and analytical skills
  • Build strong relationships and collaborate with colleagues, stake holders and vendors
  • Take the initiative to solve a challenge and seek new opportunities to test and learn
  • Focus on providing data and insights to guide key decisions
  • Love to plan and optimize resources to hit objectives
  • Are strong multi-taskers that can prioritize tasks to meet business objectives
  • Have strong communication skills and the ability to influence stakeholders
  • Have a strong attention to detail


What you have done:

  • You have an undergraduate degree preferably in business, marketing or retail
  • You have 3+ years of previous marketing experience
  • You can build compelling presentations
  • You have a strong analytical mindset to measure marketing performance and identify key insights
  • You are a passionate marketer with experience in digital media
  • Brand Marketing experience is an asset


Internal Candidates: Must fulfill minimum time-in-position (1 year) and performance management code requirements (M+, Meets Expectations and Consistently Demonstrates)

title: Sr. Product Analyst
description:
AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

  • Support the product org with product metrics reporting
  • Support product org with insights and suggestions on feature usage
  • Support product managers with reporting requirements and performance measurement of new products & features
  • Define, track, and report on product success measurement criteria

 

KPIs FOR THIS ROLE

  • Create product usage reporting requirements
  • Document reporting gaps and work with necessary teams to find solutions
  • Maintain product & feature KPIs and Dashboards

 

PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide business requirements and collaborate with internal teams on data capture strategy that will support accurate reporting and insights on sales pattern and consumer behavior
  • Evaluating analytics processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
  • Perform ad-hoc and in-depth analyses
  • Drive initiatives to improve reporting capabilities
  • Explore new data sources to add signals to existing reporting
  • Create reports and self-service dashboards to provide ongoing insight to business stakeholders, support product leadership in making effective, analytically driven, and strategic decisions
  • Provide scientific driven insights to executive leadership through weekly and monthly reporting

 

TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES

  • Proficiency in SQL (e.g. Joins, sub-queries, window functions, CTE, LAG)
  • Experience in Python/R
  • Forecasting and Modeling: Sheets, Excel, etc.
  • Ability to design testable hypotheses
  • Working knowledge of analytical and data visualization tools (Python, R, and/or Tableau) if are using any BI tools

 

NON-TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to propose complex solutions and explanations in writing
  • Ability to break down business requirements into engineering and data requirements
  • Ability to transform complex reporting into concise digestible reports and insights
  • Excellent project management skills
  • Strong verbal and presentation/communication skills; be able to build a narrative around what you see in the data and translate to the non-technical stakeholders

 

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

  • Proficiency in querying and manipulating complex raw datasets for analysis. SQL skills required, experience with Python/R, ETL a bonus
  • 5+ years of advanced proficiency in Excel (including Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc)
  • Knowledge of Git version control (Github, Bitbucket)
  • Experience with designing scientifically accurate research and performing statistical analysis on large data sets
  • BS/MS Degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Finance and other quantitative areas
  • 5+ years’ experience in sales/business reporting/analytics
  • Effective at working independently and as a member of a cross functional team
  • Experience explaining technical concepts and analysis implications clearly to varied audiences and be able to translate business objectives into actionable analyses
 

About TapClicks

TapClicks, Inc is a Smart Marketing cloud solution and a leading marketing technology company for agencies, media companies, brands, and enterprises. Its integrated Marketing Operations Platform includes sales enablement, workflow, and order management, analytics, and automated reporting – all within a single intuitive user interface available on-demand in the cloud. TapClicks was founded in 2015, is headquartered in Silicon Valley, has development and sales offices in Boston, London, Hyderabad and Montreal. But enough about us!

title: Senior Affiliate Specialist
description:
Company Description

SSENSE (pronounced [es-uhns]) is a global technology platform operating at the intersection of culture, community, and commerce. Headquartered in Montreal, it features a mix of established and emerging luxury brands across womenswear, menswear, kids-wear, and Everything Else™.

SSENSE has garnered critical acclaim as both an e-commerce engine and a producer of cultural content, generating an average of 100 million monthly page views. Approximately 80% of its audience is between the ages of 18 to 40. It is privately held and has achieved high double digit annual growth and profitability since its inception.

Job Description

Reporting to the Senior Affiliate Manager, the Senior Affiliate Specialist will be responsible for the management and optimization of key strategic affiliate accounts and operational areas as well as for contributing to the growth of the channel by delivering projects and initiatives in line with the functional roadmap.

Responsibilities 

  • Is recognized as an SME in own area within the function, with specialized expertise
  • Help develop overall marketing strategy to accelerate growth of the affiliate channel 
  • Manage relationships with publishers, service providers and affiliate networks 
  • Manage affiliate channel reporting, ensuring proper spend, ROAS and profitability,  
  • Proactively optimize commission based on cpa elasticity and weekly performance
  • Actively communicate and negotiate media buys with top affiliate partners 
  • Research, assess, and leverage growth opportunities though publisher recruitment, B2B partnerships and new models
  • Identify, obtain buy-in, and organize resources to deliver against medium sustainable performance improvement initiatives with signed off measurement
  • Support the Affiliate Manager in developing business cases to push the affiliates business further 
  • Communicate with internal departments to solve issues, identify trends and improve internal processes
  • Interpret internal or external business issues and recommends solutions/best practices
  • Solve complex problems, taking a broad perspective to identify solutions
  • Receives moderate to low level of guidance, depending of the complexity of the situation
  • Monitor compliance of existing partners with program terms and conditions and identify fraudulent activity 
  • Manage some operational tasks, such as commission validation, asset management or newsletter communications
  • Stay abreast of the latest advertising industry trends 
  • Attend training and affiliate conferences in other cities to meet publishers in person 

 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, Economics, or related field, Master a strong asset 
  • 5-7 years of total experience, 4 years experience in affiliate marketing 
  • Experience in a supervisory role, an asset 
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel in particular) and Google Analytics

  • Very strong analytical skills 
  • Strong ability to present, synthesize and influence change 
  • Highly motivated, self-driven and organized 
  • Creative thinker with excellent problem solving abilities 
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, performance-driven environment.

title: Marketing Specialist, Brand & Special Projects
description:
Company Description

Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We’ve built something great, something special – an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. Our purpose-based platform HUMANATURE and philosophy that humans are a part of nature and nature is a part of us informs everything we do. From the materials we use to the products we make, everything is meticulously crafted and built to last. At Canada Goose we endure any condition, observe every detail, and take the long view in order to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm.

Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.

Job Description

As a Marketing Specialist, Brand & Special Projects you will Execute and deliver on brand marketing projects, special projects, and collaboration partnership plans, reflective of brand strategy, including value proposition and integration options to be brought to market.

If you have finger on the pulse of global trends in both luxury & fast fashion and have a strong passion for culture, sneaker and streetwear culture, popular culture, and women’s culture with epic organizational skills with the ability to juggle multiple projects at once without breaking a sweat, keep reading! This role is for you. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop go-to-market sales plans, writing and delivering project briefs, brand campaign project management – on time and within budget constraints to ensure department and company goals are met.
  • Support the Brand Manager in the development of brand marketing plans and campaigns
  • Manage collaboration partnerships and special project programs by collaborating with partners and internal creative production for full funnel creative presentations
  • Liaise with sample production and planning teams to procure photoshoot samples ahead of each campaign
  • Maintain and manage timelines and budgets
  • Provide post-project reporting and analysis on program successes and challenges as well as campaign ROI
  • Ensure alignment across all platforms including .com and mobile, connecting the in-store and online brand stories to maintain the connection across platforms
  • Manage Collabs & Special Projects go-to-market Calendar
  • Proactively contribute creative marketing ideas for brand initiatives and special projects
  • Analyze trends, business results and the competitive environment; identify consumer insights and translate insights into action

About You: 

  • University degree in business or marketing-related field
  • 3-4 years of Marketing experience
  • Brand Partnerships experience considered a strong asset
  • Proven record of success in traditional and non-traditional marketing with measurable results
  • Superior computer skills, especially MS Office, Excel (pivot tables), Word and PowerPoint
  • Experience in the entertainment or apparel industry is a plus
  • Strong analytical and project management skills
  • Be the source! Know the hype hunter and luxury consumer and understand their behaviors.
  • Think social first - Deep understanding of the TikTok/Instagram generation
  • Solution-oriented with a focus on delivering a consumer centric approach
  • Ability to effectively communicate and bring people together
  • Constantly curious and always challenging the status quo

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Overview:

At TrackDDB, data is the driving force behind our creative solutions. Our team of talented professionals â€“ from analysts and technologists to strategists and creatives â€“ works together to exceed our clientsâ€™ business objectives through the perfect mix of data, strategy and creativity.

 

We are searching for a dedicated, team-oriented Data  Marketing Analyst who is a strong, confident communicator and is adaptable to different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets. In this role, they will pair their digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. They will find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. They must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy.  

 

What we can offer you:

  • A friendly culture deeply rooted in mutual respect for everyoneâ€™s time and individual goals
  • Opportunity for professional growth, training and industry leadership in our category
  • DDB perks, including competitive benefits, referral bonuses and our unique FUEL program to help fund inspiration outside of working hours
Responsibilities:
  • Work directly with clients, team members and senior leadership to develop analytics strategy  
  • Improve  profitability and drive revenue through  creating  effective  KPIs  and optimization of metrics that affect them
  • Guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of development
  • Lead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation  requirements gathering and documentation,  split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data mining
  • Ensure the  integrity  of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and training
  • Drive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark data
  • Interpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder  needs
  • Use advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environment
  • Facilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting,  creative  and offers
  • Creation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualization
Qualifications:
  • Curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environment
  • Undergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline
  • 1-3+ years analytical experience: strong presentation skills,  flexible,  adaptable, resourceful, assertive &  proactive,  able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation
  • Deep knowledge  of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communications
  • Experience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformation
  • Keen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadership
  • A strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-oriented
  • Experience with marketing attribution modeling
  • Demonstrated experience in  requirements gathering and documentation  for web analytics implementation including  KPI  development, tagging and report automation.
  • Intermediate level capabilities with  SQL
  • Intermediate level capabilities with Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics
  • Familiarity  with R and/or Python
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projects
  • Bonus Points for:
    • Experience with Tableau
    • Proficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)

 

#DDBCANADA

title: Bilingual Senior Advisor, Content Marketing
description:
Job Description


Seeing beyond numbersº
At Laurentian Bank, we believe we can change banking for the better. Founded in Montreal in 1846, Laurentian Bank helps families, businesses and communities thrive. Today, we have over 2,800 employees working together as One Team, to provide a broad range of financial services and advice-based solutions for customers across Canada and the United States. We drive results by placing our customers first, making the better choice, acting courageously, and believing everyone belongs.

This role sits within Laurentian Bank, a subsidiary of Laurentian Bank Financial Group.

The Bilingual Senior Advisor, Content Marketing is responsible for working within a collaborative marketing team to establish strategic marketing plans and developing English and French marketing content to support the Laurentian Bank, B2B Bank and LBC Digital brands.

This role requires an entrepreneurial and creative individual with exceptional English and French communication skills, the ability to work collaboratively, and a track record of delivering complex marketing programs on time and on budget.

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced content marketer to join our team and play a key role in our digital transformation.

Responsibilities



º Develop annual marketing and campaign plans focused on content strategy related to new and existing products and services to support customer acquisition and retention
º Provide input into the editorial calendar and annual planning activities
º Lead the development of marketing content for assigned portfolios/projects for all marketing channels and audiences, including product information, promotional campaigns, and thought leadership
º Collaborate with the Product and Project Management teams to determine marketing objectives across assigned lines of business/projects
º Work with the Client Analytics and Insights team to ensure effective targeting of messages and ongoing campaign measurement
º Collaborate with the Business Development team to develop sales support strategies and marketing materials
º Partner with the Marketing Services team on the development and execution of marketing programs
º Manage the agency relationship
º Contribute to other marketing activities as required, including public relations activities, advertising and digital marketing
º Support the marketing and communications needs of other departments including Operations, Client Services and Business Development
º Establish and manage strong working relationships with colleagues, relevant stakeholders and other business partners
º Develop and report on key marketing metrics
º Assume responsibility for assigned budget, including management and reporting
º Act as a brand advocate and champion the client experience across all marketing touch-points
º Ensure compliance with all relevant policies and procedures
º Perform other marketing duties as assigned

Qualifications


º University degree in a related field with 5 to 7 years of related marketing experience, including digital marketing
º Experience within the financial services industry specific to retail banking and B2B/B2C marketing and communications
º Experience managing agency and vendor relationships
º A strong understanding of the regulatory environment impacting financial services
º Self-motivated and results oriented individual with strong leadership, decision-making, analytical and problem-solving skills
º Creative, strategic thinker with a client-centric mindset
º A highly effective communicator with well-developed presentation skills
º Strong relationship management, negotiation and influencing skills
º Organized and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting established timelines
º Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications, Hootsuite
º Demonstrated ability in core and role specific competencies including teamwork, adaptability, customer service, planning, presentation, analytical, decision-making skills
º Bilingualism (French / English) required

Additional Information


Equity, Diversity & Inclusion
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible work environment that reflects the diversity of our customers and our communities. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, including Indigenous people, women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities, regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability or any other legally-protected ground.

Accessibility
Accommodations for persons with disabilities are available upon request for job applicants taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process.

PIPEDA
We may collect, use or disclose your personal information for the purpose of establishing an employment relationship with you.

title: Communications Consultant
description:
Summary

Health Canada is seeking a Communications Consultant to support staffing and human resource needs of the Health Products and Food Branch. This will ensure that all Investment Plan projects have strategic communication plans, communications support materials to disseminate information, as well as technical material that will be used to convey requirements and business objectives in an efficient manner. The Communications Consultant’s initiatives will deliver clear value to Canadians, along with greatest efficiency by modifying information workflows, developing strategic communication strategies, and cutting redundant operations.

Responsibilities

  • Planning, researching, modifying, assisting, writing and/or reviewing memos, scripts, plays, essays, speeches, manuals, and other non-journalistic articles with conformance to established standards on HPFB projects
  • Developing and implementing strategic communication plans
  • Providing communications consultation advice to support strategic communications initiatives and strategies
  • Creating communications support materials
  • Developing and implementing creative communication and information products using a variety of tools, techniques and media and selecting an appropriate medium to convey information, ideas, and results
  • Expressing and exchanging information in a clear and concise manner
  • Ensuring information is communicated to the appropriate people in a timely manner
  • Preparing reports for specific purposes using clear, communicative, and professional language
  • Provide advice on matters relating to policy/program development approaches or options and communications planning alternatives?
  • Researching, developing, and implementing communications strategies involving social media and related content
  • Providing suggestions on cost-cutting measures in the communications process

Mandatories

  • Hold a valid Covid-19 certificate to allow for on-site work
  • Hold a valid Secret clearance
  • Possess one of the following: Post- Secondary Education in Technical Writing, Journalism, Literature, and/or Communications, Certified Professional Technical Communicator (CPTC), Technical Writing Certificate, and/or, Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP®)
  • 7+ years’ experience as a Communications Consultant
  • Previous experienceusing word-processing, desk-top publishing, and graphics software packages to produce final camera-ready copy

title: Sr. Marketing Analytics Consultant, Post-Campaign Analysis - Remote Ontario
description:
Sr. Marketing Analytics Consultant, Post-Campaign Analysis - Remote Ontario

TTEC Consulting’s Insights Practice is looking for a Marketing Analytics Manager to provide value-added marketing consulting. More specifically, this person will design and measure campaigns, develop ad-hoc analyses, and recommend steps to optimize so our clients meet their marketing objectives. The role is expected to provide strategic direction on the development of new campaigns, including targeting strategy, value proposition development, and financial performance evaluation.

Are you a curious, strategic problem solver who is comfortable working through complex business problems? Here you will be applying your ability to think critically (to make sound judgements),  analytically (to mine the data), and creatively (to develop program ideas).You will pull your insights into a crisp, easy to understand presentation, and speak to the results with confidence.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Manage analytics projects - along with internal team, clients and agency partners - from beginning to completion
  • Translate business questions into an analytics scope, establish requirements and conduct analyses for campaign performance and other ad-hoc projects using multiple programming outputs
  • Develop comprehensive deliverables with a focus on providing concise actionable data-driven marketing insights and recommendations
  •  Present insights and recommendations to a range of stakeholders in client meetings
  • Collaborate and ideate with stakeholders on test and learn opportunities
  • Oversee the creation, maintenance and distribution of reports used for monitoring the performance of key always-on initiatives

What you’ll bring to us:

  • 3-5 years of professional experience in a marketing consulting, data-driven marketing, and/or campaign analysis role, with a demonstrated ability to interpret data and provide strategic recommendations
  • Solid understanding of CRM concepts and practices
  • Basic knowledge of statistical concepts including significance testing, sampling, etc
  • Experience creating and delivering high impact, easy to follow presentations
  • Proficiency in Excel
  • Project and client management experience

Additional skills that would be a plus:

  • Experience with forecasting
  • Ability to leverage data visualization tools, such as PowerBI and Tableau

What You Can Expect:

  • Dedication to your career growth and professional development
  • Actively diverse and inclusive culture
  • Community-minded organization committed to giving back
  • Global team of curious lifelong learners guided by our company values
  • And yes... all the competitive compensation, performance bonus opportunities, benefits you'd expect and maybe a few that would pleasantly surprise you

Who We Are:

TTEC Digital is a pioneer in customer experience, engagement and growth solutions. TTEC’s 50,000 employees serve customers in more than 80 countries and 50 languages across social, mobile, and digital channels. We utilize a holistic approach, applying solutions from two centers of excellence, Engage and Digital, to help companies provide an amazing experience to their customers, inspire customer loyalty, and grow their business. Our employees live by a set of customer-focused values that guide relationships with clients, their customers and each other.

TTEC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. TTEC embraces and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce that respects and empowers the cultures and perspectives within our global teams. We strive to reflect the communities we serve, by not only delivering amazing service and technology, but also humanity. We make it a point to make sure all our employees feel valued, belonging and comfortable being their authentic selves at work. As a global company, we know diversity is our strength because it enables us to view things from different vantage points and every individual to bring value to the table in their own unique way. But don’t take our word for it, check out some of the diversity and women in leadership awards on TTECjobs.com.

For more information about TTEC, visit ttecjobs.com or search #ExperienceTTEC throughout social media to engage in the global conversation.

#LI-Remote

Primary Location

: CA-ON-London

Job

: Consulting

title: Category Analyst
description:
Location: Toronto, ON, CanadaJob Type: ContractDate: 4/25/2022Job ID: GJ2195310425Category: Office Professionals

Join a top employer and advance your career. David Aplin Group has partnered with a Toronto based company to hire a Category Analyst.

Perks & Benefits:
  • 6-month contract with potential for an extension. 
  • A hybrid role with 3 days a week in the office and 2 days working remotely
  • Option of 8am to 4pm or 9am to 5pm daily work schedule
  • Compensation $23/an hour 

Responsibilities:
  • Coordinate and close the loop on all internal merchandising communication needs and activities on In-Store Fulfillment and other assigned categories
  • Facilitate and help complete the product listings and delisting and execute the assortment decisions made the Category Merchant
  • Ensure the agreed to merchandising plans set by the Category Merchant are communicated and executed for weekly, monthly, and seasonal timeframes.
  • Respond to article resolutions that reach the merchandising team on their set of categories
  • Liaise with field merchandising, operations, etc. on opportunities specific to their respective categories
  • Secure any missing information required for the merchandising services team to execute tasks such as costing, deals, retails, report requirements, RSC’s deleted items, etc. 
  • Support activities to achieve targeted sales and margin targets for the merchandising team

Qualifications:
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office
  • Familiarity with SAP would be considered an asset
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in an analytical role 
  • College Diploma or Degree in Economics or Accounting preferred 

Job ID:  GJ2195310425 

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Magna Generic Job Profile
description:
Group Description

Magna is an innovative leader in the development and manufacturing of high quality complete seating systems. Our solution includes seating structures, mechanisms and hardware, as well as foam and trim products for global automotive, heavy truck and bus industries. Our capabilities include market and consumer research; full concept development; design and engineering capabilities; testing, validation and world-class manufacturing. Our award-winning seating solutions are developed from consumer research, finding the ease of operation to be comfortable, convenient and connected.

 

Role Summary

 

Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Manager Advanced Purchasing & Supply Chain Design m/w/d am Standort Sailauf.

Key Responsibilities

Key Qualifications/Requirements

 

 

  • Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Einkauf in der Automobilbranche
  • Erfahrung in einem multikulturellen Geschäftsumfeld
  • Vertiefte Kenntnisse der QAF- und Kostenanalysetechniken
  • Kenntnis aller einschlägigen Rechtsnormen, Unternehmensrichtlinien und -verfahren
  • Solides technisches Verständnis (sowohl für Produkte als auch für Prozesse)
  • Benchmarking und Analyse der Kostenstruktur
  • Kenntnisse des Vertragsrechts und des Vertragsmanagements
  • Lean Supply Chain Methoden und Tools
  • verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Additional Information

 

  • Home Office Anteil (bis zu 2 Tage pro Woche)
  • 30 Tage Urlaub
  • flexible Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeit)
  • Benefits: Hort- und Kindergartenzuschuss, Mitarbeitergewinnbeteiligung, Zuschuss zur Altersvorsorge
  • kostenfrei Wasser, Kaffee und Obst; Kantinenzuschuss
  • kostenfreie Parkmöglichkeiten
  • Profitieren Sie zudem von attraktiven Angeboten und Vergünstigungen

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: Marketing and Proposal Coordinator
description:
Company Description

We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.

Job Description

IBI Group's Calgary office is seeking a Marketing and Proposal Coordinator to join the Canada West Regional Marketing Team.

IBI Group is a technology-driven design firm, providing architecture, engineering, planning, systems, and technology services to our clients for nearly 50 years.  With more than 3,200 professionals located in over 60 offices around the world, we create responsive, resilient spaces and smart urban environments by bringing the established capabilities from our Intelligence practice into our core Buildings and Infrastructure businesses. From high-rises to hospitals, and transit systems to schools, we shape the way people live, work, move, learn, and heal in the cities of tomorrow.

The Marketing and Proposal Coordinator will be a key player in a small, dynamic marketing and graphics team. As a Marketing and Proposal Coordinator, you will be an integral part of diverse project teams and will work with different departments and specializations within the firm. Working with senior leadership, you will assist with determining projects to pursue and put together proposal responses that align with IBI Group’s strategic plan. The successful candidate will be a proactive, collaborative team player with great attention to detail and the ability to follow and improve process.  This position will have the flexibility of a hybrid work situation, combining a "work from home" and in office work environment.

Most of the things you’ll work on:

  • Coordinating with the proposal leads, professional technical staff and marketing/graphics team to prepare proposals which includes collecting and analyzing business related information, writing, designing, editing and producing proposal documents;
  • Acting as the primary point of contact during the proposal process, creating a submission schedule for the proposal team in regard to communications and reminders on internal proposal deliverables and deadlines;
  • Contributing to the generation, collection, dissemination and storage of proposal-related information, and analyzing in-bound proposal requests (such as RFQ, RFP, EOI, etc.) to help prepare responses;
  • Developing opportunity-specific content as necessary, including organizational charts and schedules;
  • Coordinating team members and implementing internal deadlines to complete proposal forms, custom resume alterations, additional information from subcontractors, etc. to meet the proposal due date;
  • Maintaining and updating CRM and content library with high quality content;
  • Assisting with non-technical writing for proposal efforts and provide editorial oversight, including copy writing and editing;
  • Supporting marketing functions as needed including: event organization and facilitation, photography, writing project descriptions, liaising with global communications team, and supporting speaking engagements and presentations;
  • Creating content and stories for social media highlighting Calgary and Western Canada projects;
  • Meeting with Corporate Marketing Team to ensure brand standards are upheld;
  • Conducting market research on upcoming awards and supporting project teams on award submissions;
  • Tracking and coordinating project photography;
  • Authoring the internal weekly IBI newsletter with important announcements, project wins and social event updates and stories;
  • Participating in and facilitating marketing/proposal strategy sessions;
  • Supporting important office communications and announcements, proof-reading, editing, etc.
Qualifications

What we are looking for:

  • 2-4 years in the AEC Industry is preferred;
  • Post-Secondary Degree in English, Marketing, Communications or other relevant discipline;
  • Excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills (technical/proposal writing would be a definite asset);
  • Ability to read an RFP and respond to key requirements;
  • Proficiency of Microsoft Office as well as Adobe Creative Suite, specifically InDesign, Photoshop; Illustrator would be an asset.
  • Ability to work with diverse professionals and varying technical disciplines
  • Accountable and able to take ownership over work;
  • Strong organization skills with great attention to detail;
  • Clear communication (written and verbal) with all levels of the business;
  • Strong project and time management skills;
  • Ability to handle stressful situations with professionalism and composure;
  • Quick learner with the desire to continually learn and grow.


Additional Information

Why work with us:

Our Calgary marketing team hosts both virtual and in-person socials and meet daily virtually to foster a positive team dynamic. There are other social opportunities at both a regional level with our marketing teams in Alberta, as well as office socials. Globally, there are opportunities to connect with colleagues from around the world such as joining one of our employee resource groups on topics such as Justice, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion and the Global Women’s Network.

We offer competitive pay, flexible work options, comprehensive and employee-focused benefits including virtual healthcare and a wellness platform, and more. Our leadership team strives for transparency, hosting regular socials, where all staff can ask questions of the senior leadership, ensuring all staff feel heard and considered. We give our staff the trust and autonomy to design how they work – whether it be from home or at the office.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

#LI-GT1    #LI-Hybrid

title: Spécialiste du marketing produit
description:
Description de l'entreprise

ISAAC se fait partenaire des flottes nord-américaines pour simplifier le camionnage avec sa solution facile à utiliser. Dédiés à 100% au transport routier, nous aidons les transporteurs à surmonter leurs défis quotidiens, et à favoriser le bonheur des chauffeurs. Notre solution d’une fiabilité éprouvée s’intègre à vos systèmes existants grâce à sa plateforme ouverte, et permet à vos chauffeurs et votre équipe du bureau de travailler efficacement.

Pour plus d'informations, visitez www.isaacinstruments.com.

Description du poste

Vous cherchez à vous joindre à une entreprise en pleine croissance avec une forte culture? ISAAC ajoute un(e) Spécialiste du marketing produit à son équipe en pleine expansion.

Si vous êtes un(e) marketeur(se) passionné(e) avec de fortes compétences en gestion de projet, alors vous êtes la personne idéale pour ce rôle. Vous avez un esprit à la fois analytique et créatif, en plus d'une expérience dans le marketing du cycle de vie et la gestion des relations avec les partenaires.

Responsabilités

Sous la responsabilité du directeur de la génération de leads, vous apporterez vos connaissances et votre expertise pour aider l'organisation à atteindre ses objectifs de fidélisation des clients et d'adoption des produits. Vous fournirez également une stratégie et des campagnes de marketing pour atteindre les objectifs d'affaires dans le cadre des partenariats d'ISAAC.

 

Gestion des programmes du cycle de vie des clients

  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes Produits et Succès Client sur l'ensemble du cycle de vie et du programme de rétention
  • Collaborer avec les équipes Produits, Marketing et Succès Client afin de proposer des solutions créatives pour réduire le taux d’attrition, augmenter les ventes des comptes, fournir un service à valeur ajoutée et accroître efficacement l'utilisation répétée
  • Développer des stratégies de campagne à utiliser comme outils pour créer un contenu ciblé, pertinent et personnalisé à chaque étape du cycle de vie du client
  • Développer et exécuter des programmes via plusieurs canaux, y compris le courriel, les notifications push, les messages dans les applications, et faire des recommandations pour améliorer les points de contact avec les clients
  • Développer une compréhension approfondie de notre base de clients, en collaboration avec l'équipe de l'Analytique, y compris l'utilisation des produits, les besoins des clients et les signaux d'attrition
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe des opérations de marketing pour comprendre les réactions des clients au programme grâce à une méthodologie de test et d'apprentissage et à des tests A/B
  • Mesurer les performances de l'initiative et communiquer les résultats et les apprentissages à toutes les équipes internes

 

Gérer les relations avec les partenaires technologiques

  • Gérer les relations avec les partenaires technologiques et leurs équipes de marketing, y compris la planification des campagnes, les rapports de statut et le traitement des revues et approbations des parties prenantes
  • Diriger la stratégie de planification marketing annuelle pour assurer la réalisation des objectifs marketing et d'affaires des clients et des indicateurs clés de performance liés à l'acquisition et à la gestion des comptes
  • Développer et exécuter des stratégies d'acquisition de clients à travers plusieurs canaux payés, détenus, gagnés et partagés par nos partenaires
  • Identifier de manière proactive les nouvelles opportunités de croissance et travailler en collaboration, en interne et avec nos partenaires, pour optimiser les plans de mise en marché
  • Diriger, d'un point de vue marketing, la relation avec les partenaires en collaboration avec l'équipe de développement des affaires
Qualifications

  • Baccalauréat dans un domaine lié au marketing ou aux affaires et/ou expérience professionnelle équivalente
  • 5 ans d'expérience professionnelle en marketing, dans un environnement B2B
  • Bilingue (l'anglais est indispensable)
  • Expérience des stratégies et de l'exécution de la gestion du cycle de vie des clients
  • Expérience de travail avec des partenaires dans des environnements de marketing collaboratif et intégré
  • Expérience reconnue de réflexion stratégique pour l'élaboration de plans marketing stratégiques annuels
  • Solides compétences organisationnelles et capacité à gérer plusieurs projets de front
  • Aptitude à gérer des projets complexes impliquant plusieurs parties prenantes et des équipes interfonctionnelles
  • Esprit positif, capacité à résoudre les problèmes, esprit d'équipe qui aime par-dessus tout aider et apporter des solutions
  • La compréhension de Salesforce et de Pardot est un atout.


Informations complémentaires

Les collaborateurs sont au centre des intérêts et des valeurs d’ISAAC. C’est pourquoi vous y retrouverez de nombreux avantages tels que :

  • des opportunités de carrières variées
  • un environnement de travail stimulant axé sur l’innovation
  • des équipes enthousiastes et collaboratives
  • des salaires compétitifs et avantages sociaux favorisant la conciliation travail-famille : un plan d’assurances collectives complet, un REER collectif, un PAE, des horaires flexibles, 4 semaines de vacances, etc.
  • des activités sociales variées et des collations gratuites à tous les jours !

title: Brand Marketing Representative
description:
At TTi, people come for the opportunity and stay for the culture!


Job Description Summary


Job Description:


Brand Marketing Representative | Leadership Development Program


TTI Canada Inc. | Milwaukee®, RYOBI®, Hoover® & HART®


_Full-Time | Permanent | Positions Available Nationwide_


About TTi Canada


TTI is a world-class leader in design, manufacturing, and marketing of power tools, outdoor power equipment, floorcare products, as well as hand tools and accessories. We cover a wide range of industries, and our customers vary from consumers to professionals. Our unrelenting focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence, and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus provides TTI with a platform for sustainable leadership and growth.


Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance, and exciting innovation. We have partnered with some of Canada's largest retailers to bring our customers brands such as _Milwaukee_ ®, _RYOBI_ ®, _Hoover_ ®, and _HART_ ®.


TTI is where culture meets opportunity. We are a fast-paced, highly energetic team, and we reward innovative thinking. We provide a multi-faceted training program with hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge, and reward you! TTI is a place to explore your potential, where wins are celebrated, and leaders are visible and accessible.


As a _Brand Marketing Representative_ , you will drive sales of our _RYOBI_ ® and _RIDGID_ ® power tools lineups within select retailers. This position will allow you to enhance your selling techniques through communication skills and relationship building. You will also specialize in product knowledge to provide informed education to target audiences. This opportunity is a chance to develop your skills while launching your career in a fast-paced and extremely rewarding environment.


Duties & Responsibilities


+ Perform best-in-class service to customers while organizing and executing product knowledge events for _RYOBI_ ® and _RIDGID_ ® products.

+ Become a reputable and trustworthy representative of the company by selling in aisle through our main retailer locations of your assigned territory.

+ Create brand awareness and drive excitement by running successful sales events and presenting engaging power tool demonstrations.

+ Maximize sell-through of _RYOBI_ ® and _RIDGID_ ® products through tactical merchandising and creating enticing displays for point of purchase material.

+ Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and creative promotional activities.

+ Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTI management, and _key decision-makers within our main retailers_

+ Participate in the _Leadership Development Program_ and implement all acquired skills to deliver results.


Education & Experience Requirements


+ Legally entitled to work full-time in Canada and able to travel to the United States.

+ Valid _full_ provincial driver’s license and clean driving abstract required.

+ Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.

+ Work experience in retail sales, field sales, or customer service.

+ Capable of lifting and transporting heavy objects (up to 50 pounds).

+ Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead, in addition to ascending and descending ladders to move product.

+ You should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning, and time management skills.


Benefits


+ Competitive Base Salary and Bonus Structure

+ Company Vehicle, iPhone, and Laptop

+ Health Benefits Coverage, including Vision Care, Dental Care, and Wellness Programs

+ Registered Retirement Savings Plan with Employer Matching Contributions


_TTI commits itself to providing a safe and respectful work environment that fosters every employee’s personal development._


#LI-OP1
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
We endeavor to make this site accessible to any and all users. If you need to contact us regarding technical accessibility of our website call 443-391-1542. This number is only for technical accessibility issues, not general employment or job posting inquiries.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
At Emerson, we are innovators and problem-solvers, focused on a common purpose: leaving our world in a better place than we found it. Each and every day, our foundational values—integrity, safety and quality, supporting our people, customer focus, continuous improvement, collaboration and innovation—inform every decision we make and empower our employees to keep reaching higher. As a global technology and engineering leader, we provide groundbreaking solutions for customers in industrial, commercial, and residential markets. Our Emerson Automation Solutions business helps process, hybrid, and discrete manufacturers maximize production and protect personnel and the environment while optimizing their energy and operating costs. Our Emerson Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure. Emerson, a Fortune 500 company with $15.3 billion in sales and 200 manufacturing locations worldwide, is committed to helping employees grow and thrive throughout their careers. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring options or a recent MBA graduate, you’ll find a variety of opportunities at Emerson. Join our team and start your journey today.

If you are looking for a Marketing Coordinator position and the opportunity to grow and develop professionally, Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you!  Based in our St Laurent, Quebec location with participation in our Hybrid work schedule.  You will work in an energetic environment with opportunities to grow among a dynamic marketing and sales team. The ideal candidate is a fast-learner and brings smart execution and optimization around lead generation and lead nurture campaigns via tradeshows, traditional media, paid digital media (PPC, Paid Search) and owned content (landing page, web, and email) to drive new prospects and customers to adopt the product installed by thousands of hotels, schools, assisted living residences, and other commercial facilities.
Your focus in this role is to support traditional and digital marketing programs aimed at awareness, consideration, lead acquisition and lead nurture for the most effective smart thermostat and energy management system in the hospitality and multi-family market today.

Verdant Environmental Technologies is a top focus business unit in the Comfort Control division of Emerson.  We are the preeminent providers of Energy Management Solutions for the hotel industry and other commercial building types.  

Flexible Work Schedule – Hybrid Work Option 
This role has the flexibility of a remote work option up to three days a week. Our teams work together to ensure our chosen work schedules enable our creativity and productivity as we serve the needs of our customers.

As a Marketing Coordinator, you will do:

  • Traditional and digital marketing coordination
    • Work closely with Marketing Manager to outline and execute a cross-channel marketing strategy including tradeshow, traditional, and digital marketing efforts
    • Assist in building and assessing campaign analytics and reporting/dashboards to ensure lead acquisition and lead nurture campaigns are delivering against goals and KPIs.
    • Support Marketing Manager in developing key digital and sales enablement efforts including print materials, paid media / digital marketing assets, product documentation, spec sheets, manuals, etc.
    • Coordinate layouts of technical documentation, working closely with engineering and product teams for content and assets
    • Assist in creating and managing project timelines with multiple stakeholders
  • Tradeshow support and coordination
    • Work with Marketing Manager to identify key tradeshow opportunities and help manage tradeshow schedule and plan for the year
    • Develop and update key tradeshow assets and coordinate with vendors to produce new materials when needed
    • Help manage process for planning conference registration / vendor agreements, making sure tradeshow assets and signage are shipped and setup, as well as on-site team schedules and travel details
  • Website and landing page updates
    • Make periodic content updates to website and campaign-based landing pages
    • Work closely with email marketing team to build targeted, persona-based email journeys that help drive leads from awareness/interest to consideration and qualification
  • CRM and lead qualification / assignment
    • Work within the Salesforce CRM to prioritize, qualify, and assign leads to the proper sales team members
    • Develop methodologies for funnel optimizations and lead prioritization with sales team
    • Manage key incoming lead channels (i.e., website chat / lead forms)
    • Assist in the reporting, analytics and dashboard efforts that enable strong marketing / sales funnel insights and marketing channel optimizations by working closely with our Salesforce customer experience team to develop reports and dashboards that help quickly and regularly monitor campaign performance, channel effectiveness, sales qualification trends/insights.

WHO YOU ARE / REQUIRED COMPETENCIES:

You scan the environment for new technical skills, knowledge, or capabilities that can benefit business or personal performance. You consult diverse resources and ask more questions. You utilize analytical tools to help explore potential scenarios. You manage resources (people, funding, material, support) to get things done.

REQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCES & SKILLS: 

  • University degree with a focus on marketing, communications, or other relevant discipline.
  • 2+ years of experience in marketing or relevant professional experience
  • Working knowledge of website content management platforms like Wordpress, CRM & Marketing automation tools
  • Experience working in Adobe Creative programs (i.e., InDesign, Illustrator)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
  • Fluent in English
  • Authorized to work in Canada without sponsorship now or in the future

PREFERRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCES & SKILLS

  • Understanding of B2B marketing
  • Understanding of the HVAC market
  • Working experience in Salesforce CRM
  • Working experience in Wordpress CMS
  • Ability to work with a cross-functional team
  • Great communication and collaboration skills
  • Attention to detail and strong work ethic
  • Ability to adapt and multi-task in a rapidly changing environment
  • Critical thinker, who can analyze and improve processes
  • Fluent in French

    Schedule

    We offer the flexibility of a core hour work schedule. Employees can flex their start and stop times given they are working during the core hours of 10:00am – 4:00pm. We have a hybrid work from home policy that allows team members to work from home up to 3 days a week if they wish. Our teams work together to ensure their chosen work schedules are supporting our customers.

    About our Location

    Verdant’s new head office is located in Ville-St Laurent close to metro and bus access. Designed by local architects, our office is a perfect marriage of modern aesthetics and collaborative ergonomics.

    Comfort Control, a business unit of Emerson Commercial & Residential Solutions, is headquartered in St. Louis, MO and is an industry leader in home energy management and comfort control.  By networking our products to the cloud, we are discovering new ways to help our customers reduce energy consumption, save money, and maintain comfort.  If you want to be part of a collaborative, high energy, fast paced team, where your contributions can make a real impact on the world – you have just found the place!

    We look for results as opposed to what time you “punched in and out”.  We like to laugh and we like to perform. We are a growing dominant player in our markets and we want our employees to be an integral part of this success story.  We hope you can join us on this great adventure.

    But that’s not all:

    • Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Life Insurance, and Long-Term Disability package
    • Free snacks, soft drinks, and great coffee
    • Weekly Friday Summer BBQ’s
    • Corporate Gym and holistic Wellness program
    • Electric car chargers with ample parking
    • Flexibility with personal time off – we care about your health and family
    • Casual office wear, no suits needed!

title: Ad Ops Coordinator
description:
As an Ad Operations Coordinator, you own the execution of trafficking creative across channels. Your fundamental knowledge of the media landscape will be an invaluable asset on a team of creative thinkers. Owning the relationship with media partners will help you excel in a job requiring fast thinking, accuracy, and versatility.

You will:

•    Execute campaign set up to launch and maintenance.
•    Have a fundamental understanding of spreadsheet programs such as Excel, Sheets and Smartsheet.
•    Work with external partners to troubleshoot campaign issues.
•    Manage deadlines and workflow.
•    Own the quality and consistency of your deliverables.

You have:

•    1-2 years’ experience in advertising operations.
•    Knowledge of GCM and Social platforms.
•    Fundamental skills in standard and rich media ad trafficking software for display, video, mobile, search, and other emerging channels.
•    Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines, while paying attention to details.
•    Ability to work effectively under stressful situations and tight deadlines.
•    Good project management, planning, and organizational skills.
•    Strong problem-solving skills.
•    Ability to work independently and seek help when needed.
•    Flexibility in a constantly changing environment.

title: Business Development Coordinator
description:
Certarus is the North American leader in providing low carbon energy solutions through a fully integrated compressed natural gas (CNG), renewable natural gas (RNG), and hydrogen platform. The company safely delivers clean-burning fuels to remote communities and industrial customers not connected to a pipeline.

By displacing more carbon-intensive fuels, Certarus is leading the energy transition and helping customers lower operating costs and improve environmental performance. With the largest fleet of specialty trailers in the world, the company is uniquely positioned to meet the growing demand for low and zero-emission fuel distribution.

Summary:

The Business Development Coordinator will be an integral part of the Canadian Business Development team. The successful candidate will have an established track record in customer service and providing sales support, be technically proficient, and flexible with taking on, learning, and adjusting to all new tasks assigned. The role is well suited to someone that enjoys a fast-paced team environment where tackling challenges, problem solving, and continuous process improvement is embraced with enthusiasm. The position is based in our Calgary office and reporting to the Business Development Manager.

Schedule:

  • The position holds normal business hours
  • Little to no travel is expected
  • We support a hybrid work environment consisting of flexible remote and in-person collaboration at our Calgary office

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Assist with quote preparation and customer follow-ups
  • Prepare and organize databases, spreadsheets and reports as needed
  • Work closely with logistics and invoicing to ensure tickets are inputted in a timely matter
  • Input project details into Salesforce
  • Aid invoicing team to track and follow up on outstanding invoices
  • Create and distribute customer reporting daily

Requirements:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365, with strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
  • Team player who is detail oriented, with ability to plan work effectively, meet the deadlines assigned, and make sound decisions with little direction
  • Analytical, and investigative skills.
  • Ability to multi-task and shift priorities.
  • Excellent communication skills, interpersonal skills, and an ability to interact with customers and employees at all levels of the organization

Certarus embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way and considers qualifications, merit, and business needs in our hiring decisions. Certarus is and will remain an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Certarus offers a competitive compensation package, including benefits and retirement plans as well as employee ownership opportunities. Above all, we offer unlimited career advancement opportunities with a dynamic, rapidly growing organization.
