title: BidMan Analyst- (Marketing)
description:
Eaton’s Electrical sector is currently seeking a BidMan Analyst – (Marketing) to join our team. This position is based at our Head office in Burlington, Ontario.

Position Overview:

The Bid Manager software platform is a critical system to Eaton’s commercial and operation stakeholders. The Bid Manager Analyst will be responsible for partnering with the product managers and sales to improve, advance and maintain the Bid Manager takeoffs, functionality, and data related for all Eaton products in Canada. The role plays an integral role for creation and deployment of pricing strategies for Eaton Canada. The Bid Manager Analyst will also learn the products’ features and functions to be able to competently maintain the Bid Manager takeoff throughout the product’s life cycle.

Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each and every day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential and where you can help us reach ours.

In this function you will:

  • Partner with product managers and plants to learn the products that are configured in Bid Manager
  • Collaborate with the IT Business Relationship Manager, external resources, and stakeholders to learn engage the IT infrastructure support for Bid Manager to execute the Canadian bid manager strategy
  • Act as the key point of contact for the Bid Manager team in the US; creates detailed specs related to required function and feature changes; communicates changes as required
  • Develop, deliver, and support training initiatives related to understanding and using the Bid Manager application and data. Acts as a resource to answer questions related to the functionality of Bid Manager
  • Gather Voice of Customer by partnering with Product managers and sales to understand the usage and pain points related to bid manager. Subsequently create a portfolio of projects to advance Bid manager
  • Participate in the new product development process by implementing changes to tables (product and pricing data) and rules within Bid Manager; ensures functional alignment with the US
  • Write requirement notes for the Bid Manager take-offs in partnership with marketing
  • Configure, test, launch the bid manager takeoffs by updating the pick table rules
  • Drive standardization in designing list prices for Engineer To Order and shelf products
  • Elevate the broader understanding of stakeholders (sales, marketing, channel, operations) on functionality of Bid Manager
  • Learn pick development (specific to Bid Manager software) to maintain the take-offs specific to different product groups
  • Utilize Bid Manager software application knowledge to identify and define application requirements for specified product lines
  • Identify Bid Manager improvement and enhancement activities that are required to align Bid Manager with other applications and tools; coordinates activities with cross-functional teams to implement changes as required
  • Provide leadership on Bid Manager maintenance activities.Coordinates activities to ensure that the Canadian Bid Manager application is aligned and functional with versions /data used in other countries (USA, Mexico, Costa Rica)
  • Provide Bid Manager support to all of Eaton Canada in the form of inputting and maintaining product-line data, tables, and rules. Provides support in extracting data from the application
  • Other duties as assigned

When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

Qualifications

Required (Basic) Qualifications:

  • University Degree or College Diploma, in a technical field from an accredited institution
  • Minimum 3 years’ prior experience with electrical products
  • Must be legally eligible to work in Canada without company sponsorship now and in the future
  • No relocation provided

Preferred qualifications:

  • Certified Electrical Technician, Electrical or Mechanical Technician or Technologist designation; electrical background preferred
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience with electrical products
  • Minimum 1 year of experience using configuration or pricing platform
  • Experience using at least one programming language (Python, VB, or C++)

Position Criteria:

  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
  • Effective time management and project management skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to develop and deliver technical presentations
  • Highly motivated, self-starting, enthusiastic, results oriented team player
  • Ability to leverage resources in order to provide guidance and direction to cross-functional teams such as Business System Development, COE Engineers, and Technicians
  • Ability to work independently and innovatively to meet the overall goals of the product line
  • Strong ability to troubleshoot, problem-solve, and coordinate an action plan with required cross-functional groups
  • Strong MS Office skills; PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook

We provide benefits that are industry competitive and focused on employee well-being. Listed below are programs that are offered globally, but program availabilities may vary by site.

  • Flexible work options to help balance work/life demands (at participating Eaton sites)
  • Healthcare/retirement savings programs
  • Competitive compensation packages to reward skills and performance
  • Tuition assistance or financial help for ongoing learning and development
  • Health, Dental, Vision & Wellness programs
  • Donation matching (U.S., Canada, Puerto Rico)

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Eaton has in place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities.  If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs.   Accessibility information may be found at: https://www.eaton.com/ca/en-gb/company/policies-and-statements/accessibility.html

#LI-CH1

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Marketing

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Is remote work (i.e. working from home or another Eaton facility) allowed for this position?: No
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

title: Marketing Specialist - Manufacturing
description:
We are in search of a Marketing Specialist to join our client, a leader in manufacturing textile products in support of aerospace, military, medical, logistical, and custom markets.

What you bring to the team:
  • Proficient in development and management of websites based on WordPress platform.
  • Experience in management of Google Analytics.
  • Proficient SEO skills.
  • Experienced in content generation to include graphic design and video editing.
  • Experience with Social Media management.

What to expect:
  • responsible for content generation, website maintenance, social media management, video and photo capture/editing, monitoring engagement and analytics, championing marketing initiatives and conducting effective market research and targeted outreach. 
  • here may also be opportunities to manage 3rd parties such as printing services and other contracted services on an as-needed basis.
  • attending various industry trade shows, assist with management of registration and booth manning which includes meeting prospective customers.

Why you will love this role:
  • positive morale is one of the pillars this organization truly believes in
  • work/life balance is paramount
  • join a company that will grow exponentially right before your eyes
  • A competitive compensation package

What to do now:
  • Apply online or visit jobs.talencity.com
  • We thank all applicants and will be in touch with those best suited to discuss next steps


• Strong oral and written communication skills • Proficient in MS Office software, including Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint • Positive attitude and excellent customer service skills • Experience with content generation to include graphic design and video editing • Experience with website publishing (WordPress) • Experience with SEO and Social Media management • Controlled Goods Program - police background check required

title: Marketing & Proposal Coordinator
description:
Marketing & Proposal Coordinator

If you are looking for a career with a well known, respected and progressive mid sized construction company that has a fun, dynamic team, then this is the job for you! 

Our client is looking for a Marketing and Proposal Coordinator who will play a critical part of the team. Proposals will constitute a large share of the role, so preference will be given to candidates who have previous experience in a proposal capacity.

Proposal Responsibilities
  • Leading the proposal development process, including analyzing RFQ/RFP/EOI requirements, leading pursuit start-up meetings, coordinating with internal and external team members, providing writing and editing services, and developing graphic layouts for our submissions.
  • Researching client and project information for the development of compelling submissions.
  • Managing pursuit timelines to ensure all deadlines are being met.
  • Developing, maintaining, and organizing proposal content, including resumes, project profiles and photos, company information, and other content as needed.
  • Conducting regular opportunity searches on public procurement sites. Other Marketing and Communications
  • Creating external promotional materials, including client presentations, advertisements, and other materials as required.
  • Coordinating and developing internal presentations, reports and templates, memos, awards submissions, and other materials to support our various business units.
  • Managing the planning and content development for social media posts and campaigns.
  • Supporting the content creation and management process for our intranet and internal newsletter, Social Committee events and initiatives, external websites, and other internal and external initiatives as needed.
The Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate is enthusiastic, self-motivated, and detail oriented. You also bring exceptional writing and time management skills to the role, along with experience with publishing software (e.g. Adobe InDesign). Whether you’re working independently or as part of a team, you’re a strong communicator who’s versatile, flexible, and thrives in a fast-paced environment, often managing tight deadlines. 
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations, or related education
  • 2–3+ years of relevant experience in a Marketing, Proposal, and/or Communications role
  • Exceptional professional writing and editing skills
  • Proficiency with Adobe InDesign is a must; proficiency with other Adobe Creative Suite applications, including Illustrator and Photoshop, would be a plus
  • Proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite is an asset • Experience with social media and content management platforms are assets
  • Experience in the Architectural, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) field would be a plus
  • Exceptional analytical, time management, and multi-tasking skills • Strong relationship management skills


Thank you for your interest in this job posting.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Putting people first, every day:

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, we rely on our professionals to provide exceptional service, and help our clients by providing advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth.

Your opportunity:

Our Markets group is looking for a Marketing Coordinator to join our team. The successful candidate will support marketing, branding, and go-to-market efforts nationwide and own the following responsibilities:

 

  • Responsible for the day-to-day delivery of core Markets support, e.g.
    • brand initiatives
    • content and design project management
    • sponsorships
    • events â€“ online and in person
    • promotional items
    • database interface, and
    • information updates
  • Oversee and track project deliverables track approvals, key dates and milestones to ensure deadlines and deliverables
  • Compile campaign analytics and conduct research and analysis on potential marketing campaigns
  • Work closely with our Markets team and provide support as necessary

How do we define success for your role?

  • You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect and Collaboration
  • You understand your clientâ€™s industry, challenges, and opportunities; clients describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high quality work
  • You identify, recommend, and are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
  • You share in an inclusive and engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
  • You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
  • You grow your expertise through learning and professional development.

Your experience and education

  • You have a College Diploma or University Degree in Communications, Marketing, Business or related discipline
  • You have at least one yearâ€™s experience in a marketing role
  • Professional Services firm and/or B2B experience will be considered an advantage
  • If you have experience with marketing technology tools such as Marketo, Smartsheet, Uberflip, it will be considered a strong asset
  • You have the ability to meet tight deadlines, steer several projects simultaneously and manage priorities
  • You have a commitment to continuous development and application of skills learned

Why BDO?

Our people-first approach to talent has earned us a spot among Canadaâ€™s Top 100 Employers for 2022. This recognition is a milestone weâ€™re thrilled to add to our collection of awards for both experienced and student talent experiences.

 

Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:

  • We enable you to engage with how we change and evolve, being a key contributor to the success and growth of BDO in Canada.
  • We help you become a better professional within our services, industries, and markets with extensive opportunities for learning and development.
  • We support your achievement of personal goals outside of the office and making an impact on your community.

 

Giving back adds up:  Where company meets community.  BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.


Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market leading personal time off policy.  We are committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours, and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.

As a hybrid workplace, all BDO personnel are expected to spend some of their time working in the office, at the client and remotely unless accommodations or alternative work arrangements are in place. To protect the health and safety of our people, clients and communities, we may require all partners and employees to be COVID-19 fully vaccinated in order to enter a BDO office. Individuals that cannot be fully vaccinated with a Health Canada approved vaccine due to medical reasons or another protected ground under Human Rights legislation may request an accommodation.



Ready to make your mark at BDO? Click â€œApply nowâ€ to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.

To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out ourcareers page.  
 #LI-ES1

title: Senior Marketing Coordinator
description:
About Us 



Pani is made up of a young team of highly motivated individuals who share a mutual passion for the environment.  We have created a web-based platform which enables the operators of water treatment facilities to operate their plants more efficiently saving energy, consumables, and the environment. We are excited to tackle challenging problems for the betterment of society.  Our workplace environment fosters and encourages both ingenuity and collaboration.  



About You 



You will be a key part of Pani’s marketing team. Marketing is about understanding people and building awareness about how our services can satisfy their needs. We’re looking for an enthusiastic and versatile marketing coordinator who is hungry to do this and more. Our ideal candidate has experience implementing marketing campaigns while working collaboratively within a team. He/she will be comfortable with day-to-day marketing activities, thriving with tight deadlines and changing needs 



Responsibilities 




  • Support Pani with brand awareness, recognition & lead generation.

  • Support positioning & messaging for Pani’s target markets.

  • Assist with marketing strategy & execution

  • Assist with development of marketing collateral, including case-studies, website, brochures, and related material.

  • Help analyze customer insights, consumer trends, market analysis, and marketing best practices to build successful strategies

  • Support the execution of marketing programs from start to finish, leveraging internal support and driving collaboration.

  • Create, maintain, and conduct analytics reporting across multiple platforms and extract key insights for future campaign development and go-to-market strategies, complete with formal proposals and recommendations on tactics

  • Work with email, performance marketing and web teams to design, test and evolve lead nurturing tactics.

  • Conceptualize and execute on multi-channel campaigns across the prospect and customer lifecycle, ensuring the alignment of communications and messaging across all channels

  • Gather customer and market insights to inform outreach strategies, increase customer conversions, and generate more qualified leads

  • Identify effectiveness and impact of current marketing initiatives with tracking and analysis, and optimize accordingly



Requirements 




  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Experience implementing marketing plans and campaigns

  • Strong multitasking, and decision-making skills

  • Metrics-driven marketing mind with eye for creativity

  • Experience with marketing automation and CRM tools

  • Proficiency with online marketing and social media strategy



 



Nice to Have 




  • Experience within the cleantech, SaaS, or the water industry

  • Experience with graphic design applications (Figma, Photoshop)

  • Experience working with press and media contacts

  • High level understanding of the water sector

  • Startup experience an asset



 



Note: If you don’t meet all of our requirements exactly or have some gaps in your resume know that we would still love to hear from you. Use your cover letter to tell us about your unique experience - we understand that talent comes from many places and that skills are transferable.

title: Pricing Analyst / Analyste de prix
description:
*English will follow

L’équipe d’achats chez Altitude Sports est à la recherche d’un(e) analyste de prix qui aura comme objectif de maximiser les ventes en optimisant la stratégie de prix et d’escomptes sur Altitude-sports.com et LaDernièreChasse.com. Nous sommes à la recherche d’une personne avec un fort esprit analytique et un intérêt marqué pour le ecommerce.

Ce que tu feras:
  • Analyser les données de produits de façon à positionner nos stock afin de maximiser les marges et ventes
  • Faire des recommandations descomptes pour optimiser les marges et les ventes
  • Monter les listes de promotion et gérer lintégration des escomptes sur les plateformes
  • Sassurer que les politiques descomptes soient respectées sur nos plateformes lors dévénements promotionnels
  • Coordonner les transferts dinventaire et valider lintégration sur nos sites de ventes
  • Avoir une compréhension et connaissance des politiques et structure de prix de nos fournisseurs (MAPs)
  • Connaître les particularités de chacune des politique de prix, fenêtres de promotions, fins de saisons, etc.
  • Maintenir une communication claire et ouverte avec toutes les personnes impliquées dans la gestion des MAPs
  • Créer et analyser des rapports
  • Lister et comparer les fenêtres promotionnelles des fournisseurs et identifier les changements en ce qui concerne les politiques
Ce que tu as besoin davoir:
  • 2 à 3 années d’expérience dans un rôle analytique
  • Avoir un intérêt pour le e-commerce
  • Un diplôme universitaire en finances, administration, gestion de projets, économie, Paralegal, logistiques ou expériences équivalentes pertinentes
  • Avoir une expérience de gestion de projets multi-départemental
  • Connaissances avancées de Microsoft Office Excel, Google Sheets et une facilité générale avec l’informatique
  • Minutie, rigueur et excellente gestion des priorités
  • Être orienté sur les solutions et voir les opportunités daméliorations continues
  • Bilinguisme en français et anglais, tant à l’oral que par écrit
  • Connaissance des outils Googles (un atout)
  • Avoir de l’expérience dans le commerce au détail, industrie sports/plein air (un atout)
Ce que tu y gagneras:
  • Gros rabais sur des marques de plein air et de mode pour toi et ta famille
  • Ensemble complet davantages médicaux et dentaires
  • Accès complet aux services de télémédecine via lapplication Dialogue
  • Budget dapprentissage et de développement
  • Options de travail flexibles
  • Un espace de travail moderne au cœur de la Petite Italie à Montréal
  • Possibilité de faire partie d’équipes sportives, de participer à des sorties de groupe et des concours, grâce à notre incroyable comité social
  • Faire partie dune organisation qui sefforce davoir un impact positif sur notre environnement grâce à des normes et des initiatives en matière d’écoresponsabilité.

Altitude Sports est le leader de la vente en ligne au Canada, et se spécialise dans la rencontre de la mode avec le plein air. Fondée en 1984, l’entreprise offre des conseils de premier plan en matière d’équipement et de vêtements techniques haut de gamme, en plus d’un programme d’avantages destinés à ses membres et d’une multitude de produits soigneusement sélectionnés pour les aventures urbaines et en plein air.



The Altitude Sports buying team is looking for a Pricing Analyst whose role will be to maximize sales by optimizing the pricing and discounting strategy on Altitude-sports.com and TheLastHunt.com. We are looking for someone with a strong analytical mind and a keen interest in ecommerce.

What you will do:
  • Analyze product data in order to position our inventory in such a way to maximize margins and sales
  • Make discounting recommendations to maximize margins and sales
  • Build promotional lists and manage the integration of discounts on the platforms
  • Ensure that discount policies are respected on our platforms during promotional events
  • Coordinate inventory transfers and validate the integration on our sales sites
  • Have an understanding and knowledge of our suppliers policies and pricing structure (MAPs)
  • Know the specifics of each pricing policy, promotional windows, end of seasons, etc.
  • Maintain clear and open communication with all individuals involved in the management of MAPs
  • Create and analyze reports
  • List and compare supplier promotional windows and identify policy changes
What you need to have:
  • 2-3 years of experience in an analytical role
  • Have an interest in e-commerce
  • A university degree in finance, administration, project management, economics, paralegal, logistics or equivalent relevant experience
  • Experience managing multi-departmental projects
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel, Google Sheets and a general facility with computers
  • Thoroughness, rigor and excellent priority management
  • Solution oriented and see opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Bilingual in French and English, both written and spoken
  • Knowledge of Google tools (an asset)
  • Experience in a retail position or in the sports/outdoor industry (an asset)
Whats in it for you?
  • Discounts on outdoor and fashion brands for you and your family
  • Comprehensive health and dental benefits package
  • Full access to Telemedicine services through the Dialogue app
  • Learning and Development Budget
  • Flexible working options
  • A modern workspace in the heart of Montreal’s Little Italy
  • Opportunity to participate in sport teams, group outings and contests, courtesy of our incredible social committee
  • Working for an organization focused on making a positive impact on our environment with sustainability standards + initiatives

Altitude Sports is Canadas e-commerce leader, working and playing at the intersection of fashion and the outdoors. Founded in 1984, the company offers best-in-class advice on premium gear and technical apparel, a members-only benefits program and a curated selection of products for outdoor adventures and urban pursuits retailer.

#AltitudeSports2


Altitude Sports

title: Senior Sales Analyst
description:
At Mazda, we love sharing the beautiful machines we craft with the world. But even more, we love building relationships with the people who help make it all possible. It’s why we have created the Clubhouse of Driving Passion. We are a team of passionate car fanatics with an incurable love affair with the road. We continually strive to challenge the status quo and make it our mission to put people, quality, and experiences before transactions. Ground-breaking technologies and our latest 7th generation products are just the tip of the iceberg. If you possess an unwavering commitment to delivering service excellence and a strong desire to shatter industry stereotypes, Mazda Canada is looking for you.

The Senior Sales Analyst is a key team member of the Sales Operations department who is responsible for supporting national sales objectives and planning through providing analysis, insights, and recommendations to achieve MCI’s critical key performance indicators (KPI’s) for sales operations. This role is responsible for all national sales reporting and analytics, supporting MCI’s national production, inventory, and volume plan (GVS) for retail, fleet, and wholesale, while consistently identifying trends and utilizing a PDCA (Plan Do Check Act) approach to improve sales & profitability for MCI and our Retail partners.

Essential Duties include (but are not limited to):

National Sales Reporting
  • Develop and analyze sales reporting utilizing internal and external data to accurately report and forecast national sales results.
  • Provide insights for management to help establish and recognize trends and patterns and provide recommendations on future sales and production planning.
  • Track, analyze and evaluate critical sales KPI’s and provide proactive core business insights and strategic action plan recommendations to management.

Mazda Corporate Analysis and Studies
  • Provide analysis and insights for MC requests regarding market share, sales opportunities and risks, inventory management, market research, sales trends, and forward planning recommendations.
  • Collaborate with other internal departments and external vendors to gather the necessary information/data to provide MC with an understanding of MCI’s business strategy.

MCI Internal Meetings Support
  • Prepare high-quality status updates and insights that recognize and anticipate trends and patterns, while providing forward planning recommendations for management and senior executives.
  • Manage month-end update reporting to monitor and track performance to objectives for retail, dealer fleet, and national fleet by region and carline.
  • Support the sales operations team in the preparation and submission of our volume plan and production forecast to Mazda Corporate.

Inventory Analysis and Reporting
  • Develop and maintain monthly and ad-hoc inventory health analytics and reporting to ensure proper inventory and sales mix balance, dealer days supply, and MCI days supply.
  • Work with other Sales Operations personnel to understand production restrictions and forecast their potential impact on future sales.

MCI Internal, Regional, Retailer, and Third-party Support
  • Work in collaboration with internal departments, regional operations, Retail partners, and third-party vendors to achieve and improve MCI’s national sales and profitability objectives, while delivering exceptional customer service to all parties that are in-line with our common purpose and behavioural guidelines.

Qualifications (Experience, Knowledge & Skills Required):
  • Post-secondary degree in business analytics, data analytics, business administration, economics, statistics, data science, or business management.
  • 3 years’ relevant work experience in analytics, sales planning, business development, or an automotive sales operations environment would be considered an asset.
  • Ability to analyze, interpret, and communicate meaningful insights in data and provide recommendations to management that will impact decision making and future planning.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
  • Very detail-oriented to ensure accuracy in all aspects of the position.
  • Customer service focused for internal stakeholders and Retail partners.
  • High degree of self-initiative.
  • Ability to effectively cope with change and ambiguity, shifting gears comfortably.
  • Comfortable presenting to Senior Management and internal stakeholders
  • Bilingual (English/French) verbal and written communication skills is considered an asset.
  • Knowledge of MCI and our Dealer network is an asset.

Mazda Canada Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer andupon request by the applicant, accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process.

Mazda Canada Inc. is an Employer Partner of the Canadian Center for Diversity and Inclusion.

Mazda Canada Inc. is a proud recipient of the Top 100 Greater Toronto Employers for seven years consecutively.

title: Leasing and Marketing Coordinator (12 Month Contract)
description:
About GWL Realty Advisors

GWLRA is a leader in both the commercial and multi-residential real estate industries. Driven by our values of Integrity, Ambition, Creativity, and Empathy, our vision is to be a sustainable company known for exceptional real estate management, trusted advice, and outstanding service by consistently fulfilling our mission to deliver strong, long-term results for our clients. 
 

This is a perfect opportunity to join a well-established real estate company. As a Leasing Representative you will be an ambassador for the organization, so we are looking for someone who is a strong fit with our values and a positive reflection of our brand!

Responsibilities:
 
  • Maintain/establish strong relationships and ongoing contact with brokers, tenants and prospective tenants through meetings, luncheons, presentations, etc.
  • Negotiating financial and legal terms of leasing Proposals, Offers and Leases to achieve maximum value for our stakeholders.
  • Conduct property tours with prospects and develop in-depth knowledge of the portfolio.
  • Manage all marketing material to the brokerage community.
  • Coordinate communication between departments, i.e., asset management, construction, development, property management and accounting.
  • Strategically plan broker functions for the purpose of marketing space and maintaining business relationships.
  • Prepare and manage annual leasing budgets and other reporting as required.
  • Represent GWL Realty Advisors by maintaining the highest standards of professional ethics and integrity.
  • Attend industry related conferences and events.
  • Provide leasing/deal making support to the leasing department’s senior managers as required.

Qualifications:
 
  • Prior commercial leasing or brokerage experience (2-3 years)
  • Real estate license required
  • Strong working knowledge of offers, leases and the overall leasing process
  • Outgoing, articulate and well spoken with strong customer service skills
  • High attention to detail with strong abilities to multitask in an ever-changing environment
  • Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills and excellent presentation skills
  • Desktop publishing skills and working knowledge of Adobe InDesign
  • Post secondary degree or diploma in Business, Commerce or Real Estate Marketing while not required, is preferred.

What we Offer
  • 3 Weeks of Vacation per year
  • 3 Paid Personal Days per year
  • Up to $2,000 annual Education Allowance
  • Up to $5,000 annual Mental Health Coverage, plus other comprehensive benefits and savings programs
  • Up to $400 to use towards wellness annually to help support your financial, physical, and mental wellness

Our Business
Learn more about our commercial and residential businesses, our values, and careers at GWLRA.

Our Commitment to Diversity
GWL Realty Advisors is an equal opportunity employer. It prohibits discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial and local laws. We are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.

title: Marketing Operations Specialist
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Nulogy is a technology company driving toward more agility within the supply chain. Nulogy's software platform enables Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) companies and their contracted (external) network of manufacturers and packagers to reduce waste, reduce costs, and better serve their customers. Nulogy's software is currently being leveraged within the world's leading CPG organizations (including brands like Colgate-Palmolive, L'Oréal, and P&G) and has become synonymous with best of breed supply chain solutions. As Nulogy has grown rapidly over the last decade, the company is proud to be recognized with a variety of awards including; Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers, and Food Logistics Top 100 Software Provider and Canada's Most Admired Corporate Culture. Nulogy has also received multiple awards for company culture including most recently Canada's Great Places to Work award 2021-2022 and 2021 Best Workplace™ for Mental Wellness!

By joining Nulogy, not only will you be joining a fantastic culture of capable and motivated individuals, you'll also be joining a team that is solving challenging problems everyday with the potential to make a global impact.

 

YOUR MISSION

The Marketing Operations Specialist plays a critical role in the cross functional coordination of marketing initiatives and owning the cutting-edge applications and tools used by Nulogy's marketing team. This role is ideal for someone who has experience working with sales and in marketing roles, and is excited to join a high-growth software company.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Serve as Marketing's "owner" of Nulogy's leading-edge marketing technology stack, including Salesforce, Pardot, Bombora, LeanData, and more, assuring these systems are functional, integrated, updated, and delivering the data and reports that the marketing team requires.
  • Lead the marketing team in best practices for report/dashboard generation, lead input, database/lead management, campaign list development and management.
  • Plan and coordinate cross-functional marketing tech initiatives to achieve the goals and objectives within the required timeframe, working closely with the RevOps team.
  • Maintain the synchronization between marketing activities and technology to optimize marketing initiatives.
  • Coordinate and deliver training to marketing and sales on application updates used by the team.

EXPERIENCE & SKILL REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, communications, technology or a similar area
  • Experience in B2B technology (e.g. SaaS) marketing is required; manufacturing or supply chain experience is highly desirable.
  • 3-5 years of proven marketing operations experience, utilizing the following tools:
    - CRM (preferable Salesforce)
    - Marketing Automation (preferably Pardot)
    - Additional marketing systems, such as intent data system (preferably Bombora), Account Based Marketing tool, lead analysis and attribution tools, and more.
  • A team player with strong leadership and collaboration skills
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills
  • Dynamic, articulate, well-spoken, with strong written communication skills
  • Proactive, organized and able to handle work in stressful and uncertain environments
  • Excellent time management skills (planning & organizing) to set priorities and meet goals

WHY NULOGY

  • Nulogy was founded by 4 friends who wanted to work at a place they loved. We imbed this notion into the culture through a highly supportive benefits plan, regularly inviting family to company events, and having lots of fun as a team. Our motto is "It's Not Just Business, It's Personal". 

  • We're solving problems that no one has been able to solve before. This is an opportunity to join a team that is transforming the way that supply chains are structured.

  • Competitive benefits package: Group benefit plan including health, dental, and vision that start on day one; Parental leave: 100% top-up for 15 weeks for any parent or biological or adopted children; Unlimited paid vacation policy; RRSP Matching Program; $3k annual education budget

OUR RESPONSE TO THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC

The well-being of our employees is our top priority. In March 2020, we made the decision to ask all employees to work from home until further notice. Everyone is set up with the tools and resources required to stay connected and help employees do their best work. We continue to follow provincial and public health agency guidelines as well as consider the safety, health and interests of our employees, as we make decisions about reopening our office.

Nulogy embraces diversity, and we recognize the need for teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We encourage everyone to apply.

title: Business Development Specialist, Controls- Alberta & Mid-West
description:
Business Development Specialist, Controls- Alberta & Mid-West

 

If projects, sales hold no secrets for you and you are a pro at achieving maximum product acceptance at end user, specifier, and contractor levels, the position of Business Development Specialist, Controls – Alberta & Mid-West is for you!

 

Reporting directly to the Regional Sales Director, working closely with the Director of Controls and in cooperation with the Territory Manager(s) is her/his area, the incumbent will be responsible for achieving maximum product acceptance at end user, specifier, and contractor levels through effective market intelligence, public relations, and product training efforts. S/he will be responsible for achieving Controls sales targets as determined on an annual basis in the appropriate territory and maintaining appropriate expenses.

 

  • Develop and maintain contact with all senior persons who specify Leviton products, including but not limited to architects, consulting engineers, electrical engineers, various Government-level purchasing departments, industrial specifiers and major electrical contractors. S/he will provide them with all services they require (such as sample, literature, specifier’s catalogue and copies of product specifications) and conduct informative meetings for all types of specifiers, as required
  • Ensure that there is proper follow-up on specifications and ascertain that, where Leviton products were specified, the company obtained the order and the product was utilized. When opportunity arises, put forth necessary efforts to secure orders. S/he will also report the needs of the specifier to Leviton management by suggesting new products, promotional literature, policy changes, etc.
  • Maintain complete records of specifier’s name, where Leviton was specified, description of job, etc., and advise Leviton headquarters so that they can transmit this information to other areas that may be involved.
  • Be responsible for product training on end user, contractor or specifier sites and, when required, at the distributor Level. Upon her/his superior’s request, s/he will co-ordinate training efforts with the local Territory Managers.
  • Keep up to date with applicable local energy codes; maintain and promote best practices of Leviton material applications in satisfaction of the former.
  • Actively participate in the marketing support programs (trade shows, dinner meetings, joint calls) that are planned in her/his area by the Territory Manager or on his/her own as required to promote and secure Leviton Controls as the product of choice.
  • Ensure proper technical coverage and support of Strategic and/or House accounts that are sold to on a direct basis to drive both regional sales and National Accounts

Success factors

  • College Degree and on-the-job training experience
  • Minimum of five (5) years of work-related experience
  • Excellent sales abilities and presentation skills
  • Knowledge in business and management principles
  • Project management and excel knowledge is an asset
  • Abilities in interpersonal relations including opening doors to new relationships
  • Good judgment and able to establish priorities
  • Available to travel within the territory and/or province under her/his responsibility
  • Ability to work autonomously and well under pressure
  • A self-directed learner

 What we offer

  • Work-life balance
  • A stimulating and friendly work environment
  • Complete group insurance program & group RRSP
  • Recognition programs
  • Skills development program

 The future looks brighter than ever. Join our team now! recrutementcanada@leviton.com

 Who we are

Leviton Canada is one of a family of companies affiliated with Leviton Manufacturing Company Inc., headquartered in Melville, New York. Leviton has been a private, family-owned company since its founding in 1906. Leviton Canada's head office and distribution center are located in Pointe-Claire, in the province of Quebec. Its sales force, which is made up of representatives and manufacturing agents, is present in all Canadian provinces. Today, Leviton Canada offers more than 25,000 products and systems, supported by a team of specialists in connectivity, telecommunications, controls,

automation, and lighting solutions for the residential, commercial, and industrial markets. Almost 90% of homes in North America use at least one product that we manufacture in one of our facilities, all of which are ISO 9000 certified.

title: Bilingual Account Coordinator - Influencer Marketing (Mandarin)
description:
Company Description

About us:

In 2020, Viral Nation was voted the 4th fastest growing company in Canada. At Viral Nation, we embed brands in culture. We are not a typical ‘big agency’. We are a team of entrepreneurs, ex-global agency leaders and big talent agency recruiters who came together with a shared vision to do things differently.

We help brands find smarter ways to deliver better value to their communities by collaborating with the people who know them intimately, understand what they want, and create content that speaks directly to them. We move at the speed of culture and evolve quickly as needed. We continue to do this successfully for some of the world’s largest brands, including Facebook Oculus, Disney, DC Comics, TikTok and Tencent.

What’s in it for you:

  • Competitive salaries and 100% paid comprehensive health benefits plan 
  • Learn from an unrivaled leadership team with many years of agency experience
  • Be yourself! Work with an agency that boasts above-average diversity statistics
  • Dedicated programs to support your mental health and work-life harmony
  • Flexible work schedule and summer hours 
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities
  • Partake in our calendar of team building and social events 
  • Work with some of the world’s most engaging brands
Job Description

Main responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Assist Account Coordinators and Account Executives with day-to-day account operation and campaign execution
  • Research brands, influencers, industry trends and report back to the team
  • Track influencer social performance and log data
  • Help support influencer relations
  • Help build quarterly competitive reports for existing clients
  • Assist with maintaining and updating necessary documents and folders relating to influencer and client relations
  • Assist with documenting internal contact reports
  • Contribute out-of-the-box ideas and concepts that are brand aligned

Expectations:

  • No client contact
  • Multilingual in English in Mandarin
  • Support Account team pod with day to day tasks
  • Manage folders structures
  • Assist with building competitive/industry/political reports
  • High attention to detail
  • Help with maintaining and updating necessary documents and folders relating to influencer and client relations
  • Assist with filing influencer content keeping all folders/docs updated and follow VN's naming systems and sharing settings are changed depending on visibility needed
  • Assist with day-to-day account operation and campaign execution
  • Research brands, influencers, industry trends and report back to team
  • Track social performance and data
  • Help support influencer relations
  • Document internal and external communications
  • Contribute out-of-the-box ideas and concepts that are brand aligned
  • Use Influsoft to help with influencer sourcing, and update Influsoft and ensure all influencers are Opted in prior to their allocated live date
  • Assist with monitoring live posts, ensuring they follow brand guidelines (proper #, @ and links) before sharing with the brand
  • Outreach email send-offs with AEs cc’d
  • Contract filing
  • Create bit.ly links and prep influencer posting instructions
  • Support with influencer list building
  • Ability to flex hours to keep up the campaign communications with influencers and agents
  • Proactive attitude during communications with influencers and agents
  • Extensive knowledge of culture and trends
Qualifications

  • Bilingual in English and Mandarin
  • Passionate about influencer marketing specifically in gaming, esports and crypto
  • Basic understanding of influencer and social marketing 
  • Highly motivated
  • passionate and hungry to learn 
  • Proficient use of Microsoft and Google Drive 


Additional Information

Viral Nation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in our agency. Viral Nation welcomes applications from people with visible and non-visible disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruiting and selection process.

title: Reality Capture Specialist
description:
Company Description

Bantrel is proud to be a leading provider of Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) services in Canada.

Since our inception in 1983, we have delivered end-to-end solutions for some of Canada’s most challenging and complex energy, mining and infrastructure projects, with an unrelenting focus on safety, while delivering to the highest degree of quality. Bantrel performs design and procurement services from our Calgary, Edmonton and Toronto offices and delivers construction management and self perform construction services at various Client sites across Canada.

Our global reach and local touch is demonstrated by our affiliation with our parent company, Bechtel Corporation, one of the largest EPC companies in the world, and with McCaig Investments, a Canadian owned private company with longstanding ties to the local business community.

www.bantrel.com

Bantrel Co.: My Company | LinkedIn

Job Description

Hatch and Bantrel have formed the Hatch Bantrel Joint Venture (HBJV) to execute engineering and construction on the BHP Jansen Potash Mine Project in Saskatchewan. After successfully completing the Definition Phase Study for the project, the HBJV is currently carrying out the Detailed Engineering Phase for the Processing, Non-Process Infrastructure (NPI) and Mining Areas of the 4.5 Mtpa Stage 1 Potash Mine. With a published TIC of US $5.3-5.7 Billion this will represent one of the largest projects and private investments in Canada. The HBJV will use a hybrid of best-in-class new developing technologies and systems as well as the proven HBJV suite of tools to execute this exciting project.

The Reality Capture Specialist will be responsible for executing the reality capture program for the Jansen Project. This includes carrying out the following activities in accordance with project standards and requirements: performing and managing 360 image capture; drone orthomosaic photogrammetry; and mobile and terrestrial laser scanning. 

* Please note this position is not eligible for a relocation subsidy or living out allowance. This will be a camp position on a rotation.

In this full-time permanent role, you will be a champion of diversity & inclusion.

Duties & Responsibilities

Role responsibilities include:

  • This role will work closely with the Jansen project’s field engineering and construction supervision teams who require digital footage as well as the project’s quality assurance site survey contractor.
  • The role is responsible to manage, plan and implement the Jansen project’s potash ‘remotely piloted aircraft system’ (RPAS) program
  • The role is responsible to conduct regular and frequent:
    • Sitewide drone orthomosaic photogrammetry flights utilizing the ‘Drone Deploy’ software.  Note that all drone flights follow the Visual Flight Rule (VFR) minimums for controlled and uncontrolled airspace, as per Canadian Aviation Regulations (CARs), Part VI General Operating and Flight Rules, Division VI – Visual Flight Rules
    • Sitewide laser scanning constructed installations using the Veerum software
    • Sitewide 360 image capture utilizing the ‘Openspace’ software
  • Maintaining positive relationships and open communication with internal and external stakeholders, maintaining professionalism in all company related activities and upholding the company values
  • Attending and actively participating in meetings
  • Excellent presentation, written and oral communication skills, listening & interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills
  • Pro-active, highly motivated and a strong team player with a positive attitude
  • Strong ownership and responsibility for a project or task of high importance to see it through to completion
  • Ability to effectively prioritize, execute and deliver tasks in a high-pressure/stress environment under tight deadlines.
  • Strong attention to detail

Following may be required:

  • Travel to module assembly yards and vendor package units
  • Conducting oral presentations to varying audiences 
Qualifications

Suitable qualifications for this role include but are not limited to:

  • A recognized degree in an engineering or scientific discipline
  • Certified/diploma engineering technologist/technician
  • Specialized courses in engineering, surveying or other relevant specialized disciplines
  • Appropriate recognized trade qualifications and experience
  • Current Canadian drivers license issued from candidates point of origin

Essential capabilities:

  • Proficiency in the use of desktop PC with Microsoft and other various software
  • Proficiency with cutting edge hardware technologies and associated software/applications including mobile devices (e.g. tablet, phone) etc.

Preferences, but not pre-requisites are:

  • Field experience
  • Practical work experience in fields of design engineering, environmental, construction, operations, commissioning etc.
  • Technical knowledge and experience in the application of engineering, environmental and construction practices sufficient to comprehend specified engineering, environmental and construction requirements
  • Proficiency and experience with laser scanning LIDAR (light detection and ranging) and photogrammetry devices, laser scanning devices, drones, and 2D & 3D camera (still and video) devices
  • For this role, a ‘remotely piloted aircraft system’ (RPAS) license is required, but is not pre-requisite.  The project will provide the training and support to obtain the necessary licence(s) required as per the Transport Canada drone operating categories (i.e. basic operations, advanced operations and possibly special flight operations)
  • There is a preference for local candidates to apply who can work 5 days on (Monday to Friday) and two days (weekend) off each week


Additional Information

Please note there is a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy in place. Prospective employees will not be asked to disclose their vaccination status and only successful candidates will be asked to provide proof of vaccination and/or to seek accommodation pursuant to the mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy prior to starting work.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those candidates selected for further review will be contacted. All other resumes will be retained for future consideration.

title: Category Specialist
description:
Description


Hey, we’re Article. We’re a digital-first furniture brand that’s engineering remarkably better furniture experiences. We don’t have brick-and-mortar stores, so we’re able to deliver better value on beautiful, modern furniture. Recently named one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies, we’re on the hunt for talented, enthusiastic team members to join us at our headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia.

We’re looking for a Category Specialist that will drive the Article portfolio of products for a designated room, supporting and enabling the Category Manager in striving to increase the profitability of existing products, while expanding the catalog offering and driving the launch of new product lines.

With a deep understanding of the Article brand, the North American Furniture market, and specific product knowledge, the Category Specialist will help build product lines that deliver catalog growth, while growing market share and driving portfolio profitability.

In addition, the Category Specialist will carry out product performance analysis and define strategies to optimize Article’s product collections, ensuring that product features and the Design vision is communicated accurately across all departments and facilitating product feedback loops.

The Category Specialist will also be responsible to ensure the effective translation and execution of the Product vision in go-live and campaign product launches.


What You'll Do


The Category Specialist is an essential contribution to the Article team. Responsibilities and daily tasks include:

Analysis
  • Participate in the product performance review process, suggesting product development initiatives to improve catalog performance.
  • Perform analysis of competitor collections and evaluate new opportunities.
  • Perform market pricing analysis documents for new product development.
  • Participate in and monitor Sale pricing. Communicate ‘Sold Out’ information to the Company.
  • Participate in First Order evaluation and placement.
Product Launch
  • Communicate product go-live timelines to the Marketing team and ensuring that they have all product data and information around product vision needed for campaign planning.
  • Understand the big picture view around new products, timelines, changes in plans, marketing campaigns and communicate changes timely and effectively to all cross-functional partners.
  • Suggest marketing story ideas for product plan.
  • Partner with Supply chain and Creative teams to ensure samples are on track to meet campaign shoot timelines.
  • Ensure all product attributes are updated and accurate and clearly communicated to the photography team.
  • Oversee the SKU set up process to ensure product pages contain accurate information and reflect Product team vision.
  • Partner with the copy team on validating new product and fabric names.
  • Suggest ‘goes well with’ products that compliment new products for go-live.
  •  Suggest improvements for website and marketing teams to optimize sales.
  • Participate in the SKU and trend planning process with the Product Creation Team.

Communication
  • Ensure effective communication to cross-functional partners of new product features via Product Design Guides.
  • Support the Customer-facing team with training pre-Launch of new products and continue the support post-launch as inquiries come up.
  •  Ensure feedback from Customer Care and Website reviews are shared with the Product Development Team.
  • Provide feedback on the product page, assembly instructions, hang tag, and cut sheet creation to ensure accurate product descriptions, feature lists, and care instructions that anticipate customer needs. 
  • Maintain database information to reflect price changes, promotions, and phaseouts.

Skills Knowledge and Expertise


  • 2+ years of experience in merchandising or related positions.
  • Strong analysis skills.
  • An ability to organize, plan and think strategically as well as keeping projects moving at a fast pace
  • Familiarity with project management software is an asset.
  • An ability to understand Article’s aesthetic and recognize products that fit our brand. A deep interest in modern furniture, décor, and interior design.
  • An ability to work independently and within a team
  • Strong communication skills in English
  • A professional and positive attitude
  • A passion to continuously improving and a strong work ethic

Benefits



At Article, we believe in an “Ownership Mindset” where you’ll be given autonomy and the ability to own your work. Beyond a competitive salary:
  • We reward that ownership mindset, so we offer stock options after one year of employment
  • With our fast growth, we have a culture of curiosity, where learning happens on the fly — and while having a lot of fun
  • Access to dental and health benefits package plus a health/lifestyle spending account for your total physical and mental well-being
  • 45% discount on our products so you can experience first-hand why our customers love Article 
  • Your choice of state-of-the-art laptops with the tech and tools to easily collaborate 
Most HQ employees are working from home due to COVID-19. When it’s safe to return to the office, we have flexible solutions if you want to be in the office a lot, sometimes, or not at all. 

  • When our office is safe to reopen, you’ll love that:
    • The Article HQ is a converted warehouse with in-house photo studios, an airy open layout, an open kitchen filled with snacks, premium coffees and teas (and ALL the milks).
    • A dog-friendly office. We love our dog friends here at Article. If you have a well-behaved, well-socialized pup, we’d love to have them in the office too.
    • Onsite fitness equipment, change rooms (including towel service!) and bike storage
    • Regular extra-curricular activities, such as socials, open-mics, picnics... even cross-country skiing! For now, we've replaced them with creative virtual events for the time being — like virtual trivia night or a cooking class through Zoom!
Ready to become a Particle? Apply today. We're excited to meet you.


#INDARTICLE
#ZR1
#LI-VJ11

title: Senior Retention Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
Description


Riipen is looking for a Senior Retention Marketing Specialist to join our Marketing team!

As a Senior Retention Marketing Specialist, you’ll be owning end-to-end campaign management of various retention marketing programs from pre-production, to development, execution, and reporting. Reporting to our Senior Manager, Growth Marketing, you’ll be collaborating with the marketing team and cross-functionally to drive retention on the platform.

Riipen is a mission-driven company and we look for team members who are passionate about what we’re working toward. Our company isn’t just about education, it’s built around education. We want you to enjoy what you do and who you do it with, and to grow and learn right alongside the business itself. We champion curiosity, creativity, and collaboration; and we continuously strive to create an inclusive and supportive environment where all of our team members feel they can bring their whole selves to work. 

Key Responsibilities


  • Lead the execution of retention marketing programs; 
  • Partner cross-functionally to execute on programs that drive customer engagement and repeat conversion;
  • Develop and execute A/B testing strategies to strengthen customer retention;
  • Effectively utilize marketing automation tools to support retention campaigns; 
  • Conduct research to build a better understanding of the customer journey and pain points to be addressed;
  • Identify and propose new opportunities to optimize customer retention and loyalty programs;
  • Monitor, measure, and report on campaign key performance metrics using tools such as Hubspot and Google Sheets/Excel; and
  • Determine recommendations for optimizing results to deliver on overall company goals.
  • Participate in one-on-one and team training as offered. 

Skills Knowledge and Expertise



Great Candidates Will...

  • 3+ years of experience in retention marketing, ideally for a B2B SaaS, digital marketplace, or an EdTech company (preferred but not required);
  • Strong knowledge and experience with analytics, reporting, and tracking tools like Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Tableau;
  • Experience with data management, analysis, presentation, reporting, and tracking tools with the ability to not only report but also provide recommendations for future improvements;
  • Efficient and highly detail-oriented with strong quantitative and communication skills;
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with external and internal stakeholders at various levels of the organization;
  • Be process and detail-oriented, creative, and strong analytical skills; 
  • Have the ability to consistently deliver exceptional results on demanding timelines;
  • Possess an entrepreneurial spirit with a desire to work in a fast-paced startup environment; and
  • Have a hunger and willingness to learn - we don’t expect you to tick all the boxes. However, you should be curious and ready to take on anything thrown your way. 
Bonus Points:
  • Experience and success working with remote teams; and
  • Experience using Hubspot
We ask that if you feel like you don’t check all the boxes but have the potential to learn what you don’t know, that you still apply! We believe that diverse teams are high performing teams and we strive to employ individuals with a diversity of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. 

We would love to learn more about you! How have you championed life-long learning? What draws you to contributing to our work on eliminating barriers for emerging talent? What unique experiences would you love to bring to the work we do? 

If this role excites you, we look forward to receiving your application!


What We Offer


  • Remote/travel working opportunities (when appropriate)
  • 4-weeks of annual vacation 
  • Extended Health and Dental benefits from your first day for the duration of your contract 
We appreciate your interest and application. Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. 

Riipen is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, colour, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. 

Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

title: Product Advisor- OpenRoad Mazda Port Moody
description:
UNLIMITED POSSIBILITIES AHEAD.


We believe in doing good for our customers and for ourselves. Whether it’s launching the most anticipated model of the year or purchasing a vehicle for your next adventure, great people and relationships are at every turn with OpenRoad.


We are proud of our forward-thinking culture developed over 40 years of continuous improvement initiatives. OpenRoad is one of the largest and fastest growing automotive retail groups in the country (representing 20 automotive brands across 25 locations) with a shared vision to become the national automotive leader in customer experience. As one of Canada’s Best Employers and Best Managed Companies, we are looking for team players who are excited to continually learn, work hard, and take ownership of their role.


If you love the idea of joining an organization with unlimited possibilities to accelerate your career, then apply to OpenRoad and grow with us today! 


OpenRoad Auto Group is currently seeking to expand our team with a Full-time Product Advisor at OpenRoad Mazda Port Moody.


A Career at OpenRoad Means You’ll Enjoy:


  • Many opportunities for internal growth
  • Discounted vehicle purchase program
  • Associate perks program
  • Company social events
  • And more!


ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:    

  • Provide exceptional customer service by determining each prospective client’s vehicle needs by asking questions and listening.
  • Promote new business and contributing to company’s customer base by seeking new customers through prospecting and referral networks.
  • Selling new and pre-owned vehicles, and demonstrate vehicles (includes test drives).
  • Understand the terminology of the automobile business and keep abreast of technological changes in all products/inventory.
  • Be thoroughly familiar with all products, including features, specifications, prices, colours, options, and standard equipment. Participate in any and all product training available.
  • Use closing techniques effectively; ask for help from management with closing when necessary. Be profit-minded when closing.
  • Deliver new and pre-owned vehicles to customers, and ensure the customer understands the vehicle’s operating features, warranty and paperwork, to help ensure OpenRoad lays the foundation for customer loyalty.
  • Introduce customers to Service Department personnel to emphasize to customers the quality and efficiency of the dealership’s service operations.
  • Set goals for each month’s productivity; plan and organize how to reach those objectives.
  • Follow all dealership processes and procedures to ensure an excellent Customer Satisfaction Index rating on sales, delivery and follow up.
  • Attend department meetings as required.
  • Follow company safety policies and practices, and immediately, report any and all accidents to a Manager/Supervisor.
  • This position will be expected to perform other duties as assigned by management.
  • OpenRoad reserves the right to modify this job description as business needs require.

 

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

  • Good interpersonal skills; ability to communicate with others and to assimilate and understand information while maintaining a great deal of professionalism.
  • The ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization.
  • Strong computer skills (internet & MS Office), with ability to maintain record using computerized system.
  • Effective negotiation skills, with ability to make sound decisions in a manner consistent with the essential job functions.
  • A Current VSA MDC License.
  • A valid British Columbia Driver’s License with a good driving record.


Internal Candidates MUST apply by filling out the Internal Endorsement Form on the Intranet. Failure to complete the form will cause a delay in your application. 


https://orag.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=3109 


We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity. We stand behind the growth of our associates to help them achieve their vision and goals.


JOIN US AND GROW WITH US! 


We thank all those that have applied. Only those considered for the position will be contacted.

description:

We are looking for outgoing, positive and money driven marketers that can work part time throughout the next 4 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

title: Specialist Business Development
description:
Description:

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

·                 Prospect for new logo opportunities from targeted call lists provided by AVI-SPL and third party resources.

·                 Identify potential clients in the target market and complete appropriate research on perspective clientâ€™s business and needs

·                 Work with Management primarily to utilize resources such as data mining products, purchased lists and secondarily online public resources such as LinkedIn, Construction Websites, Local Business Journals to uncover potential clients

·                 Contacting potential clients primarily via phone to establish rapport, present the AVI-SPL value proposition and either set up a meeting as a qualified lead for an Account Manager (AM) or hand the prospect to an AM to work as a qualified lead.

·                 Partner with management to identify appropriate markets and potential clients to pursue.

·                 Collaborate with management, sales, product management and manufacturing partners and others to understand products and services to introduce to prospects.

·                 Identify if lead meets BANT (Budget, Authority, Need and Timing) criteria and is ready for sales engagement

·                 Obtain accurate customer contact information such as name, address, email, and phone number; update lead records, and enter opportunities into CRM

·                 Conduct scheduled business reviews with your manager and Branch Managers to discuss the status of leads forwarded to sales

·                 Other duties as assigned

 

Skills and Abilities:

·                 Ability to understand the working of the modern workplace and customersâ€™ issues as it relates to our business.

·                 A basic understanding and comfort level with audio visual, information technology and unified communications solutions.

·                 Ability to make a high volume of telephone calls every day.

·                 Ability to communicate in a business-like fashion.

·                 Ability to deliver an online AVI-SPL Profile and Value Proposition Power Point presentation over a unified communications platform such as Microsoft Teams.

·                 Needs to balance multiple tasks with changing priorities.

·                 Ability to work and think independently and ensuring to meet deadlines.

·                 Demonstrated customer service focus and client communication skills.

·                 Ability to maintain strict confidentiality and handle sensitive matters with discretion

·                 Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

·                 Proficient with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and ability to work within a CRM

·                 Effective communication and interaction with employees, clients, and colleagues and the ability to work effectively with all levels of the organization

 

Education/and or Experience:

·                 Minimum High school diploma or equivalent

·                 Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business or in similar or related field a plus

·                 Minimum 2 years prior sales or telemarketing experience preferred; experience in the Audio Visual or Technology field desirable

 

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. This job operates in a professional office environment. This role uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. The work environment is generally moderate in noise (inter-office conversations and computers/printers).

 

Because many of our clients are requesting that all employees working on their site be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and the current concerns of having our team in the office in a safe manner, we will require proof of vaccination prior to any employee coming onboard.

 

The physical demands of this position are those that are necessary to meet the responsibilities and essential functions of this position.   Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

 

This position regularly requires employees to sit, walk, and stand; talk or hear, both in person and by telephone; use hands repetitively to finger, handle, feel or operate standard office equipment

 

This position does not have direct reports.
