title: Marketing Operations Specialist
description:
Who We Are:

As a Best Managed Company, we are honoured to be named one of Londonâ€™s Best Places to Work. Sifton Properties Limited is a family owned and operated organization that has been in business for over 95 years. We have a family-based culture where we trust, understand, support and care about each other. As team members, we grow through collaboration, innovation, and open communication. At Sifton, we build outstanding communities where people live, work and play, and we live our values to the fullest.

 

We would love for you to join our team!

 

Reporting to the Marketing Director, the Marketing Operations Specialist is a highly collaborative team member, working with various business units and the Marketing team to ensure that our marketing technology stack is supporting the outstanding Sifton customer experience and driving new business. In this role, you will liaise with cross-functional teams with a focus on digital communication, marketing automation and customer journey enhancement.

Youâ€™ll ensure data is leveraged effectively and work together with the Marketing team to build a strong operational hub that supports a fast-moving organization. Your efforts will have lasting impact on internal teams, our prospects, and all Sifton customers.

About the Role:
  • In collaboration with business units and Marketing team, implement integrated email marketing campaigns and related tactics to align with the customer journey.
  • Maintain prospect and customer lists, ensuring proper information flow and data integrity.
  • Act as lead acquisition subject matter expert, operate and configure the technical solutions required to deliver increased marketing automation in Salesforce Marketing Cloud and related.
  • Report on the effectiveness of marketing tactics and leverage analytics (Salesforce, website, social media, email marketing) to visually communicate progress against department goals and action on insights gathered.
  • Ensure alignment and integration of marketing technology stack.
  • Maintain and report on all digital assets including website content, errors, redirects, landing page locations, etc.
  • Identify and act on opportunities to improve user experience and conversion.
  • Create and maintain new standard procedures, identify process gaps, efficiencies, refinements and establish new process.
  • Some technical and creative writing and presentation creation.
Experience & Qualifications:
  • Post secondary education with a focus on Digital Marketing/Communications or related discipline, combined with 3-5 years of working experience.
  • Related work experience in campaign execution and operations, marketing automation, digital communications and data analysis.
  • Knowledge of integrated marketing communication strategies (traditional, digital, and events) and content marketing.
  • Thrives in a highly collaborative and results-focused environment.
  • Data focused and project management minded.
  • Passion for continued education and mastering new technologies within the Marketing industry.
  • Exceptional organizational, presentation, and communication skills â€“ both verbal and written.
  • Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office
  • Proficient in the use of tools such as Google Analytics, Wordpress, Salesforce, and Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
  • Strong analytical skills and understanding of report development/requirements.
  • Detail oriented, organized and able to handle multiple projects at the same time. Strict attention to detail and accuracy is crucial.
  • Client service orientation, professionalism and excellent judgment.
What We Can Offer You:
  • Weâ€™ll set you up for success by providing in-depth training with your team and mentors, working in partnership with our leadership team.
  • Youâ€™ll enjoy special events, celebrations, and unique perks, specific to your role and work environment, that reinforce our commitment to creating a wonderful employee experience.
  • Our unique rewards and recognition programs are designed to celebrate you, your contributions and promote your success.
  • Our Employee Assistance Program is available for your everyday needs.
AODA Statement:

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee  has the opportunity to  reach their potential.

 

Sifton Properties would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

title: Communications Specialist
description:
Job Description:

Communications Specialist â€“ Dorchester, ON

At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien Ag Solutions is the retail division of Nutrienâ„¢, the largest crop inputs company in the world. As part of our collective mission of Feeding the Future, Nutrien Ag Solutions provides full-acre solutions through our trusted crop consultants at more than 2,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe and Australia. For more than 150 years, we have been helping growers achieve the highest yields with a wide selection of products, including our proprietary brands: Loveland Products, Inc.; Proven ®Seed and Dyna-Gro ®Seed; as well as financial, custom application and precision ag services.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.

Working at Nutrien Ag Solutions will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career.

What you will do:

  • Support stakeholders across the organization with implementing content strategy and managing day-to-day requests for marketing communications    
  • Assist with project management and utilization of print and digital initiative  
  • Maintain content governance and processes, including brand guidelines, across all print and digital properties  
  • Document procedures, best practices, tools and information related to communication processes  
  • Create and interpret the marketing communications report  

What you will bring:

  • Degree or Diploma in the field of Marketing or Communications
  • 2+ years brand awareness and/or product promotion experience
  • 1+ years of previous Agriculture experience, farming or working on Ag accounts
  • Experience with web analytic tools and web content entry via web CMS tools

Are you a good match? Apply today!

Nutrien Ag Solutions is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

This job will remain posted until filled.  In accordance with Nutrien policies, you will be required to undergo a background check, and may be required to undergo a substance test. Being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 is a condition of employment and that proof of vaccination will be required, with minimal exceptions, unless prohibited by applicable law.   While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

To stay connected to us and for the latest job postings and news, follow us on:  LinkedIn,  Facebook  and  Twitter  

**EOE race/color/sex/sexual orientation/gender identity/disability/veteran

title: Content Marketing Coordinator
description:
Swish Maintenance Limited is currently looking for a Content Marketing Coordinator to join our Marketing team! The Content Marketing Coordinator will provide support across multiple projects and functions throughout the business with an opportunity to grow and contribute along the way. This role can be located remotely, however reasonable proximity to a Swish branch and the ability to attend meetings at a Swish office location is required.
 AREAS OF FOCUS 
  • Drafting content for various marketing initiatives, must have the experience/ability in professional writing in a marketing/advertising capacity. 
  • Working under deadline pressure and manage projects across multiple lines of business
  • Collaborate with internal teams, external agencies and vendor partners
  • Identify market/industry trends & insights and optimize budget spend
  • Understand customer buying journey: sales process, buying cycle, website navigation
  • Willingness to learn about the business/industry and unique needs of business units
  • Research, develop and implement plans for increasing brand awareness and sales leads
  • Creative thinking in terms of content & asset development
  • Assessing past and existing campaigns/initiatives to make recommendations for future efforts
  • Responsible for producing content/copy that is in line with the voice & tone of the Swish brand and ensuring cohesive messaging across all platforms
  • Working with our Swish Clean-It® Centre retail outlets across Canada (retail marketing experience an asset)
  • Understanding and advocating for the "voice of customer" in GTM and communication strategy development
  • Other duties as assigned
WHAT WE OFFER
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • RRSP matching program
  • Performance bonuses
  • Equal opportunity, inclusive workplace
  • Positive, team-based environment
  • Starting salary $50,000 CAD
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Post secondary education - Bachelor's Degree or College Diploma in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration or related field
  • 2-4 years of relevant experience
  • Knowledge of brand management, project management and core marketing tactics
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills are a must
  • Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Design, etc.) an asset
  • Compelling portfolio of work over a wide range of creative projects
WORKING ARRANGEMENT 
  • Hybrid/Majority work-from-home opportunity (must have reasonable proximity to a Swish branch) 
  • Occasional travel within Ontario

title: Communications Consultant
description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

The role in a nutshell

The Communications Consultant is accountable for developing and delivering communications strategies and plans across many channels. Working with different business units, the successful candidate must be able to grow fruitful communications plans and strategies from a seed. Want to know more?

The role in detail:

  • Develop and deliver communication strategies that consider scope, content, tone, measurable objectives, target audiences and key messages required to achieve business and project goals.
  • Provide a plan and direction for internal partners including consideration for design, compliance, translation, and various cascading communication vehicles, while fostering positive relationships with all partners.
  • Write and edit clear, concise and consistent messages on topics ranging from regulatory initiatives, product enhancements, internal and event campaigns, and/or crisis directives, all aimed at helping advisors, clients and employees understand what’s changing in their day-to-day.
  • Collaborate with several lines of business with differing communication styles, including administrative communications for insurance and operations, and more creative communications supporting events and internal employee communications.
  • Adjust and amplify your content across multiple channels.
  • Ensure communications meet audience needs and are developed on time, brand, and approved for the relevant audience.
  • Manage competing priorities of multiple projects with varying complexities while meeting firm deadlines.
  • Collaborate to achieve consistency, alignment and continuous improvement in processes, work quality and effectiveness.
  • Manage risk through documented review and approval processes and due diligence.

You have these skills/qualifications:

  • A degree or diploma related to communications, marketing or journalism, and five years of relevant work experience.
  • Experience in financial services, life insurance, B2B, or an understanding of financial advisors and how they work.
  • Strong writing and editing skills with the ability to distill complex or detailed information into concise messages that resonate with the audience and inspire action.
  • Demonstrated digital marketing skills and experience with content management for online applications (websites, mobile apps).
  • Experience with email marketing programs, social media and event industry tools (i.e. Cvent, EventMobi) is an asset.
  • Comfortable with multiple distribution channels and accountability to multiple partners.
  • Organizational skills, attention to detail, ability to handle multiple tasks within a dynamic environment.
  • Strong information gathering and analytical skills with good follow-through.
  • Digital expertise including familiarity with mass email tools and the design and creative development process for email, online and print communications.
  • Ability to flex, reevaluate and pivot when project directions change.
  • Experience working with Office 365 and SharePoint is an asset.
  • Bilingualism (English/French) an asset.

Why come to Manulife?

You’ll be part of a creative organization dedicated to improving the health and wealth of Canadians, and you’ll enjoy:

  • An opportunity to take your career in communications to new levels
  • Professional growth, training and development (we have awesome resources)
  • An award-winning communications team that has your back

Interested?

Here’s what you need to do: As part of your resume PDF, please include a short cover letter and two of your own writing samples that represent your best work.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock and Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact

recruitment@manulife.com

.

Apply today.', 'Here’s what you need to do: As part of your resume PDF, please include a short cover letter and two of your own writing samples that represent your best work.', 'Collaborate to achieve consistency, alignment and continuous improvement in processes, work quality and effectiveness.', 'Write and edit clear, concise and consistent messages on topics ranging from regulatory initiatives, product enhancements, internal and event campaigns, and/or crisis directives, all aimed at helping advisors, clients and employees understand what’s changing in their day-to-day.', 'The Communications Consultant is accountable for developing and delivering communications strategies and plans across many channels. Working with different business units, the successful candidate must be able to grow fruitful communications plans and strategies from a seed. Want to know more?', 'Professional growth, training and development (we have awesome resources)', 'Provide a plan and direction for internal partners including consideration for design, compliance, translation, and various cascading communication vehicles, while fostering positive relationships with all partners.', 'Experience with email marketing programs, social media and event industry tools (i.e. Cvent, EventMobi) is an asset.', 'Collaborate with several lines of business with differing communication styles, including administrative communications for insurance and operations, and more creative communications supporting events and internal employee communications.', 'Ensure communications meet audience needs and are developed on time, brand, and approved for the relevant audience.', 'Interested?', 'Experience working with Office 365 and SharePoint is an asset.', 'Demonstrated digital marketing skills and experience with content management for online applications (websites, mobile apps).', 'Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? title: Senior Marketing Analyst
description:
Company Description

Assent is the supply chain sustainability management solution for the world’s most responsible, sustainability-focused complex manufacturers. The #1 business risk for complex manufacturers is hidden. Most supply chains were never built with sustainability in mind, and most manufacturers do not have deep visibility into their supply chain risks while outsourcing the majority of their production. Shaped by regulatory experts, customers and suppliers, Assent is the foundation manufacturers need for cross-enterprise sustainability. At Assent, your work will help bring transparency, sustainability, and fairness to the global community. 

We’re one of the fastest-growing technology companies - from $5 million to $50 million ARR in under five years! As the global leader in supply chain data management, we provide transparency into the supply chains of some of the world's largest and most successful companies, including 75 percent of Fortune 500 companies. In our most recent funding round, we raised $350 Million USD in funding led by Vista Equity Partners. This funding will allow us to continue to scale with purpose, and add exceptional talent to our already remarkable team. 

Job Description

Reporting to the Director of Marketing Operations, the Senior Marketing Analyst is responsible for supporting Senior Marketing Leadership by proactively generating actionable insights, diagnosing key issues pertaining to marketing processes/campaigns/initiatives and making data-driven recommendations to support business growth.

  • Identify and define requirements for reporting, analysis, and insight in collaboration with senior marketing leaders and business stakeholders across the marketing organization and beyond; including Revenue Operations, Customer Success and Product teams.
  • Lead the development of reporting and insights for marketing quarterly business reviews and sales/marketing leadership meetings (including Board of Director meetings).
  • Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to support strategic and tactical decision-making for key marketing initiatives, mapped to the buyer journey.
  • Review existing/ongoing marketing reporting (internal and external) ensuring consistent storytelling and proper campaign management; create, maintain marketing analytics reports/dashboards/datasets as needed, ensuring adoption across organization.
  • Effectively communicates complex ideas to internal and external clients, through compelling writing and verbal storytelling.
  • Partner with the Enterprise Data engineering and analytics team to build meaningful data products that support Marketing Business objectives.
Qualifications

 

  • Degree/Diploma in business, science, statistics, engineering or quantitative discipline.

  • At least  5 years of experience in a Marketing Analyst or similar role in a B2B company

  • Extensive experience with Salesforce (dashboards, reports, etc)

  • Proficient using BI tools like Tableau, PowerBI, etc.

  • Experience in a SaaS based company a plus

 



Additional Information

At Assent, we are uniquely positioned to make meaningful, impactful changes in the world around us. If you believe in doing work that matters, we want you to join our team.

Life at Assent

  • Wellness: We believe that you and your family’s well being is important. As a result, we offer vacation time that increases with tenure, comprehensive benefits packages (details vary by country), life leave days and more.

  • Financial Benefits: It’s not all about the money – well, it’s a little about the money. We understand that financial health is important and we offer a competitive base salary, a corporate bonus program, retirement savings options and more.

  • Life at Assent: There is purpose beyond your work. We provide our team members with volunteer days, flexible work options and opportunities to get involved in corporate giving initiatives.

  • Lifelong Learning: At Assent, curiosity is not only valued but encouraged. You will receive professional development days that are available to you the day you start.

  • Work The Way That Works for You: Your work and life should be balanced in a way that is purposeful for you. We offer flexible working environments for our team. Choose a space that meets your unique needs.

Work the way that works for you. Your work and life should be balanced in a way that is purposeful for you. At Assent, we offer flexible working environments for our team. Choose a space that meets your unique needs. 

At Assent, we are committed to growing and sustaining an environment where our team members feel included, valued, and heard. Our diversity and equal opportunity practices are guided and championed by our Diversity and Inclusion Working Group and our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs).

Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion includes recruiting and retaining team members from diverse backgrounds and experiences, and fostering a culture of belonging where all team members are included, treated with dignity and respect, promoted on their merits, and placed in positions to contribute to business success.

If you require assistance or accommodation throughout any part of the interview and selection process, please contact talent@assentcompliance.com and we will be happy to help.

title: Brand Strategy Consultant
description:
In this exciting role, you will help define HomeLife’s brand strategy, co-create an actionable roadmap, build organizational capabilities, and support the execution of rebranding engagements.

Your Impact:
  • Provide innovative solutions to creative problems, be a thought leader to our team, and serve as the go-to person when solutions are needed.
  • Explore disruptive strategies that will accelerate HomeLife’s growth and generate greater business value
  • Contribute to the growth and reputation of the organization by supporting thought leadership and current rebranding activities, and promoting HomeLife’s unique value proposition in the market
  • Be part of an executive team that helps build on the company’s vision and corporate branding by producing high-quality digital marketing communications spanning from social campaigns to websites, videos and presentations.
  • Be an early adopter of social media trends and technology to align with HomeLife’s reputation as an industry trendsetter.  The digital world is fast-paced, and ignoring change can lead to extreme losses.

Requirements:
  • Minimum 5 years of corporate rebranding experience in an agency environment or on the client-side, creating B2B and/or B2C communications. Experience with luxury brands is an asset.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing related field preferred
  • Understand what are the key differentiators compared with top competitors and how to translate the benefits internally to Agents and Franchisees, and externally
  • Possess a passion for business innovation, technology, and digital products and a desire to always stay ahead of the curve
  • Exceptional curiosity, drive and open-mindedness
  • Collaborative spirit; team player. Ability to work independently and also with the Chief of Transformation to solve complex creative problems and bring new ideas to life.
  • Demonstrable ability to produce video content that is original, consistent in style and quality, and on-brand
  • Strong analytical, research and problem-solving skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication

Job Details:
  • Start Date: Immediately 
  • Job Type: Contract or Part-time, which may lead to permanent full-time 
  • Compensation:  Competitive Rate or Salary, commensurate with experience.

#Integrated Marketing #Advertising #Digital Marketing #Brand Strategy #Brand Awareness #Content Creation #Video Production #Social Media Strategy #Creative #Growth Marketing

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
About Us

Peninsula Employment Services Limited (“Peninsula”) is a provider of external human resources solutions, including employment relations advice, health and safety advice and legal support, to small and medium-sized businesses located throughout Ontario. Peninsula is a division of Peninsula Business Services Limited, based in Manchester, England. Peninsula currently operates in the U.K., Ireland, Australia, New Zealand and most recently, Canada, and employs over 1,500 people globally. Peninsula opened its Canadian office in September 2017 and has quickly become one of the fastest growing companies in Ontario and Alberta.

The Role of Marketing Automation Specialist

We are currently seeking to appoint a Marketing Automation Specialist working hand-in-hand with the Marketing Automation Manager, CRM, and marketing team. With fantastic office perks, we're the perfect place for high achievers to grow and thrive.

We're looking for a hard-working and self-motivated person to join our fast-growing marketing department to deliver multiple automation campaigns across all Canadian provinces to prospects and clients.

The role will play a key part in the online acquisition growth plans and the ideal candidate will have the desire to work in a supportive environment where a driven personality will succeed. They should strive to continually improve results and be able to thrive in a friendly working environment with a desire to share new ideas and work hard towards common goals.

Type of Employment : Full-Time, Permanent
Working Days : Monday - Friday
Salary Range : $50,000 - $55,000

Day-to-Day Duties and Responsibilities

  • Use Marketo to create and implement new programs (e.g. email nurture campaigns, webinars, events, gated content)
  • Assist with management and monitoring of multiple nurture programs, conducting regular reviews and analysis to help ensure leads to progress through the sales funnel
  • Implement A/B testing campaigns to identify the best performing setups
  • Integrating campaign activity with our CRM (Salesforce) to improve quality of information for our sales team
  • Integrating and managing relevant third-party software's (e.g. GotoWebinar) with Marketo
  • Collaborate with the necessary teams to implement, and measure campaign lifecycles through acquisition, conversion, and retention
  • Monitor, manage, and optimize campaigns and campaign assets to improve ROI
  • Using Marketo's revenue analytics suite to report on the effectiveness of our marketing campaigns
  • Routinely audit the lead database to ensure data is high quality, and to ensure we remain compliant 
  • Ensure compliance with relevant anti-SPAM laws at all times, e.g. CASL

Education/Experience

  • University/College degree is Marketing 
  • 3 + years of experience in a similar role

What you Bring to the Team

  • Experience with Marketo (mandatory)
  • Experience with Salesforce (mandatory)
  • Strong understanding of email deliverability and compliance
  • Knowledge of HTML and CSS
  • Strong communication skills
  • Analytical and detail orientated
  • Excellent time management, and ability to meet deadlines
  • Knowledge of digital marketing (data capture, and campaign analysis) • Experience in a B2B marketing role

Why Work for Peninsula?

  • Day off on your birthday
  • Enhanced Benefits with Health and Dental Coverage
  • We offer a Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) Matching Program
  • Downtown Location (Right near Union Station)
  • Vacation Days increase after 2 and 5 years' service
  • Ask about our Peninsula Days, and more!

Peninsula is a highly motivated enterprise that promotes an entrepreneurial culture. Peninsula is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace where all employees are valued. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates participating in our selection process.

title: Senior Product Analyst - L2Q
description:
It’s an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of Inc. magazine’s Best Workplaces for 2020, Infoblox is the leader in cloud-first networking and security services. Our solutions empower organizations to take full advantage of the cloud to deliver network experiences that are simple, scalable, and reliable for everyone. Infoblox customers are among the largest enterprises in the world and include 70% of the Fortune 500. Our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way!

We are looking for a Product Analyst to join our product management - lead to quote (L2Q) team.  In this remote role, you will report to the Director of Product Management L2Q and work with key business stakeholders and your product team to capture high-level as-is and to-be process flows, as well as process documentation to support story requirements. You will play a critical role in helping formulate, document, organize, and monitor cross-departmental activities to improve our systems, processes, and reporting, especially as they relate to L2Q and UI/UX.

You’re the ideal candidate if you have a strong understanding of  L2Q and UI/UX, documenting requirements & portraying visuals of process functionality in Salesforce. You are an excellent communicator and enjoy the art of dissecting a process. You are a stellar collaborator and work across teams to develop the best-documented processes and workstreams. You have a high degree of professionalism, attention to detail, and the drive to go above and beyond.

 

What you’ll do:

  • Partner with stakeholders across IT and business units to drive and capture as-is and to-be process definitions in support of story requirements and the library repository
  • Translate business steps into documented workflow diagrams—both As-Is and To-Be
  • Manage stakeholder relationships, understand business processes, and work with the business unit and process architects to fill in gaps in the existing process library
  • Partner with your product and delivery teams to proactively identify the business process documentation needed to support driving business decisions and story requirements
  • Apply your appreciation of UX to inform To-Be process definitions and support requirements and data needs
  • Ensure end-to-end documentation by validating processes and system integrations with other teams, systems, solutions, and process steps
  • Develop and maintain a detailed understanding of IT solutions and understand both upstream and downstream integration points

 

What you’ll bring:

  • 3+ years of directly related professional experience with Lead to Quote (L2Q) and UI/UX, in a process analyst, business analyst, or product manager role
  • Proven experience with Visio, Lucid Charts (bonus if you know Signavio), Salesforce, CPQ, Agile tools, and other methods
  • Experience in Contact to Lead & SaaS; quoting, invoicing & billing
  • Proficiency with business process documentation and business process analysis, the ability to translate disparate information into clear diagrams and/or documentation, and a consistent track record of working across multiple stakeholders
  • Ability to proactively solve problems, thrive in a fast-paced environment and navigate competing actions with a positive attitude
  • Superb communication and presentation skills and the ability to filter and convey relevant information to the appropriate audience
  • A passion for UX and the ability to translate into process design and requirements
  • Ability to develop strong, trusting partnerships in a collaborative environment
  • Thorough understanding of enterprise business processes
  • Knowledge of the business needs for “issue to resolution”
  • Competent project management skills
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related area

 

What success looks like:

After six months, you will…

  • Work across key stakeholders and have a firm grasp of Contact to Quote (C2Q) tools and operations
  • Document primary Contact to Quote (C2Q) tools and operations
  • Have document primary C2Q business process flows
  • Contribute critical documentation support to help expedite the product backlog
  • Analyze additional incoming data to be able to validate and update existing processes

 After one year, you will…

  • Understand the Contact to Lead system functionality, including SFDC and Marketo
  • Identify opportunities to improve systems and processes
  • Collaborate with peers and teams across the organization on various business process-related initiatives
  • Be a go-to person and key contributor for process library-related items


We’ve got you covered:

Our holistic benefits package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness—as well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including a 401k with company match and generous paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our values every day—we believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers.

Speaking of a great work environment, here are just a few of the perks you may enjoy, depending on your location…

  • Onsite massages, clubs, farmers market, and fitness classes
  • Delicious and healthy snacks and beverages
  • Electric vehicle charging stations
  • Outdoor amenities, seating, and courtyard BBQ
  • Dog park and pet-friendly programs
  • Newly remodeled offices with state-of-the-art amenities


Why Infoblox?

We’ve created a culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you’re a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out what it’s like to be a Bloxer. We think you’ll be excited to join our team.

 #LI-HH!
#LI-REMOTE

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
Join our Business Analytics Team as a Pricing Analyst!

When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. And just announced, the return of the 4-day work week from May 30th to Labour Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” isn’t just a catchy saying, it’s part of the #CARFAXdifference!  

Our Pricing Analyst will join our rapidly growing Pricing group and report to the Head of B2B Pricing. Playing a key part in guiding pricing strategy and operations, this person will work closely with Product teams to support both product strategy and go-to-market initiatives.

As a Pricing Analyst you will:

  • Perform complex data analysis that will help to guide pricing strategy and operations
  • Proactively analyze product usage, billing and customer data to identify drivers of customer acquisition and churn
  • Collaborate with the Head of B2B Pricing to develop and enhance value based pricing models that align with pricing strategy
  • Work with technology teams to streamline reporting and operational pricing processes to reduce time to market
  • Ensure timeliness and accuracy of input data used in pricing models
  • Build statistical models to help with value-based customer segmentation, churn prediction and anomaly detection
  • Work with product teams to share value insights and support product development roadmap

To be considered you will need:

  • Bachelor’s degree is required, preferred degree in Mathematics, Business Analytics, Economics, or similar areas of focus
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in a business analytics role, at least one year focused on Pricing, ideally B2B
  • Advanced Excel skills (Pivot Tables, vlookups, conditional sums etc.)
  • Advanced proficiency querying databases using SQL
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly organized with attention to detail
  • A commitment to learning and continuous improvement

What’s nice to have:

  • Master’s degree with a quantitative focus
  • Experience querying data using Hive and/or Spark
  • Knowledge of a visualization tool such as MicroStrategy, Cognos, Tableau
  • Program language skills using R or Python

title: Product Marketing - Outdoor
description:
We’re looking for a Product Marketeer to join our Professional Channel Team in Markham, ON.

Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.

As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!

Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

As a Product Marketeer, you'll be responsible for leading the product marketing strategy for defined luminaire categories and managing the portfolio locally (across Commercial teams).

We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

What you’ll do

  • Lead the product marketing strategy for defined luminaire categories and manage the portfolio locally (across Commercial Teams).

  • Execute pricing and define price planning models, including associated analysis.

  • Manage the market introduction, forecasting and support market activation of new products, including competitor benchmarking.

  • Define phase-in phase-out plan and execute portfolio maintenance activities.

  • Develop technical product knowledge upon input toolkit and training by Division.

Your qualifications

  • You hold at least 5 years of professional experience working in a similar role preferably (but not essentially) in the lighting or electrical sector.

  • Previous experience working with the Canadian contractor & installer industry.

  • Understanding the Canadian lighting market is a big plus (including connected lighting, IoT, etc).

  • High knowledge of Excel and other reporting platforms.

  • You have excellent communication skills in English, and you are a strong technical presenter.

  • Team player, problem-solving mindset and proven can-do attitude, which means having the drive to succeed are attributes that define yourself.

We are an equal opportunity employer and is committed to treating all people in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

To be eligible for this position, you must legally be permitted to work in Canada and travel within North America, without any additional sponsorship support from Signify. #LI-TR1

What you’ll get in return…

We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

Who we are

Signify is the world leader in lighting. We provide professional customers and consumers with quality, energy-efficient LED lighting. And our lights, when connected, bring data to devices, apps and people – redefining what light can do and how you use it. Today, our innovations, such as LiFi – internet connectivity through light – and UV-C, solar and horticultural lighting, contribute to a safer, smarter, more sustainable world.

We’re operating in 74 countries with 32,000 people worldwide.

title: Campaign Analyst
description:
Company Description

Current Indigo employees should apply through the Internal Mobility page using your @indigo.ca email address.

Dedicated to telling stories and creating experiences, Indigo is always looking for bright, energetic and customer-focused people who can help bring our exciting mission to life in one of our more than 150 Indigo, Indigospirit, Chapters and Coles stores across Canada. We offer a variety of exciting opportunities at our retail stores, distribution centres, and home office for people who share our passions and want to be part of a dynamic and enriching culture.

WHO WE ARE

  • We love books and all things beautiful
  • We are Canada’s Cultural Department Store
  • Books are our heart and our soul and Great Books are JUST the Beginning…

We play by the following rules:

  • We exist to add joy to our customers’ lives each and every time they interact with us and our products
  • Our job is to create joyful moments for our customers
  • We treat each other the way we’d treat a valued friend
  • We inspire each other to do our best work
  • We seek to ignite creativity and innovation every day
  • We give back to the communities in which we operate
Job Description

The Campaign Analyst enables the customer communication strategy by executing targeted campaigns. This role develops the targeting methodologies, governance of processes, including rigorous measurement of digital marketing campaigns. This position will work closely with the Loyalty and Digital Marketing teams to build and execute the Indigo customer contact strategy.

WHAT YOU’LL DO: 
 

Functional

  • Partner directly with loyalty, digital marketing team, merchant teams to understand and establish target audiences for marketing campaigns
  • Create and maintain audience and customer trait documentation; ensure data and naming convention consistency across channels, and that key audience segments are used appropriately
  • Act as a customer data SME; work with other functions (CRM, Data Science, Data Engineering) within the larger Customer Data and Analytics team to implement new data points for better targeting opportunities
  • Analyze campaign results and report campaign performance with recommendations to stakeholders
  • Support the planning, execution and measurement of A/B testing in digital marketing channels
  • Lead channel deep dives to solve known problems, scope potential new campaigns, and identify opportunities to personalize content for customers
  • Standardize campaign measurement analytics, and develop a framework for socializing performance results and insights
     

People

  • Collaborate with others to drive flexible and iterative solutions, quickly and easily
  • Share technical knowledge with others and actively seek to learn from those more knowledgeable than yourself: act as a mentor for others in the CRM team
  • Help others see the impacts of their efforts and proactively engage other functions to get input
  • Encourage others to freely share their point of view and be open to feedback
     

Cultural

  • Model Indigo’s beliefs and convey a positive image in everything you do
  • Celebrate diversity of thought and have an open mindset
  • Take an active role in fostering a culture of continual learning, taking risks without the fear of making mistakes
  • Embrace, champion, and influence change through your team and/or the organization
Qualifications

WHO YOU ARE: 

  • ​​​​​Degree in a quantitative field (statistics/mathematics/engineering) or equivalent experience
  • Working experience in campaign management, CRM, or Loyalty Analytics
  • Proven ability and experience analyzing customer data for actionable business insights
  • Experience with digital marketing platforms (email, paid search, paid social) and metrics an asset
  • Excellent quantitative analytical skills
  • Ability to work with complex datasets
  • SQL programming required
  • Moderate to advanced Excel skills
  • Strong data visualization skills – proficiency with Tableau is an asset
  • Effective communication skills that include excellent written, oral, and presentation abilities
  • Ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment
  • Quick and curious learner
  • Team player with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work independently
  • Skilled at turning complex analysis into simple conclusions and recommendations
  • Dedication to exceed performance expectations and approaches work with a sense of urgency and passion
  • Passionate about the Indigo brand


Additional Information

At Indigo, we are committed to our communities, our customers, and each other; together we can make a positive impact. We know that fostering diversity and inclusion brings out your full potential and creates a joyful and welcoming environment for everyone. We are driven to be an equitable employer, which highly values your diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that you, in all your uniqueness, belong at Indigo. We welcome all applicants and encourage applications from individuals who identify as Black, Indigenous, a person of colour, LGBTQ2 and people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request to individuals who self-identify as having a disability or special need. Please contact Human Resources at 1 (888) 881-3177 (toll free) or Support-HR@indigo.ca if you require an accommodation at any time during the recruitment process. 

WELCOME HOME

title: Research Associate
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

This is a temporary contract position (expected 12 months). The position would work with the R&D program managers on product development and develop/coordinate trials with EVRAZ NA facilities. Travel within North America is required. The position requires a high level of experience in manufacturing and/or advanced materials characterization.

  • Conduct steel research with a particular focus on projects related to pipemakeing and OCTG production

  • Play an active role in planning and conducting mill trials and development activities in support of divisional goals and objectives

  • Analyze tests results and prepare written reports summarizing findings

  • Develop test procedures as required to meet goals and objectives of R&D project work

  • Analyze short-term production and quality issues as required

  • Participate in H2S rescue training (the R&D facility houses an H2S corrosion testing facility, all team members participate in rescue training

  • Performs other duties as they might be assigned

Requirements

  • M.Sc. or Ph.D. in Metallurgical, Mechanical, or Welding Engineering

  • Minimum 5 years of relevant industrial or research experience

  • Practical experience with statistics and design of experiments

  • Knowledge of physical metallurgy and mechanical testing practices

  • Project management and good organizational skills

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

The position requires a high level of experience in manufacturing and/or advanced materials characterization.']

title: 2844 Technical Marketing Specialist - Optics Engineering
description:
Our client, a GTA based measurement and chemical analysis instrumentation company is hiring a Technical Marketing Specialist with an engineering background and knowledge of optics and/or spectroscopy / spectrometry. Focus on integrating work done by social media experts with the traditional marketing side to achieve company strategic objectives.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Ensuring a formidable social media presence across all digital channels.
  • Working with sales, marketing, and digital experts to create great traditional and digital marketing campaigns and promotions.
  • Content provider for email, snail mail, brochures, hand-outs, and social media team feeding YouTube, LinkedIn, and other social media sites.
  • Reaching out to customers to explain the functioning and value of company's specific spectroscopic equipment and why it is industry leading edge.
  • Developing and distributing promotional and related material used to support sales and marketing programs.
  • Making adjustments to marketing strategy based on marketing analysis.
  • Maintaining a consistent company image across all materials, website, product lines.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • B. Eng. - optical engineering or related.
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of the theory and function related to spectrometry, spectroscopy, optical engineering based on hands-on or very strong engineering based educational background.
  • Min 5 years’ pertinent background creating and conducting marketing campaigns related to optics-based chemical instrumentation (preferred).
  • Comprehending and executing market campaigns, product launches, and market research.
  • Able to create excellent sales and marketing materials based on strong scientific knowledge - brochures, hand-outs, material for social media team to use.
  • Excellent English oral and written communication, time management, multi-tasking skills.
  • Any graphic design and Maximizer CRM experience of interest.

title: Campaign Specialist
description:
Company Description

Torstar Corporation is a progressive media organization with a long, proud history in newspapers and a passion for capitalizing on the fluid world of digital and mobile media. Torstar’s vision for success is driven by a deep customer-centric obsession, continued journalistic excellence, advanced data-driven competency and a culture that is selfless, focused, agile, collaborative and results driven. The successful candidate will be a champion of those priorities while keeping the customer at the heart of all of the creative work that s/he will be doing.

Job Description

You are a dynamic, savvy media professional who can dive in and immediately add value by increasing client investment in our house of brands. Your professional demeanor and highly developed interpersonal and communication skills make you an expert in building relationships with external clients, as well as driving cross-functional cooperation with internal teams. You can prioritize multiple complex projects – whether they call for strategic vision, or deep statistical analysis. You thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment, and leverage a highly resourceful and accountable "can do" mindset to overcome day-to-day obstacles and challenges.

What You Will Do

You will serve as the advertiser’s primary post-sale point-of-contact for all campaign-related inquiries - from start to finish of the campaign lifecycle - by owning tasks and leveraging support teams. This includes, but is not limited to, the following:

  • Serve as the primary post-sale point-of-contact for clients in a designated book of business.
  • Oversee I/O processing, campaign setup and creative submission via partner teams.
  • Monitor and influence campaign delivery, troubleshoot delivery issues, and regularly provide optimization and up-sell opportunities across platforms.
  • Author and present strategic reports, campaign wrap-ups and/or Quarterly Business Reviews to client(s).
  • Lead optimization recommendations for existing clients.
  • Foster deep client relationships through a consultative, solutions-selling approach.
  • Focus on client retention, growth, renewal, and client satisfaction.
  • Advanced understanding of all Torstar’s advertising products, internal systems, and partner teams to accurately respond to client requests; including billing inquiries, campaign performance, delivery inquiries, pixel troubleshooting, etc.
  • Share skills and knowledge with fellow team members, while building productive internal and external working relationships to drive business results.
  • Maintain and grow proficiencies in the digital marketing space.
Qualifications

  • 3 years of sales/marketing experience; digital advertising experience strongly preferred
  • A background working with in a client services role
  • Excellent written communication, compelling presentation skills
  • Computer fluency, including advanced knowledge of spreadsheets (MS Excel), word processing (MS Word), Google suite, and CRM systems
  • Exceptional time management, organization, and prioritization skills
  • An inquisitive, analytical mindset with the desire to solve problems
  • Capability to grow and prosper in an ever-changing, complex environment
  • Ability to function equally well independently and as part of a team


Additional Information

Diversity & Inclusion
Torstar Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Torstar is committed to ensuring employment opportunity to qualified applicants without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, family status or disability or any other factor protected by law.

AODA
Torstar Group of Companies is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process ensuring equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code we will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify the hiring manager upon scheduling the interview of your requirements.

COVID-19
Torstar Corporation remains committed to its employees and to providing a safe workplace. As of December 31, 2021, candidates for employment are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and successful candidates must agree to obtain any additional vaccinations or booster dose(s) that may be required. Proof of such vaccination will be required. We will make accommodation for qualifying medical or religious exemptions.

title: Product Analyst - HYBRID
description:
The Product Analyst is accountable for bridging the Product vision and design with a clear outline of the product details, behaviors and case scenarios. The individual will work with the Product Manager and UX/UI Designer to elicit and analyze design and requirements of various Products by completing case scenarios, user needs/experience analysis, work flows, and design outline.  Their experience with both business and technical functions will support the successful execution of this role.

  • Clearly bridging Product requirements and design by analyzing technical/operational requirements; constructing workflows charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities and translating them into technical and WEB /UX design solutions.

  • Improves experience by studying current practices through the creation of current/future state flows and designing modifications based on various case scenarios.

  • Documenting systems requirements and technical options for both business/customer and technical audience.

  • Leading design reviews and presentations to communicate systems designs and to validate proposed solutions.

  • Supporting QA & UAT testing where required.

  • Recommends controls by identifying problems; recommending improved procedures.

  • Capable of interpreting 3rd party, Card networks, Compliance etc. specifications and converting into product requirements

  • Supporting product projects progress by tracking releases, engaging in discussions with key product and technical stakeholders and recommending actions in support of Product Manager’s vision.

  • Prepares product/technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.

  • Communicate and collaborate with Product, UX/UI Designers, Technology and other business teams to ensure efficiencies and/or work together to close gaps.

  • Support the product lifecycle and continue to monitor and create efficiencies within product and across organization

Education and professional Designation:

Bachelor’ degree in IT/Computer Science/ Engineering or a related field

 Technical Skills

  • 3-5 years of related experience as a business systems analyst

  • Experience with web-based applications and UX design

  • Familiarity with software development and project management lifecycle practices

  • Fluent in English (reading, writing, and verbal)

  • Ability to communicate effectively with people at all levels within the organization, both orally and in written

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills with a proactive attitude

  • Well-developed organization and time management skills

  • Ability to effectively manage multiple projects/tasks varying in complexity meet deadlines and work well under pressure

  • Ability to communicate effectively with both business/technical staff and customers to convey complex ideas both verbally and in written form

To reduce the risk of COVID-19 transmission and to facilitate a safe return to the office for all employees, clients and vendors, Moneris has developed a vaccination standard that requires all employees and contract resources to be fully vaccinated in order to attend company premises, company events or conduct business travel on behalf of Moneris (and provide proof).  Bona fide exemptions may be requested in accordance with legally protected grounds. 

Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous people, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

title: National Product Analyst
description:
.

This position is responsible for working with our procurement, merchandising & inventory teams providing purchasing & analytics support at the brand/product level. They will manage vendor relationships from an inventory perspective by managing supplier programs to ensure proper stocking & manage smooth product lifecycle transitions to optimize inventory levels.

   

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Manage product lifecycle transitions (new product launches and conversions)
  • Manage and track vendor winter and spring booking procurement
  • Track and optimize supplier programs, making suggestions for inventory optimization
  • Seasonal Product screen analysis and review
  • Host periodic communication and collaboration meetings with NTD inventory and merchandising teams
  • Act as the main NTD inventory contact for vendors
  • Work collaboratively with members of the Inventory team in both Canada and the USA as well as other business units including Operations, Sales, Purchasing, Marketing and Finance
  • Work with corporate account team on product assortment and specials for OEMs and Mass Merchants
  • Help define our core offering
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Experience that Best Prepares You:

  • Minimum three (3) years’ supply chain experience in a large company, within the automotive, consumer packaged goods (CPG), retail or distribution is preferred
  • 1-3 years of product analytics/inventory management experience in the tire industry is preferred
  • Solid understanding of Procurement & Inventory Management fundamentals
  • University degree in Supply Chain, Business Administration, Economics or a related discipline

Key Competencies:

  • Experience using ERP systems, with the ability to extract information and analyze clearly and efficiently
  • Excellent skills in creating summaries, reports and dashboards
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, and experience in working collaboratively with cross-functional teams
  • Strong business acumen
  • MS Excel - Expert user (pivot tables, macros, power query etc),
  • Experience in reporting applications (SplashBI, Data Warehouse etc.)
  • Attention to detail, with thoroughness and follow through
  • Ability to work independently with strong decision making skills
  • Proven ability to manage and organize large amounts of data, providing statistical analysis

   

Build a challenging and rewarding career with us!

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
Role Summary

As the Marketing Automation Specialist, you will work closely with the Digital Marketing Manager, Email Marketing Specialist, Email Marketing Coordinator, SEO/SEM Specialist and Digital Team-members to develop and deliver campaigns that provide value to our Spa Partners (B2B), encourage Retail Customers (B2C) to try our products, and prompt audience re-engagement whenever needed. In this role, you will develop nurture programs to move customers through our sales funnels. Ultimately, you will create customized and meaningful user experiences through marketing automations that promote long-term engagement with the Eminence brand. You will report directly to the Digital Marketing Manager.

Responsibilities

  • Build, implement, monitor and improve Eminenceâ€˜s email marketing strategy, test plans and automation plan development with deep collaboration and coordination across Marketing and Sales
  • Develop and manage nurture flows for prospects, guests, partners, leads and opportunities that are aligned with Eminenceâ€™s go-to-market strategies and active sales goals
  • Manage the prospect and customer database by creating targeted lists and segments. Maintain list health, data scrubbing, data integrity, including CASL and GDPR compliance
  • Understand the bi-directional data structures with HubSpot for data integration; work with administrators to coordinate integration with CRM; work with marketing platforms to troubleshoot issues and provide team support
  • Lead the demand funnel optimization program to improve the effectiveness of campaigns from contact acquisition to revenue to renewal
  • Define and optimize key performance metrics and prepare relevant dashboards/reports to share results across the team and to senior leaders
  • Develop and manage a testing strategy to continuously optimize emails and complete campaigns
  • Oversee leadership of direct reports, and partner to enhance and ensure effective automation program to drive leads and sales
  • Use web analytics and sales data to maximize sales conversion and optimize the user experience
  • Respond to internal and external inquiries within 1 business day

Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education in marketing (preferably with a digital focus)
  • Digital marketing experience with a focus in email marketing, marketing automation technology and marketing analytics - 3 years
  • Ecommerce experience - 2 years (B2B Ecommerce experience an asset)
  • Proven experience in playing a supporting role in planning, execution and analyzing of website, promotions, and email campaigns
  • Extensive experience mapping customer journey flows and building objective-based automations
  • Ability to edit and code HTML/CSS, preferably with experience specific to emails
  • Proven experience of segmentation and persona development
  • Experience with design programs, such as InDesign and Photoshop
  • Ability to analyze data and generate reports using Google Analytics or similar analytics tools
  • Experience with marketing automation platforms (e.g. HubSpot, Eloqua, Marketo, SalesForce Marketing Cloud, Oracle Marketing Cloud, SilverPop, CheetahMail, etc.) an asset
  • Knowledge of project management software (e.g., Asana or Trello) and python an asset
  • Exemplary written/oral communication, attention to detail, multi-tasking, problem-solving, conflict resolution, analytical thinking, risk analysis, and organizational skill
  • Advanced proficiency in MS Office (including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook)

Total Rewards

  • Competitive salary, quarterly and annual bonuses based on individual and company goals
  • 100% employer-paid premiums for extended health, health spending account, wellness program, green transportation incentive, various paid time-off options available from your first day, and product discounts
  • Focus on professional development, 1:1 meetings with your leader, tuition assistance program and length of service rewards

The Application

Please submit a resume with a cover letter.

Closing date for applications: Wednesday, April 6th, 2022 at 9pm PST

Our Company

Eminence Organic Skin Care provides premium products and unparalleled service to leading salons, spas and beauty professionals. For more than 10 years in a row, skin care professionals have voted Eminence Organic Skin Care their Favorite Skin Care Line and their favorite company for Product Education. As a Certified B CorporationÂ®, Eminence Organics continues to meet the highest standards of social and environmental performance, accountability and transparency for employees, customers and the community.

Eminence Organic Skin Care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are passionate about maintaining an inclusive workplace that encourages and values diversity.

#EminenceCareers

title: Customer Marketing Specialist
description:
About Netskope

Today, there's more data and users outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter as we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter was needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security. 

Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundreds of employees spread across offices in Santa Clara, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core values are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layouts and large meeting spaces to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. From catered lunches and office celebrations to employee recognition events (pre and hopefully post-Covid) and social professional groups such as the Awesome Women of Netskope (AWON), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive.  Visit us at Netskope Careers. Please follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter@Netskope.

About the position:

As a Customer Marketing team member, you will be a hands-on partner in planning, promoting, and executing highly effective and engaging customer marketing programs from end-to-end. You have a natural inclination to measure the effectiveness of marketing activities, strong project management skills, and can effectively orchestrate many moving parts.

You will work closely with cross functional teams like Customer Experience, Campaigns, Product Marketing, and Community to help deliver a great customer experience and drive retention, customer stickiness, and lifetime value.

 This role reports into the Customer Marketing Manager on the Corporate Marketing team. A remote posting is suitable, but must be based in the U.S. or Canada.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage a global customer communication calendar to ensure we are prioritizing, segmenting, and delivering the right message at the right time to our install base
  • Deliver monthly customer communications such as newsletters, release notes, and webinar promotions
  • Work cross-functionally with Product Marketing, Partner Marketing, Customer Experience, and Campaigns to ensure all market relevant content is surfaced to customers in the right way
  • Support the Customer Experience teams to build out scalable education programs to decrease 1-to-1 support and improve customer lifetime value
  • Assist in executing personalized customer engagement and upsell programs for Netskope’s global customer base to help them successfully leverage and grow their use of the Netskope platform
  • Ensure that customer programs are demonstrably growing in line with KPI’s

Job Requirements:

  • 2+ years experience in a customer marketing or campaign role
  • B2B experience required
  • SaaS company experience preferred
  • Security and/or Networking (IT/technology industry) experience is a plus
  • Experience in agile work environments is a plus
  • Experience running multi-channel marketing campaigns and an understanding of customer journey mapping 
  • Familiar with B2B marketing tools (Salesforce, Marketo, Terminus, ON24)
  • A self-starter attitude and team player, able to accept direction, and work independently
  • A positive attitude with adaptability in a fast-paced work environment 
  • Results-oriented
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong attention to detail

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree

 

#LI-AF1 

 

Netskope respects your privacy and is committed to protecting the personal information you share with us, please refer to Netskope's Privacy Policy for more details.

title: Marketer
description:
Job Summary: SWP West is looking to hire a marketer. We are looking for outgoing, positive and money driven marketers that can work part time throughout the next 6 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

Hours: Monday - Thursday 5:00pm to 8:00pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm with a minimum of 4 hours per week. You can design your schedule!

All training will be provided!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:
  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others
Requirements to apply:
  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work

title: Marketing Content Writer - North America
description:
The Role

Sterling-Hoffman, part of the Ian Martin Group, is seeking a Content Marketer to join our growing team! If you describe yourself as someone who gets excited by creating effective copy that drives lead generation, works independently, embraces hard work and has a strong desire to continuously learn and improve, we want to hear from you.

The Content Marketer will demonstrate a clear understanding of marketing personas and target markets to deliver integrated, results-oriented content that helps generate leads for the sales funnel. Not one to rest on your laurels, you are always reviewing analytics for your campaigns to identify and execute on new tests, striving to continuously improve your work.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Develop and own effective B2B and B2C email campaigns that deliver on company strategy and drive SQLs
  • Support team members’ projects by writing powerful copy for digital marketing campaigns, sales playbooks, candidate-facing content, social media, and website
  • Own the results of your campaigns by developing and implementing testing strategies to improve performance including A/B testing, incrementally testing, audience segmentation, and more
  • Actively evaluate the effectiveness of campaigns against KPIs to maximize ROI and implement strategies with clear recommendations for future campaigns (direction, tactics, timeline, etc.)
  • Research target personas (both B2B and B2C) and understand buying intent to better inform demand generation and lead generation messaging
  • Evaluate campaign analytics to identify end-user patterns and make recommendations to continually improve campaign effectiveness
  • Create and maintain social media calendar (LinkedIn, Facebook) to ensure regular, engaging, and timely posts
  • Simultaneously manage multiple projects with competing deadlines

What You’ll Bring To The Table

  • 4 - 6 years of demonstrated experience in business or professional writing
  • At least 1 - 2 years of experience creating and managing email campaigns or other digital campaigns
  • Qualification in Marketing/Communications/Digital Advertising preferred
  • Working knowledge of HubSpot, MailChimp, Eloqua, Marketo or other Marketing Automation platforms
  • Excellent editing and proof-reading skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to work as a self-starter and take ownership of your projects
  • Knowledge of the staffing industry is a plus
  • Knowledge of the Food & Beverage or Life Sciences industries is a plus
  • B2B writing experience is a plus
  • Experience using design tools such as Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator is a plus
  • Enthusiastic about working with teams across different functions and geographies
  • You have a self-starter mindset, one that is constantly learning, tenacious and flexible
  • Comfortable working in a metrics-driven culture where you are accountable for specific content-related KPIs. 

Writing Samples

Along with your application, please submit a brief (500 words max) writing sample that showcases your work and is in line with the desired qualifications. If you experience issues submitting your writing sample, do let us know and we will be able to collect it in a different way.

About Us

  • This is a full-time, permanent position with an annual salary of $55,000 - $65,000
  • Remote work policy: The Sterling-Hoffman crew primarily work from home but we have offices in Oakville, ON and Toronto, ON that we sometimes visit as well
  • Sterling-Hoffman encourages an entrepreneurial culture of transparency, collaboration, and innovation. We continuously identify and test out areas for growth, both within our processes as well as with our business as a whole
  • Our parent company, The Ian Martin Group, is a certified B Corp. We are a company driven to connect people in meaningful work.
  • Everyone at The Ian Martin Group cares about Justice, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion. We have an active internal task force stewarding this work, addressing systemic issues both internally and externally through projects, programming and engaging allied clientele.

How to Apply

Our online application will give you the option to apply for this role as a complete person - not just a resume. We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, Francophones, veterans, and people with disabilities. Do let us know if you would like any accommodations regarding your application process. We look forward to hearing from you.
