title: Coordonnateur·trice Marketing - Analyse de ventes -Été 2022
description:
We’re looking for a sales analysis coordinator with experience in data analysis and a passion for video games. Working with our multidisciplinary Sales, Business Development & Partnerships team in charge of distribution and promotion, you will help produce quality performance reports and analysis on projects assigned to you.

To be considered for this internship, you must 
·       Be available to work 37.5 hours/week for four (4) months;
·       Be eligible to work in Canada at the time of your application.

In this role you will:

  • Help develop performance reports to analyze launch strategies and 1P sales (Steam, PlayStation, Xbox, Switch, Stadia);
  • Build ad hoc analysis to optimize products and promotions life cycles;
  • Maintain tools and dashboards to provide better visualization of sales performance.

What we're looking for :

  • Studies in business, sales, marketing or in a related field;
  • Expert or intermediate knowledge of Excel, a definite asset;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills (presentation, communication);
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills in English;
  • Ability to communicate proactively with internal and external audiences;
  • Analytical mindset, ability to work under minimal supervision, good organization skills;
  • Ability to work well within assigned timelines and deadlines;
  • Interest for new technologies, BI, and video games.

Dans ce rôle vous devrez :

  • Vous aiderez à développer des rapports de performance pour analyser les stratégies de lancement et les ventes first parties (Steam, Playstation, Xbox, Switch, Stadia);
  • Construire des analyses ad hoc pour optimiser les cycles de vie et promotions des produits;
  • Maintenir les outils et tableaux de bord afin d’apporter une meilleure visualisation des performances de ventes.

Ce que nous recherchons:

  • Études en Ventes marketing ou dans un domaine connexe;
  • Niveau intermédiaire ou Expert sur Excel serait un atout non négligeable;
  • Excellentes aptitudes interpersonnelles (présentation, communication);
  • Excellente communication écrite et verbale en anglais;
  • Communication proactive (à l’interne et à l’externe);
  • Analytique, autonome et organisé;
  • Respect des horaires et des dates de tombée;
  • Intérêt pour les nouvelles technologies et la BI et/ou les jeux vidéo.
Nous sommes à la recherche d’un coordinateur Analyse de ventes. Votre passion pour les jeux vidéo et votre expérience en analyse de données feront de vous la personne idéale pour occuper ce poste. Au sein de l'équipe multidisciplinaire Ventes, développement d'affaires et partenariats, responsable des opérations distribution et promotion, vous aiderez à de produire des rapports et des analyses de qualité sur la performance des projets qui vous sont assignés.

Pour être considéré.e pour ce stage, vous devez: 
·       Être disponible pour travailler 37.5 heures/semaine pour quatre (4) mois;
·       Être admissible pour travailler au Canada au moment du dépôt de votre candidature.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
We are growing and hiring a full-time marketing coordinator to collaborate with staff and interact with customers and end users.

Responsibilities include:
  • Assist with the development and execution of the company’s marketing strategy.
  • Generate creative and search engine optimized content, including images and stories.
  • Share posts to social media accounts, including Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn.
  • Design and create emails for our customer lists.
  • Engage with our community across our social media platforms.
  • Create blogs independently, with guidance on topics and content.
  • Coordinate PR initiatives.
Skills and Requirements:
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience with Social Media platforms and proficient with Microsoft Office.
  • Prior experience working in B2B marketing, public relations, and/or graphic design is an asset.
  • Strong organization and time management skills.
  • Ability to speak French is an asset.

title: Web Analytics Specialist (Quebec)
description:
Company Description

All of our positions are available across Canada. We offer co-working spaces in Montreal (head office), Toronto, Quebec and Windsor.

Nurun crafts useful digital experiences that elevate brands and transform businesses. From creating products and services to data science and human research, we take the best of agility and apply a hybrid approach to adapt to the needs of our clients. Even after delivery, our involvement does not stop. We push the limits of technology to evolve and optimize our products and their performance.

Job Description

Are you passionate about advancements in digital performance measurement? Are you interested in digital ecosystems and different business models? Do you want to learn and grow in a dynamic, creative, and multi-client environment at a 100% digital agency? Do people think you're skilled at summarizing, analyzing, and translating data into easily digestible content? Read on! We have an opportunity that could boost your early career!

Our Offer

As part of the strategy and business design team, you’ll be joining a team of data and web analytics experts. Your role will be to support the agency's clients in the development of digital measurement strategies as well as in the optimization of their various platforms and business activities. You’ll have the opportunity to work in collaboration with project managers, strategic planners, UX designers, and content managers to fuel strategic discussions and the implementation of data-driven recommendations.

You’ll also participate in the development of performance reports for various clients as well as the implementation and configuration of measurement tools. Your analyses will rely on several data sources, including web analytics tools, social media monitoring tools, customer databases, and reports from research institutes. The goal: to translate the study of this data into strategic recommendations and tactics for clients and internal teams.

Your day-to-day involves:

  • Defining analytical requirements for projects and writing design documents for analytical solutions (web and mobile platforms);
  • Performing quality assurance on collected data;
  • Configuring analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager;
  • Developing automated and multi-channel dashboards for monitoring client performance;
  • Contributing to the development of digital strategies for various clients and collaborating with strategic planners to identify opportunities through available data;
  • Collaborating on data-based recommendations and supporting internal teams in their implementation;
  • Defining KPIs with clients and ensuring their measurement;
  • Monitoring the latest trends/news in web analytics and data science;
  • Supporting the content team in the performance analysis of clients' social media networks and platforms.
Qualifications

Conditions for success:

  • Diploma in e-commerce, marketing, business intelligence, or equivalent related program;
  • Experience as a web analytics specialist or equivalent;
  • Experience with one or more web analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Facebook Insights, and Twitter Analytics;
  • Experience with one or more reporting and dashboarding tools such as Google Data Studio and Tableau;
  • Fluent in written and spoken English and French (our clients are international);
  • Intermediate to advanced understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, cookies, JavaScript, etc.);
  • Experience communicating and justifying recommendations to multidisciplinary teams and clients.

Assets

  • Certification in Google Analytics IQ (individual qualification);
  • Knowledge of Adobe Analytics and Adobe Dynamic Tag Management;
  • Knowledge of A/B testing tools such as Optimizely and Visual Website Optimizer;
  • Knowledge of best practices for search engine optimization (SEO);
  • Basic knowledge of marketing automation tools: Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Campaign, Marketo;
  • Knowledge of social media analysis tools: Netbase, Brandwatch.


Additional Information

Visibility into Nurun’s interview process:

At Nurun, we want our interview experience to be representative of the employee experience: collaborative, transparent, and friendly. Through virtual discussions in the comfort of your home, you'll meet with your future lead, Tom Boutet, and members of your team. To get to know you better, they'll ask about your approach and  mindset. The entire process will be completed within 2 weeks, guaranteed!

Why Nurun?

  • Large-scale digital projects for major clients around the world;
  • A competitive offer and wide range of social benefits from day one;
  • A hybrid Agile methodology enriched by collaboration with passionate experts;
  • The option of working 100% remotely, with access to a collaborative office space;
  • A flexible schedule that truly allows work-life balance; 
  • A personalized development plan supported by our continuing education platforms.

Who we are

Nurun crafts useful digital experiences that elevate brands and transform businesses. From creating products and services to data science and human research, we take the best of agility and apply a hybrid approach to adapt to the needs of our clients. Even after delivery, our involvement does not stop. We push the limits of technology to evolve and optimize our products and their performance. Curious to know more? Visit us on Instagram and LinkedIn.

title: Market Sales Coordinator
description:
Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

As a Market Sales Coordinator with United Rentals, you will support Strategic Account Managers and Market Sales Managers by being a dedicated point of contact for orders, sourcing, logistics and account coordination. You will work closely with these assigned Managers on contract terms, pricing and fulfillment. Your primary focus is on capturing rental equipment orders and fulfillment but will also participate in activities that support building customer trust, retention and promoting UR total value proposition. You will do so in a manner that supports customer advocacy and United Rentals revenue growth for all business units. Your overall objective is to deliver the highest possible levels of order fulfillment and customer satisfaction.

If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. You will be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals.Excellence in this challenging and rewarding position paves the way for advancement opportunities.

Additional responsibilities include the following:

  • Constantly capture and execute customer orders with a high degree of urgency

  • Work with Inside Sales Reps from all business units in the market, actively source equipment, arrange transportation, and develop orders accurately across all UR general rental and Specialty branches

  • Provide customers viable, well thought-out equipment alternatives if certain equipment is not available

  • Maintain high familiarity and skill within UR One, UR Control, Total Control, mobile apps and Sales Force

  • Identify and communicate opportunities to increase profitability and expand customer equipment mix

  • Provide equipment, on-rent, and invoice level reporting to customers as requested or scheduled

  • Respond to and diffuse customer objections

  • Monitor customer feedback surveys and interject as needed

  • Other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree preferred or 3 years of customer service experience

  • Strong customer service orientation

  • Strong communication and presentation skills

  • Solid computer skills and knowledge of most current business software

  • Independent worker and self-starter with strong self-imposed structure

  • Knowledge of equipment rental industry, Total Control, ERP systems, and pricing for rates, freight, and overtime

  • Ability to multi-task and interact with customers via phone, email, text or web

  • Strong sense of urgency

At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future.

What's in it for you?

U.S. Full Time roles:  Best in class benefits offering includes medical, dental, vision, flex spending and health savings accounts;  401(k) retirement with company match; life and disability insurance; and paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental leave.  Comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

U.S. Part Time roles: Benefits offering includes 401(k) retirement with company match/RRSP; paid time off including sick, vacation and holidays; and comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

Canada: Best in class benefits package which includes medical, dental & vision, RRSP/DPSP*, paid time off, comprehensive training and development, and career growth opportunities.

*Offered for full time roles, part time eligibility in select provinces

United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Marketing Operations Specialist
description:
At Upland Software, you’ll find smart, creative teams who love working together to deliver value for our customers, and a global culture of growth and possibility. Our operating model has always supported remote work and as we keep growing and evolving our workplace, that won’t change. We’re passionate. We’re proactive. We take pride in our work, and we love a good challenge. Sound like you? 

Opportunity Summary:

The Marketing Operations Specialist is an essential member our growing Marketing team. In this role, you'll be working within our marketing technology stack and alongside our marketing teams to implement key initiatives, and reporting to the Director of Marketing Strategy and Operations,

As a specialist, you’ll use your passion for data, process, operations, and love of “getting stuff done” to help our marketing team excel by collaborating with demand generation experts to build and launch campaigns through Marketo and provide visibility into campaign execution through Salesforce reports and dashboards. As you grow in this role, you’ll work with these teams to provide key insights and help define tactical execution for some of their largest pipeline building strategies.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Build, and deploy Marketo programs, consisting of list uploads, email deployments, and event and webinar campaigns. Manage end-to-end email campaign execution, including planning, list segmentation, set-up, testing, execution, reporting, and optimization.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to create and deliver highly-targeted marketing campaigns, emails, retention/reactivation programs, and customer success communications.
  • Work with the Marketing Operations Manager on the email production process and to ensure programs are properly constructed and meet quality standards.
  • Troubleshoot and QA campaigns, workflows, data issues, and other key marketing operations functions.
  • Devise new email strategies to improve overall channel performance and optimize email deliverability, including creative optimization, A/B split testing, developing automated, and triggered campaigns.
  • Build and maintain self-serve reporting in Marketo and Salesforce showing campaign performance, and regularly present vital data to key players within the organization.
  • Interact with Upland Marketing Team on a regular basis as a representative of the Marketing Operations team.

Skills & Requirements:

  • Our ideal candidate is organized, innovative, and a high-energy doer: someone who can handle multiple tasks at a time and has the ability to manage their time efficiently – and who wants to be of an elite team that sits as the operational backbone for our marketers.
  • Has a passion for processes, automation, and information systems; a person who looks at data analytically and can use it to back up assumptions and assess the success of marketing programs.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in time and project management; has ability to break down projects into smaller tasks and assign timelines throughout.
  • Experience with campaign setup, audience segmentation, email deployment, and creating and presenting reporting data
  • Proficiency with marketing automation, CRM, and CMS - preferably Marketo, Salesforce, and WordPress, respectively.
  • Knowledge of landing page and email marketing best practices is strongly preferred
  • 1+ years in a fast-paced operations environment (sales, marketing, customer success) or project management-based role
  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing/business or equivalent preferred
  • Marketo Certified Expert is a plus

Upland Software (Nasdaq: UPLD) is a leader in cloud-based tools for digital transformation. To learn more, visit www.uplandsoftware.com. 

 Upland Software is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, disability, veteran status or other legally protected status.

title: Marketing Analyst / Specialist 1 - 17444
description:
Description:
Responsible for a range of marketing initiatives required to support TELUS’ marketing strategies.

Responsibilities:
1. Assist in the preparation of training and/or communication materials. Execute and monitor existing campaigns, programs and/or initiatives.
2. Track competitive developments and compiling relevant market research and report on findings.
3. Assist in measuring the impact of individual campaigns, programs and/or initiatives.
4. Assist with budget tracking as required.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities (KSA)
1. Strong analytical, verbal and written communication, organizational and computer skills.
2. Attention to detail.
3. Positive, get-it-done attitude.

Education: Post secondary diploma / certification

Experience: 3 - 5 years of equivalent experience

title: Marketer - Strathmore
description:
Job Summary: SWP Chestermere/Strathmore/Langdon is looking to add four marketers to the team. We are looking for outgoing, positive and money-driven marketers that can work part-time throughout the next 6 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

Our hours will consist of Monday to Thursday 5:00pm to 8:00pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm, with your choice of a minimum of 6 hours per week. This job is incredibly flexible where you can choose your hours each week!

All training will be provided, there is no experience necessary.

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:
  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others
Pay Structure:
Every crew member can expect to make a minimum of minimum wage and our last years highest earning employees were averaging $25/hr. Specific pay structure will be discussed during our first phone call.

Requirements to apply:

  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work
  • Communication
  • Access to a vehicle as marketing routes will vary each day

title: Communications Specialist (FT)
description:
The Granite Club is hiring a Communications Specialist who will play an integral consulting role with internal partners, advising on communications best practices and strategies. A skilled communicator, the Specialist coordinates, writes, and edits content for a wide range of digital and print collateral. This integral member of the team is a natural wordsmith, creative marketer, experienced project manager, and web-savvy influencer. Our dynamic and energetic Communications team is driven for excellence, takes great pride in the details, and loves to be tasked with a wide variety of creative projects.

Benefits of working for the Granite Club
  • Healthy and delicious daily food offerings in our Staff Caf
  • Extensive medical and dental benefits for employees and their families
  • Indoor parking for Employees
  • Exciting and diverse Employee events for both Staff and their friends and family
  • Discounted Goodlife Fitness and GTA yoga studio memberships
  • An Employee Wellness Program focused on both physical and mental health
  • Employee amenities including a comfortable Employee resting lounge, Employee on-site gym, free wi-fi, and Employee computer stations
Primary Responsibilities
  • Consult with internal partners to gather and coordinate messaging requirements
  • Advise on Communications best practices and processes
  • Write creative and compelling marketing copy for promotional collateral across various media
  • Write professional articles, letters, and technical documents
  • Copy-edit and proofread content using Granite Club style and formatting; exemplary grammar, punctuation, and spelling; meticulous continuity and consistency
  • Coordinate bi-monthly Club magazine from submission through production
  • Work with various departments to coordinate and execute annual marketing calendars
  • Work with Communications Manager to refine and reinforce the Granite brand
  • Generate high-quality content for email campaigns to foster increased Member engagement
  • Working with Digital Marketing Specialist, oversee the website, intranet, and LCD screens to ensure they are current, consistent, and accurate; ensure GraniteClub.com is the most reliable destination for Members and prospective Members to obtain Club information
  • Maintain and enhance online presence
  • Play an integral role in the development and implementation of future social media strategies
  • Employ strong experience and sound judgment in prioritization and creative tasks; demonstrate exceptional attention to detail
  • Create, select and edit photos and other media as necessary
Required Qualifications
  • University degree in marketing, communications, public relations, or related field
  • Minimum 4–5 years professional experience as part of a marketing/communications team
  • Exceptional writing and proofreading skills; expert-level grammar and a creative flair
  • Superior planning and strategy building to achieve big picture objectives and support business goals
  • Excellent organizational and time-management skills; project management and multitasking
  • Exemplary interpersonal and customer service skills; maturity, positive attitude, and demonstrated success in liaising between many stakeholders
  • Process-driven, highly accountable, and sense of urgency for deliverables; ability to thrive in an office that is fast-paced, challenging, and evolving
  • Proficient in PC environments; tech-savvy with the ability to quickly learn new software
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Word/Excel/Powerpoint)
  • Experience working within web content management and email campaign systems; general knowledge of web best practices and familiarity with web development concepts; basic HTML and CSS an asset
  • Keen eye for aesthetics and design
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite, photography and videography an asset

About the Granite Club
The Granite philosophy of uncompromising quality is showcased in its state-of-the-art athletic facilities, world-class events and programs for all ages, delectable dining experiences, and personalized services, each tailored to suit the varied needs and desires of its diverse and sophisticated Membership.

The Granite Club is Canada's premier private Members' family, athletic, recreation, and social club. Located in north Toronto, we offer our 11,000 Members the highest standard of facilities, programs, and services.
We strive to recruit enthusiastic, dedicated individuals with a passion for providing exceptional service. We’ll reward all your hard work with a competitive salary and extensive benefits.

If you are a passionate individual looking to work as part of a growing team, click apply now!

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

As part of Granite Club policy, a condition of employment is to perform a criminal background check and a vulnerable sector search demonstrating a satisfactory criminal record prior to commencing employment.

The Granite Club is committed to providing fair and accessible employment practices. If selected for an interview, we will be happy to work with you to ensure your interview is accessible and accommodation is provided based on the information you provide to the Granite Club Recruiter.

title: Associate Principal, Marketing Transformation
description:
Overview:


Daggerwing Group is seeking an Associate Principal  for our North America office!  

About the Job:

Daggerwing Group â€“ Omnicomâ€™s global change management consulting firm, rated in the Top 10 in the world in its category â€“ is seeking an Associate Principal for Global and North American clients, with a base in North America. This role will be heavily focused in driving modern marketing and CX transformation for Fortune 500-level clients â€“ helping companies change the way that marketing organizations â€“ and marketers â€“ modernize to deliver greater value for customers, brands and their business.

 

As an Associate Principal (a VP level position), you will be focused on three areas:

  1. Driving end-to-end excellence in modern, data and insight-driven marketing processes/practices for clients â€“ working with CMOs and their leadership teams to prioritize and implement changes to marketing processes, structures, roles, capabilities, culture and talent/employee experience.
  2. Guiding, empowering and supporting Daggerwing employees so that they love the career-building benefits of working at our consultancy â€“ and feel supported within our inclusive culture.
  3. Helping to grow the business and the marketing transformation practice at Daggerwingâ€“ elevating our value with existing and new clients as well with agency partners across our parent company (Omnicom Group) network.

 

You will report to a member of Daggerwing Groupâ€™s Leadership Team in North America. You will also be part of a Global Leadership Team that you can tap into for ideas and support â€“ including leveraging consulting and creative resources from different Daggerwing Group offices around the world.

 

What will you be doing?

 

Managing delivery of marketing transformation consulting for clients

  • Applying your marketing knowledge to help clients pivot to more modern, data-driven marketing practices â€“ guiding clients to define their ideal â€˜future of marketingâ€™ state, assess their gaps and generate a roadmap for change that may range from shifting org structures across the marketing function and embracing more marketing technologies to creating more purposeful brands, redesigning E2E campaign processes and elevating capabilities in personalized engagement at every step of the customer journey.
  • Developing strategies/methods to help clients put customers at the center of marketing planning and decision-making â€“ helping clients to better understand and apply customer insights as part of culture, organization and process changes.
  • Leading, managing and/or overseeing consulting project management -- from concept to implementation, including leading team members in the development of SOWs, project plans and budgets for both new and current clients, taking into consideration client business needs and staffing/pricing approaches that ensure Daggerwing Group meets or exceeds revenue targets.
  • Building and strengthening relationships with stakeholders at Omnicom agencies, to encourage them to connect with Daggerwing Group when they have clients needing change management support.
  • Providing hands-on leadership to teams and oversight for client projects, to ensure they are on track, on time and on budget from both a client and Daggerwing Group business perspective â€“ with an emphasis on managing all projects to ensure Daggerwing meets monthly/quarterly finance projections.
  • Leading and/or facilitating the collaboration of multiple stakeholders (different departments in a client organization, agencies, other consulting firms) on large-scale client engagements, keeping all teams on track to meet client goals.

 

Strengthening the experience for our Employees

 

  • Providing hands-on coaching so that employees are always learning â€“ but at the same time ensuring that employees feel confident in trying new things, taking appropriate risks and learning new skills.
  • Working with employees to ensure that they have a learning and development plan that helps them grow and aligns with employeeâ€™s personal goals and the ambitions of Daggerwing Group.
  • Working with other Global Leadership Team members on initiatives to enhance our company culture and employee engagement.

 

 

Growing the business

 

  • Working with current clients to understand their business challenges - and then providing them with recommendations that address their challenges and opportunities.
  • Contributing to Daggerwing Groupâ€™s thought leadership platforms and contributing â€“ as a member of the Global Leadership Team â€“ ideas on ways to expand our expertise and solutions, stand out as competitors and grow our reputation.
Qualifications:

 

  • Recent experience on the client or agency side as a senior marketing leader
  • Experience as a participant/leader in any type of Marketing transformation effort (including building modern marketing capabilities, changing process and ways of working for planning and executing, adapting how companies work with agency partners in advertising, media, social, digital, experiential, etc.)
  • Strong understanding of modern marketing best practices and processes (purposeful brand building, omni channel orchestration, data-driven optimization, etc.)
  • Experience in designing or strengthening Marketing Process
  • Experience with Program/Project Management, managing large scale projects with multiple workstreams
  • Experience in advising for large clients and/or projects â€“ such as working with executive leadership teams, driving organization, marketing transformations, culture change, process change or internal communications for major new initiatives.
  • Proven experience in being a trusted advisor to a client or leader in your organisation â€“ with examples of where you were able to provide a strong point of view to address challenges
  • Ability to create and manage budgets
  • Recognised as a strong leader â€“ being a person team members want to work for because they feel that you are making their career aspirations and learning and development a priority
  • Comfortable with traveling internationally (when it safe) and has a valid passport

 

About You

Weâ€™re looking for leaders with:

 

  • A keen interest in being part of a company that is a â€˜challenger brandâ€™ â€“ working hard to bust the norms and stand out competitively against large, traditional consulting competitors
  • Curiosity and a growth mindset â€“ a positive attitude and a desire to constantly learn and grow
  • Thrive under pressure in collaborative and non-structured environments â€“ ability to be agile and flexible to continually changing priorities and ways of working
  • High degree of proactivity, a strong work ethic and self-motivated
  • Love to nurture the careers of others and is excited to play a role in team members growth and progress
  • Understand that consulting companies donâ€™t always work 9â€“5 and being part of a global company means sometimes there are calls with overseas team members at late and early hours

title: Field Marketing Specialist
description:
Who we are

mobileLIVE is a full-service digital company obsessed with helping our clients make smart investments and reduce time-to-launch.

Our team hailing from 25 countries, specializes in designing experiences, building products, and scaling technology and is committed to helping our clients navigate the most demanding challenges, unlock the real potential, and drive transformative and scalable growth.

100% client retention and 20 notable industry recognition reflect our reliability in delivering what we promise and the quality we bring to every engagement.

Join our growth-driven culture and help us lead, innovate, and simplify. We are looking for team members who embody our values:
  • Empathetic - we listen, we understand, and are considerate of everyone
  • Persevering - we don’t give up on challenges or people and go all the way
  • Inclusive - we value everyone and their perspectives
  • Reliable - we deliver what we promise, and more
  • Innovative - we make things better than they were yesterday
The role

We seek a team player passionate about helping the sales team succeed. As a Field Marketing Specialist, you’ll partner with a portfolio of accounts to plan and implement account-based programs and campaigns to achieve the desired brand experience.

This is a high-visibility role and requires exceptional project management and execution abilities.

The ideal candidate understands B2B enterprise marketing, is resourceful, creative, energetic, fun to work with, and ready to take challenges head-on.

You will
  • Support the Account Management teams to meet their objectives
  • Assist in strategizing and building integrated field campaigns
  • Lead campaign executions and track effectiveness against objectives
  • Evaluate campaign ROI in partnership with Account Management teams
  • Collaborate with content, creative, and digital marketing teams on campaigns
  • Build and maintain an events calendar aligned with company priorities
  • Coordinate speaking, sponsoring and exhibiting opportunities
  • Manage vendors required for campaign execution and the inventory
  • Research and manage creative swag and its distribution
  • Track and manage budgets and deadlines associated with activities
  • Monitor industry trends and competitor activities
Mandatory Skills
  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field
  • 2+ years of experience of planning and executing marketing events and activities
  • Understands B2B enterprise marketing and is experienced in supporting the sales team
  • Resourceful, creative, energetic, fun to work with, and ready to take challenges head-on
  • Collaborative with excellent interpersonal, written, social, and verbal communication skills
  • Strong ability to multitask and meet deadlines for the campaigns
What to expect

Besides Competitive Salary and working for one of Canada’s Best Managed and Top 50 Technology Companies, you should expect:
  • Purposeful Work: autonomy, resources, and time you need to do what matters for our clients and most importantly - you
  • Positive Environment: recognition coupled with a flexible environment that celebrates diversity, inclusivity and encourages everyone to achieve their best
  • Growth & Development: opportunities to grow professionally and personally through mentorship, training, and development programs
  • Transparency & Trust: direction, purpose, mission, and expectations are never a secret; you’ll always know where you stand as well as where you’re going
  • Exclusive Perks: discounts on shopping, the gym, insurance, mobile phone plans, not to mention an office smoothie bar and enough coffee to make you vibrate
  • Meaningful Benefits: life happens. You’ll get health, dental, vision, disability, travel insurance, and much more all covered by us
  • Unforgettable Events: team bonding, BBQs, office lunches (pizza, always pizza), gala dinners, and any other excuse to have fun
Inclusion and equal opportunity employment

mobileLIVE is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status, or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request.

Are you ready to join the award-winning team and help us accelerate digital transformation?

title: Ad Operations Coordinator (1 Year Contract)
description:
Samsung Ads l AdGear is an advanced Advertising Technology Company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry's most comprehensive data to build the world's smartest connected audience platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on big complex projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.

Samsung Ads is looking to add an Ad Operations Coordinator to our Ad Operations team.

This role will be based in Montreal Canada. Any roles based in Montreal will follow a hybrid work model. 

About the team

As an AdOperations Coordinator, you will work closely with Platform and AdOperations Specialists to own the success of digital advertising campaigns. You will have the unique opportunity to work on the leading edge of innovation with the company's proprietary ad platform and to learn hands-on about digital advertising supported by a hard-working and fun team. The ideal candidate would have a keen interest in new technologies and digital media and be highly motivated to grow and learn in this challenging fast-paced environment.

This role reports directly to the Ad Operations team lead

What you will do

  • Share campaign calendar with Platform and Ad Operation Specialists
  • Assist with the set-up and QA of creatives for trafficking purposes
  • Perform quality control of creatives, directly on the TVs
  • Monitor campaign pacing and performance based on given KPIs
  • Partner with the other members of the Campaign Management team to troubleshoot delivery issue and to enhance internal tools & processes
  • Assist in the development of custom client-facing performance reports
  • Generate reports across multiple brand safety and attribution ad servers

What you will need

  • 0 to 1 year experience in online advertising, marketing or digital media
  • Degree in Marketing, Communications, Computer Science, or a related field
  • Understanding of digital campaign life cycle and fundamental knowledge of online media metrics and analysis
  • Computer literate with superior knowledge of Excel
  • Effective time management, communication, analytical thinking and problem-solving skills

Benefits

  • 100% company-paid comprehensive health & dental coverage as of Day 1. Access to an employee assistance program  and a virtual care platform (wellness, medical & nutrition).
  • Personal spending account & Healthcare spending account with Sun Life
  • Competitive compensation package, including performance incentive bonus plan based on company, team and personal objectives
  • Minimum 21 days of paid time off 

Perks

  • Virtual social committee-lead activities such as monthly wine club night, games night as well as wellness initiatives like virtual yoga and meditation, art therapy, aromatherapy classes
  • Access to learning and development opportunities (your own LinkedIn Learning license, Pluralsight, professional development program, continuing education and more)
  • Officevibe - anonymous feedback from our teams to know how you're really doing and keep you engaged
  • Onboarding framework which ensures you're set up for success from Day 1 to Year 1. This also includes a buddy program (someone who will be there for you) from Day 1
  • Amazing discounts through Samsung Employee Discounts website and access to Perkopolis website with great rebates, coupons and promotions
  • Summer Fridays
  • Generous  Employee Referral Program
  • Giving Back Program which includes donation matching & volunteering initiatives including one paid volunteer day

*certain benefits & perks apply to only full time permanent roles. Please ask TA for additional details.

Life at Samsung Ads

Samsung Ads is an advanced Advertising Technology Company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry's most comprehensive data to build the world's smartest connected audience platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on big complex projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.

We are proud to have built a world-class organization, grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.

Are you hesitant to submit an application because you're not sure if you check every box? Apply anyway! We would love to hear from you and figure out what you can add to the culture here at Samsung Ads.

Samsung Ads cherche à ajouter un coordonnateur des opérations publicitaires à notre équipe des opérations publicitaires.

À propos de l'équipe

En tant que coordonnateur des opérations publicitaires, vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les spécialistes de la plateforme et des opérations publicitaires pour vous approprier le succès des campagnes publicitaires numériques. Vous aurez l'opportunité unique de travailler à la pointe de l'innovation avec la plateforme publicitaire exclusive de l'entreprise et d'apprendre de manière pratique la publicité numérique avec le soutien d'une équipe travailleuse et amusante. Le candidat idéal aurait un vif intérêt pour les nouvelles technologies et les médias numériques et serait très motivé pour grandir et apprendre dans cet environnement stimulant et en évolution rapide.

Ce rôle relève directement du chef d'équipe des opérations publicitaires.

Tous nos employés travaillent actuellement à distance depuis leur domicile. À l'avenir, ce rôle sera hybride et nécessitera une combinaison de travail à partir de notre bureau de Montréal, QC et de travail à distance.

Veuillez noter que vous travaillerez pendant les heures de la côte ouest (12 h-20 h), car vous serez en contact avec notre équipe de la côte ouest. Il s'agit d'un rôle contractuel d'un an, avec possibilité de conversion.

Ce que vous ferez

  • Partager le calendrier des campagnes avec les spécialistes de la plateforme et des opérations publicitaires.
  • Participer à la configuration et au contrôle qualité des créations à des fins de trafic.
  • Effectuer un contrôle qualité des créations, directement sur les téléviseurs.
  • Surveiller le rythme et les performances des campagnes en fonction d'indicateurs clés de performance donnés.
  • Collaborer avec les autres membres de l'équipe de gestion de campagne pour résoudre les problèmes de livraison et améliorer les outils et processus internes.
  • Aider au développement de rapports de performance personnalisés destinés aux clients.
  • Générer des rapports sur plusieurs serveurs publicitaires de sécurité de la marque et d'attribution.

Ce dont vous aurez besoin

  • 0 à 1 an d'expérience dans la publicité en ligne, le marketing ou les médias numériques.
  • Diplôme en marketing, communication, informatique ou dans un domaine connexe.
  • Compréhension du cycle de vie des campagnes numériques et connaissance fondamentale des mesures et de l'analyse des médias en ligne.
  • Connaissances en informatique avec une connaissance supérieure d'Excel.
  • Compétences efficaces en gestion du temps, en communication, en pensée analytique et en résolution de problèmes.

La vie chez Samsung Ads

Samsung Ads est une société de technologie publicitaire avancée en croissance rapide qui vise à permettre aux marques de se connecter aux audiences de Samsung TV lorsqu'elles sont exposées aux médias numériques en utilisant les données les plus complètes de l'industrie pour créer la plateforme d'audience connectée la plus intelligente au monde. Faire partie d'une entreprise internationale telle que Samsung et faire des affaires dans le monde entier signifie que nous pouvons travailler sur de grands projets complexes avec des parties prenantes et des équipes situées dans le monde entier.

Nous sommes fiers d'avoir bâti une organisation de classe mondiale, fondée sur un esprit entrepreneurial et collaboratif. Travailler chez Samsung Ads offre l'un des meilleurs environnements du secteur pour découvrir à quelle vitesse vous pouvez grandir, ce que vous pouvez réaliser et à quel point vous pouvez être bon. Nous nous épanouissons dans la résolution de problèmes, en innovant et en profitant de chaque partie du voyage.

Avantages

  • Couverture médicale et dentaire complète payée à 100 % par l'entreprise dès le premier jour. Accès à un programme d'aide aux employés et à une plateforme de soins virtuels (bien-être, médical, et nutrition).
  • Compte de dépenses personnel et compte de dépenses de soins de santé avec Sun Life.
  • Paquet de rémunération concurrentielle, y compris un plan de primes de rendements basé sur les objectifs de l'entreprise, de l'équipe et personnels.
  • Minimum de 21 jours de congés payés.

À-côtés

  • Activités virtuelles dirigées par un comité social comme la soirée mensuelle du club de vin, soirées de jeux ainsi que des initiatives de bien-être comme le yoga et la méditation virtuels, l'art-thérapie, les cours d'aromathérapie.
  • Accès à des opportunités d'apprentissage et de développement (votre propre licence LinkedIn Learning, Pluralsight, programme de développement professionnel, formation continue et plus).
  • Officevibe : des commentaires anonymes de nos équipes pour savoir comment vous vous en sortez vraiment et vous garder engagé.
  • Cadre d'intégration qui garantit que vous êtes prêt à réussir du jour 1 à l'année 1. Cela inclut également un programme de jumelage (quelqu'un qui sera là pour vous) à partir du jour 1.
  • Des remises incroyables sur le site Web Samsung Employee Discounts et un accès au site Web de Perkopolis avec d'excellents rabais, coupons et promotions.
  • Les vendredis d'été.
  • Généreux programme de recommandation d'employés.
  • Le programme Giving Back, qui comprend des initiatives de jumelage de dons et de bénévolat, y compris une journée de bénévolat rémunéré.

*Certains avantages et à-côtés s'appliquent uniquement aux postes permanents à temps plein. Veuillez demander des détails supplémentaires à l'AT.

Vous hésitez à soumettre une candidature parce que vous n'êtes pas sûr de cocher toutes les cases? Postulez quand même! Nous aimerions avoir de vos nouvelles et découvrir ce que vous pouvez ajouter à la culture ici, chez Samsung Ads.

title: Marketing Proposal Specialist (Calgary/Edmonton/Vancouver/Toronto)
description:
Company Description

Creative thinking. Collective value.

Lemay brings together a team of architects and designers, leaders and change-makers driven by passion and compassion. We approach every design problem with curiosity, invention and a generous spirit to uncover hidden opportunities. We believe that everyone needs and deserves meaningful space to grow.

Job Description

Do you have a passion to lead story telling and foster relationships through inspirational content? Are you recognized for your ability to execute compelling, graphically inclined, and engaging material to win new business? The following might be for you!

What you will accomplish with us 

  • Showcase your strategic mindset through proposal responses and marketing packages;
  • Project manage the creation, process, and submission of all proposal submissions;
  • Coordinate the research, creation, development, and scheduling of specific client bids, pitches and proposals ;
  • Collaborate with internal partners and external resources to synthesize responses that capture the essence of our prospect’s vision and brand;
  • Develop and execute formatting, graphics, design and layout to align with the company’s standards;
  • Keep a strong pulse on potential opportunities - RFP/RFQ/RFI;
  • Participate and facilitate in strategic business development activities.

What you need

  • Professional experience in design, journalism, or any other design related field;
  • Between 3 and 5 years of experience in proposals, marketing and communications, project coordination, or equivalent;
  • Experience in writing winning high value, professional and creative packages;
  • Exceptional project management skills, ability to manage competing deadlines;
  • Ability to write effective, persuasive, engaging narratives with a creative flair;
  • Technology savvy and graphic design oriented using graphic packaging programs and software: Adobe InDesign and MS Office suite;
  • Thrive in a high volume, high quality, high-energy environment;
  • Flexibility to support deliverables and deadlines;
  • Opportunity to collaborate with senior staff on business development activates, pursuits, initiatives;
  • Portfolio preferred – graphic packaging, pitch, or a variety of experiences will be considered.

What we offer

Lemay makes its employee development and well-being a priority. Part of that is offering the following advantages:

  • Competitive salary and bonus program;
  • Flexible group insurance plan (health and dental insurance, health and well-being management accounts);
  • Payment of professional association membership fees;
  • 3 weeks of vacation;
  • Possibility of flexible schedule and summer schedule;
  • Social activities throughout the year;
  • Transnational creative work environment;
  • Hybrid work available (remote and in office as required).

Please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Analyste marketing principal - Clientèle
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Notre spécialité, c'est d'optimiser! Et nous sommes fiers de notre expertise. Nous mettons à profit notre intelligence collective pour impacter la vie des gens en améliorant l'efficacité de la mobilité urbaine. Nos solutions logicielles innovantes et nos services experts dans les domaines du transport collectif et des opérations postales sont reconnus partout dans le monde.

Description du poste

Tes principales responsabilités

  • Analyser les données sur la clientèle, soumettre des recommandations et supporter l’ensemble du secteur dans ses différents projets, ses stratégies commerciales et ses stratégies d’expérience client.
  • Collaborer étroitement aux activités de communications marketing relativement au ciblage des clients, à leurs segmentations, à l’automatisation marketing et à l’analyse de la performance des activités.
  • Développer des indicateurs et métriques sur la clientèle, assurer leurs suivis et analyser les écarts aux cibles afin d’élaborer des recommandations.
  • Supporter l’ensemble du secteur commercial dans l’exploitation et l’analytique du CRM, notamment dans la mise en place de processus d’affaires, d’analyses, de rapports et tableaux de bord automatisés.
  • Agir à titre de gardien et expert sur les données sur la clientèle et leur qualité, afin de maximiser leurs diffusions (voix du client), leurs utilisations et leurs évolutions.
  • Collaborer étroitement avec l’équipe SI à l’implantation, la configuration, la documentation et l’évolution du CRM à titre de super utilisateur pour l’ensemble du secteur (marketing, ventes et développement des affaires).
  • Développer et réaliser les collectes de données sur la clientèle (sondages et autres collectes), de l’élaboration de la méthodologie pour répondre aux besoins jusqu’aux recommandations suivant l’analyse des données opérationnelles et expérientielles.
  • Supporter le directeur dans la mise en place de la nouvelle fonction Analytique marketing, notamment par la prise en charge de projets novateurs et d’activités relatives à la gestion du changement.
  • Demeurer à l’affût des tendances relatives à l’analytique marketing et à l’expérience client afin d’intégrer les meilleurs pratiques à l’organisation.
Qualifications

Prérequis

  • Baccalauréat en marketing ou dans un domaine analytique connexe ou l'équivalent en expérience de travail pertinente;
  • Plus de 5 ans d'expérience pertinente analytique marketing et en expérience client;
  • Expérience dans des entreprises offrant des produits et services B2B;
  • Expérience dans sociétés de transport de personnes ou dans une entreprise de développement logiciel – Un atout;
  • Solide bagage et maîtrise des meilleures pratiques en analytique marketing et en expérience client, notamment pour exploiter un CRM dans un contexte marketing et vente;
  • Connaissances du CRM Microsoft Dynamics 365;
  • Connaissances des différentes méthodologies en recherche marketing;
  • Connaissances de Qualtrics et de Microsoft BI – Un atout.

Compétences

  • Grande capacité à planifier, organiser et mener plusieurs projets de bout en bout;
  • Très grande polyvalence et capacité d’adaptation;
  • Sens de l’initiative et autonomie;
  • Savoir faire face à l’ambiguïté;
  • Excellentes compétences de communication orale et écrite, en français et en anglais;
  • Excellente aptitude pour les communications interpersonnelles et le travail d’équipe;
  • Grandes habiletés analytiques;
  • Fortes habiletés de vulgarisation, de synthèse et de présentation.


Informations complémentaires

Chez GIRO, tu seras rapidement intégré et appelé à contribuer concrètement ! Le bien-être et l’épanouissement de nos employés est une valeur qui nous tient à cœur. C’est pourquoi nous offrons un ensemble d’avantages, dont :

  • Un horaire de travail flexible, incluant le télé-travail
  • Un accueil chaleureux et un programme d’apprentissage progressif
  • Plusieurs activités de reconnaissance et de « Team Building »: déjeuners d’équipe, cours de yoga ou d’aérobie, party de Noel, activités sportives, etc.
  • Une journée GIRO où les employés sont encouragés à faire du plein-air
  • Un régime d’assurance collectif de base couvert à 100%
  • Un remboursement de la carte OPUS ou d’une espace de stationnement
  • Les jours ouvrables entre Noel et Jour de l’An congés et payés

Tu veux en savoir plus ? Nous t’invitons à nous soumettre ta candidature et à communiquer directement avec nos conseillers en acquisition de talents !  

Au plaisir de te rencontrer !

Le générique masculin est utilisé uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte.

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
Overview:

Hexagon's Autonomy & Positioning division, is looking for a Marketing Automation Specialist to join our high-tech engineering and manufacturing company that is committed to customer service excellence and continuous improvement.    If you're passionate about digital marketing and looking for a unique opportunity to help build a B2B automation program from the ground up, we want to hear from you! We're looking for someone who knows Pardot or a similar marketing automation platform inside and out to join our Marketing Communications team. In this role, you'll use your marketing automation experience to develop our lead generation and nurturing program to help connect the dots between marketing efforts and sales results. Through collaboration with our team of writers and project managers, you'll help us develop and deliver marketing programs that attract and engage prospective customers while guiding them through the customer journey.

 

Hexagonâ€™s Autonomy & Positioning division is a global technology leader, pioneering end-to-end solutions for assured positioning on land, sea, and air.  We are an industry leader recognized for technical innovation, unsurpassed quality, and industry-leading customer support.   Our organization is a dynamic, fast-paced, highly collaborative environment.    Come see why we are recognized as one of Alberta's Top 75 Employers since 2019!

Responsibilities:

As Marketing Automation Specialist, responsibilities include:

  • Lead day-to-day marketing activities relating to marketing automation, PPC, operational, e-commerce and email marketing campaigns to drive customer acquisition using Pardot and Salesforce
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to develop end-to-end digital marketing campaigns
  • Support marketing operations, lead management, and campaign execution to drive digital engagement
  • Contribute to the planning, quality assurance process, and execution of email and digital marketing campaigns, including product, promotional and triggered emails, automations, content syndication, etc.
  • Implement A/B testing to improve conversion across all funnels to improve conversions
  • Maintain and organize A&P's Pardot business units, including ongoing maintenance of templates, database health, landing pages, distribution lists, custom fields, etc.
  • Develop and maintain reports at both the technical level and for non-marketing stakeholders
  • Develop, implement, and continuously evolve best digital and email marketing practices across channels
  • Develop and monitor campaign budgets
  • Support Pardot admin duties for all A&P Pardot business units
Qualifications:

Must-have:

  • 2+ years using Pardot (preferred) HubSpot, Marketo or a similar tool in a marketing automation role
  • 4-6 years of experience in digital marketing, preferably in B2B environments.
  • In-depth knowledge and proven success with paid marketing campaigns, including PPC, retargeting, social advertising, content distribution and placement networks, and third-party publications
  • Excellent written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
  • Proven ability to manage multiple deadline-driven projects with diverse stakeholders
  • Proficient in Google Analytics and Google Data Studio
  • Knowledge of Salesforce CRM and the relationship to Pardot automations

Nice-to-have:

  • Pardot certification, a marketing-related certificate program or a Bachelor's degree is nice to have, but not required if you've got a proven track record of creativity and success with Pardot campaigns
  • HTML/CSS
  • Adobe Creative Suite
  • SEO experience
  • Graphic design
  • Working knowledge of GDPR/Privacy regulations as it relates to digital marketing

Key Success Factors:  

  • Highly analytical, detail-oriented and organised
  • Self-driven with the ability to work independently while collaborating remotely with team members to achieve campaign timelines and goals

title: Sales Analyst
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Perpetua provides growth optimization and reporting technology for the world’s smartest eCommerce businesses. Through the platform, brands and sellers create goals based on strategy and rely on Perpetua’s best-in-class, always-on optimization to execute tactically. Perpetua’s intelligent reporting tools will also surface the most important metrics you need in order to easily quantify and examine the investment of your advertising dollars into your business. Integrations with Amazon, Instacart, Walmart and more ensure brands achieve full-funnel engagement and maximum visibility.

We're currently hiring for a Sales Analyst to support our leadership in identifying the biggest opportunities globally to accelerate our sales growth. This role will have a meaningful impact on our sales process and broader GTM, and advise sales leadership in a project based environment.




At Perpetua, we are dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce with varied experiences, perspectives and opinions. We believe diversity helps our team perform better and enables us to build an outstanding product for our customers. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.</section>

title: Marketer
company: SWP West - Victoria W Highlands/Colwood/Langford/View Royal - V9B
description:
Job Summary: SWP Langford is looking to hire a marketer. We are looking for outgoing, positive and money driven marketers that can work part time throughout the next 6 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it. Marketers will receive bonuses for every lead they get.

Hours: Monday - Thursday 5:00pm to 8:00pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm with a minimum of 4 hours per week. You can design your own schedule around school/sports/etc!

All training will be provided!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:
  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others
Requirements to apply:
  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work

title: Product Analyst
description:
Product Analyst

Founded in 1991, the Mircom Group of Companies is North America’s largest independent designer, manufacturer and distributor of intelligent building and life safety solutions. Reaching customers in over 100 countries worldwide, our portfolio includes: fire detection alarm, communications, security, mass notification, building automation unified building technologies.

Mircom’s mission is to save lives and protect property by providing a line-up of innovative and advanced solutions which are scalable to satisfy diverse user demands, from small buildings to the largest communities. Our unwavering commitment to North American manufacturing enables us to offer the highest quality and best competitive value across our vast range of products and solutions.

Summary:

With a global mandate, the Product Analyst (Fire Products) is a subject matter expert who will be reporting to the Director of Product Management and support the Product Managers directly.  The Product Analyst will act as a liaison between internal sales, customers, external associations and the factory to ensure that product information is communicated effectively. As a key member of the Mircom Fire Product PM team, the Product Analyst maintains a balance between business and quantitative product support.  The role requires knowledge of the product life cycle including: requirements development, design specifications, solution development, testing, support, and training.  Understanding industry and competitive trends in the Fire market is an important component of the role.. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Handle daily inquiries from customers and internal departments regarding product issues (approvals, variations, pricing, cost, model numbers).
  • Perform system inquiries, data mining and product analysis.
  • Communicate new and current product features to Sales and Professional Services.
  • Produce regular Revenue/Sales Performance Dashboards for the Product Management team.
  • Participate in analyzing and designing new product features and enhancements.
  • Gather requirements from customers, prospective customers, internal sales and professional services.
  • Assist Product Managers with various elements of Product Lifecycle Management. (Development, Introduction, Growth, Maturity, Decline and End of Life).
  • Define product requirements by researching existing client needs, competitive products, industry trends and utilizing Mircom subject matter expert knowledge.
  • Understand the competitive marketplace and publish tools to help Sales position products.
  • Provide analytical insights to help drive the product development roadmap.
  • Prepare training, launch and tradeshow materials
  • May represent Product Management on cross-functional teams for Process improvements and other initiatives such as SKU Simplification, new product launches or cost reduction

Requirements and Skills: 

  • 3+ years of experience in business analysis, product analysis.
  • Knowledge of relevant fire detection products technology is a strong asset.
  • Electronic or Marketing Diploma is an asset.
  • Very Strong written communication skills.
  • Excellent people and management skills to interact with staff, colleagues and third parties.
  • Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Visio).
  • Ability to work collaboratively with others to achieve a common goal.
  • Ability to write clear, concise reports and documentation.
  • Strong oral communication and presentation skills.
  • Solid critical thinking, analytical and problem resolution skills to analyze trends and impacts, identify options and implications, and propose practical solutions.
  • Ability to eliminate obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches.

What Mircom Offers:

  • A great working environment with opportunity for career advancement
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Insurance benefits
  • Company RRSP program

Interested applicants please forward a copy of your resume to Human Resources.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this position however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Mircom Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer that considers all applicants regardless of cultural background, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, family status, disability or any other grounds as outlined in the Ontario Human Rights Code.  In compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, Mircom is committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive work environment for all individuals with disabilities in a respectful and dignified manner. Accommodations will be made available, upon request, to applicants who have specialized needs throughout the recruitment process

Disclaimer: Mircom does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved in advance by Mircom to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. We will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

title: Pricing Analyst
description:
Company Description

Be part of a community of authentic, proud and trusted people.

Our Heavy Vehicle Parts Division is the country’s largest network. This division’s banners include Traction, TW and Cadel. Servicing the transport, construction and farming sectors, we keep them moving forward. This makes for a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.

Job Description

The Heavy Vehicle Division's Pricing and Gross Margin Management team is currently seeking a Pricing Analyst who will play a diversified role within the group.

The incumbent will be responsible for maintaining and adhering to the division's pricing and margin policies. As such, you will work in close collaboration with the Operations, Sales and Product Management teams. This position requires advanced analytical skills and the ability to draft reports and oversee multiple pricing and gross margin projects.

You will have to:

  • Analyze prices et gross margins of requested special prices submitted by the stores and distribution centers to ensure acceptable margins
  • Produce monthly special prices reports and point out irregularities in the system and whether they are related to approval processes, gross margin or signed agreements
  • Perform monthly analysis of promotional prices to determine if there are conflicts with regional pricing structure and propose new prices
  • Researching and collect pricing data from all levels of distribution within the company, and from the competition, to propose solutions or corrections.
  • Suggest and collaborate on the implementation of regional adjustments and analyze the adjustments in place to ensure they are in line with the market and the company’s strategy
  • Conduct and present analysis of sales and gross profits results and develop pricing strategies to maximize competitiveness
  • Collaborate on variation projects related to price management
Qualifications

To join our team, you need:

  • College diploma or bachelor’s degree in administration, finance, logistics, economy or a related field
  • 1 to 3 years of experience in pricing analysis structure
  • Excellent understanding of the Microsoft Office environment (proficiency in Excel is required)
  • Fluency in English and French, both spoken and written
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Demonstrate strong organizational skills and rigor
  • Demonstrate autonomy
  • Ability to solve complex problems and explain them to the business
  • Have a very good sense of organization


Additional Information

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Company Description

RedIron is a systems integrator focused on transformative innovations in retail. Since 2000, we’ve helped some of the largest brands implement, integrate, extend & maintain any major retail software system.

RedIron is uniquely equipped to recognize and understand a retailer’s pain points and deliver on their business objectives and goals. Working with RedIron, retailers benefit from years of experience, smart project processes, and technology solutions that streamline processes, profitability and deliver a modern customer experience.

Job Description

We're looking for a creative, tech-savvy Marketing Coordinator to join our growing team. Working closely with, and reporting directly to the Marketing Director, the candidate will be responsible for helping to develop and execute our marketing plan with a focus on social media marketing and lead generation campaigns.

The ideal candidate has strong experience with various social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn, and Twitter.

Responsibilities:

Social Media Management:

· Create social media content, including text, image & video. Managing online communities across multiple platforms (engaging with followers, responding to comments, instigating conversations) and publishing content.

· Responsible for managing a social media editorial calendar and managing the editing, approval, and scheduling of all posts for all platforms.

· Reporting & Analytics – responsible for tracking and updating KPI dashboards with metrics from social media, emails, ads, and websites. Oversight of marketing automation technology and CRM platform.

· Develop and implement electronic advertising campaigns through Facebook Ads, LinkedIn Ads, and Google Ads; email marketing campaigns and content marketing strategies.

· Develop and implement lead generation strategies through social media marketing and advertising.

Qualifications

Who You Are?

· Education: Bachelor’s degree in a Business-oriented field with a major in Marketing or a related business discipline.

· 2 years marketing experience

· Sound knowledge of social media, and email platforms.

· Excellent written and communications skills.

· A strong grasp of current marketing trends and the ability to lead digital marketing campaigns from concept to execution.

· Strategic thinker who is creative yet data-driven.

· Super organized with the ability to execute efficiently and with strong attention to detail.

· Must be flexible in approach and be able to prioritize as company and customers’ requirements evolve.

· Basic proficiency with photography, video editing, and graphic design.

Nice to haves: CRM experience, understanding of data analytics

 

Communications:

Respond to client inquiries and provide customer support via chat, email, and telephone.

 

Research:

· Conduct primary research through feedback surveys and client interviews to identify unmet needs and opportunities for improvement.

· Conduct secondary research on competitors and marketing strategies to enhance the marketing plan.



Additional Information

What We Offer

Compensation – we offer an attractive package with a competitive base salary and a bonus paid when you achieve predetermined targets.

Great Culture – we’re a gang of hardworking aspiring entrepreneurs. We hold each other accountable to high standards and help each other attain our most ambitious goals.
