title: Senior Campaign Marketing Specialist
description:
SOTI is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world.

Job Title:

Senior Campaign Marketing Specialist

Location:

Mississauga (Hybrid)

Who We Are

At SOTI, we are committed to delivering best in class mobile and IoT device management solutions. We are looking for out of the box thinkers that appreciate the art of creating great software.

To us, being visionary is more important than doing things the way they’ve always been done. 

What We’re Looking For

SOTI is looking for its next Senior Campaign Marketing Specialist to join our rapidly growing team. The ideal candidate is responsible for managing the overall coordination of campaign material workflows to ensure the successful delivery of the individual and collective elements submitted by internal clients. Their impact includes executing on their own projects prioritizing and organizing the workflow of multi-channel components through multiple teams within the marketing team, led by their team manager. Their contribution plays a direct role in helping provide solid execution and completion of marketing projects and initiatives. The candidate will be working globally to ensure successful completion of all campaigns as assigned by their leader.

What’s in it for you?

The People - From our humble origins in our founder’s basement, to our industry leading position today, SOTI has worked hard to foster a company culture that we can all believe in. A culture that emphasizes personal growth, continuous innovation, and fun.

The Growth -Our environment fosters new ideas, fresh perspectives, and the ability to take them over the goal line. SOTI is a fast-paced environment with a global reach that encourages you to make your mark and be part of something big!

The Technology - You’ll get the chance to work with leading edge technologies and take on complex and interesting projects, as part of highly collaborative and agile teams. You will work alongside SOTI’s partners which include leading tech giants that will keep you on the cusp of emerging technologies.

What You’ll Do

  • Responsible to coordinate projects across the global marketing team (global communications, product marketing, digital marketing and creative)
  • Meets with client(s) and project team members to ensure execution of global marketing campaigns with proper project plans in place
  • Independently review briefs and request forms and transform them into project plans and work back schedules for execution and delivery
  • Manage and drive new and complex projects in support of clients/business unit(s)
  • Develop project work back plans to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery of materials, provide time estimates for proposed projects independently or through collaboration with department team members, understand the process and the critical steps necessary to deliver a high-quality end product to clients
  • In a high-demand position with frequently changing priorities, you will help triage and mitigate client concerns and escalations
  • Use project planning tools (e.g., Asana) for proper projects, tasks and work back schedules
  • Highlight blockers/issues and mitigate risks for successful project completion
  • Ability to influence without authority, think proactively and function independently
  • Invests in own personal development to continuously improve themselves

Experience You’ll Bring:

  • Diploma/Degree in project management, marketing, or related fields
  • 5 years of related job experience
  • Ability to work well with a team and as an individual contributor with some guidance
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Exceptional communication and project management skills with ability to execute multiple congruent projects themselves and through others
  • Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail essential
  • High level of organization, research, analysis, problem solving, customer service and planning skills
  • Ability to work effectively in a changing and often high-pressure environment
  • Judgment on how to respond quickly, yet thoughtfully, to urgent matters
  • Technology industry knowledge is an asset

About SOTI

SOTI is a proven leader at creating innovative solutions that reduce the cost and complexity of business-critical mobility and the IoT. Thousands of companies around the world depend on us to secure, manage, and support their mobile operations. SOTI’s two decades of success has built strong partnerships with leading mobile platform providers and device manufacturers. These relationships give us unparalleled insight into new technology and industry trends before they happen. SOTI is a proven innovator — clear vision, laser focus and a commitment to R&D has made us the market leader at delivering exciting, new business mobility solutions. SOTI helps businesses take mobility to endless possibilities.

At SOTI, we celebrate the uniqueness of our global teams and are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are curious problem solvers who are committed to bringing the best mobile and IoT management solutions to market. We offer careers with #EndlessPossibilities.

We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the requirements under the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify People & Culture at careers@soti.net.

#LI-RA1

If you want to bring your ideas to life, apply at SOTI today.

We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the requirements under the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify People & Culture at

careers@soti.net

.

Please note that SOTI does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Services Agreement with agency/recruiter, SOTI will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee.

You will work alongside SOTI’s partners which include leading tech giants that will keep you on the cusp of emerging technologies.', 'Responsible to coordinate projects across the global marketing team (global communications, product marketing, digital marketing and creative)', 'Exceptional communication and project management skills with ability to execute multiple congruent projects themselves and through others', 'Use project planning tools (e.g., Asana) for proper projects, tasks and work back schedules', 'Independently review briefs and request forms and transform them into project plans and work back schedules for execution and delivery', 'Manage and drive new and complex projects in support of clients/business unit(s)', 'Who We Are', 'Meets with client(s) and project team members to ensure execution of global marketing campaigns with proper project plans in place', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail essential', '5 years of related job experience', 'What We’re Looking For', 'High level of organization, research, analysis, problem solving, customer service and planning skills']

title: Sales & Marketing Coordinator
description:
Are you the next Sales & Marketing Coordinator at Kinetic Commerce?

Do you love bringing to market real world innovative solutions that change the way people work and shop?  Have an insatiable appetite to learn sales and marketing processes that drive growth? Love to work with a world-class team engaged with some of the worldâ€™s largest and leading edge retailers? Then, you may be the right fit. Kinetic Commerce is a rapidly growing retail technology focused on enabling next-generation retail experiences.

We attract creative, independent thinkers who share a desire for excellence within an open culture. If you have a passion for marketing and sales enablement, we invite you to join our team!

Description:

Reporting to the Chief Revenue Officer, and working closely with Business Development and  Kineticâ€™s Customer Success Teams, the Sales & Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for managing marketing and sales lead generation campaigns for the company.

Responsibilities:

  • Management and help create sales and marketing collateral.
  • Oversee the company lead generation campaigns including Linkedin Outreach, Webinars and Online content.
  • Manage Kineticâ€™s social media accounts for the company.
  • Assist in the management of the company's CRM (Hubspot) and other sales and marketing tools. 
  • Organize and help manage appointments for Account Executives with prospects and partners.
  • Communicate with new business leads to evaluate fit with Kinetic products and services.
  • Respond to or route inbound communications.
  • Coordinate and work with in-house teams as well as vendors, agencies and freelancers that support Kineticâ€™s sales and marketing activities.
  • Help edit and customize presentations and marketing materials.
  • Support in creating proposals, quotes, and statements of work.
  • Manage a list of events and trade shows for the Retail Industry.
  • Help prepare speaker proposals for industry events.
  • Develop and maintain media contacts.
  • Work with team members to identify and execute guest blog and podcast opportunities.
  • Provide feedback and insights from campaign results to help improve go-to-market strategies for Kinetic Commerce.

Experience:

  • 2 years of experience in a B2B sales and marketing role, particularly supporting digital or SaaS products.
  • Experience working with a company that provides solutions to the Retail Industry.

Skills & Knowledge:

  • Knowledge of the B2B sales and marketing process and campaign management.
  • Strong writing and verbal communication skills.
  • Command of business systems for marketing sales enablement, including Google Suite, Keynote, CRM (Hubspot), LinkedIn Sales Navigator, or similar tools.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage content marketing, and lead generation campaigns from ideation to execution.
  • Knowledge of B2B sales and marketing assets including, case studies, sales decks, marketing presentations, web pages, emails, blogs, video scripts, etc.
  • Organization and time-management skills.
  • Familiarity with marketing automation tools is an asset.

title: Marketer
description:
Job Summary: SWP Burnaby has an opening for door-to-door marketers. We are looking for outgoing, positive, and money-driven marketers that can work part-time throughout the next 6 months. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our team who is willing to learn the job and the culture, but of course, make some money while doing it.

Hours: 

Monday & Tuesday 4:30 pm to 8:00 pm Saturday 12:30 pm to 3:30 pm & 4 pm to 6 pm, you can pick and choose which days work best for your schedule!

All training will be provided!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:
  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others
Requirements to apply:
  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work

Payment Structure:

  • We start at $16/HR with an option of bonuses for completing certain tasks.
  • Getting a lead
  • The lead turns into a job
  • Getting a lawn sign up on private property (with permission of the owner)
  • Hitting the goal for the night

If you have friends whom you think will love this job, ask them to submit their application too so you can work together!

If you are looking for full-time employment we can discuss a painting position this Summer if you are interested

title: Research Associate
description:
Our client has pursued and achieved breakthroughs in medicine for more than three decades, with the goal of creating a better, healthier world for all people. They have commercialized more than 25 innovative medicines, helping to transform treatment for people living with HIV, viral hepatitis, cancer and other life-threatening diseases. Through their ongoing bold and transformative science, they’re driving innovations that have the potential to become the next generation of life-changing medicines.

We are currently seeking a "Research Associate" for a contract role in Edmonton, AB. Please apply if you would be interested and available for it.

Duration: 6 Months

Requirement:
  • Independently plans and executes experiments that support development activities and project goals.
  • Demonstrates and applies advanced level of understanding project goals and methods.
  • Selects appropriate methods and techniques in performing methods development.
  • Recommends alternatives, researches new methods and techniques and proactively seek out senior personnel to discuss potential solutions to problems.
  • Participates in group meetings.
  • Presents results of work, interprets data, and draws conclusions regarding presented material and nature of work.
  • Works with minimal supervision on projects of moderate to complex scope.
  • Uses good verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills to provide insight into the processes used to achieve results of assigned tasks.
  • Prepares validation protocols and reports or analytical development reports.
Regards,
Ankush Jha
Cell: 289-236-0817
Email: ankush.jha@artech.com

title: Marketing and Business Development Coordinator
description:
Marketing and Business Development Coordinator

Are you a recent graduate in Business or Administration? Are you seeking a collaborative work environment where you can learn, grow, and develop your career? Do you strive to provide value driven services and enjoy working on daily challenges? If this sounds like you, TWD may have the position youâ€™ve been looking for!

About TWD Technologies Ltd.:

First established in 1999, TWD has grown into a leading multi-discipline engineering, procurement and construction management company providing project development, execution and engineering services. Our expertise includes oil and gas, pipelines, terminalling and blending, renewables, power, infrastructure, chemical processing, and food and beverage.

Working as a tightly-knit team, TWD is committed to making a big impact in our industry. We aim high and weâ€™re proud of the fact that we push the limits of whatâ€™s possible on a daily basis. Weâ€™ve created a dynamic work environment that emphasizes the importance of creativity and fosters a strong sense of community.

At TWD Technologies, we are seeking a highly motivated Marketing and Business Development Coordinator to join our Team in Burnaby, BC! The successful candidate will provide general administrative support to the Business Development team including but not limited to proposal preparation and research, support sales activities, and assist in promotional materials.

What Youâ€™ll be Doing:

As a Marketing and Business Development Coordinator youâ€™ll work as part of the Business Development team to provide deliverables to a variety of stakeholders. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

General

  • Support and assist TWD Business Development team in meeting and exceeding sales targets.
  • Contribute to company business development activities.
  • Provide administrative support for Business Development team.
  • Assist in preparing and distributing reports that support the sales team.
  • Provide support for internal meetings.
  • Take on special projects, initiatives and other duties as assigned.

Proposal Preparation

  • Support incoming inquiries and support proposal preparation.
  • Assist in proposal preparation including generation, writing and research
  • Ensure inquiry and proposal process is conducted in a timely manner that meets internal procedures and customer satisfaction.

Promotions and Promotional Material

  • Assist in TWD promotional items program.
  • Assist in updating TWD Website and social media feeds.
  • Support in developing new TWD Project Profiles.
  • Ensure consistency of all internal and external documentation and communications.
  • Prepare brochures for prospective clients.
  • Supporting the re-branding of resumes

What You Bring:

  • College/University Diploma or Degree in Business or Administration
  • 2 years of experience in sales or equivalent
  • Proficient in MS Office Applications
  • Experience in Adobe Illustrator and Adobe InDesign is an asset
  • Excellent communication skills with strong initiative
  • Outstanding organizational and time management skills
  • Experience with creating effective marketing and promotional materials an asset
  • Detail oriented professional
  • Ability to conduct themselves in a professional and discreet manner.

 

What We Offer:

  • Competitive Compensation Package
  • Company Paid Group Benefits Plan
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • RRSP Matching Program 
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Wellness Subsidy Program 
  • Service Recognition Program
  • Work Perks Program
  • Employee Referral Bonus Program

We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all qualified applicants. If you require accommodation at any time throughout the recruitment process, please contact our Human Resources Team.

title: Data Analyst, Marketing
description:
Responsibilities:

  • Assist Manager, Performance Data Analytics, with Marketing and Market Insights and Pricing data analysis in identifying trends in its revenue and marketing data
  • Act as a primary source of expertise in the data structure and workflow of SAP and supporting systems
  • Assist in creating insights on marketing data analytics with use of reports and dashboards
  • Analyze the marketing data in support of the revenue and marketing teams
  • Analyze problems and errors produced by business applications
  • Evaluate query design, data structure, and data quality to provide recommendations for improvement as needed
  • Research and review large sets of data, using peer analysis with benchmarking and competitor analysis
  • Assist in developing metrics, KPI’s and business cases
  • Work with teams to provide input into the test strategy, test scenarios, test data requirements, and supporting user validation
  • Support data validation and analysis with other performance analytics projects
  • Conduct insightful, ad hoc analysis to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues
  • Conduct analysis to validate system issues and work with IT to resolve those issues
  • Provide training and support cross functional teams
  • Develop documentation of key processes, and build data dictionary
  • Complete all other duties as assigned

 

Qualifications:

  • A bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field
  • 1-3 years experience in a similar role preferred
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (Functions, formulas, charts, tables, and power query)
  • Experience in BI tools a plus (Microsoft PowerBI preferred)
  • Experience in Marketing, Sales or Business Analytics considered an asset
  • Actively demonstrates confidentiality, tact and discretion in preparing, disclosing and handling information of a confidential and/or sensitive nature
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and as a member of a team
  • Strong problem-solving skills, mathematical and data literacy
  • Must possess a detail oriented, and analytical mindset
  • Excellent communication, organizational, and time management skills

title: Shopper Marketing Coordinator
description:
Not just a job…
a community
a partnership
a team
 
You’ll experience them all at London Drugs.  As one of Canada’s  most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team! 
 
Our Marketing Department located at our head office in Richmond, BC currently has an opportunity for:
 
Shopper Marketing Coordinator

This position is responsible for supporting the strategy, planning and execution of brand and category advertising and promotions.

Roles and Responsibilities: 
  • Work with shopper marketing team leads to execute strategic advertising and marketing plans to drive business results 
  • Manage multiple projects as assigned by the Shopper Marketing Manager based on seasonality and customer relevance.
  • Manage communication and marketing services as support between business team and Marketing.
  • Work with internal and external stakeholders to implement marketing plan across various categories and services.
  • Work with data and insights team to inform decision making and make recommendations to the business.
  • Facilitate consistent execution of plans across all customer touch points including Website, in-store, print and social media.
  • Ensure strong and clear brand communication with our customers, while balancing business priorities
  • Support creative and communication development with production and content teams. 
  • Project manage key initiatives with cross functional players.
The successful candidate should possess the following:
  • Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills and the ability to deal with senior levels of the organization.
  • Ability to negotiate and sell a concept.
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strong administrative skills. 
  • Highly organized and able to multitask effectively and work under changing priorities. 
  • Initiative to isolate and solve problems.
EDUCATION & KNOWLEDGE: 
  • Minimum 3 years of increasing responsibility in a marketing role.
  • Retail Marketing experience an asset.
  • A marketing degree or equivalent work experience an asset.

London Drugs offers advancement opportunities through our promote-from-within policies, salaries commensurate with experience, as well as a comprehensive benefits program including: 

  • Comprehensive medical, dental, prescription drug and vision coverage for you and your family (Ensuring you and your family are taken care of)
  • Employee Discount Program (Sharing our success) 
  • Employee Recognition Program (Tangible rewards for great work!) 
  • Company matched RRSPs (Helping you plan for your future) 
  • Ongoing In-House Training & Education Courses (Lifelong learning) 
  • Employee Family Assistance Program (Free confidential counseling) 
  • Community Involvement (Giving back to our communities) 
If you are a well-organized, self-motivated, individual who has a positive attitude and a commitment to achieving Company objectives, then we have the opportunity for you to excel! 
 
Apply Now!
 
We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.
  
London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.
  
To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Insight Analyst
description:
You have a proven track record of delivering insightful analysis and value to clients in a fast-paced environment? You are excited to work directly with our clients and to help market leaders deliver and optimize their digital solutions? Emplifi is a global leader in Customer Experience solutions, guiding the world's customer-centric brands to the insights they need to improve the customer experience.

We are looking for an Insight Analyst to join the Analytical Services group at our Montreal (remote option available for the right candidate in Canada) or Columbus (Ohio) office reporting to the Insight Manager. You will work directly with one of our Fortune 10 clients leveraging strong analytical and presentation skills to create compelling insights to one of our key partners in the health care industry. Our partner is a drug-free
workplace and our future colleague is required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Apply today and join our dynamic company!

 

 

What You'll Do Here

  • Conducting analyses of our client's website performance (integrating multiple data sources including quantitative results, trend information, competitive insights and behavioral/Adobe Analytics data) and assist in preparing easy to interpret presentations that deliver insightful, strategic, and actionable insights;
  • Understand our client's business objectives and develop and execute research plans that effectively address needs of digital teams across their Enterprise;
  • Respond to requests for ad hoc analysis within short timeframes and an emphasis on exceptional quality and accuracy;
  • Contribute to the success of a strong strategic insights group as a collaborative team member;
  • Work in conjunction with client-side and Emplifi-side teams to build dialogue and cross-team liaisons. 
  • Supporting Project Managers in order to generate account satisfaction and growth;
  • Supporting ongoing development of Emplifi's solutions within research design, statistics, semantics, and predictive sciences.

What You'll Bring to Us

  • 1 to 2 years of work experience in consumer research, digital or web analytics, usability research, or experience management;
  • Experience with an Analytics tool (i.e.: Python, R, SQL, Q-research, PowerBI) and the MS Office suite;
  • Understanding of digital business strategies;
  • Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a relevant program including: Marketing Science; Business Management / eCommerce; Psychology / Social Sciences;
  • Very strong professional communication skills in English (French an asset).

What We Offer

  • International, fast paced and rapidly growing environment
  • Chance to work with the world's biggest brands at the CX tech leader
  • Agile and open-minded culture with a high level of flexibility
  • Opportunity for professional growth and development
  • 3 weeks of PTO (current PTO accrued by 6% from each paycheck)
  • Flexible working hours
  • A corporate group insurance coverage
  • Personal days (5 days per year) (prorated)
  • Sick days (unlimited)
  • Community days (2 days per year)
  • Access to an Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • There's more as well! Speak with us to find out all details!

title: Content Marketing Coordinator
description:
Swish Maintenance Limited is currently looking for a Content Marketing Coordinator to join our Marketing team! The Content Marketing Coordinator will provide support across multiple projects and functions throughout the business with an opportunity to grow and contribute along the way. This role can be located remotely, however reasonable proximity to a Swish branch and the ability to attend meetings at a Swish office location is required. 
 
AREAS OF FOCUS 
  • Drafting content for various marketing initiatives, must have the experience/ability in professional writing in a marketing/advertising capacity. 
  • Working under deadline pressure and manage projects across multiple lines of business
  • Collaborate with internal teams, external agencies and vendor partners
  • Identify market/industry trends & insights and optimize budget spend
  • Understand customer buying journey: sales process, buying cycle, website navigation
  • Willingness to learn about the business/industry and unique needs of business units
  • Research, develop and implement plans for increasing brand awareness and sales leads
  • Creative thinking in terms of content & asset development
  • Assessing past and existing campaigns/initiatives to make recommendations for future efforts
  • Responsible for producing content/copy that is in line with the voice & tone of the Swish brand and ensuring cohesive messaging across all platforms
  • Working with our Swish Clean-It® Centre retail outlets across Canada (retail marketing experience an asset)
  • Understanding and advocating for the "voice of customer" in GTM and communication strategy development
  • Other duties as assigned
WHAT WE OFFER
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • RRSP matching program
  • Performance bonuses
  • Equal opportunity, inclusive workplace
  • Positive, team-based environment
  • Starting salary $50,000 CAD
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Post secondary education - Bachelor's Degree or College Diploma in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration or related field
  • 2-4 years of relevant experience
  • Knowledge of brand management, project management and core marketing tactics
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills are a must
  • Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Design, etc.) an asset
  • Compelling portfolio of work over a wide range of creative projects
WORKING ARRANGEMENT 
  • Hybrid/Majority work-from-home opportunity (must have reasonable proximity to a Swish branch) 
  • Occasional travel within Ontario

title: Content Marketing Specialist
description:
Job Summary:

Do you love writing? Are you a compelling storyteller? Do you have a passion for creating marketing content that connects with your audience and strengthens relationships with customers? Do you want to make a difference in public transportation and help connect people to jobs, opportunities, and communities?

We are looking for a Content Specialist with the ability to write and edit content for a wide range of marketing communications. The successful candidate will be an extremely talented, passionate, and detailed writer who will aid in the planning, development, generation and implementation of our content marketing strategy. The Content Specialist is responsible for the timely delivery and quality of marketing content that is tailored to our target audience, in close collaboration with internal subject matter experts and teams. He or she understands how to create the right type of content for the different stages of the buyer's journey.

The ideal person is someone who can dive in and easily get a feel for our brand and voice, quickly be immersed in the diverse transit technologies we write about and create targeted content that generates engagement amongst our target audience, moves leads through our funnel, and ultimately influences sales opportunities.

This is an opportunity to work with a passionate, driven team in an exciting industry, and gain a wealth of experience in content marketing to further your own marketing career.

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

  • Write and edit a wide variety of content, including product overviews and descriptions, case studies, whitepapers, e-books, email, blog, landing pages, press releases, videos, events, social and presentation decks
  • Work closely with the Content Marketing Manager to develop concepts into specific content that will feed into strategic marketing campaigns spanning across multiple touch points (website, print, email, content hubs etc.)
  • Work with internal subject matter experts, external production specialists and undertake research to develop content that achieves response from our target markets.
  • Strategize with the marketing team on the appropriate targets for campaigns (target buyer persona, best content type and channel to reach that persona, metrics etc.)
  • Utilize industry and organizational knowledge to develop ideas and content
  • Draft and edit assigned content for multiple channels at once
  • Measure and report to showcase how content is performing against business objectives and targets.

Qualifications

  • 5 years' experience in producing high quality marketing content.
  • Passionate and enthusiastic for content creation
  • With an excellent attention to detail (you catch grammar and spelling mistakes easily)
  • A strategic thinker who can approach content creation from a strategic lens, asking the value of the content we’re creating, what we’re trying to achieve, and optimize content if metrics aren’t being met
  • Strong writing skills
  • Hands-on and eager to roll up sleeves to get things done in an agile, collaborative environment
  • Great interpersonal skills, able to work with key stakeholders internally and externally to the business
  • Excellent project management skills, able to work independently on multiple projects at once
  • Post-secondary education in Marketing, Media, Journalism or Communications.
  • A portfolio of work showcasing your content writing skills, preferably in a B2B marketing environment.

Worker Type:

Regular

Number of Openings Available:

1

title: Business Developer
description:
Overview:

Co-operative Education at the University of Waterloo is a global leader in employer partnerships, managing over 19,100 work-terms a year with over 6,900 employers in more than 60 countries. Within Co-operative Education (Co-op), the Business Developer plays a vital role in achieving the 97% overall student employment rate.

 

The Business Developer generates, develops and converts employer prospects into paid, creditable co-op jobs for all programs, but will place priority on growing job opportunities for strategically prioritized segments.The Business Developer must demonstrate excellent sales skills and relationship management with a proven track record of generating leads and successfully converting them to meet strategic targets. Strong organizational skills are imperative to document, track and report on interactions and the status of each lead within the official system of record. The Business Developer is required to have excellent communication and interpersonal skills to provide high quality, professional interactions and customer service to prospective and new employers.

 

The Business Developer is focused on actively bringing in new business and will contribute to all business development initiatives, including targeted business development campaigns in a particular region or industry as well as supporting the creation of business development presentations, resources and tools.

 

Success measures include the numbers of presentations, calls and meetings with prospective employers, leads generated for all programs and for programs of strategic priority, conversion rates from leads to job postings, number of jobs posted/filled for each new employer, number of new employers successfully retained/transferred for another hiring cycle, and resolution of recruiting/work term issues to ensure a successful co-op experience.

 

This position has a specific focus on job development related to faculty programs and focus programs and will report to the Manager, Business Development.

 

Responsibilities:

Actively seek student employment opportunities with new employers to attain a first-work term student employment rate of greater than 95% and to achieve an overall employment rate of greater than 97%. A business developer is required to

  • Use a keen understanding of effective sales and conversion tools and techniques to assess the prospective employerâ€™s needs and discuss how hiring a student could bring value to the employer
  • Generate, qualify, steward and convert relevant prospective employer leads to job postings and to achieve the target number of jobs filled as defined in annual goals
  • Build their individual lead funnel to develop employment opportunities within their designated region/strategic area of job development focus through their own lead-generation initiatives including: research, active lead follow-up calling, networking, acting on referrals, developing and leveraging a strong personal network within industry and industry associations, social media campaigns, etc.
  • Manage their leads actively to move inactive/unproductive leads from their roster on a monthly basis and ensure high value leads are prioritized and actively followed up within accepted time frames and then moved toward becoming a new employer
  • Regularly explore, participate in and leverage industry events and networks (face-to-face and digital), job portals and boards, and memberships to target highest job development outcomes
  • Become an expert in our co-operative education model, understanding our programs, students, and process to effectively guide and steward new employers and prospects

Retain, support and transition new employers from the point of employer registration to the successful completion of at least one full employment cycle

  • Convert prospective employer leads to new employers by providing exceptional client service â€“ from guiding new employers through the hiring process inclusive of consultation on how to write a compelling, creditable job description to finalizing the hiring of a student including salary advice
  • Actively advance benefits and opportunities (i.e. new funding available) for specific leads and new employers to increase hiring levels and retention through excellent customer service
  • Facilitate an informed and professional introduction of the new employer to the hiring process support team and explain the various roles and their new direct points of contact
  • Transfer successful new employers to their ongoing service team at or above the transfer rate specified in annual individual goals
  • Ensure a retention rate of new employers as set by strategic department goals

Record and report interactions and outcomes accurately and completely

  • Record all relevant data about each lead into the lead management system accurately and completely
  • Record all communications, presentations, meetings and the outcomes of the interaction within the lead management system
  • Meet established new employer targets as indicated in Co-opâ€™s overall business goals
  • Report on progress and communicate with transparency, clarity and openness to broaden understanding of prospecting outcomes, quality of lead funnel management, lead conversion to job postings and to jobs filled and number of students hired
  • Address challenges within the business development process with solutions for optimal outcomes
  • Coordinate and transport materials to and from events and manage set-up and tear-down of Co-opâ€™s booth at an event or activity as required

Represent Co-op and UWaterloo at key external events

  • Present a professional manner and appearance to represent Co-op and the University at conferences, networking events, outreach activities and other special events
  • Demonstrate excellent communication, public presentation and speaking skills, having prepared for every event with research and understanding of audience, targets, and potential for job development
  • Utilize social media to promote Co-op professionally and effectively
  • Network effectively to establish potential relationships and to increase prospects and leads in funnel
  • Comply with brand guidelines and presentation guidelines for consistent representation and quality of the overall brand (e.g. trade show booth set-up consistently every time)
  • Effectively capture all actionable leads using lead qualification best practices and digital lead capture system, ensuring all event leads are received for processing within a maximum two days after an an event

Collaborate with campus partners and others at events when requested by manager

  • On occasion, the Business Developer may be required to speak at an event or participate in an expert panel on behalf of Co-op and the University
  • Continuously improve business development approaches, processes and technology for greater efficiency, effectiveness, productivity and results
  • Positive participation in business development virtual team meetings, team meetings and department meetings through attendance, sharing of ideas and active listening
  • Adopt and suggest technologies that can enable more efficiency and productivity for business development
  • Demonstrate initiative in trying alternative methods to achieve results (e.g. phone call follow-up instead of standardized follow-up email, digital approaches)
  • Seek improvement and coaching to continuously evolve and improve approach and effectiveness
  • Seek opportunities to gain relevant knowledge and share resources so that others may also benefit
Qualifications:
  • Undergraduate degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience  
  • 5-7 years of sales experience with demonstrated success â€“ preferably in a business-to-business context
  • Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills required to build lasting relationships, along with well-developed presentation skills
  • Proven, in-depth understanding of the sales process and the steps necessary to close a sale
  • Demonstrated ability to grow a successful sales funnel through self-generated leads and initiatives
  • Excellent sales conversion track record
  • Excellent customer service, relationship management skills and understanding of the customer experience
  • Respectful and contributing team player and influencer to achieve objectives through support from others
  • Skill in prioritizing and triaging obligations
  • Excellent time management, organization and attention to detail
  • Strong IT fluency
  • In-depth knowledge of co-operative education and its challenges and opportunities
  • Creative thinker with and the ability to find helpful solutions to tough problems
  • The ability to handle pressure and meet targets
  • Due to the responsive nature of this role and the travel and events involved, unusual hours including evening and weekend work will be required
  • This position works from a home office with regular travel within the Region.  
Vaccination Requirement Statement:

Effective May 1, 2022, the University suspended its Vaccination Requirement. Prior to May 1, pursuant to this Requirement, all University employees were required to submit proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (subject to the Universityâ€™s obligations under the Human Rights Code to accommodate employees who were unable to receive a vaccination). The Universityâ€™s Vaccination Requirement website can be found here: https://uwaterloo.ca/coronavirus/return/vaccination-requirement.    

 

The pandemic is ongoing and public health advice continues to evolve. Accordingly, the University reserves the absolute right to reinstate the Vaccination Requirement on short notice, and upon such reinstatement you will be required to comply. You shall also be required to comply with any new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University from time to time, including new policies/requirements related to mandatory employee vaccination. As the University may need to reinstate the Requirement on short notice, it will continue to collect and maintain up-to-date information on employee vaccination status. Please submit your Covid-19 vaccine status (QR code) to: https://checkin.uwaterloo.ca/    

 

 

Failure to comply with the Vaccination Requirement if it is reinstated, including failure to comply with any future amendments to the Vaccination Requirement, or failure to comply with new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University, including those related to new mandatory employee vaccination, shall result in discipline up to and including termination of employment.

 

The requirement to be vaccinated, if reinstated, will be subject to the duty to accommodate pursuant to the Human Rights Code. If you are unable to be vaccinated for reasons related to a ground protected under the Human Rights Code, you may submit a written request for accommodation with an explanation of the reasons and/or any supporting documentation. If you request accommodation, the University may follow up with you for further information if necessary.

Equity Statement:

The University of Waterloo is committed to implementing the Calls to Action framed by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. We acknowledge that we live and work on the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg and Haudenosaunee peoples. The University of Waterloo is situated on the Haldimand Tract, the land granted to the Six Nations that includes six miles on each side of the Grand River.

 

The University values the diverse and intersectional identities of its students, faculty, and staff. The University regards equity and diversity as an integral part of academic excellence and is committed to accessibility for all employees. The University of Waterloo seeks applicants who embrace our values of equity, anti-racism and inclusion. As such, we encourage applications from candidates who have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including applicants who identify as First Nations, MÃ©tis and/or Inuit/Inuk, Black, racialized, a person with a disability, women and/or 2SLGBTQ+.

 

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

 

The University of Waterloo is committed to accessibility for persons with disabilities. If you have any application, interview, or workplace accommodation requests, please contact Human Resources atâ€¯hrhelp@uwaterloo.caâ€¯or 519-888-4567, ext. 45935.

title: Market Researcher
description:
SKYSERVICE BUSINESS AVIATION

Skyservice is a North American leader in business aviation. Built on the key principles of safety and service excellence, we provide a full service experience from Aircraft Management, Aircraft Charter, Maintenance and Aircraft sales from our Fixed Base Operations that span Canada and the western United States. People and values are the inseparable assets that drive our dedication to Quality, Safety, Respect, Commitment and Efficiency. These are the core values that guide us every day and help build our reputation as leaders in aviation services. Skyservice is a team dedicated to supporting and developing our employees. If you want to grow your career and broaden your experience, then Skyservice is the right team for you.

PURPOSE:

Reporting to the Chief Commercial Officer, the Market Researcher will support the Skyservice Sales Teams with a specific focus on market and industry research.  The Market Researcher will also lead CRM reporting activities and will work closely with the team on drafting and reviewing of proposals and key presentations.  The successful candidate will be an integral member of the Sales Team.

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Conduct internal and external research and compile data into usable format for the Sales teams;
  • Research and source potential clients and leads for potential sales opportunities;
  • Liaise with aircraft Engineers, Crew and Flight Coordination to gather and confirm specifications for aircraft listings;
  • Post and maintain ads for sales team to advertising platforms such as com;
  • Work closely with Marketing to ensure accurate and timely preparation of sales brochures and materials;
  • Act as the primary CRM point of contact for Sales team; liaise with IT and Salesforce Administrator as required;
  • Review and draft proposals for the sales team with support from business unit leader and Legal; action follow-up items as required;
  • Coordinate with other departments to ensure accuracy and completeness of all proposals;
  • Support the preparation and production of sales-related presentations;
  • Collaborate with Business Unit Lead and Legal to transition from proposal to contracting / closing stage as required;
  • Administer and maintain sales reports / records for senior management reporting; ensure sales account details in Salesforce are maintained and kept current
  • Assist with planning and organization of tradeshow and promotional activities and events as required.
QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS REQUIRED:
  • Post-secondary education in Business Administration or similar is required;
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a market research or sales coordination role is preferred;
  • Current knowledge of aviation industry and trends is an asset;
  • Highly analytical; able to organize and interpret data and create visual results;
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic environment;
  • Exceptional computer literacy and working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint);
  • Ability to organize high volume of data into visual aids;
  • Working knowledge of Salesforce is considered an asset;
  • Highly organized with strong interpersonal skills.

Skyservice is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. If for any reason you cannot apply through our job board, please contact a member of our Human Resources team for special accommodation.

title: Spécialiste marketing et développement commercial / Marketing and Commercial Development Specialist
description:
VERSION FRANÇAISE

Spécialiste marketing et développement commercial

 

À propos du poste

Le groupe IBE est à la recherche d'un(e) spécialiste en marketing et développement commercial pour leur emplacement de Montréal.

 

À propos de l'entreprise

Le Groupe IBE est une entreprise d'entrepreneur général au sein du domaine de la construction qui se spécialise dans les secteurs résidentiels, commerciaux et institutionnels. Nous exécutons une variété de projets à l'échelle internationale. Nous sommes une équipe unie, diversifiée, ambitieuse et multidisciplinaire. Notre objectif est de fournir des solutions optimales à nos clients en leur apportant notre expertise en gestion de projet et notre expertise technique.

Nous sommes une équipe agile en pleine expansion. Nous valorisons la communication, la transparence, l'apprentissage continu et le travail d'équipe. Nous nous efforçons de nous développer et d'atteindre ensemble nos objectifs communs. Nous avons de grandes aspirations et nous apprécions les idées de notre équipe.

En rejoignant le groupe IBE, vous faites partie d'une équipe qui veut votre succès. Vous aurez les outils et l'opportunité de perfectionner vos compétences et de faire partie de projets passionnants.

 

Principales responsabilités:

  • Établir un plan de commercialisation
  • Analyser les tendances du marché, les offres des concurrents et les données démographiques
  • Création de niches et de slogans marketing
  • Préparation des outils de présentation
  • Traduction de tous les outils marketing
  • Recherche de clients potentiels avec différents moteurs de recherche
  • S'assurer que toutes les activités de marketing sont rentables
  • Créer un partenariat avec d'autres entreprises
  • Surveiller les performances marketing et ajuster les stratégies au besoin

 

Exigences du rôle:

  • Baccalauréat en marketing, en publicité ou dans une discipline connexe
  • 1 à 2 ans d'expérience dans un rôle marketing
  • Parfaitement bilingue en français et en anglais (parlé, lu et écrit)
  • Compétences en organisation et en priorisation
  • Maîtrise des outils d'analyse Web
  • À l'aise de travailler dans un environnement au rythme rapide
  • Joueur d'équipe exceptionnel

 

Ce que nous offrons:

  • Salaire compétitif
  • Assurance collective pour soins médicaux et dentaires
  • Cotisations REER possibles
  • Accompagnement dans votre formation et développement
  • Possibilité d'évolution au sein de l'organisation
  • Prime de performance
  • Allocations et avantages sociaux éventuels (voiture, essence, etc.)
  • Stationnement gratuit au centre de Montréal (ou à 5 minutes à pied du métro)

 

Cela ressemble à la prochaine étape de votre carrière? Si oui, nous serions ravis de discuter avec vous!

 

ENGLISH VERSION

Marketing and Commercial Development Specialist

 

About the job

The IBE Group is looking for a Marketing and Commercial Development Specialist for their Montreal location.

 

About the company

The IBE Group is a general contractor company working in the construction industry in residential, commercial and institutional sectors. We execute a variety of projects internationally. We are a tight-knit, diverse, ambitious and multi-disciplinary team. Our objective is to provide optimal solutions to our clients by providing them with our project management and technical expertise.

We are an agile team in full expansion. We value communication, transparency continuous learning and teamwork. We thrive on developing ourselves and achieving our common goals together. We have big aspirations, and we value our team's ideas.

When joining the IBE group, you become part of a team that wants your success. You will be given the tools and opportunity to hone your skills and be part of exciting projects.

 

Main Responsibilities:

  • Establish a marketing plan
  • Analyze market trends, competitor offerings and demographics
  • Creation of niches and marketing slogans
  • Preparation of presentation tools
  • Translation of all marketing tools
  • Search for potential customers with different search engines
  • Ensure all marketing activities are profitable and cost-effective
  • Create a partnership with other companies
  • Monitor marketing performance and adjust strategies as needed

 

Role Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in marketing, advertising or a related discipline
  • Between 1 to 2 years of experience in a marketing role
  • Perfectly bilingual in French and English (spoken, read and written)
  • Strong organizational and prioritization skills
  • Proficiency with web analytics tools
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
  • Exceptionnal team player

 

What we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Group insurance for medical and dental
  • Possible RRSP contributions
  • Support in your training and development
  • Possibility for advancement within the organization
  • Performance bonus
  • Possible allowances and perk benefits (car, gas, etc.)
  • Free parking in the center of Montreal (or 5 minute walk from the metro)

 

Does this sound like the next step in your career? If so, we'd love to talk with you!

Skyservice is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. If for any reason you cannot apply through our job board, please contact a member of our Human Resources team for special accommodation.

title: Marketer
description:
Job Summary: We are looking to hire marketers! We are looking for outgoing, positive and money driven people that can work part time. We generally look for fun, outgoing people who want to be a part of our learn first culture, but of course make some money while doing it.

Our hours will consist of Monday to Thursday 4:30 to 7:30pm and Saturday/Sunday 1:00pm to 4:00pm. you can choose your own schedule as long as you work a minimum of 4 hours per week, with no cap on hours! You can design your schedule to work around your busy schedule.

All training will be provided!

This job is great for friend groups and we strongly encourage friends to apply together.

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:

  • How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers
  • Reaching your goals, and helping others reach a common goal
  • Motivating yourself, and others

Pay Structure:
Every crew member can expect to make a minimum of $16 an hour and our last years highest earning employees were averaging $25/hr. Specific pay structure will be discussed during our first phone call.

Bonuses:

  • Per Lead
  • Per Estimate
  • Per Lawn Sign

Requirements to apply:

  • Great Attitude
  • Willingness to learn
  • Punctual
  • Respectful
  • Honest
  • Motivated to Work
  • Communication

title: Hybrid Product Development Specialist
description:
Staples Promotional Products- Product Development Specialist


Staples is business to business.You’re what binds us together.


Staples Promotional Products is the world's most trusted source for branded merchandise. As an unprecedented 11-time winner of the Distributor of the Year Award and the highest-ranking Canadian distributor on the North American Top 40 list, we are committed to providing outstanding service and exceptional value. That's why companies large and small, all over the world, turn to us for the resources they need to increase brand reach and visibility.


Here’s a peek into what we do!https://www.youtube.com/watch?reload=9&v=KK5lM-0wTvQ


What you’ll be doing:


+ Collaborate with Strategic Account Manager to develop the merchandising strategy for customer programs.

+ Monitors consumer retail trends across channels (print/social) to develop customer branded merchandise that will support the customer’s brand objectives.

+ Remain current on preferred and industry supplier products and services.

+ Be our customers’ brand advocate – responsible for ensuring products meet customer brand and compliance guidelines.

+ Attends off-site client meetings, makes presentations to customers and when necessary, unpacks/packs boxes or packages to show merchandise or catalogues at client or vendor events

+ Conduct product movement and category analysis and utilizes this data along with demographic information and retail trends to drive merchandising recommendations.

+ Adhere to and develop expertise on product safety & compliance guidelines and processes.

+ Control and maintain margins within set guidelines by program.

+ Ensure smooth working and customer satisfaction by working with members of the sales team, account services, and sales support teams across the business

+ Some travel is required; generally restricted to local office metropolitan area, and with 4-6 cross-border (USA) trips annually.

+ Work overtime as required to meet deadlines and provide team coverage upon request.


What you bring to the table


+ Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills with a flair for presenting

+ An innate love for product and sourcing with an agile understanding to adapt products and solutions to relevant trends.

+ Awareness on relevant issues and ability to use them to provide purposeful and intentional products and solutions.

+ Inclusive and team spirited working with an ability to build collaborative relationships and trust through open communication

+ Accountable, Positive Attitude and Takes Initiative to Learn, Share and Grow.

+ Strong organizational skills and the ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks/projects simultaneously in a fast-paced and changing work environment and under tight deadlines

+ Strong problem solving and analytical skill set with Strong negotiation skills

+ Self-motivated with high energy and enthusiasm


Qualifications :


What’s needed- Basic Qualifications


+ Purchasing / buying / merchandising experience preferably from the fashion and/or retail consumer goods industry

+ 2-3 Years relevant work experience in product marketing, merchandising or related field Experience in the retail / agency (fashion or consumer goods) industry preferred.

+ Proficient use of Microsoft programs (Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint)

+ High School Diploma required

+ University or college diploma in fashion, sales or business or equivalent working experience within a B2B sales environment is preferred


We Offer:


+ Competitive salary.

+ Inclusive culture with associate-led Business Resource Groups and resources such as the Social Justice Resource Centre.

+ Flexible PTO and Holiday Schedule (10 observed paid holidays), Online and Retail Discounts, Company Match RRSP, Benefits and Physical and Mental Health Wellness programs.

+ Growth & development opportunities.


_Interested in joining the team? Check out our_ _perks and benefits_ _!_


_Staples Professional is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and we encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including those with disabilities._

Our small Canadian-born business was founded in 1978 and has become a global organisation that now spans 120 locations across 20 countries. Our distinctive Principal-led, privately-owned model puts us in the enviable position of being able to offer every employee the opportunity to own a share of our business, and inspires and allows anyone to become a Principal. This role carries voting rights so our people have a very real say in the future direction and operation of our business. title: Category Analyst Canada
description:
Summary:

Category Analyst - Canada  

 

At our Company, we grow People, Brands, and Businesses! We are seeking a dynamic Category Analyst to support the development of customer and client sales growth strategies by providing insightful analytics and shopper insights that support a mutually beneficial growth plan. The Category Analyst interfaces with customers, various members of the category management and customer development teams. The Category Analyst works to develop category review, prepare new item presentations, provides assortment and promotion analysis, and handle ad hoc requests.

 

Take this opportunity to join North Americaâ€™s leading business solutions provider and build your career working with amazing people in a growing industry! Apply today!

 

What we offer:

  • Full-Time Benefits (Health, Dental, Disability, Life, Lifeworks Program)
  • PerkSpot Discounts on Travel, Movies, Cell Phones and more
  • Training and Career Development
  • Generous Paid Time-Off  

Responsibilities:

  • Source data from syndicated, customer-specific and/or market resources.
  • Quantify, analyze, and interpret data.
  • Evaluate the reliability of source information by weighting raw data and organizing results for analysis.
  • Maintain project schedule by monitoring project progress, coordinating activities, resolving problems and make adjustments as needed to meet deadlines.
  • Organize information into presentation format by studying, analyzing, interpreting and classifying data.
  • Assist the management team as needed by participating in presentations to answer any questions regarding the data and data analysis information.

Qualifications:

  • Associate's Degree or equivalent experience required; Bachelorâ€™s Degree or equivalent work experience preferred
  • Working knowledge of syndicated data and applications
  • Analytical and Research Skills
  • Understand legal regulations within category management and work within compliance guidelines
  • Well-organized, detail-oriented, and able to handle a fast-paced work environment
  • Ability to ensure a high level of service and quality is maintained

The Company  is one of North Americaâ€™s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers, and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods.  The Company services a variety of trade channels including grocery, mass merchandise, specialty, convenience, drug, dollar, club, hardware, consumer electronics and home centers. We bridge the gap between manufacturers and retailers, providing consumers access to the best products available in the marketplace today.

The Company welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.   The Company will provide reasonable accommodations, accessible formats, and communication support upon request to persons with disabilities who take part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.   If you require accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact: Recruiter, Talent Acquisition, for external applicants, or, a Supervisor for internal applicants.

Responsibilities:

The Company  is one of North Americaâ€™s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods.  The Company services a variety of trade channels including grocery, mass merchandise, specialty, convenience, drug, dollar, club, hardware, consumer electronics and home centers. We bridge the gap between manufacturers and retailers, providing consumers access to the best products available in the marketplace today.

 

Position Summary

 

The Category Analyst supports the development of customer and client sales growth strategies by providing insightful analytics and shopper insights that support a mutually beneficial growth plan. The Category Analyst interfaces with customers, various members of the category management and customer development teams. The Category Analyst works to develop category review, prepare new item presentations, provides assortment and promotion analysis, and handle ad hoc requests.

 

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

 

Data Collection

  • Source data from syndicated, customer-specific and/or market resources
  • Meet specific needs of requesting party by determining appropriate data selection and custom assortment as directed by supervisor

Data Analysis/Interpretation/Application

  • Quantify, analyze, and interpret data
  • Evaluate the reliability of source information by weighting raw data and organizing results for analysis
  • Create excel templates utilizing raw data

Project Management

  • Maintain project schedule by monitoring project progress, coordinating activities, resolving problems and make adjustments as needed to meet deadlines

Presentation Development

  • Organize information into presentation format by studying, analyzing, interpreting and classifying data

Presentation Delivery

  • Assist the management team as needed by participating in presentations to answer any questions regarding the data and data analysis information

Supervisory Responsibilities

Direct Reports

This position does not have supervisory responsibilities for direct reports

 

Indirect Reports

This position does not have guidance or mentoring responsibilities for indirect reports

 

Travel and/or Driving Requirements

Travel is not an essential duty and function of this job. Driving is an essential duty or function of this job.

 

Minimum Qualifications

Education Level: (Required): Associate's Degree or  Bachelorâ€™s Degree or equivalent experience

                                                                                                             

Skills, Knowledge and Abilities

  • Working knowledge of syndicated data and applications
  • Analytical and research Skills
  • Understand legal regulations within category management and work within compliance guidelines
  • Well-organized, detail-oriented, and able to handle a fast-paced work environment
  • Excellent customer service orientation
  • Ability to ensure a high level of service and quality is maintained
  • Team building Skills
  • Ability to work effectively with management
  • Ability to develop and present category strategy growth opportunities and recommendations to key accounts.
  • Excellent Excel and Power Point skills.
  • Strong communication skills and time management skills.
  • Ability to work across multiple categories.
  • The Category Analyst has the ability to work independently and in teams.

Environmental & Physical Requirements

Office / Sedentary Requirements

Incumbent must be able to perform the essential functions of the job. Work is performed primarily in an office environment. Typically requires the ability to sit for extended periods of time (66%+ each day), ability to hear the telephone, ability to enter data on a computer and may also require the ability to lift up to 10 pounds.

 

Additional Information Regarding  The Company Job Duties and Job Descriptions

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Overview:

This  is an  exciting  opportunity for an experienced Marketing Coordinator to join a small Events team within our Marketing department, who are responsible for executing the largest gathering of data professionals focused on the data  platform. This is a demand generation and marketing communications role and requires the successful candidate to drive registrations and build excitement for this yearâ€™s hybrid conference taking place in Seattle this November.

Youâ€™ll be comfortable creating campaigns across a variety of marketing channels including, email, social media, paid-media, web content, video, and more.  Successful collaboration with our in-house brand team and other marketing teams will be essential to fulfil our communication plans and registration targets.      

Apply online today!

Key responsibilities  (Not in order of importance)  

  • Coordinate and support event marketing in the run up to and during PASS Data Community Summit.
  • Create on-brand assets for a variety of uses which include but are not limited to websites, email templates, social media graphics, event displays, print collateral, and videos to support the content for integrated demand generation campaigns.
  • Develop messaging, content and email campaigns designed to resonate with certain personas, segments and verticals.
  • Pre, during and post-event communications using event management software, including but not limited to RainFocus and Marketo.
  • Support with creating, uploading and scheduling social media campaigns as required
  • Oversee various social media channels and coordinate internal and external correspondence in a friendly manner (consistent with the Redgate brand).
  • Build and develop relationships with internal team members based across various time-zones to enable them to fulfil requirements and meet deadlines.
  • Use your event and community insight to offer suggestions and ideas where appropriate.

What makes you  a Marketing  Coordinator?  

  • Demonstrable experience of working in an events marketing role, supporting multiple event projects concurrently as part of a team, as well as independently.
  • Graphic or digital designing experience with Figma or Sketch or InVision, and Adobe Creative Suite.
  • Able to work well under pressure with excellent attention to detail, time management and organizational skills, with a keen interest in prioritising workload and taking your own initiative.
  • Able to hit the ground running and get up to speed quickly to take ownership of the marketing coordination of an international hybrid conference.
  • Socially competent, a proactive team player, self-motivated, and enthusiastic.
  • Ability to work across teams, functions and time zones to get the right stuff done first time.
  • A problem-solver with the ability to think creatively and on your feet, react rapidly to situations, prioritise your workload and implement measures to improve procedures and workflow.
  • Excellent communication skills including the ability to develop, and repurpose, written marketing copy across a wide range of channels.
  • Experience of using RainFocus or an online events platform, Marketo and Hootsuite would be an advantage.

 

Whatâ€™s the package?  

  • Competitive salary based on experience, and  a great benefits package to include:
    • 20 days holiday + statutory holidays
    • Medical, dental, vision & travel insurance
    • Life insurance, long term disability insurance
    • Company annual profit share/equity award
  • Award winning culture  

Achieving work life balance has never been more important and so Redgate has adopted a flexible-hybrid model. This means that people will work flexibly with a blend of remote (home) and co-located (office) work, with teams having the flexibility to decide which location best suits the outcomes they need to deliver.

Where you work and how frequently you attend the office will depend on the nature of your role, make-up of the team and the type of work that you need to do. A weekly visit to the office is likely for most people to support our collaborative culture and enable our teams to deliver great work, though less frequent visits may also work well. So, if you are able to travel to & from the office safely in a day, that works well for us.  With that, we are currently seeking candidates who are within a commutable distance of  Vancouver and reside within the province.  

You must have the right to live and work in British Columbia, Canada to apply for this role.  

Redgate Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Senior Lifecycle Marketing Specialist
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Do you love working with different departments to create interesting and innovative online campaigns? Are you a big-picture thinker where you see how your efforts fit into achieving key business goals? If so, our Senior Lifecycle Marketing Specialist position might just be the right position for you!

We form long-term connections as we respect the time and money of our regular players and customers. And we want you to be part of our Lifecycle Marketing team that strives to connect with our customers and help build games that connect them with other players. You are a mold-breaker who loves to learn and test new things. More than this, you can quickly pick up new tools and processes while always looking for ways to improve and build upon past successes.

This role can be based remotely anywhere in Canada

Excited by this opportunity? We invite you to apply now and start the conversation with us. Together, we can create and support some of the best games ever made and entertain the world!

About Kabam
Kabam is a world leader of developing entertaining, immersive, and highly social multiplayer games for mobile devices. They merge consumer behaviour with the art of game design to create experiences that are enjoyed by millions of players across the globe. Each game has raised the benchmark in mobile gaming, bringing high-quality graphics, next-generation technology and revolutionary gameplay to the console in every player’s pocket.
Kabam has partnered with leading entertainment brands like Disney, Hasbro and Universal to create mobile games based on some of the world’s most iconic franchises.

Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads including Fast & Furious 6: The Game, Fast & Furious: Legacy,Marvel Contest of Champions,Transformers: Forged to Fight,Shop TitansandMini Guns.These games have also received multiple awards such as Apple’s Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year.

Founded in 2006, Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, Montreal, Charlottetown, Los Angeles, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.

Kabam is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and equitable workplace, and inclusive environment for all existing and potential employees. Employment decisions are based on candidate qualifications and business need, not race, color, ancestry, place of origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, political belief, religion, creed, marital or family status, medical condition, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, prior criminal conviction or any other protected class in accordance with federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</section>

title: B2B Marketing Coordinator
description:
The Role

Our Marketing team is growing and requires a B2B Marketing Coordinator to support our growing B2B Marketing initiatives. We are looking for a highly curious and driven individual who is eager to learn. This opportunity does not require a specific set of prior work experience but rather a set of fundamental characteristics - curiosity, resourcefulness and hustle.

 

Responsibilities

  • Coordination of content as designated by the Senior Marketing Coordinator including: blog, email, social, web, print and more as needs arise
  • Webinar support, including coordination of speakers, sending of invites & follow-up communication with attendees
  • Coordination and quality assurance of weekly emails
  • Researching competitor content to help inform marketing strategies
  • Ensuring all creative assets are consistent with our brand style guide
  • Reporting, or coordinating the reporting, of key performance indicators for B2B marketing initiatives

     

     

    Education and Experience

  • Undergraduate or master’s university degree in marketing, communications, or related field.
  • Knowledge of B2B marketing an asset
  • Some CMS (Salesforce) experience an asset
  • Experience with Hubspot, Salesforce, CallRail, Google Data Studio is an asset

  •  

    Skills and Abilities

  • Requires a high degree of initiative, dependability, and ability to work with little supervision
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
