Req ID: BUS000LA

title: Marketing Specialist IT/IS
description:
Impact Healthcare

Roche Diagnostics is not only a healthcare leader but has the ambition to become a leader in digital health. Our digital teams are laying the groundwork for the future by developing various  innovative digital solutions centered around patients; supporting faster access and more efficient use of healthcare spend. Do you want to be part of this transformation, bringing technology & insights to healthcare; supporting earlier diagnosis, connecting various technologies and helping clinicians in finding the right treatments? 

Our Core Lab & Digital Solutions Marketing team aims to set the strategy, build partnership in transforming our healthcare system. Come join us!

 

Making a Big Difference

As a Marketing Specialist IT/ IS you will be responsible for all on market digital products (Navify, Viewics, cobas infinity to name a few). You will be the resident business expert for the IT / IS products in your portfolio. You will interact with the appropriate global development and commercialisation teams across North America, Europe and Asia. You will work closely with members of the Commercial Operations and the Regulatory & Quality chapters to ensure that all on market digital solutions and SW applications are relevant to the Canadian market. You will collaborate across the Marketing team of Specialists and Strategists to ensure the best strategies and tactics are being deployed with the Commercial Operations team.

 

Responsibilities:

*Position location; Reside anywhere in Canada with the understanding of meetings focusing on EST

  • Own pre-market plan/business case for new products- which lead to launch

  • Responsible for co-creation of innovative software applications and product enhancements addressing Canadian market issues.

  • Train and work collaboratively with the Commercial Operations team to keep bi-directional updates on products, competition & product challenges, liaison with North American and European development centers

  • Become a business matter expert on the portfolio for the Canadian Market

  • Responsible for the successful management of the products' life cycle from 'cradle to grave' in their respective BU portfolio

  • Will work closely across Chapters to ensure products are relevant, competitive and viable for the Canadian Market.

 

Requirements 

  • 5+ years’ experience in software development, Product Owner roles

  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent field 

  • Experience in the design and/or implementation of SaaS models, cloud solution using AWS

  • Agile, Growth Mindset and willingness to New Ways of Working a must

  • Understanding of Public Healthcare System preferably Canada 

  • Bilingual in English and French preferred

  • Reside anywhere in Canada with the understanding of meetings focusing on EST

  • Minimal travel up to 25% annually

 

Impact sur les soins de santé

Roche Diagnostics n'est pas seulement un leader de la santé mais a l'ambition de devenir un leader de la santé numérique. Nos équipes digitales préparent le futur en développant diverses solutions digitales innovantes centrées sur le patient ; favoriser un accès plus rapide et une utilisation plus efficace des dépenses de santé. Voulez-vous faire partie de cette transformation, apporter la technologie et les connaissances aux soins de santé ? soutenir un diagnostic plus précoce, connecter diverses technologies et aider les cliniciens à trouver les bons traitements ?

Notre équipe Marketing des solutions pour le laboratoire central et numériques vise à définir la stratégie, à établir des partenariats pour transformer notre système de santé. Venez nous rejoindre!

 

Faire une grande différence

En tant que spécialiste marketing TI/SI, vous serez responsable de tous les produits numériques du marché (Navify, Viewics, cobas infinity pour n'en nommer que quelques-uns). Vous serez l'expert en la matière résident pour les produits IT/IS de votre portfolio. Vous interagirez avec les équipes de développement et de commercialisation mondiales appropriées en Amérique du Nord, en Europe et en Asie. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les membres des chapitres des opérations commerciales et de la réglementation et de la qualité pour vous assurer que toutes les solutions numériques et applications logicielles sur le marché sont pertinentes pour le marché canadien. Vous collaborerez avec l'équipe marketing de spécialistes et de stratèges pour vous assurer que les meilleures stratégies et tactiques sont déployées avec l'équipe des opérations commerciales.

Responsabilités

*Localisation de l’emploi:Résider n'importe où au Canada avec la compréhension que les réunions sont durant l’heure normale de l’Est

 

  • Propre plan de pré-commercialisation/analyse de rentabilisation pour les nouveaux produits - qui conduisent au lancement

  • Responsable de la co-création d'applications logicielles innovantes et d'améliorations de produits répondant aux problèmes du marché canadien.

  • Former et travailler en collaboration avec l'équipe des opérations commerciales pour tenir des mises à jour bidirectionnelles sur les produits, la concurrence et les défis liés aux produits, en liaison avec les centres de développement nord-américains et européens

  • Devenez un expert en affaires sur le portefeuille pour le marché canadien

  • Responsable de la gestion réussie du cycle de vie des produits du « berceau à la tombe » dans leur portfolio de votre unité d’affaires respective

  • Travaillera en étroite collaboration entre les chapitres pour s'assurer que les produits sont pertinents, compétitifs et viables pour le marché canadien.

Requis

  • Plus de 5 ans d'expérience dans le développement de logiciels, rôles de Product Owner

  • B.S. ou M.S. en informatique ou dans un domaine équivalent

  • Expérience dans la conception et/ou la mise en œuvre de modèles SaaS, solution cloud utilisant AWS

  • Agile, esprit de croissance et volonté de nouvelles façons de travailler un must

  • Bilingue anglais et français, de préférence

  • Résider n'importe où au Canada avec la compréhension que les réunions sont durant l’heure normale de l’Est

  • Voyagement minimal jusqu'à 25% par an

title: International Business Developer – North America
description:
#BusinessDevelopmentUSandCanada #InternationalSales #GlobalScopeCompany #DynamicWork #TopWorldKnownBrands #TopBusinessSchools

 

Advent Group is a marketing company specialized in graduate education and corporate learning since 2004. Based in Paris, Sofia and Montreal, Advent Group offers its employees a stimulating job that requires them to grow!

 

We are a worldwide leader in education events and marketing solutions for the higher education sector.

 

  • 5M+ digital audience outreach
  • 300+ events per year
  • 170+ team members
  • 350+ leading partner universities
  • 6 continents of operation


What is the essence of the role?

We are looking for a dynamic individual to join our business development team. Based in Montreal and working as part of an international team, you will be responsible to sell a variety of marketing services, education events and digital products to a clientele of business schoolsand universities in North America (US and Canada).

 

N.B. The job is not remote. It is based in Montreal and requires travel across Canada and the USduring 40% of the time. The payment structure includes base salary+ bonuses based on performance.  

 

What will your job look like?

  • Developing sustainable relationships with current and prospective clients (business schools and universities across North America)
  • Performing researches to generate leads and establishing the first contact with prospective clients by preferably travelling and meetingthem face-to-face whenever possible
  • Updating clients and presenting to them Advent Group’s products, events and services, including media – digitaland print
  • Following up after client meetings – preparing quotes and negotiating with them until the deal is closed
  • Coordinating with internal departments to enhance the client experience
  • Responding to client requests regarding our products 
  • Co-operating with the back-office support by providing them with timely information and guidance
  • Bearing responsibility for follow-ups and debrief sessions with clients
  • Participating at online and physical events as an education consultant in worldwide locations


What do you need to be successful?

  • At least 3 years of work experience and a university degree in Management, Economics, Business Administration, Marketing and Communication or relevant
  • A skilled negotiator with proven track record in sales, B2B and business development, where experience in the higher education field (including a role in an admissions department) would be a great advantage. Previous marketing experience would also be a plus
  • Ability to build, maintain and grow client relationships
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability and readiness to travel in US and Canada (around 40% of the time when travel is possible)
  • Self-driven person with innovative mindset
  • Confident MS Office user (especially Excel), comfortable with using a CRM
  • Fluent in written and spoken English
  • Knowledge of French and/or other languages would be a bonus

 

Why Should You Apply? 

  • If you are a person who would like to work in an international environment, but not in big corporations or bureaucratic organizations – you should apply!
  • If you are a person who likes a structured and organized approach at work, but at the same time is not afraid of a little bit of chaos from time to time – you should apply!
  • If you want to make a difference and work on projects that are so specific that you will amaze your friends every time you talk about your job – you should apply!
  • And of course, if you are looking for a job within a stable company with steady growth and vision for the future – you should apply! 

 

GROW BY HELPING OTHERS GROW

PERSONAL MISSION WITH A GLOBAL IMPACT


 What do we offer you?

  • Job with a meaning and a cause
  • Being a part of international projects
  • Having the chance to make a difference
  • Competitive salary and attractive bonus scheme
  • Flexible remote role
  • Exciting opportunity for domestic and international travel
  • Dynamic workplace
  • A strong supportive culture
  • Professional development opportunities

 

 

If interested, please send us your CV in English.

 

By submitting your CV you agree your CV to be kept in our database for a month and used for the purpose of this job vacancy.

 

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Senior Marketing Operations Specialist
description:
About Us

Our mission is to make hourly work easier for local businesses and hourly workers. Homebase currently serves more than 100,000 small (but mighty) businesses with everything they need to manage their hourly teams: employee scheduling, time clocks, payroll, team communication, hiring, onboarding, and compliance. Just don't call us "Human Capital Management." We have built tools for the busiest businesses, so owners and employees can spend less time on bullsh*t and more time on what matters. The Homebase team brings small business expertise from Intuit, Square, OpenTable, Yelp, Gusto, and First Data. Homebase is backed by leading venture investors Bain Capital Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Plus Capital, and GGV Capital.

You

  • You are a data-driven marketing operations manager who has broad experience across a large marketing automation tech stack
  • You love process - building new processes, improving current processes, and translating marketing requirements into campaigns
  • You're a problem solver - ready to jump into the data to troubleshoot any issues that come your way or discover new insights to drive growth
  • You love to learn - from new methods of data analysis to new communication best practices
  • You enjoy synthesizing data into actionable insights for others in your organization
  • You enjoy working within a data model architecture, ensuring standardization and cleanliness of customer data in various platforms
  • You love working across an organization - from Product to Engineering to Customer Success, and more
  • You are passionate about helping local small businesses and are excited to use email (and other methods) to communicate with small business owners
  • You have a customer-first mindset, building experiences that serve the needs of your target audience
  • You have a background in marketing operations but are also interested in learning new skills from data pipelines/migration to sales operations to customer journey mapping

The Job

As a member of our growing marketing team, you'll work closely with our marketing, product, and customer success leaders to shape the future of our chat & email marketing systems. You'll not only lead our chat marketing efforts, but you will be pivotal in centralizing how we communicate with our customers across our customer success, sales, marketing, and product teams. You'll own our data migration efforts, ensuring that customer data is passed from our internal systems to our marketing automation tools. This role also presents the opportunity to expand your scope of work outside of chat & email, as there will be opportunities to learn and work on sales operations, customer lifecycle mapping, landing page testing, etc.

Responsibilities

  • Develop new communication strategies within our current email & chatbot marketing system, communicating with over 100K small business owners 
  • Own data migration efforts from our internal systems to marketing automation vendors
  • Report on effectiveness of email & chatbot marketing to senior management
  • Partner with Customer Success to design and implement new email & chatbot workflows to support sales operations processes
  • Design and implement new email, text, chat, or other communication workflows for different steps of the customer journey
  • Conduct and measure A/B tests to learn, optimize, improve our communications
  • Build custom lists of customers to communicate with based on actions taken within our product
  • Identify and troubleshoot technical and data issues with with Data and Engineering teams
  • Work with our Marketing and Product teams to attract Homebase customers, encourage them to use our product, and get them to pay
  • Build a multi-channel view of customer touchpoints, tying together points of contact across Sales, Marketing, and Product
  • Ensure we are always complying with relevant chat, email, text, and other regulations

Must-Have

  • 2+ years experience managing email & chat marketing automation platforms 
  • 4+ years of marketing experience
  • Chat software experience (e.g. Drift, Intercom, Zendesk, Podium) and experience building out chat playbooks
  • Email marketing software experience (eg. Iterable, HubSpot, Pardot, Constant Contact) and technical experience expanding scope of email marketing program
  • Strong data analysis skills - proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets is a must
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g Looker, Google Analytics, Tableau, Domo)
  • SQL experience or willingness to learn
  • Working knowledge of HTML
  • Excellent understanding of what makes a good/effective email; copywriting and editing skills are a plus
  • Strong attention to detail and the ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Ability to synthesize data and present actionable insights
  • Comfort taking on projects outside of your defined role
  • Be self-directed and able to manage complex projects from end-to-end
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic, fast paced environment, serving as a cross-departmental marketing resource across multiple time zones

What We Offer You

  • Supplemental Benefits 
  • Stock Options - Everyone is an owner
  • Fun Team Activities
  • A dynamic, well-connected, productive team that is thriving while working from home and who have found new ways to connect and have fun despite social distancing

At Homebase, we value our differences, and we encourage all to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Homebase is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: Brand Content Strategist
description:
About Legible

Our Mission: Legible will empower and connect authors and readers through open access to a global reading and publishing platform. Legible is making books beautiful and accessible.

Our Community Values: Accessibility, Sustainability, Beauty and Integrity

At Legible, we make books easy to access from anywhere on the globe, with nothing but a browser and an internet or cell connection - no special devices necessary! No paper, no waste. Just beautifully written words on exquisitely designed digital pages. 

Books have always been, as Stephen King put it, “a uniquely portable magic,” and we aim to make them even more portable - to connect more authors and readers around the world than ever before. And to bring new and diverse voices to the readers who most need to hear them. 

About the role 

This new role at Legible will help provide content strategy for the Legible brand. You'll function as a key liaison between the product, curation and publishing teams while bringing a marketing perspective. You'll take a lead role in designing marketing content that aligns with our customer journey and act as the custodian of the brand's tone and voice.

What makes this job different

You'll get the opportunity to grow the brand voice from the ground up and provide strategic clarity for marketing content at Legible.

What you'll be doing

  • Develop and contribute to content strategies that people will love when interacting with Legible.
  • Work with the Marketing Director and key stakeholders to define and maintain a consistent brand tone & voice that aligns with our corporate values of accessibility, sustainability, beauty and integrity.
  • Liaison with internal product and publishing teams, and work closely with external agencies to produce clear, consistent and beautiful content that drives Legible's brand narrative into new and existing markets.
  • Write, edit and create marketing content campaigns, social media, multimedia, website, and event collateral.
  • Take a lead role in designing marketing assets that align with our customer journey and market need.
  • Collaborate with the Director and stakeholders to develop and align the content strategy across the organization.
  • Work with team members to build, maintain, and share content guidelines to scale best practices in content creation.
  • Conduct content inventories, audits, user testing, stakeholder interviews, and user testing activities.
  • Maintain the marketing content calendar, deliverables and timeline.
  • Work with the Creative Director to establish a clear glossary of terms, messaging frameworks, taxonomies, and brand guidelines for the company.
  • Maintain familiarity with industry trends, issues, and technologies

Your first challenge

Work with the Marketing Director and stakeholders to determine a strategic approach to content and a list of key list of content assets to prioritize, plan and then execute.

About you

Some key things about you

  • At core, you're a writer, but you love all forms of content whether it's visual, audio, multimedia, and whatever else can or should exist.
  • You're creative and analytical, but mostly strategic.
  • You have a love of grammar, design, and have already red-lined everything in this job posting that needs an edit. Your strong opinions on the oxford comma have made you enemies.
  • To say you have amazing communication skills is a laughable understatement. 
  • You're empathetic so, of course, you are in our customer's heads.
  • You're fun and outgoing but have an affinity for research and planning.

Key experience and skills

  • 8 - 10 years experience as a content writer, producer, or journalist, preferably in the technology, publishing or eCommerce industries
  • BA or relevant degree or equivalent experience
  • Experience working with Creatives at all levels
  • Solid understanding of user experience and content-first UX design
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
  • Able to communicate complex information with persuasive clarity to all audiences
  • Knowledge of SEO and familiar with SEM campaigns
  • Proven ability to work independently and collaborate diplomatically with a cross-functional team
  • Rigorous approach to documentation and organization

About the team

You'll be working with some of the nicest people. Reporting to the Director of Marketing, you'll be working with experienced and dedicated marketing professionals helping to build and grow Legible. 

Why Legible? 

Legible is a startup with a heart - a company that values equity and diversity at its very core. It is somewhere you can come to grow and experience different areas of the business. We are a small but mighty team, who is just turning the page on a new and exciting chapter of growth. 

We offer:

  • A flexible working schedule
  • Great paid time off package, including a paid winter break! 
  • Positions you can grow and make your own
  • A multitude of avenues for career growth and change
  • An open-door policy - you can approach any member of leadership with confidence
  • An inclusive working environment - anyone and everyone is welcome at Legible
  • Community Values - We work together as a team to better our local and global communities. We are invested in making a positive difference in the world.

“Systemic racism is a machine that runs whether we pull the levers or not, and by just letting it be, we are responsible for what it produces. We have to actually dismantle the machine if we want to make change.” - Ijeoma Oluo, So You Want to Talk About Race

At Legible, we strive for diversity and inclusion to create a genuinely healthy and equitable workplace for everyone. We are committed to the ongoing process of building a culture of respect at every level, ensuring that everyone feels safe, supported, and valued.

Let's be real: employee handbooks always talk a lot about diversity and inclusion, but in the actual day-to-day, employees knowingly or unknowingly indulge in microaggressions toward BIPOC colleagues, claim that “sexism goes both ways,” and so on. At Legible, we know that oppression is systemic and structural. Cishet privilege, non-disabled privilege, white privilege, male privilege—these are real and have consequences for people. We're aware that being marginalized at work causes real distress, especially when accountability doesn't seem to exist. 

How is Legible going to dismantle the machine and what makes us different? It starts here; everyone has an opportunity to join Legible and make a difference -  our hiring process is fair and equitable. As a company we will be devoted to providing regular training and info sessions to our employees to ensure that we are aware of our privileges and will work to address microaggressions on a daily basis. One look at Legible.com will show how committed we are to diversity and inclusivity. We are a company that will beautifully entwine, celebrate and support diverse cultures and varying beliefs. 

A few years ago, an interviewer asked Lin-Manuel Miranda, the creator of the Broadway smash hit Hamilton, why his cast was so diverse. Miranda replied, "That's just what happens when you go looking for the very best people!" At Legible, we couldn't agree more! 

Legible recognizes the right for human beings to self identify. You are valued, safe and supported.

To be considered for this position, you must be eligible to work in Canada and pass a background check.

title: Content Marketer
description:
We are looking for a self-motivated and talented individual to manage and lead our communications. In this position, you will be in charge of producing high-quality content that engages customers and builds brand recognition.

Your main duties will also include creating informative content, press releases, articles, and media opportunities to share our company's brand, products, and services. The ideal candidate will be an excellent communicator, with brilliant presentation and organizational skills.

Responsibilities:

  • Create informative and interesting press releases, press kits, newsletters, and related marketing materials.
  • Develop and implement effective communication strategies that build customer loyalty programs, brand awareness, and customer satisfaction.
  • Prepare detailed media activity reports.
  • Plan and manage the design, content, and production of all marketing materials.
  • Work with different marketing teams to generate new ideas and strategies.
  • Supervise projects to guarantee all content is publication-ready.
  • Create communication and marketing strategies for new products, launches, events, and promotions.
  • Respond to communication-related issues in a timely manner.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in communications, journalism, public relations or relevant field.
  • A minimum of 5 years experience in a similar role.
  • Proven experience in B2B SAAS startups.
  • Strong knowledge of communication practices and techniques.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

title: Growth Marketer (Remote)
description:
About Bird&Be

The current fertility experience is broken, and we want your help fixing it. We offer personalized fertility kits, designed to help our customers optimize their outcomes, no matter the stage of their journey. With rising infertility rates, our kits will help educate our customers on their fertility health early, and help them take action with personalized supplements and prescription medication that is scientifically proven to impact outcomes. All delivered together in a beautiful box right to their doorstep.

All of this will be done under a brand umbrella that resonates with our customer base. We see a future that is different from the current "family planning" aisle filled with blue and pink boxes, plastered with photos of white babies. Our brand will reflect the modern millennial. Less First Response, more Knix. 

We are a very early stage startup, and are building a brilliant team that is excited to help solve this complex problem. 

About you

You want to be part of a small, very early stage startup that is having a massive impact on people’s lives. You are self motivated, love to collaborate, and are resourceful. You’ll need to be as passionate about our vision and as ambitious for growth as the founding team.

We are dealing with very emotional (and sometimes traumatic) subject matter for our customers, so your empathy must run high. You will need high level knowledge of digital strategies and a digital-first approach to communications and community development. You are an expert in multi-platform formats and strategies - Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest, Tiktok, Twitter, blog, etc. You are highly experienced in directing paid/organic search strategy, display advertising, content and retention marketing and emerging marketing channels. You understand and utilize analytics to find ways to improve performance across all channels. 

The work

This role is focused on digital marketing and community development, reporting directly to the CEO. Your role is to lead and drive communications in the US and Canada, build and expand our online audience, community and user base.  You’ll be working closely with our designer and developer to execute creative and effective marketing campaigns, turning small budgets into highly successful outcomes.  You will need to be nimble and resourceful and be able to recommend changes as we test different customer acquisition strategies.

Your responsibilities:

  • Work with the CEO/COO on development and execution of highly creative communications strategies for Bird&Be in Canada/US

  • Lead digital marketing strategy to amplify the impact, influence and visibility of brand and product launches

  • Focus on building brand awareness and authority, driving traffic and growing the business

  • Align digital marketing support to amplify PR strategy

  • Analyze metrics to understand where we need to improve performance, make changes, or double down on a highly functioning strategy

Role requirements:

  • Experienced (3+ years experience) in launching small to large-scale digital (earned and paid) campaigns with an understanding of ROI and measuring customer insights

  • You are passionate about driving stories across different social channels 

  • Excellent knowledge of media, cultural landscape and societal dynamics in Canada and the US

  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills and full proficiency in English

  • Strong problem solving skills with a creative approach

  • Thrives in a scrappy, fast-paced environment

  • Generous and passionate team leader with strong organizational skills

title: Franchise Marketing Strategist
description:
The 401 Group of Companies, is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's fastest growing dealer groups offering a full line of automotive, recreational vehicle, powersport and marine products and services. The 401 Group of Companies has 20+ locations across Ontario including the Blackshop Restaurant and Wine Bar as well as our headquarters, both located in the thriving city of Cambridge, Ontario. Our brands include but aren't limited to Kia, Mitsubishi, Volkswagen, Hyundai, Yamaha, 401 Auto Financing, CampMart and Grand River Boats. If you have a growth mindset like us, we'd love to see your resume and have a conversation. The opportunities at the 401 Group of Companies are endless!

 

Location: 2200 Eagle Street North, Cambridge, ON


Hours: Monday - Friday 8 am to 5 pm 

 

 This role will specifically focus on marketing for our franchises as we continue to grow the 401 Group of Companies!


Role and Responsibilities:  

  • Build on and execute the 401 Auto RV Group’s organic social media content strategy by growing our audience, increasing engagement and driving conversions and clicks 
  • Create a robust franchise social content calendar through content planning and real-time customer engagement
  • Create engaging written content including customer stories, articles, whitepapers, blogs and any other media coverage
  • Create, edit, publish and share content to attract and engage the 401Group of Companies social community across all corporate platforms for franchises our ie: Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, TikTok and Pinterest 
  • Collaborate with internal departments to create buzz and excitement around new franchise products, partnerships, employment opportunity/employer branding and other corporate messaging 
  • Monitor all mentions and DMs to ensure they meet the 401 Auto RV Group’s branding and professional image and direct/escalate inquiries as appropriate 
  • Protect the company’s brand and keep a consistent pulse on relevant Canadian automotive & RV news and trending topics 
  • Provide insights for the organization based on social listening, market trends and platform innovations 
  • Utilize your analytical ability to evaluate customer experience across multiple channels and customer touchpoints 
  • Other duties as designed

     

    Qualifications and Skills: 

    • Successful completion of post-secondary education in communications, digital marketing, or public relations 
    • 3+ years of experience in social media marketing, content marketing and communications
    • Direct experience growing a following on social media on behalf of a growing, mid-size, start-up and professional brand 
    • Previous experience in marketing and developing social content for an automotive company is considered an asset 
    • Technically savvy and knowledgeable in social media platforms as outlined above and how to optimize each platforms use 
    • Strong understanding of social analytical tools such as Google Analytics, Hootsuite and Webtrends Analytics 
    • Strong understanding of social media metrics and the ability to convey them to internal partners 
    • Working knowledge of graphic design tools ie: Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva
    • Proven ability to produce high quality and creative work while understanding the requirements of design including typography and layout 
    • Proven ability to be highly innovative, and effective in creating visually appealing content 
    • Exceptionally strong communication skills – written, verbal and interpersonal 
    • An entrepreneurial spirit and creative mindset 
    • Valid G Driver's License and acceptable driving record 

     

    The 401 Grouo of Companies is an equal opportunity employer and we are pleased to accommodate individual needs within our recruitment process. Please speak with our HR department should you require any accommodation.

title: Skilled Marketer
description:
If you're looking for an extremely CHALLENGING role that will reward the HARDEST workers, this might be the job for you. We are looking for a few all-stars to add to our amazingly talented team for this summer ahead. This year is going to be a GREAT one, with a company goal of maximizing growth while maintaining a fun and enjoyable experience for our team, through our Work Hard, Play Hard strategy.

Requirements

- Strong work ethic

- Enjoy working outdoors

- Minimal Fear of heights

- Great teamwork skills

Benefits

- Positive team atmosphere

- Strong mentorship program

- Extra incentives/raises

- Top-tier training

The application process is highly competitive, and priority is given to the earliest applicants. To apply to join the team for summer 2021, send in a resume outlining why you are the best pick.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
As a Marketing Coordinator, you will be managing a series of on-going projects, applying a data-driven approach to drive our marketing decisions, and ideating on different marketing strategies. You will also help contribute to managing our social media channels and build our brand presence in the local entrepreneurship ecosystem. Below are a few of the exciting initiatives that you could be a part of:


As a Marketing Coordinator you will be responsible for:

  • Content ideation (social media and blog)
  • Work along side Project Leads to execute EntSoc projects (launching pilot versions, creating drafts and revisions, conducting primary research – this also includes taking part in cross-team projects)

title: Sales & Marketing Coordinator Remote
description:
Role

This particular function is mainly in charge of supporting the company throughout the regions, by controlling the business, industry preparation as well as campaign execution, which includes strategic and tactical plan to increase penetration inside new places, by delivering need & sales targets. The job will even support the buyer Liaison Officer in ensuring almost all nearby location engagement is extensively planned and opportunities are backed.

Responsibility
  • Execute all web, SEO/SEM, email, social media and display and search advertising campaigns, sales funnels, Content Marketing
  • Maintain social media presence
  • Collaborate with internal teams to create landing pages, keyword research, ad copy, banner designs and optimize user experience
  • Measure and report on the performance of all digital marketing campaigns
  • Produce marketing content for promotion across digital marketing channels, including email, website, social media, search, and chat.
  • Plan, develop and optimize paid media campaigns.
  • Work with strategic partners and stakeholders on workflow processes and systems to maximize effectiveness.
  • Report on project progress and engage in client, user, and partner communications.
  • Build knowledge bases around processes, business rules and assist in documenting best practices.
  • Work closely with internal teams to bring campaigns to life while driving and measuring key business results
  • Analyze and gather data
  • Identify A/B testing opportunities, executing and optimizing against results
  • Review and test emails, campaigns, and features before launch
  • Stay on top of new trends in digital marketing content and strategy
  • Create engaging monthly social media content calendars.
  • Generate and utilize web analytics codes & tracking. Plan and develop email campaigns.
  • Regularly update the website and other properties with marketing content.
  • Design creative assets for social media channels, email campaigns, websites, and landing pages. e.g. Canva, Photoshop, Illustrator
  • Produce and analyze monthly performance reports.
Requirements

Client service

- Client Service refers to the ability to communicate efficiently and professionally with clients. At work, client service skills are required to interact with clients on behalf of the employer.

Teamwork

- Teamwork refers to the skills needed to interact with other people. At work, people work with others in pairs and in small and large groups to coordinate tasks, share resources, plan, make decisions, negotiate, solve conflicts and complete other activities that involve teamwork.

Communication

- Communication refers to the skills needed to exchange thoughts and information with other people. This exchange can happen orally by speaking, listening and using non-verbal cues, such as body language or in writing. At work, people use communication skills to talk to customers, discuss products with suppliers, explain work procedures to co-workers, participate in virtual sales meetings with clients, and other activities that involve verbal or written exchanges.

Digital skills

- Digital technology refers to the skills needed to understand and use digital systems, tools and applications, and to process digital information. At work, people use digital technology skills to input, access, analyze, organize, create and communicate information and ideas using computers, software, point-of-sale equipment, email, podcasts, web applications, smart phones and other digital devices.

Leadership

- Leadership refers to a number of skills, including communication, relationship building, and the ability to delegate and traits such as honesty. At work, leadership skills are required when working in a team, demonstrating initiative, and taking responsibility for the completion of tasks that require multiple employees.

Department Mission / Job to be done

AKP Solutions is a small consulting firm located in Toronto providing general business management and professional consulting services through independent contractors since 2019. In response to COVID-19, we are proud to be building Cansulta, a website and online community for small business owners and entrepreneurs who need to manage and grow their business to connect with vetted consultants. Cansulta is an innovative online platform dedicated to the shared success of entrepreneurs and consultants centered on its core tenets of accessibility, affordability and automation. Our internal activities include the research, planning, design, development, project management, marketing, and support services required to maintain the platform.

title: Facebook Ad Specialist Remote
description:
Role

This role requires a combination of strategic thinking, analytical, creative and communication skills. The ideal candidate should have exceptional skills in planning and executing ad strategies and thrive working on multiple campaigns at a given time. He or she should have experience about running Facebook campaigns. Experience on running marketing campaigns using other platforms is a plus!

Responsibility
  • Develop and manage digital marketing campaigns mainly Facebook ADS.
  • Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs) while identifying new KPIs to grow revenue from acquisition channels.
  • Identify trends and insights, and optimize spend and performance based on the insights
  • Brainstorm new and creative growth strategies
  • Monitor competitor activity across digital platforms
  • Continued audience research + persona planning + discovery of current trends
  • Keep organized records of marketing metrics and results of past campaigns Minimum Qualifications
  • Configure event tracking via pixels or Google Analytics custom events to measure campaign results.
Requirements
  • 3+ years working with Facebook Business Manager 
  • 3+ years running Facebook Ads for various businesses sectors
  • 2+ years with Google Analytics or other tracking tools

title: Communications Consultant (Level 3)
description:
Reference # :20-00153Title :Communications Consultant (Level 3)
Location :Ottawa, ON
Position Type :Contract
Experience Level :11 YearsStart Date :08/20/2020 
Description
 Location Ottawa 
 Language Bilingual essential
 Security Clearance  Enhanced Reliability security clearance required 

Our Federal Government client requires a Senior-levelCommunications Consultant to: 
  1. Plan, research, modify, assist, write and/or review memos, learning materials, manuals and other non-journalistic articles with conformance to established standards
  2. Develop and implement communication plans in geographically dispersed organizations going through an organizational growth, modernization or transformation
  3. Provide communications consultation advice to support initiatives and outreach
  4. Create communications support materials, etc. 
This will be a multi-year part-time contract engagement based in Ottawa with remote working flexibility. This position requires full English and French bilingual capability. 

The Senior Communications Consultant must have: 
  • Demonstrable experience as a Communications Consultant on at least 3 projects (each must be for a minimum duration of 8 months) - with at least 1 of these projects having been delivered to a federal department or agency
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Communications Consultant - with demonstrable experience of five of the following:
    • Creating communication plans
    • Establishing engagement strategies
    • Drafting preliminary outreach documents
    • Researching and preparing stakeholder lists
    • Leading engagement meetings and discussions
    • Preparing reports on engagement meetings
    • Recommending next steps in communication cycle
  • Full bilingual capability (English and French) with a minimum of 3 years of demonstrable experience in creating and editing large-scale bilingual documentation (100+ pages)
  • Degree or Diploma in a related field
  • Related Professional Certification(s) to the field of work. 

If you are interested in this exciting multi-year contract opportunity, plus you can meet the above-noted criteria, please apply today via the application button. One of our team will then get in touch to discuss your candidacy, and to provide more information on this opening. 

We look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you.

title: Jr. Software Product Analyst - Sales
description:
â€œPBS is the fastest growing â€œAll Inclusive Business Platformâ€ vendor in North America and weâ€™ve only just begun! â€œ 

The Opportunity:

We are changing the way people buy and service cars one dealership at a time. In business for over 30 years, PBS is the third largest DMS (Dealership Management System) provider to the North American retail automotive industry. Each month we welcome hundreds of new users to our software platform, and we need your help.

We are unique in the industry because we view our customers as business partners, technology innovators, and friends. Our software can run all aspects of an automotive dealership with sales, service, inventory management, and accounting modules.

And that's where you come into the picture. While specific roles are posted, PBS is always open to pivoting with quality people and adding to the team based on your skills and the needs of our customers. After you join the team, we will continue the process of moving you into new roles based on your talents, growth, and interests.

 

The Role:

As a Jr Software Product Analyst (Sales module) you will be working within the Development department and will be responsible for problem management, quality assurance testing, documenting and participating in the full development lifecycle of new and existing software features and services for the Sales module of our software.

 

Job Responsibilities:

  • Manage multiple tasks at once, maintaining exceptional quality
  • Collaborate with team members to plan and design new features
  • Investigate, replicate and escalate problems and bugs
  • Execute test procedures on bugs and new features
  • Review requirements analysis
  • Create new product documentation
  • Participate in team meetings and SCRUM
  • Minimum one Development-defined onsite engagement per year

 

â€‹Qualifications:

  • University degree; or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • 1 years QA and/or industry experience
  • Advanced Microsoft Office knowledge
  • Experience with Agile software development, MySQL and with bug tracking tools will be a definitive asset
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively in both a team atmosphere and independently
  • Exceptional attention to detail, outstanding prioritization and organizational skills, including strong project management skills
  • Strong problem-solving skills.  Willing to dive into difficult technical issues
  • Flexible, fast learner who thrives in a constantly changing work environment
  • Exceptional time management skills

 

What we offer:

  • Internal promotion and growth opportunities
  • An education department dedicated to helping you with professional and personal development
  • The opportunity to travel
  • Access to an onsite gym at some locations and/or corporate membership to Goodlife
  • Free parking
  • Staff events
  • Bonus for product certification up to $4,800 per year
  • Great referral bonus
  • Staff discounts with GM, Dell, and more

 

PBS Systems is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Disability Assistance (Requests on your application status will not receive replies.)

PBS Systems is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including any job seeker with a disability. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to recruitment@pbssystems.com. In your email please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting and the Job Title of the position for which you are applying.

JOIN A WINNING TEAM AT PBS Systems

At PBS Systems we thrive on inspiring pride among our team members and envy among our competitors.

Our culture rests on providing opportunity and challenge for our team members while encouraging healthy work-life balance.

To keep growing and building on our success we look for like-minded individuals to join our team.

Bring your passion, energy and experience.

We will give you the training, support and encouragement to succeed.

title: Entry Level Marketing and Sales Coordinator
description:
We are looking for entry-level Marketing and Sales Coordinator to help with the project for our client. The right candidate will help with marketing events and marketing promotions with clients, customer service, sales training, and sales strategy development!

 

We do offer in-house training to applicants with no sales and marketing experience.

 

We have a diverse team with well-rounded individuals. The environment and energy within the office are contagious. We have a team of hard-working and self-motivated individuals that are able to meet and exceed goals. We have a work hard play hard mentality and those who like challenges receive incentives such as trips, rewards, and special team outings!

 

If you:

*Wish to work in a fun and diverse environment

*Want the opportunity to learn and gain skills 

*Enjoy the ability to move up the ranks based on performance

*Would like the opportunity to travel

*Work well in teams and individually

*Have a competitive entrepreneurial spirit 

*Like to take on challenges and new tasks

*Would like to be fully trained 

 

Please apply with your resume attached. To be qualified for the position, you must be available full-time and be 18 years or older to pass a criminal background check. Thank you and good luck!

title: Junior Ad Operations Coordinator
description:
Company Description

We are on the hunt for a versatile, self-driven, Junior
Ad Operations Coordinator to join our team, to work on our diverse set of web monetization funnels, catering to premium clients and our own web properties.

For this role, you only need a general understanding of social platforms and search products such as Facebook and Google Ads. The training is done “on the job” as we’re acutely aware not a lot of people do what we do!

Job Description

  • Launching paid media campaigns on multiple ad networks following a clearly outlined procedure, which can include things such as ad copywriting and image creation and manipulation. The campaigns are all loaded via our internal media management platform.

  • Analyze data, craft insights, and make recommendations on a daily basis relating to the nature of the content, landing page templates and monetization performance

  • SEM / SEO keyword research to enhance paid traffic funnels

Qualifications

  • Paid digital media buying experience on at least one of the following platforms: Facebook/Instagram, Taboola, Outbrain, Google, Microsoft Ads or Gemini.

  • Fluent in English (spoken/written), comfortable with crafting ads (copy and images)

  • Desire to work in a very fast-paced environment and handle multiple initiatives at one time.

  • Strong analytical abilities and the ability to communicate findings

  • Excitement to learn new platforms and uncover opportunities in new media channels

  • Self-starter mentality with a drive to succeed

  • (preferred but not mandatory) Bachelor’s degree in Business or Marketing with a strong inclination for statistical analysis.

  • (preferred) Bilingual English and French, any European language such as Spanish and German is a major plus.



Additional Information

Psquared bring to the table:

  • Fast-growing list of premium clients and partners, 300% revenues growth in the last 2 years
  • competitive base salary and bonus structure, eligible for employee stock options 
  • Flexible work hours and location. The applicants can be located in Toronto or Montreal, happy to discuss work arrangement for applicants within North America.
  • Health & Dental Plan
  • Flexible vacation plan
  • Working on adding tons of stuff to this list!

The applicants can be located in Toronto or\xa0Montreal, happy to discuss work arrangement for applicants within North America.']

title: Assistant Marketing Manager, Campaigns (Toronto, ON, CA, L4W 5M3)
description:
Job ID: 209087 
Location Name:ON-FSC Toronto Off (0581)
Address:5560 Explorer Drive, 2nd Floor, Toronto, ONL4W 5M3, Canada (CA)
Job Type:Full Time
Position Type (Regular/Temporary):Regular
Job Function:Marketing
Is This Position Eligible for Remote? :  

 

At Sephora Canada, we’re passionate about finding and sharing beauty in the world. Our constant innovation, our ability to see and lead trends, and our focus on providing an outstanding customer experience make us the most-loved beauty community and top of mind for every Canadian. We find beauty in our communities, in our differences, our experiences, and in the spirit of our employees.

 

ABOUT THE ROLE:

As Assistant Manager, Campaigns, you will support the SEPHORA Canada Campaigns & Content team as we build brand equity, client engagement, and competitive advantage across our campaign activations. You will be responsible for the delivery of multiple client facing campaigns simultaneously as well as having planning, budgeting and hindsight responsibilities. 

 

You will play a role inspiring collaboration and driving executional excellence through a variety of cross-functional teams and cross-border counterparts. You will report directly to the Senior Manager, Campaigns.

 

WHAT YOU'LL DO:

  • Support Senior Manager across breakthrough local campaign activations to build awareness, brand love and drive sales, from inception through to execution and hind-sighting, driven by insights and long-term strategies.
  • Support execution of leveraged campaigns by partnering with US teams to track projects and drive strategic local amplification opportunity and alignment.
  • Review/QA campaign creative to ensure business objectives, accuracy, and language considerations are met.
  • Content development and briefing for Internal Communications, Store Communications, and Education related to campaign execution.
  • Responsible for management of calendars, trackers, and inputs documents; ensure accuracy and recency across activities and forecasts.
  • Support budget management, including planning, preparing purchase order requisitions, managing invoices, and monthly reconciliation.
  • Cultivate strong partnerships cross-functionally across numerous functions across Sephora, both within and outside of the Marketing department, and across multiple levels (including, but not limited to Creative, Events, Brand Marketing, Retail Marketing, Merchandising, Promotions, Store Communications, and the Retail Field Team).
  • Partnership with Project Management team, Translations, Creative and Store Communications
  • Actively participate and support Senior Manager in annual business and marketing planning process.

 

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:

  • Experience with campaign execution, in an omni-channel environment.
  • 2-5 years’ experience demonstrated campaign execution experience; project management, cross-functional team experience
  • You are collaborative, creative, and ready to build on ideas, and bring new ideas to the team.
  • You’re organized and have a knack for managing your time and prioritizing tasks while
  • maintaining quality and expectations.
  • You are energized by a fast-paced environment.   
  • You’re agile, a self-starter that takes initiative.
  • You’re technically savvy in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook. 
  • You have a data-mindset to help drive decisions and recommendations
  • Passion for the Beauty business
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business related degree or equivalent experience

 

WHY YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE:

  • You’ll be part of a unique culture and family of passionate and inspiring individuals.
  • You’ll work alongside the best talent in the industry – people you’ll be proud to work with.
  • You’ll have access to the global community of luxury group LVMH (Louis Vuitton Moët Hennessy) for endless career opportunities.
  • You’ll have the opportunity to be part of a community that drives meaningful social and environmental change and receive matching donations to support your charitable giving.
  • Benefits you can mix and match, depending on your needs.
  • Employee Assistance Program services for those times you need extra support.
  • Holidays, time off, summer hours and flexibility to support work-life balance.
  • And of course, there’s our incredible swag – free product gifts throughout the year and tons of discounts with our brand partners.

 

This position requires that the employee be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to commencing employment and that they agree to obtain any future required boosters or vaccinations as recommended by the government of Canada or the health authorities of the province in which you would be working and in accordance with Sephora Vaccination Policy. If you are not able to obtain a COVID-19 vaccine for a reason related to a protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation, you can request accommodation from Sephora.


COMPANY OVERVIEW:
SEPHORA has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s Paris. Sephora was acquired by luxury group Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton (LVMH) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, SEPHORA COLLECTION. Sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. Sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the Beauty Studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from Personal Beauty Advisors, and exclusive retail technology SKINCARE IQ, COLOR IQ, and FRAGRANCE IQ. Sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

title: Assistant Brand Manager
description:
Company Description

We manage the brands of – and run events for – some of North America’s largest companies. Our mission is to increase the exposure of our clients’ brand, to bring in quality long term customers and to help drive revenue, all whilst making sure that the person appreciates the experience with the brand. People want to listen to and be involved with Professionals!

Job Description

We seeking an Assistant to the Brand Team to support several brands, managers and categories in a fast-paced and exciting environment. This individual will work with key internal and external teams to facilitate product development and marketing. Ideal candidate will be an organized team player that can manage multiple tasks/projects simultaneously while maintaining the highest level of organization.

Salary range: $45000 - $55000 per year.

Job Description:

  • Act with integrity, trust, and respect for our employees, peers, and customers per our Mission, Declaration, and Statement of Purpose.

  • Educate others about our brand; positively promote the brand at all times.

  • Participate in several marketing communications and promotional programs and activities.

  • Work well with a team and comfortable speaking in front of groups and engaging with new people in person and digitally.

  • Answer all incoming calls and direct them to the appropriate person/department.

Qualifications

  • A graduate-level professional qualification relevant to marketing, business, communications, etc, is an asset.

  • Previous experience in relevant job roles.

  • Marketing experience in brand marketing or other sales related role preferred.

  • Experience working in a Marketing agency or global corporate environment - self-initiating with ability to work independently and as the member of a team is a plus.

  • Customer service-oriented - as per agency backgrounds working for their clients

title: Marketing Specialist (Assistant Brand Manager)
description:
Refer A Friend

Company Description


At McDonald's, we are committed to being the best, and that starts with finding the best people. We have built a team of extraordinary people from around the world. We are problem solvers, risk takers, innovators, and thought leaders that take our work seriously, but have fun doing it. We challenge ourselves to get smarter and sharper every day, we value personal and professional growth, and believe in rewarding and celebrating our successes.


Job Description


Our Values:

  • We place the customer experience at the core of all we do.
  • We are committed to our people.
  • We believe in the McDonald’s system.
  • We operate our business ethically.
  • We give back to our communities and our customers.
  • We grow our business profitably.

Summary:

How would you like to work for the #1 quick service restaurant operation in the world?

We currently have an opportunity for a Marketing Specialist, to join our team at the Toronto Corporate Office. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment filled with non-stop action, then this role is for you!

Job Description:

  • Assist the National Marketing Manager on Chicken, Beef and Rest Of Day Food categories; responsible for facilitating and influencing the cross-functional team project development process and managing the collaborative process to ensure initiatives are on strategy, approved by all stakeholders and within required timelines
  • Strategic support for advertising campaigns and retail promotions; supporting the development of communication briefs and cross-functional briefing presentations with creative thinking, and providing strategic feedback on advertising campaigns and retail promotions (merchandising, mass, digital, social, owned assets & media plans)
  • Responsible for internal review and approval of advertising campaigns and retail promotions, to ensure they adhere to brand standards & legal regulations
  • Liaison with cross-functional and external teams to lead the execution of marketing campaigns, retail promotions and product launches (Menu, Merchandising, Supply Chain, Operations, Legal and Quality Assurance, Advertising Agency)
  • Support the product innovation process including concept development, menu briefs, and consumer research & validation
  • Work with Consumer and Business Insights teams to understand category opportunities, consumer needs, and identify opportunities to drive sales and visits
  • Marketing lead for Deployment and Restaurant Execution of promotions
  • Responsible for developing communication for the field to ensure proper understanding of marketing promotions and flawless execution; includes developing content and presenting on Restaurant Operations Webcasts, developing content for internal website with promotional information, and utilizing internal communication tools to communicate to the field in a timely manner
  • War Room lead for marketing promotions; required to gather key information from each team on the success of the promotion and facilitate the War Room discussion; provide follow up action items and communication, and facilitate any post-promotion recap required to support future promotions
  • Management of Campaign administration: budget management, file management, ensuring campaign & project background information are saved & archived for easy reference

Core competencies:

The successful candidate must display, to some degree, the following core competencies:

  • Customer Focus: Strives to deliver high quality products and superior service that exceeds the expectations of our internal and external customers.
  • Communication: Demonstrates strong two-way communications skills. Conveys information and ideas in an open, articulate and timely manner. Considers cultural differences and others’ perspectives when communicating.
  • Change and Innovation: Identifies the changing needs of our customers, employees and systems and successfully leads innovation that improves the business.
  • Builds and leverages Talent: Builds the quality of McDonald’s employee base by seeking out the high performers, helping others develop and grow, rewarding high achievement, and supporting diversity of thought and perspective.
  • Plans and Acts Strategically: Develops a clear and compelling vision, strategy, or action plan that is aligned with the organization’s goals.
  • Teamwork: Works cooperatively as a member of a team and is committee to the overall team objectives rather than one’s own interest. Is open to other’s diverse ideas and leverages the team’s differences to achieve results.
  • Leading others: Positively influences others and collaborates in ways that create alignment and inspire others to take action and/or change perspective.

Qualifications


The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and qualifications:

  • 3-5 years’ of marketing experience in consumer retail or service marketing
  • Degree in Marketing or Business is preferred
  • Creative thinker that is customer-focused
  • Strong communication skills to act as a liaison, work effectively, and build relationships with key stakeholders
  • Takes initiative to work independently on day-to-day priorities and planning for future needs.
  • Must have good organizational skills, be detailed-oriented, and have the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritization for completion
  • Ability to think ahead and anticipate issues, creative problem solver, and critical thinker
  • Thrives in a fast paced environment
  • Advanced level skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

**This position is a Flex Hybrid Model, requiring 3 days in-office and 2 days remote.**


Additional Information


McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

Requsition ID: REF3117F

McDonald's Corporation and McDonald's USA, LLC (the "Company") are committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage or citizenship, disability, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances.

McDonald's and its franchisees are taking proactive steps in response to the COVID-19 outbreak to ensure the safety in our restaurants across all communities. Our values of quality, service, and cleanliness continue to guide us. We're following direction from the CDC, state, and local governments and adhering to our deep cleaning procedures in every restaurant, every day. We also fully support employees who stay home from work if they are feeling sick. Read more about the ways we are prioritizing health at https://news.mcdonalds.com/news-releases/news-release-details/prioritizing-health-safety-and-community-mcdonalds-shares.

If you have any questions, please first call the restaurant as this will help the restaurant comply with any social distancing guidelines or other compliance obligations. For corporate roles, please proceed to the online application, or if you already applied, contact supportteam@us.mcd.com</section>

title: Area Manager in Training - Ottawa Area
description:
Summary

The Area Manager in Training shall provide leadership, direction, and accountability for the Retail Store Team in a designated region. The Retail Area Manager in Training is a leader in driving result through effective sales team management, customer/guest engagement, coaching and mentoring using all available business KPI’s.

Responsible for managing multiple priorities, the supervision of a team of Store Managers, retail projects, execution of initiatives to enhance performance, execution, driving top line sales with a strong focus on profitability.

The Retail Area Manager in Training will provide sound leadership and coaching for all direct reports and will work closely with the Retail District Manager, Store Operations and all Head Office partners to ensure and support the growth and development of the region’s retail team through established goals and objectives which align with revenue, operations and customer service targets to enhance profitability.

The Area Manager in Training shall be responsible for the achievement of aggressive operations goals and targets, focused on high levels of customer satisfaction and overall store level performance.

Job Duties

  • Ensures the communication, understanding and belief in the company's goals and mission statement. Coaches all employees to work towards a common company objective.
  • Responsible for company monthly and weekly revenue and profit projections.
  • Oversees Store Managers to ensure that daily and weekly staff schedules are in direct relation to daily, weekly revenue.
  • Review monthly sales objectives and develop strategies to achieve targets
  • Gives prompt and proper direction to Store Managers and Direct reports
  • Provide leadership and support for all direct reports to ensure they excel in their roles to enhance employee engagement in order to drive results and achieve top performance.
  • Develop a positive collaborative working relationship with staff and partners to aid company performance
  • Adheres and enforces all company safety policies and procedures.
  • Attends to any emergencies as they arise at the store level and provide resolution or the appropriate level of communication.
  • Identify operational and merchandising deficiencies in all stores and provide solutions and guidance to all stores
  • Leads any training initiatives to achieve organizational goals and objectives.
  • Assumes responsibility for job and store profitability by finding areas of improvement and implementing initiatives.
  • Develop a positive working relationship with all levels of the organization to accomplish the company’s mission.
  • Adheres and enforces all company safety policies and procedures.
  • Attends Store and Head office meetings as required.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree (B. A. or B. S.) from four-year college or university; or five to seven years of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • 3-5 years in the retail Industry in a multi-unit role.
  • CannSell Certification and Clean police record check.
  • Cannabis Retail Store Manager license from AGCO an asset.
  • To perform the job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of word processing software, spreadsheet software, e-mail software and use of the Internet.
  • The candidate must be well spoken and possess the ability to speak clearly and confidently in all business settings. The ability to conduct and reside over meetings.
  • Excellent Business Math skills. The ability to read, understand and calculate math calculations such as discounts, interest rates, percentages etc. Ability to apply concepts of basic math and written skills.
  • The ability to delegate, set expectations and monitor progress of all direct reports.

Motivate, inspire, provide, and accept feedback to and from employees

Reports to:  Retail District Manager

title: Marketing Specialist (Assistant Brand Manager)
description:
Company Description

At McDonald's, we are committed to being the best, and that starts with finding the best people. We have built a team of extraordinary people from around the world. We are problem solvers, risk takers, innovators, and thought leaders that take our work seriously, but have fun doing it. We challenge ourselves to get smarter and sharper every day, we value personal and professional growth, and believe in rewarding and celebrating our successes.

Job Description

Our Values:

  • We place the customer experience at the core of all we do.
  • We are committed to our people.
  • We believe in the McDonald’s system.
  • We operate our business ethically.
  • We give back to our communities and our customers.
  • We grow our business profitably.

Summary:

How would you like to work for the #1 quick service restaurant operation in the world?  

We currently have an opportunity for a Marketing Specialist, to join our team at the Toronto Corporate Office.  If you thrive in a fast-paced environment filled with non-stop action, then this role is for you!

 

Job Description:

  • Assist the National Marketing Manager on Chicken, Beef and Rest Of Day Food categories; responsible for facilitating and influencing the cross-functional team project development process and managing the collaborative process to ensure initiatives are on strategy, approved by all stakeholders and within required timelines
  • Strategic support for advertising campaigns and retail promotions; supporting the development of communication briefs and cross-functional briefing presentations with creative thinking, and providing strategic feedback on advertising campaigns and retail promotions (merchandising, mass, digital, social, owned assets & media plans)
  • Responsible for internal review and approval of advertising campaigns and retail promotions, to ensure they adhere to brand standards & legal regulations
  • Liaison with cross-functional and external teams to lead the execution of marketing campaigns, retail promotions and product launches (Menu, Merchandising, Supply Chain, Operations, Legal and Quality Assurance, Advertising Agency)
  • Support the product innovation process including concept development, menu briefs, and consumer research & validation
  • Work with Consumer and Business Insights teams to understand category opportunities, consumer needs, and identify opportunities to drive sales and visits
  • Marketing lead for Deployment and Restaurant Execution of promotions
  • Responsible for developing communication for the field to ensure proper understanding of marketing promotions and flawless execution; includes developing content and presenting on Restaurant Operations Webcasts, developing content for internal website with promotional information, and utilizing internal communication tools to communicate to the field in a timely manner
  • War Room lead for marketing promotions; required to gather key information from each team on the success of the promotion and facilitate the War Room discussion; provide follow up action items and communication, and facilitate any post-promotion recap required to support future promotions
  • Management of Campaign administration: budget management, file management, ensuring campaign & project background information are saved & archived for easy reference

 

Core competencies:

The successful candidate must display, to some degree, the following core competencies:

  • Customer Focus: Strives to deliver high quality products and superior service that exceeds the expectations of our internal and external customers.
  • Communication: Demonstrates strong two-way communications skills.  Conveys information and ideas in an open, articulate and timely manner.  Considers cultural differences and others’ perspectives when communicating.
  • Change and Innovation: Identifies the changing needs of our customers, employees and systems and successfully leads innovation that improves the business.
  • Builds and leverages Talent: Builds the quality of McDonald’s employee base by seeking out the high performers, helping others develop and grow, rewarding high achievement, and supporting diversity of thought and perspective.
  • Plans and Acts Strategically: Develops a clear and compelling vision, strategy, or action plan that is aligned with the organization’s goals.
  • Teamwork: Works cooperatively as a member of a team and is committee to the overall team objectives rather than one’s own interest.  Is open to other’s diverse ideas and leverages the team’s differences to achieve results.
  • Leading others: Positively influences others and collaborates in ways that create alignment and inspire others to take action and/or change perspective.
Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and qualifications:

  • 3-5 years’ of marketing experience in consumer retail or service marketing
  • Degree in Marketing or Business is preferred
  • Creative thinker that is customer-focused
  • Strong communication skills to act as a liaison, work effectively, and build relationships with key stakeholders
  • Takes initiative to work independently on day-to-day priorities and planning for future needs.
  • Must have good organizational skills, be detailed-oriented, and have the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritization for completion
  • Ability to think ahead and anticipate issues, creative problem solver, and critical thinker
  • Thrives in a fast paced environment 
  • Advanced level skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

 

**This position is a Flex Hybrid Model, requiring 3 days in-office and 2 days remote.**



Additional Information

McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.
