title: Assistant Channel Manager – Hardware & Automotive
description:
At TTi, people come for the opportunity and stay for the culture!


Job Description Summary


Job Description:


As the Assistant Channel Manager for Hardware & Automotive your primary responsibility will be to define how we win through promotions and programs in the core end-user verticals Milwaukee targets (Hardware, ResCon, Automotive). This will be accomplished through detailed analysis of competitive promotional offerings and frequent communication with key customers, JSS EURs/KAMs and our sales team.


The successful candidate will use this information to develop programs and promotions from the end-user’s point-of-view that will allow us to dominate in these segments and lock out our competition. Areas of oversight will include JSS conversion programs, E-Rebates and Mail-in-Rebates, SBU-focused events and product line reviews. Channel Managers will report into relevant Program Managers to ensure programs are aligned with overall business strategy from start to finish.


Duties and Responsibilities:


• Competitive Analysis:


o Engage with JSS & Sales teams to gain access to and analyze competitive promo offerings relevant to your end-user verticals


o Develop & maintain a competitive promotional landscapes and trackers for these executions


o Summarize strengths & weaknesses and identify opportunities for Milwaukee to increase market share within your areas of oversight


• Promotions and Programs:


o Use competitive analysis & feedback from JSS/Sales & Program Managers to develop compelling Milwaukee promotions & programs for your end-user verticals


o Develop and maintain Milwaukee Promo Landscapes


o E-Rebates/MIRs/JSS Programs – Development/execution/maintenance/tracking


o Full Year Programs (e.g. Partnership Programs, Merchandizing RedZone/SWAS) – Development/execution/maintenance/tracking


• Events:


o Work with Product Team & JSS to develop vertical-focused event promotions (e.g. Marketing-funded distributor events and blitzes)


• Distributor Line Reviews - work with product team/sales managers to provide support and intel for locked-in pricing


Skills and Education


• Must be an excellent communicator


• Requires a bachelor’s degree or equivalent industry experience


• Minimum 3 years’ experience in sales and/or marketing


• Must be proficient in computer skills and Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint and Teams most importantly)


• Must possess effective business communication skills, broad business perspective and market savvy


• Valid driver’s license required


• Clean driver’s abstract


• Must be able to work in-person at TTi HQ (Markham)


• Some travel required


#LI-EZ1
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
We endeavor to make this site accessible to any and all users. If you need to contact us regarding technical accessibility of our website call 443-391-1542. This number is only for technical accessibility issues, not general employment or job posting inquiries.

title: Concepteur UX
description:
Quel sera votre impact?

Harris Healthcare, solutions santé est à la recherche de personnes brillantes, motivées et créatives pour jouer un rôle de premier plan dans la conception et la définition de la prochaine génération de logiciels de prestation de soins dans le domaine des technologies de I’ information de santé. Nous recherchons des personnes qui connaissent bien les systèmes cliniques etflux de travail, mais qui sont également prêtes à les réimaginer. Cette opportunité intéressera les concepteurs UX qui sont frustrés par les lacunes des solutions informatiques actuelles et qui souhaitent avoir la chance de participer à la création d'expériences utilisateur de nouvelle génération pour les logiciels de santé à partir de zéro.

Le concepteur UX travaillera avec une équipe d'autres concepteurs UX, de responsables de produits, de clients et d'autres parties prenantes pour concevoir, prototyper et évaluer des expériences utilisateur innovantes. Ce rôle est axé sur l'interaction avec le client et le travail tout au long du cycle de vie de l'idéation. Les sessions de travail virtuelles iront du brainstorming initial aux tests d'utilisabilité qualitatifs et quantitatifs. Il s'agit de développer un système complexe à partir de la base et non d'un poste de conception web.

Ce que nous recherchons:

  • Une solide expérience en conception UX
  • Expérience de l'utilisation des normes et techniques de conception UX telles que ISO 9241-11 ou User Experience Honeycomb
  • Expérience en animation d'ateliers UX avec les utilisateurs finaux et les parties prenantes, ainsi que des méthodologies de test d'utilisabilité telles que la méthode de la pensée à voix haute
  • Expérience et passion pour la création d'interfaces à partir de zéro
  • Connaissance approfondie des paradigmes actuels et émergents en matière d'UX, avec la capacité de penser de manière créative afin d'adopter de nouvelles approches
  • Connaissance des outils permettant de répondre à l'ensemble des besoins, commençant par des outils de prototypage, jusqu’à la mesure de l'efficacité de l'UX
  • Capacité d’extrapoler à partir d'ateliers approfondis sur des sujets spécifiques vers une orientation plus large de la conception du système afin de contribuer au cahier de conception
  • Excellentes compétences en communication
  • Bilingue; anglais-français

Ce qui vous distinguera:

  • Expérience de la conception d'applications dans le domaine des soins de santé
  • Expérience du développement Agile, y compris l'utilisation de Jira et Confluence
  • Expérience avec les principaux facteurs de forme, y compris l'ordinateur portable, la tablette et le téléphone intelligent
  • Créativité pour exécuter des ateliers entièrement à distance

Avantages:

  • Possibilité de travailler principalement à distance et conditions de travail flexibles
  • 3 semaines de vacances et 5 jours de congé personnel
  • Couverture complète des soins médicaux et dentaires dès le premier jour d'emploi
  • Divers avantages tels que la récompense liée au style de vie, journée de bénévolat et option d’achat d’actions pour employés
  • Plan d'évolution de carrière

À propos de nous

Notre mission est d'offrir de la flexibilité et de la valeur parmi les solutions logicielles de soins de santé, d'augmenter continuellement notre niveau de service et de livraison, et d'établir des relations à long terme et mutuellement bénéfiques avec nos clients. Nos relations de confiance avec nos clients sont fondées sur une approche de partenariat consultatif, qui soutient les efforts de nos clients sur le plan clinique, opérationnel et financier, pour conduire à leur succès à long terme.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
description:
What does Shinydocs do? We are a data-centric software company, on a mission to change the way organizations find, understand, and action their data to make better business decisions.Founded in 2014, Shinydocs searches, organizes, and understands unstructured data at scale, providing actionable security, compliance, and business operations insights. We’re partnering with some of the largest companies in the world to revolutionize how they handle information. We are leaders in our field and our people are some of the best and brightest in what they do. Why Shinydocs? We are excited that you are here and interested in learning more about us. Shinydocs is committed to provide a barrier-free and inclusive work environment where everyone belongs. We want our team to be able to do their best work, be their whole selves and experience their full potential. We are an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business and job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national or ethnic origin, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital or civil status, political affiliation, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the jurisdictions in which we operate.If you require support and/or accommodation during any phase of our hiring process, please do not hesitate to connect with Samantha Sheen-Manor our Talent Acquisition Business partner (ssheenmanor@shinydocs.com). We’ll work to learn more about your needs to provide you the best experience possible and know that all information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential. The future is bright and “shiny” at Shinydocs. We’re a dynamic and diverse team with experience, fueled by passion for the work we do and live by our values of Excellence, Adaptability and Teamwork. You’ll be surrounded by the best and brightest minds who truly value your contribution. They will be excited to collaborate with you and will be cheering you on every step of the way. Oh and you’ll be laughing often throughout the day, either with others, at each other, or at yourself :-)



+ Satisfying Work: We’re building new stuff that solves real-world problems for exciting organizations. Everyone here is self-directed, empowered and enabled to do their best work.


+ Remote First: We’re committed to a remote first work environment. We offer flexible hours and respect our team members schedules to enable them to find the work life harmony that they deserve to have in their lives.


+ Comprehensive Total Rewards & Wellness Package: We collaborate with our whole team to develop programs that meet their needs including offering fully paid group benefits from day one, Health Care and Wellness Spending Accounts, RRSP matching, a Safe Transportation subsidy, Phone and Internet subsidies, and a Worry-Free subsidy that supports those unexpected experiences and help you provide care for your animal companions too!


+ Professional Development, Growth & Purpose: Follow your passion and find purpose in your work. Experience learning opportunities through courses, shadowing, Shiny “U” Sessions & Show N’ Tells.


+ Culture & Communication: Weekly All Hands, Coffee with the CEO, and regular virtual socials and team building activities during core work hours which keeps you connected and respects your work life harmony.


+ Community Commitment: We support a variety of organizations on behalf of our team and we are proud (and active) corporate members of the WIT Network.



If you are curious to learn more and have some of these skills but maybe not all of them we still encourage you to apply as we would love to review your unique background and learn more about you! How will I make an impact? As a Product Marketing Manager reporting to the Senior Director of Products, you will develop effective marketing strategies and communication plans that will bring the value of a line of products to the market. This position will interface primarily with our technical product managers, but also the marketing, sales, development, and customer support teams.Within your first 30 days, you will familiarize yourself with our market and customers. You will gain a good understanding of our different product offerings and begin drafting market strategies for one of our products. Day in the Life: Market Validation - Understanding competitive advantage, conducting competitor analysis and market research.Collaborate - Work with our Sales & Marketing departments to develop product pricing strategies and structures. Customer Centric - Understanding key customer value propositions and creating messaging that communicates that value to target customer personas. Champion Shinydocs Culture - Lead by example; everyone on the Shinydocs team (including you!) contributes to and defines our company culture. Not sure if you have enough or the right experience for this job? Apply anyways. Only 1% of candidates will ever meet every single requirement on most job postings. It’s not a big deal if you don’t meet all our requirements. Diversity of our talent’s backgrounds, skills, experiences and education is what makes us stronger. If you are passionate about what you do, are a great colleague, interested in learning, and willing to work hard, we want to hear from you.


Powered by JazzHR

title: UI/ UX Designer
description:
Overview:

Who We Are:

Since 2007, Dealer-FX has been transforming how automotive retailers manage their service operations and how they interact with consumers. Through advanced data integrations and mobile technology, Dealer-FX streamlines processes and communication for automotive service departments while delivering convenience, transparency, and trust to consumers. Dealer-FX is a wholly owned subsidiary of Snap-on Incorporated (NYSE: SNA), which acquired Dealer-FX in 2021.

Dealer-FX has been serving automotive OEMs and dealerships for almost a decade. Dealer-FX is transforming how millions of consumers interact with automotive brands and their retailers. Our platform uses advanced data analysis and mobile applications to deliver convenience, transparency and trust to consumers, and increased efficiency, profitability, retention and brand loyalty to OEMs and dealers.

Responsibilities:

Weâ€™re looking for a UI/UX Design for Dealer-FX. This individual will work closely with the entire product team to move the software forward and collaborate with other designers, developers, and our marketing team. Weâ€™re looking for someone who is open-minded and can apply design thinking and human-centered design methodologies within their day-to-day work. The ideal candidate will actively contribute to user research, design specifications, user flows, prototyping, and visual interface design at a system and micro-level. Weâ€™re especially looking for someone who can instinctively weave iconography, typography, color, space, and texture together to simplify and improve how automotive dealership personnel experiences the next-generation Dealer-FX platform.

 

 A Day in the Life:

  • Work within a close-knit design team on various projects to better the end-to-end experience of our software and mobile apps
  • Adapt your skill sets across challenges within the product life cycleâ€”from identifying problems, research, ideation, and execution
  • Work within our agile team structure to provide quality assurance on our design outputs
  • Design flows and experiences that simplify and distill down complex actions into usable interfaces
  • Give and solicit feedback from the broader product team to continually improve quality

 

Qualifications:

What You'll Bring:

  • 1-3+ years of creative experience in product design
  • Graphic design/UX degree, diploma, or equivalent work experience
  • A design portfolio that illustrates a range of strategic thinking, visual design, and strong UX
  • Technical proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma
  • Knowledge and/or hands-on experience working in rapid product development and an agile environment
  • Strong understanding of core design principles related to typography, grid systems, design specifications, visual hierarchy, color systems, white space, etc.
  • A conceptual thinker who can develop and oversee a creative vision from concept to execution on multiple platforms including mobile, web, and B2B enterprise platforms
  • A keen eye for usability principles and creating great user experiences
  • Experience working on projects from discovery through to shipping/iteration
  • The knack to ask â€œwhy?â€â€”you believe in purpose-driven decisions that are strategically informed to drive meaningful solutions to user problems and opportunities
  • Support for continuous and iterative improvementâ€”you are comfortable with feedback cycles that are openly communicative and generous within one-on-one and large team settings

 

What's in it For You?  

  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Choice of basic or enhanced health benefit plans, dental and vision benefits
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Free underground parking
  • 3 weeksâ€™ paid vacation
  • 1 paid annual volunteer day  

 

No unsolicited agency referrals

Dealer-FX is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities.

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Job Summary:

 

       The primary objective of this role is to identify and develop strategic business relationships with potential clients as well as improve the organizationâ€™s market position and achieve financial growth and achieve the annual sales target.  Target market segments for this position are automotive EV/HEV powertrain, aerospace motors, and micro-mobility applications for thin gauge non-oriented electrical steels (NOES) and motor cores.

 

Responsibilities and Duties:

 

  • Coordinate stakeholders & integrate for cross/multi functional team work to breakthrough concerning points to expand business.
  • Oversee product sales from traditional applications (ie., industrial motors, generators, etc) to move into automotive and niche applications (ie., energy storage aerospace/defence)
  • Transforming future market growth and moving to high value stream and added value products, by applying advanced technical and industry knowledge of NOES materials and high efficiency motor applications including high frequency drives
  • Identify new markets and regions where significant growth can be achieved in automotive, micro-mobility and renewable energy applications
  • Lead organization into new markets and breaking new grounds to identify key niche applications and opening new markets for its ultra-thin gauge electrical steel products
  • Advise customers on benefits and tailoring solutions to become a key player in the automotive supply chain and becoming part of the E-mobility revolution
  • Develop new business opportunities and other prospects for potential new clients
  • Participate in pricing solutions

 

Quality Knowledge Requirements:

 

  • Experience with Safe Work Standards/Job Instructions able to Train/Audit
  • Experience with 200 Level Manuals as designated (calibration, doc control, material substitution)
  • Strong knowledge of motor and generator material (NOES) specifications, and processing capabilities, tolerances and needs.

 

Position Requirements:
 

  • Knowledge and hands on experience in structure-property relationship of metallic materials
  • Expertise in understanding mechanical behaviour of metallic materials corresponding to the changes in composition and microstructure
  • expertise understanding fracture mechanisms and the reasons for fracture and failure of metallic materials in service
  • Confidence in performing tensile, impact toughness, hardness, fracture toughness and fatigue testing of materials
  • Competence in using material characterization techniques, such as optical microscopy, electron microscopy (SEM), electronic back scattered diffraction (EBSD), x-ray diffraction (XRD), thermal analysis (TG/DSC/Dilatometer) and surface profilometer to perform microstructural and fractographic analysis
  • Knowledge and experience in the selection of motor core materials to achieve the performance expectations of unique designs
  • Application of high frequency motor drives, and the use of ultra-thin NOES materials
  • Advanced processing and bonding techniques for the production of motor cores for automotive, aerospace and micro-mobility applications
  • Experience and knowledge of non-oriented electrical steels, their production and characteristics.
  • Maintain extensive knowledge of current market conditions in automotive power train, micro-mobility and unique high frequency motor applications.
  • Basic computer programming and web design
  • Knowledge with matlab and nanotechnology
  • Strong technical background and skills; business, sales and marketing acumen, and the ability to sell highly value added motor product solutions.
  • Exceptional verbal and written  and interpersonal communication skills to create strong relationships with partners, clients and team members
  • Able to work well independently and in a team environment
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Understanding of business trends
  • Organizational skills
  • Must be able to travel 50% of the time

 

 If you would like to be considered, please apply by submitting your resume

For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Full time, benefits, vacation, RRSP and Pension offered!

title: Business Development Consultant
description:
Adaptability, grit, and heart are what make us stand out from the rest. When you join our Business Development Representative team, youâ€™ll gain more than just a job title and a paycheck. Youâ€™ll find yourself surrounded by like-minded team members who share a growth-oriented mindset and our vision for success. Within our forward-thinking and supportive environment, you have the ability to build character, become a leader, and develop professional advancement. With the support of fellow Business Development Consultant team members and confidence in yourself, we genuinely believe that anything is possible. 

Witness our Business Development team members strategizing together, sharing fresh ideas in open-forum brainstorming sessions, and creating knockout solutions one after another to drive sales margins. If youâ€™re adaptable, imaginative, and embrace challenges with open arms, youâ€™ll be right at home with our Business Development Team.

 

Business Development Consultant Responsibilities: 

  • Seek new business opportunities by establishing and expanding relationships with current and prospective decision-makers
  • Stay up-to-date with new products, services, pricing, and sales promotions by attending daily meetings and training courses
  • Contact potential clients through lead generation and residential visits
  • Study each product offered by our top tier clients and be able to persuasively educate potential consumers of how each works and its specifications; understand how to upsell and recommend complementary merchandise
  • Customize product solutions to increase customer satisfaction and improve profit margins
  • Present sales pitches, product reports, and other valuable data to potential consumers in a way that promotes our clients brand and mission and helps the audience identify a need for the product or service
  • Participate in the development of business plans and be prepared to review and discuss ideas with senior leadership

 

Business Development Consultant Requirements: 

  • 1-2 years of experience as a Business Development Representative, Sales, Account Manager or similar role
  • Driven self-motivated individual with a hunter mentality who is capable of working independently to exceed sales objectives
  • Experience developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas
  • Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Attention to detail in all task completions

 

As a Business Development Consultant, youâ€™ll enjoy: 

  • Personalized training, mentorship, & career development program
  • Exciting tropical retreats (Post COVID-19) and company-sponsored vacations
  • Uncapped commission incentives and bonuses
  • Intense client exposure for some of the best names in their industry
  • Holidays off!

title: Business Development Manager
description:
Business Development Manager Job Description

Job Overview

ARC Business Solutions Inc. is a leading Technology company in North America. Our goal is to create partnerships with our clients by building strong long-term relationships.  As a Business Development Manager for the Managed Services division, you will be part of an energetic team of professionals who are committed to achieving our ambitious customer acquisition and revenue growth objectives. If you are someone who enjoys working with people, is friendly and outgoing and committed to making a difference, then this job could be the perfect fit for you.

Responsibilities for Business Development Manager

  • Ability to build strong Business Relationships with new and existing clients
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills
  • Strong listening and presentation skills
  • Develop creative marketing plans and execute on these plans
  • Research accounts, identify key players and generate interest
  • Understand customer business needs and translate them to technology solutions
  • Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails
  • Effectively work in a Team Environment leveraging Teams members strengths
  • Work closely with Technical Operations Manager to translate Business drivers into Technology solutions
  • Ability to develop Strategic roadmaps
    • Translating business impacts into long-term plans
    • Priortizing needs and improvements
    • Budgeting and Planning
    • Communicating the business value of the process
  • Participate in lead generation strategies, such as cold calling, to identify business prospects create and maintain a list of current and potential customers
  • Maintain a log of which customers have been contacted, the outcome of each interaction and issues that need to be flagged for follow up
  • Proactively follow up with customers to get their feedback, guarantee their satisfaction and develop ideas for pitch modification to advertise services more successfully
  • Proven sales experience
  • Track record of over-achieving quota

Qualifications

  • 5 years of experience in Business Development
  • Experience with Managed IT services
  • Possess excellent customer service skills
  • Must be knowledgeable on services
  • Excellent oral communication skills
  • Willingness to work varied hours that change weekly
  • Self-motivated and able to manage time effectively
  • Familiarity with negotiation, upselling and other sales tactics
  • Oversight of a Team Management

title: Cyber Insurance Marketing Manager
description:
"At Cowbell, our mission is to protect small to medium-sized enterprises by making cyber insurance accessible to all. Join our fast-growing team of diverse and passionate individuals on this mission to reinvent how businesses manage cyber risk and buy cyber insurance.

Cowbell is a fast-growing, next-generation cyber insurance provider, built on cutting-edge technology by a team of seasoned professionals united in their mission to achieve our ambitious goals. We believe in a people-first culture and know that great work isnt done without a phenomenal team, so we make sure to reflect that in our core values, benefits & wellness program. 

In support of increasing demand, we are actively looking for ambitious people, who are not afraid of hard-work, ambiguity and a dash of chaos, to join our team and be part of a growing institution where they can hone their skills and develop new ones in a fun, challenging and dynamic environment.

If that sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Cowbell Cyber is hiring an CyberInsurance Marketing Manager  to join our Marketing Department team. 

The Insurance Marketing Manager should have a strong background in commercial lines, preferably cyber insurance because this role is tasked with supporting and managing the relationship with our top broker partners with marketing support such as content writing and co-branded marketing materials, CE course instruction, and ongoing cyber insurance product training.

What you will do:

  • Produce and Develop Cyber insurance focused co-branded content:broker marketing kits, case studies, etc.
  • Lead CE Courses and Webinars for Cowbells partner agencies 
  • Be the Cowbell Champion at Industry Conferences with the sales team and drive market awareness
  • Present at client partner office visits representing the marketing team
  • Cross-collaborate with internal departments: sales, underwriting, claims, and marketing teams
  • Manage the ongoing Cowbell Cyber broker relationship at the marketing level
  • Have ability to engage with senior level stakeholders
  • Providing data analytics, research, and pushing forward marketing initiatives in the market for brokers and agents
  • Provide ongoing training support for broker agencies
  • Be passionate about cyber insurance or insurance in general
  • Build broker presentation decks
  • Marketing Administrative Duties where needed

What Cowbell needs from you:

  • 5 years Insurance Experience Required; Cyber Insurance preferred
  • Bachelors Degree preferred
  • Advanced Technical writing experience
  • Advanced skills in Powerpoint, Google Slides, & Canva
  • Strong people management skills 
  • Must present well both verbally and in writing
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment, thats constantly changing
  • Should be a self-starter and strategic thinker
  • Excellent Project Management Skills 
  • Possess initiative, creativity, and thinks outside of the box
  • High energy level with a strong service oriented attitude
  • Great time management skills and be highly organized

What Cowbell brings to the table:

  • We are certified as a Great Place to Work. 
  • Nationwide medical, dental and vision coverage plus life insurance, long term disability and flexible spending accounts.
  • 401K matching. 
  • Employee equity plan for all and wealth enablement plan for select customer facing roles.
  • Comprehensive wellness program including unlimited PTO, monthly wellness day off, subscription to meditation app, lunch and learns, book club, weekly lunch stipends, happy hours and much more.
  • Professional development and the opportunity to learn the ins and outs of cyber insurance, cyber security as well as continuing to build your professional skills in a team environment.

title: Marketing Manager, Nurture Programs
description:
*Locations: Toronto and Ottawa*


The team:

As a key member of our Global Demand Generation Team, you are driven, enthusiastic, and innovative in your approach to leveraging content and automation to generate and nurture leads. In this role you are responsible for developing and implementing the Genetec marketing nurture strategy to progress the sales funnel and uncover new opportunities faster.

Reporting to the Sr Manager of Demand Generation, you work cross-functionally with like-minded Campaign, Product and Industry marketers exposing you to all aspects of B2B technology marketing. You will focus on building the global nurture framework to accelerate pipeline velocity and will also support the development, execution and measurement of integrated marketing campaigns that embrace the entire buyer journey.

You have a strategic mindset and the ability to successfully build, manage, and scale marketing nurture programs for products or industries through implementation of segmented nurture streams and transitions based on buyer's journey and behaviour.

What your day will look like:

  • Develop nurture programs which include segmentation and strategic marketing tactics to support a buyer’s journey across different stages in the sales funnel
  • Plan, execute, and optimize integrated multi-channel demand generation programs with a demonstrable impact on revenue (including digital, webinars, virtual and in-person events, ABM, nurtures, email marketing and paid ads)
  • Map and document nurture strategy, automation processes, programs and procedures
  • Measure and monitor sales funnel activity, making recommendations to address gaps including working closely with the SDR teams on targeted campaigns and effective follow-up
  • Collaborate effectively with key stakeholders across the sales team and global marketing (including regional, digital, content and product marketing) teams to drive end-to-end program results
  • Evaluate, measure, and report on all marketing campaign effectiveness and ROI (Reverse water fall journey)

About you:

  • 5+ years experience in high growth, entrepreneurial B2B environments (preferably technology sector)
  • Bachelor’s Degree required; Marketing, or related field
  • Experience building marketing nurture frameworks and content mapping based on buyer journey to support sales development practice
  • Experience with A/B and multivariate testing to continually optimize impact of campaign efforts
  • Expert knowledge of demand generation mix including email marketing, direct mail, social media, online marketing, channel marketing, webinars, tradeshows and field events
  • Master project manager with superb attention to detail, strong communication and analytics skills
  • Knowledge of marketing automation platforms and CRM (e.g. Marketo and Microsoft Dynamics)
  • Language proficiency: Excellence in spoken and written English. French or other language considered a tremendous asset

Great if you have:

  • Experience building out a unified campaign development process and lead outreach methodology
  • Built, tested and optimized marketing nurture programs that improved customer experience and accelerated pipeline
  • Worked with project management and digital asset management tools (such as Wrike and Widen)
  • Experience working in matrix organizations

Let's talk perks!

  • Attractive compensation package
  • Training Tuition Reimbursement Program
  • Subsidized meals in our amazing Bistro (Les Cordons Bleus)/Virtual cooking classes
  • Work-life balance with a flexible working schedule
  • Free, unlimited coffee
  • Private, free parking for all employees
  • Onsite fitness facility with personal trainer/Virtual exercise classes

Would you like to know what it looks like to work at Genetec? Click on the following link to find out for yourself! Genetec Culture

Thank you for your application, but please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted. Head-hunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumés/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers.

title: Business Development Professional (Remote)
description:
Dematic is a leading supplier of integrated automated technology, software and services to optimize the supply chain. Dematic employs over 6,000 skilled logistics professionals to serve its customers globally, with engineering centers and manufacturing facilities located around the world. Dematic is one brand under the KION Group of companies and has implemented more than 6,000 integrated systems for a customer base that includes small, medium and large companies doing business in a variety of market sectors.

The Business Development Professional will assist the sales team in finding “unseen” customers within the installed base and at targeted accounts, gaining access to key decisionmakers', and securing face-to-face meetings for the assigned account manager. This role will be instrumental in lead generation by identifying, qualifying, and contacting new prospects. The ideal candidate will have business development skills, and a “hunter” mentality. They should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.

***This role offers the flexibility to work on a remote model with the understanding that on-site meetings may take place on occasion at our headquarters.

What we offer:

Career Development

We are here to support you for the entirety of your Dematic career. From a fast start of learning Dematic’s history and foundational training to succeed in your role to leadership development programs, technical training and certifications, and Career Navigator to identify challenging new opportunities, our goal is to help you grow beyond your borders.

Competitive Compensation and Benefits

Our attractive and market competitive total rewards packages are designed to reward high performance and to assist in managing your personal and family needs. Dematic offers robust packages based on employment status and national requirements.

Pay Transparency

Dematic is committed to pay transparency. As such, Dematic will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.

However, Dematic will still maintain confidentiality of your pay information. Employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by Dematic, or (c) consistent with Dematic’s legal duty to furnish information.

Global Opportunities

As a global company, our employees are exposed to different ideas and perspectives from around the world. We offer international assignments for qualified employees and wherever possible, we offer flexible working hours and modern workspace design.

Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/

Tasks and Qualifications:

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Proactive Outbound Lead Generation: Identify unseen opportunities in new, competitive, and existing accounts and facilitate interactions with key prospects to drive organic growth.

  • Develop Target Account Growth and Penetration Strategies: Work with the sales team to grow business in targeted accounts via data analysis, campaigns and direct interaction with key decision makers.

  • Optimize Inbound Lead Quality: Increase velocity of lead intake and qualification. Process incoming prospects from Marketing to create a robust pipeline of Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLS). Determine which leads need to be nurtured and which are “hot,” so the sales team receives real business opportunities.

  • Nurture Relationships with Key Decision Makers: Identify and follow key decision makers at target companies, nurture relationships, and create opportunities for the sales team to present solutions. Provide the information and answers prospects need to build trust, increase brand awareness, and maintain a connection until they are ready to make a purchase.

  • Prioritized Pipeline Growth: Work with Market Development Directors (MDDs) to develop a list of top accounts in each vertical. Categorize by Existing, Engaged and Develop. Proactively research and nurture the Engaged and Develop accounts. Identify opportunities for quick wins.

  • Act as conduit for Voice of Internal Customer (VOIC) from Sales to Marketing. Communicate content needs and drip campaign ideas to facilitate lead generation and marketing automation.

  • Surface and alleviate pain points to help Sales be more effective.

  • Contribute to vertical market dashboards and Quick Market Intelligence (QMI) calls.

  • Research target accounts’ business issues and goals to offer appropriate business solutions.

  • Provide actionable data and intelligence to help the sales team drive outcomes.

  • Proactively collect competitive intelligence insights about customer priorities and future ambitions and share with internal customers.

  • Identify key industry events that would result in lead generation.

  • Define and execute territory development plans in conjunction with assigned Account Manager(s)

  • Proactively update Salesforce with new account information, competitive insights, and key contacts at target accounts.

Qualifications:

  • Business or Marketing degree with technical understanding or engineering background with strong sales and business development skills.

  • 6+ years of successful B2B sales experience, preferably in industrial automation, material handling, logistics, e-commerce, supply chain, grocery, food & beverage or general merchandise.

  • Working knowledge of Salesforce.com

  • “Hunter” sales mindset

  • Excellent verbal and written communications, and presentation skills.

  • A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must

  • Ability to travel up to ~20%.

#LI-SM1

Dematic is committed to pay transparency. As such, Dematic will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.

However, Dematic will still maintain confidentiality of your pay information. Employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by Dematic, or (c) consistent with Dematic’s legal duty to furnish information.

Global Opportunities

As a global company, our employees are exposed to different ideas and perspectives from around the world. We offer international assignments for qualified employees and wherever possible, we offer flexible working hours and modern workspace design.

Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/

Tasks and Qualifications:

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Proactive Outbound Lead Generation: Identify unseen opportunities in new, competitive, and existing accounts and facilitate interactions with key prospects to drive organic growth.

  • Develop Target Account Growth and Penetration Strategies: Work with the sales team to grow business in targeted accounts via data analysis, campaigns and direct interaction with key decision makers.

  • Optimize Inbound Lead Quality: Increase velocity of lead intake and qualification. Process incoming prospects from Marketing to create a robust pipeline of Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLS). Determine which leads need to be nurtured and which are “hot,” so the sales team receives real business opportunities.

  • Nurture Relationships with Key Decision Makers: Identify and follow key decision makers at target companies, nurture relationships, and create opportunities for the sales team to present solutions. Provide the information and answers prospects need to build trust, increase brand awareness, and maintain a connection until they are ready to make a purchase.

  • Prioritized Pipeline Growth: Work with Market Development Directors (MDDs) to develop a list of top accounts in each vertical. Categorize by Existing, Engaged and Develop. Proactively research and nurture the Engaged and Develop accounts. Identify opportunities for quick wins.

  • Act as conduit for Voice of Internal Customer (VOIC) from Sales to Marketing. Communicate content needs and drip campaign ideas to facilitate lead generation and marketing automation.

  • Surface and alleviate pain points to help Sales be more effective.

  • Contribute to vertical market dashboards and Quick Market Intelligence (QMI) calls.

  • Research target accounts’ business issues and goals to offer appropriate business solutions.

  • Provide actionable data and intelligence to help the sales team drive outcomes.

  • Proactively collect competitive intelligence insights about customer priorities and future ambitions and share with internal customers.

  • Identify key industry events that would result in lead generation.

  • Define and execute territory development plans in conjunction with assigned Account Manager(s)

  • Proactively update Salesforce with new account information, competitive insights, and key contacts at target accounts.

Qualifications:

  • Business or Marketing degree with technical understanding or engineering background with strong sales and business development skills.

  • 6+ years of successful B2B sales experience, preferably in industrial automation, material handling, logistics, e-commerce, supply chain, grocery, food & beverage or general merchandise.

  • Working knowledge of Salesforce.com

  • “Hunter” sales mindset

  • Excellent verbal and written communications, and presentation skills.

  • A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must

  • Ability to travel up to ~20%.

#LI-SM1

title: Senior Solutions Marketing Manager (Remote)
description:
We’re Ada, a brand interaction platform that empowers brands to live up to their promises and have more—and more valuable—interactions with the people who love them. Our AI-powered platform has automated over 3.5 billion brand interactions for the world’s fastest growing enterprises, including Zoom, Facebook, and Shopify. In May 2021, we raised Series C funding of $130M by Spark Capital (early investors of Twitter, Slack, Snapchat), and officially became a global unicorn with a $1.2B valuation! 

The passion of our people and dedication to their craft continues to drive our dramatic global growth. 

Our work is rooted in authenticity, courage, empathy, and simplicity. We use these values to create a culture that encourages groundbreaking results, career progression, and community investment. You can learn more about the founding of our company here.  

We are inspired every day by the opportunity to pioneer a new industry, and welcome those who want to join us.

Reporting to the Director of Partnerships Marketing, we are looking for a results-driven and collaborative Sr. Solutions Marketing Manager (Partnerships) to help develop and execute marketing strategies and product messaging focused on our partners. This role will be responsible for articulating “better together” stories, developing partner enablement content, and customer facing co-messaged assets to enable partners to sell Ada and accelerate partner-sourced opportunity growth. This role will also be responsible for managing Ada’s listings on our partners’ app stores and marketplaces, as well as, working with partners on their Ada App Directory listing(s). The ideal candidate will have experience working with and presenting to partners. 

This role will work closely with Ada’s product marketing, partnerships, business development, sales and marketing teams.

About You

  • You have 5-7 years of experience in B2B SaaS, with a preference for product marketing and working with partners.
  • You are tech savvy with a solid foundational understanding of CX technology, and the ability to learn and enable others on the Ada Platform.
  • You have experience marketing to technical partners.
  • You are a strong writer who can tell stories and enable partners on the value of Ada products and as a partner.
  • You have a keen ability to develop strong relationships with internal stakeholders and partners.
  • You are creative, proactive, and agile.
  • You are a strong communicator and team leader.

Outcomes

  • Get to know our products inside and out to deeply understand how Ada uniquely provides value to the market. 
  • Understand the landscape, industry, pain points, use cases, and ongoing differentiation for target audiences.
  • Learn the competitive landscape and collaborate with Product Marketing to create assets for partners.
  • Lead overall partner messaging and positioning, and management of product launches with partners.
  • Become an expert on our buyer personas and consult our product team with a data-backed voice of the partner to fuel our growth.
  • Manage the creation of content including enablement assets for partners and co-branded content for customers.
  • Own Ada’s app store and marketplace listings and assist partners with listing on the Ada App Directory.
  • Support the development of marketing campaigns, event messaging, and resources that drive partner-sourced pipeline.
  • Work with Product Marketing on market and trends analysis, pricing strategy, and competitive intelligence for the purpose of partner enablement.
#LI-remote
#LI-SC1

Benefits
• Competitive salary and generous stock option plan
• Unlimited vacation
• Wellness account
• Extended health coverage
• Dental/optical/travel insurance
• Life insurance
• Employee and family assistance plan

Perks
• Flexible work schedule
• Digital first, fully remote with WFH budget
• In-house social worker
• Paid parental leave for Canadian and U.S. residents
• Development opportunities

About Us
Ada is a rapidly growing digital first company in a thriving AI ecosystem. We optimize our communication, collaboration, and work ethic for the digital world instead of in-person. We are building the workplace of the future to build the customer experience of the future. With flexible working hours, together we'll determine a schedule that fits your style and the requirements of your role. 

We are backed by world-class investors, including Spark, Accel, FirstMark, Bessemer Venture Partners, and Version One. We provide our employees with competitive compensation, great health benefits, and ownership in our company.  

Ada is an equal opportunity employer. In fact, diversity is what drives our success—it’s at the core of how we hire, communicate, and work. Like our platform, we are inclusive to all, and combine our diverse backgrounds, skill sets and thinking to build the best experiences for our clients and their customers.

Ada Privacy Policy

title: UX Researcher
description:
About CarbonCure Technologies

CarbonCure Technologies is an award-winning clean technology company leading a global mission to reduce the carbon footprint of concrete – the world’s most used building material. Our vision is to drive an annual reduction of 500 megatonnes of carbon dioxide(CO2) emissions; the equivalent of removing 100 million cars from the road. Our technology has been installed in over 400 concreteplants in North America, Asia, and Europe. CarbonCure is proud to be named the Cleantech Group Global 100’s Top North American Company in 2020, and the winner of the global NRG COSIA Carbon XPRIZE. We are backed by Breakthrough Energy Ventures, the Amazon Climate Pledge Fund, and Mitsubishi.

 

Our Culture

Our team is made up of energetic, entrepreneurial individuals who are passionate about driving meaningful solutions to combat climate change. Besides being dedicated to our mission, we believe in work-life balance and active involvement in our local community. We value integrity and accountability; and our core values include high performance, collaboration, straight-talk, and continued innovation. We don’t take ourselves too seriously, but we are here to change the world.

 

Purpose Driven Position

CarbonCure is on a mission to revolutionize the concrete industry. CarbonCure is looking for a UX Researcher to assist our UX/UI, and digital teams. Joining the UX/UI team, you will collaborate across multiple departments to evaluate current and upcoming user research needs that help to improve product definition and drive business goals. You will work closely with the product team to identify research objectives, and present design research findings to the larger team in a clear and organized fashion. You will be expected to translate initial concepts and findings into wireframes and UI prototypes, so a background in UI design is an asset. The CarbonCure team is small, tight-knit and supportive, with emphasis on trust and independence. This is a customer centric role, working to translate the needs of the customer into online business opportunities.


About you

You are known as a dynamic leader, and you are looking to make an impact. You are curious about the clean tech sector and how CarbonCure is helping to reduce the carbon footprint of the ready mix concrete industry around the world. Leading the introduction of our software solutions to the concrete industry appeals to you. Inspiring leadership, risk-taking, and dogged determination are your hallmarks. You are solutions oriented with a passion for user centric design and research.


What you'll be doing


  • Deliver insights to help inform and execute on major initiatives by conducting generative and evaluative research
  • Define and conduct mixed methods research across multiple projects while building strong relationships with internal users and our customers
  • Create UI concepts from ideas to engage users and collect feedback
  • Communicate insights and recommendations in a consumable, engaging way using artifacts such as reports, journey maps persona, and other formats as appropriate
  • Help educate and advocate for the best research practices on behalf of the digital team


What you'll need to succeed

  • A passion for sustainability and addressing climate change
  • Degree in Digital Design, UXR, Cognitive Science or equivalent experience 
  • A strong portfolio of work related to UXR and UX/UI
  • 1-2 years' experience working as a UX Researcher
  • Direct experience building and leading user research and testing plans of tech products
  • Experience with a range of testing methodologies, both quantitative, such as statistical analysis and A/B testing, and qualitative research
  • Experience effectively collaborating with multidisciplinary teams with an emphasis on clear communication and straight talk  to advocate for user-centered experiences
  • Strong storytelling and problem solving skills with a passion for finding effective ways to advocate for our users


Nice to haves

  • Experience with design software, specifically within  Adobe CC and Miro (Figma is a bonus)
  • Experience in information design & working with chart design.
  • Understanding of digital marketing & customer retention strategies
  • Understanding of visual communication principles such as typography, color and form


Work Environment 

  • Full-time position will be remote (main office located in Dartmouth, NS)
  • Work with a high-functioning team dedicated to our customers and producing high quality output
  • Hours are flexible, but a minimum of eight (8) hours per day Monday to Friday is required, with the possibility of additional time based on project and customer demand
  • Fail fast mentality typical with start-up companies
  • Participate in on-going discussions and contribute ideas that speak to project objectives like design, user experience, development, testing solutions, and tools


Why work here?

  • Actively participate in a tangible cleantech solution in the fight against climate change
  • Join a small team where your contributions are critical to everyone’s success
  • Compensation based on experience
  • Work laptop of your choosing
  • Work in a diverse and inclusive environment
  • Remote work with flexible hours


We are changing the world. We need you, so contact us.


Closing Statement

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest. Please note only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you feel passionate about this opportunity and believe that you have the skills to excel in this role, apply! Or if this sounds like someone you know, please share this posting.

 

We want you to know that you can be a great candidate even if you don't fit everything we've described above. You can also have important skills we haven't thought of. If that's you, don't hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself. We are committed to fostering diversity in our organization and building an equitable and inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and experiences. We're taking steps to meet that commitment. We especially encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, including women, people of color, LGBTQ people, veterans, and people with disabilities.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: UX Engineer (Remote Friendly)
description:
At Vendasta, we believe in helping great local businesses survive and thrive in a world that’s more competitive than ever—and we’re growing our team! This is an opportunity to join one of the fastest growing tech companies in Canada and make a direct impact on local economies worldwide. In a world where local businesses all over the globe have had their livelihoods turned upside down, Vendasta continues to help them embrace digital solutions and flourish. 


Vendasta is a certified Great Place to Work and Best Workplace™ for Today’s Youth and Women. Keep reading if you’d like to join us on our mission to support small businesses all over the world.


About the Job

We are building the leading platform for channel partners to provide digital solutions to local businesses. We have ambitious goals over the next couple of years and we are building one of the best design teams in Canada to do so. One big goal over this next year is to unify our platform experience. We are looking to hire a UX Engineer to help make this a reality. If you like diving deep, working in the details, using design systems and making delightful user experiences then you are exactly who we are looking for.


What is a UX Engineer? To put it simply, a UX engineer is a designer who can code, or a developer who can design.


The position is remote-friendly (anywhere in Canada), with the option to work from our office in Saskatoon. Apply and have a virtual coffee with our UX Lead to learn more.


The impact you’ll have

  • Work across teams or even cross-divisionally to implement UI on design-heavy projects
  • Help break down complex user problems into simple and easy to use prototypes
  • Be involved in designing and implementing features from ideation to delivery to adoption
  • To ensure a consistent and cohesive experience for our users by leveraging our design framework
  • Pair and mentor other developers looking to build their front end skills
  • Identify and prioritize design debt and contribute to our design organization goals


The value you’ll bring 

  • 5+ years product design experience, ideally in cross-functional teams
  • 5+ years of front end software development experience (HTML, CSS, and Javascript)
  • Excellent, highly creative communication and critical thinking skills
  • Portfolio showing deep product understanding and craftsmanship, both UI and UX
  • Proficiency with Figma or Adobe XD
  • Solid understanding of cross-platform design systems and technical frameworks
  • Motivated by feedback, but able to take criticism
  • Excellent collaboration skills across disciplines

Bonus Points For

  • Experience with Angular and Typescript
  • Experience with Git and Github
  • Experience with Agile software development practices at SaaS companies
  • Experience building and maintaining a design framework


About Vendasta

So what do we actually do? We create an entire platform full of digital products & solutions that help small to medium sized businesses (SMBs) have a stronger presence online through digital advertising, online listings, reputation management, website creation, social media marketing … and much more! Our platform is used exclusively by channel partners, who sell products and services to SMBs, allowing them to leverage us to scale and grow their business. We’re trusted by 60,000+ channel partners, serving over 5.5 million small to medium businesses worldwide! 


Perks

  • Benefits  - health, dental, life, and disability insurance, an employee assistance program (EAP)*, and $500 annual Health Spending Account. Premiums for health & dental insurance will be covered by Vendasta!
  • Vacation - Minimum 3 weeks paid vacation per year; uncapped sick time policy.
  • Employee Options Program  - get in on Vendasta’s growth and success!
  • Sweet Eats - On site cafeteria with beverages & snacks all day and free catered lunch every Friday
  • Training & Career Development - Education reimbursement program, professional development plans, leadership workshops, mentorship program, and so much more! 
  • Culture - comprised of our core values: Drive, Innovation, Respect, and Agility
  • Social Events -  Ideas on Tap, ski trips, virtual talent shows, yoga classes, and more! 
  • Giving Back -  endless opportunities to take part in programs and initiatives that give back to the community we work in, including paid volunteer time.
Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Business Development Manager (Remote)
description:
Firmex is a global software-as-a-service provider with corporate headquarters in Toronto, Canada. The company’s Firmex VDR service is the world’s most trusted virtual data room, having been used by over 140,000 companies worldwide to share confidential documents for due diligence, litigation and compliance.  

Firmex is currently operating 100% remotely during the pandemic. Once it is safe to do so, you will have the flexibility to work in the office or continue to work from home...or a mix of both! 

As the Business Development (BD) Manager, you will develop and grow the Business Development Representative (BDR) team and help them progress in their sales careers. You will also serve as the go-to expert in the sales organization for the best outbound pipeline generation practices. The BD Manager will report directly to our Vice President of Sales and will build and manage a team of Business Development Representatives.

As our Business Development Manager, you will:

  • Your priority will be to coach, empower, and manage your team, providing guidance on all aspects of the sales process and best practices, building pipeline and driving qualified opportunities for the sales organization. 
  • As the BD Manager, you will help all members of the team strategize the best way to target accounts and develop new opportunities for our sales teams. 
  • Coordinating hiring and the development of the team structure.
  • You will work with the marketing and product teams to provide the BDR’s with continuous learning to help them overachieve their quota and identify and make recommendations for improvement on outreach methods.
  • You will have an intimate knowledge of challenges BDRs commonly face on a daily basis and best practices as to how to overcome those challenges. 
  • Identify and make recommendations to help improve productivity, efficiency, and process.
  • Influence a repeatable and scalable process for generating pipeline as the company scales.
  • Establish 30-60-90 day plan for BDR roles.
  • Create and deliver accurate analysis on individual/team results and maintain reporting to accurately track and manage BDR sales metrics.
  • Conduct weekly 1:1s with each BDR team member, and drive career progression paths for BDRs.
  • Work closely with Sales representatives and management to ensure lead quality and quantity.
  • Foster collaboration with Sales Executives and Sr Sales Executives to penetrate targeted accounts.

What you'll need to be successful here:

  • The ideal candidate is someone who has previously been in a quota carrying role and overachieved in it
  • Experience managing and improving BDR KPIs 
  • Consistent track record of quota overachievement as lead 
  • Understanding of sales process and best practices - preferably within a direct, B2B outbound sales environment 
  • Create open-communication, driving a fun and successful sales team climate
  • High degree of motivation, energy, and creativity in a fast-paced organization 
  • Results oriented, metrics-driven track record 
  • Strong organizational and team management skills
  • Experience with sales management and lead gen software tools (SFDC, LinkedIn, Groove, etc) 
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills 
  • General skills: Motivating others, team building, providing feedback, coaching, self-development, motivation for sales, self-confidence, sales planning, and orienting employees
*Note: This is a summary of the duties that are essential to this role and is not an exhaustive list. Firmex reserves the right to add or amend duties as necessary. 

At Firmex, we’re successful because we care about our clients, and our team members share our core values of humour, success, respect and collaboration. We know that success is derived from motivated people who take pride in building a business that makes a difference. 

Firmex is an equal-opportunity employer strongly committed to diversity and inclusion within the workplace.

Firmex welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities and can make accommodations on request for candidates throughout all aspects of the hiring process.

title: UX Strategist - Remote (US & Canada)
description:
This position is open to applicants in the US and Canada

ABOUT OUR COMPANY

Kanopi Studios is a Design, Development & Support Agency with a fully distributed team of people who are experts in Drupal & WordPress.

Our clients have a mission; we design, build and support websites that help their mission thrive.

But we want our employees to thrive as well. Because our team members do great work for great clients, Kanopi works hard to support them in their career as they continue to create a better web.

As a result, our business continues to grow, and so must our team. We’re excited to announce this opportunity to join our team as a UX Strategist.

ABOUT THE JOB

As Kanopi's UX Strategist, you will be responsible for using qualitative and quantitative research to craft delightful and functional user experiences. You will be our in-house subject matter expert, often serving as the team's advisor responsible for defining the overall UX vision throughout the entire project lifecycle.

You will lead clients through the Discovery process, including but not limited to stakeholder interviews, user feedback collection, and data analysis. Your responsibilities will encompass crafting the Discovery strategy and translating it into deliverables like user flows, customer journey maps, competitor reviews, Information Architecture (IA), sitemaps, template identification, content strategy, and initial prototypes.

Your projects will challenge you to craft user-centered experiences and utilize a data-driven problem-solving approach. You can clearly and confidently articulate the "why" behind your decisions while balancing client desires and user needs.

This position reports to Kanopi's Manager of Creative Services.

Requirements

In this role, you can expect to:

  • Lead the entire lifecycle of user research from open-ended discovery to concept testing, including:
    • IA, writing surveys, and user journeys.
    • Synthesizing research techniques and data insights that lead to actionable strategic recommendations.
  • Review, analyze, and provide design feedback to ensure visuals align with user and business objectives.
  • Identify areas of opportunity, defining their priority for internal teams.
  • Lead clients through and participate in Discovery and UX work sessions.
  • Create project deliverables, including user flows, customer journey maps, IA, sitemaps, wireframes, etc.
  • Contribute and collaborate with the Creative Services team to help elevate deliverables.
  • Approach User Experience deliverables using an atomic design principle methodology, streamlining the user interactions for visual implementation into pattern libraries, etc.

ABOUT THE COMPENSATION & WORK REQUIREMENTS

This is a full-time position. Salary and compensation is commensurate with experience. Not to worry. The pay is competitive and what you’d expect for this role. This is a 100% remote role, but you must live and be able to work in North America.


NOW... LET'S TALK ABOUT YOU!

We are looking for candidates who have…

  • 5+ years of professional experience in web and UX strategy.
  • 3+ years of experience working within an agency setting, preferably remotely or with a distributed project team.
  • A strong portfolio containing specific examples showcasing user research, journeys, personas, IA, and strategic UX thinking.
  • The ability to translate high-level strategic concepts into easily digestible client-friendly information.
  • The ability to implement a mobile-first user experience methodology.
  • Inherent professionalism and responsiveness to client needs, including issues as they arise.
  • General comfort context-switching between multiple projects in a fast-paced, multi-time-zone environment.
  • Proactive verbal and written communication skills, and can respond quickly and remain flexible in a rapidly changing environment.
  • Curiosity and initiative to learn and adapt to new applications and frameworks.
  • Proven experience delivering high-quality work with an eye on time and budget.

At Kanopi, we believe a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and voices make for a better workplace. We strongly and enthusiastically encourage people of color, individuals who identify within and beyond the LGBTQ+ spectrum, women, and people with disabilities to apply.

NOW, WHAT?

If you think this post was written just for you, here’s what to do next:

  1. Submit your resume and a link to your portfolio.
  2. Answer the questions you see here on this page.
  3. Send us a cover letter.

Now… About that cover letter… This is VERY important!

Please include all of the typical reasons why you’d be an outstanding candidate for this position, plus answer this question: What is your favorite piece of technology?

Our screening process takes a bit of time, because we like to ensure that you are the perfect fit for us, and we are the perfect fit for you! After we’ve taken a look at your application, we will send you a series of questions that will help us get to know you better. From there, you will engage in several interviews with members of our team, and a skills assessment or two in order to take a look at how you do the things you do! Some candidates may even do a mini-project, depending on the role you are interviewing for. We’ll be happy to explain a bit more once we’re in the interview stage.

Please note - we try to make an effort to contact every applicant to let you know the status of your application, but we are human, so if you don’t hear from us, drop us a line!

Benefits

Fully Remote: Work where and when you do your best. It’s about feeling connected to others, having a flexible schedule and staying healthy.

Top Talent: Since we are not limited by walls, our ability to hire the best is limitless. Collaborate, learn and surround yourself with a strongly skilled and diverse team.

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by those assigned to this classification. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by those occupying this position. The job description and job functions described herein are subject to possible modification by Kanopi Studios in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

No agencies, recruiters or applicants outside of the US or Canada.

title: UX Researcher
description:
About the company
Fable is a Toronto-based accessibility company that is helping businesses make their digital services accessible to a billion people with disabilities worldwide. We’ve built a crowdtesting platform that connects digital teams to people with disabilities for user research and testing. Our customers include Walmart, Slack, Shopify and many more.


About the role
Fable is looking for an UX Researcher who is responsible for identifying accessibility issues through user interviews and evaluative research using our platform. This role involves regularly engaging with people with disabilities and requires a candidate who is sensitive, respectful and who has the ability to tailor their processes to meet individual requirements.


This UX Researcher will work closely with customers and other Fable team members to conduct rigorous research about how various digital product offerings can be improved for people with disabilities. An understanding of how various assistive technologies interact with digital products, and the web, is preferred.


In this role, you will help facilitate unmoderated research sessions with Fable’s community of people with disabilities. You will oversee a number of weekly remote sessions with community members as they conduct independent tasks. Facilitation is an important role in ensuring community members are well supported for remote engagement and that they have the direction needed to have a successful session.


The successful candidate will be open to supporting the business in many ways, leveraging any and all skills you may have. This individual is analytical, detail oriented, responsible and consistently demonstrates strong communication skills.


Key responsibilities

  • Conduct evaluative research for customers digital products including websites, web apps, mobile apps and software
  • Provide support in training testers for moderated and unmoderated sessions on Fable’s platform
  • Contribute to developing qualitative and quantitative methods to evaluate usability of assistive technology users in remote engagements
  • Schedule and conduct interviews with people with disabilities
  • Record problems/defects identified during testing and prioritize them
  • Collaborate with project lead to scope audit and testing requirements
  • Communicate the status of testing, including reporting of overall test results
  • After customers resolve accessibility issues, support with re-testing

Requirements

Skills and Qualifications

  • Skilled in facilitation of user interviews
  • Able to define research goals, articulate hypotheses and apply the best research methods for a wide range of problems
  • Experience translating research findings into actionable recommendations
  • Strong analytical, communication and team skills
  • Ability to communicate to a wide range of project stakeholders including executives, managers, designers and developers
  • Compassionate and patient demeanour with confidence and assertion to get things done
  • Active listening and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to build relationships and connect with people quickly
  • Organized and able to manage a large volume of tasks independently
  • Confidence to manage difficult situations and conversations
  • Tech-savvy with the ability to navigate apps and software

You must be:

  • Proficient with user research: Experienced in running and reporting on the results of user interviews and usability audits
  • Technical: Able to troubleshoot issues with remote testing on Zoom with Assistive technology users.
  • Passionate: Be interested and curious about assistive technology, accessibility and user research.
  • Open-minded: Be open and personable so that you can set a positive tone at the start of sessions.
  • Problem-solver: If something goes wrong, you look for the next step to solve it.

Nice to have:

  • Familiar with web accessibility and WCAG
  • Experience with assistive technology or engaging with assistive technology users


At Fable we value diversity and would love to have applicants that are traditionally underrepresented in technology roles. If you don’t meet all the required skills and qualifications due to barriers you’ve faced in your life, please apply and explain why you’re passionate about this role in your cover letter.

Benefits

What's in it for you?

At Fable, you'll join a vibrant and rapid growth environment where you'll work with individuals who share the same values of being passionate, socially driven, inclusive, collaborative, and respectful. We offer great benefits such as stock options, career progression, professional development, health/dental benefits, and more.


Accessibility accommodations

Fable is an inclusive workplace. If you are facing any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please reach out to us at jobs@makeitfable.com.

  • If you require any accessibility accommodation for the interviewing process, please fill out this application form.
