title: Senior UX Designer - (Remote)
description:
Help companies compete with the FANGs, by making the flow of work visible so they can remove bottlenecks and increase flow.


About Tasktop

Founded in Vancouver BC Canada, Tasktop has a young, global, energetic vibe, while proudly counting the majority of the Fortune 100 as customers. Tasktop pioneered software developer efficiency starting with the Mylyn open-source project and continues to innovate in the industry with our CEO Mik Kersten's best-selling book 'Project to Product'.

Our new product Viz has defined the Value Stream Management category. We lead by leveraging the strong thought leadership of our management team and flow experts. We have some of the top flow experts in the world. We use our own products and practice what our flow experts teach.

Design sits within the Product Research arm of Tasktop along with the Data Science and Product Strategy teams. We work on everything from long term strategic vision to day-to-day feature work.


Your Impact

  • Directly shape a new product in a new category that helps product teams see and improve the flow of work and helps executives make better investment decisions for their products and teams.


Who You Are

  • IQ with EQ. Smart, humble, and empathetic.
  • Big picture and attention to detail. You enjoy thinking at the level of the forest, the trees and down to the leaves on the trees.
  • Have a strong sense of teamwork and put the customers’ needs first.
  • Driven and excited about the challenges of a fast-paced, innovative software startup-like environment.

Requirements

Working closely with the Product Design Director, the Product Management team and the Data Science team, you will be responsible for designing end-to-end interfaces for enterprise products relied upon by some of the world’s largest companies.


Key skills required

  • Interaction design. Create fluid/effortless workflows and micro interactions.
  • Visual design. Expert in type, colour, icon, and grid systems.
  • Data visualization. Ability to choose the best chart type to tell the story and know when to invent something new.
  • Depth and experience in using Sketch, Figma, InVision, Axure, Balsamiq or other tools for high-fidelity mockups and prototype concepts.
  • Ability to create or use interaction design pattern libraries - and an ability to articulate the reasoning for these choices.
  • Some experience analyzing usage data using tools such as Pendo
  • Facilitating design-thinking exercises with internal teams and customers


Experience

  • 5+ years designing user interfaces using a user centered process, including planning and executing user research, iterative design and usability testing
  • Designing user interfaces and behaviors for business to business (B2B) applications (desktop or web) that includes dashboards with charting, error handling or conditional workflows
  • Some technical experience, understanding how software gets built


Education

  • BA / BSc in interactive design, product design, graphic / communication design, information design, or other visual arts
  • A formal design education is preferred

Benefits

Why Tasktop:

Diversity and caring for each other are two of Tasktop’s key values and at Tasktop, we have built a community of mutual respect and trust. We believe that diverse teams perform better and foster an environment of belonging and inclusion. We aim to continually learn, evolve, and be better versions of ourselves.

As a Tasktop employee you will enjoy flexibility, a fitness allowance, volunteer programs, a generous vacation offering, and plenty more benefits!

title: Frontend Development Manager, Marketing (Remote, Americas)
description:
Shopify is on a fast-moving mission to make the best products for merchants, buyers, and partners around the globe — and engineers play a vital role in building that future. Here are just some of the stories from the engineering teams who build and scale Shopify.

Our Frontend Engineers in Marketing collaborate closely with designers, content strategists, product managers, data scientists, and our broader marketing teams to build incredible merchant and prospect-facing websites, campaigns, and developer-facing tools. You’ll use the latest web standards in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and work with Ruby on Rails to develop websites and web applications that scale and perform well on all devices. Frontend Development exists across all of Shopify, from Product to Marketing, working closely with the teams that create performant experiences and communicate Shopify’s impact on commerce to a global audience. Collaborating with our Data, SEO, and Operations teams to make data-informed decisions, you’ll work on large-scale, multi-language, and localized websites to help drive new merchant acquisition and bring Shopify to audiences around the world.

As a Frontend Development Manager in Marketing, you’ll lead and inspire a team of Frontend Engineers that work on campaigns and initiatives across various marketing channels and touchpoints. You will lead planning, resourcing, and executing projects, while providing mentorship and creating growth opportunities for your team. You’ll also collaborate across different crafts and leadership teams to help push the disciplines of Frontend Development and Marketing User Experience (UX) both within our team and across the company.

What you’ll do as a Marketing-focused Frontend Development Manager at Shopify:

  • Work on problems with your teams, roll up your sleeves, form an opinion, and advocate for engineering-specific roadmap items.

  • Mentor and lead a small team of developers while also providing growth opportunities.

  • You understand that leadership is a craft, and know how to mentor your team members to help them grow and succeed.

  • Help your team ship exceptional user experiences and establish clear definitions of quality.

  • Build accessible, responsive, performant experiences, and educate teams across UX and Marketing on why this matters.

  • Evaluate and provide supportive and constructive feedback to your reports. 

  • Partner closely with content design and marketing design leadership peers to strategize, problem solve, and take our teams to the next level. 

 The right candidate will have:

  • Proven senior leadership skills. Your management skills and technical depth allow you to develop and mentor other leads as well as build credibility with your team, while executing broader engineering strategies.

  • Strong communication skills and the ability to influence and advocate for the Frontend Development craft.

  • You feel comfortable diving into the code and interacting with developers at all levels of seniority and have a commitment and drive for quality, technical excellence, and results.

  • Experience building responsive, performant, and accessible web experiences that engage audiences through the use of animation and complex interactions.

  • Working with modern web stacks (transpilers, linters, build and CI tools, etc.).

  • Experience designing and developing APIs, working with Content Management Systems, and Design Systems.

  • A passion for efficiency and collaboration, with a history of establishing great relationships across UX, Engineering, Marketing, Leadership, Product Marketing, Data, and SEO teams distributed across multiple time zones.

  • You are comfortable working with senior stakeholders (Director level and up), both technical and non technical.

  • Has proven experience representing the front end development craft through presentations, workshops and articles. 

It would be great if you had experience with:

  • Working in an agency or creative environment delivering large-scale, multi-language websites, microsites, landing pages, and campaigns with complex internationalization and localization requirements.

  • A deep understanding of one or more specific client-side areas like animation, web performance, or accessibility for example.

  • Experimentation and evaluation methodologies to help inform decisions with real-world data.

title: Product Designer
description:
Bridgit is workforce intelligence for the construction industry. Our mission is simple – to help the trillion dollar construction industry maximize profits and reduce risk by taking a people-first approach. We are, and always have been, driven by the want to disrupt and transform construction.

Bridgit is a Series B company, having raised over $43.5 million CAD in funding, from investors like Camber Creek, Export Development Canada, Salesforce Ventures, Storm Ventures, and more.

We offer a remote-first environment with flexible working hours as well as options for working locations.

Make an impression, make an impact.

The Product Design team at Bridgit

Our product design team works as a Centralized Partnership - product designers collaborate closely with each other while also being dedicated partners to cross-functional pods (called Product Focus Areas). Designers, developers, and PMs work together with no silos or artificial barriers, moving as they see fit as they work toward completing established business and organizational objectives. We value flexibility in how we work, and strive to find a balance in having established processes rooted in best practices while also encouraging designers to adapt their process to the problem at hand. We also place high importance on collaboration, within our team, with product management and development, and with the company as a whole.


What you will do

As Product Designer, you will help us solve complex business problems with intuitive solutions that our customers will love. You are a driven, critical-thinking designer who loves to collaborate. In this role, you’ll be owning the design on a range of projects and features for our Bridgit Bench product and will be working closely with owners from product management and development.

You can expect to:

  • Work through problems end-to-end from exploration, to problem definition, to solution design, to reviewing and iterating on results
    • Conducting research to identify and explore opportunities
    • Facilitating collaborative sessions in order to gain shared understanding with cross-functional peers and stakeholders
    • Designing and prototyping multiple ideas rapidly to validate product directions
    • Measuring and evaluating the effectiveness of shipped solutions to inform iterations
  • Work collaboratively with development and product teams as you build and ship ideas
  • Take a data-informed approach to design decisions, using qualitative insights as well as quantitative data to evaluate and improve on the experience
  • Strategize the approach to your work, thinking in terms of service design and systems, not just screens
  • Work closely with and mentor other designers on the team
  • Work closely with the Design Lead to contribute to and evolve design processes

Requirements

Are You a Good Fit for a Product Designer at Bridgit?

Let’s start with our core values:

  • Deliver results, fast
  • Fixate on the customer
  • Be open, be honest
  • Win or lose together
  • Never stop learning

Does that sound like you? Great! Keep reading.

  • You have 4+ years relevant design experience designing web and mobile apps and systems. You have helped ship products, ideally in the SaaS/B2B space (or have a strong desire to do so).
  • You’re able to clearly communicate design work to multiple stakeholders, articulating your design decisions with research and data to back them up.
  • You describe yourself as a driven self-starter who is excited about collaborating within the design team as well as non-designers.
  • You have a solid understanding of the product development process, from research, to problem definition, to detailed UI and analyzing results.
  • You have the ability to understand and follow a design system, and contribute to it when necessary.
  • You are a team player; you know how to check your ego at the door and focus on what’s best for our team, company, and customers.

We recognize many of the skills we’ve developed over our careers are often transferable. We believe that creativity, enthusiasm, and drive are the keys to success. If you’re not sure you meet every qualification but feel you have other experience relevant to the role, we encourage you to apply.

As we move into a remote-first future, the health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, customers, and communities remain our number one priority. While vaccination is not a condition of employment, Bridgit does require all team members to be fully-vaccinated against COVID-19, as defined by the Government of Ontario, when entering our offices and attending in-person events, subject to applicable legal exemptions.

Benefits

  • An autonomous environment with the opportunity to make an impact quickly
  • A culture that encourages innovation and professional growth, among other things
  • Competitive salary and options
  • Perks and benefits including unlimited vacation, 4-hour Fridays and extended long weekends

Bridgit values diversity and believes that our strength comes from including the perspectives of all kinds of contributors. We encourage people from underrepresented communities to apply, including racial minorities, LGBTQIA+, and those with disabilities. Accommodations are available during all stages of the recruitment process, please advise us of any needs as required.

title: Demand Generation Manager- (Hybrid/Remote)
description:
Who we are 

GroupBy’s AI-powered and fully cloud native technology powers the world’s most relevant and highly converting eCommerce brands. Our SaaS-based, data driven eCommerce platform provides industry-leading features for data enrichment, search, navigation, personalization, merchandising, and much more! Today, GroupBy is recognized for its success enhancing large-scale, complex B2B and B2C eCommerce configurations. Also, in late 2021, we kicked off our exciting partnership with Google whereby we will be the site search provider of choice recommended by Google to all of their retail clients. This partnership will allow us to grow 30-50% in 2022.

While we have numerous accolades, we would like to highlight that Groupby was honored with a spot on LinkedIn Top Startups 2018: The 25 most sought-after startups in Canada LinkedIn Top 25. 

Do you thrive in a diverse and exciting environment that’s continuously evolving? Join our team and find out why GroupBy is such a great place to work!

GroupBy is looking for a Demand Gen Marketer (DGM).

Our ideal candidate is someone with a can-do attitude, HubSpot mastery and demonstrated success in marketing to enterprise-level organizations. This is a new position based on the Marketing team and reports to the Head of Marketing. The DGM is extremely results oriented, a self starter with proven strategic thinking skills and the ability to multitask. 

The Job
The DGM will develop, execute and optimize the programs that will drive revenue and company growth, and works closely with the GroupBy Sales team to develop and oversee implementation of demand generation strategies to help the company achieve revenue targets. The right fit for this role will demonstrate flexibility and adaptability, is someone who can work with minimal supervision, alone or on a team.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Campaign Strategist (Nurture & Acquisition) - Strategize and devise B2C or B2B marketing campaigns
  • Create integrated/multi-channel campaigns; Drip/Nurture Campaigns; Acquisition Campaigns; Partner Campaigns, Customer Success Campaigns
  • Collaborate with marketing team, VP Marketing and sales managers to create promotional concepts and campaign plans
  • Prepare list segmentations
  • Write, edit and proofread copy for promotional materials within marketing campaigns/emails
  • Ensure that the organization’s brand and identity is adhered to in campaigns and in all communication channels
  • Collaborate with Product Marketing Manager to successfully disseminate content via proper digital/print channels
  • Deliver regular reports of campaign results, including web analysis and evaluation of KPIs
  • Manage the implementation, tracking and measurement of marketing campaigns
  • Track and communicate project status across teams using Wrike
  • Ensure campaign learnings are documented and shared internally
  • Collect and use data to inform new campaigns and the evaluation of existing campaigns
  • Keep abreast of current trends in marketing
  • Optimize Hubspot functionality and lead transfer to Salesforce
  • Additional marketing tasks that contribute to the overall marketing team’s success

Skills You Have

  • Hubspot Marketing Automation Expert
  • 3-5 years as campaign or data operations specialist with a focus on CRM operations, database marketing, direct marketing, loyalty program management, list generation, data analytics, solution design, email deployment, campaign management/testing and reporting
  • Relevant university degree in Business, Marketing OR equivalent work experience in a technical or business/technical blended field
  • You are meticulously organized. You can keep others organized too.
  • Experience crafting business requirements documents and Campaign Briefs
  • Experience performing list pulls from Zoominfo/Builtwith
  • Mandatory - Experience with marketing automation and email marketing tools (such as Hubspot, Salesforce, Google Analytics)
  • Sound analytical skills, organizational and problem-solving skills
  • HTML coding would be an asset

Nice to have

  • Experience in a Saas or ecommerce environment
  • Experience collaborating with a sales team
  • Strong Social Media Marketing experience
Why You'll Love Working Here 

In 2021, we received a 92% employee engagement score on our annual employee satisfaction survey.

We offer a hybrid work environment.

We have many fun perks like getting your birthday off, half days before a holiday weekend, unlimited vacation, $500 annual educational budget to spend as you wish, many opportunities for growth and more!

We have a strict "no jerks" allowed policy. Only good humans allowed.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
About Fable:

Fable is a Toronto-based accessibility company that is helping businesses make their digital products and services accessible to a billion people with disabilities worldwide. We've built a platform that connects digital teams to people with disabilities for user research and testing. Our customers include Walmart, Slack, Shopify, and many more.


About the role:

We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager.

In this role, you will develop and manage Fable’s product marketing. We will trust you as our lead on new campaigns for our products, features, updates, and more including on our website, app, email, social channels, sales collateral, and more. You will be well equipped with internal/external resources, funding, and you will have plenty of opportunities for creativity. This is a perfect role for a talented and ambitious product marketing manager who wants to join a fast-growing company and take on more responsibility. You will report to our marketing leadership while coordinating closely with our product team, revenue team, and executive leadership.


As a Product Marketing Manager, you'll be expected to:

  • Build customer insights, partnering with our marketing, revenue, and product teams to align on customer needs and core value proposition across customer segments and products.
  • Develop positioning and messaging that can be leveraged by all GTM teams to drive adoption and retention
  • Evolve Fable's product launch playbook for new launches and features to drive awareness, leads, and adoption
  • Own product-related communications across our customer lifecycle, ensuring that customers get the right messages at the right time to get the most value from Fable
  • Own all product messaging on the Fable website, with input from our marketing, revenue, and product teams
  • Create sales enablement content, including product collateral targeting specific buyer personas, that improves our win rate and accelerates our average time to close
  • Support the revenue team to adopt sales enablement content and integrate it into the sales approach
  • Own the development of customer case studies that result in new customer acquisition and customer advocacy
  • Work with Senior Brand Designer and external contractors, including illustration and video design, to create outstanding collateral
  • Work with the product and CS teams to develop product documentation and guides

Requirements

Key qualifications and assets

  • 5+ years of experience in SaaS companies with at least 2 years of experience as a Product Marketing Manager.
  • Strong writing ability, able to develop positioning and tell stories
  • A track record of successfully launching products and driving adoption of new and existing features
  • Experience collaborating across the company and different functions
  • Experience in competitive analysis and differentiation

You must be

  • An experienced product marketer with examples of work for us to discuss
  • Effective at working independently, participating in group meetings, and driving forward on goals
  • Willing to learn about accessibility and follow inclusive design practices.
  • Open to working in a fast-moving team
  • Willing to learn new tools and adjust quickly
  • Able to work within bounds of North American time zones, Eastern Time preferred.

Nice to haves

  • Familiar with product marketing frameworks
  • Experience with JIRA
  • Familiarity with web accessibility and digital accessibility
  • Experience with assistive technology or engaging with assistive technology users

Benefits

What's in it for you?

At Fable, you'll join a vibrant and rapid growth environment where you'll work with individuals who share the same values of being passionate, socially driven, inclusive, collaborative, and respectful. We offer great benefits such as stock options, career progression, professional development, health/dental benefits, and more.


Accessibility accommodations

Fable is an inclusive workplace. If you are facing any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please reach out to us at jobs@makeitfable.com.

  • If you require any accessibility accommodation for the interviewing process, please fill out this application form.

title: Lifecycle Marketing Manager, Payments (Remote)
description:
Lifecycle Marketing Manager, Payments

 

About FreshBooks

It turns out unicorns are real! In fact, FreshBooks just became one after raising our valuation to more than $1 billion. And ever since launching in 2003, weve been on a steady incline towards one goal: Building easy-to-use accounting software for small business owners. Its the goal thats driven us to expand into five offices, serving customers in over 160 countries. And its the goal wed love for you to be a part of as a member of our global team as we continue our journey

 

The Opportunity  

Were looking for an experienced, data-driven marketing manager to lead our initiatives to expand the adoption of payment solutions within our customer base. The ideal candidate will have knowledge of lifecycle marketing and payment solutions, excel with data-driven analytical challenges as well as apply creative thinking to develop programs that will delight our customers. Proficiency in coordinating and supporting Sales teams and projects with Product Development to improve our customer experience and drive growth is also a great asset. 

This role is ideal for someone who views experiences holistically through a customer-centric lens, is data-driven and digitally savvy, loves balancing multiple stakeholders and can switch quickly from strategic thinking to the tactical details. Success in this role will require a metrics-based approach and ability to navigate ambiguous requirements. The successful candidate will exhibit a passion for innovation and for customer experience, with expertise in payment solutions and in customer relationship marketing. 

What youll do: 

  • Drive execution and continued optimization of our payment adoption campaigns, including lifecycle trigger programs, and transactional messaging across multiple channels and touch-points 
  • Innovate and optimize our payment engagement and retention activities across all marketing assets (in-app, website, etc)
  • Apply strategies to drive customer adoption and revenue growth to support the introduction of new products and services
  • Develop and maintain nurture programs to generate qualified leads for our Sales teams
  • Use data-driven analysis and customer insights to develop hypotheses and partner with the operations teams to execute A/B testing plans to continuously improve performance
  • Manage research efforts to inform ongoing marketing strategy
  • Contribute in defining positioning of payment solutions in cooperation with product marketing and product development
  • Periodically review marketing collateral and online material as it relates to the payments value proposition. 

What you'll need: 

  • 3+ years experience in fintech or payment industry 
  • Experience in a mix of strategy and operational roles
  • A track-record of successfully partnering with cross-functional teams, including Sales teams, to meet goals
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Nice to have 
    • experience using Business Intelligence tools like Looker or Tableau, and Excel an asset (SQL knowledge gets you extra bonus points!)

Does this sound like you? 

  • Youre all about the customer
    You have a passion to communicate with, learn about and serve FreshBooks customers around the world. You know what an extraordinary customer experience looks like, and do everything in your power to consistently deliver awesome 
  • Data is your guiding light
    You can dig into complex data sets and have no problems synthesizing quantitative and qualitative data to help answer why? You then share your insights with the broader team so everyone learns 
  • Youre a strategic doer
    You set insanely ambitious goals for yourself and then build a rock-solid strategy and tactical plan to help you get there 
  • Communication comes naturally
    Youre an expert communicator and the biggest advocate for the features you launch. Youll make sure the entire company hears about the latest news...twiceand youll do it in a unique and memorable way 
  • You love working with teams
    Instead of this is how it is, you ask what do you think of this approach? Youre open to outside opinions and have no problem asking others how can I help? to clear roadblocks 
  • Youre ambitious and innovative
    You dont accept the status quo simply because its what weve always done. You push for better, newer, more innovative and efficient ways to do things 

What Youll Love About Working Here:

  • Three-week onboarding that brings you up to speed on our brand, product, and most importantly, our customers. Its an awesome opportunity to dive in and understand what were all about and build your network within the company. Plus, there are prizes! 
  • Our ever-expanding, global team cares about making accounting incredibly easy for business owners around the world. 
  • Amazing growth and mentorship opportunities from a team with a laser-focused mission of shipping extraordinary experiences.
  • Collaborative remote or hybrid model with a global team
  • A work/life balance you can brag to your friends about:
  • Two weeks parental paid leave and paid leave top-up
  • Health & dental coverage tailored to your local office
  • Generous time off - including vacation, volunteer, and innovation days 
  • Health and Wellness credits 
  • Learning and development opportunities that are both in-house and external
  • Retirement savings programs matched to your local office 
  • Stock options for all full-time employees 
  • And finally, we have fun at work...Want to start a chess team? Awesome. Want to host a homemade-ice-cream-making Zoom night?  Whatever your passion is, bring it to FreshBooks, tell others about it, and enjoy what you do every day.

Why Join Us:

We're a motivated bunch, with our eyes laser-focused on shipping extraordinary experiences to businesses. You will be surrounded by hardworking team members who share a common vision for what an amazing software company could be, and have the opportunity to help build an elite one, right here in downtown Toronto.

 

Apply Now

Have we got your attention? Submit your application today and a member of our recruitment team will be in touch with you shortly!

FreshBooks is an equal opportunity employer that embraces the differences in all of our employees. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all FreshBookers. All applicants are evaluated based on their experience and qualifications in relation to this position.

FreshBooks provides employment accommodation during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please indicate this on your application and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. For any questions, suggestions or required documents regarding accessibility in a different format, please contact us at phone 416-780-2700 and/or

accessibility@freshbooks.com

.

 #LI-SS2

title: Senior Business Development Manager
description:
Business Unit:

Cubic Transportation Systems

Company Details:

Cubic offers an opportunity to provide innovative technology for government and commercial customers around the globe, helping to solve their future problems today. We’re the leading integrator of payment and information technology and services for intelligent travel solutions worldwide, and the leading provider of realistic combat training systems, secure communications and networking and highly specialized support services for military and security forces of the U.S. and allied nations. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and thrive in an innovative environment, we want to talk to you about your next role at Cubic! We are seeking employees inspired by technology, and motivated by the rewards of hard work, commitment, teamwork, quality, integrity, and respect. We invite you to explore opportunities with Cubic.

Job Details:

Job Summary: Performs duties to identify, advocate and pursue business development opportunities/strategies.  Business Development Managers are the front line force with respect to customer contact, coordination, and correspondence.  Develops and implements sales and marketing strategies. Monitors and analyzes sales and marketing activity against goals. This position typically works under limited supervision and direction.  Incumbents of this position will regularly exercise discretionary and substantial decision-making authority.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Identifies “new” business opportunities. 
  • Develops and implements sales and marketing strategies.
  • Monitors and analyzes sales and marketing activity against goals.
  • Provides input for accurate and realistic bookings forecast estimates. 
  • Develops and maintains contacts with customers. 
  • Develops and maintains program descriptions, and capture plans.
  • Advises and counsels management on bid/no bid decisions, multi-company teaming decisions, system design, pricing strategy, supplemental staffing, and other issues affecting probability of winning contracts.
  • Develops marketing information used for new business proposals, product specifications, statements of work and systems requirements.
  • Recommends application and/or modification of Company products to satisfy customer requirements.
  • Confers with customer technical representatives and management to determine and interpret customer requirements
  • Improves competitive position by recommending new applications of systems, providing information on the technical development of systems and assisting in program planning.
  • Keeps track of potential sales opportunities and marketing efforts of competitor firms.
  • Manages discretionary resources.
  • May act as capture manager, to manage strategic proposal efforts.
  • Participates in the preparation of the strategic plan.

Minimum Job Requirements:

  • Four-year college degree in engineering, management, or marketing, plus ten years’ experience in a sales/marketing position. MBA Preferred.
  • Experience in strategic planning and execution.
  • Knowledge of contracting, negotiating, and change management.
  • Knowledge of structuring sales quota goals and revenue expectations.
  • Experience in planning marketing strategies, advertising campaigns, and successful public relations efforts.
  • Must have excellent communication, negotiation and presentation skills. 
  • Must be able to travel as required. 
  • Able to prioritize work, complete multiple tasks and work under deadlines.


 

The description provided above is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties, responsibilities and requirements.  Duties, responsibilities and requirements may change over time and according to business need.

Worker Type:

Employee

title: Director of Marketing - Carbon Removal
description:
About CarbonCure Technologies

CarbonCure Technologies is an award-winning clean technology company leading a global mission to reduce the carbon footprint of concrete – the world’s most used building material. Our vision is to drive an annual reduction of 500 million tonnes of carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions; the equivalent of removing 100 million cars from the road. Our technology has been installed in over 400 concrete plants in North America and Asia, and Europe. CarbonCure is proud to be named the Cleantech Group Global 100’s Top North American Company in 2020, and the winner of the global NRG COSIA Carbon XPRIZE. We are backed by Breakthrough Energy Ventures, the Amazon Climate Pledge Fund, and Mitsubishi.

 

Our Culture

Our team is made up of energetic, entrepreneurial individuals who are passionate about driving meaningful solutions to combat climate change. Besides being dedicated to our mission, we believe in work-life balance and active involvement in our local community. We value integrity and accountability; and our core values include high performance, collaboration, straight-talk, and continued innovation. We don’t take ourselves too seriously, but we are here to change the world.

 

Purpose-driven position

CarbonCure is experiencing aggressive growth as our technology and value propositions are becoming globally recognized. With growing awareness  that carbon removal will be critical to meeting our climate targets, we are seeing increasing demand for CarbonCure's carbon removal credits, which have already been sold to several buyers including Stripe and Shopify. This is a growing revenue stream which will be an effective mechanism to accelerate adoption of CarbonCure’s carbon dioxide removal (CDR) technologies.

 

Reporting to the Senior Director of Global Marketing, the Director of Marketing - Carbon Removal will be responsible for the development and execution of CarbonCure’s carbon removal marketing strategy and programs. Working in lockstep with marketing and the Carbon Finance sales and customer success teams, your primary responsibility is to drive marketing-sourced and influenced revenue through cohesive, integrated campaigns, customized content and messaging, and lead nurturing.

 

Responsibilities

 

  • Use an ABM strategy to identify high value corporate carbon removal buyers - across different industries and with different needs - you will be responsible for creating campaigns and programs focused on inbound and outbound lead generation, including planning, budgeting, execution, optimization, and reporting
  • Manage and execute multi-channel, multi-touch (digital ads, social media, email marketing, events, direct mail, webinars, etc.) demand generation programs designed to drive awareness, engagement and conversion of leads 
  • Customize nurture programs designed to provide content aligned with the buyer journey, moving marketing leads through the funnel to sales-ready stage; adapt and customize for different types of business requirements where needed
  • Develop content, messaging, and value propositions that align with CarbonCure’s business objectives and users' needs. Identify unique content requirements based on persona needs that includes ebooks, case studies, blog posts, sales sheets, etc.
  • Manage/select paid lead sources
  • Develop event strategies including webinars and tradeshows
  • Use effective social media mediums to drive tangible MQLs
  • Forecast, measure, analyze, and report on the impact of marketing performance on sales pipeline, including MQLs generated, conversion to SAL and pipeline contribution; measure effectiveness, performance and ROI of marketing spend and adjust along the way


Other Requirements and Expectations

 

  • 5-7 years of experience in B2B demand generation
  • Account-based marketing experience is strong plus
  • Knowledge of best practices for sales and marketing operations, automation and workflow processes; understanding & experience with lead management (lead scoring, nurturing, handoff) marketing automation and demand generation with focus on revenue impact
  • High degree of self-motivation, initiative in sharing information, contributing toward group goals, and being accountable for results. 
  • Knowledge of or passion for decarbonization, carbon removal and carbon offsetting would be a plus
  • Entrepreneurial drive to build a program that will have a major impact on company bottom line, flexibility to adapt to changing business requirements.
  • Proven track record for delivering sales results related to the marketing objectives as outlined in the position description
  • Technology savvy with web, marketing automation (preferably Marketo), CRM system (salesforce.com preferably), Google Analytics, and other demand generation related tools and platforms
  • Familiarity with social media through paid and organic marketing an asset
  • Demonstrated experience of partnering with sales and sales leadership on campaigns driving revenue growth
  • Strong organizational skills: ability to multi-task, prioritize issues/escalations, and manage many projects simultaneously
  • Ability to coordinate with other team members of assorted responsibilities situated across multiple time zones
  • Familiarity with carbon removal, climate change, carbon utilization, the concrete industry,  green building and embodied carbon is a bonus
  • Far-reaching ambition and optimism; approach CarbonCure’s ambitious global growth targets with an optimistic, yet pragmatic “how can we make this happen” attitude. 
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related field.

 

We’re changing the world. We need you, so contact us.

 

Closing Statement

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest. Please note only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you feel passionate about this opportunity and believe that you have the skills to excel in this role, apply! Or if this sounds like someone you know, please share this posting.

 

We want you to know that you can be a great candidate even if you don't fit everything we've described above. You can also have important skills we haven't thought of. If that's you, don't hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself. We are committed to fostering diversity in our organization and building an equitable and inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and experiences. We're taking steps to meet that commitment. We especially encourage members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, including women, people of color, LGBTQ people, veterans, and people with disabilities.

title: Demand Generation Marketing Manager - Remote Canada or US
description:
WorkJam’s mission? To provide the best Digital Workplace for frontline and hourly workers. Through our industry-leading Digital Frontline Workplace platform, we are positively impacting the lives of millions of frontline employees worldwide, enabling them to achieve breakthrough productivity levels at companies of all sizes. We’re proud of our dedicated teams who are driven to make a difference in the world. Join our team today and bring your innovative ideas, passion, and commitment to excellence to make an impact on our products and the new markets we create!

 

WorkJam is a high growth global organisation with operations in North America, Europe, and Australia with our head office based in Montreal. Learn more about WorkJam at WorkJam.com!


Your role as a B2B Demand Generation Marketing Manager

We are currently looking for a demand generation manager with 5+ years of experience who will be responsible for nurturing leads and helping create demand for our enterprise sales team. This person should have expertise in crafting and executing successful demand generation programs for the enterprise segment, while collaborating closely with product marketing, sales and BDR’s.  This person will also have end-to-end responsibility trade shows and events. If you’re looking to roll up your sleeves, make an immediate impact, and be a high-visibility marketer with a high-growth technology company, this role might be for you!

 

What you'll be doing:

  • The B2B Demand Generation Marketing Manager will play a strategic and tactical role in a fast-paced collaborative environment.
  • Collaborate with BDR’s and with Sales to plan and execute mid-funnel emails and nurture campaigns that leverage Pardot/Sales Force and field marketing activities including events and sponsorships.
  • Plan and oversee the execution webinars and field marketing activities, including trade shows and event sponsorships.
  • Directs team to plan and execute customer events including content and logistics.
  • Responsible for tracking and qualifying campaign ROI’s.
  • Manage Salesforce.Com and Pardot for purposes of driving, maintaining and analyzing lead activity.
  • Manage database segmentation in Pardot.
  • Evaluate and nurture sales opportunities through marketing campaigns.
  • Occasional travel (Trade shows, on site workshops, etc.)

 

What we're looking for:

  • BS/BA in marketing, communication or another related field
  • Salesforce.com and Pardot experience a must – you are a super user!
  • Proven experience as marketing manager or similar, including experience managing/directing others
  • Experience implementing enterprise-level demand generation programs
  • Tactical, hands-on experience with lead forecasting, reporting, and analysis
  • Excellent English presentation, written and oral communication skills, enjoys writing and the writing process.
  • Energy and enthusiasm for bringing in leads and building market presence
  • Working knowledge/understanding of B2B software marketing channels and techniques
  • Proven experience with project management, especially relating to events
  • Highly organization, attention to detail and critical thinking are all required
  • Ability to work well in collaborative environments with attention to detail
  • Demonstrate ability to work remotely with professionalism and efficiency
  • Solid computer skills, including MS Office, marketing software (Adobe Creative Suite)


What we offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • 4 weeks’ vacation
  • Contribution to your retirement/pension plan
  • A flexible and remote/hybrid work environment
  • Work with the latest technology
  • A dynamic and inclusive culture
  • A supportive team that will encourage your professional growth and development

title: UX Principal (Remote)
description:
BenchSci’s vision is to bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We’re achieving it by empowering scientists with the world’s most advanced biomedical artificial intelligence. Backed by F-Prime, Gradient Ventures (Google’s AI fund), and Inovia Capital, our platform accelerates science at 15 top-20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading research centers worldwide. We’re a remote-first company recognized for our impact and culture as a Deloitte Tech Fast 50TM, CIX Top 10 Growth, Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked organization on Glassdoor. Learn more at www.benchsci.com.

We’re looking for a Principal Product Designer to join our team. In this role, you will work closely with the Director of Product Design and an existing team of high-performing UX designers & researchers to create new experiences that help scientists accelerate their research. 

As a Principal UX Designer, you will champion design thinking at BenchSci and put it into practice while bringing new ideas from concept to launch. You are an expert at gathering and understanding business & user requirements, creating information architecture diagrams and user journeys and when needed building high & low fidelity prototypes.

You will

  • Transform complex ideas, business opportunities, research and creative vision into tangible products that provide desirable outcomes and add disproportionate value for users.
  • Lead and establish best practices and design thinking workshops/processes - driving futuristic digital experiences.
  • Collaborate with product managers, scientists, and engineers, to influence product direction, and design solutions that meet the business, technical, and user needs.
  • Use strong communication skills to present, articulate, and explain design recommendations and decisions within cross-functional teams and to stakeholders.
  • Lead designers through all phases of product development, ship, and iterate.
  • Utilize qualitative and quantitative data and customer feedback in your design process.
  • Work autonomously to achieve our outcomes and manage your timelines.
  • Be a passionate advocate for the user, grounding ideas in data-driven solutions by partnering with our User Experience Research team to incorporate customer insights and principles throughout the creative process.

You have

  • 8+ years of end-to-end design experience in transforming technically complex products into intuitive user experiences.
  • A proven record of providing thought leadership, bringing industry trends and positively leading change to mature the design practice.
  • Background or educational equivalent in usability, human factors, digital design, and/or engineering, with digital emphasis.
  • Prior experience developing a digital experience strategy and vision, including journey mapping, leading change and collaborating with a variety of business, technology and creative partners.
  • Superior communication skills and a proven track record of building and developing relationships with senior leadership as well as technology and business teams. 
  • A proven track record in senior design positions, working across all stages of product development from early-stage discovery to implementation.
  • A background in life sciences (strong asset).
  • Experience in visualizing complex data (strong asset).
Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture that hires the best talent from around the world
A competitive compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options 
Comprehensive health and dental benefits with an emphasis on mental health
An annual Executive Health Assessment at Medcan for proactive health awareness
Three weeks of vacation plus an additional day for every completed year
A $2000 Annual Learning & Development budget
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options
Additional time-off: 2 weeks for Winter Holiday, every other Friday in July and August, your birthday, and more!
A $1000 work from home allowance to make your home setup perfect for you
An Oculus Quest 2 to connect with your team members in Virtual Reality
An executive coach for managers to assist in leading high-performing teams
Complimentary Headspace account to support mental wellness and focus
Complimentary genome sequencing from 23andMe to better understand your health through your DNA

Our Culture:
We believe culture is critical to success and invest accordingly. We live and promote our FASTT values of focus, advancement with speed, tenacity, and transparency. We work hard to maintain an engaging, supportive environment where everyone can do their best work. To learn more, read our culture deck.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. To learn more, read about our DEI initiatives.

Accessibility Accommodations:
BenchSci provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Sr. Field Marketing Manager - Java - Remote
description:
Plans, executes, and measures demand generation marketing programs to grow sales pipeline and revenue for Field Sales organization.

Meets with Sales leaders to create strategic marketing plan in Sales support of pipeline and revenue objectives. Participant in regular pipeline and forecast review meetings. Develops and implements tactical marketing programs in conjunction with Sales, Channels, Product Marketing, Product Management, Oracle Direct (Telesales), and external influencers such as user groups and industry trade associations. Provides onsite execution support for marketing programs. Tracks lead flow to ensure the appropriate Sales channels are following up with event attendees and campaign responders in a timely manner. Creates and manages program budget, measures ROI through metrics analysis and reporting. Acts as a virtual team liaison for corporate business initiatives, programs and launches. Communicates program status, action items, and deliverables across Field Marketing team and Sales.

Proven track record executing multi-faceted event programs. Excellent interpersonal skills. Ability to provide consultative input to senior Sales leaders. Basic understanding of business management and operations, including finance/revenue/pipeline principles. Able to engage customers in dialogue about their business needs and IT solutions. Excellent written and verbal skills, and ability to work on far-flung virtual teams. Moderate technical and strategic understanding of Technology, Applications, and Industry solutions being marketed. Attention to detail and discipline to follow established policies and processes from event design to execution to lead flow.

Java is the #1 programming language deployed by over 80% of enterprises globally. Java SE Subscription business is going through an explosive growth period and is expected to maintain its momentum over the next few years.

 

The Senior Field Marketing Manager will be responsible for the planning, implementation and reporting of regional events and campaigns in close coordination with the sales team to drive demand for the Java SE Subscription offerings in support of the pipeline goals.

 

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute regional offline and online campaigns including hosted events, third party sponsorships, direct mail, email campaigns, webcasts, and ABM programs.
  • Support go-to-market strategy along with sales, business development and product marketing.
  • Own events calendar and optimize selection based on past learnings.
  • Curate compelling regional content and CTAs consistent with regional priorities.
  • Manage and optimize Account Based Marketing programs for highly targeted regional segments.
  • Lead development of ad copy and landing pages to capture lead data from regional paid search engine marketing efforts.
  • Establish and manage quarterly and annual key performance indicators and budgets for regional demand generation programs to ensure spending is allocated to highest-performing marketing tactics.
  • Prepare reports and dashboards to communicate results to stakeholders.

 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business.
  • 5+ years of field marketing experience with a strong Enterprise SaaS market focus.
  • Track record of driving pipeline and awareness for enterprise technology providers.
  • Knowledge of Marketing and Sales disciplines (Events, Digital, Social, SEO/SEM, Content led Marketing TOFU/MOFU/BOFU, Pipeline Management, Program Management, Marketing Automation, Inbound/Outbound Techniques, Buyers Journey by Persona)
  • Experience in using marketing systems (CRM, Marketing Automation, BI).
  • Thoughtful problem-solving skills and mature, polished business acumen rooted in proven demand generation results.
  • Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
  • Self-motivated and reliable, with a strong independent work ethic and entrepreneurial mindset.
  • Expected to work independently, and as part of a virtual team where open, collaborative communication is expected.
  • Enthusiastic, open, and flexible personality with strong drive and proven ability to perform in high-paced environment.
  • Data driven and results oriented.
  • Collaboration mindset is a must.


Job Field: Marketing

title: Senior Experience Designer (Remote Friendly: North America Based)
description:
At our core, Electronic Arts is a game maker that connects hundreds of millions of players from around the globe to some of the world's greatest games. The EAX team is driving the strategy and implementation of important programs for EA's community of players to connect them to one another and to the games they love to play. These programs include in-game experiences to connect players across platforms, our subscription service EA Play and the EA app for Windows.

In your role as an Senior Experience Designer you will lead detailed systems design and information architecture for products that allow our players to connect and play together across platforms. Your work will be used by millions of players around the world.

To do this, you'll partner across game teams, product management, design, research, engineering, and marketing to gain understanding and support their goals. You will think about quality, consistency, usability, scalability, and the needs of our players. As part of the broader UX Design family, you will be an important contributor to the EAX team.

You're someone who…

  • Enjoys solving complex problems and translating your solutions into easy to understand design artefacts.
  • Loves partnering with product managers and developers to create sensible solutions that provide measurable outcomes for our players and the business.
  • Demonstrates an attention to craft and an eye for detail.
  • Can determine the best UX approaches based on player feedback and the competitive landscape, identifying challenges and adapting as you go.
  • Can convey your ideas and design rationale to your team and partners.
  • Has 5+ years of experience in UX and product design.

In a typical week, you'll…

  • Provide systems design and information architecture of EA's cross-platform social systems, ensuring every feature that ships is at quality, adds value, and delights our players.
  • Collaborate with various game studios to bring to life cross-platform social experiences that integrate into their games and meet the needs of their players.
  • Create, concept, and share ideas with other designers and scrum partners.
  • Partner with UX Research, using insights to inform product direction and design decisions.

You'll build relationships and work with…

  • Product management, engineers, game studio teams, and marketing managers to bring an ongoing roadmap of interactive features to life.
  • UX Research, Consumer Insights, and analytics to ensure feature optimizations are measurably improving the player experience.

We love to celebrate our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match, of course, free video games and more!

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Lighthouse Labs is looking to welcome a new Product Marketing Manager that will work closely and collaboratively with the marketing team, product managers, and sales, to develop product positioning and communications for both prospects and students (including our Alumni community). As one of the most community-focused and mission-driven professional education companies in Canada, we rely on our relationships with the community, partners and customers to fuel our success. This position is instrumental in driving demand and improving conversion rates across multiple consumer segments and products.


Reporting directly to the Sr. Manager, Product Marketing & Insights, you’ll work proactively to deepen your understanding of the market and competitive landscape. You will use data and insights to get to know our students better than they know themselves, including how they make their decisions and evaluate their successes.  


 What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Responsible for insights to support our GTM strategies for our current core programs. 
  • Deepening our understanding of current target segments and personas within North America through data and insights including primary and secondary research. 
  • Identification of new target segments and personas within North America.. 
  • Support the development of product documentation and student experiences based on a solid understanding of the target audience, consumer personas, competitive landscape, and product value proposition
  • Manage all product marketing content for the entire student lifecycle (including case studies)
  • Collaborate with the growth and content marketing team to develop marketing campaigns, events, blogs,  whitepapers, webcasts and other relevant resources for the target audience(s), based on product positioning stemming from the insights you’ll gather.
  • Research and develop clear and concise value propositions and solution-based narratives.
  • Translating product features and experiences into the problems they solve and the value they provide.
  • Collaborate and work cross-functionally with Marketing, Admissions, Sales, Product, Educational Delivery and Career Services. 
  • Assist with strategic initiatives and programs to drive new student leads and conversion.  

 

What we need from you:

  • 2+ years Product Marketing experience;
  • Ability to turn data and insights into marketing strategies and messages;
  • Strong storytelling skills to be able to translate requirements and features into stories our target audience can care about;
  • Effective communicator with the ability to bring others along the journey, both internal and external;
  • Ability to take initiative and solve problems with minimum supervision (resourcefulness);
  • Ability to build strong interpersonal relationships cross-functionally;
  • Ability to juggle multiple priorities, and be flexible in a fast-paced environment;


Why you’ll like the job: 

  •  Fast-paced culture focused on continuous learning and growth
  • 4 WEEKS PTO! (15 vacation days, 5 personal days)
  • Unlimited sick days
  • A remote working budget to get your home office up and running
  • A learning fund to support professional development
  • Flexible working hours
  • 100% employer-paid health benefits


About us: 

Lighthouse Labs was founded in 2013 with the mission to effectively and efficiently prepare the workforce with the analytical and technical skills necessary to succeed in a world of automation. With an initial focus on our open-enrolment developer bootcamp, we have grown into a leading provider of professional education services, delivering outstanding educational outcomes for our students. Our secret? Innovative curriculum, proprietary ed-tech, unique mentorship and career services and partnerships with government and industry-leading organizations. We’re a bunch of quirky, inclusive and smart people who are changing lives by reimagining education - join us!


Lighthouse Labs is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All positions at this time are remote, and we welcome all applicants. Feel free to ask us about other perks of working at Lighthouse Labs!

title: Senior Product Designer, Mobile (Remote)
description:
Wonolo (Work Now Locally) is disrupting the $140BN temporary staffing industry. Founded in 2014, Wonolo's mission is to help people find consistent work. Through our two-sided tech marketplace, we connect hundreds of businesses in need of front-line workers with 500,000 underemployed workers in local markets across the United States, within minutes. Wonolo empowers the in-demand workforce by democratizing access to flexible work, opportunities to learn new skills, a living wage, and comprehensive portable benefits and perks.

Wonolo is looking for a seasoned Staff Product Designer who will be responsible for creating innovative experiences for Wonoloers. In this role, you will partner with Product Managers, Researchers, Software Engineers, and Business teams to develop the Wonolo app for job seekers, helping Wonoloers find meaningful and fulfilling work! You are a generalist with a broad range of experiences working on mobile products, and fluent throughout the entire product development process, from discovery to production. 

Product Design at Wonolo is part of the Technology organization composed of Product Designers, UX Researchers, Product Managers, Product Analysts, Software Engineers, and QA. Our Tech team is responsible for building the web and mobile products for our customers and worker community, as well as the matching algorithm, backend platform, and internal tools. We put users at the center of everything we do so if you’re customer-obsessed and looking for a high impact opportunity at a technology startup in scaling mode, please apply with your portfolio as we’d love to hear from you!  

We are remote-first and welcome qualified candidates located anywhere in the United States and Canada.

What you'll do:

  • Lead cross functional projects with Product, Engineering, and Business teams to execute product design vision on the Wonoloer team
  • Deliver User Experience (UX), User Interface (UI), and Interaction Design (IxD) for iOS and Android
  • Define interaction models, user flows, and UI specifications
  • Develop our mobile design system in Figma
  • Partner with UX Research to come up with research plans and help execute tactical research through usability testing
  • Share and solicit feedback from team members and stakeholders at various stages of development
  • Present designs regularly to key stakeholders and company-wide

Who you are:

  • 6+ years experience working in UX, UI, or Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) related field
  • You have demonstrated mastery in the craft of design and are considered a leader by your peers. 
  • You have a track record of delivering on numerous projects of large and/or ambiguous scope (for example, tackling a systems-level problem with many constraints, launching a well-thought-through and well-executed new feature/app/program, etc.)
  • You own entire product areas, user experiences, and KPIs such as activation and retention.
  • Your deliverables meet high design standards; you play an active role in defining and enforcing these standards. You’ve established a deep understanding of how things work at Wonolo and use that to improve workflows and product launches.
  • You proactively work with cross-functional teammates to provide definition for undefined/ambiguous projects.
  • You’re a master at running design critics, design thinking workshops, and other meetings with important stakeholders.
  • You’re actively involved in shaping the team by participating in recruiting, interviewing, and mentoring junior designers.
  • You are seen as a culture carrier.

  • If you have read up to this point, we hope you are excited about this opportunity to work at Wonolo! Even if your experience does not check every bullet point, we still highly encourage you to apply. The best hires do not always check off every box of a job description.

Benefits and perks:

  • Competitive salary, meaningful equity, and company bonus
  • We cover 100% insurance (medical/dental/vision) premiums
  • We encourage a healthy work-life balance and offer flexible schedules, an open vacation policy, and the ability to work from anywhere in the US or Canada (no more commutes!)
  • Generous parental leave plan
  • Cell phone reimbursement and laptop
  • 401(k) plan as well as life and disability insurance
  • Team outings, virtual happy hours, company off-sites, and more!
About Wonolo:

Wonolo is a two-sided job marketplace that serves over 1 million front-line workers, providing them access to flexible and consistent job opportunities across the United States within minutes, at companies such as Peloton, Coca-Cola, Neiman Marcus, Papa John's, and thousands more.

We are a remote-first company with 180+ full-time employees, and quickly scaling our team within the United States and Canada. We are well funded and backed by leading investors including Sequoia Capital, Bain Capital, and Leeds Illuminate, among others.

Learn more about us:
Wonolo raises $140M to continue supporting over 1 million laborers and front-line workers
Wonolo is one of Glassdoor's best tech companies to work for in 2021
Sequoia, leading Silicon Valley venture capital firm, invests in Wonolo
Yong Kim (CEO) on why he's passionate about empowering the in-demand workforce

Wonolo is a Great Place to Work-Certified company for delivering a consistently high-trust experience for all employees. We value representation and are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees.

#24 in Glassdoor's Best Places to Work 2021 (Small and Medium)
#12 in Fortune's Best Workplaces in the Bay Area 2021 (Small and Medium)
Inc. Magazine's Best Workplaces 2020 (Medium to Large)

Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Equity, and Belonging
Wonolo welcomes you as you and celebrates our collective diversity. We work to serve the underserved, and we are built on the strength of our entire community. We are especially interested in candidates who represent different cultures, perspectives, and backgrounds as these empower our team to come together to make the best decisions and the biggest impact.

Wonolo is an equal opportunity employer. We work to ensure all people feel supported, empowered, and connected at work. A big part of this effort is through our support for members and allies of Employee Resource Groups such as Whammies of Color and Allies at Wonolo (WoCAW), Women of Wonolo (WoW), Parents of Wonolo (PoW), and People Out at Wonolo and Allies (POWA). Individuals seeking to work at or with Wonolo are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status under all applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Wonolo Privacy Statement
By providing your personal information and/or submitting your application, you agree that Wonolo may use your personal information for the purposes of carrying out its recruitment and hiring process, which may include, but not limited to, reviewing your qualifications, verifying your information, communicating with you about the recruitment process, and retaining your personal data as otherwise needed for recruitment-related activities.

Information you provide Wonolo as part of the recruitment process is accessible only to those Wonolo employees and other third-party service providers involved with Wonolo's recruitment, interview, and onboarding process. Wonolo does not disclose your personal information to any third party in a manner that would be considered a sale under applicable laws. By providing your personal information as an applicant for this position or any other position at Wonolo, you agree that your personal data may be transferred and/or disclosed to Wonolo's third-party providers. This may include transfers to servers and databases outside the country where you provided Wonolo with your personal data.

This position is not open to applicants residing in or otherwise based in the State of Colorado or New York City. The work location is flexible if approved by the Company, except that the position may not be performed remotely from within the State of Colorado or New York City.

title: Marketing Operations Manager
description:
You found us. Awesome. Something led you here, maybe a glimpse of potential and something amazing? Well that’s how we feel about Klue.   

Everyone has competitors, yet few know them well. Cue Klue. We are a team relentlessly focused on creating industry leading software to enable every department of every business to leverage the best of the web’s knowledge and the collective insights of their own people.

We are a high-growth company with:
- An experienced leadership team at the helm
- Risk-takers and builders who own it and get IT done
- Combined group, who love the fact that not everything is defined, so we can innovate, create, ignite

Joining Klue, you’ll have the opportunity to own your zone, experiment and find what works. Then execute with the support of a team propelling you forward. We’re all creating this industry leading product.  It's an experience that will no doubt change your career forever.

We’re growing and currently looking to add a Marketing Operations Manager to our team. This role is a key player in the enablement of the Marketing team. Your mission is to automate and improve processes and systems through strategic data analysis to identify opportunities for growth and scalability.

What you’ll do:

  • This role will help define the marketing strategy including campaign execution, reporting, marketing attribution and segmentation
  • Building, maintaining, optimizing, and integrating a set of marketing tech stacks (including Hubspot, Chilipiper, Unbounce, and Outreach). 
  • Working closely with business partners across the organization including our Rev Ops Manager to ensure our tech stacks integration across the entire buyer journey.
  • Analyze the efficiency of marketing programs, create and develop improved reporting systems across the marketing function (to support demand gen, content, brand, SDR and PMM teams) and develop insights where marketing could improve outcomes.

This is you:

  • Data driven, analytical with a strategic mindset
  • Proven problem solver, inquisitive, curious
  • Have a builder mindset who loves to have impact through action
  • Team focused, collaborative
  • Inspire and ignite those around  you
  • Experienced managing and mining a CRM
  • Experienced in managing marketing processes
  • Motivated by finding the story in data, team wins, and the opportunity to build something incredible
If you’re hooked and feeling more curious about us, or the role - reach out. Let’s see if there is a great home here with you, now or in the future.

We’re an award winning company, recently named one of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone HC, included on Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50 list, and winning Tech Culture of the Year at the Technology Impact Awards. We think there is something pretty special going on here. Don’t miss your chance to have a seat on the rocketship before it takes off. 

As #kluecrew grows, we’ve made a commitment to support and contribute to a diverse environment; on our teams and in our community. While we’ll admit we haven’t figured it all out and realize this is a long journey for us all. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have dedicated that commitment to our current and future #kluecrew. During the interview process, please let us know if there is anything we need to make more accessible or accommodate to support you to be successful.

All interviews will be conducted via video calls. We will continue, while safe to work in a hybrid model of WFH (remote) and in-office. We are excited to work together again in a space, but just as excited to have great people across timezones help us strive for that high quality asynchronous team communication.

We’re excited to meet you and in the meantime, get to know us:
ED&I Initiatives & Commitments - Pay Up For Progress & 50 - 30 Challenge & Klue Blog
️ Series A (2020)
Series B (2021)
Culture, culture, culture!
Glassdoor
About Us
Twitter
Instagram
☕️ LinkedIn
Angel.co

title: Manager/ Sr. Manager - CPG Consulting (DTC)
description:
Tiger Analytics is an advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for several Fortune 100 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our consultants bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI. Our business value and leadership have been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for someone with a good blend of business consulting skills and a data analytics background. If you are passionate about working on unstructured business problems that can be solved using data, we would like to talk to you.


Responsibilities:

  • Work on the latest applications of data science to solve business problems in the Direct to Consumer (DTC) Space
  • Conduct solution and requirement workshops involving business and analytics stakeholders
  • Leverage DTC best practices to define and design advanced analytics solutions
  • Participate in discussions with team members to select and apply relevant analytic techniques and create actionable business insights
  • Ability to understand the business context by discussing existing data models with senior client leaders and deriving useful business insights
  • Ability to break down a project into specific tasks involving business analysis, data science, and engineering
  • Direct teams of business analysts to create data-driven solutions
  • Architect data analytics frameworks and solutions to solve data-driven business problems
  • Use Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Operational Research techniques to develop data models
  • Report the results and insights using business intelligence tools
  • Responsible for making presentations to senior management, communicating results to business teams, and develop plans to help operationalize analytic solutions
  • Being able to effectively communicate with and manage expectations across stakeholders

Requirements

  • 6-10 years of professional work experience with at least 5 years in business data analytics in the DTC space
  • Prior experience working in the consumer goods / Retail industry
  • Have led Digital and analytics transformation programs
  • Experience working with large data sets would be preferable (with an emphasis on business analysis problems)
  • Experience in working with offshore teams
  • Bachelor's degree in business administration or a closely related field. MBA preferred
  • Ability to engage with executive/VP level stakeholders from the client’s team to translate business problems to high-level analytics solution approach
  • Strong project management and team management skills and ability to work with global teams
  • Strong SQL skills and excellent knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau
  • Knowledge of statistical and machine learning algorithms
  • Exposure to cloud platforms and big data systems such as Hadoop HDFS, Hive is a plus

Benefits

Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.
