title: 437 | Brand Marketing Manager
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Bloom is a full-service workplace design consultancy representing 437 on their search for a Brand Marketing Manager to join their team. As Talent Advisors, we will be the liaison between 437 and yourself during this recruitment process. We do not use fancy tech to search through resumes at Bloom; every resume is reviewed by a human to ensure that we attain a consistent and equitable interview process. You will directly join the team at 437 if you are selected as the successful candidate. We look forward to receiving your application!
-------

“Before starting 437, finding swimwear that made us feel confident and sexy was next to impossible. So we dreamt up our perfect bikini—one that was curve-hugging and meticulously cut. Turns out, it was your dream bikini too.” Hyla Nayeri + Adrien Bettio"

Hi! We are Hyla Nayeri and Adrien Bettio, Co- Founders of 437. We built 437 when we saw a gap in the swimwear market. We have since gained over 290K social followers and stolen the hearts of our customers from around the world. Since our start 5 years ago, we have expanded beyond our bestselling swimsuits to creating apparel. Through our growth, our vision for the company remains the same: to continue empowering our customers through our thoughtful designs, branding, and voice.

In order to continue doing so, we are looking to expand our 437 team! We are looking for a Brand Marketing Manager who aligns with our company values as we take pride in hiring and empowering individuals to reach their full potential in a welcoming, challenging and fun environment.

About You

We are looking for a talented Brand Marketing Manager who is passionate about fashion and marketing. You are excited about growth and are curious about how to grow in multiple different ways. You are creative and strategic, you are excited to test new ideas and stay ahead of the curve.

If the thought of joining a growing and dynamic team excites you, then we want to hear from you!

The opportunity

As the Brand Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all non-performance facets of marketing of 437. You wil be driving overall customer growth and retention by optimizing current channels and developing new marketing strategies internationally.

Reporting in Hyla, Co-founder, you will help drive strategy, KPIs, oversee results, and the execution of campaigns. You will also be managing budget distribution and the daily operations of Marketing. You will have full autonomy to build new processes that allow your team to become experts in their craft.

We’re looking for a strategic, creative, and inquisitive leader who can break down problems and deliver impactful solutions while building an elite team!

How We Hire
Like Bloom, 437 iscommitted to a fair and equitable hiring process for all candidates. To ensure that each candidate’s journey is consistent and the selection process is unbiased, the team at 437 will not be responding to any personal messages regarding this role or other opportunities.

The Interview Process
Round 1: Phone screen with a Talent Advisor from Bloom
Round 2: Virtual 60-minute interview with Hyla and Adrien, Cofounders
Round 3: Virtual 60-minute interview with a 437 Panel including Aparna, Performance Marketing Manager, Hyla and Adrien, Cofounders
Round 4: Virtual 60-minute interview with a 437 Panel including Hyla and Adrien, Cofounders and another Cross-functional team member.
Round 5: Conduct References + Offer.

Following the advice of Canadian health authorities, to mitigate the risk of potential spread of COVID-19 and support social distancing, all recruiting activities including interviews and new hire on-boarding will be conducted virtually.

Total Rewards
Annual Salary ranges from $75,000 CAD to $90,000 CAD
We are flexible, so please apply if you think you’re the right person!

Perks at 437
Besides salary and product-based perks, we also offer full time employees a competitive benefits package. You will also join an open and collaborative environment with lots of autonomy to make a huge impact and opportunities to learn and grow in a fun, professional and fast-paced environment.

Location
Our HQ is located in Toronto, Ontario. This role is a hybrid role and does require you to be onsite.

---------

At 437, we are looking for creative and intelligent minds who will contribute to defining the future of swimwear and apparel. Being bold, taking risks and creating something unique for the everyday woman is our core intention. Once you’ve applied, if we like what we see, you’ll have a phone chat with our recruiter, then a couple of meetings with the team. We’ll take you through our exciting expectations of this role and how you can make an impact, then we make an offer. We believe in moving fast.

437 is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds, disabilities and perspectives to apply. For any accessibility-related assistance, requests for information in accessible alternative formats or to report any accessibility problems, please share in your application or email jade@buildwithbloom.com.

#LI-Hybrid</section>

title: Head of Marketing
location: Area F (Mcconnell Creek/Hatzic Prairie), British Columbia
description:
Led by funding from Crosslink Capital, Bullpen Capital and Y Combinator, Roofr is the all-in-one sales platform for roofers to grow their business- from fast and accurate satellite roof measurements to project-winning proposals.  

Our mission is to ensure every family across North America has access to protect their home with an affordable roof. 

The right candidate for this role has both experience and is passionate about working in a product-led, fast-paced B2B SaaS organization. The Head of Marketing will be responsible for all marketing functions including but not limited to brand, demand generation, content creation, messaging, storytelling, digital marketing strategy /execution, communications, events and marketing operations.

 They will be responsible for building a world class marketing team, and leading them from insight to execution to help scale our offerings. We are looking for a leader who will roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty with their team, managing with a servant leadership focus . 

The Head of Marketing will collaborate with key leaders across the business, from sales, success, revenue operations, partnerships and product to build and implement strategic plans to elevate awareness of the company, communicate our uniquely differentiated story, offerings, and value propositions, grow interest in Roofr and generate demand from targeted markets that achieves our company objectives and builds customer advocacy. 

This role offers an experienced, motivated, and hardworking marketing leader the opportunity to build marketing at Roofr from the ground up. We need a master of using the right and left-hand sides of the brain. We are looking for a forward thinking marketing leader who can position Roofr as a game changing stand out in the industry.

What you will do:

  • Define, monitor, and report on KPIs that quantify product success. 
  • Analyze both qualitative and quantitative data to better understand our user's behavior and apply those learnings to our marketing initiatives 
  • Own the product-led motions
  • Craft and execute marketing campaigns via SEM, paid social, email, display, and events to accelerate customer acquisition.
  • Develop GTM for new features and product launches.
  • Act as a project manager for all of the marketing-related initiatives your team is responsible for, ensuring that all initiatives are on time, on budget and adequately resourced.
  • Build the marketing department from the ground up. Source, hire, and manage a team of both marketing specialists and managers that will help Roofr reach its objectives. Provide guidance and feedback and act as a mentor to all marketing team members.
  • Ensure our brand message is strong and consistent across all channels and marketing efforts (like events, email campaigns, web pages and promotional material)
  • Identify opportunities to reach new market segments and expand market share. Monitor competition (acquisitions, pricing changes, and new products and features). Conduct general market research to keep abreast of trends and competitor’s marketing movements
  • Successfully navigate the post-COVID events world, so we participate in the right events at the right level and have the greatest possible impact.
  • Support the partnerships team with resources and marketing best practices to ensure co-marketing efforts are optimized for success
  • Work closely with leaders across the organization to collaborate on company-wide strategy.

What you’ll bring:

  • 5+ years of experience in managing both Brand/Product + Performance Marketing teams in a high velocity,product-led growth, SaaS B2B organization 
  • Strong hiring ability with experience building out Marketing teams
  • Experience taking a company from early traction to $20M+ ARR
  • Experience scaling a team from Series A to Series C and beyond
  • Obsessed with customer experience 
  • Expert in product-led growth

What you are:

  • You are flexible with an ability to quickly adapt to new situations
  • You're innovative and solution-oriented
  • Team player with demonstrated collaboration skills
  • You are a strong communicator with great presentation skills
  • You are analytical with a demonstrated ability to utilize data to make informed decisions
  • You are highly organized and can prioritize and juggle multiple projects at once
  • You are a critical thinker who doesn’t settle for the status quo
  • You are obsessed with customer experience
  • You sweat the details.
  • You are an empathetic leader with a desire to listen
  • You are a charismatic leader with a strong EQ and coaching adaptability

What you’ll get:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Health Benefits from day 1
  • Flexible PTO
  • Remote-First Culture with home office set-up and quarterly or bi-annual retreats!
Our Commitment: Roofr is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building an organization that empowers inclusion and diversity. We believe that diversity drives innovation. At Roofr, everyone is welcome and employees are comfortable being authentic at all times.

title: Department Manager, Marketing and Communications 2022 - Remote
description:
Department Manager, Marketing and Communications - Remote

This position is available Canada-wide. It is a full-time contract position.

You must apply using our easy-apply portal: https://ontariomusicians.easyapply.co/

Note: Emails regarding this position come from a "Get Hired" account, and may be delivered to your spam folder. For support, please email

jobs@canadianmusicians.coop

.

This program pays at least minimum wage for your province. The summer employment length is 7-16 weeks between the beginning of May and beginning of September. 

Students at a post-secondary institution are welcomed and encouraged to apply for this position as part of a program’s requirements for a co-op or work placement.

As a Department Manager, you will oversee and be responsible for all operations and staff within the Marketing and Communications department. The Marketing and Communications department includes Marketing and Communications Coordinators and Social Media Coordinators. The Department Manager will take part in hiring and onboarding processes for their prospective staff, including training and orientation, and will be responsible for scheduling, guiding, and supporting the department’s work and goals. Department Managers and Program Administrators will also meet at least weekly at a company Leadership meeting, and will take part in leading company-wide staff meetings. Each Department Manager will report directly to Corporate Services, including the Managing Director and other members of the Leadership Team.

 

The Marketing and Communications department will perform marketing, communications and public relations duties for The Co-op. The Marketing and Communications Coordinators are knowledgeable on aspects of The Co-op, including brand image, brand identity, and funder-required social media usage, in order to facilitate the external-facing requirements of the organization. They develop all external-facing communications, including press releases and social media posts, ensuring that they align with the objectives and requirements of The Co-op. The Marketing and Communications Coordinators work closely with Social Media Coordinators to ensure our social media presence meets The Co-op’s objectives. Marketing and Communications Coordinators also engage in grant writing activities. 

 

Due to federal funding requirements for this program, successful applicants must be:

  • 15–30 years of age on their first day of work

  • A Canadian citizen, have a permanent resident card, or be protected under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (there is no requirement to be a student) 

  • Residing in Canada during the length of the employment.

Duties and Responsibilities: 

  • Plan, organize, direct, control and evaluate the operations of the Marketing and Communications department in consultation with Corporate Services and other members of the Leadership Team

  • Establish administrative procedures to meet objectives set by the Board of Directors and the Leadership Team

  • Work with staff engaged in providing records management, finance, human resources or other administrative services

  • Draft communications materials and proposals as needed

  • Develop, implement and evaluate public relations strategies and programs designed to inform stakeholders, employees and the general public of initiatives and policies of businesses, governments and other organizations

  • Arrange and promote interviews, news conferences and other media events

  • Act as spokesperson for the organization and answer written and oral inquiries

  • Coordinate special publicity events and promotions for internal and external audiences

  • In coordination with the Social Media Coordinators, maintain social media accounts, including managing reviews and testimonials, and responding to comments

  • Support Corporate Services in the organization and maintenance of multiple grant writing projects

  • Prepare or oversee preparation of reports, briefs, speeches, presentations, and press releases

  • Plan, administer and control budgets for contracts, equipment and supplies

  • Prepare reports and briefs for management committees 

  • Cooperate with HR to interview, hire, onboard and oversee training for staff

  • Communicate job expectations to staff

  • Ensure company goals and objectives are being met by each employee and provide feedback

  • Motivate and inspire staff and facilitate personal growth through team and individual activities and goal-setting

  • Attend regular meetings with other leaders, including the Managing Director, to plan and address company and programming needs

  • Approve timesheets and time off requests for staff under their supervision

  • Set strategic long and short-term departmental goals and evaluate outcomes

  • Foster a productive work environment

  • Ensure adherence to company and industry regulations

  • Perform other appropriate duties as assigned by management

 

Education/experience requirements:

  • The ideal candidate will possess or be nearing completion of a post-secondary or post-graduate program in Business Administration; or possess equivalent work experience and knowledge. 

  • The ideal candidate will have one to three years of experience as a manager, supervisor, or leader (including, but not limited to, peer mentors, camp counsellors, instructors, etc.). 

  • Experience and familiarity with membership-based organizations is an asset.

  • Experience creating and implementing strategies for an online work environment is an asset.

 

Key Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and other characteristics: 

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Personable demeanor

  • Outstanding organization skills

  • Ability to collaborate with several teams at once, managing your work within multiple initiatives simultaneously

  • Ability to diffuse difficult situations (e.g. complaints, concerns) and address accordingly in compliance with company policies and procedures 

  • Prioritization

  • Meeting deadlines

  • Critical thinking skills

  • Active problem-solving skills

  • Accuracy in data entry

  • Intermediate computer literacy using the following systems and software:

    • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)

    • Google Workspace (Gmail, Google Drive, Google Docs, Google Calendar, etc.)

    • Online communications platforms (Slack, Discord, Zoom, etc.)

     

    The Co-op seeks individuals who enjoy collaboration, creativity, learning new skills, and engaging with artists and the community. This position may involve working some evenings and weekends as needed for special events and items needed on an urgent basis.  

    As part of your application, you must submit a portfolio of your relevant skills and areas of expertise. This could include a professional portfolio, your past freelance projects, or school assignments. Please utilize Google Drive, Dropbox, or equivalent platform to link these files, and ensure that application screeners will be able to open the files without needing to log into that platform. Files submitted as part of your portfolio will be kept confidential and unpublished.

    To have your application considered by the Hiring Team, all pre-interview questions must be filled out completely. Please note that there are no part-time positions this year.

     

    If you are successful in our initial screening, you will be invited to a formal job interview.

    Additional Information

    Membership is not required to participate in the competition for this position, and no preference is given to existing members in our ranking process, however, upon acceptance of an employment contract, all employees are required to join the co-operative.


    Those not selected for an employed position are still welcome to join The Co-op as members. Professional Creator members have access to the same live or digital resources, support and community as those in our musician programs.

     

    Canadian Musicians Co-operative welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please email

    jobs@canadianmusicians.coop

    if you have any questions or require accommodations as part of the application or interview process.

    We thank you for your interest in Canadian Musicians Co-operative and for participating in our competition. Only those candidates selected for consideration will be contacted.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
**AN ENGLISH VERSION FOLLOWS**


Notre cœur est la science. Nos solutions sont accessibles. Notre mission est de donner du pouvoir aux gens.


La famille de solutions numériques de Carebook, puissantes, très engageantes et centrées sur le client, permet aux pharmacies, aux employeurs et aux assureurs de permettre à leurs clients, employés et assurés de prendre le contrôle de leur parcours de santé, à chaque étape. Carebook est le connecteur d'un nouveau modèle de soins de santé et sert actuellement plus de 3,5 millions de titulaires de licence dans le monde.


Basé à Montréal, avec des bureaux à Winnipeg et Kelowna, et dirigé par une équipe de classe mondiale et un conseil d'administration ayant une vaste expérience des affaires mondiales et de l'industrie des soins de santé, le cœur de Carebook est la science et la technologie, sa philosophie est people-ﬁrst, et son objectif est la santé accessible et connectée pour tous.


Carebook poursuit une stratégie disciplinée de fusions et acquisitions parallèlement à une croissance organique afin de se développer dans la verticale des pharmacies et d'ouvrir les verticales des employeurs et des assurances. L'une des principales stratégies de croissance de Carebook consiste à développer sa plateforme à l'aide de technologies de pointe et d'acquisitions rentables. Carebook a récemment acquis deux entreprises de premier plan, InfoTech et CoreHealth, qui offrent toutes deux des produits et des plateformes logicielles robustes, des équipes de gestion solides et des bases de clients de premier ordre.


Les actions de Carebook se négocient à la TSXV sous le symbole "CRBK" et les actions de la société se négocient également sur les marchés OTC sous le symbole CRBKF et à la Bourse de Francfort sous le symbole PMM1.


Plus d'informations sur www.carebook.com



VOTRE DÉFI


Vous concevez des produits numériques de haute qualité et avez l'habitude de travailler en collaboration avec des équipes multidisciplinaires très performantes. Vous êtes comme un poisson dans l'eau lorsqu'il s'agit de travailler sur le design, des sessions stratégiques aux ateliers tactiques, et vous n'avez pas peur de retrousser vos manches pour faire bouger les choses.



En tant que designer, vous avez l'occasion de :

  • Utiliser une approche pratique et en collaboration avec une équipe multidisciplinaire - comprenant des concepteurs UX et UI, des propriétaires de produits et des développeurs - diriger la conception de la prochaine génération d'application et d'écosystème de santé et de bien-être.
  • Vous dirigerez les efforts de conception en produisant des maquettes, des prototypes, des actifs d'interface utilisateur, des cartes du parcours de l'utilisateur, une architecture de l'information, une conception de l'interaction et bien plus encore.
  • Concevoir des expériences agréables à regarder et naturelles à utiliser, qui favoriseront l'engagement et la fidélisation des utilisateurs.
  • Contribuez à la définition de la vision du produit et faites-la passer par toutes les étapes de la conception.
  • Mettez à profit votre expérience en matière de conception, de la créativité à la connaissance des processus, pour vous assurer que la boucle de retour d'information sur le produit est fréquemment et efficacement activée afin de fournir des produits de qualité qui résolvent de manière élégante les problèmes des utilisateurs.
  • Concevoir les expériences et les tests de recherche UX, compiler les résultats et présenter les informations à l'équipe produit et aux parties prenantes.
  • Articuler et présenter clairement le résultat de la conception aux parties prenantes et aux autres membres de l'équipe, et inclure le retour d'information dans les itérations suivantes.



VOUS AVEZ

  • Une connaissance approfondie de l'utilisabilité, de l'architecture de l'information, des meilleures pratiques et des normes de conception (accessibilité, Android vs iOS, web, etc.).
  • De multiples expériences de conception de produits, de leur construction, de leur réalisation, de leur modification et de la répétition du cycle complet !
    10 ans d'expérience en UX/UI ou en conception de produits numériques - web et mobile.
  • Vous avez le souci du détail, de l'utilisateur et de la créativité dans la résolution de problèmes et la mise en œuvre de solutions.
  • Expérience des produits B2C et B2B
  • Fortes compétences organisationnelles et gestion du temps
  • Expérience de l'évolution dans le cycle de développement Agile/Scrum, de la création et de la livraison d'un design de haute qualité dans les délais impartis.
  • À l'aise pour travailler avec les contraintes d'une équipe de développement en démarrage
  • Excellent niveau d'anglais et de français écrit et parlé


Êtes-vous prêt à relever le défi ? Carebook est en pleine croissance et recherche des personnes motivées et énergiques pour nous aider à aller de l'avant. Est-ce que cela vous convient ? Nous sommes impatients d'avoir de vos nouvelles ! ... Ce n'est pas tout à fait ça, mais vous avez la bonne personne en tête ? Partagez avec elle !

-------------------------------------------------------------


Our core is science. Our solutions are accessible. Our mission is to empower people.


Carebook’s family of powerful, highly engaging, customer centric digital solutions empower pharmacies, employers, and insurers to enable their customers, employees, and insurees to take control of their health journeys, every step of the way. Carebook is the connector to a new model of healthcare and currently serves over 3.5 million license holders around the world.


Based in Montreal, with offices in Winnipeg and Kelowna, and led by a world-class team and board of directors with extensive global business and healthcare industry experience, Carebook’s core is science and technology, its philosophy is people-ﬁrst, and its goal is accessible, connected health for everyone.


Carebook is pursuing a disciplined M&A strategy in parallel with organic growth to expand in the pharmacy vertical and to open both employer and insurance verticals. One of Carebook’s key strategies for growth is to build out its platform with leading technology and accretive acquisitions. Carebook recently acquired two leading companies, InfoTech and CoreHealth, with both companies offering robust products and software platforms, strong management teams and blue-chip client bases.


Carebook's shares trade on the TSXV under the symbol "CRBK" and the company's shares also trade on the OTC Markets under the symbol CRBKF and Frankfurt Stock Exchange under the symbol PMM1.


More at www.carebook.com


YOUR CHALLENGE


You design high quality digital products and are accustomed to doing it collaboratively with multi-disciplinary high performers. You are like a fish in water when it comes to working on design  from strategic sessions to tactical workshops and are not afraid to roll your sleeves to make it happen.


As a Designer, you have the opportunity to:


  • Utilize a hands-on approach and in collaboration with a multidisciplinary team - including UX & UI designers, product owners and developers - leading the design of the next generation of health and wellness application and ecosystem
  • Spearhead design efforts by producing low and high resolution wireframes, prototypes, UI assets, user journey maps, information architecture, interaction design, and more
  • Design experiences that are beautiful to look at and natural to use that will foster user engagement and retention
  • Contribute to the product’s vision definition and carry it through all the design stages
  • Bring your design experience, from creativity to process knowledge, in play to make sure we fly the product feedback loop frequently and effectively to deliver great products that elegantly solve users’ pains
  • Design the UX research experiments and tests, compile the results and present the insights to the product team and stakeholders
  • Clearly articulate and present the design output to the stakeholders and other team members, and include the feedback in the next iterations


YOU HAVE

  • Deep understanding of usability, information architecture, design best practices & standards (accessibility, Android vs iOS, web, etc)
  • Multiple experiences of envisioning products, building it, see it come to life, tweaking it and repeat the whole cycle!
  • 10 years of UX/UI or product design experience working with digital products - web and mobile
  • Attention to detail, user first orientation, and creativity in problem-solving and solution implementation
  • Experience with B2C and B2B products
  • Strong organizational skills and time management
  • Experience evolving in Agile/Scrum development cycle, creating and delivering high quality design on time
  • Comfortable working with start-up development team constraints
  • Excellent written and spoken English and French levels

 

Are you up for the challenge? Carebook is growing quickly and seeking motivated and energetic individuals to help propel us forward. Does this sound like a right fit? We can’t wait to hear from you! … Not quite right, but you have the right person in mind? Please share with them!



Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: UX/Information Designer (Remote/Hybrid Optional)
description:
Markit Digital is dedicated to the delivery and presentation of financial data, transforming complex information into elegant user experiences. As a leading Software as a Service (SaaS) provider in the financial services industry, our innovative visualizations are the standard for interpreting, manipulating and displaying financial information.

The design team at Markit Digital is one of the largest in the financial industry. Our work, and how we work affects the way our clients do business, how their users make important decisions and what finance means to the world. As individuals, we come from many backgrounds and perspectives. While some of us have finance experience, our larger belief is that new ideas come from learning, research, analytical thinking, questioning and translating what we know to new contexts. In our data-driven world, making the complex simple is a prime challenge. This is the core of what we do.

Have you ever thought about the typical user experience involved with trading on the stock market? Does the poor design of your banking app often leave you scratching your head? What if you could make it better? We’re in the business of making the financial world friendlier and we’re looking for energetic designers who can geek out about data and ways to present it to regular humans. You’ll be exposed to a plethora of unique projects and challenges from clients located both domestically and around the world—Australia, Singapore, Italy and the UK, to name a few—and the solutions are never cookie-cutter.

As a Designer you have:

  • One or more years design experience; focusing on interface and data display for web, mobile and desktop applications.
  • Mastery of your tools—Adobe Creative Cloud and interactive prototyping tools. Familiarity with HTML, CSS and Java Script would also be helpful.
  • An analytical and visual mind, with a hunger for learning and a desire to solve complex human problems with technology.
  • Strong process—concept and refine designs through sketches, diagrams, wireframes, visual designs and interactive pieces.
  • A desire to challenge yourself both personally and professionally; as well as staying current with technology and interaction design trends.
  • Knowledge of UI animation, Storyboarding, Motion graphics, 3D a plus.

-----------------------------------------------

Equal Opportunity Employer:

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law.  Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: 

EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com

 and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. 

US Candidates Only:

title: Partner Marketing Manager
description:
Uberflip is a marketing technology company founded in 2012 with 170+ employees and headquarters in Toronto. Customer-facing teams use the Uberflip platform to package marketing collateral into mini, personalized websites that educate buyers on their product or service. Uberflip's core product features enable marketers to centralize and organize all their content, drive consumption with an AI-powered recommendation engine, and get data and analytics to measure and optimize the performance of content and campaigns. Our Uberflip Analytics & Enrichment give marketers the ability to integrate their favourite tech with our platform. 

We're on the search for a Partner Marketing Manager!

Reporting into the Senior Manager, Growth Marketing, the Partner Marketing Manager will be responsible for driving co-marketing activities with Uberflip’s technology, agency, and strategic partners. Through a range of digital and offline campaigns, you will work with our partners to create an incredible joint-customer experience, aligning content and other strategies to drive adoption, retention and advocacy of the Uberflip platform. You will work closely with the Sales, Growth Marketing, Partner, and Customer Success teams.

Please note this is a 12 month contract position.

What you will be doing:

  • Create, execute and optimize a go-to-market strategy in conjunction with our Strategic Partnerships team and Marketing team
  • Leverage existing Uberflip technology, processes, content, and campaigns to drive partner-sourced pipeline
  • Take responsibility for a owning a pipeline contribution number sourced direct or indirect from partner marketing activities
  • Design and manage how our partner ecosystem is included and represented throughout the buyer journey on our digital properties
  • Working with Growth & Customer Marketing to develop joint-case studies, use cases and other content to educate prospects on joint value propositions
  • Participate in partner events and design and execute Uberflip events that allow for partner participation
  • Forecast, measure, analyze and report on the impact of partner marketing activities on sales pipeline and revenue
  • Constant communication with the sales organization, ensuring alignment on metrics, messaging, buyer persona, and other key business initiatives.
  • Manage and maintain the Partner Marketing budget

We want to talk to you if:

  • Minimum five years in partner marketing or demand generation, B2B software-as-a-service marketing experience preferred
  • Strong understanding of marketing and partner ecosystems 
  • Demonstrated track record of directly managing a mix of modern growth marketing campaigns
  • Clear understanding of ROI analysis and proven analytical ability to track multiple campaigns, analyze results, and recommend changes
  • Experience using Salesforce, Marketo, and Google Analytics
  • Demonstrated experience of working with cross-functional teams, including external 3rd parties
  • Partnering with 3rd party organizations on campaigns for driving revenue growth
  • Strong project management and planning skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously for seamless execution
  • Strong communication and writing skills
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related field 

What you will love about us:

  • Great Company Culture 
  • Inclusive and Collaborative work environment
  • Competitive Health Benefits for you and your family starting day one
  • Wellness Programs including company paid counselling
  • Flexible Working Hours and Remote work flexibility
  • Employee Stock Option Program
  • Unlimited Vacation Days 
  • Additional Paid Health Days
  • Parental Leave Top Up Program 
  • Learning Credits to put towards your professional development
  • (Virtual) Regular Standups, Demos, and Socials to keep us aligned and connected 
  • And so much more!
Uberflip is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. If you're smart and good at what you do, come as you are!

title: Director, Strategic Planning
location: Area F (Mcconnell Creek/Hatzic Prairie), British Columbia
description:
Clio is more than just a tech companywe are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

We are currently seeking a Director, Strategic Planning  to join our Business Operations team. 

What your team does:

The Strategic Planning Team focuses on Strategy Design, Execution Planning, Monitoring, and Governing the Strategy.

The Strategic Planning Team team has a positive, gritty, and supportive culture. We look for curious people that build partnerships across the business, enjoy finding solutions to ambiguous challenges, and love influencing stakeholders towards a common goal -- especially while using their strong financial, critical thinking, SaaS experience, and communications skills to outline the road ahead! In our work together, we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and above all, collaborative.

What youll work on:

  • Build, mentor, coach and grow an efficient strategic planning team that supports the business through strategic guidance, thought leadership, and analytical excellence. 
  • Help shape the strategic planning frameworks and processes used to create transformative growth. 
  • Help build and modify the business strategy for one of the leading high-growth vertical SaaS  companies.
  • Steer the planning and content development and review for our 18-month planning cadence, quarterly Board meetings, and other business plan-related presentations as may be required
  • Work closely with FP&A, Corporate Development / M & A and the Senior Executive team to facilitate the development of Clios 18-month plan and to implement the right operational cadence and reporting to measure progress and ensure accountability to that plan (Operating Rhythm).
  • Monitor and evaluate Clios business strategy and core KPIs and work to drive governance and accountability in partnership with other seniors leaders.
  • Strategically evaluate new growth opportunities in partnership with the S-team and the Extended Leadership Team. Work with cross-functional partners to surface opportunities and threats, outline data-driven strategic decisions, and frame actionable strategic recommendations. Partner with cross-functional leaders to successfully implement recommendations and be jointly accountable for outcomes.
  • Drive the strategy and execution plan to ensure we are operating as a high-performing organization.

What you may have:

  • 8+ years of strategy and operations experience at a top-tier management consulting, fintech and/or growth stage software company.
  • Exceptional facilitation and leadership skills. Demonstrated ability to work in a matrix environment and ability to both influence and develop strong partnerships at all levels.
  • Strong financial and analytical skills along with a deep understanding of SaaS metrics and multiple years of experience working in high-growth SaaS environments.
  • High EQ, strong communicator who knows how to translate analysis into business insights, and communicate objectives, plans, status and results clearly. Excellent communication skills, including business writing and presentations.
  • Strongproject management and change management skills. 
  • Capacity to operate with a strong sense of urgency while focusing on the details to strive for execution excellence.
  • Solutions-oriented, with a track record of identifying and implementing creative solutions.
  • Demonstrated ability with implementing business processes and activity-based metrics including leading and lagging success indicators

Serious bonus points if you have:

  • Strong domain expertise, including legal tech and/or payments.

Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

About Clio

At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system. 

We are an award-winning team that has been recognized as one of Canadas Best Managed Companies, Canadas Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Companys list of Most Innovative Companies.  In line with our mission, weve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative, and most recently, securing a  US$110M Series E funding round and a USD $1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If youve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

title: Pricing Analytics Lead
location: Area F (Mcconnell Creek/Hatzic Prairie), British Columbia
description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest. Affirm, Inc. proudly includes Affirm, PayBright, and Returnly. 

Were looking for intelligent, driven professionals to join our Merchant Pricing team. Merchant Pricing is a function within the broader Finance organization and is responsible for enabling efficient value exchange between merchants and consumers through innovative and strategic pricing solutions and building standard methodologies.

In this role, you will help Affirm scale up its merchant base and achieve profitability targets while managing risk and will collaborate with Commercial, Product, Engineering, Finance, Capital Markets, and internal risk teams. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as interpersonal skills to work cross-functionally and drive forward recommendations.

What you'll do

  • Draw insights from data and design and test new pricing and credit strategies for our top clients. 
  • Manage the profitability of the portfolio and be the owner of your vertical
  • Drive execution by launching and leading cross-functional initiatives and projects
  • Identify opportunities to improve current process and infrastructure
  • Work with various cross-functional teams to assess, define, optimize and scale pricing opportunities for different markets
  • Assist in new product formation and new markets exploration
  • Conduct ad-hoc data analyses
  • Manage external reporting and present to investors and stakeholders

What we look for

  • 5+ years of experience in an analytically-driven strategy role (credit, risk, management consulting, finance, analytics, etc.)
  • A proactive leader that can seek out new opportunities, drive projects, navigate ambiguity and develop creative solutions with minimal guidance 
  • Ability to collaborate and influence across different teams in the organization
  • Experience with SQL, Python, or other scripting languages
  • Enough laziness to find a faster way to do your least favorite tasks
  • Intelligence + Humility. Hubris is the fastest way to blow up a bank!
  • Grit. Lots of grit. Youll wear 7 hats and not love all of them

Location - Remote Canada

#LI-Remote

Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles are remote and can be located anywhere in the U.S. and Canada (with the exception of the U.S. Territories, Quebec, Yukon, Nunavut, and the Northwest Territories) unless the job indicates a different global location. We are currently building operations in Spain, Poland, and Australia.  Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely or from an Affirm office in their country of hire, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our offices in Chicago, New York, Pittsburgh, Salt Lake City, San Francisco and Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.

All full-time jobs at Affirm (excluding interns and apprentices) are tied to a transparent grade-based pay range taking location into account. 

[Colorado Candidates] In accordance with Colorados Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the grade for this position in Colorado is listed above. You can find the Colorado base pay range and benefits here.

If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this role. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people who believe in Affirm's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of waysnot just candidates who check all the boxes.
 
Inclusivity:

At Affirm, People Come First is one of our core values, and thats why diversity and inclusion are vital to our priorities as an equal opportunity employer. You can read about our D&I program here and our progress thus far in our 2021 DEI Report.

We also believe Its On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.

By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy, or the Affirm Employment Privacy Notice (EU) for applicants applying from the European Union, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.

title: Business Development Manager (Remote Opportunity Available)
description:
Job Summary:

Job Description:

Job Description

Reporting into the Head of M&A, the Business Development Manager will be responsible for representing the front-end of Volaris Group's acquisition activities such as: establishing contacts, building, and nurturing relationships with CEO's and owners of global companies. Our focus is to build a strong portfolio of businesses that are specialists in their own market.

We are looking for a Business Development Associate to focus on selected verticals in North America and Europe.


The Company

Volaris Group acquires, strengthens, and grows vertical market technology businesses.  We are not your typical private equity or strategic acquirer.  We never “exit” our investments and operate in a highly decentralized manner.  As a result, our 400+ portfolio businesses have the confidence, entrepreneurial drive, and best practices to dominate their industry.  The Volaris Group is a subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc. (www.csisoftware.com), listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange.


What you will be doing

  • You will drive our acquisition activities of sourcing and nurturing target companies by:

  • Creatively identifying leads for vertical market software businesses meeting our strategic criteria and specific metrics

  • Maintaining and building a proprietary database of industry contacts

  • Developing and conducting prospecting campaigns through digital media, outbound cold calling, emails, in-person meetings, and industry events

  • Demonstrating creativity, persistence, and credibility in reaching out to Owners, Operators, and C-Suite leadership

  • Gathering target company information.


Skills You Will Bring

  • We are looking for someone that is driven to perform, is results-oriented, and has great an attention to detail. You have excellent social skills, a professional demeanor, and are an energetic self-starter.  You are inquisitive and intellectually curious by nature and enjoy forming and nurturing relationships with executives and thought leaders.

  • Excellent academic performance in an undergraduate business degree.

  • Strong communication skills. Fluency in English is necessary

  • Familiarity with Salesforce is necessary.

  • 3+ years of experience in a business development/lead generation role, ideally in a B2B environment.

  • Ability to manage a pipeline of leads and exceed prospecting target quotas. You are highly metrics-driven and possess extensive experience with cold calling founders and c-suite executives to generate an effective acquisition funnel.

  • Confident in presenting to C-suite executives and business owners.

  • Experience working in M&A, software, or technology is considered an asset

  • Professional attitude and a persistent and solid work ethic. Ability to work independently and in a collaborative team-oriented environment.

  • Able to travel up to 10% of your time for tradeshows


What We Offer

  • Flexible work schedules with an opportunity to work remotely

  • Benefits starting on day 1

  • Professional development

  • Employee Stock Ownership Program

  • Opportunity to network with peers within Volaris/CSI

  • ..and more

Worker Type:

Regular

Number of Openings Available:    

1

title: UX Designer - Remote
description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, were empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.

UX Designer

Job location: This is a remote position. You can work from home and be located anywhere in Ontario, Canada.

About the team

As part of the core product team, we work closely with developers and product management to solve complex problems through innovation and user experience design. If you join us, youll work directly with customers and users to understand requirements and work collaboratively with other teams to design the best possible solutions. Testing and validating design decisions take place throughout the design cycle with help from UXR professionals on the team.

At Kinaxis, designers on the UX team lead and facilitate design on a multitude of interesting and challenging projects. Our work includes new product features & experiences, artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) capabilities, and new supply chain solutions. We're also constantly building-up our design system that we call Parcel.

Learn more about UX @ Kinaxis here: http://kinaxis.design.

What you will do

  • Work with cross-functional teams (developers, product managers, UX researchers and fellow designers) to drive design vision and strategy that meets the needs of our users and the market.
  • Create wireframes, storyboards, and prototypes.
  • Contribute to, enhance and leverage from our design system.
  • Visualize ideas and concepts and communicate them effectively and compellingly for internal stakeholders, partners and customers.
  • Socialize and test your designs and iterate with the feedback you receive.
  • Collaborate with peers and stakeholders to design comprehensive solutions, upholding the needs of the user, but sensitive to technical considerations and time to market.
  • Plan and facilitate design thinking workshops to discover customer needs and collaboratively innovate on new solutions.

Technologies we use

  • Miro, for collaborative story-mapping, brainstorming, and early concept generation.
  • Figma, for our design system and high fidelity prototyping.
  • Adobe Creative Suite, for hi-fidelity graphic design and illustration.

What we are looking for

  • An education in Human Computer Interaction, User Interface Design, Industrial Design, or equivalent experience.
  • 3+ years of software design experience, with a portfolio of projects that showcase your design process and skills.
  • A creative mindset and a passion for designing modern, high-quality solutions.
  • Strong communication skills, team-orientation and are responsive to feedback.
  • Analytical skills, a strong attention to detail, and perseverance to understand and solve complex design challenges.
  • A motivation to keep learning and improving.

 

What we have to offer

  • Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovatingour work is never done. Thats because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems theyre passionate about.
  • Great People - We take our work seriously, but we dont take ourselves too seriously! Its in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.
  • Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.
  • Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen. 

    For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the companys blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/.

    Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at

    accommodations@kinaxis.com

    . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

We're also constantly building-up our design system that we call Parcel.", 'Learn more about UX @ Kinaxis here: http://kinaxis.design.', 'Contribute to, enhance and leverage from our design system.', 'Work with cross-functional teams (developers, product managers, UX researchers and fellow designers) to drive design vision and strategy that meets the needs of our users and the market.', 'As part of the core product team, we work closely with developers and product management to solve complex problems through innovation and user experience design. If you join us, youll work directly with customers and users to understand requirements and work collaboratively with other teams to design the best possible solutions. Testing and validating design decisions take place throughout the design cycle with help from UXR professionals on the team.', '3+ years of software design experience, with a portfolio of projects that showcase your design process and skills.', 'Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovatingour work is never done. Thats because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems theyre passionate about.', 'By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.', 'Create wireframes, storyboards, and prototypes.', 'Socialize and test your designs and iterate with the feedback you receive.']

title: UX/UI Designer with User Design Experience
description:
UX/UI Designer with User Design Experience

Designer With A Heart: You’re a talented designer with a passion for resolving user pain points through great design. You’ve got a solid track record of creating intuitive e-commerce experiences. You’re a seasoned pro at crafting wireframes, annotations, and prototypes. If that sounds like you, then you might have what it takes to be our new UX/UI Designer.

You’ll love working here…

We know you’ll thrive in our supportive work environment. AlgaeCal isn’t one of those companies that treats you like a brainless robot, slowly crushing your soul with 80-hour workweeks and pointless projects that never see the light of day. That’s not our style. So if you want to play in the major leagues – but without the stresses of Maddison Avenue – this is the perfect job for you.

This job might be for you if you’ve got….

  • 5+ years of experience in a UI design role with a strong User Design Experience background.
  • A degree in a design-related field.
  • A strong portfolio that demonstrates your mastery of digital design skills.
  • A deep understanding of typography, UI, and visual design culture.
  • Proficiency in Figma, InVision, and Adobe Creative Suite
  • Familiarity with working in an Agile environment.
  • Experience with design systems, user-centered design techniques; sprints & team based concepting.
  • A friendly way of collaborating with stakeholders in the ideation process.
  • A solid understanding of marketing/advertising techniques.
  • Experience working in an e-Commerce environment.

What Will You Earn?

Let’s agree on salary and vacation once we know what you offer, but our goal is to pay above the market rate for your unique skills.

Other Goodies

  • Annual team trip (most recently, Los Cabos, Mexico!) which you are eligible for after one year of employment. This amounts to another week of paid vacation, plus we cover hotel, food, flights and entertainment.
  • AlgaeCal Healthcare Plan (Premiums Covered 100%!), which you're eligible to sign up for after three months of employment
  • Monthly team events and activities
  • Flexible Stat Holidays with the option to bank days for later use
  • Weekly team lunches
  • Casual dress code

How to apply

So, do you have what it takes to become the next member of team AlgaeCal?

Job opportunities like this don’t come along often, and we’ve got a lot to offer our successful applicants. So, to make sure our future UX/UI Designer is the real-deal, will be a great fit, and will thrive at AlgaeCal, we ask a little more than your run-of-the-mill job application:

If this sounds like a position for you, please respond to this advertisement with your resume and cover letter. Please, read carefully:

1. Write a cover letter addressing:

  1. Why you're the best UX/UI Designer for this role. Give quantifiable examples of related achievements.
  2. Describe why you fit perfectly with our values. Read them:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1deCCJZ6tiDiOSlr_W...
  3. What's the toughest challenge you’ve ever overcome in your life? How did you overcome it?
  4. What are the last three books you’ve read?
  5. What do you do for fun?

2. Explain what you’re doing now for a job:

  1. If you don’t have one, explain why.
  2. If you have one, explain why you’re looking elsewhere.

3. Upload your cover letter and resume:

  1. Ensure that your cover letter and resume are saved and sent as one file.

Yes, our hiring process is challenging, but it’s our way of selecting the best--and your way of ensuring your AlgaeCal teammates are tops.

Click the “Apply Now” button on this page and upload your cover letter and resume.

***Note: Please include your cover letter WITH your resume in one document.

Applications without a cover letter will not be read! Include the URL link to your personal website / portfolio****

We are looking to hire as soon as we find the right person, so act quickly and you can also expect a prompt response.


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Senior User Experience Designer - Full Time - Remote - ON/BC
description:
LifeLabs is the largest community diagnostics laboratory in Canada, serving the healthcare needs of Canadians for over 50 years. Our team members are truly centred around our customers, and we know that behind every lab requisition, sample being tested, or investment in technology is an individual and their family counting on us.

 

Consistently named one of Canada's Best Employers by Forbes, LifeLabs has also been recognized for having an award-winning Mental Health Program from Benefits Canada. The passion and commitment of over 6,000 diverse and innovative team members unites and motivates us to ensure our customers receive high quality tests and results that they can trust. Agile, customer-centred, caring and teamwork: we live these values every day in what we do to support our customers and healthcare providers, driving forward our vision of empowering a healthier you.

Make a difference – join the LifeLabs team today!

 

Reports to: Senior Manager, Digital Marketing

 

Purpose of the Role: Focused on building and ensuring a seamless customer experience throughout LifeLabs digital ecosystem. This role will work collaboratively with an integrated team of product managers, researchers, marketers, data architects and developers. The role will embrace the latest methods, tools, and technologies to drive innovation and change. Self-managed and cross-functional, this role will be empowered and have the resources and authority to drive a customer-led digital  transformation

 

Core Accountabilities

  • Ensure an integrated design approach with business areas and the enterprise as appropriate
  • Build and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with business, product, and technology partners to ensure the delivery of industry-leading experiences
  • Advocate for the best client experience. Make recommendations to senior leaders
  • Identify and mitigate risks to the client experience
  • As the business SME, mentor and educate internal stakeholders
  • Work with user experience researcher to understand the users digital issues. Take a design from early concepts to final design
  • Work with user experience researcher to implement and validate ideas on each iteration of customer journey to ensure solutions align with business goals
  • Continue efforts to define design processes, establish design operations and extend our existing design system
  • Articulates, develops and models the end user experience including the visual design of the application, to make user interaction simple, efficient and consistent
  • Leads projects in design, development, documentation, debugging and support of the user interface to have best possible user experience
  • Leverage UX tools to A/B test conversions and campaign elements throughout organizations digital ecosystem
  • Ensure organization is compliant within AODA regulations
  • Experience designing digital solutions that support best practices within search engine optimization and other digital marketing functions

 

Minimum Hiring Requirements

  • University undergraduate degree in related discipline
  • 5-7 years of experience in digital design, interaction, and visual design
  • Experience in the planning, designing, execution, of customer/user experience research
  • An excellent written and verbal communicator with the ability to communicate effectively with all stakeholders, customers, and team members
  • Dynamic, possessing the ability to prioritize multiple work assignments and manage time

 

At LifeLabs, we strive to create an inclusive and equitable workplace where our team members and the communities we serve feel accepted, valued, and respected.

In accordance with LifeLabs’ Accessibility Policy, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. For a confidential inquiry or to request an accommodation, please contact your recruiter or email

careers@lifelabs.com

.

 

LifeLabs is committed to providing a safe environment for our employees, customers, and the communities we serve. We have been a leader throughout the COVID-19 pandemic regarding health and safety measures and have always put our employees and customers at the center of every decision that we make. As an organization in the health care sector, we believe the COVID vaccination adds a layer of protection that complements the extensive and necessary health and safety protocols that we have taken to date. With this in mind, we currently require all LifeLabs employees, contractors, students and volunteers to be fully vaccinated.

LifeLabs operates under a distributed workforce model, where employee flexibility is a key priority. Further information will be provided during the interview process on what this means for employees.

title: Product Designer
description:
Were the technology leader building the modern home management platform. Today, millions of people use Thumbtack to effortlessly manage their homes. We help them confidently know what to do, when to do it and who to hire. 

Our goal is simple: to be the only platform homeowners need to fix, maintain and improve their homes. As a long-term partner for homeowners, our promise is to turn what was once confusing and intimidating into something straightforward and a lot less stressful.

At Thumbtack, we're not just creating a new era of homeownership. Were supporting local economies and building stronger communities. Each day, we connect local professionals across America with busy homeowners so they can grow their businesses. 

Thumbtack is for everyone. Our customers and pros come from all walks of life and every county in the country. We want our team to reflect that. If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply. 

Our North Star is bright and our ambitions are big. Weve been at this for over a decade, but the way we see it: were just getting started.

Thumbtack by the Numbers

  • Available in all 3,143 U.S. counties.
  • Nearly 4.5 million customers in the last 12 months
  • Hundreds of thousands of local professionals on our platform
  • 65 million projects started on Thumbtack
  • Over 7.5 million 5-star reviews left for stellar pros

About the Design Team

We're a tight-knit team of product designers, researchers, and product writers working closely with engineers and product managers to research, explore, and iterate on well-crafted user experiences that are innovative, engaging, and delightful. We collaborate regularly through design reviews, work sessions, and presentations to inspire and influence the direction of the product and company as a whole.

About the Role

As a Product Designer, youll work collaboratively and iteratively to turn complex problems into intuitive user experiences. Youll own projects from conception to launch and measure success through data and user research. Youll play a key role in roadmapping, feature design, and the quality of our products, and your work will impact both user and business goals.

Responsibilities

  • Design intuitive, human-centric flows and experiences on web, iOS, and Android  
  • Collaborate closely with fellow designers, product managers, and engineers 
  • Use research and qualitative data to guide design and development decisions 
  • Analyze the success of your solutions and iterate 
  • Contribute to the visual design of our patterns and design system
  • Present work and use design to build alignment and influence product direction  
  • Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the product and executive teams

Must-Have Qualifications

If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.

  • 4+ years of experience
  • Portfolio with a history of impactful projects that showcase your design process 
  • Demonstrate strong UX, interaction, and visual design skills along with a human-centric approach to designing products.
  • A bias for action and tenacious focus on how your work impacts users and the business 
  • Strong cross-functional collaboration and communication skills.
  • Fluency in commonly used design software and related tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe CS, etc.)

Nice-to-Have Qualifications

  • Experience with helping set product strategy through methods like design sprints, quarterly or yearly planning, and team brainstorms
  • Experience setting a vision for a product experience
  • Experience designing for a two-sided marketplace
  • Prototyping skills (using Invision, HTML, CSS, Framer, Principle, etc.)

Thumbtack is a virtual-first company, meaning you can live and work from any one of our approved locations across the United States, Ontario or the Philippines. When it is safe to gather, we will begin to host in-person events on a regular basis. Remote employees will be expected to travel occasionally for these events to a Thumbtack library or offsite team-building location. In cities with 5+ employees, we are establishing local communities, where employees can gather for local events. Additionally, employees in the San Francisco, Salt Lake City, Toronto and Manila areas will have opt-in access to communal workspace at one of our Thumbtack libraries. We always prioritize the health and safety of our employees. Currently, participation in these events and Thumbtack library use are optional. Both require employees to be fully vaccinated.

More About Us

Thumbtack is a technology leader building the modern home management platform. Through the Thumbtack app, homeowners can effortlessly manage their homes confidently knowing what to do, when to do it, and who to hire. Bringing the $500 billion home services industry online, Thumbtack empowers millions of homeowners to fix, maintain, and improve their most valuable asset. 

Founded in 2008, Thumbtack is backed by over $500 million in funding from folks that include Sequoia Capital, CapitalG, Tiger Global Management, Javelin Investment Partners, Baillie Gifford. 

  • See what its like to work here  
  • Meet the pros who inspire us
  • Follow us on LinkedIn  
  • Discover our virtual first plan

Thumbtack embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you are a California resident, please review information regarding your rights under California privacy laws contained in Thumbtacks Privacy policy available at https://www.thumbtack.com/privacy/.

*Currently, Thumbtackers can live anywhere in Ontario, Canada or the Philippines or in any of the following US states: AZ, CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, HI, IL, IN, KY, MD, MA, MI, MN, MO, NE, NV, NH, NJ, NY, NC, OH, OK, OR, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WI. Our long term vision is to hire across all of the United States and Canada, but this expansion will take a few years.

title: Senior User Experience Strategist (Remote)
description:
We believe that small, collaborative, and cross-functional teams are best equipped to ship the most optimal project outcomes. Within these teams, members of our Strategy group help to bring focus and direction, ensuring the work we produce is supported by principles, delivering on the needs and expectations of both end users and the business.


As a Senior UX Strategist, you’ll lead the research, planning, and design of digital experiences, products, and services. You’ll collaborate with visual designers, strategists, writers, and engineers, to produce a range of deliverables that help bring our work into clarity. This includes everything from rough sketches to schematics, from mockups to prototypes. Through workshops, concepting sprints, and various other methods, you’ll contribute to solutions that help our clients improve how they engage with customers and drive growth. This is an immersive role, ideal for candidates excited to work at the intersection of experience design and business strategy.


This role is open to remote candidates with preference for Toronto or NYC.


What You’ll Do


  • Develop a clear understanding of our clients, their business, and objectives
  • Support the research process from planning through analysis of findings
  • Lead concepting, ideation, and the design of digital experiences, striking a balance between best practices and innovation
  • Help develop deliverables such as personas, user journeys, wireframes, and prototypes
  • Support the planning and facilitation of stakeholder interviews, and workshops
  • Collaborate with your team to ensure we’re considering the full range of opportunities across content, interaction, technology, and integrations
  • Help develop and manage product roadmaps that create alignment on scope
  • Mentor Strategy team colleagues, creating a positive environment for growth
  • Lead presentations to internal teams and client stakeholder groups


What You’ll Bring


  • 5+ years experience in the digital agency, startup, or consulting space
  • A strong portfolio demonstrating skill, craft, thinking, and expertise
  • Deep knowledge of digital platforms, devices, and technologies with specific focus on web, mobile, e-commerce, and digital in-store
  • Experience across product design, journey mapping, user experience, content strategy, information architecture, and interaction design
  • Experience working with UI patterns, grids, and design systems
  • Experience in qualitative and quantitative research, facilication, and analysis
  • Knowledge of usability, accessibility, SEO, analytics, and A/B testing
  • Experience engaging clients and leading workshops with senior-level stakeholders
  • Strength in presenting, persuading, and selling through ideas
  • Degree in business, design, or communication an asset but not required
  • Ability to work within PST and EST time zone work hours


About Engine Digital


At Engine Digital, we believe modern business is driven by a focus on the customer and built upon exceptional brand experiences, seamless digital commerce, and frictionless services. It is through this lens that we help our clients to harness design as the foundation for differentiation and a driver of growth.


We’re committed to building a diverse team and to operating an inclusive organization that represents the makeup of our community. We do not accept discrimination on the basis of gender, race, ethnicity, citizenship, origin, religion, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, or military status. Candidates that only meet some of the stated requirements for the role are encouraged to apply however, only those shortlisted may be contacted.


No recruiters, agencies, or phone calls please.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.
