title: Lead Product Designer (Remote)
description:
We’re in the process of transforming design at Yelp and searching for a Lead Product Designer ready to take the next step in their career. You’ll have ownership of the design of the product you’re working on, and will collaborate with product managers, engineers, writers, researchers, and other designers to make quick decisions in a highly collaborative environment. 

Yelp is the best source of knowledge about local businesses. At Yelp, you'll have the opportunity to have a real impact on a product that hundreds of millions of consumers trust to discover and engage with businesses in their community!

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

This opportunity is fully remote and does not require you to be located in any particular area in Canada. We welcome applicants from throughout Canada.

Where You Come In:

  • Translate quantitative and qualitative insights into high quality product experiences that drive results.
  • Be a champion of our users, and act as an expert of design thinking in the organization.
  • Own large, cross-team projects from concept to completion collaborating closely with cross-functional leaders.
  • Build business context to prioritize your work and identify new opportunities that best position Yelp to execute on its goals.
  • Take an active interest in developing the careers of others through coaching and mentorship.
  • Champion changes that enable strong growth and execution of Yelp Product Design.
  • Build community internally, seek group success over your own, and advocate for Yelp’s values.

What it Takes to Succeed:

  • Ideally 7+ years experience in using design practices and skills that result in high quality work.
  • Know how to thoughtfully design complex products for scale working with an evolving design system. 
  • Are a strong communicator, clearly articulating project information to cross-functional stakeholders across multiple teams.
  • Comfortable working with stakeholders to set priorities and scope across multiple competing projects.
  • Experience designing for consumer-facing or business-facing products across multiple platforms.
Send us examples of some of your recent design work and tell us why you want to join Yelp!

Vaccination against COVID-19 is not required for this role. We nonetheless encourage all employees to get vaccinated. Employees who are not vaccinated may not visit Yelp’s offices or participate in any in-person work activities, and are not eligible to transfer or be promoted to a role that requires vaccination.


#LI-Remote

At Yelp, we believe that diversity is an expression of all the unique characteristics that make us human: race, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, and education — and those are just a few. We recognize that diverse backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our teams and our product. The foundation of our diversity efforts are closely tied to our core values, which include “Playing Well With Others” and “Authenticity.”

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other protected status.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at

title: Product Designer
description:
At Interaxon, we develop engaging experiences using brain-sensing technology. We are a passionate team of researchers, technical experts and scientists building the world’s leading science-based brain platform to empower personal transformation through human-centred innovation. Our Muse headbands are designed to make meditation easier and provide real-time audio and visual feedback on your meditative state through the Muse companion app. www.choosemuse.com


As a  Product Designer at Interaxon, you’ll help turn our product vision into reality. You are a design thinker who is experienced in merging skills in visual design, UX and product management to create and deliver engaging interactions with clean usable interfaces in a mobile app. You are a proactive contributor who enjoys working with emerging technologies. You'll work with a skilled and kind multidisciplinary team to bring meaningful design solutions into the lives of our customers. 

This role is remote-friendly, with a preference for candidates based in Canada. 


This role is remote-friendly, with a preference for candidates based in Canada. 


Your role:

  • Collaborate with cross disciplinary development teams, ensuring product design needs are specified and communicated, deadlines are met, and an industry leading experience is delivered  to our users.
  • Contribute to product roadmap and feature prioritization. actively participate in design workshops to define and sketch new potential features and products.
  • Design interface concepts for new features and communicate them through wireframes, prototypes and animations which can be presented to the team and tested with users.
  • Share your prototypes with application developers to ensure your visual concepts are understood and implemented successfully on native platforms.
  • Work within brand guidelines and collaborate with our marketing team to ensure that all interface design concepts align with the visual brand without sacrificing usability.
  • Keep tabs on other ongoing UX and market research processes (customer feedback, surveys, analytics, ethnography, etc.) to maintain a high-level understanding of product and user experience to continually enhance the user journey.


What you have:

  • A genuine interest in meditation/mindfulness or in learning about it.
  • 3+ years experience designing and bringing apps or digital products to market, demonstrated with a strong portfolio. 
  • Experience managing all aspects of shipping product features, from concept through to post-launch.
  • Curious and passionate about understanding our users through feedback, research, and data insights. Ability to apply that knowledge to create high-impact user experiences through user-centered design practices, excellent tactical visual skills and a solid knack for storytelling. 
  • Self motivated to  clearly present and justify requirements and designs to various stakeholders, articulating requirements to developers and conveying ROI to business leaders.
  • Proficiency in creating mockups, rapid prototypes and animations using Figma, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite.
  • A deep understanding of Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines and/or Google’s Material Design standards.
  • Strong knowledge of the latest digital product trends, product management and design practices (Agile, Lean UX, design sprints (GV), and/or design thinking.



What we offer:


Our collaborative culture is an extension of our vision to empower personal transformation to improve lives and change the world. We have a flexible working environment, on-going work from home options, a great benefits package, weekly team meditations and Zoom yoga, and a commitment to keeping connected while working apart. Join a team passionate about making a difference.


Interaxon is a company fueled on innovation and inclusion.  We believe that diversity is an essential part of our workplace culture, and we continue to grow our team through equal opportunity and barrier-free recruitment. Additionally, if you require any accommodations during the selection process, please let us know!

 

Note: We suggest adding "apps.bamboohr.com" to your contact list so you don't miss any emails from us regarding your application.

Apply for this Position

title: Senior Partner Development Manager
description:
Tigera provides active, zero-trust based security for cloud-native applications running on containers and Kubernetes. Its Cloud-Native Application Protection Platform (CNAPP) prevents, detects, troubleshoots, and automatically mitigates exposure risks of security issues in build, deploy, and runtime stages.

Tigera is the creator and maintainer of Calico Open Source, the most widely adopted container networking and security solution. The company’s software powers more than 100M containers across 2M+ nodes in 166 countries, and is supported across all major cloud providers and Kubernetes distributions.

As our team grows, we are looking for colleagues who not only share our passion for this work and growing our company, but who will also strengthen our company values and help ensure that Tigera remains a great place to work. At our core, our focus is on our customers, who are the heroes of our story; on aiming high and staying nimble in how we get there; on continuous learning to drive our success; and on respecting, collaborating, and supporting each other on a daily basis.

If you are looking to help make a substantial impact, and our values and products align with your vision of your career growth, we want to hear from you!


About Your Role

Tigera is looking for a Senior Partner Development Manager who can lead and grow partner relationships with our major cloud and technology partners. In this highly visible role, you will be responsible for initiating and maturing our partnership and business development initiatives by developing and delivering deeply integrated solutions for our joint customers. These integrated solutions will then be used as a driver for joint co-marketing and co-selling activities.

Partners are pivotal to our long-term success and sustained growth, and this role gives you a rare opportunity to lead and build this growth foundation in an early-stage startup. The role is based out of our offices in either Vancouver, Canada, or the San Francisco Bay area (we have offices in both San Francisco and San Jose). We are also open to evaluating a remote candidate in other locations in North America. The role reports to VP of Business Development and will require a moderate amount of travel.


You Will

  • Define the strategy and execute on the success of the partner relationship
  • Serve as a quarterback for co-engineering, co-marketing, and co-selling initiatives between the partner’s teams and Tigera
  • Drive business opportunities from target partners to support our revenue growth
  • Build mindshare and deep relationships with the solutions architect and sales organizations
  • Evangelize value proposition with their executives, partner team, and product team
  • Achieve and maintain the desired level of partner certification/competency with the target partners
  • Execute quarterly business reviews with managed partners
  • Monitor and report the effectiveness of various partner initiatives internally within Tigera


You Have

  • 6+ years of related partner alliances experience in enterprise software or SaaS
  • Proven track record of initiating and executing partner relationships with large companies
  • Strong technical background and ability to think through technical integration opportunities
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently and cross-functionally
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and self-motivated to build strong relationships and influence partner teams to drive projects to completion
  • Domain experience in Kubernetes solutions, distributions, or cloud providers is a plus
  • An insatiable level of curiosity and a constant learner


Why Join Us

With offices in San Francisco, San Jose, Vancouver (Canada), Cork (Ireland), and London (England), we have a thriving team of diverse individuals from all over the world. We believe in a collaborative, flexible work environment based on respect for, and commitment from, every employee. We also offer a competitive compensation package along with full health, vision, and dental benefits. These benefits, coupled with an amazing team of individuals who believe in our mission and value openness, collaboration, and teamwork, make Tigera an awesome place to work.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer (Remote)
description:
About bird&be

The current fertility experience is broken, and we want your help fixing it. We offer personalized fertility kits, designed to help our customer's optimize their outcomes, no matter the stage of their journey. With rising infertility rates, our kits will help educate our customers on their fertility health early, and help them take action with personalized supplements and prescription medication that is scientifically proven to impact outcomes. All delivered together in a beautiful box right to their doorstep.


This will be done under a brand umbrella that resonates with our customer base. We see a future that is different from the current "family planning" aisles filled with blue and white boxes, plastered with photos of white babies on them. Our brand will reflect the modern millennial. Less First Response, more Knix. 

About you

You want to be part of a small, very early stage startup that has a massive impact on people's lives. You are self-motivated, love to collaborate (Figma is great for that), and are resourceful to get things done. 


You love to design simple, beautiful experiences that can help alleviate this emotional burden from our customers, and help educate them along the way.


You care about the details, and know that sometimes the small things can go a long way. 


We are dealing with a very emotional (and sometimes traumatic) subject matter for our customers, so your empathy must run high. 

The work


As our first full-time Senior UX Designer, you will own the end-to-end customer experience, ensuring a consistent, delightful experience from our ecommerce site & web application, to our packaging and unboxing experience. 


You will be responsible for redefining the fertility education and care experience, and own the design of our eCommerce experience, emails, guides that help people understand more about their fertility health, and other exciting projects that come up. 

 

Your responsibilities

  • Design our e-commerce website and marketing pages

  • Design our Health Assessment, Patient + Doctor Portal, and other web app features

  • Design templates for our emails

  • Define the UX of each different touchpoint with our brand

  • Solve UX problems, with conversion and customer empathy top of mind

  • Perform concept and usability testing and gather feedback

  • Build wireframes and prototypes around customer needs

  • Work with our development team to implement designs to specs

  • Stay informed about competitor products and industry trends

 

Role requirements

  • 5+ years' experience of working as a Designer

  • Significant experience with design software like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe products

  • Experience talking to customers and conducting research

  • Excellent knowledge of interaction design and information architecture

  • Good knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript is a plus

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with business-oriented approach

  • Strong communication skills

  • Copywriting skills would be a cherry on top


Interview Process


Stage 1 - Chat with the COO 

Stage 2 - Portfolio Review with COO & CEO

Stage 3 - Take home challenge

Stage 4 - Offer

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
location: Area F (Mcconnell Creek/Hatzic Prairie), British Columbia
description:
Replicant was founded on the belief that machines are ready to have useful, complex conversations that will transform the way they interact with the world, starting with customer service.

Replicant is building the world's first autonomous contact center that works out-of-the-box to solve customer problems over the phone using voice AI. You can think of Replicant Voice as a self-service, Thinking Machine™. Just like agents, Replicant is able to speak with customers in a natural tone, answer questions without delay, and deflect calls to resolve customer issues quickly. Now, enterprise customers can eliminate hold times, manage unpredictable call volumes, and give agents time back to resolve high empathy cases with a new, human + AI operating model.

If you're excited by AI and human-to-machine communications and want to make an impact with great technologists and strong go-to-market leaders, then look no further. We've grown our team by 3x, increased revenue by 4x, and were named a top enterprise AI company by The Information. We currently serve Fortune 500 customers, run millions of AI calls per month in production, and are increasing our footprint globally.

Replicant is looking for a full stack product marketer who can contribute across all aspects of our business. The Senior Product Marketing Manager will engage with stakeholders across product, sales and marketing to translate our industry-leading technology into compelling messaging, enable the sales team with outstanding tools and content, and help establish Replicant as the premier conversational AI company. This role will be instrumental in driving the success of our GTM strategy, from prioritizing verticals, identifying our ICP, defining our personas, and delivering messaging and content. This position will report into the Sr. Director of Marketing. 

What You'll Do

  • Positioning and Messaging: Develop clear, compelling messaging that sets us apart from competitors and drives sales with both prospects and customers
  • GTM Strategy: Define and manage go-to-market strategy for key industries including messaging, positioning, launch planning, sales enablement, and customer adoption.
  • Verticals and Personas: Identify and prioritize top vertical industries based on TAM, use cases and other criteria. Help define our ideal customer profile and build / maintain our buyer personas
  • Enablement: Work with customer-facing teams and partner with sales enablement to create high-impact narratives, content, collateral and training to drive acquisition, conversion, and expansion
  • Competitive Intelligence: Identify Replicant’s strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities through in-depth market research and enable customer-facing teams to succeed in competitive situations with supporting collateral including win/loss analysis and objection handling
  • Sales Collateral: Create sales and customer-facing content, videos, webinars, and product assets that distill core messages and are inspiring and relevant to companies of various industries and sizes – from mid-market to complex global enterprises
  • Market Research: Talk regularly to customers and prospects to develop a rich understanding of our market, our customers, their needs and how to drive value for them with new business plays
  • Metrics and Iteration: Develop and track metrics (both qualitative and quantitative) that help us understand the success of our products in the market and seek to continuously improve upon that success

What You'll Bring

  • Living our Values: Comfortable embodying Replicant’s values of ownership, humility, high standards, care, low ego, and inclusion
  • Storytelling Mindset: You have deep empathy for customers and are able to adapt how you communicate to best reach and engage your audience. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Passionate: You are deeply engaged in the success of the company, and your own personal growth
  • Curious: You are a lifelong learner who actively seeks new experiences, and wants to understand Replicant’s business, our market, our customers and our technology
  • BA/BS or equivalent working experience in enterprise SaaS and/or AI
  • 4-6 years of experience with product marketing, content marketing or sales/solutions engineering
  • Experience with product-led GTMs and delivering products to market
  • Leadership experience across large, geographically distributed teams
  • Ability to lead and communicate cross-functionally with sales, customer success and other departments

Perks

For all employees, we offer:
  Remote working environment that respects time zone differences
  Highly competitive salaries, equity, and for US Employees, a 401(k) plan
  Top of the line healthcare (medical, vision, and dental)
  Unlimited paid time off, with a minimum of 15 days off per year
✈️  Amazing team trips & offsites where you can find our CEO baking bread for the team

Our Values

Replicant has three core values. It is critical that everyone who joins the team feels excited and moved by these values as every new team member makes an impact on our culture.

Blade Runners: We take ownership and pride to influence the outcomes of our goals. We are successful, and like a Blade Runner, use the tools at our disposal to reach our objectives. We value open and honest communication and proactively seek feedback along the way. We are a company driven to grow and achieve both individually and as a team.

Bread Makers: We are humble and strive toward an egalitarian culture. No task is too big or too small. We work together to achieve our goals and develop our company mission. We believe that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts in everything that we do.

Självdistans (Self-Distance): Självdistans is Swedish for self-distance. It's the ability to critically reflect on oneself and one's relations from an external perspective. With this in mind, we act with objectivity and always remember that we are not our work. There's no perfect science to growing a team or business, but we trust everyone at Replicant to point out our blind spots and humbly admit their own.

title: Strategy Director (Remote)
description:
We believe that small, collaborative, and cross-functional teams are best equipped to ship the most optimal project outcomes. Within these teams, members of our Strategy group help to bring focus and direction, ensuring the work we produce is supported by principles, delivering on the needs and expectations of both end users and the business.


As Strategy Director, you'll lead teams through research, concepting, and ideation to develop innovative digital solutions based on insights. You’ll guide clients towards new opportunities to strengthen the brand and drive growth across digital channels. Through collaboration, you’ll establish the agency as a trusted partner in defining transformative digital experiences. You’ll stay informed and close to culture and trends, from brand to business model innovation, from startup to enterprise. Your understanding of all things e-commerce, direct-to-consumer, and the unbundling of legacy business will help guide the work you lead and the solutions you present as authentic, insightful, and innovative.


This role is open to remote candidates with preference for Toronto or NYC.


What You’ll Do


  • Define the approach and methodology for your engagements
  • Develop briefs, requirements, project plans, and product roadmaps
  • Guide teams towards a clear understanding of our clients, their business, and objectives
  • Lead and direct teams through the concepting and ideation process
  • Plan and lead research efforts and analyze and distill findings into actionable insights
  • Engage client-side stakeholders through workshops, presentations, reviews, and pitches
  • Manage, lead, recruit, and mentor Strategy team colleagues
  • Work with VP Strategy to continually improve and refine capabilities and approaches
  • Contribute to agency marketing, thought leadership, and events


What You’ll Bring


  • 8+ years experience in the digital agency, startup, or consulting space with 2+ years experience managing and leading teams
  • A strong portfolio demonstrating skill, craft, thinking, and expertise
  • Deep knowledge of digital platforms, devices, and technologies with specific focus on web, mobile, e-commerce, and digital in-store
  • Experience across brand strategy, product strategy, service design, journey mapping, user experience, content strategy, information architecture, and interaction design
  • Experience developing qualitative and quantitative research plans, facilitating studies, and distilling insights
  • Experience engaging clients and leading workshops with senior to C-level level stakeholders
  • Strength in presenting, persuading, and selling through ideas to small and large audiences
  • BA/MBA preferred but not required
  • Ability to work within PST and EST time zone work hours


About Engine Digital


At Engine Digital, we believe modern business is driven by a focus on the customer and built upon exceptional brand experiences, seamless digital commerce, and frictionless services. It is through this lens that we help our clients to harness design as the foundation for differentiation and a driver of growth.


We’re committed to building a diverse team and to operating an inclusive organization that represents the makeup of our community. We do not accept discrimination on the basis of gender, race, ethnicity, citizenship, origin, religion, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, or military status.


No recruiters, agencies, or phone calls please.

Apply for This Job

Apply for this Position

Thank You

Your application was submitted successfully.

title: Product Specialist (100% Remote)
description:
Judo is growing quickly, and we're searching for a tech-savvy Product Specialist to help us deliver a world-class customer learning experience.

About Judo:

Judo is a server-driven UI platform for iOS and Android apps that frees up countless hours for product, marketing and engineering teams. Using our Mac app, teams can build user interfaces visually in a fraction of the time it would take otherwise, and can publish them instantly without submitting to the App/Play store.

Judo’s iOS and Android SDKs are installed in close to 100 different apps reaching millions of users. Some of our customers include DraftKings, Cabela’s and the New England Patriots. Judo has established a leadership position in the emerging world of server-driven UI.

Our name derives from the martial art, a key principle of which is “maximum efficiency with minimal effort”. This concept is captured in our mission to enable product teams to build faster and iterate more frequently.

We’re backed by the same group that funded Shippabo, Airtable, LaunchKit and more (TenOneTen and Freestyle VC), a top U.S. accelerator as well as several prominent angel investors. We’ve built a solid reputation with several major sports franchises as clients, and are now charting new territory as we explore the multitude of other industries who could benefit from incorporating Judo into their native app workflows.

About our team:

We’re a group of humans who believe that we’re our most creative and most innovative when we have the flexibility to determine where and when we work. We’re 100% remote and intend to stay that way. Currently we have team members based in Canada, Brazil, Scotland and Poland. We’re intentional about remote culture, and believe that meaningful connections and effective collaboration with teammates aren’t only possible in a remote environment - but that they’re crucial for organizational success.

Things move quickly around here. Judo is a fast-paced, self-directed, energetic environment where everyone is bringing a fiery passion to work every single day. We value hustle, balance, innovation, customer obsession, design-centricity and continuous learning. We’re entrepreneurial in spirit, creative in our thinking, and experimental in our approach.

About the role:

As a Product Specialist at Judo, you'll support our efforts to deliver a world-class customer learning experience. You’ll help us further develop our Learning Center, while playing a pivotal role in helping our enterprise customers with product onboarding and adoption via Slack, email and Zoom.

What you’ll do as a Product Specialist at Judo:

In your first 30 days, you will:

  • Meet with Judo’s CTO and CEO to learn about the company’s history and vision for the future
  • Learn about Judo as a product and as a business, and meet new colleagues from various teams as part of our structured onboarding program
  • Work closely with our Senior Product Specialist Lead to learn the ins and outs of our Judo MacOS, iOS and Android apps
  • Connect with the Customer Success team to gain a better understanding of our enterprise customers’ needs, and the role our product specialists play in customer adoption of the Judo platform

In your first 60 days you will focus on contributing by:

  • Connecting with our dev team leads to better understand the Judo integration process and how we use GitHub
  • Fielding product-related questions from Enterprise customers via email and Slack, as well as engaging with the Judo users on our community forum
  • Working with data sources / APIs to build complex Judo experiences for prospects and customers

In your first 90 days you will take initiative by:

  • Getting involved with the development of our product onboarding strategy for Enterprise customers
  • Tackling special projects related to the enhancement of the Learning Center

What we’d love to see in your work history:

  • 2+ years of experience in a solution-oriented role, such as product support, product specialist or customer success, preferably with an early-stage SaaS company
  • Experience working in a B2B environment, ideally in mobile or with mobile SDKs
  • Familiarity with REST APIs/JSON is a bonus

Some of the attributes we hope you’ll bring to the role:

  • Keen interest in all things digital and the intersection between design and mobile development
  • Comfortable discussing product details & technical configurations in written and verbal channels
  • A solutions-oriented individual who is interested in helping customers and solving problems
  • Attention to detail - we’d love to see you mention “Kano Jigoro” in your cover letter
  • Strong communication skills
  • Fluency in spoken and written English. Knowledge of a second language is considered an asset
  • Entrepreneurial spirit and a “get stuff done” attitude
  • The ability to be self-directed in your work
  • A fierce curiosity for your craft, always striving to learn more and improve yourself
  • The ability to wear many hats, find ways to bring value and a willingness to do what needs to be done
  • A desire to help our team continuously improve. We want you to teach us new things!
  • A demonstrated ability to be productive working remotely and an enthusiasm for remote work environments

A few of the reasons why you should join Judo:

  • We’re a dynamic and entrepreneurial team working on the cutting edge of server-driven UI
  • Small, dynamic teams = massive impact
  • Be part of a high performing team of critical thinkers that thrive on problem-solving
  • Maintain optimal work-life balance in a remote environment with flexible hours
  • We're a quickly-growing startup with competitive salaries and stock option plan
  • Extended health and dental coverage
  • Topped-up maternity and parental leave
  • Subsidized coworking memberships
  • We encourage open communication with management and company leadership
  • Participate in optional virtual social events regularly to connect with colleagues
  • Join us for in-person retreats with the full team twice annually
  • Take part in the Judo Meetup program, which encourages team members around the world to spend time together in person (expenses paid)
  • Work alongside an international team of smart, kind individuals who celebrate each other and care for each other

Salary: 60K-75K CAD annually

Start Date: Flexible depending on the availability of the successful candidate

If you don’t have all of the attributes or particular experience we've listed above, please know that we would still love to hear from you! Use your cover letter to tell us about your unique experience - we understand that talent comes from many places and that skills are transferable.

Judo's total addressable market is vast, our platform is unique, and our team is ambitious. If you’re eager to be a part of something big in this next chapter of your career - we’d love to have you aboard for liftoff. Apply now!

At Judo, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Judo is an equal-opportunity employer, and we support applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the interview process.

title: Marketing - Product Marketing Manager
description:
Reporting to the Manager, Product Marketing, you will lead the go-to-market strategy and marketing plan for Blackline Safety’s technology solutions. Working collaboratively with Product Management, Sales, and Marketing, you’ll be the glue that binds our product strategy to the tactics we need to drive success in sales and marketing to achieve results. You’ll be our product evangelist and will play an integral role in organizing product launches.

In this role, you’ll understand the market and competitive landscape, and know our buyers better than they know themselves, including how they make their buying decisions. Using market evidence and your expertise, you’ll drive the development of positioning and messaging that resonates with buyers and empowers our sales channels to be successful.

You’ll partner with the marketing and sales teams to develop programs that drive adoption and demand. Presenting our value proposition in a way that resonates and articles how we solve buyers’ problems.

Responsibilities

  • Market intelligence – be the expert on our buyers, who are they, how they buy, and their key buying criteria
  • Understand the competitive landscape – be an expert on competitive alternatives and how they are positioned
  • Develop product positioning and messaging collaboratively with Product Management and Marketing
  • Understand and document your buyer's process, including where they get information, and the how, what, when and why behind the decisions they make. Drive changes based on this learning.
  • Develop marketing and communication plans for our solutions including key activities to support the retention of existing customers and the acquisition of new customers.
  • Assess the effectiveness of the marketing programs that support your products on an ongoing basis, and report back to the business on required changes.
  • Develop the launch plan for new products, releases, and updates and manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan.
  • Identify market themes and act as the primary thought-leader for the products you support externally, including speaking engagements and written content.
  • Understand and support our sales channels; train them on the problems we solve for our buyers and users; owning the development of internal and external communications and tools.
  • Work with various subject matter experts (PR, Digital, Demand Gen, etc) to ensure our product messages are communicated throughout our content.

Skills, Qualifications, Education

  • 8+ years of product marketing experience, with a background in hardware and B2B SaaS software
  • Effective communicator with a vision who can bring others along the journey, both internal and external
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Proven ability to turn data and insights into marketing strategies and message
  • Passion for solving customer problems and understanding
  • Strong project management skills and attention to detail
  • Highly motivated and collaborative working style to ensure cross-functional alignment
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office

Position Overview

  • Full-time salaried position: compensation to match your experience and talent
  • Rapidly growing tech company expanding globally
  • Extended Health and Dental benefits, along with a wellness program
  • Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Educational Assistance Program
  • Patent Program
  • Company stock purchase plan with matching RSP contributions

About Blackline Safety

Blackline Safety is a world leader in developing and manufacturing wirelessly connected safety products. We offer the broadest and most complete portfolio available in the industry. Our products are designed to save lives and we monitor personnel working alone in populated areas, complex indoor facilities, and the remote reaches of our planet. Blackline’s products are used to keep people safe in the event of falls, missed check-ins, man-downs, and exposure to explosive or toxic gas. Our design, development, sales, marketing, support, and production are all performed in-house at our headquarters in Calgary, AB. Blackline Safety is a publicly-traded company (TSX: BLN).

Blackline Safety is powered by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer. We consider all applicants, regardless of age, religion, race, color, ancestry, gender, gender identity or expression, disability, national origin, race, sexual orientation. We enthusiastically encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. Come join our inclusive team and start collaborating with us on exciting projects!

title: Development Manager
description:
Are you a high energy, results oriented professional with experience in Urban Planning and Development? 

CityState Consulting Group is looking for a Development Manager to join its growing team in Port Moody, BC!  

ABOUT YOU 

You are an experienced Development Manager with a passion for the industry, a strong client centric approach and a desire to work on exciting projects in the Urban Planning and Design space. With your experience in Development (ideally a blend of public and private sector), you are ready for the opportunity to accelerate your personal and professional growth and create long-lasting relationships built on accountability, transparency, and quality. You are looking to join a company for long term career success, and a team that works hard and takes the time to celebrate accomplishments together along the way.  

ABOUT CITYSTATE CONSULTING GROUP 

We are a rapidly accelerating Urban Planning and Design firm located in a modern, spacious office in the heart of Port Moodyâ€™s heritage district, where our professional team draws inspiration from the clients we work with and our exceptionally talented colleagues. Supporting a variety of clients in the Lower Mainland, Sunshine Coast, and Okanagan we are a multi-faceted firm specializing in everything from OCP amendments, rezoning, subdivision and development applications, environmental enhancements to heritage revitalizations and providing sustainable building design services.  

Whether itâ€™s in the realm of policy research and development, design and concept plans, or process management, we attribute our success to close relations with municipalities, while providing a quick turnaround to support our clients by creating innovative solutions for (often) uniquely challenging sites.  

We take great care in selecting clients and team members who will align closely with our values and do whatâ€™s right; to protect the environment, save heritage structures and develop in a way that enhances our surroundings; at CityState we build better communities. From our stunning designs and the fine art displayed on our walls to the work that we deliver, we take utmost pride in the details!  

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

As a Development Manager reporting to the firmâ€™s Senior Planner, your day-to-day duties will include: 

Client Management & Relationship Building (25%) 

  • Provide innovative and integrated consulting services to our private and public clients 

  • Rapidly respond to client requests and encourage an overall sense of urgency. 

  • Review, summarize and strategize responses to various municipalities, while building strong relationships with City staff 

  • Demonstrate an ability to comprehend and provide recommendations to influence civil plans, architectural designs, topographical surveys, geotechnical reports, arborist reports, etc., in a way that serves in the clients best financial interest 

  • Create and grow strong client relationships through timely and effective communication, trust and accountability 

  • Present data and materials to clients in a succinct and simplified manner, catering to our clientsâ€™ business and financial needs 

Project Management (60%) 

  • Coordinate effectively with Engineers, Surveyors, Biologists and related professionals to achieve project goals and milestones 

  • Liasing with City staff and acting as the main point of contact for updates and inquiries 

  • Analyze applicable bylaws and policies related to planning and development projects 

  • Prepare reports, analyses and studies related to community planning, policy, land use 

  • Deliver development concepts and comprehensive neighbourhood planning projects 

  • Lead innovative public consultation processes 

  • Consolidate planning and development proposals, applications and plans compliant with relevant planning and development policies 

Leadership (15%) 

  • Supervise and provide direction to other team members when acting as Project Lead 

  • Close communication and timely follow-up with all involved in designated projects to continuously drive them forward 

  • Analysis and verification of sub-consultant reports to distinguish and advise on â€˜good enoughâ€™ and â€˜outstandingâ€™ work 

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

  • Masterâ€™s Degree in Urban Planning, a related discipline, or anâ€¯equivalent combination of education and experience 

  • 5 years of experience working in land development processes and community planning in BC or a similar environment 

  • Experience in both Public and Private Sectors is considered an asset 

  • Previous education in Business or Project Management considered an asset 

  • Leadership experience in coordinating multidisciplinary teams 

  • Ability to manage complex land development and community planning projects 

  • Ability to conduct planning research, prepare reports, and lead public consultation programs 

  • Exceptional writing, research and communication/public speaking skills 

  • Excellent computer skills proficiency with Project Management software, Microsoft Suite, Acrobat Pro, SketchUp, Rivet and AutoCAD 

  • Comprehensive understanding of land development processes, applicable government regulations and planning theory 

  • Exceptional problem-solving skills, particularly at the design and construction stages 

  • Ability to work efficiently and accurately under pressure and tight deadlines 

  • Existing business relationships in the development industry 

  • Willingness to work in-person in our state-of-the-art Port Moody, BC Office 

OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU

Weâ€™re committed to our small and mighty team and take care of our people. In addition to joining an organization that values you, your contribution and your growth, some of the benefits you will receive include: 

  • A team committed to putting people first and creating long-lasting relationships. 

  • A beautiful office that is centrally located in Port Moody and easily accessible (only a 7-minute walk from the SkyTrain!) 

  • Recognition programs to celebrate excellence and performance. 

  • Shared commitment to excellence in every project that we touch. 

  • Endless opportunities for personal and professional growth, including networking in our neighbouring co-working community 

Plus, the basics: 

  • Competitive compensation plan 

  • Comprehensive health, medical and dental benefits plan that is flexible to meet your specific needs 

  • Paid vacation  

  • Full-time work & flexible working hours 

If you are ready to contribute to an organization that has its sights set on the future, we want to meet you!  

Please apply today by submitting your resume and cover letter.

title: Conversational UX Designer
description:
They say you only get one chance to make a great first impression.  At Wysdom weâ€™re here to change that. We exist to help our clients make a great first impression with their customers â€“ over and over again!

Conversation is the new user interface (UI). It will power everything from self-driving cars to gadgets around your home. For a conversational UI to satisfy customers it requires continuous improvement.  Wysdom creates and manages the smartest virtual agents on behalf of our clients. 

Wysdom is a fast growing, venture-backed start-up led by a team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products. We make sure Wysdom is a place that employees can learn, grow, have fun, and achieve excellence. 

Fit is everything for us.  We believe in hiring for attitude, skills, and potential.  We offer lots of autonomy and flexibility to be excellent at delivering value and hitting goals. If youâ€™re an entrepreneurial, results oriented person, who doesnâ€™t shy away from a challenge, youâ€™re going to enjoy working here.  Are you who we are looking for?

We are looking for a rockstar Conversational UX Designer to join Wysdom. Wysdom is committed to slowing climate change by removing our team's personal commute so has become a fully remote company and this position can be located anywhere in Canada.

But what will I actually be doing?

You will be part of our Center of Excellence team and work closely with our clients designing Conversational AI chatbots for them.

The day-to-day role will entail designing, building, testing, and analyzing customer conversational flows on various Conversational AI platforms. You will work with Conversational AI platforms, in-house tools and use various prototyping to design, build and improve Conversational AI deployments to help elevate the experience our clients are able to provide to their customers. Finally, there will be opportunities to improve our processes, develop new techniques, and create best practices for various processes on different Conversational AI platforms.

In this role, you will: 

  • Conduct UX research and define the problem space/requirements by helping clients make appropriate trade-offs between optimal user experience, compliance & legal requirements, and technological limitations
  • Apply user-centric thinking to understand user needs & goals to be used in the design process (from user research methods to usability testing)
  • Draft and prototype conversational flows
  • Design, develop and evolve conversational flows to resolve specific customer inbound issues or proactively engage with the end customer for specific use cases
  • Leverage AI, NLP, analytics and automation to push the boundaries of conversational AI virtual agents for our clients
  • Create robust test plans that cover all possible scenarios, covering all conversational paths within a use-cases
  • Conduct analyses of real usage data by analyzing conversation logs to inform UX efforts 
  • Drive root cause analyses to respond to UX performance issues
  • Develop and modify existing testing scripts in Python
  • Triage and fix issues discovered through testing
  • Plan and coordinate implementation of best practices across client deployments        

Beyond these day-to-day responsibilities, your sense of curiosity, design thinking and analytical mindset will challenge you to dig deeper into the ways in which we can continually improve our solutions, our success rate, and the customer experience.

About You 

  • Experience in designing and developing conversational AI applications and/or virtual assistants
  • Experience building chatbots on platforms such as Dialogflow, Rasa, Chatfuel, Salesforce, Zendesk, Intercom, Facebook, etc would be considered a big asset
  • Knowledge and experience with natural language understanding/processing systems (you know what an intent, utterance, and named entity is)
  • Analytical abilities to understand end-user experience in order to optimize it
  • Technical knowledge of the fundamentals of conversation, speech, and language technologies 
  • Strong writing and communications skills
  • Above-average Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets skills
  • Passion for delivering amazing results
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Analytical thinker with strong problem-solving and logical reasoning skills
  • Empathetic with clients, customers, and users
  • Proactive mindset of taking initiative, looking ahead, and calling out risks
  • Good communication skills to convey ideas and information effectively
  • Working knowledge of Python or other programming languages is an asset
  • French would be considered an asset

About Wysdom.AI
Wysdom.AI is a venture-funded start-up and is led by an experienced team of serial entrepreneurs with a history of building great teams and products.  We offer a terrific work environment in all our offices, full company-paid benefits from your first day, and a stock option program, to ensure you participate in the growth we see ahead. Head here to read more about what itâ€™s like to work at Wysdom.

title: Manager, Marketing & Customer Experience (Major Routes)
description:
Job Description :

â€œWe connect communities and customers to the people and places important in their livesâ€

 

Currently we are recruiting for an exciting management position within our marketing department.

 

MANAGER, MARKETING & CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE (MAJOR ROUTES)

Richmond or Victoria

 

We're proud to be one of the largest ferry operators in the world and for 60 years, we have been dedicated to providing safe and efficient travel to our customers and we are looking for a key member of our marketing team to support our continued growth. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the Customer Experience Master Plan is being delivered and corporate brand standards are evident throughout the operations.

 

Reporting to the Director, Corporate Marketing & Customer Experience, you will play an important role in defining and improving the customer experience at all touch points along the customer journey, using an evidence based approached to identify gaps in the customer experience and customer pain points. You will develop and leverage relationships with internal departments to communicate findings, develop plans and work together to implement solutions. As a key member of the marketing team, you are responsible for creating, planning and executing programs, related activities and ensuring the successful achievement of all associated program objectives/action plans.

 

Your capacity to create strong internal and external relationship is key as you will be working with Community Engagement and in response to community requests, evaluate in-kind and partnership investments that deliver on the principles of BC Ferriesâ€™ community investment strategy. Additionally, the evaluation of customer feedback from all sources, including Customer Satisfaction Tracking, Customer Care, FACs and other sources of research will be critical to your delivery of essential recommendations for your region.  Do note that frequent travel to terminals and ships to evaluate the customer experience and work with site management to identify areas of improvement is required.

 

Your background qualifications round out your experience and includes:

 

  • Demonstrated initiative, with strong experience handling multiple time-critical projects within an evolving business environment
  • Demonstrated interest in customer experience, marketing, branding, transportation and tourism industry
  • Experience in strategy, consumer research, brand management, and communications considered an asset
  • Experience directing multifaceted teams at various levels within an organization and expertly managing multiple stakeholder relationships is preferred
  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Marketing, Business or a closely related discipline is preferred

 

Please apply by May 20, 2022.

 

At BC Ferries, our employees are our most important assets in delivering our commitment to customer safety, service and satisfaction.  We offer a unique West Coast working environment with diverse challenges and opportunities. Whether your goal is to work behind the scenes, onboard our ships, or within our land based operations, you are a key contributor to the BC Ferries team.

 

With 47 ports of call and around 500 sailings every day, BC Ferries is the largest independently-owned ferry company in the world. Dedicated to safety, excellence, innovation, and people, we are committed to continuously improving the west coast travel experience of our customers.

 

BC Ferries supports employment equity and diversity in the workplace and we encourage applications from all qualified individuals including women, visible minorities, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (LGBTQ2S+), and others who reflect our ever-changing workplace.

 

We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Part Time Entry Level Marketer
description:
Job Summary: SWP West is looking to hire hard-working part-time marketers that are available for the next 4-6 months. This is an ideal job for individuals that want to work PART-TIME and make extra cash going door to door and business to business offering our painting services  here in the SW of Calgary. Hours are flexible based on your schedule, which works well for individuals attending High School or University, and you can expect to work anywhere from 4-10 hours per week. 

Who we are:

SWP West is a residential and commercial house painting company that has been around for over 30 years, we offer professional and high quality painting for houses, decks, fences and much more!

 

What Benefits our Part Time Marketers receive:

- Customer service and interpersonal skills

- Potential for growth and promotions within the company 

- Communication skills

- Potential for bonuses and the ability to make above your base pay

- A reference letter from your employer that can be used when applying for future positions 

- Great work experience and sales experience 

 

What you will be doing as a Part Time Marketer:

All marketers who will be joining my team will be helping me market our painting services by going door-to-door to assigned neighborhoods and talking to potential customers, as well as dropping off flyers. All training will be provided so no experience is necessary!

 

Where you will be working:

You will be working in the SW of Calgary, specifically in neighborhoods in the T2Y area. (Shawnessy, Millrise, Somerset, Bridlewood, Evergreen)

 

Work Hours:

You can expect to work on evenings during the weekdays, starting at 4:30pm/5:00pm until 7:30pm/8:00pm and Saturdays during the day, starting at 11am/12pm and working 2-3 hours. You will be able to choose what days and start times work best for you based on your schedule and you will be working around 4-10 hours per week(Flexible).

 

Pay: 

The pay is hourly + commission,  therefore the sky is the limit in terms of income. 

A marketer can be making $15-$20+ per hour!

More details on the specific pay structure to be discussed at the interview.   

 

Qualifications:

- Sales experience is an asset but not required as all employees will be fully trained in the field 

- Vehicle or a reliable mode of transportation is required (you will be working in the SW of Calgary in neighborhoods in the T2Y area)

- Available at least 4 hours per week

- Fluent english 

- Positive and great attitude

- Good communication skills

- Great attitude

- Friendly 

- Willingness to learn

 

As a successful marketer for our organization you will learn the following:

- How to communicate effectively with customers, and fellow workers

- Reach your goals, and helping others reach a common goal

- Motivating yourself, and others

title: Sr Product Designer
description:
As our Senior Product Designer, you will be designing for Tenant Experience (Tenex) product, and execute on a suite of web and mobile products that help our users visit buildings and stay connected to their workplaces and teams, regardless of their location.

Every day, you will work in a cross-functional team of Product Management, Engineering, and QA to conduct research, prototype solutions, and deliver highly-attuned customer experiences.

To thrive in this role, you will have experience with designing web and mobile applications at an enterprise software company. Your portfolio will demonstrate some of your best work and exemplify your process, usability principles, and research methodologies. An interest or experience in Real Estate is preferred.

Here’s what you can expect as a Senior Product Designer:

    • Problem-solving through teamwork: By partnering closely with the Product Manager, Tech Lead, and Engineers
    • Opportunity to design products and features: By proactively solving for non-linear user journeys and cross-product considerations across relevant users and permissions
    • Opportunity to make high-impact improvements throughout our design system and increase product coherence
    • Customer interaction: Lead customer discovery and validation sessions and perform outreach and facilitation
    • Opportunity to pitch ideas, and contribute to the design process and strategies

title: Sr. Interaction Designer 3 - 17683
description:
Client is seeking a Senior Interaction Designer to deliver world-class experiences to our customers. The ideal candidate will demonstrate knowledge for tactical elements of user-centred design and have experience in eCommerce. You demonstrate a developing strength with interaction design fundamentals, including; application of branding and design systems, information architecture, screen flows, customer journey mapping, customer research and testing.

As a Senior Interaction Designer supporting the Business-to-Business (B2B) eCommerce team, you will be collaborating with an internal project team to design product shopping experiences tailored to our small and medium sized business customers, enabling them to easily shop and purchase their products online.

Here’s how:
  • Work with Product Owners, Content and Design leads to determine business requirements
  • Lead user flow, user story, empathy and journey mapping exercises with fellow team members and stakeholders
  • Communicate with developers throughout the project cycle, working together on creating a seamless user experience by wireframing solutions, discussing requirements, and finalizing visual designs.
  • Craft, review and understand the holistic end-to-end user experience
  • Ensure design and copy are in sync at all times by working with our content strategy leads
  • Work with our Design System to execute and finalize visual designs and collaborate with the Design System team to develop new features and functionalities.
  • Apply the brand standards across all design work
  • Use a variety of user research tools and techniques to validate design decisions; hear directly from our users by organizing usability testing sessions and working alongside our user research and analytics teams to gain deeper insights from our customers.
  • Ensure that the digital customer experience for those using assistive technologies is considered at all times. You will work with our accessibility tools to ensure all accessibility standards are met.

Must Haves:
1. 4-5+ years as a UX Designer, particularly in Ecommerce or Buying Experience
2. Experience User Testing
3. Must have experience in an Agile environment

Nice to have
1. UI/Design Systems Experience
2. Experience using design tools such as Figma
3. Working with and presenting to High Level Stakeholders

title: Business Development Manager
description:
The Opportunity:

1-800-GOT-JUNK?, the biggest junk removal company in the world and a household name, is looking for a dynamic, experienced sales professional to join our national accounts team. As the Business Development Manager, you will generate new business leads and develop strategic relationships with large corporate clients to knock our aggressive sales targets out of the park! This position is located at our Toronto corporate office with frequent travel across North America.

What people say about you

 

I am a tenacious hunter who is ambitious and results-driven. As a natural salesperson, I thrive in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. I am a confident, independent self-starter with a competitive drive and a strong sense of urgency. I proactively seek out opportunities and thrive on exceeding aggressive sales targets.

 

When we say Itâ€™s All About People we mean it. We have created a hybrid work model that helps us get together to Collaborate, Celebrate and Connect while enjoying the flexibility of working where it makes sense for you. For this roleâ€™s duty and responsibility we anticipate that you will be in the office 25% of time, and travel within North America 25% of the time.

 

O2E Brands is committed to creating a safe and healthy environment for our team members, customers and community. As part of this commitment, we require all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for an exemption under provincial health guidelines as of January 7th, 2022.

 

A Day in the Life:
  • Work closely with the Director, National Accounts, to develop a sales strategy to seek and establish new business
    opportunities across North America
  • Build and maintain a prospect list that focuses on appropriate companies
  • Expand and build new business through a combination of emails, phone calls, networking through trade associations and in-person client meetings
  • Work closely with the Commercial Sales Operations teams to develop custom solutions for recurring service needs that address our prospective customers needs
  • Establish and develop relationships with corporate and commercial clients across North America
  • Work closely with the National Account Managers to transition new client accounts, track and manage
    all activities and opportunities into Salesforce CRM
  • Manage the activities required for effective relationship and business management through utilizing
    our CRM

 

What You Bring to the Table:
  • Proven BD experience in a business to business environment
  • Ability to travel across North America up to 50% of the time
  • High-level, strategic selling skills derived from working in multi-layered, business-to-business focused environments
  • Demonstrated experience prospecting new clients through a combination of cold-calls and in-person meetings
  • Proven track record of success in business development demonstrated by meeting aggressive sales targets
  • A passion for personal and professional growth
  • Strong communications skills including presentation skills

title: Marketing Manager (Live Action) â€“ Mat Leave
description:
Overview:

Location: Toronto (currently remote, eventually hybrid)

Department: Marketing & Communications

Start date: ASAP (14-month Mat leave)

 

 

Find a job that lets your imagination run wild!

WildBrain is made up of a team of innovators and creators who bring industry-leading kidsâ€™ content and brands to families globally. We inspire imagination, put creativity first, and believe in the power of storytelling. We are constantly connecting the powers of our global team, making WildBrain a collaborative, openminded and passionate environment to work in.

 

To work at WildBrain means you get to create stories that lets imaginations run wild. Join our team today to become part of the story!

 

About the Role

Reporting to the Director of Publicity, Live Action, the Marketing Manager (14-month Mat leave) is responsible for overseeing production marketing assets across the original live-action slate in support of the marketing and PR programs of our strategic broadcast and streaming partners. You will become an expert on the original IP in production on our live-action slate, getting to know the core of each show to ensure its marketing materials represent the show well to clients and to the audience.   You also provide the Production team(s) with the guidance and support to create excellent marketing deliverables and provide the Distribution team or key content clients with insight into each show.

 

This is a 14-month maternity leave position based in Toronto, Canada with health and dental benefits, PTO, flex days, RRSP matching, etc.

Responsibilities:

What You'll Do:  

  • Develop and execute strategic and creative marketing plans for priority live-action shows, ensuring alignment with companyâ€™s overall business strategies
  • Work closely with Director of Publicity, Live Action and Unit Publicist to develop, track and deliver Schedule B marketing materials for live action series including bonus content (series trailers, sizzle reel, episode trailers, key clips, behind-the-scenes content), distribution support materials (series synopses, episode synopses, cast and crew bios), marketing and art assets (series bible, logos, key marketing images, gallery photography, publicity stills, fonts, additional graphic elements), and website and social media materials (social media handles, and cast/producer/partner handles)
  • Support content partners (HBOMax, AppleTV+, CBC) proactively with ideas and assets in support of on-air programming while expertly balancing internal resources and availability
  • Lead analysis of marketing asset performance to facilitate campaign optimization, and key learnings for subsequent asset iterations
  • Maintain relationships with producers and their crews to stay informed about all studio productions and be able to advise other teams (Distribution, Communications, PR, etc.) on the details and status of each production.Build and maintain close relationships with programming and creative teams to drive the development of creative assets
  • Assist the Director, Live Action Publicity, with publicity efforts including media relations, events and cast relations
  • Assist with the creation of presentations and collateral materials to support global distribution sales efforts
  • Lead digital media marketing effort for WildBrainâ€™s original production live action slate
  • Manage and execute live action digital media budgets
  • When applicable, work with federal funding bodies, producing applications to finance digital media projects
Qualifications:

What You'll Bring:

  • 3-5 years of relevant experience coming from content marketing, production management, or animation asset management environments required
  • Experience or familiarity with production processes â€“ bonus if experienced with kids & family content
  • Excellent communicator with client-facing experience
  • Ability to act as a translator between production teams and other groups (Marketing, Distribution, Clients, etc.)
  • Ability to deliver a clear and concise creative brief to graphic designers and production
  • Skilled at interpreting feedback from multiple sources into clear actionable notes
  • Excellent writing and copyediting skills, with ability to adapt to different voices and styles
  • An eye for design and layout in marketing creative, presentations, and text documents
  • Expert-level PowerPoint skills, with an eye for consistency and layout
  • Highly organized and able to prioritize both own workload and tasks assigned to others

 

What We Offer

Working at WildBrain is more than a job â€” itâ€™s the opportunity to join forces with extraordinary, insightful and imaginative people who will recognize your talents and encourage your professional growth and development in a work environment that promotes creativity and individuality. We offer competitive family-focused benefits, we invest in our people and their future with generous RRSP matching, plus bonus time-off, because you deserve it!

 

Our Commitment

Diversity and Inclusion are in our DNA. As a global leader in kids and family entertainment, we strive to reflect and honour the diversity of our audiences around the world. We believe that creating diverse and inclusive content & brands begins with fostering a culture of belonging at WildBrain. To us, a culture of belonging is one where we celebrate and welcome the diversity of all employees, stakeholders, and external partners and strive to create an environment where every individual feels valued, respected, and brings their authentic self to work.

 

We demonstrate our commitment to this by striving to provide a supportive work environment and a corporate culture that welcomes and encourages equal opportunities for all employees. We recognize that people bring experience and talent that goes beyond the technical skills and requirements of a job. If you possess similar experience that is close to what weâ€™ve listed here, we encourage you to please still consider applying. We strongly believe that diverse experience, transferable skills, and passion are key! WildBrain accommodates people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Applicants are encouraged to make their needs known in advance if accommodation is required.

 

About WildBrain:

At WildBrain we make great content for kids and families. With approximately 13,000 half-hours of filmed entertainment in our library â€“ one of the worldâ€™s most extensive â€“ we are home to such brands as Peanuts, Teletubbies, Strawberry Shortcake, Caillou, Inspector Gadget, Johnny Test and Degrassi. Our shows are seen in more than 150 countries on over 500 telecasters and streaming platforms. WildBrainâ€™s portfolio spans all areas of the entertainment industry: WildBrain Studios, where we develop and produce hit animated and live actions series; WildBrain Television, which is composed of prominent kidsâ€™ television channels in Canada (Family Channel, Family CHRGD, Family Jr. and TÃ©lÃ©magino); home to Peanuts Worldwide; brand management to some of the worldâ€™s most-loved kids brands; celebrated global licensing and distribution teams with WildBrain CPLG, and a leading childrenâ€™s YouTube network in WildBrain Spark, one of the largest networks of kidsâ€™ channels on YouTube, with over 168 million subscribers.

 

WildBrain is headquartered in Canada with offices worldwide and trades on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: WILD). Visit wildbrain.com to learn more!

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Overview:

KUBRA is looking for a brilliant and diligent Product Marketing Manager to join our Marketing team!


As a Product Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for the go-to market strategy for KUBRA products as well as getting clients excited about product features and translating them into customer-facing messaging. You will also  directly impact the product marketing strategy for an exciting portfolio of KUBRA solutions for the B2B audience.  

What you get to do every day:
  • Executing the strategic product marketing and go-to-market plans for products and services
  • Tracking industry trends for the portfolio of products/solutions. Monitors competitive developments.
  • Assessing market need, opportunity, adoption rates, and competitive product profiles for the portfolio.
  • Developing sales and training materials for portfolio products, new features, and services.
  • Provides support for product demonstrations at trade shows and webinars and delivering presentations to customers and prospects
  • Assisting product management leads with market research and product usability testing to ensure an optimal customer experience.
  • Defining product target audience, segmentation, messaging framework, go-to-market, and lifecycle strategies
What kind of person should you be?:
  • You have the ability to clearly articulate business decision drivers, costs and benefits with senior executives and decision makers
  • You can adapt to new technology and learn new programs effectively
  • You enjoy building strong relationships, gaining credibility and partnering with clients, internal customers, business leaders and peers
  • You take pleasure in thinking creatively and logically while successfully interpreting, analyzing and resolving problems assigned or encountered
  • You have the ability to effectively plan, direct, influence and organize the work of others to obtain desired results
  • You are skilled at integrating the ideas and needs of others in developing product strategies to accomplish objectives
What skills do you need?:
  • 3-5 years of product marketing or channel management experience in a B2B environment
  • 3-5 years of experience creating, executing and managing technology marketing programs
  • Experience within the SaaS industry or with payment software is a HUGE plus
  • Understanding of qualitative and quantitative methods and tools for analysis, interpretation, and decision-making purposes
  • Must be able to clearly articulate business decision drivers and benefits with senior executives and decision-makers
  • Education required: Undergraduate degree in business, marketing, communications, computer science or related discipline
What can you expect from us?:
  • Award-winning culture that fosters growth, diversity and inclusion for all
  • Paid day off for your birthday
  • Access to LinkedIn learning courses
  • Continued education with our education reimbursement program
  • Flexible schedules
  • Free unlimited access to our refreshment stations (fully stocked with tea, coffee and other beverages)
  • Two paid days for volunteer opportunities

KUBRA is a fast-growing company that delivers customer communications solutions to some of the largest utility, insurance, and government entities across North America. KUBRA offers billing and payments, mapping, mobile apps, proactive communications, and artificial intelligence solutions for customers. With more than 1.5 billion customer interactions annually, KUBRA services reach over 40% of households in the U.S. and Canada. KUBRA is an operating subsidiary of Hearst.

 

Our office is small enough to allow creative individuals to flourish, yet large enough to provide long-term stability. We place a tremendous amount of responsibility on our team members to be productive, focused and self-motivated. We offer a casual work environment, competitive compensation and a stellar benefits program.

 

KUBRA is an equal opportunity employer dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. We will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request by emailing the  

recruitment-team@kubra.com

. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
AMA:

YOUâ€™RE A fast thinking, TROUBLE SHOOTING, TASK-JUGGLING dynamo.

 

 

Posted: 2022-05-04
Closing: When Filled
Location: Edmonton Kingsway Centre

 

 

You sleep and breathe both digital and traditional media. You understand that knowledge is power and for you, there's nothing more fulfilling than developing breakthrough strategies and processes (or enhancing existing ones) that help you bring valuable knowledge to others. You also have a whole lot of experience and proof that you know how to get results over the short and long term. Answers live in the research data and you love utilizing that information to problem solve and find new opportunities for growth and change. Your portfolio will focus on AMA Insurance, that strives to provide advice to our members to help them protect the things they care about most.

 

You use market research and data to help guide your marketing strategies and provide informed recommendations to help increase important KPIs. This role is responsible for developing, managing and implementing marketing tactics and strategies to increase traffic, leads, conversion rates,  and revenues that will contribute to the success and growth of AMA.

 

 

WHAT MOVES YOU

  • You're detail oriented, and the type of person who rolls up their sleeves and gets the job done.
  • You thrive in fast-paced environments and are flexible and able to roll with changing scenarios.
  • You're both a right- and left-brained thinker. Your innovative side is balanced by your quantitative analytical abilities.
  • You love to share thoughts and ideas - after all, two heads are better than one.
  • You have experience and expertise in product positioning and messaging. You love figuring out what drives consumer behaviour and are in touch with digital marketing trends and best practices through more traditional means.
  • You live and breathe brands. You understand that loyalty is built through consistency.
  • You can strategize and execute integrated campaigns across a range of platforms.

 

WHAT YOUâ€™LL DO

  • Report to the Marketing Manager.
  • Define marketing mediums and techniques to increase visibility and traffic across our Insurance business unit.
  • Deliver personal-based messaging and collateral geared at engaging and supporting customers in all stages of their lifecycle.
  • Develop lead generation strategies to effectively incubate, qualify, and convert leads.
  • Meet with Business units and partners to keep current with strategies, needs, changes to products and services, market considerations and the business environment.
  • Ensure member and client issues are dealt with promptly and efficiently.
  • Perform detailed analysis and report results across programs, campaigns and segments and make actionable recommendations for improvement.
  • Continually test/optimize existing campaigns to identify areas of improvement.
  • Propose new and improved inbound marketing campaign ideas.
  • Define key performance indicators and implement enterprise-level measurement, analytics and reporting measures to gauge success.

 

WHAT YOUâ€™VE DONE

  • You have a university degree or post-secondary diploma in a related field, such as Marketing or Communications.
  • You have a strong background in both digital as well as traditional marketing with a minimum of five (5) years of experience.
  • You also have a minimum of five (5) years of experience building marketing strategies under your belt.
  • Youâ€™re a strong copywriter with experience creating copy for email marketing, social media, etc.
  • You have a strong understanding and experience with Social, SEO, PPC, and Email marketing  

 

WHAT YOU'LL GET

  • Competitive salary.
  • Flexible benefits.
  • Outstanding employer-paid Pension Plan.
  • Great AMA discounts.
  • Unlimited learning opportunities.
  • Paid vacation and floater day.

 

We thank all applicants for their interest;  however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
