title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
GameDriver is looking to hire a full-time Product Marketing Manager to build our brand and increase our exposure in the video game, AR and VR industries. Are you a strong marketer with experience in software, test automation and/or gaming? Are you excited about introducing new tools for developers in the fastest growing technologies? Can you build relationships with, and connections to, key players in these software segments? Are you looking for a unique opportunity with a fast-growing software test automation startup? Would you like to work from home? If so, please read on!

This remote product marketing role earns a competitive salary of $80,000 - $100,000 (CDN) /year, depending on experience. We provide great benefits and perks, including an extended benefits plan, stock options, and flexible hours with unmetered PTO. If this sounds like the right opportunity to leverage your tech industry communications and management skills, apply today!


ABOUT GAMEDRIVER

Founded in the San Francisco Bay area in 2018, GameDriver's mission is to bring test automation capabilities to the video game industry, including 2D, 3D, VR, and AR experiences across PC, mobile, console, and standalone VR platforms. We believe that the best way to improve quality is through better testing. The only way to consistently improve testing is to automate as much as possible. We deliver the only solution in the industry that provides cross-platform testing using a standard set of tools. Unlike other automation techniques, GameDriver works from within the game.

We are a VC-backed software startup, so our company tends to attract a certain kind of employee. It's important that we hire the right people, so we approach hiring in the same way that we approach our business. Through innovative thinking, we create a fulfilling work experience that enriches the lives of our employees!


A DAY IN THE LIFE OF THE PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER

As our Product Marketing Manager, your primary mission is to spread the word about GameDriver and our business value proposition, while working efficiently to put us in front of the right people at the right time. You are a charismatic, sociable person who can effectively develop relationships with influencers, podcasters, and media in the video gaming, AR, and VR industries. You will seek out and attend relevant game industry events, such as online and in-person conferences, where you will engage potential partners (console manufacturers, game engine developers and complementary software companies), industry influencers and customers (major and independent game studios, and enterprises).

In collaboration with our other departments, you create messages for our partners that fit their individual personas and platforms while accurately representing GameDriver. You coordinate with public relations service providers, advertising agencies, and content producers to help develop our image and spread our name into the game and immersive experiences spaces. You take pride in building positive relationships to accelerate our business!


QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER

  • Minimum of a Bachelor's degree in marketing, business or communications
  • 5+ years of experience in the software industry
  • 4+ years of experience in product marketing
  • 2+ years of marketing experience in software, SaaS, video games, AR/ VR, or test automation.

Can you develop the voice of a fast-growing software company while building an effective plan to reach target audiences? Are you highly organized and collaborative? Can you effectively manage a wide range of service providers and agencies across multiple time zones? Do you enjoy working from home? If yes, you might just be perfect for this product marketing position!


WORK SCHEDULE FOR OUR PRODUCT MARKETING MANAGER

This role is fully remote so you can work from home on a flexible schedule. Some travel may be required.


ARE YOU READY TO JOIN THE GAMEDRIVER TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this marketing role, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting you!

Location: Remote

title: Business Development Manager (SaaS)
description:
Business Development Manager

Job Type:Full Time employment
Location: Mostly remote withinGTA,Ottawa or Montreal (Kitchener Waterloo, London, Hamilton also considered)
Company:growing e-commerce SaaS product company headquartered inToronto

As Business Development Manager, you will drive the business development of new accounts globally. Your knowledge of the e-commerce landscape along with an ability to understand and articulate the key business outcomes and objectives will be a key success driver for this role. You will be gritty to build a pipeline of potential customers to identify specific prospects/partners to approach while communicating the specific PIM value proposition for their business and technology stack.

Specific Responsibilities

• Prospect new sales leads including leveraging your own network via inbound lead follow up and outbound cold calling via, email, phone and social media
• Building a funnel of target customers, through several platforms like Salesforce, ZoomInfo, Linkedin, and emails
• Respond, engage and quality inbound leads and inquiries
• Work closely with other team members to develop account intelligence, relationship maps, and use case opportunities.
• Schedule appointments for demo’s follow up emails and in person/virtual meetings with prospects.
• Hold intelligent and engaging conversations
• Act as the subject matter expert on PIM
• Route Qualified leads to the appropriate Account Executive for further development and closure
• Team with partners to build sales pipeline and close deals
• Creating and developing value propositions
• Work with cross-functional teams as necessary and serve as the primary customer contact for all pre-sales-related activities.
• Maintain and keep the CRM current
• Provide guidance to customers starting their PIM journey on how to pick best-fit solutions

What you bring:

• Gritty driven individual who is willing to be at the forefront solutions development and pre-sales
• Excited and eager to engage with new customers
• Strong communication and written skills
• Experience in a consultative sales role or a SaaS environment
• Entrepreneurial mindset and a desire to generate new business
• Experience whiteboarding to uncover customer problems to position services and products

title: Marketing Operations Manager
description:
Appnovation helps brands thrive through innovative, people-inspired experiences and solutions. By embracing the powerful combination of technology and agility, we seamlessly integrate strategy, experience, design, development and analytics.

We create standout digital experiences by collaborating with brands to understand the individual challenges and goals for every initiative. Focusing on our clients' customers, we effectively combine empathy, evidence and real-world insight so that solutions are derived from truth and meaning. Appnovation is an award-winning team dedicated to inspiring possibility.

The Corporate Marketing Department oversees Appnovation's global marketing initiatives, including brand voice and creative governance. Through thought leadership and customer success stories, our aim is to elevate the Appnovation brand by showcasing our services and expertise.

The team supports the entire lifecycle of our customer journey, from lead generation, to relationship nurturing, to post-project case study development and beyond. We're driven by data and iterative improvements, and remain agile to quickly pivot directions and tactics based on business needs.

We're looking for driven, passionate individuals who are open to collaboration, taking on challenges, and learning new skills. Successful candidates will be vocal about their strengths, interests, and career aspirations. Growth is a core value of Appnovation and we're looking for growth-oriented people to join our team.

YOU WILL HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO:

  • Apply your expertise in marketing automation, lead generation and journey/campaign orchestration to develop a lead generation and nurture strategy that supports pipeline and revenue goals.
  • Work closely with stakeholders and contributors across our global team, and gain exposure to & mentorship from executive leadership, senior marketing, and more.
  • Design, implement and drive adoption of best-in-class marketing processes/workflows, systems and tools across the organization.
  • Share ownership of the company MarTech stack and through discovering and onboarding new techs, expand your own stack.
  • Help drive reporting and analysis of key campaign and team performance metrics, including marketing influence on company revenue. 

WHO YOU ARE:

  • Strategic thinker, with the ability to see the big picture and balance competing projects, priorities and tasks.
  • Strong self-starter with proven leadership skills and the ability to pivot and problem-solve.
  • 5+ years of experience in digital marketing, marketing operations, marketing automation or related practice.
  • Fundamentally driven by a test-and-learn mindset and makes data-based decisions.
  • Demonstrated experience managing a MarTech stack with proficiency in the following tools (or equivalent): Pardot, Salesforce CRM, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, LinkedIn Advertising, Unbounce, Dreamweaver/HTML, Datorama and Drupal.
  • Stays abreast of trends in the marketing and technology space and driven to learn and explore new processes, technologies and tools. 

Vijay: #LI-VB1

Thank you for your interest in a career with Appnovation Technologies! Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
At Appnovation, we recognize that diverse teams are the strongest teams. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is not only something that we embrace - we celebrate it! We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds, lived experiences and industries to apply. Come join us at Appnovation, and learn more about how we stay true to our company values as we build better lives through better digital.

Accommodations are available upon request throughout the recruitment process.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Overview:

Boston Pizza International Inc. is Canadaâ€™s No. 1 casual dining brand with almost 400 restaurants in Canada and more than $1 billion in sales. The company has been recognized as a Platinum Member of Canadaâ€™s 50 Best Managed Companies and as one of Canadaâ€™s Best Places to Work. Reporting into the Sr Director, Digital Marketing, the role will play a hands-on role in developing and leading Boston Pizza digital marketing activities in Canada.

 

Digital marketing for Boston Pizza focuses on leveraging our owned digital channels for customer engagement, driving guests to our restaurants, growing sales of take-out and delivery (TOD), as well improving the in-restaurant experience for our guests

 

Background Experience:

  • Minimum 3-5 years of industry experience in digital marketing, ideally gained in retail or B2C
  • Adobe or comparable platform working experience
  • A proven ability to translate the overall brand strategy into digital marketing plans and articulate the vision/plan in an approachable manner
  • Working knowledgeable of best-in-class digital technologies, techniques and processes
  • Experience in a variety of digital marketing elements (e-commerce, landing page design, app development, digital signage, online customer experiences, SEO)
  • Demonstrated ability to integrate across functional areas within an organization
  • Experience within a Franchise organization would be an asset
  • Proven ability to manage in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

Key Behavioural Competencies

  • A confident, energetic thinker
  • Entrepreneurial spirit to bring new ideas and lead efforts confidently
  • Highly analytical and able to apply â€˜return on investmentâ€™ thinking to all decisions
  • Strong interpersonal skills and collaborative team player
  • The ability to manage multiple agency partners and stakeholders
  • Passionate about the brand! Loves the idea of working in the food hospitality industry
Responsibilities:

Duties and Responsibilities

Digital marketing for Boston Pizza focuses on leveraging our owned digital channels for customer engagement, driving guests to our restaurants, growing sales of take-out and delivery (TOD), as well improving the in-restaurant experience for our guests. The core goal of this role is to apply the marketing layer to our digital platforms and to drive SEO success. Key elements of the role include:

  • Lead marketing support for bringing national and regional campaigns to life through our digital properties (bostonpizza.com, BP App)
    • Build custom landing page experiences within AEM
    • Develop and upload promotional marketing tiles on bostonpizza.com within AEM
    • Support Take-Out & Delivery (TOD) Manager to achieve conversion goals through custom online experiences that drive online purchase
  • Update and maintain all bostonpizza.com and BP App marketing content
  • Optimize bostonpizza.com engagement through A/B tests and experiments
  • Lead SEO strategy for bostonpizza.com and franchisee locations
    • Leverage keyword, industry and competitive research to inform content strategies
    • Ensure SEO best practices are implemented on current and new website tactics
  • Partner in bringing new digital awareness & engagement activations to life, and help identify opportunities for enhanced guest experiences across all digital and in-restaurant channels
  • Provide analysis and insight on campaign metrics and digital channel trends
  • Review projects for fiscal responsibility, ensuring a balance between cost and quality of delivery
  • Guest promotion of digital properties in-store, online and offline (note â€“ this does not encompass responsibility for social or digital media associated with our marketing campaigns)
  • Keep abreast of digital and e-commerce best practices and innovations, monitor trends and competitive actions to inform future plans
Qualifications:

Boston Pizza was established over 50 years ago and is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's 50 Top Managed Companies for over 20 years in a row. We are committed to the development & growth of our team members, integrity, philanthropy and innovation. If you love working with people in a team environment and believe in exceeding the expectations of Guests daily, Boston Pizza is the place for you!

title: Manager, Marketing
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">The Manager, Marketing is responsible for driving qualified traffic and sales to all channels while building awareness, engagement and growth in the brand, focusing on supporting the print and GM categories. This role is responsible for the development of external marketing campaigns that line up and support the storytelling function, strategic vendor partnerships, and traffic driving promotions, while delivering on KPI’s. _WHAT YOU’LL DO: _ *_Functional_* * Support the Storytelling process as it pertains to developing seasonal omni-channel marketing programs that deliver against marketing goals in the most on-brand, innovative, effective and efficient manner * Lead cross-functional omni development and briefing of seasonal and everyday campaigns to studio partners and external agencies * Collaborate with Marketing Director to develop compelling media campaigns and assets * Measure and analyze program effectiveness through tracking of advertising, promotional analysis, contribution of insights for planning, post-mortems and ROI, in collaboration with cross functional teams and media agency * Own day-to-day relationships with the General Merchandise merchant partners, including managing vendor partnerships * Manage sales promotions for full house business keeping key functional partners updated and aligned on objectives, concept and roll out * Act as marketing lead for Retail support * Provide marketing insights for Weekly Business Review including tracking of competitive activity (omni retail & advertising) and apply observations and learnings to drive Indigo business * Oversee postmortem activities cross-functionally, for each campaign * Ensure the completion of team deliverables and set/adhere to team budgets, as applicable * Act as an advocate for the customer by placing them at the forefront of all design and decision-making processes * Proactively identify and anticipate customer expectations and needs * Embrace and seek out technology that creates high tech and high touch solutions for Indigo’s customers * Challenge the status quo and consistently identify areas for improvement, diagnose issues and working to resolve them *_People_* * Build strong teams by attracting and developing the best talent * Bring out the best in others, empower and constructively stretch talent * Give authentic feedback on performance and potential * Ensure all team members understand where they stand and have clear performance objectives aligned with Indigo and team goals * Collaborate with others to drive flexible and iterative solutions, quickly and easily * Share technical knowledge with others and actively seek to learn from those more knowledgeable than yourself * Help others see the impacts of their efforts and proactively engage other functions to get input * Encourage others to freely share their point of view and be open to feedback * Accountable for the overall engagement, productivity, turnover and bench strength of the team *_Cultural_* * Model Indigo’s beliefs and convey a positive image in everything you do * Celebrate diversity of thought and have an open mindset * Take an active role in fostering a culture of to lead and manage cross functional teams including non-direct reports * Strong analytical skills, both quantitative and qualitative * Project Management skills * Experience developing integrated campaigns (direct, digital and mass) * High attention to detail and strong organizational skills * Excellent written and verbal communication skills * A willingness to take risks and make decisions; creative and innovative approach to problem solving * Service driven with a passion for the Indigo brand * Desire to continuously learn and improve what and how we do * True believer in teamwork and the ability to understand the impact of one’s actions on another team, individual or process * An optimist who supports what is right and helps to fix what is wrong At Indigo, we are committed to our communities, our customers, and each other; together we can make a positive impact. We know that fostering diversity and inclusion brings out your full potential and creates a joyful and welcoming environment for everyone. We are driven to be an equitable employer, which highly values your diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that you, in all your uniqueness, belong at Indigo. We welcome all applicants and encourage applications from individuals who identify as Black, Indigenous, a person of colour, LGBTQ2+ and people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request to individuals who self-identify as having a disability or special need. Please contact Human Resources at 1 (888) 881-3177 (toll free) or Support-HR@indigo.ca if you require an accommodation at any time during the recruitment process. *WELCOME HOME*</section>

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Vetster is the world's fastest growing veterinary telehealth and pet care marketplace. Since our launch in 2020 we have established ourselves as a leader in the rapidly growing pet care industry. With a $30M USD Series B, game-changing partner with PetMeds, and named Overall Pet Healthcare Company of the Year, Vetster is the leader in virtual veterinary care.

We know that by empowering pet owners with easy-to-use, convenient services and an open marketplace, we can move the industry forward, create professional opportunities in the veterinary community, and fundamentally improve animal wellbeing and access to care. The work we are doing is groundbreaking and is changing lives.

Vetster offers flex and remote working options and is headquartered in Toronto, Canada. We work in cross-functional teams and believe ownership and accountability, along with trust, respect and inclusion are core tenets of success in our new working paradigm. At all levels, successful Vetster team members are those who seek to grow their careers and who share our ambition to build a global high-growth brand.


Opportunity

The Product Marketing Manager is a critical role at this stage of Vetster's growth. As a Product Marketing Manager, You'll be a key contributor to the business strategy in partnership with product, sales, and operations teams. The right candidate is adept at developing user and industry insights, influencing the product roadmap, and developing product value propositions and messaging. 

The Product Marketing Manager will report directly to the Chief Product Officer.

Responsibilities

  • Develop deep customer, product, market, and competitive understanding in partnership with Product Management to optimize product positioning, inform pricing and packaging, develop go-to-market strategies, and enable marketing, sales, and success teams
  • Help define the target markets and customer profiles that put Vetster in the best position to win
  • Own product positioning and messaging for new and existing Vetster products
  • Be the voice of the customer by driving research efforts, connecting directly with Pet Parents and Vet Communities while partnering closely with sales
  • Work among high-performing engineers, designers and product managers in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, hybrid technology/operations environment
  • Produce best-in-class product communications, from marketing campaigns to sales materials
  • Work closely with the marketing team to set strategy and support campaign activations
  • Influence and articulate the strategy for the all Vetster product lines

Requirements

  • 5+ years in a product marketing role at a global SaaS organization
  • Decisive leader and skilled prioritizer that can execute complex strategies and drive measurable results
  • Healthy mix of quantitative and qualitative analysis to inform decision making
  • Proven ability to launch new products and features and growing market share
  • Exceptional communicator, presenter, motivator, and influencer that's comfortable in a boardroom, on a stage, or in front of a camera
  • Skilled negotiator that can work with others to get ideas approved and executed
  • Stellar written and verbal communication skills; there is a heavy amount of writing, copy editing, and presenting/selling ideas in this role
  • Comfortable with manipulating and analyzing data
  • Skilled at developing cross-functional relationships; this roles requires continual collaboration with multiple functions
  • Ability to easily put yourself in a customer's shoes; empathy is a strength
  • Proficient in modern marketing automation solutions
  • Knowledgeable about SaaS products, B2C/B2B marketing, and business models
  • Results-driven and has experience measuring the success of key initiatives


Vetster Benefits

  • Full access to the Vetster service for your own pets
  • Bring your furry (canine) friends to our office
  • Vacation and personal days to support work-life balance
  • Attractive health and dental benefits for you and your family
  • Competitive salary based on experience and market
  • Flexible work and remote work options
  • Career growth and international work opportunities
  • Team building and social events

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
Does this sound like you? You have that optimism that you can have a career that changes the world. You want to work with people, make a difference in their lives, and get the breadth of experience you can build a meaningful career on.

If so, you'll find what you're looking for here.

About MakerKids

MakerKids (https://makerkids.com) is an award-winning learning platform that is building core technical, programming, and social-emotional skills for kids. Parents use MakerKids to augment their child's core curriculum with small group project-based learning programs that have won the endorsement of psychologists, Intel, and other child education advocates. We run classes on coding, robotics and Minecraft. Our classes help kids develop confidence, social skills, resilience and a positive relationship with technology. We ignite kids' potential and inspire them to be inventors, entrepreneurs, and innovators. Kids have started businesses, won prizes from NASA, and reported positive mental health outcomes. We are a pioneer in the education industry, having started the first and largest makerspace for kids in the world. Today, we provide amazing interest-driven virtual and in-person STEM programs to help kids move from being consumers to creators. We've been featured in major media such as Wired, Popular Science and Forbes, and have spoken at TEDx, SXSW, Maker Faire, MakerCon, and more. We are a social impact company and our mission is to help people reach their potential and make a positive impact on the world. We are leading classes that improve kids' lives significantly, enabling them to see their own power and realize that they can make a difference. Come change the world with us, one kid at a time.

We're growing quickly, and we're looking for leaders to grow with us and ultimately drive our mission forward. Right now, we're looking for a Growth Marketing Manager.

Why Join Us

In addition to making a positive impact on the world, you can participate in our:

  • Staff discount on MakerKids programs
  • Fun social events with the team like karaoke, escape rooms, improv classes, and other activities
  • Referral Program
  • Flexible schedules available
  • Paid Vacation
  • Compensation commensurate with experience, and bonuses based on targets
  • Equity
  • Generous learning budget
  • Opportunities for growth and advancement

You'll love this role if you:

  • Want to have a positive impact on kids
  • Want to share your love for technology and making
  • Dig a relaxed, casual, and fun work group (warning: musical theatre nerds and Dungeons & Dragons players among us)
  • Did we mention having fun while working? We like doing stuff together online or in-person – virtual coffees, improv classes, escape rooms, and other staff socials
  • And we also take our work seriously, create space for each other's opinions and perspectives, and pursuing success together

We just raised funds, we are partnered with a university on a research project in progress, and you will get to shape the future of the company and grow your own team. 

    The Role

    The Growth Marketing Manager will run and/or oversee the day-to-day marketing functions of our MakerKids experience. You'll accomplish this by running and/or managing our paid ads (or working with an ad specialist on ensuring our paid ads are achieving proper ROI), SEO, website, CRO, email marketing, social media marketing, affiliate marketing, design, promotional calendar and blogs. 

    Once you've learned how our marketing runs, you'll turn your attention to optimizing our marketing and growing revenue. You will define and champion the overarching marketing strategy, so we'll be very open to any improvements you can make to achieve your vision. 

    Responsibilities: 

    • Establish and implement growth strategies to support MakerKids' revenue goals. Set and implement strategies to grow qualified, profitable external traffic to our products and services, maximize sales and revenue, and meet other business objectives through various marketing strategies.
    • Take ownership of running and/or overseeing our marketing team functions: reporting, paid ads, SEO/SEM, Content Marketing, Multiple call-to-action landing pages, Social media engagement, email marketing, affiliate marketing, and more.
    • Own the budget, measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs) 
    • Lead campaign design and build to test ad copy, landing page, bidding, and audience targeting to find opportunities to drive incremental growth.
    • Recommend the suite of tools, technologies, automation and processes necessary for scaling our marketing efforts. Identify and test new customer acquisition opportunities to improve performance and/or reduce expenses, with a drive to rapid growth in new customer acquisition.
    • Focus on MakerKids' brand and differentiating message, our market and buyer personas, competitive analysis and industry analysis
    • Take a proactive, problem-solving approach to improve our current marketing procedures and delivery to maximize our revenue
    • Lead the onboarding, training, and supervision of new marketing staff, contractors and agencies as needed as we grow.
    • Steward the website and design we use every day
    • Manage the marketing materials to meet high quality standards
    • Create brand awareness and other marketing activities to increase our growth

    This is a varied position that will include an operations component as well, and if you have experience as a Marketing Manager, that variety will feel familiar. You'll have our full support to make changes that will make a lasting difference on our business.

    You're the right fit for this role because you have a customer-centric mindset, and are always looking for ways to improve marketing, or tackle high-leverage challenges to make things work better.

    Role Details

    This is a full-time, permanent position.  All MakerKids staff are currently working remotely and will continue doing so until it is safe to return to office or have the option of remaining remote. This position can return to office, or can remain remote indefinitely.

    Our bright, colourful, playful makerspace office is located at 2451 Bloor Street West in Toronto, steps from Jane TTC station, which is a good home base for meetings. We are currently working remotely. This position could be remote indefinitely, or in-person or a hybrid as mutually agreed upon.

    Qualifications

    If you have these, you'll be a great fit:

    • Experience growing revenue in a marketing position
    • Experience with managing or overseeing marketing areas such as website/SEO, copywriting, affiliate marketing, promotional calendars, growing followers, making/overseeing design, writing email newsletters that convert, and managing/overseeing paid ads (with knowledge of Google Analytics, Google Adwords, and Facebook Ads Manager)
    • Strong leadership experience, grit, and self-starter capabilities
    • An ability to pass a criminal background check with vulnerable sector screening

    Anything on this list would be an asset:

    • Experience with Wordpress and/or Webflow
    • Startup experience (preferably in a company that grew substantially within the time worked)
    • Good understanding of SEO
    • Good analytical skills (Google Analytics, Segmetrics, Heap, Looker, Tableau, Google Adwords, Facebook Ads, and/or Hubspot)
    • Design experience
    • UI/UX experience
    • Bachelor's degree in any related field

    If this opportunity sounds like the meaningful, career-building challenge you've been looking for, we can't wait to meet you!

    We strive to build a team that reflects the diversity of the community we work in and encourage applications from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with disabilities. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us.

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
What's MoneyClip?

MoneyClip is a digital wallet that provides Canadians with simplified access to the world of Decentralized Finance (DeFi). Building on peer-to-peer payments, MoneyClip is growing into a broad financial application built on the blockchain. At MoneyClip, we're combining unique cutting-edge technology with beautiful products that will change the way we understand and use money in our day-to-day lives.

Your Role: Growth Marketing Manager

You'll be joining our growth marketing team, with the responsibility of accelerating our user growth and engagement by leveraging digital channels. 

The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to create and execute effective acquisition strategies, launch new marketing programs, build relationships with agencies, networks, and optimize ongoing activities. This will be a hands-on tactical role where you'll have ownership and agency to effect valuable business metrics through innovation and experimentation. 

What You'll Do: 

  • Execute and oversee the growth strategy and conversion of our mobile apps and the website
  • Develop and execute acquisition and engagement strategies to deliver marketing campaigns that position the company solutions competitively 
  • Manage the customer journey end-to-end, from top of the funnel marketing campaigns to user activation initiatives
  • Identify new growth opportunities through user research, market research, competitor analysis and data analysis
  • Map conversions metrics and make proposals to improve key KPI's (Acquisition / Activation / Retention / Referral)
  • Measure, optimize and review key metrics to constantly improve funnel performance
  • Review and analyze marketing campaign performance data to identify trends and opportunities, as well as develop best practices to increase efficiency and effectiveness of campaign results.
  • Define paths of success through the creation of best practices within both organic and paid acquisition avenues
  • Demonstrate ability to work at the planning level (generating bold and innovative ideas for growth via paid and owned channels) and the expertise to see them through to execution
  • Provide complete performance reporting and analysis on mobile marketing campaigns and take relevant action on insights gained

What You'll Need:

  • A self-starter mentality: the ability to work independently, self-educate, build, communicate and execute on a growth marketing strategy
  • Data-driven mindset with a strong creative, imaginative flair for out of the box growth ideas and a proven track record of using metrics to develop and iterate campaigns
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to find ways to execute ideas with available resources and/or constraints
  • Understanding or curiosity of Cryptocurrency, DeFi, Web3, or Blockchain 
  • B.A./B.S. degree preferred, or equivalent experience
  • Digital marketing background in ASO, SMM, PPC (ASA/UAC), Email marketing, referral or retention marketing 
  • 4+ years of relevant work experience in mobile marketing or digital marketing with 2+ years of experience in mobile marketing strongly preferred 

Why MoneyClip?

  • Market competitive salary commensurate with experience
  • We're a stable, funded startup with a highly determined and capable leadership team
  • We're still early-stage. If you've always wanted to be a part of something bigger, make a lasting contribution and disrupt the market, this is your opportunity 
  • We are the future. Our product offering connects directly to DeFi (Decentralized Finance) protocols which are powered by Blockchain. We're pushing the envelope and challenging the status quo 
  • We invest deeply in our team members through an annual professional development allowance of $2,500
  • We offer team members a comprehensive benefits package (health, dental, vision) from day one
  • We are a remote-first company with the possibility of a hybrid option in the future
  • We will provide the resources, technology, and tools to ensure you are successful and give you a comfortable budget to set up your home office 
  • We take pride in our startup culture, deeply focus on collaboration and working towards the wider vision of bringing DeFi products to the masses 
  • A minimum of 3 weeks of vacation, generous sick and personal day policies, and offer parental leave top-up
  • A great team, yes really. 

Thank you 

As a thank you for considering applying to the role, click on this link to download the app for $15 cash in your MoneyClip wallet, no strings attached! 

We'd love to hear how you'd make the product and/or marketing better, please feel free to reach out on any of our social channels. 

Want to hear more? Visit our website and learn more!

MoneyClip is proud to be a diverse and equal opportunity employer and as such does not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, national origins, age, sexual orientation, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Selection decisions are solely based on job-related factors. MoneyClip is pleased to provide any accommodations you may require during the interview process. To request accommodations, email careers @moneyclip.io.

title: UX Designer
description:
Vetster is the world's fastest growing veterinary telehealth and pet care marketplace. Since our launch in 2020 we have established ourselves as a leader in the rapidly growing pet care industry. Named Overall Pet Healthcare Company of the Year, Vetster makes it easier for pet owners to connect with the veterinary care they need - any time, any where. 

We know that by empowering pet owners  with easy-to-use, convenient services and an open marketplace, we can move the industry forward, create professional opportunities in the veterinary community, and fundamentally improve animal wellbeing and access to care. The work we are doing is groundbreaking and is changing lives. 

Vetster offers flex and remote working options and is headquartered in Toronto, Canada. We work in cross-functional teams and believe ownership and accountability, along with trust, respect and inclusion are core tenets of success in our new working paradigm. At all levels, successful Vetster team members are those who seek to grow their careers and who share our ambition to build a global high-growth brand. 

Position Overview & Responsibilities:

As a UX Designer, you will design key assets to deliver a personalized, consistent, easy-to-use customer experience for our partners and customers. You will work closely with product managers, developers, copywriters, SEOs and data scientists to ideate, design and deliver an experience that serves the right content at the right time for our users.

Planning & Wireframing

  • Participate in the creation of the overall flow of the user experience for each product experience.
  • Source and analyze best practices, and innovate on best practices when possible for each kind of user flow.
  • Make sure to align each user experience for consistency across the Vetster's experience.
  • Adapt, improve, and synthesize complex ideas into simple web-based user experiences.

Designing

  • Design each interface to make them a beautiful, attractive user experience.
  • Iterate on your designs, from the feedback of the team given business requirements.
  • Leverages existing designs when possible.
  • Connect the dots between different parts of the Vetster UX.
  • Coordinates approvals with additional designers and team members.

Testing

  • Engages with subject matter experts from across the organization to deliver on their program goals by iteratively testing various UX approaches to better understand and satisfy the user intent of our customers and partners.
  • Participate in the A/B testing and SEO A/B testing with the team.
  • Review quantitative and qualitative data with the team and “debug” your user experience steps to make them as frictionless as possible over time.

Requirements

  • 3 to 5 years of experience delivering global products in a similar large-scale product-led environment.
  • Advanced knowledge of app user interface design and creates a variety of artifacts with core design tools, such as Figma and Sketch. 
  • Demonstrates advanced knowledge of the principles, concepts, and theories of product design and related areas including copywriting and research.
  • Experience supporting designs with a broad mix of qualitative and quantitative insights.
  • Experience collaborating with Product Management and engineering counterparts.
  • The ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously, and multi-task in an agile environment is a plus.

Skills 

  • Demonstrates a good understanding of Vetster's brand, design and accessibility standards, works closely with the design system and contributes to the design system.
  • Creates high-quality well-researched and data-informed design assets and solutions.
  • Responsible for the overall product design quality of the Homepage entry point and UI framework.
  • Generates new product ideas and devises tests and/or processes to evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions.
  • Coding CSS at a developer level is nice to have.

WHAT WE OFFER 

  • Full access to the Vetster service for your own pets.
  • Bring your furry (canine) friends to our office.
  • Vacation and personal days to support work-life balance.
  • Attractive health and dental benefits for you and your family.
  • Competitive salary based on experience and market.
  • Flexible work and remote work options.
  • Career growth and international work opportunities.
  • Team building and social events.
  • Proud to be a living wage employer

title: Sr. Brand Manager, Innovation, Canada / International
description:
Business Unit Overview:

At Post Consumer Brands, we have mor ethan 125 years of experience making the breakfast cereals that people love. And even after a century, we're still innovating. We are driven by our mission to Make Better Happen - and we want YOU to join our team!

Brand:

With names like Pebbles, Honey Bunches of Oats, Great Grains, and Malt-O-Meal in our portfolio, weâ€™ve earned more spots in the top 50 best-selling brands than any other cereal company. And as the third-ranked company in the cereal category, our business is growing. Thatâ€™s where you come in. Our company is a hearty mix of ambitious people who want to make great things happen.  

Location Description:

Post Consumer Brands Canadian corporate office is in the country's largest city, yet just a short drive from nature and charming small towns. The Toronto office is home to about 40 sales and marketing professionals focused on Post Consumer Brands international presence in North America and beyond. Join an exciting team that's on the forefront of our innovation and growth.

Responsibilities:

Overview

 

At Post Consumer Brands, we are driven by a single mission: Make Better Happen.   This mission is multi-faceted and applies to the consumers we serve, the customers we partner with, and the shareholder value that we create.   We are committed to safe, delicious breakfast cereal that is safely produced and responsibly marketed.   We are a growth-minded food company that believes deeply in the power of teamworkâ€¦and we are looking for our next member of the team.

With more than 90% of households in Canada buying cereal, our brands (Shreddies, Honey Bunches of Oats, Shredded Wheat, Honeycomb, and more) have been honored to compete in a large category and fill an important space in our consumersâ€™ cupboards for more than 100 years and counting!  

In order to maintain our strength and drive further growth, we are currently hiring a Senior Brand Manager of Portfolio Innovation.  

 

Responsibilities and Accountabilities

 

The Senior Brand Manager of portfolio innovation is a key, critical leader in the management of our innovation pipeline across all brands within Ready To Eat Cereal (RTEC) and Snacking. Unlocking growth potential for our company, this position is responsible for driving growth while delivering profitability targets of branded innovation items.   Through influence and effective collaborating, the incumbent will align the organization to the key strategies that fuel the innovation plan, as well as the scope and scale of innovation to be pursued. This marketing opportunity will require the ability to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment, multi-task, and keeping various projects on track simultaneously. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, will be required to keep other functional areas apprised of and engaged in teamâ€™s initiatives.  

Specific accountabilities include:

  • In collaboration with the U.S innovation team develop and oversee execution of a 36-month innovation pipeline for the ready to eat cereal and snacking portfolio
  • Responsibilities include idea generation, commercialization, launch and post launch brand management of new platforms and categories
  • Collaborate closely with R&D on near in and further out technologies available and how/when to scale for our brands
  • Partner with cross-functional team members to ensure proper leverage of the PCB commercialization process and capabilities
  • Work with Insights and Analytics team to identify learning agendas to drive stronger understanding of the consumer and jobs to be done
  • Engage with Sales to develop sales materials and communication timeline
  • Establish a â€œbest practiceâ€ playbook for the successful launch of sustaining innovation
  • Establish and trace critical KPIs for each new item launch, incorporating measurement into an innovation continuous improvement model
  • In partnership with Demand Planning and Sales, align to monthly consumption and demand forecasts
  • Define, develop and implement integrated communication plans to reach the right audience, with the right message, at the right time, and in the right medium to drive household penetration.
Qualifications:

Education

  • Bachelorâ€™s Degree required, MBA Preferred.

 

Experience

  • Minimum of 7 years in brand marketing within consumer packaged goods; previous innovation experience preferred

 

Other Characteristics

  • Knowledge of consumer retail marketing, advertising, sales, trade and consumer promotion, market analysis, market research, budgeting, financial analysis, and pricing, innovation are all needed in order to be effective in this role
  • Fluid understanding of a P&L and the ability to drive actions that balance top and bottom line performance
  • A â€œcan doâ€ attitude and approach to leading with a strong bias for action and results

 

Post Holdings and Post Consumer Brands provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, status as a covered veteran and any other category protected under applicable federal, state, provincial and local laws.

You will be responsible for managing our fountain and frozen partnership with 7Eleven, driving the marketing calendar, finding synergies between PepsiCo & customer strategies and developing breakthrough programming to deliver growth. title: Senior UI Designer
description:
Senior UI Designer

We're a virtual reality (VR) game development studio that's creating the next generation of online casino gaming. Our exclusive partnership with PokerStars (the world's largest poker site) has propelled our debut game (PokerStars VR) to becoming one of the most popular multiplayer games in VR.

Originally based in Toronto, our team has adopted remote working for the future. As we continue to grow rapidly, we're looking for talented people to help make our ambitions a reality. If you're passionate about gaming and VR, we'd be delighted to hear from you!

Role

We are looking for a creative and highly motivated Senior User Interface Designer to join our team. You will be building the cutting edge in online multiplayer casino games across multiple platforms (Desktop VR, Mobile VR, Console VR). You will deliver visually impressive moments that positively influence gameplay and enhance the player experience.

Responsibilities

  • Must be able to design interfaces that are fresh, appealing, and usable
  • Help define and implement set methodologies, and design guides for alignment across all VR platforms
  • Must have hands-on UI design chops to develop mockups and prototypes
  • Must be able to work closely with Product Managers, Designers, UX and Developers to establish the look of the VR's front-end
  • Knowledge in assisting all cross-functional designers and engineers to build logical, and user friendly UI solutions
  • Must always have the user-advocacy mindset by research and pre-production designs to test usability and and offer implementation suggestions 
  • Ability to accept feedback, iterate, work with othes and adapt to it

Requirements

  • 4+ years in a UI Design role at a game studio, VR studio or equivalent experience in mobile
  • 4+ years of Unity Engine experience
  • Mobile UI experience
  • Ability to accept feedback and adapt to it
  • A creative and collaborative spirit
  • Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills
  • A keen eye for detail
  • Ability to onboard and work remotely

Nice-To-Haves

  • UX design experience
  • VR interaction experience
  • Unity experience
  • Cross-platform design experience

title: User Experience Designer
description:
At Ensemble, we build innovative custom software solutions for some of the largest brands in the media and entertainment, financial services, insurance, government, life sciences, and manufacturing industries. We're proud of what we do, and we know that our incredible team is the secret to our success.

Ensemble is currently looking to grow our User Experience team with individuals who are passionate about crafting unique and exciting experiences for our clients. As a member of our User Experience team, you will work to elicit requirements, define the Information Architecture, produce Wireframes and deliver high quality Visual Designs. We are looking for someone with a particularly great eye for visual design.

The UX Designer role is perfect for you if you have:

  • A background in User Experience and/or Graphic Design (Web Development will be considered too).
  • A strong Visual Design sense, with a knowledge of web, mobile and 10ft design standards 
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign), Adobe XD and Figma.
  • A solid understanding of User Centred Design principals and goals as well as SDLC.
  • Great at explaining things. You can organize your thoughts in a concise, friendly way that communicates the right information to the right audience. 
  • Excellent time management skills, as well as the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. 
  • Positive in the face of adversity. Sometimes deadlines are tight, sometimes gathering information can be a struggle, can you handle it with a smile on your face?

Along with a keen desire to succeed, we are searching for individuals who enjoy working in a collaborative team environment. If you have excellent communication and time management skills, paired with a winning attitude and an unparalleled work ethic, then you would be a good fit for Ensemble — and we want to hear from you.

Life at Ensemble:

We support a healthy work/life balance for our employees, but we know that's easier said than done. So, in addition to a comprehensive benefits plan we also offer:

  • Remote work (must be located within Canada)
  • Option to drop-in and work at our offices in Yaletown and Richmond, BC,
  • Team lunches to celebrate project milestones,
  • Gaming, activity, and movie nights (remote for now, in-person returning soon),
  • Lunch & Learns on various topics, 
  • Access to the Ensemble farm in Richmond, BC which includes:
    • Meeting and office space for drop-in work
    • Basketball, pickleball, tennis, beach volleyball, and a running track
    • Ping pong and foosball
    • Garden plots for planting vegetables
    • Barbecue, picnic tables, and kitchen amenities
  • Summer family barbecue & winter holiday party 

A bit more about us:

Since 1995, Ensemble has been providing custom technology solutions to our customers, with the goal of helping them deliver incredible digital experiences to their customers. We have built such strong relationships with our customers over the years that the majority of our business now comes from repeat business and referrals — and we couldn't be happier about that.

Regardless of who we work with, or what we are working on, our success relies on three important factors: our customers, our people, and our process.

With teams in Europe and North America, Ensemble operates on a global scale providing solutions and support to some of the largest brands around the world.

If you are interested in joining our team, apply today!

title: Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager
description:
WHO WE ARE 

At Personify, we build strong connections with our clients so they can build strong connections with their communities. One of the most diversified and fastest-growing technology providers of integrated software solutions, we are innovative leaders in the industry and respond to the needs of our clients through products that include: 

  • A2Z Events, a multi-event platform that enables clients to manage their events from start to finish, including floor plans, financials, managing contracts and sponsorships, and increasing engagement through mobile applications and a networking suite. 
  • CommUnity, an online community platform for those with common interests to connect, learn and collaborate.  
  • WildApricot, an all-in-one solution that automates and simplifies workflows enabling nonprofits and associations to manage their membership, streamline their processes, and make room for human connections. 
  • MemberClicks, an easy-to-use member management cloud solution aimed at small to medium-sized nonprofit organizations and associations. 
  • ThreeSixty, an enterprise management solution for associations, nonprofits, YMCAs and JCCs to engage, manage and grow their membership. 
  • And more. 

At Personify, we're in the relationship building business, powering conversations, donations, events, and foundations through analytics, tools, and robust backend management systems. With 300+ employees in our offices in Austin, Atlanta, and Toronto, and as part of remote teams across Canada and the US, we're the people designing the technology that reaches 30,000+ clients resulting in 3B+ interactions a year with our products. Joining us is a chance to take your skills and expertise and build solutions for the real world that strengthen the connection between clients, their mission, and their communities. 

WHO WE NEED 

You will own paid search (PPC, SEM) demand generation for Personify's SMB products (WildApricot and MemberClicks), developing end-to-end campaigns from initial brainstorm to execution. This role requires significant experience with paid digital media: running quick and cost-effective tests, optimizing ad copy and landing page copy/design, and reporting. You will be responsible for testing new paid channels in addition to managing all current PPC, retargeting, and programmatic efforts. Collaboration is the key to success for this role as you will be working with other marketing team members, sales, and outside agencies to execute on the go-to-market strategies optimizing the conversion of marketing efforts into pipeline and revenue.  

WHO YOU ARE 

The ideal person for this role is a self-motivated, goal-oriented, organized individual who is obsessed with meeting monthly, quarterly, and yearly goals. You are an inquisitive self-starter who loves to solve problems, think outside of the box, analyze data, and make decisions based on quantitative results. 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU 

You will be working with an amazing team of marketing and sales professionals that are invested in your success. We work and play hard, celebrate results, learn from our mistakes, and work to continually improve our performance so that everyone succeeds. 

HOW YOU WILL MAKE AN IMPACT 

  • Work with internal subject matter experts and two outside agencies to build digital campaigns (PPC, retargeting, programmatic)  
  • Manage Gartner Digital Advertising relationship, including overseeing client review process, optimizing product overviews, managing bids to ensure they are in line with the budget and generating monthly, quarterly, and yearly budgeted MQLs 
  • Increase ad click thru rates and landing page conversion rates through regular, methodical A/B testing 
  • Design and implement lead conversion campaigns including email marketing drips, nurture and recycled lead lifecycles.  
  • Manage list segmentation and scoring to deliver more targeted and relevant messaging to improve engagement and ultimately conversion.  
  • Partner closely with marketing and sales teams across Personify to ensure proper messaging, timing, and execution of campaigns across email, web personalization, and advertising efforts.  
  • Explore, test, deploy, and analyze new paid channels 
  • Develop, document, and implement repeatable testing processes 
  • Leverage reporting, analytics, and marketing technology stack to optimize strategy and execution continuously 
  • Provide detailed reports and proactive solutions to the team and senior leaders 

WHAT YOU BRING 

  • Bachelor's degree required 
  • 4-5 years of demand generation experience with a complete understanding of paid media  
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required 
  • Strong work ethic 
  • High accountability 
  • Excellent time management skills 
  • Desire to continually grow and improve 
  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills 
  • Preferred Salesforce and Marketo experience

WHY JOIN US? 

We are committed to creating a balanced, inclusive, and equitable workplace.  

  • We recognize and appreciate the varied experiences, backgrounds, and knowledge our team can bring to our culture, operations, products, and relationships internally and externally. 
  • We have an impactful recruitment diversity strategy to increase representation across the company at every level. And, we're working with our teams to create employee resource groups that further support our people in the safe spaces and ways they need to feel heard. 

We're proud of our evolution. We promote – and live – a culture of not just listening but acting, making ourselves available and accessible. 

We're a great place to work. 

Guided by our values, inspired by our clients, and forging ahead with optimism and the commitment to service of a new President and CEO, Scott Collison, at the helm, Personify is driven by our purpose. We empower our clients, from small nonprofits to large enterprise organizations, to build strong connections with their communities, ultimately enabling them to achieve their missions. And, our leadership team brings profound expertise and a deep commitment to taking Personify to the next level. 

With generous paid-time-off, flexibility, and the option to be fully remote, we prioritize the well-being of our teams. Choosing where to power up their laptops empowers our employees to connect with each other and our clients from anywhere while meeting their life demands and without sacrificing their performance. In fact, we know it makes them do better, feel better, and enjoy being part of our company.  

Recognized by Built In Austin in its Best Places to Work Awards for three years in a row in 2019, 2020, and 2021, we spend our days creating a virtual place and physical space where people are comfortable being themselves, feel supported and heard, enjoy each other's company, and have an opportunity to shine.  

Apply now. 

Personify is a company made up of people who like to work with brilliant teams passionate about delivering exceptional solutions to our clients. We're a place to make an impact, see the difference, and accelerate your career doing something you love. 

We know not everyone gains their education and skills the traditional way, so if you feel you have 70% of the qualifications you are looking for and you are ready to make a difference, submit your application. Of course, we can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider the full scope of who you are and what you bring. 

Personify is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran or disability status, or other protected characteristics.  

Employment offers are contingent on the candidate successfully completing a background investigation in compliance with federal, state, and local laws.

Of course, we can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider the full scope of who you are and what you bring.", 'High accountability', 'Work with internal subject matter experts and two outside agencies to build digital campaigns (PPC, retargeting, programmatic)', "Bachelor's degree required"]

title: Product Marketing Manager, Devices
description:
Stratuscent has digitized the sense of smell. We've done for the nose what the camera did for the eyes and the microphone did for the ears. It took six years and some help from NASA but we did it. Now it's time for us to bring it to the world. The first product we launched on the B2C side is NOZE - the world's smartest air quality monitor. You can learn more about it at GetNoze.com

Are you interested in rolling up your sleeves and taking broad ownership over a cutting edge product? This is a rare opportunity to enter a transformative tech company and become an instrumental part of its growth journey.

People who succeed at Stratuscent have a sense of urgency, a ton of initiative, infinite curiosity, strong internal drive, and an enthusiasm for new technologies. If you're bursting with fresh ideas and want to join a company in its journey to change the status quo, then this opportunity is for you.

Who You Are

You are a self-starter with a strong entrepreneurial mindset. This role will require you to think both strategically and tactically, and you absolutely must enjoy rolling up your sleeves and getting your hands dirty. This role is not for those who want predictable because no two days will be the same.

You will be a natural problem solver, a relentless multi-tasker, a bold ideator, and a determined executor. You are a generalist who can appreciate the big picture while having an eye for detail, and “getting things done” is just the way you operate. For this role, we value breadth over depth. Most importantly, you understand that the key to your success is in building great working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.

What you will do:

  • Take the role of de facto CEO of the NOZE product bridging the technical, business and creative worlds to maximize business impact;
  • Develop product roadmaps, craft positioning and go-to-market strategies, and effectively execute in-market to hit KPIs;
  • Oversee, manage and optimize the customer experience on our D2C site as well as our presence on partner e-commerce platforms to maximize conversion;
  • Provide guidance to the marketing team on product use cases, benefits, market segments, competitive advantages, features, etc;
  • Develop robust quality feedback loops, analytics, and processes to drive continuous customer experience improvement;
  • Assess and evaluate new business opportunities for extending NOZE into new market segments based on salient pain points;
  • Own the customer support function to delight customers and create positive experiences;
  • Lead the discovery, prioritization and development of new features focusing on both backend functionality as well as user experience to ensure a world class product;
  • Maintain a real-time pulse on the market landscape with continuous market and competitive research.

What you need:

  • A self-starter mentality with natural leadership qualities;
  • Proven track record in product management, taking end-to-end ownership and driving results;
  • High energy and flexibility to manage diverse responsibilities and multiple tasks under competing deadlines in a fast-paced and often ambiguous environment;
  • Ability to address any audience with confidence and professionalism, and leverage this skill to gain buy-in, overcome issues and achieve results;
  • A proven track-record of successfully releasing and growing a B2C product;
  • Experience working with new or emerging technologies and a borderline obsession for design and user experience would be major assets.

What we offer:

  • The opportunity to join a forward-thinking company surrounded by a collaborative team of innovative thinkers
  • A rewarding career path with diverse opportunities for professional growth
  • A competitive compensation and benefits package including employer paid health and dental benefits for regular, full-time employees
  • A generous learning and development budget to attend conferences, classes and other events
  • A bunch of other perks that involve food, fun and travel

title: Area Manager
description:
PTW is a leading industry solutions provider delivering construction, fabrication, and maintenance services. Our network extends across Canada, and the United States. We create and deliver innovative industrial solutions to customers in the agricultural, mining, oil and gas, petrochemical, pulp and paper, nuclear and renewable energy industries.

PTW is hiring an Area Manager to join our team in Medicine Hat, AB!

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Area Manager is accountable for all aspects of branch operations, customer service and the delivery of branch results consistent with PTW’s operational expectations. This role is responsible for the direction and leadership for the overall operations, and to effectively and efficiently manage the development and directions of the operational team to drive the growth of revenue, technical productivity and promote high quality customer satisfaction while building relationships. 

A DAY IN THE LIFE…

  • Manage all aspects of branch operations that include but not limited to employees, scheduling, efficiency, cost control, preventative maintenance, revenue opportunities and inventory levels.
  • Develop and implement new business strategies for creating or improving processes and procedures to improve branch performance.
  • Monitor branch performance against goals to ensure that progress is being made, and that corrective action is taken if necessary.
  • Required to visit active worksites a minimum of twice per month to discuss safety and work practices displaying visible safety leadership.
  • Responsible for appropriate staff levels to meet requirements of the branch.
  • Responsible for recruitment, hiring, terminations and performance management.
  • Develop and manage business relationships and customer contacts.
  • Manage the morale in the branch by setting and demonstrating a strong business ethic for dealing with employees, suppliers and customers.
  • Enhance and develop processes and practices to meet the goals of the department.
  • Ensure the consistent delivery of high quality service in the branch to exceed customer expectations.
  • Assist with budget preparation.
  • Monitor financial performance to ensure the branch is meeting or exceeding budgetary commitment.
  • Analyzes and reports on the branch’s key performance indicators and industry/market trends.
  • Develop and implement strategies around improving the financial performance of the branch.
  • Analyze employee and customer concerns and present options to solve their issues.

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum of five (5) years in a management or senior supervisory role.
  • Journeyman Electrician and/or Instrument Technician.
  • Preference given to those with post-secondary education in business.
  • Advanced knowledge of the industry and company operations required.
  • Excellent management, negotiating and organizational skills. Demonstrated ability to lead a team and achieve results.
  • Experience in budgeting, project management and operations.

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

  • Travel may be required for this position.

Why PTW?

Competitive Wages and benefits plans | PTW Apprenticeship Tuition Program | Quality work | Safety and quality are built into everything we do | Safety Training and PPE provided | Consistent work | Opportunity for advancement | Learning and development | Opportunities to travel, stay local or relocate | Team atmosphere | People-focused company

ADDITIONAL INFO

We care about your health and safety. At PTW, we follow all protocols set by the provincial and local governments. We also implement measures as required by our clients and our own Health and Safety team.

PTW is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process. Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

OUR VALUES GROUND US: CARE | EXCELLENCE | PASSION

title: Senior Regional Revenue Manager
description:
Senior Regional Revenue Manager

Our entire Accor estate expands across the world. With over 300,000 experts committed to rejuvenating the hospitality experience we pride ourselves in being the employer of choice, so live limitlessly, come as you are, grow with us, work with purpose and explore the endless opportunities in store.

We are worldwide Augmented Hospitality leaders, the best at what we do. Heartists is what we call ourselves, generous, passionate, attentive and free, whether we are welcoming guests, connecting with our peers or serving others, it’s all in our DNA!

Our Talents enrich our culture and are huge contributors to success of our brand. Each Heartist has a story to tell of their own journey at Accor. We welcome you to take a step into our world and begin the next chapter of your career journey with us as Senior Regional Revenue Manager!

Here is a snapshot at some of the responsibilities you will hold:

  • Ensure that the RM Strategy (business mix, pricing, brand positioning of the hotels) is in place and properly deployed to achievea business consistency in the area (market place or region).

  • Is in charge to create and leverage some synergies between the hotels, ensuringthat the business is properly split among them (especially in a competitive environment)

  • Through the organization of regular meetings with the operations, ensure that the revenue of each hotel is optimized thanks to a consistent approach on pricing, reservation, distribution strategy development at hotel level.

  • Is in charge to consolidate and manage the reporting of the RM performance at the regional or market place level and suggest the appropriate sales actions according to business risks and opportunities detected for the future periods (from one week to one year)

  • Act as a consultant for the hotel general Manager and revenue manager for RM technical and HR topics (recruitment, coaching, training)

  • Coordinate the appropriation and use by the hotels of RM processes, systems and tools in his perimeter.

Your profile? You will have a Degree in Hotel Management (or equivalent) with at least 5 to 7 year’s experience in a similar position and a strong grasp of Revenue Management systems such as EzRMS & IDeaS.

You will be highly engaging leader, analytically/data driven with a strong commercial acumen!

To acknowledge your hard work, loyalty and commitment to us, we offer an extensive benefits package; competitive salary, bonus, season ticket loans, subsidised gym membership, private medical healthcare, pension, and of course complimentary hotel stays (to name a few). 

Your Accor experience begins now, so if you are looking to take the next step in your careeer journey then we want to hear from you!

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS
