title: Business Development Consultant (Sales)
description:
Creating Peace of Mind by Pioneering Safety and Security


At Allegion, we help keep the people you know and love safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 brands, 11,000+ employees globally and products sold in 130 countries, we specialize in security around the doorway and beyond.


At Allegion: We’re Redefining Security . Allegion products help keep people safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 highly recognizable brands sold globally like Schlage, LCN, Von Duprin, Glynn Johnson, Locknetics, Ives etc., we specialize in security around the doorway and adjacent area: everything from residential locks and portable security to commercial locks, exit devices, openers and closers, electronic access control and workforce productivity solutions.


At the core of this $2.7 billion business is the knowledge and experience of over 11,000+ dedicated employees across the globe and - we’re growing!


If you are a dynamic, driven, visionary problem solver focused on providing solutions to customers, boosting brand awareness, and improving competitive product performance in local markets all while advancing your career within a warehouse, then this opportunity is perfect for you: Allegion Canada is currently looking for a Residential Territory Manager to join our winning team in Mississauga, ON.


The Residential Territory Manager is responsible for driving all demand creation activities for the Allegion product portfolio in the Single and Multi-Family vertical markets across Alberta– with a specific focus on the Schlage Residential product offering – as well as the management of the assigned accounts responsible for the delivery of market share growth in these important market segments. The ideal candidate will utilize prospect selling sales skills to identify and enhance relationships with key decision makers within the developers, builders, interior designers, installers, and distributors that support these markets.


What you will do


+ Lead the local execution of the Single & Multi Family programs to targeted accounts to drive market share growth by developing business relationships with major influencers in the region.

+ Establish Territory Business Plans that align to Business goals and Key Initiatives and will include the following: dealer targets, builder targets, product training, investment strategies, and revenue goals

+ Utilize Dynamics CRM to effectively manage the sales process, account planning and collaboration across multiple functional areas.

+ Networks with all types of end-users and influencers, including single & multi-family builders, installers, remodelers, architects, designers, consultants, general contractors, integrators/low voltage by way of active participation in industry events and associations

+ Utilizes existing marketing programs to maximize market-share growth for our residential product portfolio

+ Develops and maintains list of current and prospective customers to include top 30 single & multi-family owners, builders with corporate offices in region

+ Responsible for meeting budget and expense parameters for optimizing operating profit

+ Supports the business marketing strategies by providing accurate and timely sales reports and competitive information to the Regional Sales Organization.

+ Utilizes specification writer for determining new construction specifications in the Multi-Family vertical

+ Maintain excellent industry, territory, and product knowledge to identify trends, displacement opportunities and competitive activity that will allow for market disruption and share gain in both new construction and aftermarket channels.

+ Provides forecasting data for Inventory Management Team


What you will need


+ 5-7 years of Consultative, solution-based sales experience with similar/relevant industries and products

+ Strong collaboration skills and demonstrated ability to work effectively across functions (marketing, customer care, operations etc.). A Team player with a positive attitude and aptitude for learning

+ Ability to communicate effectively at all levels, outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

+ Ability to work with and influence a variety of indirect and direct accounts

+ Self-motivator and entrepreneurial mindset with a strong Consultative Solutions based sales background

+ Able to work at building a business. Small scale to larger scale builds up.

+ Ability to think strategically and problem solve with entrepreneurial commitment to achieving goals.

+ Strong organizational skills with the ability to execute on business plans.

+ Customer-centric with the ability to balance both customer benefits and business financials effectively.


Allegion is a Great Place to Grow your Career if: 


+ You are seeking a rewarding opportunity that allows you to truly help others.  With thousands of employees and customers around the world, there’s plenty of room to make an impact. As our values state, “this is your business, run with it” (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html) .

+ You value personal well-being and balance because we do too! 

+ You’re looking for a company that will invest in your professional development.  As we grow, we want you to grow with us. 

+ You want a culture that promotes work-life balance.  Our employees enjoy generous time off, because at Allegion we recognize that you have a full life outside of work! 


What You'll Get from Us:


+ A commitment to Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging: making a difference and leading with purpose

+ High energy, influential, cross collaborative team environment

+ Opportunities to leverage your unique strengths through Clifton Strengths testing and coaching.

+ Customized individual development plans and growth maps to help you unlock your full potential and career graph with Allegion.

+ Competitive base salary

+ Flexible, Hybrid model of working


+ Health, dental and other insurance coverage, helping you “be safe, be healthy” (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html#serve)   

+ Tuition Reimbursement  

+ Employee Discounts

+ Community involvement and opportunities to give back so you can “serve others, not yourself”  (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html#serve)


Want to know more about us? Follow this link https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/index.html to learn more.


Apply to join our team today. We look forward to hearing from you!


We Celebrate Who We Are!


Allegion is committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. Together, we embrace all differences and similarities among colleagues, as well as the differences and similarities within the relationships that we foster with customers, suppliers and the communities where we live and work. Whatever your background, experience, race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, disability status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law, we will make sure that you have every opportunity to impress us in your application and the opportunity to give your best at work, not because we’re required to, but because it’s the right thing to do. We are also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If for any reason you cannot apply through our career site and require an accommodation or assistance, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team .


© Allegion plc, 2020 | Block D, Iveagh Court, Harcourt Road, Dublin 2, Co. Dublin, Ireland


REGISTERED IN IRELAND WITH LIMITED LIABILITY REGISTERED NUMBER 527370


Allegion is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/equal-opportunity.html)


Privacy Policy

title: Gestionnaire de projets marketing et e-commerce
description:
Notre partenaire, une entreprise Québécoise en approvisionnement de produits d'horticulture est à la recherche d'un gestionnaire marketing et e-commerce à sa succursale de Laval. Travailler pour cette entreprise dynamique et en pleine croissance consolidera tes compétences de généraliste marketing et favorisera l'évolution de ta carrière!

Entreprise et une équipe et un management de type famille professionnelle travaillante, un fort esprit d’équipe, là ou ton opinion a de la valeur et peut faire partie du changement!

Avantages
L'entreprise offre un salaire compétitif et des programmes de bénéfices complets incluant
• Assurance collectives avec invalidité longue durée et assurance-vie
• Congés pour maladie
• REER collectif
• Télémédecine
• Programme d’aide aux employés et à la famille (PAEF);
• Programme de consultation de médecin virtuel (EQ Care).
• 1 jour de télé-travail par semaine
• Espace de travail fermé au bureau



Responsabilités
Marketing
- Contribuer, diriger et évaluer la mise en œuvre des stratégies de marketing.
- Collaborer avec les ventes et les autres départements pour les stratégies marketing.
- Effectuer des études de marché et analyser les résultats.
- Planifier, organiser et participer aux activités marketing pour renforcer la notoriété de la marque, incluant les sessions de formation.
- Gérer le contenu et le matériel promotionnels tel que brochures, infolettres et catalogues de produits en respect avec les échéanciers du plan marketing.
- Planifier et gérer le budget et le plan marketing, en collaboration avec les fonctions ventes et finances.
- Effectuer la vigie des différents événements promotionnels de l’industrie afin d’assurer une présence stratégique.
- Gérer et protéger l’image de marque.
Réseaux sociaux
- Produit et met en œuvre un plan de communication adapté aux médias sociaux.
- Entretenir notre présence dans les médias sociaux sur l'ensemble des canaux numériques
- Gérer les publications et les commentaires sur les réseaux sociaux.
e-Commerce
- Améliorer la visibilité web de l'entreprise et planifier les campagnes de marketing numérique, notamment sur le web, référencement/moteurs de recherche, par courriel, dans les médias sociaux et de publicité visuelle.
- Suivre les statistiques du trafic internet et faire des recommandations pour améliorer les performances.
- Développer la plateforme et l'interface graphique de la solution de commerce en ligne (front et back office).
- Définir la stratégie e-commerce et identifier les produits et services à commercialiser en ligne.
- Améliorer l’expérience de navigation du client web en implantant et présentant des idées de nouvelles présentations et d’améliorations.
- Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le département des achats, des ventes, des services corporatifs et des équipes contractuelles.



Qualifications
COMPÉTENCES RECHERCHÉES :
• BAC en marketing numérique ou équivalent.
• Minimum de 3 ans d’expériences en marketing, en gestion de site web et en e-commerce.
• Être déterminé à toujours vouloir améliorer l’expérience du client numérique (UX).
• Excellente connaissance du marketing digital et de la gestion des réseaux sociaux.
• Connaissance de base en programmation web (HTML).
• Expérience avec des outils de référencement web (Google Search Console, Google Analytics, …)
• Connaissance du milieu de la distribution/commerce de détails/agriculture/horticulture (un atout).
• Connaissance de la plateforme Magento 2 Commerce (un atout).
• Connaissance des logiciels Photoshop, InDesign et Illustrator (un atout).
• Être responsable, proactif et automne.


Sommaire
Tu as des questions? Tu as de l'intérêt?
N'hésites plus et contacte-moi

annick.brouillard@randstad.ca

Pourquoi faire affaires avec moi:

Accès à des opportunités d’emploi qui ne sont pas affichées ailleurs sur le web.
Nous sommes un partenaire d’affaire stratégique dans vos recherches d’emploi.
On négocie vos conditions d’emploi pour vous.
Nous travaillons sur le territoire de Laval depuis plusieurs années, nous connaissons bien les entreprises et choisissons bien nos clients.
Vous n’avez rien à perdre, notre service est tout à fait gratuit pour les chercheurs d’emploi!

Randstad Canada s'engage à favoriser une main-d'œuvre représentative de toutes les populations du Canada. Nous nous engageons en conséquence à développer et à mettre en œuvre des stratégies pour promouvoir l'équité, la diversité et l'inclusion dans toutes nos sphères d'activité en examinant nos politiques, pratiques et systèmes internes tout au long du cycle de vie de notre main-d'œuvre, y compris au niveau du recrutement, de la rétention et de l'avancement pour tout individu. En plus de notre profond engagement sur le respect des principes des droits de la personne, nous nous engageons à prendre toute mesure positive pour influer sur les changements à mettre en place en vue de garantir la participation de tout individu dans le monde du travail et ce, sans obstacle, systémique ou autre, en particulier pour les groupes en quête d'équité généralement sous-représentés dans la main-d'œuvre au Canada, y compris les personnes qui s'identifient comme femmes ou personnes non-binaires/non conformes au genre, les Peuples et communautés autochtones, les personnes en situation de handicap (visible ou invisible), les personnes faisant partie des minorités visibles, les personnes racisées et des communautés LGBTQ2+.

Randstad Canada s'engage à créer et à maintenir un milieu de travail inclusif et accessible pour toutes les personnes candidates et employés en soutenant leurs besoins d'accessibilité et d'accommodation tout au long du cycle de vie de l'emploi. Nous demandons à toutes les personnes demandeuses d'emploi de bien vouloir identifier leurs besoins en matière d'accommodation en envoyant un courriel à

accessibilite@randstad.ca

pour s'assurer de leur capacité à participer pleinement au processus d'entrevue.

title: Junior Brand Assistant
description:
Lions Dynasty is seeking a Brand Assistant to act as the face of client brands at marketing campaigns throughout the North York area. Lions Dynasty creates tailored marketing campaigns for some of the largest corporations in the nation.  We have recently expanded our client portfolio due to high demand, and have recently signed on with one of our largest clients to date! Lions Dynasty is in immediate need of a professional with excellent customer service skill to maintain customer and client relationships and promote client products!

As a Brand Assistant, you will have the opportunity to represent prestigious clientele in the field.  You will foster excitement about clientsâ€™ brands and products, build a loyal client base, and drive future business.  The right candidate will have the opportunity assist with executing field marketing campaigns and expand new projects for clients.

Responsibilities of the Brand Assistant:

  • Attend events in designated promotional areas outside big-box retailers to provide excellent face-to-face customer service and educate customers on the benefits of clients' products and services.
  • Create a unique customer service experience at in-field marketing campaigns to increase brand awareness and build customer loyalty.
  • Educate consumers on benefits of client services, overcome objections, and close sales of client services.
  • Coordinate and execute strategic in-field marketing campaigns relevant to the region to increase client revenue.
  • Create, build, and maintain relationships with clientele and sales team to facilitate brand growth.
  • Support management to ensure campaigns are consistent with marketing plans on time, budget, and scope.


Benefits of the Brand Assistant Position:

  • Outstanding training program with extensive personal coaching by experience staff.
  • Opportunity to represent quality products and network with prestigious clientele.
  • Full-time, permanent position with consistent hours.
  • Competitive hourly rate plus performance bonuses.

Requirements for the Brand Assistant:

  • Experience in retail, sales, field sales, field marketing, product demonstrations and associated fields providing customer service and promotional support an asset.
  • Understanding of marketing and sales fundamentals including product positioning, pricing, market research, and distribution preferred.
  • Engaging presentation skills with ability to adapt do different audiences.
  • Self-starter with outgoing and results-oriented personality
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

*Local applicants only. Must be able to start work within 1-2 weeks of employment offer acceptance!

A valid work permit is required as we are not currently offering sponsorship. 

 

** ** Having a valid driverâ€™s license and reliable transportation (personally owned vehicle) is recommended. Travel to on-site events will be a requirement in this role. ** 

Powered by JazzHR

title: Manager, IT Trading & Marketing (Calgary, AB, CA)
description:
WHO WE ARE

“Powering Economies and Communities”

TransAlta owns, operates, and develops a diverse fleet of electrical generation assets in Canada, the United States and Australia, providing municipalities, industries and businesses with safe, low-cost and reliable clean electricity.For over 100 years, TransAlta has been a responsible operator and proud community-member where its employees work and live. We are committed to fostering a dynamic, productive, and safe work environment. Our employees contribute to a diverse, open, and transparent culture with clear accountabilities, strong leadership, and challenging opportunities for personal career growth.

For more information about TransAlta, visit our website at,www.transalta.com.

Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion

It is our collective mission to ensure that every single employee feels a sense of inclusion and belonging and can show up to work as their true authentic self. TransAlta is committed to hiring a diverse workforce including women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and members of the LGBTQ2+ community. TransAlta believes that diversity enhances the quality of its performance, is an essential element to effective corporate governance, and cultivates a strong workplace culture. Click here for our Diversity and Inclusion Pledge.

TransAlta has received certification fromDiversio, a technology company setting the global standard for equity, diversity, and inclusion, for its continued commitment to and meaningful performance on ED&I in the workplace.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We have a great opportunity for a Manager, Trading & Marketing IT to join our Data & Innovation team for a temporary 12-month period. This Manager rolehas the overall responsibility to serve as the strategic interface with the Trading & Marketing, and Asset Optimization business units for the purpose of business technology strategy development, solution delivery, service management, risk management and relationship management.

As the Manager, Trading & Marketing IT, you will proactively share knowledge of technology risks and opportunities to build competitive advantage and improve efficiency and effectiveness of these business units. You will partner with business leadership and other key stakeholders to define opportunities and identify and prioritize projects based on predefined criteria (e.g., return on investment, productivity, compliance); and serve as a lead role in enabling the business to achieve their objectives through the effective use of technology.

This role reports directly to the VP, Data & Innovation, and will be based at our head office in Downtown Calgary, with the flexibility of a hybrid work schedule.

ACCOUNTABILITIES / RESPONSIBILTIES

Here is the great work that you will get to do and be responsible for:

  • Responsible for the development and implementation of solution roadmaps over a 2-3-year horizon

  • Collaborate with management to develop annual and multi-year budgets for respective business areas

  • Develop solution concepts and business cases for new investments

  • Create and analyze relevant information and develop recommendations that they present to senior management

  • Act as the key liaison across all functional areas, including business units, the IT department, and outside vendors

  • Possess a broad knowledge of most technical and business resources and use them to effectively coordinate team members and external resources

  • Create shared vision of their respective solutions and facilitate decision making and arbitration relating to trade-offs both within and between different solution platforms

  • Oversee the launch of solutions and help to maximize the positive impact on the organization

  • Identify, screen, and evaluate new solution opportunities to address unmet (internal and external) customer needs

  • Partner with key staff members to create strategic business plans

  • Possess strong analytical skills, including an understanding of business economics and financial resources.

  • Collaborate with architecture and operations teams to ensure solution compatibility with company standards

  • Collaborate with the Project Management Office on the intake process and prioritization of candidate projects across the company

ABOUT YOU

The successful candidate must have:

  • 7-10 years project management experience leading business and IT programs/projects

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or other related field or equivalent work experience.

  • 5+ years of IT and business work experience with a broad range of exposure to various technical environments and business segments. At least 3 years of experience with managing team(s) responsible in strategic planning, business development or client management and working with a broad range of diverse and complicated business units

  • Experience leading and motivating teams of IT and business professionals

  • Advanced knowledge of MS Project Professional, Word, Excel, Power Point & SharePoint

  • Familiarity with all phases of the project management life cycle with a focus on project change control, issue & risk management practices, and project documentation control

  • Advanced knowledge of MS Project Professional, Word, Excel, Power Point & SharePoint

  • LEAN thinking to drive change that enables efficiencies and drives growth

The following would be an asset:

  • Certification as a Project Management Professional (PMP)

  • Previous implementation experience with SAP, Commercial, Operations or Trading systems

  • Prior experience or knowledge of the electric generation and marketing business

Other skills:

  • Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal

  • Ability to work independently and maintain a cooperative working relationship with peer groups and teams

  • Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations

  • Resilient and tenacious with a propensity to persevere

  • Must be a team player and able to work collaboratively with and through others

Become part of our TransAlta team today! We look forward to reviewing your application. All applications will be reviewed in a timely manner to the best of our abilities. We appreciate your patience and understanding during the recruitment process.

title: Senior Performance Marketing Lead (Remote)
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">About KOHO
KOHO is a quickly scaling FinTech company backed by leading investors and advisors from around the world. We started KOHO because we believe in doing two things:

Democratizing access to the best financial products and giving everyone a great financial foundation.

Since our journey began 6 years ago, we’ve raised more than $340M, grown the KOHO Collective to over 250 employees, and created accounts for more than 600,000 Canadians.

About the Role

We are looking for a Senior Performance Marketing Lead who wants to join our mission of giving everyone financial freedom. In this role, your main mission will be to help us acquire new users through paid channels to meet our growth objectives.

Our dream candidate is data driven, collaborative, and has the ability to manage and optimize paid campaigns in a fast paced environment.

Joining the (lovely!) KOHO Team
We invest time and resources into making sure KOHO is as good as the people we hire. Here are some of the reasons we attract the best people:

• Balance Your Life - Generous PTO, generous vacation, and a lifestyle spending account
• Work Anywhere - Permanently remote and $1,000 to set up your home office
• Level Up - Access to an in-house certified performance coach
• Reach Your Goals - Salary assessments twice a year, annual training allowance
• The KOHO Culture - We have won 6 "Great Place to Work ®" awards since 2019

The KOHO culture is one of collaboration, creativity, and diverse perspectives. We are committed to building and fostering an inclusive, accessible environment for everyone. If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding accessibility needs, please contact peopleaccessibility@koho.ca and the People and Culture team will be happy to help.

#LI-Remote #LI-DP1</section>

title: Product Designer
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Who are we?
We’re a small, diverse team working at the cutting edge of machine learning. At Cohere, our mission is to build machines that understand the world and to make them safely accessible to all. Language is at the crux of this, but it can be difficult and expensive to parse the syntax, semantics, and context that all work together to give words meaning. The Cohere platform provides access to Large Language Models through its APIs that read billions of web pages and learn to understand the meaning, sentiment, and intent of the words we use in a richness never seen before.

We recently raised our Series B, signed a multi-year partnership with Google Cloud, and we are focused on bringing our technology to market. We will partner with customers so they can build natural language understanding and generation into their products with just a few lines of code.

We’re ambitious — we believe our technology will fundamentally transform how industries interact with natural language. And we have the technical chops to back it up - Cohere’s CEO, Aidan Gomez, is a co-author of the groundbreaking paper “Attention is all you need”, (over 23k citations) and was previously part of Google Brain. Our entire technical team is world-class.

We are focused on creating a diverse and inclusive work environment so that all of our team members can thrive. We welcome kind and brilliant people to our team, from wherever they come.

Why this role?
Design uncharted user experiences that augment all the others. Empower technologists to reimagine the building blocks of human-computer interaction: language.

Please Note: Our office is located in Toronto, Canada but this role is remote-flexible and is open to those located in either Canada or the US.




If some of the above doesn’t line up perfectly with your experience, we still encourage you to apply! If you consider yourself a thoughtful worker, a lifelong learner, and a kind and playful team member, Cohere is the place for you.

We welcome applicants of all kinds and are committed to providing both an equal opportunity process and work environment. We value and celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment for all.

Our Perks: 
 An open and inclusive culture and work environment
‍ Work closely with a team on the cutting edge of AI research
 Free daily lunch
 Full health and dental benefits for employees based in Canada and the US, including a separate budget to take care of your mental health
 100% Parental Leave top-up for 6 months for employees based in Canada and 12 weeks in the US
 Personal enrichment benefits towards arts and culture, fitness and well-being, quality time, and workspace improvement
 Remote-flexible, offices in Toronto and Palo Alto and coworking stipend
✈️ 6 weeks of vacation and shared Canada/US holidays

#LI-Remote</section>

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">xMatters, an Everbridge company, is a service reliability platform that helps DevOps, SREs, and operations teams rapidly deliver products at scale by automating workflows and ensuring infrastructure and applications are always working. Our code-free workflow builder, adaptive approach to incident management, and real-time performance analytics all support a single goal: deliver customer happiness. Over 2.7 million users trust xMatters daily at successful startups and global giants including 3M, Accenture, athenahealth, Box, Credit Suisse, Danske Bank, Experian, HSBC, NVIDIA, Pepsico, Tesco, ViaSat and Vodafone.

As a Senior UI/UX Designer of our growing team, you’ll collaborate closely with our amazing engineers, product managers, product communicators, marketing gurus, fellow UX wizards, and other stakeholders to design and shape our world-class platform.  As a user advocate you are passionate about ideating and creating experiences by gathering knowledge through research, applying design thinking principles, wireframing and prototyping, negotiating and collaborating with engineering, and creating beautiful interfaces that are enjoyable to use. If you have the technical skills, experience, and personality to design elegant solutions to complex UI/UX challenges, we want to hear from you.

#LI-Remote
#LI-JS1


Bridger Culture:

At Everbridge, we have a mission that matters–to keep people safe and businesses runningduring critical events. Our “Bridgers” join Everbridge to make a positive impacton the world through their work. The core of our company culture is built around making a difference. Our people are dedicated to solving problems during difficult times and challenging situations as our software was built to save lives.

We are a rapidly growing organization transforming the field of critical event management and need passionate, committed and determined individuals to help us carry out our mission. Our environment is dynamic, and our culture is constantly evolving and expanding in order to provide the best employee experience.

Click hereto learn more about what we do. Passionate about our mission? Want to #BeTheBridge? Apply to be a part of our team today!

Everbridge is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, or sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.</section>

title: Entry Level Marketer
description:
Job Summary: We are looking to hire a group of people - between 2-3 individuals - for our Tsawwassen/Ladner marketing team. This opportunity is extremely flexible and is easy to work around schooling hours and other commitments that you may have(sports, social occasions and so on). The commitment is between 1-3 nights a week and is only approximately 2-3 hours each night (5:30PM-8:30PM). All training and supplies will be provided!

All COVID-19 guidelines will be followed and adhered to at all times.
 

Pay Structure:
$16 per hour. 

Job Requirements:
- Great Attitude
- Willingness to learn
- Punctual
- Respectful
- Honest
- Motivated to Work
- Communication

Vehicle is an asset!

title: Creator Community & Marketing Lead
description:
A new dimension to your career.

Masterpiece Studio’s culture of innovation is engrained in everything we do. For us, breaking barriers isn’t just a once-in-a-while occurrence– it’s a part of our everyday routine. Why? Because this company lives on the cutting edge of tech, art, and business theory. Our immersive 3D design pipeline empowers creatives to envision and change our future world, and our work environment does much the same. In fact, the people at Masterpiece Studio are very similar to the products they work on: highly inventive, but always grounded in artistry and tangible results.


Essentially, our team is anything but one dimensional. Forget the classic management hierarchy– from the admin space to the technical side, every person here provides valuable insights and a willingness to pivot. We’re intrinsically motivated to do our best individually, but we’re also here to support each other as needed. At Masterpiece Studio, it's all about blending highly professional results with a collaborative atmosphere.


We believe our people are at their best when they are passionate about the work they do. The projects you will work on here will be ones you won’t want to stop talking about, researching, and exploring every chance you get. Our team enables individuals to develop their skills, so you’ll never be put in a box– but we will challenge you to take the reins and step outside of it.


So if you’ve got a thirst for knowledge and a passion for disrupting the status quo, we’d love to talk. Masterpiece Studio is always looking for big dreamers to help build the new world in 3D.


The Role

The Creator Community & Marketing Lead role strives to create the ultimate destination for everything 3D while delivering real value for all stakeholders engaged.


As a member of the growth team, you will achieve the outcome of helping to create this destination through authentic community building practices, as well as activities that tie back to both key marketing and business objectives.


You will accomplish this in part by working cross-functionally with the data team, customer success team, product team and more, as you iterate and innovate on the value being created, delivered and exchanged throughout our community.


Our Creator Community & Marketing Lead will be accountable for activities including:

  • Helping to design and build an incredible community culture and “destination”;
  • Designing better pathways and mechanisms for value and engagement within that community (community roles, rituals, and more);
  • Actively participating in community by creating in 3D alongside side other creators (openly sharing your 3D creative journey, tips, techniques, key resources and more along the way;
  • Creating, iterating and managing a variety of marketing channels within which to reach creators and engage our community;
  • Maintaining an active profile both internally and externally within key communities.


The Day to Day

We believe our next hire will accomplish their goals by:


  • Playing a key role in ongoing customer discovery (really understand core user needs and desires);
  • Championing 3D creators across the industry and taking active part in & monitoring internal and external communities of interest (via Discord, Facebook Groups, social media and more);
  • Engaging in 3D creation, sharing and more alongside them;
  • Tracking and submitting user feedback via a variety of channels (support, product backlog, etc);
  • Leveraging & updating our CRM to support other teams with relevant information & opportunities from the community;
  • Highlighting unique opportunities to a variety of teams (including marketing, management and product);
  • Working collaboratively to further develop, enrich & distribute resources based on needs and feedback.

What we believe our next hire will bring to the business:


Demonstrated expertise in:

  • Intermediate understanding of 3D asset creation and animation (Blender, Zbrush, Maya, MotionBuilder, etc)
  • Community building;
    • Leveraging stage-specific community-building tactics;
    • Community moderation skills;
    • Strong communication and emotional intelligence skills


It would be beneficial (though not required) if they also have working knowledge of:

  • An understanding of marketing and key channels
  • Email Marketing
  • Social Media Marketing (a variety of tools and delivery/engagement methods)
    • LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter
    • Discord
    • Others, including emerging VR communities
    • Content Marketing
    • A strong Customer Success Mindset


In a perfect world (though also not required), they would:

  • Have experience across the 3D creative pipeline
  • Be familiar with top tools
  • Have a following/industry network


What You’ll Get By Joining Our Team


You will have the chance to lead an industry.

Many people only dream of having the opportunity to set the standard in art, tech, and business– but if you have the talent, Masterpiece Studio has the power to make it your new normal. We work in a space where things are constantly changing, which means you’ll always have a new puzzle to solve. If you’re inspired by overcoming the impossible with stellar teammates by your side, Masterpiece is the place to bring your best to even better.


You will feel the impact of your work.

At Masterpiece Studio, you have the power to shape your career, doing the things you love most on projects with serious impact. We pride ourselves on pushing boundaries, so we encourage conversations about how to do things better– and when it’s your turn to speak up, this team will always have your back.


You will be a lifelong learner.

Joining the Masterpiece Studio team means committing to continuous development and curiosity. After all, it’s hard to stay stagnant in an industry as dynamic as ours. We’ll work with you to find the common ground between our overarching goals and your personal interests, so you can expand your skillset to a whole new level.


Perks

    • Shape the future of VR creation for gaming, animation, and the metaverse
    • Partner with the biggest players in tech
    • Direct access to our C-Level
    • Freedom to build and innovate beyond your job description
    • Remote work opportunities


Masterpiece Studio is bringing cutting-edge machine learning and cutting-edge VR technologies together to enable hundreds of millions of people to create 3D content. This tight-knit team of strong individuals is working together to make a massive impact and change an industry.


Masterpiece Studio is years ahead of anybody else in the world, leading an industry with a simplified full solution to make real-time 3D content. With many of the top companies in the world partnering with us, there is an immense opportunity to grow.


“Against all odds, people thought it couldn’t be done, but this passionate team came together, and found a way to break through, to have breakthrough technology and make it all work.” - Jon Gagne, CEO of Masterpiece Studio


We’re taking on the Goliaths of the world– and we're winning.


EEOC


Masterpiece Studio is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are given consideration regardless of race, religion, colour, gender, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class as provided in applicable employment laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at careers (at) masterpiecestudio (dot) com.

title: Global Marketing Manager: Energy, Resources & Industrials - Deloitte Global (Toronto, Ontario, Canada)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada 
All Available Locations: Toronto; Calgary; Edmonton; London; Markham; Mississauga; Montreal; Ottawa; Vancouver; Vaughan 

 

 

Our Purpose

 

At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

  • By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
  • Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
  • Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness. 
  • Experience a firm where wellness matters.
  • Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
  • Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.

 

Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cutting edge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with premier thought leaders in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?

 

What will your typical day look like?

 

The Global Clients and Industries (GC&I) team within Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited (DTTL) is responsible for driving growth and alignment within the Deloitte member firm network to deliver a consistent experience and the very best of Deloitte across the network to our Global Crown Jewel/Global Strategic (GCJ/GS) clients. The goal is to serve our GCJ/GS clients with quality and distinction and make a measurable, tangible, and attributable impact.

 

GC&I Marketing and Communications directs, manages, and coordinates high impact, global marketing campaigns to deliver on the sector/industry, business, and member firms marketing strategies to promote solutions/services, business, and industry insights, and create a unique client experience. These multifaceted marketing campaigns are designed to enhance Deloitte brand eminence, reaching a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders, including clients, media, government, non-government organizations, industry influencers, and the internal Deloitte network.


An exciting opportunity exists to join the Global Energy, Resources & Industrials Industry group (ER&I). As the Global Marketing Manager, ER&I you will develop and execute integrated marketing and communication plans drawing upon all elements of the marketing mix/communications channels. Specifically:

 

  • Work with Energy, Resources & Industrials Marketing Leader to consult and collaborate with all stakeholders i.e., Global Industry Leader/Global Sector Leaders, Businesses and Member Firm leaders to clearly define Marketing Campaign objectives and deliver expected results.
  • Manage the marketing strategy and campaign for the Industrial Products and Construction sector.
  • Collaborate with member firm (MF) marketers to support the development and execution of the global marketing strategy and campaigns e.g., amplification of MF content/supporting research and distribution of content to clients through member firm CRM systems.
  • Assist with third party relationships in collaboration with industry/sector teams and the Industry Marketing Leaders (e.g., key industry associations/partners, agencies used for design/development of content, event and conference organizers for sponsorships and profiling). 
  • Assess needs, write, edit, produce, and manage distribution of internal and external marketing content for the campaigns; leverage internal resources (e.g., GC&I Marketing Services team, Green Dot Agency, CoRE Creative Services, Global PR, additional internal design studios, internal channel owners, etc.) to effectively execute on the planned campaigns across all channels.
  • Ensure compliance with legal and DTTL brand standards for marketing as appropriate.
  • Manage sector/industry marketing campaign metrics (ROI) and provide input and feedback to help shape delivery and measurement process; adjust plans and tactics based upon collected metrics. 

 
 

 

About the team

 

Deloitte Global Culture:

 

At Deloitte, we expect results. Incredible—tangible—results. And Deloitte Global professionals play a unique role in delivering those results. We reach across disciplines and borders to serve our global organization. We are the engine of Deloitte. We develop and lead global strategies and provide programs and services that unite our network. In Deloitte Global, everyone has an opportunity to lead. We see the importance of your perspective and your ability to create value. We want you to fit in—with an inclusive culture, focus on work-life fit and well-being, and a supportive, connected environment; but we also want you to stand out—with opportunities to have a strategic impact, innovate, and take the risks necessary to make your mark. Deloitte Global supports our talented professionals in answering the question: What impact will you make?

 

Global Clients & Industries provides expertise and knowledge around industries, clients, and markets to win new engagements, retain clients, and increase market share. Using industry insight, a multidisciplinary approach, and cross-border collaboration, we support lead client service professionals and their teams around the world.

 

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

 

You are someone with:

 

  • 5-8 years of experience in marketing and communications
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Power Point and Excel.
  • Strong business acumen and an ability to drive campaign content/approach from the view of the audience.
  • Advanced skills in English, verbal and written.
  • Excellent communication, writing, and editing skills; with an ear for authentic, persuasive language, strong listening skills, and quick understanding of audience and content.
  • Open-minded creativity and imagination; a good eye for compelling visual design.
  • High attention to detail.
  • Strong collaboration skills; team-oriented with ability to manage multiple projects at once.
  • Strong relationship building/relationship management skills and proven influencing skills.
  • Up to 20% travel may be required.
  • Experience in Industrial Products is a plus

 

Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:

  • You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
  • You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
  • You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.


The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities!  Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates that represents the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes candidates from Indigenous communities in support of living our values and our commitments to our Reconciliation Action Plan . We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

 

Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

title: Field Marketing Manager - Canada
description:
PURPOSE OF THIS JOB

Translate the National Community and Special Ops strategy to the field in assigned markets. Manage the Field Marketing Specialists and Part time Community Cebadors, and define priorities for each one of the markets.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

· Work closely with the Community Network and Special Operations national teams to implement national strategy

· Work with local Sales team to find new business opportunities, impacting the heart and lifestyle of local consumers, ultimately leading to successful development of the business.

· Implement and uphold a logistical systems for warehousing and infrastructure to ensure the right tools and management are in place to support the local needs, succeeding in premium appearance with the smallest footprint possible.

· In depth understanding of the consumer in various fields across the different regions which forms the basis of local idea generation and execution.

· Management of branded tools being used by Field Marketing Specialists and other employees in assigned markets/regions e.g., Event Vehicles, Event Equipment etc.

· Develop and manage the regional budget with the support of the Field Marketing Director and National Managers.

· Regularly review the environmental impact of the teams marketing activity working with the wider field marketing team to develop a year round plan and new initiatives to keep impact to a minimum, ensuring we leave the places we operate in better than we found them.

· Manage field expenses and general administration (i.e. PTO approvals, payroll, etc.)

· Build smart and mutually beneficial collaborations by working with other brands, organizations and networks that bring added value such as expertise, networks, goods, budget or facilities.

· Coordinate with agencies and specialized companies when outsourcing event logistics.

· Create and support local key events, scenes and marketing opportunities in line with Guayaki brand values that are relevant to the local communities and consumers, in alignment with the Special operations National Team

· Ensure that every consumer experience with the brand is a positive one thanks to love for the detail and premium execution at events and all other field marketing activities.

· Act as a role model to your team and display the Guayaki values with a consistent tone of voice that is motivating and inspiring.

· Source, hire, train and manage a diverse team of Field Marketing Specialist that perfectly fit the field scenes and brand.

· Set regional objectives and clear goals with your Field Marketing Specialist to ensure accountability to their key deliverables and conduct on-going performance evaluations.

· Provide on-going coaching and support to ensure Field Marketing Specialists achieve their deliverables.

· Create new and innovative ideas that bring the brand to life and capitalize on new business opportunities. Tapping into local networks, scenes and partner, based on the knowledge and ownership of your region and the global and national priorities.

· Regularly assess and identify development needs of the Field Marketing Specialist working closely with the Field Senior Manager to help make it happen.

· Identify and nurture key talent within the Guayaki Community network giving them opportunities to live up to their potential. Communicate deeper collaborative opportunities with National Community team or Partnership team when applicable.

· Source, hire, train and manage a diverse team of Part Time Community Cebadors in alignment with National Community strategy.

· Train the regional Guayaki team (including sales) on necessary brand strategies and relevant execution guidelines.

· Oversee Fan Club field operations in your region in alignment with National Community strategy.

· Work with FMS team and with National Community Manger to collect feedback regarding Branded collateral to continuously improve branded materials and merchandise to Brand team.


MINIMUM EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS

· BA Degree in Business, Marketing or related field required

· Minimum 5-7 years of relevant work experience in field marketing and implementing integrated campaigns across multiple locations.

· Knowledge of digital marketing, advertising and event planning

· Ability to multi-task and work effectively with a variety of tasks and business partners (both internal and external partners); must be able to work cross-functionally with internal sales and operations teams to effectively generate, execute and report on marketing programs.

· Ability to interact with various levels of stakeholders and make decisions based on data and insights

· Expert knowledge of marketing planning tools and strategies

· Proven business thinker with solid strategic skills and capacity to understand business from a market, region, P&L, and product perspective.

· Professional team-player, collaborative, and open to feedback

· Strategic, self-motivated, intellectually curious, innovative and resourceful

· Dynamic communicator with great oral and written skills.

· Big picture thinker and adaptable to changing environments

· Detail-oriented, organized and proactive

· Approaches new and different ideas with curiosity and open-mindedness


TRAVEL / PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Travel

Travels 50% in your allocated Region supporting the key markets

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

· Employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear.

· Employee frequently is required to walk and sit.

· Employee is occasionally required to stand and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.

· Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus

title: User Experience Designer
description:
About Deliverr

Founded in 2016, Deliverr is dedicated to growing local economies and empowering new ways of working, earning, and living. Deliverr has become the fastest-growing on-demand liquor delivery in the Regina, growing 170% year-over-year. Deliverr has distinguished itself by offering liquor and grocery on-demand delivery. Deliverr’s technology-led approach to solving for hyperlocal, offers a hassle-free fast and reliable delivery experience for our consumers.

About the Job

Deliverr is looking for a User Experience Designer (UED) in Regina, SK. The UED to turn our marketplace into easy-to-use product for our users. UED responsibilities include gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. To be successful in this role, you should have experience with design software and wireframe tools.

Roles & Responsibilities:

  • Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and developers

  • Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps

  • Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs and widgets

  • Build page navigation buttons and search fields

  • Develop UI for Deliverr website and mobile app mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like

  • Create original graphic designs (e.g. icons, images, sketches and tables)

  • Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders

  • Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)

  • Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback

  • Adhere to style standards on fonts, colors, and images

title: Senior UX/UI Designer (Remote)
description:
About bird&be

The current fertility experience is broken, and we want your help fixing it. We offer personalized fertility kits, designed to help our customer's optimize their outcomes, no matter the stage of their journey. With rising infertility rates, our kits will help educate our customers on their fertility health early, and help them take action with personalized supplements and prescription medication that is scientifically proven to impact outcomes. All delivered together in a beautiful box right to their doorstep.


This will be done under a brand umbrella that resonates with our customer base. We see a future that is different from the current "family planning" aisles filled with blue and white boxes, plastered with photos of white babies on them. Our brand will reflect the modern millennial. Less First Response, more Knix. 

About you

You want to be part of a small, very early stage startup that has a massive impact on people's lives. You are self-motivated, love to collaborate (Figma is great for that), and are resourceful to get things done. 


You love to design simple, beautiful experiences that can help alleviate this emotional burden from our customers, and help educate them along the way.


You care about the details, and know that sometimes the small things can go a long way. 


We are dealing with a very emotional (and sometimes traumatic) subject matter for our customers, so your empathy must run high. 

The work


As our first full-time Senior UX Designer, you will own the end-to-end customer experience, ensuring a consistent, delightful experience from our ecommerce site & web application, to our packaging and unboxing experience. 


You will be responsible for redefining the fertility education and care experience, and own the design of our eCommerce experience, emails, guides that help people understand more about their fertility health, and other exciting projects that come up. 

 

Your responsibilities

  • Design our e-commerce website and marketing pages

  • Design our Health Assessment, Patient + Doctor Portal, and other web app features

  • Design templates for our emails

  • Define the UX of each different touchpoint with our brand

  • Solve UX problems, with conversion and customer empathy top of mind

  • Perform concept and usability testing and gather feedback

  • Build wireframes and prototypes around customer needs

  • Work with our development team to implement designs to specs

  • Stay informed about competitor products and industry trends

 

Role requirements

  • 5+ years' experience of working as a Designer

  • Significant experience with design software like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe products

  • Experience talking to customers and conducting research

  • Excellent knowledge of interaction design and information architecture

  • Good knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript is a plus

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with business-oriented approach

  • Strong communication skills

  • Copywriting skills would be a cherry on top


Interview Process


Stage 1 - Chat with the COO 

Stage 2 - Portfolio Review with COO & CEO

Stage 3 - Take home challenge

Stage 4 - Offer

title: Director of Insight, BC
description:
Overview

Job Summary

Working under minimal supervision, this position will leverage your interpersonal and technical skillsets along with your regional market expertise across product types to build and foster client relationships, drive public brand awareness through timely data-driven market insights and utilize both of those skillsets to work alongside our transaction partner to grow client relationships, building client relationships and focus on business development opportunities. Your adoption of proprietary Avison Young technologies will be essential for this and allow you to seamlessly navigate unprecedented real estate and real estate-adjacent market conditions by sharing insights leveraging the powerful intersection of data, analytics, visualization and automation. This approach will allow Avison Young’s external clients to become more productive and push our internal stakeholders to become more efficient, with both becoming more successful in their common ventures.

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for ensuring Avison Young has a clear, data-based, analytically informed view of current trends and future outlook for all relevant real estate markets and sectors within the region; this view must be informed by wider trends at national and global levels, be updated on a timely basis, and communicated clearly and effectively to key stakeholders
  • Develop “subject matter expertise” on relevant segments of the regional (Metro Vancouver) real estate market, acting as a key AY spokesperson for clients and the media on real estate and related trends and market activity within the region
  • Authoring highly regular data-driven Insight utilizing digital tools in partnership with Innovation & Insights leadership alongside Marketing and Market leadership that can influence clients’ decision-making processes and promote the Avison Young brand
  • Engaging our occupier and investor clients and prospects to guide them through market conditions by leveraging our proprietary digital data analytics tools that help to shape and solve their real estate strategies more dynamically and seamlessly
  • Develop client relationships alongside and sometimes not alongside our business to drive differentiation of the AY brand and its focus on data, analytics, insight and technology
  • Working with National and Global I&I Leadership plus regional AY Management and stakeholders to develop a prioritized business plan for the Regional Team
  • Interaction with key stakeholders (particularly local AY Managing Directors, business line leaders and senior professionals) to understand local business needs, gather and incorporate feedback on product and service development, and maximize the Regional Team’s contribution to Avison Young’s business across the region
  • Development of a strategic resource plan for the region, identifying current or future personnel or other resource needs and liaison with national I&I management to agree how best to meet these needs
  • Day to day management of the workload, tasks and responsibilities of the Regional Team, including delegation to junior management members of the team as appropriate
  • Proactively identifying new clients and through that effort provide strategic guidance to Regional leadership on how best to approach, engage and pursue those opportunities
  • Partner with our National Insight Lead, Canada on thought leadership initiatives providing regional commentary and support
  • Partnership with our Data Team and the Canadian Innovation, Data and Analytics Lead who will collectively partner with you to collect and analyze economic, demographic and occupier and investment real estate data affecting the office, industrial, data centre, residential and retail sectors
  • Leading or participating in select press, public relations and real estate industry engagements, including interviews, panel discussions, press releases and presentations;
  • Partner with and provide input to the Innovation & Insight teams to build and evolve our platform
    Identifies and communicates possible improvements in the work process for customers and peers
    Pursuing a program of continued self-development through the use of selected reading, seminars and participation in continuing education
    Oversee process to compile and author bi-annual office market leasing, bi-annual industrial market sales/leasing report, bi-annual investment report, bi-annual multi-residential report, bi-annual report on three defined downtown office tenant profiles.
  • Oversee process to compile and author a range of research collaterals, including charts, graphs and written summaries for general use as well as custom pitch-focused pieces for brokers upon request.
  • Oversee process to compile and author Other AY topical reports on behalf of Avison Young and modify market activity charts and graphs and write short stories on local developments in the market
  • Provide content for social media posts related to research
  • Administer the summer internship program (assisted by research managers)
  • Daily distribution of relevant CRE news stories/press releases/government studies/legislation to relevant broker teams in the Vancouver office
  • Performing other ad hoc duties as assigned by immediate supervisor or upper management.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required; Master’s degree preferred in a real estate, finance, economics, business, urban development, or related field
  • 7+ years of commercial real estate or consulting experience preferred, but other relevant professional experience considered
  • 4-5 years managing people
  • Proven ability to present using different digital mediums to large audiences including clients
  • Proven ability to create strategic plans addressing business needs for a specific market
  • Proven ability to both develop and be integral in partnering to develop new client and business relationships
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills; able to engage and communicate with clients and produce complex deliverables under tight deadlines in partnership with an interdisciplinary team
  • Excellent strategic pitching and problem-solving skills
  • Highly motivated and energetic individual with the ability to be self-directed and work with minimal supervision
  • Adaptable to thrive in a fast-paced and quickly changing workplace and market environment, with various and evolving client and work priorities.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Office environment; temperature controlled
  • Some travel required

Our Equal Opportunity Commitment

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.
The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law. For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY! To learn more about us, please visit our website: www.avisonyoung.com.

title: Category Manager - Bilingual
description:
For 100 years, Nedco has been a cornerstone in the electrical industry. With branches across Canada, Nedco is pleased to offer one stop shopping for a wide range of quality products such as communications, wire and cable, distribution, lighting, data, home integration and security.


We are currently seeking a highly motivated Category Manager - Bilingual to join our National team.  You will be responsible for developing and implementing category strategies to improve the customer experience (internal and external) by working with suppliers, branches / sales teams, procurement and business leaders in each Nedco division across Canada.


You love a challenge and can complete complex projects quickly and adeptly with your understanding of the business priorities. You act with appropriate urgency to various market events and trends that require a quick turnaround in plans and strategy.


Responsibilities:




  • Responsible for creation and execution of the strategy for respective categories aligned with the national strategy.  Include managing local/regional suppliers, actively monitoring KPI's (i.e annual sales and profitability objectives).   Responsible for delivering on category objectives with primary (Tier 1) and secondary (Tier 2) suppliers, ensuring they understand business priorities and needs.




  • Execute cost savings initiatives (negotiated savings). Responsible for assessing and managing category risks and opportunities for the division related to these negotiated initiatives.




  • Identify and maintain continuous in-depth knowledge of identified commodities/products, new and future industry trends, and developing technologies where required for the respective categories (i.e. attend / participate in tradeshows and trade/industry associations events as required).




  • Conduct regular branch visits to better understand challenges and deploy an action plan towards resolution to enable the branches to better manage their business




  • Implement and maintain frequent communication between sales, marketing, procurement, operations groups.




  • Review, analyze, complete and submit stock package proposals respective to the product portfolio.




  • Develop, plan, review, recommend and coordinate promotional and awareness campaigns with manufacturers (including new products, code change, and forecasts).




  • Provide category expertise to product specialists, sales representatives, branch personnel.




  • Analyze sales and margins reports to identify variances year over year and trends within the category to identify areas of opportunity for improvement.  Implement corrective plans where appropriate.




  • Other category management responsibilities as required.




Other Qualifications:




  • Deep knowledge of category, market trends and impacts to cost structures






  • 5+ years of experience in a similar category role in electrical/distribution




  • University/College degree required in, business or commerce




  • Strong relationship building and business acumen are required. Need to be able to establish credibility and influence with business stakeholders




  • Ability to deal effectively with ambiguity and resolve multi-party conflicts to get to the “right answer”




  • Needs to understand the power dynamic within the spend category and create his/her own network for success (entrepreneurial spirit)




  • Must be a motivated self-starter and quick study




  • Experience leading high level negotiations for products and services




  • Proven analytical and problem-solving skills are required as well as excellent attention to accuracy and detail




  • Must be able to create comprehensive project plans and execute with discipline






  • Ability to travel as needed with overnight stay




  • Proficiency in PowerPoint, Word and Excel




Nedco is an equal opportunity employer.   We offer




  • Competitive compensation




  • Benefits plan




  • Excellent opportunities for growth and advancement




If you require any accommodation in the application process, please contact us with the “Need Help” button in Fitzii.


We thank all candidates for their interest. However, only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: User Interface Designer
description:
Since 2019, CapIntel has been on a mission to elevate finance to build wealth for all; this means helping advisors better support their clients, so they feel at ease knowing their future is secure. We’ve mastered the client experience around investments and are working with some of the largest wealth brands in North America to modernize their sales processes with innovative Wealth Tech. CapIntel’s sales enablement platform helps enterprises bridge crucial efficiency and communication gaps by enhancing how advisors and wholesalers analyze, present, and sell investments to retail investors. CapIntel is expanding rapidly, having achieved over 750% in growth in 2021, and we’re continuing to build our team to support our transformative impact on the wealth industry.


UI Designer

A key success factor of our product is rooted in beautiful and functional design. We’re seeking a UI-focused designer to conceptualize the feel of the CapIntel products and brand. The UI Designer collaborates with the design team to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and mockups, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.

Your homebase will be the Design Team;however, you’ll also work with cross-functional teams (with partners from Development, Product Management, and Product Research) on projects, maximizing innovation and strategic thinking so that each aspect of the product is a slam dunk for users.

What you’ll do

  • Push the company’s vision to its limit, creating a market-leading interface, imagery and user interface
  • Cultivate positive collaborations with Product Management, Development, and the Design team, to meet project deadlines and drive the human-centered design process
  • Evolve CapIntel’s visual language and tone by shaping our design system and establishing clear guidelines
  • Support cross-functional initiatives through art direction, creative problem-solving, and asset creation
  • Create high-fidelity UI designs that align with usability, accessibility, and brand standards
  • Work with the design team to produce polished deliverables that elevates our work

Who you are and what you bring

  • 3 years proven work experience as a UI Designer or similar role
  • Proficient with interface design tools (e.g. Figma)
  • Comprehensive understanding of graphic design principles
  • Creativity with an inspiring portfolio of design projects
  • Bold, gritty and curious character

We know from experience that what matters most is a positive attitude, a hunger to learn, and the drive to create quality work and get results. While we value experience and specific kinds of knowledge, we also know that sometimes it’s a roundabout journey along a career path. And if you’re not sure you meet the experience requirements for this position, but you know in your gut that you’ve got what it takes to bring this role to the next level, we’d like to hear from you!

Our compensation portfolio

  • Salary We’re proud to offer a fair, competitive, and equitable process to determining your salary that is based on your skills, knowledge, experience and internal equity. You can rest assured that we will present you our best salary offer so you don’t have to worry about playing the negotiation game.
  • Benefits Our comprehensive benefit package is available from your first day and if something doesn’t quite meet your needs, we also offer a generous healthcare spending allowance.
  • Time away from work We love working at CapIntel, but we also love our lives outside of work. We offer competitive vacation days, lifecare days, and company holidays and build in some flexibility too!
  • Professional growth: We thrive on building our career journeys through learning, mentoring and experiencing through our jobs, our colleagues and our leadership team. Not only do we encourage it, but we also enforce a culture that ensures we thrive, grow and evolve.
  • Belonging We respect, appreciate and celebrate our individuality. And we know that our diverse perspectives further each other and our business along the path towards greatness. We find ways to socialize, build a sense of community (even if it is across the country!) and challenge each other to share creativity in our “safe-to-fail” environment. We’re committed to making sure you know you’re appreciated for exactly who you are.

Where we work

  • Remote first. We trust our teammates to find the work location that allows them to do their best work – remotely or in person. We’re a Canadian based, remote-first environment, but if you get your energy from working in the presence of others, then you can access our in-office collaboration zone and individual workspaces in Gatineau, QC or Halifax, NS. We currently have hubs of virtual employees in Halifax, Ottawa/Gatineau, and Southwestern Ontario (and a few others scattered across Canada). We do find value in our teammates being able to connect, collaborate, learn from and mentor one another, so we may request you to travel to a central location for periodic team meetings.
  • Eastern time zone We operate in the Eastern Time Zone and trust you to manage your work responsibilities in a way that supports your teammates, feeds your ingenuity, and creates a sustainable and healthy balance with your personal life.
  • Equipment set up We’ll set you up with your choice of PC or Mac, and provide you with a $750 equipment spending account to purchase the additional equipment you need to set up your virtual space and do your best work.

How we work

These principles guide our decisions towards our common goal of success:

  • Accountability
  • Teamwork
  • Simplify
  • Prioritize & Execute
  • Autonomy

What’s next

We’re actively seeking candidates for this position, and keen to see your application. If this role interests you, please submit your application no later than April 8th. However, we’re keen to fill this role, so we’ll reach out and hire the candidate even before the deadline - so don’t wait until the last minute to apply!

Equity, diversity and accessibility

CapIntel believes that all dimensions of diversity are our strength, and that we have a role to play in actively reducing and eliminating systemic barriers to employment equity. We believe in equal employment opportunities regardless of race, ethnicity, language, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family and marital status, neurodivergence, national origin, and age. We cultivate an inclusive workplace where people excel based on personal merit, qualification, experience, ability, and job performance.

If you require an accommodation that will reduce a barrier to your application, please send an email to

accessibility@capintel.com

and our Talent & Employee Experience teammates will work with you on options to ensure you are set up for success.
