title: Head of Marketing
description:
Since we launched in 2019, CapIntel has been on a mission to elevate finance to build wealth for all; this means helping advisors better support their clients, so they feel at ease knowing their future is secure. We’ve mastered the client experience around investments and are working with some of the largest wealth brands in North America to modernize their sales processes with innovative Wealth Tech. CapIntel’s sales enablement platform helps enterprises bridge crucial efficiency and communication gaps by enhancing how advisors and wholesalers analyze, present, and sell investments to retail investors. CapIntel is expanding rapidly, having achieved over 750% in growth in 2021, and we’re continuing to build our team to support our transformative impact on the wealth industry.

Head of Marketing

We’re seeking a dynamic, strategic thinker to head up our Marketing team and become an integral part of shaping the future of our brand. In this newly created role, the Head of Marketing will report to the CRO and work closely with functional leaders across the company. You'll lead the program strategy build out and grow the Marketing team to keep our rocket ship flying!

What you’ll do

  • Partner with the leadership team to plan and execute key marketing programs
  • Raise brand awareness, while attracting customers and driving engagement and loyalty
  • Hire and coach a team of up and coming marketing superstars and ensure we’re building a culture of grit, creativity and bravery
  • Lead our PR efforts to create a leading industry brand
  • Collaborate with our Sales and Product teams to align our commercial objectives of promoting and driving awareness of our products and services, while always bringing the voice of the customer back to any decision we make
  • Monitor and evaluate the overall performance of the Marketing team against predetermined targets, as well as individual’s performance
  • Measure, analyze, and report on programs, campaigns, OKRs, and KPIs for the marketing team
  • Guide the prioritization of marketing-related initiatives as the targets and teams scale

Who you are and what you bring

  • 5+ years of experience in a marketing leadership role. It’s ok if you haven’t been a Head of Marketing, but you’ve been leading and directing the strategy and are ready for the next step as a Head of Marketing
  • 3+ years of B2B SaaS marketing experience
  • Experience with a start up to a scale up environment would be an awesome bonus
  • Experience designing and implementing programs that drive awareness, pipeline and revenue
  • Proven ability to excel in a fast-paced collaborative work environment and manage multiple projects at once
  • Team players with bias to action to achieve success in an agile environment
  • Bold, gritty and curious character

We know that what matters most is a positive attitude, a hunger to learn, and the drive to create quality work and get results. While we value experience and specific kinds of knowledge, we also know that sometimes it’s a roundabout journey along a career path. And if you’re not sure you meet the experience requirements for this position, but you know in your gut that you’ve got what it takes to bring this role to the next level, we’d like to hear from you!

Our compensation portfolio

  • Salary We’re proud to offer a fair, competitive, and equitable process to determining your salary that is based on your skills, knowledge, experience and internal equity. You can rest assured that we will present you our best salary offer so you don’t have to worry about playing the negotiation game.
  • Benefits Our comprehensive benefit package is available from your first day and if something doesn’t quite meet your needs, we also offer a generous healthcare spending allowance.
  • Time away from work We love working at CapIntel, but we also love our lives outside of work. We offer competitive vacation days, lifecare days, and company holidays and build in some flexibility too!
  • Professional growth: We thrive on building our career journeys through learning, mentoring and experiencing through our jobs, our colleagues and our leadership team. Not only do we encourage it, but we also enforce a culture that ensures we thrive, grow and evolve.
  • Belonging We respect, appreciate and celebrate our individuality. And we know that our diverse perspectives further each other and our business along the path towards greatness. We find ways to socialize, build a sense of community (even if it is across the country!) and challenge each other to share creativity in our “safe-to-fail” environment. We’re committed to making sure you know you’re appreciated for exactly who you are.

Where we work

  • Remote first. We trust our teammates to find the work location that allows them to do their best work – remotely or in person. We’re a Canadian based, remote-first environment, with modern offices in Gatineau, QC and Halifax, NS and hubs of virtual employees in Southwestern Ontario. For this role, we do find value in our Marketing teammates being able to connect, collaborate, learn from and mentor one another in-person, so we are looking for someone who will primarily work from home but be able to commute monthly to a central location in Southwestern Ontario / Toronto to connect, collaborate, learn from and mentor with teammates.
  • Eastern time zone We operate in the Eastern Time Zone and trust you to manage your work responsibilities in the time that supports your teammates, feeds your ingenuity, and creates a sustainable and healthy balance with your personal life.
  • Equipment set up We’ll set you up with your choice of PC or Mac, and provide you with a $750 equipment spending account to purchase the additional equipment you need to set up your virtual space and do your best work.

How we work

These principles guide our decisions towards our common goal of success.

  • Accountability
  • Teamwork
  • Simple
  • Prioritize & Execute
  • Autonomy

Equity, diversity and accessibility

CapIntel believes that all dimensions of diversity are a strength, and that we have a role to play in actively reducing and eliminating systemic barriers to employment equity. We believe in equal employment opportunities regardless of race, ethnicity, language, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family and marital status, neurodivergence, national origin, and age. We cultivate an inclusive workplace where people excel based on personal merit, qualification, experience, ability, and job performance.

If you require an accommodation that will reduce a barrier to your application, please send an email to

accessibility@capintel.com

and our Talent & Employee Experience teammates will work with you on options to ensure you are set up for success.

title: Category Manager, New Verticals
description:
Goodfood (TSX:FOOD) is a leading online grocery service in Canada, delivering fresh meal solutions that make it easy for members from coast to coast to enjoy delicious meals at home every week. Goodfood’s mission is to make the impossible come true, from farm to kitchen, by enabling members to do their weekly meal planning and grocery shopping in minutes. Goodfood members get access to a unique selection of products online as well as exclusive pricing made possible by its world-class direct-to-consumer fulfillment eco-system. Goodfood currently has more than 300,000 active subscribers and over 3000 dedicated and passionate employees across Canada.

The Category Manager role is a unique opportunity to build out new businesses (non-food) within Goodfood’s new Merchandising division. You will play a key role in shaping how Canadians from coast-to-coast conduct their weekly shop on a regular basis! Come and join us in building a new and improved experience for Canadians from the ground up! As a Category Manager in the Merchandising team, you will own and define the products within your category that will be instrumental in ensuring we offer our members high quality at affordable prices.

Responsibilities:

  • Define and develop the product roadmap for your category (non-food, bathroom, pharmacy, personal care, baby, pets, alcohol and household cleaning), sourcing quality new products to differentiate Goodfood
  • Drive sales growth within your category, pulling levers around product mix, promotions, and pricing (while maintaining target discounts and margins)
  • Stay in tune with member feedback and make recommendations for remediating or sunsetting underperforming products
  • Develop effective marketing, advertising, and merchandising plans which ensure the items in your category are leveraged to maximize the sum of parts within the broader portfolio
  • Own the P&L for your respective category, considering overall revenue targets against margin goals but also managing optimal inventory levels, costs, and forecasts
  • Scout the world of newness and innovation and stay close to trends to identify what are the next must have products within your category; taste every product you launch
  • Coach your peers in the art of negotiation and lean into discussions with suppliers yourself to achieve pricing and terms that translate into the best value for our members

Requirements:

  • 4 to 7 years experience, ideally as a consumables or personal care category manager or similar role. Experience with private label brands a major plus
  • Ability to lead, manage, and motivate cross functional teams. Lead by example with optimism, passion, and initiative. Know when to delegate and when to lean in and lean out
  • Entrepreneurial mindset with can-do, problem-solving attitude. Previous experience building, growing, and incubating a business a major asset
  • Strong negotiation skills and an understanding of the need to structure flexible and pragmatic deals that allow us to test products and support our continued rapid growth
  • Willing to get your hands dirty - be just as comfortable defining your product roadmap as you are as placing your own purchase orders and ensuring the inventory gets to us on time
  • Exceptional communication, stakeholder management, and organizational skills
  • Great team player with strong, demonstrated leadership capabilities
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Analytical aptitude with a focus on making data-driven decisions
  • Autonomous and able to act like an owner
  • Bilingualism (English & French) is an asset

Why Goodfood?

Our team strives to give our members a world class customer experience. We believe in being ambassadors of the brand to make the impossible come true from the farm to table!

What we have to offer our employees:

  • Competitive Group Insurance
  • Personal No Questions asked days
  • Annual fitness credit
  • Stock option program
  • Annual Bonus Program

title: Director of Marketing
description:
Company Description

Purpose Unlimited is an independent financial services company with an unrelenting focus on customer-centric innovation, delivered through technology-driven solutions. Led by entrepreneur Som Seif, the company is developing a diversified product platform aimed at addressing historically underserved segments of the market. Purpose Unlimited's businesses include Purpose Investments, Purpose Advisor Solutions, and Driven.

Who is Purpose Investments?

Purpose Investments is an innovation-driven asset management company with over $12 billion under management, offering both managed and quantitative investment products. In 2021, we have launched an exciting new set of funds to the market that includes the World’s First Bitcoin ETF, the World’s First Ether ETF, a Globe Climate Fund and an innovative Retirement Pension Fund called Longevity Pension Fund. This is just the beginning for us, with lots more opportunities to grow in the near future.

Job Description

We want you to be proud of the work you do each day. There is a lot of work to be done, and we are looking for someone to work alongside our Chief Customer Experience Officer, channeling our CEO’s vision, and bringing our story to life in a creative way. The opportunity is there. It is your job to seize it.

Reporting to the Chief Customer Experience Officer, the Director of Marketing will be responsible for providing memorable brand marketing experiences that you yourself would respond to. This individual will question the status quo, focusing on working smarter versus harder, trying to create a true impact in the industry.

What you will do

  • Develops and executes marketing plans and strategy, working with our product, sales, portfolio management, and customer experience teams to assist with growth and expansion of our products
  • Communicates with outside partners and vendors on various ongoing campaigns
  • Works with the Design, Business Intelligence, Content and Engineering teams on design, layout, and production of promotional marketing material
  • Liaises with external PR firms for ongoing media relations
  • Builds and maintains relationships with strategically aligned external organizations such as local publications and relevant industry/business associations and organizations
  • Meets with partners in key practice areas to develop and implement business plans. Monitor and support business development activities of those partners, including identifying prospects, developing pursuit strategies, and monitoring and supporting pursuit efforts
  • Develops and continually updates sales materials that highlight the attributes of the firm and its key practices. This includes generating entirely new content as well as editing and improving existing sales content
  • Coordinates and manages webinars for clients and prospects
  • Researches, identifies and presents industry/competition trends
Qualifications

What you will bring

  • 7 years working in B2B Marketing, in the finance or asset management space
  • Proven work experience coaching and leading teams
  • Bachelor's degree level education in Marketing, Business, or related discipline
  • Experience in the development of annual Marketing plans and marketing performance analysis
  • Experience and knowledge about various marketing strategies, including organic, SEO, paid, digital, social media, relationship, content, and video
  • Proven experience in campaign management and the development of an insight-driven demand generation strategy
  • Highly proficient ability to interpret data to determine decision-making, work to budgets and financial plans, and develop action plans for improvement
  • Experienced managing and leading media plans, and buying media for ad campaigns
  • Expert capabilities in computer programs and software like Office 365, Slack, Zoom, HubSpot, Siteimprove, and Google Analytics
  • Strong project management capabilities


Additional Information

Why should you join us?

  • We believe in an innovative and vibrant culture – Work for an innovative, people-first, financial services firm that values entrepreneurialism 
  • We believe in flexibility – A flexible hybrid work model that empowers you to do your best work whether at home or at the office
  • We care about your rewards – Competitive compensation including bonuses & equity programs
  • We care about your health – Comprehensive group health, dental benefits, and life insurance at little to no cost to you. We also offer a Lifestyle Spending Account for all your wellness needs
  • We care about your quality of life – A flexible paid-time-off policy with unlimited vacation days, flexible sick and mental health days
  • We care about your family – Paid parental leave for eligible employees with top-up 
  • We care about your future – Generous Group RRSP matching and TFSA program in Purpose funds
  • We care about your development – We offer training opportunities and tuition support year-round

Purpose Investments is an equal employer and we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and barrier-free work environment for all employees and candidates. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply and if accommodation is required during any stage of the recruitment process, please contact any member of the People and Culture team at hr@purposefin.com. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

In light of the COVID-19 pandemic, we are currently working from home. The safety and wellbeing of our teams is our top priority and office time is currently available on a voluntary basis. Our future of work philosophy will be a hybrid model allowing for flexibility and collaboration.

For safety reasons, Purpose Investments has adopted a vaccination policy that allows only fully vaccinated employees to enter our offices.

title: Product Designer
description:
At Evident Point, we work at the forefront of eReader development, making interactive digital textbooks and eBooks available to schools and to consumers who enjoy immersive reading on web and mobile devices. As a Product designer you’ll be at the forefront of our creative processes. Our ideal candidate is a detail-oriented individual with superior design thinking and application skills, with proven experience and an established portfolio, who is eager to learn or innovate on the latest techniques to solve various UI/UX design challenges for web and mobile applications.

As a Product Designer on the team you will be responsible for designing and prototyping high quality on-screen reading clients and back-end services. You will also be blazing the trail for new digital textbook enhancements, great layout and enhanced student learning experiences. On the consumer side we strive to provide the highest quality, cross device reading solutions to our unique audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Designing and prototyping high quality on-screen reading clients and back-end services.
  • Create new digital textbook enhancements, great layout and enhanced student learning experiences for web and mobile application.
  • Develop and provide the highest quality, cross device reading solutions to our unique audiences.
  • Use an evidence-based approach to decision making while enhancing customer experience.
  • Collaborate with our Program Managers to make sure we build what customers want.
  • Build great user experiences for cross-platform applications.
  • Create wireframes, high fidelity mockups and prototypes, designing and contributing to our thriving design system library, refine existing and upcoming application interfaces, and compose preliminary usability requirements by communicating with other teams, customers, stakeholders as well as our partners in the industry and open-source communities.

Core Skills

Strong understanding of user-centered design, including contextual design principles.

Strong communication skills and experience working in cross-functional teams

Proficiency with interface design tools such as Figma (our primary tool), Adobe XD or Sketch

Employing design tools to document user flows, interaction and motion as learnings, insights, system design and front-end design outcomes (e.g. interview notes, user-flows or iA flowcharts, and visual designs)

Demonstrate high level experience with low-fi to hi-fi design processes

A minimum of a BS or BA degree (or equivalent experience) in Human-Computer Interaction, UX/UI/Design Diploma or Degree, or a related area

3+ years of experience designing and shipping cross-platform products (Web, Android/iOS) as a collaborative, empathetic, problem-solver, ideally in the SaaS/B2B space

A portfolio showing UX problem-solving and great visual designs

Working knowledge of HTML5/CSS3 (SASS)

Preferred Qualifications

Proficiency with maintaining and creating branding guidelines and design systems for multiple products.

Understanding of the overall software development process, particularly the agile methodology

Familiarity with e-reading software applications is an asset

You will also be blazing the trail for new digital textbook enhancements, great layout and enhanced student learning experiences. title: Business Development Manager
description:
Employment Type: 1 year (potential for renewal) - Full Time

Location: Canada - Remote

Deadline for submission: May 24, 2022

About us

At Nutrition International, we make a difference, because nutrition is the difference.

Woven into the very fabric of our approach is the passion and drive of our global team of over 400 people, working in 13 offices across 11 countries with one common goal: transforming the lives of people who need it most through improved nutrition.

If you are a motivated and passionate individual who shares our conviction that a better world is possible through improved nutrition, wants to leave the world a little better than they found it, and is looking to be part of a global team with a clear vision, we want to hear from you. Please consider applying for the position below.

Know our team

Nutrition International's Business Development (BD) unit is a diverse team of dedicated professionals with extensive global experience in resource mobilization and non-profit fundraising for international development. The unit leads, coordinates, and supports funding identification and positioning, grant acquisition, and relationship cultivation processes with institutional and private donors and implementing partners. The BD unit works closely with other teams across the organization to grow and diversify resources for Nutrition International's global strategy and Investment Case. The BD team is located in Nutrition International's Headquarters in Ottawa, Canada, with dedicated counterparts within our Regional Offices in Africa and Asia. Currently, Nutrition International is seeking applications for a Business Development Manager to be based in Canada.

About you

As part of Nutrition International’s Business Development Team, the Business Development Manager will report to the Director, Business Development and will be responsible for helping secure financial resources for Nutrition International (NI). We are looking for candidates with experience in developing comprehensive proposals for projects funded by donors such as U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), the U.K.’s Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office (FCDO), the European Union, Global Affairs Canada (GAC), the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, and others. Successful candidates will have proven experience in developing high-value winning proposals preferably in the fields of health, nutrition, and gender empowerment.

You are someone with a post-graduate/advanced university degree required in social sciences, international development, marketing, management, business or public administration, or related fields, required (Master’s level qualifications preferred). You have 5-10 years relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and experience in resource development, project management or related field, preferably in a not-for-profit environment. You are experienced in project development and design expertise, including developing logical frameworks, performance measurement frameworks and budgets with a proven track record of success developing competitive, high-value proposals. Demonstrated experience in managing, leading and writing USAID bids will be considered an asset.

Fluency in English is required. French will be considered an asset.

About the role

In this role you will:

  • Lead the cultivation of prospective donors, including preparing for, leading, and participating in ‘pitch’ meetings.
  • Manage the development, finalization, and submission of project proposals to donors.
  • Manage the post-submission period in close collaboration Operations, Corporate Services and Country/Regional Office teams.
  • Support internal partners (Operations, Corporate Services) in ensuring key contractual obligations with donors are effectively met such as ensuring timely submission of reports that meet the expressed satisfaction of donors.
  • Domestic and/or international travel is required – not expected to exceed 30 days a year.

What we offer

Competitive market pay, health and dental benefits, four weeks of vacation (plus public holidays), and flexible work hours. We offer a collaborative and engaging work environment.

Selected candidates must have current legal entitlement to work in Canada (Permanent Residency, Current Work Permit, Citizenship, USMCA eligibility or other reciprocal trade agreement). We thank you for your interest, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Nutrition International is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible work environment. Upon request, accommodations due to a disability are available throughout the selection process.

Please note that all our offers are conditional subject to appropriate screening checks and satisfactory reference checks.

For more detailed information about the role, please click on the attached Job Description. Please click on the Apply button below to submit your application.

title: Senior Manager, Growth
description:
PressReader is a rapidly growing technology company that partners with the world’s leading publishers to deliver content to millions of users in over 160 countries. Our progressive approach to digital distribution has allowed publishers such as The Washington Post, The Guardian, Newsweek, Rolling Stone, The Globe and Mail, and Vogue to find new audiences through business partnerships, including airlines, hotels, cruise ships, libraries, and thousands of other companies worldwide.

Our technology also powers Branded Editions (BE) - a white-label solution that enables publishers to deliver their digital content in interactive ways. BE allows them to build a customizable platform that supports a wide range of revenue opportunities.

We have an opportunity for a Senior Manager, Growth role to join our Marketing Team.

As an experienced growth marketer, you use your impeccable communication skills and attention to detail to collaborate efficiently with cross-function teams. You are analytical, structured and organized, and you understand how to plan campaigns. Building on your proven people management experience, you are looking forward to working with a dynamic and talented team.

In this role, you will:

  • Communicate regular updates across all sales teams about marketing objectives and strategies  
  • Manage internal and external client expectations with respect to project delivery, scope, and timelines  
  • Participate in the annual budgeting process in collaboration with the Director, Marketing  
  • Drive PressReader with a focus on the executive team, and in some cases, Directors) as a thought leader in the industries in which it operates  
  • Develop and manage an effective lead generation and inbound management system/process, driving acquisition for B2B verticals 
  • Oversee paid acquisition advertising for B2B channels 
  • Report, recommend, and iterate on growth campaigns to drive increased ROI 
  • Work with product and CRM teams to build and maintain end-to-end analytics and integration systems 
  • Monitor key performance metrics including Leads, New Customers, LTV, and CPA for inbound marketing 
  • Work with the creative and content marketing teams on building the B2B content channel for lead generation 

You are a great fit if you have:

  • 6+ years’ experience in a similar role, using digital media and analytics platforms
  • Solid communication skills and you know how to present ideas and get people’s buy-in
  • Strong collaborative skills and you seek out cross-functional feedback and input to build comprehensive strategies 
  • Experience working with marketing automation and/or CRM platforms like HubSpot, Microsoft Dynamics 
  • A data-driven mindset with a passion for continuous learning to seek new strategies and techniques to regularly upgrade the programs  
  • Experience working with six to seven-figure budgets

Bonus points if you:

  • Are familiar with key B2B growth metrics such as Leads, MQLs, SQLs, New Customers, LTV, and CPA
  • Have a great sense of humor and enjoy working with diverse talented individuals
  • Have a strong interest in the technology sector

This role is a full-time position based in our Richmond, BC office. Working from home is available during the Covid pandemic and we are actively considering and trialing hybrid solutions post-pandemic.

We understand everyone has different circumstances; however, we will only consider applicants who are legally eligible to work in Canada.

If you don’t see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed for this job, we still encourage you to apply. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive and diverse company and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, sexual identification, and life experiences.

Sometimes emergencies happen and you may need to reschedule an interview. We understand. Please let us know without worrying about losing the opportunity or your credibility.

PressReader offers a compensation package which includes extended health care, dental, vision and accidental death insurance paid by the company; 15 paid vacation days to start, sick and bereavement days; reimbursements for professional training and membership in professional associations; fitness subsidy and more, along with a chance to be working with amazing people.

To apply, please submit your resume, and a cover letter explaining why you are the right person for this role.

This is a great opportunity for the right candidate.

We can’t wait to meet you!

title: User Experience (UX) Designer
description:
Are you a mid-level software user experience (UX) designer who is seeking a new career opportunity? We are looking for a solid designer to help create product user interfaces that delight end-users within law firms.

At PCLaw | Time Matters™, we focus on only one thing – helping law firms around the world run the business of law more efficiently. With best-in-class on premise practice management software, we are innovating the way law firms track client data and manage billing, legal accounting, and trust accounting.

We are looking to grow our team with members who will help contribute to our company’s core values. We reallycare about the work we do and the people we work with. We foster diversity, inclusiveness, talent and respect. We strive for excellence in everything we do. And we never ever give up!

Our company provides a challenging and rewarding work environment and we are always working to form the best team, with emphasis on lifelong learning and development.

We hope you’ll join us on our journey to improve the business of law!

User Experience (UX) Designer - Toronto, Ontario

What makes you successful in this role?

As a User Experience (UX) Designer, you will own UX design strategically and tactically across the PCLaw | Time Matters portfolio of web-based and on-premise software solutions.

You will work with our team of product management, software development, client success and quality assurance teams to design and implement amazing experiences for our end users. Primary responsibilities include internal propagation and reinforcement of a strong user research culture, creation of standardized cross-product design systems and associated tools; oversight of design consistency across products and projects; creation of wireframes and mockups; iterative adaption of designs and workflows in response to user feedback and customer research; communication and collaboration with developers and other internal stakeholders.

Additional responsibilities may include participation in customer-facing research and input on other product aspects such as usability and navigation, labeling and messaging, and accessibility. You will also have the ability to influence the long-term product vision from a design and UX perspective.

You will have the opportunity to directly and materially impact the way our end users engage with our products!

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Work with product leadership to define, document and espouse design vision across the product portfolio
  • Creation of design system of standards and tools to enable software development teams to implement the vision in a high quality and consistent manner
  • Define design requirements for specific product releases
  • Identify and escalate UX and usability challenges within product interfaces and workflows
  • Ideate and collaborate with product teams on solution options
  • Work directly with developers for solution implementation
  • Create storyboards, wireframes, mockups, workflow diagrams etc. as needed
  • Testing of UI and workflow elements with customers and potential customers
  • Providing best practices advice and guidance to the company on the implementation of UX design, UX research methodologies and testing activities
  • Perform user acceptance testing (UAT) from a UX perspective
  • Monitor and enforce standards across multiple products and projects
  • Contribute to positive evolution of teams and products over time

What would we like for you to have?

Required:

  • 3-7 years of user experience (UX) design experience within a software environment
  • Knowledge of UX design best practices and how to implement
  • Proven track record of influencing positive end user outcomes through UX design
  • Ability to listen to customers; understand and develop empathy for the challenges they face; advocate for customer experience
  • Experience working with Figma or similar UX/UI design tool
  • Passion for the disciplines of user experience, user experience research, UX design and/or related approaches to ensuring successful solutions
  • Self-motivated, self-starter – see a problem, solve a problem
  • Ability to lead, influence and mentor teammates and colleagues within and across departments
  • Ability to self-project manage and prioritize tasks in alignment with business goals
  • Excellent communication skills and attention to detail
  • Comfort in a fast-paced, fluid startup-like environment
  • Ability to travel on occasion

Preferred

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent amount of relevant work experience
  • Basic familiarity with the legal industry, law firm practice management and/or accounting, law office concepts and terminology

To ensure the health and safety of our staff, all future hires of PCLaw | Time Matters must be willing and able to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination upon their hire date. Reasonable accommodation will be considered for those meeting the conditions of a qualified exception.

As a PCLaw | Time Matters™ team member, you’ll become part of a quirky, fun-loving, relaxed environment. We play as hard as we work, while enjoying a competitive salary, medical, dental, and vision benefits, employee assistance programs, RRSP, tuition reimbursement, and much more. Not to mention additional perks like company-paid team events, pre-stocked refrigerators and snacks, and a great break-out game area! Come be a part of our team!

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, height, weight, or any other characteristic protected by law.

*Targeted compensation for this role is between $95,000.00 - $110,000.00 CAD. Final compensation will depend on experience and skillset.

*Third party submittals will not be considered for this opportunity.

title: UX / UI Designer
description:
veritree is an award-winning climate tech start up based in Vancouver. Our technology measures and verifies the impact of global restoration efforts from the ground-up. We are a small team on a big mission to plant 1 billion verified trees by 2030 with our community of businesses, planting organisations, and consumers who believe in the transformative power of verified restoration projects to create real and meaningful impact for the planet, nature and people.

Since our launch in 2021, we have already signed on 30 forward thinking brands to plant over 7 million trees, including Samsung, Cardano, JEEP, Vega, and many more. We are honoured to have been selected as a winner of the Uplink - World Economic Forum Carbon Market Challenge.

We are adding a talented UI / UX Designer to our Design department. As a UI/UX Designer, you will be working closely with the rest of the Design and Engineering team to build a diverse product line in the veritree ecosystem. These products will provide an engaging experience that enables our partners to learn about and share their impact.

Why join us?

  • We are quickly growing. There will be a lot of opportunities for you to develop, learn new things, take on responsibilities, and innovate
  • You will be working for a mission-based company. You will be empowered to make a real, positive impact on a defining issue of our time, climate change
  • You will be surrounded by a small team of talented and passionate people driven by our company mission.
  • You will have the opportunity to either work from our Vancouver HQ, remote from anywhere in Canada, or a combination of both.


What will you be doing?

  • You will gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
  • You will articulate design thinking and process using UX research methodologies
  • With your solid understanding of design systems, you will leverage and contribute to design systems
  • You will present process, drafts, and final designs to internal teams and key stakeholders
  • You will prototype, test, and iterate to continually improve product
  • You will adhere to design best practices in typography, colours, information architecture etc.
  • You will ensure designs meet accessibility standards

Professional Requirements

  • 4+ years of work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
  • Portfolio showcasing successful products
  • Proficiency in Figma, Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
  • Ability to design across platforms (mobile, web, desktop, etc)
  • Knowledge of prototyping tools (e.g. Figma and InVision)
  • Extended healthcare plan
  • Generous paid days off
  • Ability to work from home with flexible hours
  • Opportunities for training and development
  • Employee discounts with tentree.com


veritree is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business needs.

title: Field Marketing Manager
description:
Job Description

We’re looking for a Field Marketing Manager to join our growing team in Canada. Procore is expanding our reach internationally, helping construction companies revolutionize their businesses. We’re breaching greenfield territories where the market has tremendous potential and building our team to lead this exciting endeavor. We’ve earned a spot on Glassdoor’s 2022 Best Places to Work and continue our expansion into the global market. Are you up for the challenge?

As a Field Marketing Manager, you’ll lead our industry marketing motion (not limited to field and industry partnerships) to partner with our campaigns team and reach nationwide audiences across multiple verticals that drive demand, growth, and thought leadership. You’ll provide critical support for building the brand in Canada, across multiple provinces, establishing Procore as the construction platform of choice. A successful Field Marketing Manager has an audience-first mindset that can successfully elevate the brand, expand our reach, and generate demand. 

The role will report to our Sr. Marketing Manager, Canada, and has the opportunity to be based in our Toronto or Vancouver office. Remote delivery may be considered for the right candidate. We’re looking for candidates to join us immediately.  

What you’ll do: 

  • Be the key driver in our brand-to-demand motion across Canada, partnering with our product marketing and campaigns team

  • Serve as a thought leader and construction tech vertical market expert in the Canadian construction industry and community

  • Own, maintain, and build partnerships with associations, industry brands and influencers, and event organizers

  • Be responsible for elevating our field motion and in-person experiences cross-country

  • Create partner marketing programs collaborating with key industry partners and bring compelling offers to the market

  • Lead industry marketing and sales enablement through appropriate market positioning of our platform and applications, through industry, thought leadership, messaging, and product/services launches

  • Elevate our content marketing function outside of the main channels that exist today, tying it back to the industry and being a truly industry-first content machine

  • Interview customers, partners, executives, and prospects on industry-level stages, virtual channels, and repurpose them into multiple formats

  • Work with product marketing and campaigns team to design cross-channel campaigns to reach opportunity generation targets and produce compelling content by segment to be used by sales and in marketing campaigns

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams in events (tradeshows, webinars, conferences, etc.) and present as a thought leader in vertical/industry breakouts

What we are looking for:

  • 3 years of experience in field and partner marketing, or high-tech B2B experience at a construction tech company 

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or comparable education/experience

  • Proven success executing integrated field, partner, campaign marketing and aligning with sales for enablement and follow up

  • Familiarity with Salesforce, tracking and analytics tools (Tableau, Google Analytics) to assess program effectiveness 

  • Passionate about the construction industry and connecting Procore to industry leaders

  • Effective problem-solving, strategic, and analytical capabilities with a track record of setting and delivering against measurable marketing metrics 

  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills (bonus if bilingual)

  • A self-starter, highly organized, creative, and detail-oriented

Additional Information

If you'd like to stay in touch and be the first to hear about new roles at Procore, join our Talent Community.

About Us

Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes, and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore. 

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome builders of all backgrounds. We thrive in a diverse, dynamic, and inclusive environment. We do not tolerate discrimination against employees on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.

Perks & Benefits

You are a person with dreams, goals, and ambitions—both personally and professionally. That's why we believe in providing benefits that not only match our Procore values (Openness, Optimism, and Ownership) but enhance the lives of our team members. Here are just a few of our benefit offerings: generous paid vacation, employee stock purchase plan, employee enrichment and development programs, and friends and family events.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Are you a passionate marketing expert looking for meaningful work that can make an impact?  Can you pivot and flex in a fast-paced, dynamic environment? GS1 Canada is looking for an experienced, energetic Marketing Manager to support our work across the foodservice, grocery, healthcare, pharmacy and retail sectors in Canada. This role is an exciting opportunity to lead the development and execution of integrated B2B marketing strategies for a diverse portfolio.  In addition to bringing broad marketing experience to our team, you’ll also have a strong understanding of project management best practices for the collaborative development and timely execution of creative marketing communication plans.  You’ll help define the value, messaging, and go-to-market strategies, and execute campaigns that reinforce our value as trusted, strategic industry partners , increase awareness and drive engagement for your portfolio. 

GS1 Canada is a neutral, not-for-profit organization that develops and maintains global standards for efficient business communication. At GS1 Canada, it is in our DNA to do the right thing. We believe in the power of standards to transform the way we live and work. We believe in the uniqueness, drive, and passion of our people to carry our values and vision forward. We are a team of friendly and passionate people, optimistic about our capabilities. Together with our people-centered culture and innovative solutions, our vision is to become a strategic partner that inspires, leads, and enables best-in-class supply chain standards.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Proactively lead the planning and development of integrated marketing communications plans to support your portfolio, ensuring a high degree of collaboration, transparency and communication with internal teams, business owners and key stakeholders
  • Coordinate and supervise supporting teams in the timely execution, monitoring and measurement of marketing project plans
  • Develop insights through data analysis to optimize results and inform future planning
  • Develop compelling creative campaigns, content and collateral to support business objectives
  • Identify ongoing opportunities to promote and amplify key messages, including targeted events and strategic association partnerships
  • Manage multiple project timelines, ensuring efficient development and timely delivery of internal and external plans
  • Actively lead and participate in cross-functional planning meetings as a marketing, brand and subscriber champion
  • Enthusiastically support corporate values and team engagement

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE:

  • 5+ years of experience in a marketing role developing and implementing effective marketing and communications plans and tactics
  • Proven track record of exceptional project management
  • Creative thinking skills to develop innovative, unique marketing campaigns, tactics and collateral
  • Collaborative, engaged team player with a demonstrated ability to problem solve and manage multiple, simultaneous priority projects in a fast-paced environment
  • Accountability for timely and accurate execution of deliverables
  • Data driven approach to marketing, with experience in measurement and analysis of results
  • Strong oral, written and presentation skills with focused attention to detail
  • Highly developed interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate with stakeholders of all levels in a professional and efficient manner
  • Strong alignment with GS1 Canada values: Accountability, Inclusive Collaboration and Integrity Always

 

 GS1 Canada is an equal opportunity employer. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team at humanresources@gs1ca.org if you require accommodation due to a disability during the interview and assessment process.

title: Crypto Marketing Director
description:
Goldentrust Capital is looking for a Crypto Marketing Director to join our team.

Job Detail:
  • This is a full-time, in-person position in the office located in North York, Ontario. 
  • This is a leadership role that focuses on the company’s metaverse project, thus the ideal candidate should be experts in cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. 

Job Overview:
  • You will be responsible for the building and scaling up of the marketing department of Goldentrust Capital’s metaverse project.
  • You will work closely with the development team and sales team to design and implement a marketing strategy tailored to the project’s needs.
  • You will be responsible for the day to day handling of the strategy, from content creation to social media management to various forms of paid advertising.
  • You will be responsible for managing the marketing budget.

Requirements:
  • 3+ years of experience in a marketing position.
  • Knowledge and passion in cryptocurrency and blockchain technology such as NFTs and play-to-earn gaming.
  • Experience in copywriting and content creation.
  • Experience in project management, including mentoring and overseeing marketing teams. 
  • Deep understanding of the online-advertising industry, knowledge and experience with influencer marketing, SEO and social media management.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.


About Goldentrust Group:

Goldentrust Group is located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It was established in 2010 and so far, the company's total assets have reached hundreds of millions. Our investment tenet is not only to provide investors and partners with financial guarantees of safety, but also to create regulation, participation, win-win situations, and sustainable development to preserve and grow their assets. We provide our private equity investors with consistently strong returns that are significantly higher than what they can achieve in the public market. In order to achieve this goal, we have hired outstanding talents to provide unparalleled customer service to all clients and our flexible capital operation skills have also created an excellent return on investment for the majority of investors.

title: Area Manager
description:
Apply by visiting the link below:
https://jobs.elections.on.ca/

What to expect in this role
The Area Manager (AM) oversees several paper-based voting locations and supervises poll officials on election day.
 
Reporting to the Returning Officer or designate, you will:
  • Supervise two (2) to five (5) voting locations on election day. The ability to travel and provide your own transportation between voting locations is a requirement of the job and mileage is paid. 
  • Act as a liaison to relay information between the voting locations and the Returning Officer. 
  • Report any services that are disrupted, incidents that occur or complaints that are made at the voting location to the Returning Officer in a timely manner. 
  • Contact poll officials to ensure your team is available to work on the prescribed days and times. 
  • Complete tasks manually, using paper forms and lists at voting locations. 
  • Ensure staffing resources, supplies and poll layout conforms with Elections Ontario standards. 
  • Ensure all voting locations are free of any partisan campaign materials. 
  • Ensure all voting locations are accessible to the electors.
  • Supervise poll officials and voting locations to ensure proper procedures are being executed.
  • Assist electors with disabilities, if required. 
  • Ensure Scrutineers and candidate representatives are following guidelines set forth within the voting locations. 
  • Temporarily backfill a poll official role, if required. 
  • Resolve any issues at the voting location escalated by the poll officials as they arise. 
  • Ensure all assigned voting locations promptly close on time, and that all electors that entered the voting location prior to close can mark and cast their ballot to vote. 
  • Complete the paper-based Ballot Statement of the Poll form after the closing of the polls. 
  • Communicate the results to the returning office. 
  • Remove all posters and signage after closing on election day. 
  • Ensure poll supplies from the voting locations are returned to the returning office after closing on election day. 
  • Ensure time sheets from the voting locations are returned to the returning office after closing on election day.
 
What you need to qualify:
  • Access to a cell phone and vehicle to travel to and from the returning office and voting locations.
  • Availability to work up to 13 hours on election day.
  • Availability to attend a training session.
  • Ability to read and observe voting procedures at the voting location.
  • Strong interpersonal communication (verbal and written) and problem- solving skills to resolve issues and communicate solutions to staff and the public in an efficient and timely manner.
  • Ability to understand, rationalize and resolve situations efficiently as they arise.
  • Ability to identify and verify information provided by an elector in a timely manner via hard copy or mobile device.
  • Ability to complete paper-based forms with clear and legible handwriting and good attention to detail.
  • Ability to calculate, tally and track number the number of ballots manually.
  • Ability to stand and work for long stretches of time (up to 13 hours).
  • Ability to learn quickly, follow directions, and complete repetitive duties.
  • Ability to multi-task.
  • Must be a Canadian citizen and at least 18 years of age on election day.

Apply by visiting the link below:
https://jobs.elections.on.ca/

title: Area Manager
description:
Our Connected Home team is proud to offer our customers seamless and simple technology that fits into any lifestyle. Our fibre network supports millions of customers with high-speed Internet, TV, and Smart Home Monitoring to keep Canadians connected to the people and things that matter most. We know that our customers rely on us to provide them reliable connectivity, that is why we have made a commitment to providing the fastest and most consistent network in the areas we serve.  We are growing our Connected Home team and are looking for team members that are collaborative, digital-first, fast-moving, bold-thinking, and focused on delivering impact in everything they do. Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada. 
Let’s make your possible at Rogers. Are you up for the challenge and the fun? If so, consider the following opportunity: This position is responsible for the successful management of a team of Field Client Account Specialists focusing on selling Rogers products and services to residential customers within Toronto and surroundings region focusing on the MDU segment.
 
Successful candidate to Utilize advanced knowledge of products and services as well as sales process experience to maximize sales and effectively work assigned territory. And to ensure your team’s success, you’ll monitor performance metrics on a daily basis and provide coaching as needed.
 
The Field Sales Area Manager is an important role accountable to develop plans & drive sales results and reports to the Regional Sales Manager.
 
Responsibilities:
 Leverage directed sales leads and identifying new sources of opportunities for sales in single family units (SFU's) Utilizing customer facing door to door sales tactics (up to 95% in field presence)Manage and coach a team of internal Client Account Specialists targeting customers within Single Family Units (SFU's) by going door to door.Develop and implement sales plans by leveraging directed lead strategies to ensure all sales and revenue targets for Ignite TV, Ignite Internet, Rogers Smart Home Monitoring and Wireless are met or exceeded.Train and coach Client Account Specialists on Sales Process, Territory Coverage, Systems, Tools, Promotions and Plans and highlight key differentiators to increase and/or maintain the Market Share for new and existing Rogers customersAnalyze Salesforce dashboard, sales reports and territory sales breakdown for each Client Account SpecialistGather and provide feedback on market insights and competitive intelligence for assigned territoryParticipate and Coach Sales Reps through regular door-to-door field workMotivate and provide strong leadership to sales staff through performance management techniques such as quality evaluations, individual sales plans and ongoing coaching, guidance, and monitoring of Client Account Specialists productivityWork collaboratively with District Sales Manager to address process gaps and barriers to sales performanceEnsure adherence to all sales training and certification requirements for all team membersDocument best practices and ensure constant evolution of the teamAssist in designing and developing promotions to achieve targeted market share and revenue within territoryHiring, onboarding/offboarding and training of the Client Account SpecialistsRole-modeling best-in-class sales behavior at all timesPosition must assist in maintaining the confidentiality of customer and business data at all timesLearning, adhering, and enforcing all applicable Health & Safety regulations, both legislatively mandated, and as outlined in Company policy 
Qualifications:
 Core Competencies: Customer Focus; Teamwork; Communication; Accountability; InnovationPost-secondary school educationDemonstrated ability to drive team performance within a customer-centric sales environmentAdaptability in a fast-paced, changing work environment3-5 years Telecom Industry or Door to Door sales management experience is an assetAvailable to work flexible work shiftsDemonstrated leadership abilitiesProven track record to coach and motivate a teamBilingual / Multilanguage abilities an assetStrong Interpersonal and Communication SkillsStrong computer skills, with excellent knowledge and ability in Microsoft Office suite (Work, Excel & PowerPoint) and handheld devicesAvailable to work on a flexible schedule: days, evenings, weekends & statutory holidays to meet customer needs. Must have a valid driver’s license and vehicle available​As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine. Schedule: Full time
Shift: Flex Time
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 857 York Mills Rd. (055), North York, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 50%
Posting Category/Function: Sales & Account Management
Requisition ID: 267074
 
Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work: Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what’s right, each and every day
We believe in the power of new ideas
We work as one team, with one vision
We give back to our communities and protect our environment
 What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.
 
Posting Notes:  Sales & Marketing

title: Pricing Director
description:
Pricing Director


Advert:


People make Sage great. From our colleagues delivering ground-breaking solutions to the customers who use them: people have helped us grow for more than thirty years, and people are driving our future as a great SaaS company. We're writing our next chapter. Be part of it!


At Sage, we recognize that the world of work has rapidly shifted over the last few years, particularly how we work. That is why we have committed to working in a hybrid way going forward. Human connection is an essential ingredient of the 4 principles that make up our Flexible Human Work hybrid framework and we want to be transparent in what that looks like when you join our Sage family. On one hand, our offices will continue to play an important role in our future and serve as a place for spontaneous conversations, connection, collaboration as well as focused time. On the other hand, we have learned to reimagine where and when we work and to unlock that flexibility and innovation for our colleagues offering them the opportunity to work flex across their home, Sage offices or customer sites.


We invite you to join us and help us write our next chapter. Follow us on our social media sites to join in conversations about open positions and company news! #lifeatsage #sagecareers. If you would like support with your application (or require any adjustments) please contact us atcareers@sage.comfor assistance. All qualified applicants will be thoughtfully considered and never discriminated against based on their race, color, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.


Job Description:


Reporting to the VP, Pricing and being a key member of the global pricing team, the Innovation Pricing Director is responsible for: researching & developing new pricing models for Sage; developing and embedding stronger pricing capabilities across Sage; working on key global and local pricing projects – typically with global responsibility for one or more key product sets; and supporting local activities in one or more Sage markets by providing pricing and broader commercial expertise to local management. The role will require close collaboration with finance, product marketing, marketing, sales and channel marketing teams, both at a local and global level.


Key Responsibilities:


Key accountabilities and decision ownership: (8 or 10 max)

• Drive innovation in pricing models and approaches, to support Sage’s ambitions in the digital network space.

• Defines and delivers new pricing recommendations for one or more key product categories and works closely with global and/or local Sales, Product Marketing, Marketing and Finance teams to do so.

• Formulates pricing logic, rules and controls to support the delivery of new pricing recommendations.

• Supports development of strategies to maximize adoption of cloud products, migrate existing customers, and deliver increased revenue per customer.

• Designs and undertakes pricing research projects – with support from external agencies.

• Develops and delivers training sessions on pricing and best practice sharing activities, in order to help raise the quality of pricing decisions at Sage.

• Partners with Finance to provide data, analytics and expertise to support making strategic and tactical pricing decisions on an ongoing basis – including pricing and financial modeling support.

• Partners with Sales, Marketing and Finance to correctly position product portfolio and establish pricing content aligned with product/sales strategy and revenue objectives.

• Evaluates the customers’ requirements to inform new pricing decisions; coordinates with Marketing to ensure customer feedback is incorporated into pricing recommendations through customer research, surveys, focus groups, etc.

• Contributes to monitoring of ongoing competitive (pricing) environment to ensure practices do not adversely impact company reputation or customer satisfaction.


Function:


Performance and Pricing


Country:


Canada


Office Location:


Toronto;Remote


Work Place type


Hybrid

title: EL Canada Business Development Segment Manager
description:
EL Canada Business Development Segment Manager Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB Smart Buildings digitally transforms commercial, industrial and residential buildings for the highest comfort, efficiency, safety and security - enhancing quality of life in buildings of the future through safe, smart and sustainable electrification solutions, services and products.This BDM position is responsible for the growth of the Commercial Building Segment. The BDM will be expected to define and deploy a market strategy that will result in meeting/exceeding order Target, increasing our market presence as well as forging strong relationships with key stakeholders in the segment. It is expected that the BDM will work closely with the Regional Sales teams and Field Application Engineers across ABB to ensure alignment of the market strategy. A key focus area for the BDM will be in leading business development and sales of the building automation portfolio (HVAC Control, Lighting Control, Energy Management) in Canada by working with system integrators to promote/develop this part of the portfolio. Additionally, the BDM will be required to develop value propositions that offer not only the Electrification (EL) portfolio, but the entire ABB portfolio in order to support a One ABB approach. This will require the BDM to work across all divisions within the company (with the support of the National Sales manager). In fact, a key metric of success beyond order target, will be the profile of Products and Solutions sold.
Your responsibilities

  • Meet/Exceed Order intake targets.
  • Develop and Deploy Market strategy that identifies Trends, Channels to Market, Decision makers & Influencers, Competitors, Key actions for growth, Skills & Competencies Development Plan and Investments/resources required.
  • Working with other ABB units develop a unique Value proposition that delivers a One ABB offering in the areas of Products, Solutions and Services for the segment.
  • Roll out/Educate the approved Strategy to all regional sales teams and obtain Support & Buy in with the purpose being to identify and prioritize business opportunities culminating in the capture of these agreed opportunities based on an excellent understanding of local situation.
  • Meet with stakeholders across the segment to deliver our segment Value proposition as well as understand their challenges in order to help them achieve their goals, always driving to get the C Suite.
  • Cultivate long term relationships with key management within the customer organization.
  • Ensure Accuracy of SFDC at all times.
  • Participate in Monthly segment cadence meetings and prepare Monthly report re the status of the pipeline, key opportunities update and monthly activities.
  • Engage with ABB Account managers to share business opportunities and develop Unique Value Propositions.
  • Where Specific Key accounts have been assigned, establish key relationships and develop and update account plans based on changing market conditions.
  • Account Management of ABB System Integrators for the ABB Smart Building portfolio
  • Identification and recruitment of new system integrators to carry the ABB Smart Building portfolio.
  • Coordinating commercial building initiatives across Canada with EL Sales, FAE's, other ABB Business areas and other ABB representatives (ie. Stakeholder engagement and target project approach).
  • Defining and then supporting development and implementation of a marketing strategy for the segment. Thought leader for the segment.
  • Expand knowledge with end-users and business partners of the energy efficiency solutions offered by ABB Building Automation Porfolio.
  • Work closely with the Building Automation channel to maximize the offering towards the market in both brown field and green field projects.

Your background
  • Engineering degree or Technologist Diploma preferred.
  • 5+ yrs Proven Sales/Business Development experience in the Building Automation HVAC industry.
  • Proven Experience in developing executive level relationships.
  • Proven ability to translate market requirements into an actionable value proposition.
  • Strong communication negotiation and influencing skills as well as stakeholder management in complex organizations.
  • Tolerant of ambiguity, resiliency.
  • Results oriented execution mindset.
  • Position will require 30% travel mostly within North America.

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our websitewww.abb.com.For the 4th year in a row, ABB Canada has been recognized as one of Canada's top employers by Forbes Magazine and has been ranked #1 within the industry category. Also named as Canada's Top 100 Employers, Montreal's Top Employers, Canada's Top Employers for Young People, and Best Candidate Experience Award (CandE Award), ABB's culture and commitment are to provide a caring workplace where everyone collaborates, feels valued, respected, included and supported. Also committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to the applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.#LI-Hybrid

title: Sr. Revenue Growth Manager
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Conagra Brands is one of North America's leading branded food companies. We have a rich heritage of making great food, and a team that’s passionate about innovation and growth. Conagra offers choices for every occasion through iconic brands, such as Hunts, Aylmer, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, VH Sauces, Pogo and Vlasic®, and emerging brands, including Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein®, and Frontera®. We pride ourselves on having the most impactful, energized and inclusive culture in the food industry. For more information, visit www.conagrabrands.ca. Conagra offre des choix pour toute occasion grâce à des marques réputées comme Hunt’s®, Aylmer®, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, les sauces VH®, Pogo®, Vlasic® et des marques émergentes, dont Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein® et Frontera®. Nous sommes très fiers d’avoir la culture la plus influente, la plus dynamique et la plus inclusive du secteur alimentaire. Pour en savoir plus, visitez www.conagrabrands.ca. Position summary: Reporting to the Director of Market Development, the position’s principal objective is to lead the development and execution of revenue growth strategy, including short and long term strategic plans and analytics for Price, Pack, Mix, and Trade to drive top and bottom line growth. The position offers a unique experience not found within any other Sales function because of the high degree of interaction with sales, brand, finance, and insights teams within the organization. Core Responsibilities: Define and drive the agenda for the overarching Net Revenue Management strategic growth framework for Conagra Canada. Define a multiyear strategy to realize Net Sales and Gross Margin in a sustainable and consistent manner in collaboration with Marketing, Sales, and Finance (Inclusive, but not limited to; pricing slopes, pricing role in market, price positioning, portfolio pricing, role of trade, trade planning, trade optimization, etc.) Develops tools to enhance and integrate descriptive and predictive demand and financial analytics to optimize and streamline pricing scenario development and decision making process. Owns software, spreadsheets, models, and other programs used to assist in price decisions Partner with Brand and MS&P teams to define the role of pricing in categories, ensure alignment to brand objectives and consideration of competitive pricing and promo strategies Lead communication and alignment to sales and marketing organizations on development, execution, and review of pricing actions including development of “selling stories” for sales team for all pricing actions Responsible for analysis, execution and scorecarding of strategic pricing recommendations (base, incremental, EDLP etc) in addition to pricing strategy for innovation for select brands within our portfolio Identify where to unlock opportunities for Price, Pack, Mix and Trade at National and Customer levels. Lead recommendations for customer specific trade optimization solutions in partnership with MS&P to sales. Lead evaluation and improve trade promotion analysis through building capabilities and offering recommendations to deliver greater ROI’s driving topline sales while optimizing trade spend. Develop and execute Customer Segmentation Strategy balancing internal metrics, growth potential, and size of customer to drive the role of trade at a customer and role of the customer for the organization Lead development and refinement of channel strategy pricing guardrails and processes, including actively involved in pricing exception decisions Recruit, hire, and develop a team with collective expertise to manage all strategic, operational, tactical, and administrative elements of revenue growth management within a highly collaborative environment Potential responsibility to include meeting with select retail customers to discuss RGM initiatives Serve as a Canadian point of contact for RGM-related elements of the SAP/TPM rollout Collaborate with the US RGM teams to leverage plans and tools Qualifications, Education & Experience: University degree in Business or like discipline, MBA is an asset 3+ years revenue management, pricing, and/or trade marketing experience preferred 5-7 years of progressive customer, marketing, revenue growth management and/or finance management experience in the CPG industry preferred Strategic thinker who is willing to work outside of their comfort zone and has the courage to challenge status quo in the spirit of efficiency Excellent analytical skills and a high level of competency with modeling, complex analytics, consumer research, and customer databases Ability to articulate complex concepts in clear, simple & logical terms, and build compelling and persuasive presentations that aligns and facilitates discussion Strong track record in developing talent and building organizational capability a distinct advantage Takes an enterprise view that considers and anticipates implications across channels, customers, consumers and competitors when building strategies Thrives in a cross functional, team environment with the ability to lead teams through projects Our Modern Workplace: Conagra’s culture of collaboration enhances our ability to meet critical business goals, deliver value to customers and consumers and provide you with the flexibility you need to achieve a better work-life balance. We carefully consider each role and how often each team member needs to collaborate in-person. This position requires you work from our Mississauga office [3] days a week. title: UI/UX Designer [Mobile]
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">About Pocket Worlds

We harness the power of virtual worlds and the metaverse to connect people. We build deep, rich virtual worlds that are social by design and last for decades. Our first world, Highrise, is a creative 2D isometric world where people make avatars, express themselves, and create deep friendships along the way. Over 10 million people have already joined the world of Highrise, and it's growing faster every day.

We're a completely remote company with a diverse set of employees spanning 16 different countries. We are connected by a singular mission of building amazing games that bring our players together, and we live by our values, which you can read here.

Join our world class team who've shipped amazing products for Apple, Google, Electronic Arts, Zeptolab, Nanobit, and other top companies.

About the Role

We are growing and looking for a skilled and enthusiastic UI/UX Designer with some (or a lot of) experience in creating user-centered designs.

We are looking for a passionate designer excited to make the world both more accessible and fun. You will be working to construct delightful user experiences around play and friendships.

This role, along with our entire company, is fully remote.

Benefits

- Home office stipend. Haven't worked remotely before? We offer a generous stipend to help you set up a productive workspace.
- Competitive salaries and significant equity.
- Unlimited Vacation policy. Time off is important - we encourage you to take the time you need.
- Education stipend. We deeply believe in learning and self improvement. We've set aside a budget for every employee to learn additional skills and grow.</section>
