Il/Elle est également responsable de bien préparer l’équipe créative interne afin qu’elle puisse livrer du contenu marketing de qualité aux clients internes.</section>

title: Marketing Manager, Demand Generation - REMOTE
description:
Why CompuCom? (Overview):

CompuCom Systems, Inc. provides end-to-end managed services, technology and consulting to enable the digital workplace for enterprise, midsize and small businesses. CompuCom delights with individual experiences, drives workplace collaboration and productivity, and delivers operational performance and efficiency.

 

This is a remote position open for   Canadian residents in ET time zone.  

 

CompuCom enables our clients to focus on what matters most â€“ their customers and their businesses. To do so, we employ a customer-centric, hard-working, and talented group of people. Join the team today by applying to the following Marketing Manager role:

What We Need & What You'll Do (Responsibilities):

A versatile marketer who is excellence driven, focused on solutions, and passionate about high-quality outcomes, the Demand Generation Marketing Manager is an effective tactician, critical thinker and problem solver. Understanding the value of targeted marketing programs and communication, this team member is responsible for the development and execution of demand generation marketing plans and developing and managing events and roadshows to drive pipeline growth and lead conversion.

 

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

  1. Contribute to a wide range of national marketing campaigns by defining goals, developing campaigns, and working cross-functionally on design, execution, and management of regional, OEM and existing customer marketing programs and events that are aligned to sales goals and initiatives that drive marketing success and business growth.
  2. Identify growth opportunities and partner with sales teams to strategically cultivate new markets and drive pipeline growth, including leading customer advocacy activities in the field, partnering with CEs to engage and encourage customer evidence.
  3. The maintenance, tracking and support of marketing programs including (but not limited to): project plan management, tactical support for marketing initiatives, liaison for digital marketing, field event, and creative collateral requests.
  4. Collaborate with Sales and OEM Partner Alliance Managers and conduct planning and execution of all regional field marketing and virtual events- schedules, event logistics, creative approvals, tracking and submission of invoices ensuring payment processing.
Who You Are (Qualifications):

Experience / Skills:

  • Bachelors degree in Marketing preferred or minimum of 4 years equivalent experience
  • Up-to-date knowledge of and expertise in latest digital tools and techniques
  • Up-to-date knowledge of marketing techniques â€“ i.e. ABM, event management, digital advertising, direct mail, upsell/cross-sell
  • Exemplary written and verbal communication skills, with experience editing for proper grammar, tone and voice and ability to articulate value prop to different audiences and in a variety of formats
  • Effective project management skills â€“ self-starter, detail-oriented, deadline-oriented, organized, resourceful

Other

  • Legally able to work in the Canada

title: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
Limelight is quickly growing in the world of B2B SaaS. Our platform automates manual spreadsheet processes so businesses can spend more time on insights. As we continue to scale, it's important to us to nurture the culture we have built where team members work closely together to solve problems, innovate and get creative. 

Limelight is looking for a Growth Marketing Manager to join the team!

The role will build, execute and report on multi-channel marketing campaigns designed to generate a predictable pipeline by driving sales qualified leads in North America for our platform. Youâ€™ll be owning our marketing budget and youâ€™ll be supported by our amazing marketing team which comprises of different areas of expertise such as UI/UX design, content, and SEO specialists.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead Demand Generation programs, including setting strategy, developing forecasts, evaluating appropriate budget levels, and measuring results.
  • Develop strategies for both acquiring and nurturing leads that drive awareness, consideration, and purchase intent across all channels including email, webinars, partners, paid programs, and virtual events.
  • Ensure world-class quality of any marketing materials that are produced, including web content, webinars, events, white papers, ROI studies, ads, graphics, and videos.
  • Identify new optimization tests and growth opportunities for faster growth, better lifetime value, and/or lower CAC.
  • Communicate with marketing, executive staff, and sales management on an ongoing basis regarding new and nurtured lead performance results.
  • Mentor and coach members of the marketing team to ensure their professional development success.

Qualifications:

  • You are results-oriented and use analytics to drive strategy
  • You have an expert understanding of SEO, CRM, Lead Nurture, and Demand Generation
  • Hands-on experience with Marketing Automation, HubSpot, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, and LinkedIn Ads
  • You possess great writing, communication, and presentation skills
  • You thrive in a fast-paced environment and working with cross-functional teams
  • Natural curiosity with the ability to think â€˜outside the boxâ€™
  • You can understand and explain technical and financial concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Self-starter with proven initiative - Have an idea? Do not wait for others, get started!
  • You are empathetic and know how to think like the customer; you believe that your customerâ€™s success is your success
  • 5 years in managing and supporting a team

Education

  • Bachelor's Degree or College Diploma

 

Some Reasons Our Team Loves Working Here

  • We emphasize a highly collaborative environment. Everyone builds things and collaborates across departments. The best solution can come from anywhere or anyone
  • Weâ€™re fierce defenders of a healthy work-life balance
  • Respect, trust, and honesty. Personal and professional maturity is important to us, and we keep each other honest
  • We pay competitive salaries and have a flexible vacation
  • We provide great benefits: drug, dental, vision, life
  • We have an amazing team that will be eager to help you succeed in your role and grow and develop in your career
  • We trust ourselves and our team to do whatâ€™s right. We empower each other and donâ€™t micromanage

title: Business Development Associate
description:
Overview:

Our vibrant company is looking for an enthusiastic Business Development Associate to join our highly motivated and talented team in Calgary, AB. Propra is reimagining property management technology with a focus on building simple, modern, and easy-to-use tools to improve efficiency, communication, and cost-savings while elevating the resident and landlord experience.

 

Since we are an early-stage startup, you have the opportunity to get in on the ground floor and make a lasting impact. Our team is highly collaborative and customer obsessed, often stretching outside of the boundaries of traditional roles to help move things forward and leave things better than they found them. We are committed to a hybrid work style but, whenever you stop by you'll get to enjoy some of the best of downtown Calgary from our East Village office. Take a break and enjoy a scenic walk down the Bow River.


As a Business Development Associate, you have the opportunity to get in on the ground floor and make a lasting impact as an early member of the team. Your business development work will be instrumental in moving the company forward as you will be providing focus and attention to engaging and growing boutique real estate market segment.

What you'll be doing::
  • Work alongside the Co-Founders, collaborating with the engineering and product team
  • Focus on growing the customer base specifically of small and medium-size real estate firms (<2,500 units)
  • Take the lead to identify, evaluate, negotiate, and manage customer partnerships that can involve marketing, content, customer/merchant product and technology components
  • Contribute to the assessment of technical feasibility for Propra to execute on strategic opportunities
  • Evaluate the economic and strategic cost-benefit of customer and industry partnerships
  • Develop best practices to foster, manage, and track opportunities
  • Support the strategic objectives and interests of Propraâ€™s business
Who we're looking for::
  • Experience in business development, market analysis or management consulting in a corporate, startup or real estate environment
  • Bachelor's degree in Business or proven technical acumen
  • End-to-end negotiation experience, including identifying, developing, and executing successful partnerships such as large scale marketing deals and strategic technology relationships.
  • Minimum 2 years of SaaS sales and/or real estate experience is required
What will help you succeed::
  • Demonstrated ability to think strategically and creatively while applying sound business judgment and quantitative analytics
  • Excellent oral and written skills to communicate complex issues and influence others internally and externally
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to gain the respect of external senior management and executives
  • Ability to build and maintain a network of relationships which facilitate deal flow
  • Self-starter who can excel in a fast-paced and fluid environment
  • Passion for big challenges
About applying with us::

Propra is an equal opportunity employer. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position may be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and a credit check.

We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there; when you apply, our team may reach out to you about other possible opportunities you may be a fit for.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
VendorPM is on a mission to revolutionize the property management industry by being the first in Canada to offer a software-enabled marketplace helping owners and property managers better work with vendors. We transform vendor management - a process that is decentralized, tedious and out-of-date - and streamline it for efficiency and simplicity, all while providing head office with visibility and control.

Weâ€™re one of the fastest growing Toronto startups and weâ€™re backed by world-leading SaaS & PropTech funds including; Bessemer Venture Partners, Prudence VC & Navitas Capital.

Our team is passionate about growth, innovation, and collaboration so if you have a growth mindset, love a fast paced environment and are looking to make a groundbreaking impact in this industry, you are probably a great fit for our team!

The Role

As a Senior Product Designer, you will take on a leading role in the design of our invoicing and payments tools. You will work closely with the Payments PM to architect a fully-integrated payments experience that makes sending and receiving funds through VendorPM feel simple and transparent. At VendorPM, youâ€™ll only work with self-sufficient, autonomous teams - thereâ€™s no old fashioned corporate hierarchy. Design isnâ€™t just a team, itâ€™s a practice and a philosophy. Design, Product, and Engineering work as partners every step of the way. We talk to users directly, test our designs, and use best-in-class tools like UserTesting and Dovetail to move quickly to key insights.

Whatâ€™s In It For You

â—       Pivotal role at a high growth, venture backed company.

â—       Competitive compensation package.

â—      Comprehensive health benefits package including medical care, dental and vision care, life insurance, etc and a health spending account..

â—       Work from home opportunities, with the option to work from our vibrant downtown Toronto office.

â—        3 weeks vacation Paid sick/wellness days

â—       Real work/life balance

â—      Team events

â—       Collaborative tight-knit team

â—       Ongoing learning and development opportunities

As a Member Of Our Team You Will

If you are looking for an environment where creativity and ingenuity are highly valued and where success requires close collaboration with the rest of your team, this role may be a great fit for you!

â—  Conduct user research in collaboration with Product Managers to understand user needs, pains, behaviors, and attitudes in order to explore opportunities for new features and improved UX.

â—  Synthesize research data into actionable insights and useful knowledge artifacts, such as user journey maps, task flow diagrams, and empathy maps.

â—  Collaborate with PMs and Engineers to maintain close alignment on feasibility and objectives of design projects.

â—  Participate in design review sessions, both as a facilitator and a reviewer; communicate design hypotheses and rationale clearly, to facilitate effective design reviews.

â—  Test designs directly with users via both moderated and unmoderated user testing sessions.

â—  Produce dev-ready design artifacts with clear instructions and annotations to ensure faithful execution of the intended user experience.

â—  Review and test delivered UI to ensure consistency with intended UX and existing design system.

â—  Review product impact in collaboration with Product Managers to evaluate the impact of design and feature decisions, and identify opportunities for further iteration.

â—  Collaborate with, support, and elevate the other members of the Product Design team; share your unique knowledge and expertise to make us stronger as a whole!

Interesting Projects

â—  Vendor Payments

â—‹  Design a way for Vendors to turn project quotes into payable invoices.

â—‹  Onboard users to a new payments system (KYC/Stripe integration).

â—‹  Enable Property Managers to pay invoices quickly and easily.

â—  Financial Dashboards

â—‹  Help users track financial activity related to their projects on VendorPM.

Youâ€™re the Missing Piece of the Puzzle

â—  Minimum 3 years of experience designing and shipping products as a Product/UX/UI Designer.

â—  High level of proficiency in producing high-fidelity UI assets and testable prototypes.

â—  Experience working on complex products with multiple user types and integrated systems.

â—  Experience testing designs directly with users and applying insights to designs.

Bonus If You Have

â—  Experience working on payments, KYC, invoicing or similar.

â—  Experience working in a quick-to-ship software environment.

â—  Experience working on the same product for an extended period, including optimizing via successive updates.

â—  A user-focused, organized, and iterative approach to design.

â—  Familiar with working with, adhering to, and contributing to a design system.

â—  Strong to very-strong written and verbal communication skills.

â—  Experience working with Figma.

Meet Your Fellow Problem-Solvers

We believe in problem-solving as a team. So why not meet your fellow problem solvers?

Andrew Baldanza, Director of Product Design

Dylan Sher, VP of Operations

Emiel Bril, CEO

Interview Process

We want to be a surprising and exciting place, but we also want you to know what to expect on your journey, starting with the interview process:

â—     Interview Process Step 1: Google Meets exploratory call with Recruiter.

â—     Interview Process Step 2: Interview with Hiring Manager & portfolio review.

â—     Interview Process Step 3: Panel interview with a few members of the Product team

Please check out these short explainer videos to learn more about us!

For property managers

For vendors

At VendorPM, weâ€™re committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and clients feel valued, respected and supported. We aim to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities, and to create an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.Learn more about what itâ€™s like to be an employee at VendorPM.

*Remote applicants must reside in Canada and have valid Canadian work authorization.

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Marketing Manager - Home Care
  • Toronto, North York
  • Half-Time
Company Description

ComForCare Home Care is a boutique agency serving North Toronto and North York families.  We provide trusted in-home services to seniors with a staff of Personal Support Workers (PSW's).  Our elite caregivers are carefully screened and selected to help seniors live their best lives possible.  Care is planned and supervised by Registered Nurses.  We assist with activities of daily living (ADL's) and provide person-centred care in a highly tailored concierge fashion.

Marketing Manager, North Toronto, North York
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity in one of the fastest growing areas of healthcare that will allow you to make a difference in people's lives while you grow your career in a small business setting? We are ComForCare Home Care, a leading home care company, and want you to take our growth to the next level in the business to business market.  Apply your energy and skills to this dynamic and entrepreneurial environment and become an integral part of a small caring, professional team that is instrumental in providing the highest quality care to our clients.
ComForCare is seeking an experienced Account Executive to fill the role of Marketing Manager to develop and manage relationships with referral sources in the community to promote ComForCare services and help expand our business to business portfolio in the North Toronto North York Territory. You will focus on staffing and cluster care opportunities in the Retirement Home and Long Term Care segments.  This position requires an individual who ideally has relationships in these communities, and is highly motivated, results driven, and able to develop and build strong, lasting relationships.Job DescriptionResponsibilities:
  • Generate referrals for PSW services by building relationships with retirement homes, long term care homes, other independent and assisted living facilities and other community resources.
  • Conduct market analysis; develop sales strategy, goals and plans.
  • Conduct sales calls, and evaluate results and effectiveness of sales activity
  • Support business development activities and help establish strong relationships with new and existing referral sources.
Qualifications
  • At least two years recent sales experience, ideally in the home care/long term care industry.
  • Formal sales training.
  • Proven ability to develop and implement a sales and marketing plan.
  • Evidence of achieving referral goals within the market.
  • Excellent planning, organization and presentation skills are critical.
  • The ideal candidate will have established healthcare/homecare contacts and be able to readily network in the community.
Additional InformationRewarding work, a fulfilling career and compassionate colleagues are just a few of the many reasons why the most talented and admired home care professionals  make ComForCare among the Best Places to Work (2022). With offices throughout Ontario, ComForCare believes that our clients and their families deserve home  care delivered with compassion, excellence and reliability. Become part of a caring, professional team that provides the highest quality care while developing your career with an industry leader.

By selecting the positions below, you acknowledge that you are applying for employment with an independently owned and operated ComForCare franchisee, a separate company and employer from ComForCare and any of its affiliates or subsidiaries. You understand that each independent franchisee is solely responsible for all decisions relating to employment including (and without limitation to) hiring and termination, and ComForCare does not accept, review or store my application. Any questions about your application or the hiring process must be directed to the locally owned and operated ComForCare franchisee.

Equal Opportunity Employer: Disability/Veteran.

title: BIS Knowledge Manager
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.

The Knowledge Manager role is to identify, collect, synthesize, organize and manage IT knowledge to support end users across the enterprise. This strategic (design) and hands on delivery (implementation) role manages all aspects of Knowledge Management, creates guidelines for what information is captured, and by whom how it integrates with the technical architecture, and how to keep it from growing stale.

An ideal candidate thrives in a dynamic fast-paced environment and has a background in leading content and information architecture strategy across an organization. As a Knowledge Manager, you will define the content/knowledge management strategy and lead the content architecture and strategy. The role will focus on developing, auditing, and maintaining high quality content for employees.

In your role, you will:
  • Work closely with key stakeholders across the company to maintain consistency at a global scale and align the content strategy with their vision
  • Define the knowledge management strategy for our knowledge base and maintain high quality, up-to-date, and searchable content for audiences of varying skill level
  • Work effectively across the organization with stakeholders, change management, service teams, trainers, and subject matter experts to develop and support new and existing applications, products, features, and services.
  • Establish writing guidelines based on knowledge base best practices and develop the team to ensure they are achieving or surpassing them.
  • Plan and manage support for knowledge management tools and processes
  • Encourage people throughout the service provider to contribute knowledge to the knowledge management system in ServiceNow
  • Act as an adviser to business and IT personnel on knowledge management matters, including policy decisions on storage, value, worth etc.
  • Identify, control and store any information deemed to be pertinent to the services provided that is not available by other means
  • Maintain controlled knowledge items in ServiceNow to ensure that they are current, relevant and valid
  • Monitor publicity regarding the knowledge information to ensure that information is not duplicated and is recognized as a central source of information etc.
  • Set direction and provide a framework through which improvement objectives can be delivered
  • Communicate the vision of continuous service improvement (CSI) across the IT organization, Design the CSI register and associated activities, Define and create reports on CSI, critical success factors (CSFs), key performance indicators (KPIs) and SLAs.
  • Support the development and implementation of the new Knowledge Base framework across the organization to enable increased organizational efficiency and performance.
  • Manage the accessibility and flow of knowledge within the organization and to external parties.
  • Optimize the usage of knowledge Management system’s features.
  • Help capture new knowledge with the usage of a knowledge management system.
  • Gather feedback from end users to understand how to improve efficiencies when it comes to Knowledge base management.
  • Propose recommendations for improving content management system capabilities within the KB.
  • Monitor progress and adoption by keeping track of engagement, project outcomes and other metrics. Provide reporting and data insight on user feedback, and other data analytics
  • Develop and maintain performance indicators and track metrics for knowledge systems, contents available, and newly introduced programs/projects
  • Work closely with the Compliance team to ensure all documents meets legislative requirements
  • Provide relevant coaching, training, and support to champion a knowledge management culture.

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You have experience as IT Knowledge Manager
  • You have 5 to 7 years of experience
  • You have a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent years of experience inInformation Technology or Business Administration
  • You have ITIL Certification
  • You have good knowledge of ITSM processes and ServiceNow, specially ServiceNow Knowledge Management module.
  • You have outstanding communication skills – Written and Verbal, should be able to
  • You have expertise on Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint
  • You have graduation in Computer Science, IT or relevant field
Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities
Your ideas move people.

title: Assistant Marketing Manager - MAC
description:
Assistant Marketing Manager - MAC ( Job Number: 223589 )
Brand : MAC
Job : Retail - Corporate
Primary Location : Americas-CA-ON-Toronto
Schedule : Full-time
Job Type : Standard
Description

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Assistant Manager is responsible for executing trade marketing strategies and retail activations that drives sales market share for MAC’s retail channels, inclusive of MAC, Sephora, HBC and Nordstrom.

The Assistant Manager works alongside the Marketing Director, and in close collaboration with sales, retail partners and retail.com marketing manager to ensure flawless execution of MAC’s omni channel strategy and deliver the best experience to consumers. The Assistant Manager is responsible for executing marketing campaigns to specific channel needs, ensuring all campaigns are executed flawlessly and on time.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES: Instore Retail Marketing, Promotions, Field and Eventing

Retail Marketing

  • Support marketing director on annual planning, launch support, seasonal changes, and activation/promotional calendars/memos
  • Collaborate with cross functional team to develop strategies, sales plans, and execution tactics for in store for each channel in line with brand priorities
  • Manage a robust marketing program that supports new launches, core business categories and retail exclusives
  • Lead communication and project management of all marketing components for retail partners from planning through to execution
  • Own creative briefs and adaptations for marketing needs
  • Manage the delivery and execution of all in-store elements of co-op programming
  • Work closely with Visual Merchandising to plan and execute merchandising/visual priorities to support all exclusive programs including but not limited to: calendarization, creative request submissions, status meetings, routing for feedback and approval
  • Partner with Sales Director and retail.com Manager in the creation of an integrated, Omni channel marketing strategy to drive awareness and engagement while maximizing ROI
  • Using insights into consumers’ profile and behaviours define a compelling marketing strategy within their accounts to increase consumers’ engagement and conversion
  • Lead the execution of new door and counter openings across the estate driving awareness and buzz within local area ensuring sales goals are achieved
  • Partner with Sales Director to ensure optimal productivity of gondolas of all respective retailers, and evaluate retail sales impact of discontinued skus
  • Contribute to 360 planning of new product launches

Promotions, GWPs, and Sampling

  • Develop, execute, and analyze account specific promotions, GWPs, PWPs, and sampling programs to drive trial and conversion while protecting the brand’s equity
  • Own forecasting, planning, processing, and execution of GWPs and sampling programs
  • Analyze program performance to deliver both quantitative and qualitative feedback measuring ROI for future programs and enhancements
  • Provide clear and insightful analysis of product and category performance – contributing to MOB and NPD results monthly

Field Engagement Eventing

  • Partner with Field Directors on communications to the field, coordinate, and support clientelling needs, and guidance on launches
  • Develop and execute events/programs to engage BA’s to promote morale and advocacy of MAC
  • Drive an efficient retail event strategy anchored around: consumer engagement, sales activation, and brand equity building
Qualifications

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Undergraduate degree preferred
  • Minimum 3-4 years of relevant experience
  • Strategic mindset with excellent quantitative, analytical and problem-solving capabilities
  • Flexible and able to juggle multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
  • Strong relationship builder
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate across cross functional teams
  • Project management skills including scheduling and timelines, budgeting, and communications
  • Creative, innovative, and resourceful
  • Experience working with Canadian retailers is an asset
  • Beauty industry experience an asset
  • Bilingual candidates an asset
We are an equal opportunity employer. Minorities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available on request.

title: Director of Marketing, Demand Generation
description:
Make an impact! Help medical professionals deliver better patient care with high-definition ultrasound imaging.

 

Today, as many as 25 million medical professionals globally don’t have access to medical imaging, which is proven to improve patient care and reduce healthcare costs. That’s why we’re on a mission to make medical imaging accessible everywhere by delivering high-performance, affordable, and easy-to-use solutions powered by artificial intelligence and connected to the cloud.

 

By making Clarius your next career move, you’re joining a team of 130+ people who are talented, innovative, and highly collegial. You’re also joining a community that includes thousands of physicians worldwide who use Clarius to deliver better patient care – nearly two million high-definition exams have been performed using Clarius. And you’re joining a marketing team that’s hitting it out of the park!

 

Lead our high-performing Demand Generation Team!

 

The Global Demand Generation Team is effectively delivering thousands of qualified leads every month and exceeding targets. Demand generation activities are fueled by the killer Content Team that’s working with key opinion leaders and luminary physicians every week to develop new quality digital content, including webinars, educational video tutorials, clinical and patient interviews, blog posts, and more!

 

As our Marketing Director, Global Demand Generation, you will be responsible for leading and growing our team of marketing managers and specialists, across various aspects of demand generation, including marketing operations, email marketing, social media, PPC, 3rd party advertising, industry conferences, and workshops. You’ll take responsibility for overseeing integrated multi-channel marketing programs to build market awareness and maximize lead generation.

 

You’re a natural born leader, highly detailed oriented, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. As Global Demand Generation Director, you will play a central role in developing and executing our marketing strategy, being a good steward of our generous marketing budget to drive global growth. You will help define our brand experience and positioning, drive awareness through multichannel strategies, and oversee the development and execution of content strategies. You will be joining at an exciting time, as we’ve just launched the 3rd generation of our wireless scanners with a new membership offering that’s fast-gaining market traction.

 

Reporting to our VP of Marketing, you’ll be focused on developing operational excellence to support a talented, high-performing team. You’ll own your systems, processes, and campaigns to really hit it out of the park. Your passion for results, mentoring staff, and process improvements means you’ll be highly successful in constantly growing the funnel with sales qualified leads. You’ll manage reports and dashboards to ensure metrics and results can be easily understood by stakeholders organization-wide, and to show off that you’re hitting and exceeding targets.

 

We have a phenomenal product offering, happy customers, a supportive marketing team, large database, and strong lead volumes. We’re a great place to work. Come be part of this feel-good local medical technology success story. Apply today!

 

You will

  • Oversee and manage a seven-figure marketing budget, allocating and investing funds wisely to optimize performance across channels and deliver the highest number of quality leads
  • Provide leadership, manage, and oversee all deliverables for the Demand Generation Team, fostering ideas and continual growth
  • Grow our demand generation function, fueling pipeline and revenue growth by meeting or exceeding monthly and quarterly lead targets of a high quality across medical specialties
  • Develop strategies to generate excitement and interest for our comprehensive line of wireless ultrasound scanners and imaging solutions with targeted demand generation programs across a variety of medical specialties
  • Measure, report on, test, and optimize campaign-level performance
  • Drive full-funnel performance marketing and growth levers (from acquisition and adoption to monetization and retention)
  • Strike the right balance across a variety of acquisition channels – including pay-per-click campaigns, industry conferences, social media, email campaigns, 3rd party advertising, and offline marketing – to optimize for results
  • Monitor demand generation KPIs and update our reporting framework, share results with stakeholders, and make recommendations for next steps, efficiencies, improvements, and new opportunities
  • Facilitate strategic relationships and partnerships with key industry players, institutions, and vendors, negotiating favorable contracts with 3rd party vendors

 

You bring

  • 10+ years of experience in B2B or B2C marketing in technology, SaaS experience desirable
  • Minimum 5 years of proven team development, management, and leadership skills
  • Medical industry experience is desirable
  • Expertise in digital marketing, including SEO, PPC, lead scoring, email, nurturing programs, list management, segmentation, and targeting
  • Strong analytical skills with expertise in setting measurable goals and evaluating campaign effectiveness to optimize results
  • Deep understanding of optimization requirements at the different stages of the funnel
  • Strong knowledge of CRM and marketing automation systems, Salesforce & Marketo desirable
  • Ability to creatively devise and lead cross channel marketing campaigns that engage, educate, and motivate
  • Strong project management, self-motivation, and resourcefulness in driving projects forward
  • Experience negotiating and managing complex contracts with vendors
  • Strong understanding of the latest trends and best practices in online/digital marketing and measurement
  • Experience managing large marketing budgets and expenditures in a cost-conscious way and proving ROI in marketing initiatives
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, including editing, proofreading, copywriting, and making presentations to a variety of diverse audiences
  • Ability to deliver initiatives from conception through completion and delivering on competing priorities in a dynamic environment

Requirements:

None

title: UI Designer
description:
Our client is looking for an UI Designer to join their team.

Responsibilities:

  • Be a great team player, experienced in working with agile teams. Ability to collaborate closely with developers, copywriters, and UX designers.
  • Create, improve, and use wireframes, prototypes, style guides, user flows, and effectively communicate your interaction ideas using any of these methods.
  • Present and defend your design decisions. All your design decisions should be based on the overall design roadmap as well as your own design thinking and fundamental principles (i.e. color theory, visual weight, etc.)
  • Continually keep yourself and your design team updated with the latest changes in your industry's standards.
  • Offer recommended solutions to clients' design and usability problems
  • Help conduct user research and evaluate user feedback
  • Rapidly iterate on design prototypes and working applications.

Must-Have Skills:

  • 3-5 years of demonstrated experience in creating and implementing UI design
  • Proficient with visual design programs such as Sketch & Figma
  • Experience using tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator & Zeplin
  • Proficiency in rapid prototyping via InVision
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
  • Strong portfolio to be presented and defended during interview.

Nice to Have Skills:

  • Experience conducting user validations of designs via A/B Testing
  • Experience designing for a consumer facing app
  • Experience in creating and contributing to design system documents
